Naloxone reverses the antihypertensive effect of clonidine .
B O O O O O B O
In unanesthetized , spontaneously hypertensive rats the decrease in blood pressure and heart rate produced by intravenous clonidine , 5 to 20 micrograms / kg , was inhibited or reversed
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
by nalozone , 0 . 2 to 2 mg / kg .
O B O O O O O O O O O O
The hypotensive effect of 100 mg / kg alpha - methyldopa was also partially reversed by naloxone .
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O B O
Naloxone alone did not affect either blood pressure or heart rate .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
In brain membranes from spontaneously hypertensive rats clonidine , 10 ( - 8 ) to 10 ( - 5 )
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
M , did not influence stereoselective binding of [ 3H ] - naloxone ( 8 nM ) , and naloxone , 10 ( - 8 ) to 10 ( -
O O O O O O O O B I I I I O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
4 )
O O
M , did not influence clonidine - suppressible binding of [ 3H ] - dihydroergocryptine ( 1 nM ) .
O O O O O B O O O O B I I I I O O O O O
These findings indicate that in spontaneously hypertensive rats the effects of central alpha - adrenoceptor stimulation involve activation of opiate receptors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As naloxone and clonidine do not appear to interact with the same receptor site , the observed functional antagonism suggests the release of an endogenous opiate by clonidine or
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
alpha - methyldopa and the possible role of the opiate in the central control of sympathetic tone .
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lidocaine - induced cardiac asystole .
B O O O O O
Intravenous administration of a single 50 - mg bolus of lidocaine in a 67 - year - old man resulted in profound depression of the activity of the sinoatrial and
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
atrioventricular nodal pacemakers .
O O O O
The patient had no apparent associated conditions which might have predisposed him to the development of bradyarrhythmias ; and , thus , this probably represented a true idiosyncrasy to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
lidocaine .
B O
Suxamethonium infusion rate and observed fasciculations .
B O O O O O O
A dose - response study .
O O O O O O
Suxamethonium chloride
B I
( Sch ) was administered i . v .
O B O O O O O O O
to 36 adult males at six rates : 0 . 25 mg s - 1 to 20 mg s - 1 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The infusion was discontinued either when there was no muscular response to tetanic stimulation of the ulnar nerve or when Sch 120 mg was exceeded .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Six additional patients received a 30 - mg i . v .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
bolus dose .
O O O
Fasciculations in six areas of the body were scored from 0 to 3 and summated as a total fasciculation score .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The times to first fasciculation , twitch suppression and tetanus suppression were inversely related to the infusion rates .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fasciculations in the six areas and the total fasciculation score were related directly to the rate of infusion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Total fasciculation scores in the 30 - mg bolus group and the 5 - mg s - 1 and 20 - mg s - 1 infusion groups were not significantly
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
different .
O O
Galanthamine hydrobromide , a longer acting anticholinesterase drug , in the treatment of the central effects of scopolamine ( Hyoscine ) .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
Galanthamine hydrobromide , an anticholinesterase drug capable of penetrating the blood - brain barrier , was used in a patient demonstrating central effects of scopolamine ( hyoscine ) overdosage .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
It is longer acting than physostigmine and is used in anaesthesia to reverse the non - depolarizing neuromuscular block .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , studies into the dose necessary to combating scopolamine intoxication are indicated .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Effects of uninephrectomy and high protein feeding on lithium - induced chronic renal failure in rats .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Rats with lithium - induced nephropathy were subjected to high protein ( HP ) feeding , uninephrectomy ( NX ) or a combination of these , in an attempt to
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
induce glomerular hyperfiltration and further progression of renal failure .
O O O O O O O O O O
Newborn female Wistar rats were fed a lithium - containing diet ( 50 mmol / kg ) for 8 weeks and then randomized to normal diet , HP diet (
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
40 vs . 19 % ) , NX or HP + NX for another 8 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Corresponding non - lithium pretreated groups were generated .
O O O B O O O O O
When comparing all lithium treated versus non - lithium - treated groups , lithium caused a reduction in glomerular filtration rate ( GFR ) without significant changes in effective renal
O O O B O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
plasma flow ( as determined by a marker secreted into the proximal tubules ) or lithium clearance .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Consequently , lithium pretreatment caused a fall in filtration fraction and an increase in fractional Li excretion .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Lithium also caused proteinuria and systolic hypertension in absence of glomerulosclerosis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
HP failed to accentuante progression of renal failure and in fact tended to increase GFR and decrease plasma creatinine levels in lithium pretreated rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O
NX caused an additive deterioration in GFR which , however , was ameliorated by HP .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NX + HP caused a further rise in blood pressure in Li - pretreated rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The results indicate that Li - induced nephropathy , even when the GFR is only modestly reduced , is associated with proteinuria and arterial systolic hypertension .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this model of chronic renal failure the decline in GFR is not accompanied by a corresponding fall in effective renal plasma flow , which may be the functional expression
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of the formation of nonfiltrating atubular glomeruli .
O O O O O O O O
The fractional reabsorption of tubular fluid by the proximal tubules is reduced , leaving the distal delivery unchanged . ( ABSTRACT TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment of Crohn 's disease with fusidic acid : an antibiotic with immunosuppressive properties similar to cyclosporin .
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O B O
Fusidic acid is an antibiotic with T - cell specific immunosuppressive effects similar to those of cyclosporin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Because of the need for the development of new treatments for Crohn 's disease , a pilot study was undertaken to estimate the pharmacodynamics and tolerability of fusidic acid treatment
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
in chronic active , therapy - resistant patients .
O O O O O O O O O
Eight Crohn 's disease patients were included .
O O O O O O O O
Fusidic acid was administered orally in a dose of 500 mg t . d . s .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and the treatment was planned to last 8 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O
The disease activity was primarily measured by a modified individual grading score .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Five of 8 patients ( 63 % ) improved during fusidic acid treatment : 3 at two weeks and 2 after four weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
There were no serious clinical side effects , but dose reduction was required in two patients because of nausea .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Biochemically , an increase in alkaline phosphatases was noted in 5 of 8 cases ( 63 % ) , and the greatest increases were seen in those who had elevated
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
levels prior to treatment .
O O O O O
All reversed to pre - treatment levels after cessation of treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results of this pilot study suggest that fusidic acid may be of benefit in selected chronic active Crohn 's disease patients in whom conventional treatment is ineffective .
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because there seems to exist a scientific rationale for the use of fusidic acid at the cytokine level in inflammatory bowel disease , we suggest that the role of this
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
treatment should be further investigated .
O O O O O O
Electrocardiographic evidence of myocardial injury in psychiatrically hospitalized cocaine abusers .
O O O O O O O O B O O
The electrocardiograms ( ECG ) of 99 cocaine - abusing patients were compared with the ECGs of 50 schizophrenic controls .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Eleven of the cocaine abusers and none of the controls had ECG evidence of significant myocardial injury defined as myocardial infarction , ischemia , and bundle branch block .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sulpiride - induced tardive dystonia .
B O O O O O
Sulpiride is a selective D2 - receptor antagonist with antipsychotic and antidepressant properties .
B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Although initially thought to be free of extrapyramidal side effects , sulpiride - induced tardive dyskinesia and parkinsonism have been reported occasionally .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
We studied a 37 - year - old man who developed persistent segmental dystonia within 2 months after starting sulpiride therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
We could not find any previous reports of sulpiride - induced tardive dystonia .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Ocular and auditory toxicity in hemodialyzed patients receiving desferrioxamine .
O O O O O O O O B O
During an 18 - month period of study 41 hemodialyzed patients receiving desferrioxamine ( 10 - 40 mg / kg BW / 3 times weekly ) for the first time
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
were monitored for detection of audiovisual toxicity .
O O O O O O O O
6 patients presented clinical symptoms of visual or auditory toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Moreover , detailed ophthalmologic and audiologic studies disclosed abnormalities in 7 more asymptomatic patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Visual toxicity was of retinal origin and was characterized by a tritan - type dyschromatopsy , sometimes associated with a loss of visual acuity and pigmentary retinal deposits .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Auditory toxicity was characterized by a mid - to high - frequency neurosensorial hearing loss and the lesion was of the cochlear type .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Desferrioxamine withdrawal resulted in a complete recovery of visual function in 1 patient and partial recovery in 3 , and a complete reversal of hearing loss in 3 patients and
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
partial recovery in 3 .
O O O O O
This toxicity appeared in patients receiving the higher doses of desferrioxamine or coincided with the normalization of ferritin or aluminium serum levels .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O
The data indicate that audiovisual toxicity is not an infrequent complication in hemodialyzed patients receiving desferrioxamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Periodical audiovisual monitoring should be performed on hemodialyzed patients receiving the drug in order to detect adverse effects as early as possible .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Myasthenia gravis presenting as weakness after magnesium administration .
O O O O O O B O O
We studied a patient with no prior history of neuromuscular disease who became virtually quadriplegic after parenteral magnesium administration for preeclampsia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The serum magnesium concentration was 3 . 0 mEq / L , which is usually well tolerated .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The magnesium was stopped and she recovered over a few days .
O B O O O O O O O O O O
While she was weak , 2 - Hz repetitive stimulation revealed a decrement without significant facilitation at rapid rates or after exercise , suggesting postsynaptic neuromuscular blockade .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After her strength returned , repetitive stimulation was normal , but single fiber EMG revealed increased jitter and blocking .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Her acetylcholine receptor antibody level was markedly elevated .
O B O O O O O O O
Although paralysis after magnesium administration has been described in patients with known myasthenia gravis , it has not previously been reported to be the initial or only manifestation of the
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
disease .
O O
Patients who are unusually sensitive to the neuromuscular effects of magnesium should be suspected of having an underlying disorder of neuromuscular transmission .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Chloroacetaldehyde and its contribution to urotoxicity during treatment with cyclophosphamide or ifosfamide .
B O O O O O O O O B O B O
An experimental study / short communication .
O O O O O O O
Based on clinical data , indicating that chloroacetaldehyde ( CAA ) is an important metabolite of oxazaphosphorine cytostatics , an experimental study was carried out in order to elucidate the
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
role of CAA in the development of hemorrhagic cystitis .
O O B O O O O O O O
The data demonstrate that CAA after i . v .
O O O O B O O O O O
administration does not contribute to bladder damage .
O O O O O O O O
When instilled directly into the bladder , CAA exerts urotoxic effects , it is , however , susceptible to detoxification with mesna .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Source of pain and primitive dysfunction in migraine : an identical site ?
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Twenty common migraine patients received a one sided frontotemporal application of nitroglycerin ( 10 patients ) or placebo ointment ( 10 patients ) in a double blind study .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Early onset migraine attacks were induced by nitroglycerin in seven out of 10 patients versus no patient in the placebo group .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Subsequently 20 migraine patients , who developed an early onset attack with frontotemporal nitroglycerin , received the drug in a second induction test at other body areas .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No early onset migraine was observed .
O O O O O O O
Thus the migraine - inducing effect of nitroglycerin seems to depend on direct stimulation of the habitual site of pain , suggesting that the frontotemporal region is of crucial importance
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in the development of a migraine crisis .
O O O O O O O O
This is not consistent with a CNS origin of migraine attack .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clotiazepam - induced acute hepatitis .
B O O O O O
We report the case of a patient who developed acute hepatitis with extensive hepatocellular necrosis , 7 months after the onset of administration of clotiazepam , a thienodiazepine derivative .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O
Clotiazepam withdrawal was followed by prompt recovery .
B O O O O O O O
The administration of several benzodiazepines , chemically related to clotiazepam , did not interfere with recovery and did not induce any relapse of hepatitis .
O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This observation shows that clotiazepam can induce acute hepatitis and suggests that there is no cross hepatotoxicity between clotiazepam and several benzodiazepines .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O
Arterial hypertension as a complication of prolonged ketoconazole treatment .
O O O O O O O B O O
Two of 14 patients with Cushing 's syndrome treated on a long - term basis with ketoconazole developed sustained hypertension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
In both cases normal plasma and urinary free cortisol levels had been achieved following ketoconazole therapy , yet continuous blood pressure monitoring demonstrated hypertension 31 ( patient 1 ) and
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
52 weeks ( patient 2 ) after treatment .
O O O O O O O O O
In patient 1 , plasma levels of deoxycorticosterone and 11 - deoxycortisol were elevated .
O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O
In patient 2 , in addition to an increase in both deoxycorticosterone and 11 - deoxycortisol levels , plasma aldosterone values were raised , with a concomitant suppression of renin
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
levels .
O O
Our findings show that long - term treatment with high doses of ketoconazole may induce enzyme blockade leading to mineralocorticoid - related hypertension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Effects of an inhibitor of angiotensin converting enzyme ( Captopril ) on pulmonary and renal insufficiency due to intravascular coagulation in the rat .
O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Induction of intravascular coagulation and inhibition of fibrinolysis by injection of thrombin and tranexamic acid ( AMCA ) in the rat gives rise to pulmonary and renal insufficiency resembling that
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
occurring after trauma or sepsis in man .
O O O O O O O O
Injection of Captopril ( 1 mg / kg ) , an inhibitor of angiotensin converting enzyme ( ACE ) , reduced both pulmonary and renal insufficiency in this rat model
O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The lung weights were lower and PaO2 was improved in rats given this enzyme - blocking agent .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The contents of albumin in the lungs were not changed , indicating that Captopril did not influence the extravasation of protein .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Renal damage as reflected by an increase in serum urea and in kidney weight was prevented by Captopril .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O
The amount of fibrin in the kidneys was also considerably lower than in animals which received thrombin and AMCA alone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
It is suggested that the effects of Captopril on the lungs may be attributable to a vasodilatory effect due to a reduction in the circulating level of Angiotension II and
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
an increase in prostacyclin ( secondary to an increase in bradykinin ) .
O O O B O O O O O O B O O
Captopril may , by the same mechanism , reduce the increase in glomerular filtration that is known to occur after an injection of thrombin , thereby diminishing the aggregation of
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
fibrin monomers in the glomeruli , with the result that less fibrin will be deposited and thus less kidney damage will be produced .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A randomized comparison of labetalol and nitroprusside for induced hypotension .
O O O O B O B O O O O
In a randomized study , labetalol - induced hypotension and nitroprusside - induced hypotension were compared in 20 patients ( 10 in each group ) scheduled for major orthopedic procedures
O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Each patient was subjected to an identical anesthetic protocol and similar drug - induced reductions in mean arterial blood pressure ( BP ) ( 50 to 55 mmHg ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nitroprusside infusion was associated with a significant ( p less than 0 . 05 ) increase in heart rate and cardiac output ; rebound hypertension was observed in three patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
after discontinuation of nitroprusside .
O O O B O
Labetalol administration was not associated with any of these findings .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Arterial PO2 decreased in both groups .
O B O O O O O
It was concluded that labetalol offers advantages over nitroprusside .
O O O O B O O O B O
Chronic carbamazepine treatment in the rat : efficacy , toxicity , and effect on plasma and tissue folate concentrations .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Folate depletion has often been a problem in chronic antiepileptic drug ( AED ) therapy .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Carbamazepine ( CBZ ) , a commonly used AED , has been implicated in some clinical studies .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A rat model was developed to examine the effects of chronic CBZ treatment on folate concentrations in the rat .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O
In the course of developing this model , a common vehicle , propylene glycol , by itself in high doses , was found to exhibit protective properties against induced seizures
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and inhibited weight gain .
O O O O O
Seizures induced by hexafluorodiethyl ether ( HFDE ) were also found to be a more sensitive measure of protection by CBZ than seizures induced by maximal electroshock ( MES )
O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Oral administration of CBZ as an aqueous suspension every 8 h at a dose of 250 mg / kg was continuously protective against HFDE - induced seizures and was minimally
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
toxic as measured by weight gain over 8 weeks of treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The CBZ levels measured in plasma and brain of these animals , however , were below those normally considered protective .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This treatment with CBZ had no apparent adverse effect on folate concentrations in the rat , and , indeed , the folate concentration increased in liver after 6 weeks of
O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
treatment and in plasma at 8 weeks of treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O
Inhibition of sympathoadrenal activity by atrial natriuretic factor in dogs .

O O O O
Death from chemotherapy in gestational trophoblastic disease .
O O O O O O O O
Multiple cytotoxic drug administration is the generally accepted treatment of patients with a high - risk stage of choriocarcinoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Based on this principle a 27 - year old woman , classified as being in the high - risk group ( Goldstein and Berkowitz score : 11 ) , was
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
treated with multiple cytotoxic drugs .
O O O O O O
The multiple drug schema consisted of : Etoposide 16 . 213 , Methotrexate , Cyclophosphamide , Actomycin - D , and Cisplatin .
O O O O O O O B O O O O B O B O B I I O O B O
On the first day of the schedule , moderate high doses of Methotrexate , Etoposide and Cyclophosphamide were administered .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O
Within 8 hours after initiation of therapy the patient died with a clinical picture resembling massive pulmonary obstruction due to choriocarcinomic tissue plugs , probably originating from the uterus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Formation of these plugs was probably due to extensive tumor necrosis at the level of the walls of the major uterine veins , which resulted in an open exchange of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
tumor plugs to the vascular spaces ; decrease in tumor tissue coherence secondary to chemotherapy may have further contributed to the formation of tumor emboli .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In view of the close time association between the start of chemotherapy and the acute onset of massive embolism other explanations , such as spontaneous necrosis , must be considered
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
less likely .
O O O
Patients with large pelvic tumor loads are , according to existing classifications , at high risk to die and to develop drug resistance .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Notwithstanding these facts our findings suggest that these patients might benefit from relatively mild initial treatment , especially true for patients not previously exposed to this drug .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Close observation of the response status both clinically and with beta - hCG values may indicate whether and when more agressive combination chemotherapy should be started . ( ABSTRACT TRUNCATED
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
AT 250 WORDS )
O O O O
Sexual dysfunction among patients with arthritis .
O O O O O O O
The relationship of arthritis and sexual dysfunction was investigated among 169 patients with rheumatoid arthritis , osteoarthritis and spondyloarthropathy , 130 of whom were pair - matched to controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Assessments of marital happiness and depressed mood were also made using the CES - D and the Azrin Marital Happiness Scale ( AMHS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sexual dysfunctions were found to be common among patients and controls , the majority in both groups reporting one or more dysfunctions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Impotence was more common among male patients than controls and was found to be associated with co - morbidity and the taking of methotrexate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Depressed mood was more common among patients and was associated with certain sexual difficulties , but not with impotence .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Marital unhappiness , as indicated by AMHS scores , was not associated with arthritis but was associated with sexual dysfunction , sexual dissatisfaction and being female .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Does paracetamol cause urothelial cancer or renal papillary necrosis ?
O B O O O O O O O O
The risk of developing renal papillary necrosis or cancer of the renal pelvis , ureter or bladder associated with consumption of either phenacetin or paracetamol was calculated from data acquired
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
by questionnaire from 381 cases and 808 controls .
O O O O O O O O O
The risk of renal papillary necrosis was increased nearly 20 - fold by consumption of phenacetin , which also increased the risk for cancer of the renal pelvis and bladder
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
but not for ureteric cancer .
O O O O O O
By contrast , we were unable to substantiate an increased risk from paracetamol consumption for renal papillary necrosis or any of these cancers although there was a suggestion of an
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
association with cancer of the ureter .
O O O O O O O
Dapsone - associated Heinz body hemolytic anemia in a Cambodian woman with hemoglobin E trait .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A Cambodian woman with hemoglobin E trait ( AE ) and leprosy developed a Heinz body hemolytic anemia while taking a dose of dapsone ( 50 mg / day )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
not usually associated with clinical hemolysis .
O O O O O O O
Her red blood cells ( RBCs ) had increased incubated Heinz body formation , decreased reduced glutathione ( GSH ) , and decreased GSH stability .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O B O O
The pentose phosphate shunt activity of the dapsone - exposed AE RBCs was increased compared to normal RBCs .
O B I O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Although the AE RBCs from an individual not taking dapsone had increased incubated Heinz body formation , the GSH content and GSH stability were normal .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O
The pentose phosphate shunt activity of the non - dapsone - exposed AE RBCs was decreased compared to normal RBCs .
O B I O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Thus , AE RBCs appear to have an increased sensitivity to oxidant stress both in vitro and in vivo , since dapsone does not cause hemolytic anemia at this dose
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
in hematologically normal individuals .
O O O O O
Given the influx of Southeast Asians into the United States , oxidant medications should be used with caution , especially if an infection is present , in individuals of ethnic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
backgrounds that have an increased prevalence of hemoglobin E .

Severe complications of antianginal drug therapy in a patient identified as a poor metabolizer of metoprolol , propafenone , diltiazem , and sparteine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O B O
A 47 - year - old patient suffering from coronary artery disease was admitted to the CCU in shock with III .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
AV block , severe hypotension , and impairment of ventricular function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
One week prior to admission a therapy with standard doses of metoprolol ( 100 mg t . i . d .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
and then 100 mg b . i . d . ) had been initiated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two days before admission diltiazem ( 60 mg b . i . d . ) was prescribed in addition .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Analyses of a blood sample revealed unusually high plasma concentrations of metoprolol ( greater than 3000 ng / ml ) and diltiazem ( 526 ng / ml ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The patient recovered within 1 week following discontinuation of antianginal therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Three months later the patient was exposed to a single dose of metoprolol , diltiazem , propafenone ( since he had received this drug in the past ) , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
sparteine ( as a probe for the debrisoquine / sparteine type polymorphism of oxidative drug metabolism ) .
B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
It was found that he was a poor metabolizer of all four drugs , indicating that their metabolism is under the same genetic control .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , patients belonging to the poor - metabolizer phenotype of sparteine / debrisoquine polymorphism in drug metabolism , which constitutes 6 . 4 % of the German population ,
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
may experience adverse drug reactions when treated with standard doses of one of these drugs alone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Moreover , the coadministration of these frequently used drugs is expected to be especially harmful in this subgroup of patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Triazolam - induced brief episodes of secondary mania in a depressed patient .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Large doses of triazolam repeatedly induced brief episodes of mania in a depressed elderly woman .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Features of organic mental disorder ( delirium ) were not present .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Manic excitement was coincident with the duration of action of triazolam .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
The possible contribution of the triazolo group to changes in affective status is discussed .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
On the mechanisms of the development of tolerance to the muscular rigidity produced by morphine in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
The development of tolerance to the muscular rigidity produced by morphine was studied in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Saline - pretreated controls given a test dose of morphine ( 20 mg / kg i . p . ) showed a pronounced rigidity recorded as tonic activity in the
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
electromyogram .
O O
Rats treated for 11 days with morphine and withdrawn for 36 - 40 h showed differences in the development of tolerance : about half of the animals showed a rigidity
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
after the test dose of morphine that was not significantly less than in the controls and were akinetic ( A group ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The other rats showed a strong decrease in the rigidity and the occurrence of stereotyped ( S ) licking and / or gnawing in presence of akinetic or hyperkinetic (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
K ) behaviour ( AS / KS group ) , suggesting signs of dopaminergic activation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The rigidity was considerably decreased in both groups after 20 days ' treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In a further series of experiments , haloperidol ( 0 . 2 mg / kg i . p . ) was used in order to block the dopaminergic activation and
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to estimate the real degree of the tolerance to the rigidity without any dopaminergic interference .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Haloperidol enhanced the rigidity in the A group .
B O O O O O O O O
However , the level in the AS / KS group remained considerably lower than in the A group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results suggest that rigidity , which is assumed to be due to an action of morphine in the striatum , can be antagonized by another process leading to dopaminergic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
activation in the striatum .
O O O O O
Nevertheless , there occurs some real tolerance to this effect .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The rapid alternations of rigidity and the signs of dopaminergic activation observed in the animals of the AS / KS group might be due to rapid shifts in the predominance
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of various DA - innervated structures .
O O O O O O O
Compression neuropathy of the radial nerve due to pentazocine - induced fibrous myopathy .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Fibrous myopathy is a common , well - known side effect of repeated pentazocine injection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
However , compression neuropathy due to fibrotic muscle affected by pentazocine - induced myopathy has not previously been reported .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
In a 37 - year - old woman with documented pentazocine - induced fibrous myopathy of triceps and deltoid muscles bilaterally and a three - week history of right wrist
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
drop , electrodiagnostic examination showed a severe but partial lesion of the right radial nerve distal to the branches to the triceps , in addition to the fibrous myopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Surgery revealed the right radial nerve to be severely compressed by the densely fibrotic lateral head of the triceps .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Decompression and neurolysis were performed with good subsequent recovery of function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recurrent reversible acute renal failure from amphotericin .
O O O O O O B O
A patient with cryptogenic cirrhosis and disseminated sporotrichosis developed acute renal failure immediately following the administration of amphotericin B on four separate occasions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
The abruptness of the renal failure and its reversibility within days suggests that there was a functional component to the renal dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We propose that amphotericin , in the setting of reduced effective arterial volume , may activate tubuloglomerular feedback , thereby contributing to acute renal failure .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pneumonitis with pleural and pericardial effusion and neuropathy during amiodarone therapy .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
A patient with sinuatrial disease and implanted pacemaker was treated with amiodarone ( maximum dose 1000 mg , maintenance dose 800 mg daily ) for 10 months , for control
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of supraventricular tachyarrhythmias .
O O O O
He developed pneumonitis , pleural and pericardial effusions , and a predominantly proximal motor neuropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Immediate but gradual improvement followed withdrawal of amiodarone and treatment with prednisolone .
O O O O O O O B O O O B O
Review of this and previously reported cases indicates the need for early diagnosis of amiodarone pneumonitis , immediate withdrawal of amiodarone , and prompt but continued steroid therapy to ensure
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O
full recovery .
O O O
Indomethacin - induced renal insufficiency : recurrence on rechallenge .
B O O O O O O O O O
We have reported a case of acute oliguric renal failure with hyperkalemia in a patient with cirrhosis , ascites , and cor pulmonale after indomethacin therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Prompt restoration of renal function followed drug withdrawal , while re - exposure to a single dose of indomethacin caused recurrence of acute reversible oliguria .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Our case supports the hypothesis that endogenous renal prostaglandins play a role in the maintenance of renal blood flow when circulating plasma volume is diminished .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Since nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory agents interfere with this compensatory mechanism and may cause acute renal failure , they should be used with caution in such patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Comparison of the subjective effects and plasma concentrations following oral and i . m .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
administration of flunitrazepam in volunteers .
O O B O O O
Flunitrazepam 0 . 5 , 1 . 0 or 2 . 0 mg was given by the oral or i . m .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
routes to groups of volunteers and its effects compared .
O O O O O O O O O O
Plasma concentrations of the drug were estimated by gas - liquid chromatography , in a smaller number of the subjects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The most striking effect was sedation which increased with the dose , 2 mg producing deep sleep although the subjects could still be aroused .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effects of i . m .
O O O O O O O
administration were apparent earlier and sometimes lasted longer than those following oral administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dizziness was less marked than sedation , but increased with the dose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was pain on i . m .
O O O O O O O O
injection of flunitrazepam significantly more often than with isotonic saline .
O O B O O O O O O O O
Plasma concentrations varied with dose and route and corresponded qualitatively with the subjective effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The drug was still present in measurable quantities after 24 h even with the smallest dose .

Changes in heart size during long - term timolol treatment after myocardial infarction .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
The effect of long - term timolol treatment on heart size after myocardial infarction was evaluated by X - ray in a double - blind study including 241 patients (
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
placebo 126 , timolol 115 ) .
O O O B O O O
The follow - up period was 12 months .
O O O O O O O O O
The timolol - treated patients showed a small but significant increase in heart size from baseline in contrast to a decrease in the placebo group .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These differences may be caused by timolol - induced bradycardia and a compensatory increase in end - diastolic volume .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The timolol - related increase in heart size was observed only in patients with normal and borderline heart size .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In patients with cardiomegaly , the increase in heart size was similar in both groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After re - infarction , heart size increased in the placebo group and remained unchanged in the timolol group .

Vitamin D3 toxicity in dairy cows .
B I O O O O O
Large parenteral doses of vitamin D3 ( 15 to 17 . 5 x 10 ( 6 ) IU vitamin D3 ) were associated with prolonged hypercalcemia , hyperphosphatemia , and
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
large increases of vitamin D3 and its metabolites in the blood plasma of nonlactating nonpregnant and pregnant Jersey cows .
O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Calcium concentrations 1 day postpartum were higher in cows treated with vitamin D3 about 32 days prepartum ( 8 . 8 mg / 100 ml ) than in control cows
B O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 5 . 5 mg / 100 ml ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
None of the cows treated with vitamin D3 showed signs of milk fever during the peripartal period ; however , 22 % of the control cows developed clinical signs of
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
milk fever during this period .
O O O O O O
Signs of vitamin D3 toxicity were not observed in nonlactating nonpregnant cows ; however , pregnant cows commonly developed severe signs of vitamin D3 toxicity and 10 of 17 cows
O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O
died .
O O
There was widespread metastatic calcification in the cows that died .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Because of the extreme toxicity of vitamin D3 in pregnant Jersey cows and the low margin of safety between doses of vitamin D3 that prevent milk fever and doses that
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
induce milk fever , we concluded that vitamin D3 can not be used practically to prevent milk fever when injected several weeks prepartum .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diseases of peripheral nerves as seen in the Nigerian African .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The anatomical and aetiological diagnoses of peripheral nerve disease excluding its primary benign and malignant disorders , as seen in 358 Nigerians are presented .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There is a male preponderance and the peak incidence is in the fourth decade .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sensori - motor neuropathy was the commonest presentation ( 50 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Guillain - Barr syndrome was the commonest identifiable cause ( 15 . 6 % ) , accounting for half of the cases with motor neuropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Peripheral neuropathy due to nutritional deficiency of thiamine and riboflavin was common ( 10 . 1 % ) and presented mainly as sensory and sensori - motor neuropathy .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diabetes mellitus was the major cause of autonomic neuropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O
Isoniazid was the most frequent agent in drug - induced neuropathy .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Migraine ( 20 % ) was not an uncommon cause of cranial neuropathy although malignancies arising from the reticuloendothelial system or related structures of the head and neck were more
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
frequent ( 26 % ) .
O O O O O O
In 26 . 5 % of all the cases , the aetiology of the neuropathy was undetermined .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Heredofamilial and connective tissue disorders were rare .
O O O O O O O O
Some of the factors related to the clinical presentation and pathogenesis of the neuropathies are briefly discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A double - blind study of the efficacy and safety of dothiepin hydrochloride in the treatment of major depressive disorder .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
In a 6 - week double - blind parallel treatment study , dothiepin and amitriptyline were compared to placebo in the treatment of 33 depressed outpatients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dothiepin and amitriptyline were equally effective in alleviating the symptoms of depressive illness , and both were significantly superior to placebo .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The overall incidence of side effects and the frequency and severity of blurred vision , dry mouth , and drowsiness were significantly less with dothiepin than with amitriptyline .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O
Dothiepin also produced fewer CNS and cardiovascular effects .
B O O O O O O O O
There were no clinically important changes in laboratory parameters .
O O O O O O O O O O
Dothiepin thus was found to be an effective antidepressant drug associated with fewer side effects than amitriptyline in the treatment of depressed outpatients .
B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Behavioral effects of diazepam and propranolol in patients with panic disorder and agoraphobia .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
The effects of oral doses of diazepam ( single dose of 10 mg and a median dose of 30 mg / day for 2 weeks ) and propranolol ( single
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
dose of 80 mg and a median dose of 240 mg / day for 2 weeks ) on psychological performance of patients with panic disorders and agoraphobia were investigated in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a double - blind , randomized and crossover design .
O O O O O O O O O O
Both drugs impaired immediate free recall but the decrease was greater for diazepam than propranolol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Delayed free recall was also impaired but the two drugs did not differ .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients tapped faster after propranolol than diazepam and they were more sedated after diazepam than propranolol .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O B O B O
After 2 weeks of treatment , patients tested 5 - 8 h after the last dose of medication did not show any decrement of performance .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results are similar to those previously found in healthy subjects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Accumulation of drugs was not reflected in prolonged behavioral impairment .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of aspirin on N - [ 4 - ( 5 - nitro - 2 - furyl ) - 2 - thiazolyl ] - formamide - induced epithelial proliferation in
O O B O B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O O
the urinary bladder and forestomach of the rat .
O O O O O O O O O
The co - administration of aspirin with N - [ 4 - ( 5 - nitro - 2 - furyl ) - 2 - thiazolyl ] - formamide (
O O O O O B O B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O
FANFT ) to rats resulted in a reduced incidence of FANFT - induced bladder carcinomas but a concomitant induction of forestomach tumors .
B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
An autoradiographic study was performed on male F - 344 rats fed diet containing FANFT at a level of 0 . 2 % and / or aspirin at a level
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
of 0 . 5 % to evaluate the effect of aspirin on the increased cell proliferation induced by FANFT in the forestomach and bladder .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
FANFT - induced cell proliferation in the bladder was significantly suppressed by aspirin co - administration after 4 weeks but not after 12 weeks .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the forestomach , and also in the liver , aspirin did not affect the FANFT - induced increase in labeling index .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O
The present results are consistent with the carcinogenicity experiment suggesting that different mechanisms are involved in FANFT carcinogenesis in the bladder and forestomach , and that aspirin 's effect on
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O
FANFT in the forestomach is not due to an irritant effect associated with increased cell proliferation .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Also , there appears to be an adaptation by the rats to the chronic ingestion of aspirin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Provocation of postural hypotension by nitroglycerin in diabetic autonomic neuropathy ?
O O O O O B O O O O O
The effect of nitroglycerin on heart rate and systolic blood pressure was compared in 5 normal subjects , 12 diabetic subjects without autonomic neuropathy , and 5 diabetic subjects with
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
autonomic neuropathy .
O O O
The magnitude and time course of the increase in heart rate and the decrease in systolic blood pressure after nitroglycerin were similar in the normal and diabetic subjects without autonomic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
neuropathy , whereas a lesser increase in heart rate and a greater decrease in systolic blood pressure occurred in the diabetic subjects with autonomic neuropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is therefore suggested that caution should be exercised when prescribing vasodilator drugs in diabetic patients , particularly those with autonomic neuropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Characterization of estrogen - induced adenohypophyseal tumors in the Fischer 344 rat .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Pituitary tumors were induced in F344 female rats by chronic treatment with diethylstilbestrol ( DES , 8 - 10 mg ) implanted subcutaneously in silastic capsules .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Over a range of 1 - 150 days of DES treatment , pairs of control and DES - treated rats were sacrificed , and their pituitaries dissociated enzymatically into single
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- cell preparations .
O O O O
The cell populations were examined regarding total cell recovery correlated with gland weight , intracellular prolactin ( PRL ) content and subsequent release in primary culture , immunocytochemical PRL staining
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, density and / or size alterations via separation on Ficoll - Hypaque and by unit gravity sedimentation , and cell cycle analysis , after acriflavine DNA staining , by
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
laser flow cytometry .
O O O O
Total cell yields from DES - treated pituitaries increased from 1 . 3 times control yields at 8 days of treatment to 58 . 9 times control values by day
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
150 .
O O
Intracellular PRL content ranged from 1 . 9 to 9 . 4 times control levels , and PRL release in vitro was significantly and consistently higher than controls , after
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
at least 8 days of DES exposure .
O O O O O B O O
Beyond 8 days of DES exposure , the immunochemically PRL - positive proportion of cells increased to over 50 % of the total population .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Increased density and / or size and PRL content were indicated for the majority of the PRL cell population in both types of separation protocols .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All these effects of DES were more pronounced among previously ovariectomized animals .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The data extend the findings of other investigators , further establishing the DES - induced tumor as a model for study of PRL cellular control mechanisms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Triamterene nephrolithiasis complicating dyazide therapy .
B O O B O O
A case of triamterene nephrolithiasis is reported in a man after 4 years of hydrochlorothiazide - triamterene therapy for hypertension .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O
The stone passed spontaneously and was found to contain a triamterene metabolite admixed with uric acid salts .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B I I O
Factors affecting triamterene nephrolithiasis are discussed and 2 previously reported cases are reviewed .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Metabolic involvement in adriamycin cardiotoxicity .
O O O B O O
The cardiotoxic effects of adriamycin were studied in mammalian myocardial cells in culture as a model system .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adriamycin inhibited cell growth and the rhythmic contractions characteristic of myocardial cells in culture .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A possible involvement of energy metabolism was suggested previously , and in this study the adenylate energy charge and phosphorylcreatine mole fraction were determined in the adriamycin - treated cells
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O
.
O
The adenylate energy charge was found to be significantly decreased , while the phophorylcreatine mole fraction was unchanged .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Such disparity suggests an inhibition of creatine phosphokinase .
O O O O O O B O O
The addition of 1 mM adenosine to the myocardial cell cultures markedly increases the ATP concentration through a pathway reportedly leading to a compartmentalized ATP pool .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O
In the adriamycin - treated cells , the addition of adenosine increased the adenylate charge and , concomitant with this inrcease , the cells ' functional integrity , in terms
O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of percentage of beating cells and rate of contractions , was maintained .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Age - dependent sensitivity of the rat to neurotoxic effects of streptomycin .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Streptomycin sulfate ( 300 mg / kg s . c . ) was injected for various periods into preweanling rats and for 3 weeks into weanling rats .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Beginning at 8 days of age , body movement and hearing were examined for 6 and up to 17 weeks , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Abnormal movements and deafness occurred only in rats treated during the preweaning period ; within this period the greatest sensitivities for these abnormalities occurred from 2 to 11 - 17
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and 5 to 11 days of age , respectively , indicating that the cochlea is more sensitive to streptomycin than the site ( vestibular or central ) responsible for the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
dyskinesias .
O O
Crescentic fibrillary glomerulonephritis associated with intermittent rifampin therapy for pulmonary tuberculosis .
O O O O O O B O O O O O
This case study reveals an unusual finding of rapidly proliferative crescentic glomerulonephritis in a patient treated with rifampin who had no other identifiable causes for developing this disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
This patient underwent a 10 - month regimen of rifampin and isoniazid for pulmonary tuberculosis and was discovered to have developed signs of severe renal failure five weeks after completion
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of therapy .
O O O
Renal biopsy revealed severe glomerulonephritis with crescents , electron dense fibrillar deposits and moderate lymphocytic interstitial infiltrate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Other possible causes of rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis were investigated and ruled out .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This report documents the unusual occurrence of rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis with crescents and fibrillar glomerulonephritis in a patient treated with rifampin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Time course of lipid peroxidation in puromycin aminonucleoside - induced nephropathy .
O O O O O O B I O O O O
Reactive oxygen species have been implicated in the pathogenesis of acute puromycin aminonucleoside ( PAN ) - induced nephropathy , with antioxidants significantly reducing the proteinuria .
O B O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
The temporal relationship between lipid peroxidation in the kidney and proteinuria was examined in this study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Rats were treated with a single IV injection of puromycin aminonucleoside , ( PAN , 7 . 5 mg / kg ) and 24 hour urine samples were obtained prior
O O O O O O O O O B I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to sacrifice on days 3 , 5 , 7 , 10 , 17 , 27 , 41
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( N = 5 - 10 per group ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
The kidneys were removed , flushed with ice cold TRIS buffer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Kidney cortices from each animal were used to prepare homogenates .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Tissue lipid peroxidation was measured in whole homogenates as well as in lipid extracts from homogenates as thiobarbituric acid reactive substances .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O
Proteinuria was evident at day 5 , peaked at day 7 and persisted to day 27 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lipid peroxidation in homogenates was maximal at day 3 and declined rapidly to control levels by day 17 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This study supports the role of lipid peroxidation in mediating the proteinuric injury in PAN nephropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Clomipramine - induced sleep disturbance does not impair its prolactin - releasing action .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The present study was undertaken to examine the role of sleep disturbance , induced by clomipramine administration , on the secretory rate of prolactin ( PRL ) in addition to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the direct drug effect .
O O O O O
Two groups of supine subjects were studied under placebo - controlled conditions , one during the night , when sleeping ( n = 7 ) and the other at daytime
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, when awake ( n = 6 ) .
O O O O O O O O O
Each subject received a single 50 mg dose of clomipramine given orally 2 hours before blood collection .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Plasma PRL concentrations were analysed at 10 min intervals and underlying secretory rates calculated by a deconvolution procedure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
For both experiments the drug intake led to significant increases in PRL secretion , acting preferentially on tonic secretion as pulse amplitude and frequency did not differ significantly from corresponding
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
control values .
O O O
During the night clomipramine ingestion altered the complete sleep architecture in that it suppressed REM sleep and the sleep cycles and induced increased wakefulness .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As the relative increase in PRL secretion expressed as a percentage of the mean did not significantly differ between the night and day time studies ( 46 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
19 % vs 34 + / -
O O O O O O O
10 % ) , it can be concluded that the observed sleep disturbance did not interfere with the drug action per se .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The presence of REM sleep was shown not to be a determining factor either for secretory pulse amplitude and frequency , as , for both , mean nocturnal values were
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
similar with and without prior clomipramine ingestion .
O O O O O B O O
Angioedema following the intravenous administration of metoprolol .
O O O O O O B O
A 72 - year - old woman was admitted to the hospital with """" flash """" pulmonary edema , preceded by chest pain , requiring intubation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Her medical history included coronary artery disease with previous myocardial infarctions , hypertension , and diabetes mellitus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A history of angioedema secondary to lisinopril therapy was elicited .
O O O O O O B O O O O
Current medications did not include angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitors or beta - blockers .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
She had no previous beta - blocking drug exposure .
O O O O O O O O O O
During the first day of hospitalization ( while intubated ) , intravenous metoprolol was given , resulting in severe angioedema .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The angioedema resolved after therapy with intravenous steroids and diphenhydramine hydrochloride .
O O O O O O O B O B O O
Effect of coniine on the developing chick embryo .
O O B O O O O O O
Coniine , an alkaloid from Conium maculatum ( poison hemlock ) , has been shown to be teratogenic in livestock .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The major teratogenic outcome is arthrogryposis , presumably due to nicotinic receptor blockade .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , coniine has failed to produce arthrogryposis in rats or mice and is only weakly teratogenic in rabbits .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of this study was to evaluate and compare the effects of coniine and nicotine in the developing chick .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
Concentrations of coniine and nicotine sulfate were 0 . 015 % , 0 . 03 % , 0 . 075 % , 0 . 15 % , 0 . 75
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% , 1 . 5 % , 3 % , and 6 % and 1 % , 5 % , and 10 % , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both compounds caused deformations and lethality in a dose - dependent manner .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All concentrations of nicotine sulfate caused some lethality but a no effect level for coniine lethality was 0 . 75 % .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The deformations caused by both coniine and nicotine sulfate were excessive flexion or extension of one or more toes .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
No histopathological alterations or differences in bone formation were seen in the limbs or toes of any chicks from any group ; however , extensive cranial hemorrhage occurred in all
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
nicotine sulfate - treated chicks .
B O O O O O
There was a statistically significant ( P < or = 0 . 01 ) decrease in movement in coniine and nicotine sulfate treated chicks as determined by ultrasound .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
Control chicks were in motion an average of 33 . 67 % of the time , while coniine - treated chicks were only moving 8 . 95 % of a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 - min interval , and no movement was observed for nicotine sulfate treated chicks .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
In summary , the chick embryo provides a reliable and simple experimental animal model of coniine - induced arthrogryposis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Data from this model support a mechanism involving nicotinic receptor blockade with subsequent decreased fetal movement .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Epidural blood flow during prostaglandin E1 or trimethaphan induced hypotension .
O O O O B I O B O O O
To evaluate the effect of prostaglandin E1 ( PGE1 ) or trimethaphan ( TMP ) induced hypotension on epidural blood flow ( EBF ) during spinal surgery , EBF was
O O O O O B I O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
measured using the heat clearance method in 30 patients who underwent postero - lateral interbody fusion under isoflurane anaesthesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
An initial dose of 0 . 1 microgram . kg - 1 . min - 1 of PGE1 ( 15 patients ) , or 10 micrograms . kg - 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
. min - 1 of TMP ( 15 patients ) was administered intravenously after the dural opening and the dose was adjusted to maintain the mean arterial blood pressure (
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MAP ) at about 60 mmHg .
O O O O O O O
The hypotensive drug was discontinued at the completion of the operative procedure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After starting PGE1 or TMP , MAP and rate pressure product ( RPP ) decreased significantly compared with preinfusion values ( P < 0 . 01 ) , and the
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
degree of hypotension due to PGE1 remained constant until 60 min after its discontinuation .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Heart rate ( HR ) did not change in either group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
EBFF did not change during PGE1 infusion whereas in the TMP group , EBF decreased significantly at 30 and 60 min after the start of TMP ( preinfusion : 45
O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
. 9 + / -
O O O O O
13 . 9 ml / 100g / min .
O O O O O O O O O
30 min : 32 . 3 + / -
O O O O O O O O O
9 . 9 ml / 100
O O O O O O
g / min ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
60 min : 30 + / -
O O O O O O O
7 . 5 ml / 100 g / min ( P < 0 . 05 ) ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that PGE1 may be preferable to TMP for hypotensive anaesthesia in spinal surgery because TMP decreased EBF .
O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O
Immunohistochemical studies with antibodies to neurofilament proteins on axonal damage in experimental focal lesions in rat .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Immunohistochemistry with monoclonal antibodies against neurofilament ( NF ) proteins of middle and high molecular weight class , NF - M and NF - H , was used to study
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
axonal injury in the borderzone of focal lesions in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Focal injury in the cortex was produced by infusion of lactate at acid pH or by stab caused by needle insertion .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Infarcts in substantia nigra pars reticulata were evoked by prolonged pilocarpine - induced status epilepticus .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Immunohistochemical staining for NFs showed characteristic terminal clubs of axons in the borderzone of lesions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Differences in the labelling pattern occurred with different antibodies which apparently depended on molecular weight class of NFs and phosphorylation state .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These immunohistochemical changes of NFs can serve as a marker for axonal damage in various experimental traumatic or ischemic lesions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Increase of Parkinson disability after fluoxetine medication .
O O O O O B O O
Depression is a major clinical feature of Parkinson 's disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O
We report the increased amount of motor disability in four patients with idiopathic Parkinson 's disease after exposure to the antidepressant fluoxetine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B B O
The possibility of a clinically relevant dopamine - antagonistic capacity of fluoxetine in Parkinson 's disease patients must be considered .
O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Acetaminophen - induced hypotension .
B O O O O
Through 30 years of widespread use , acetaminophen has been shown to be a remarkably safe medication in therapeutic dosages .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The potential for acetaminophen to produce cardiovascular toxicities is very low .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
However , acetaminophen has been demonstrated to produce symptoms of anaphylaxis , including hypotension , in sensitive individuals .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This article describes two critically ill patients in whom transient episodes of hypotension reproducibly developed after administration of acetaminophen .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Other symptoms of allergic reactions were not clinically detectable .
O O O O O O O O O O
The hypotensive episodes were severe enough to require vasopressor administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The reports illustrate the need for clinicians to consider acetaminophen in patients with hypotension of unknown origin .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Acute hepatitis , autoimmune hemolytic anemia , and erythroblastocytopenia induced by ceftriaxone .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
An 80 - yr - old man developed acute hepatitis shortly after ingesting oral ceftriaxone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Although the transaminases gradually returned to baseline after withholding the beta lactam antibiotic , there was a gradual increase in serum bilirubin and a decrease in hemoglobin concentration caused by
O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
an autoimmune hemolytic anemia and erythroblastocytopenia .
O O O O O O O
These responded to systemic steroids and immunoglobulins .
O O O O B O O O
Despite the widespread use of these agents this triad of side effects has not previously been reported in connection with beta lactam antibiotics .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
Adverse effects of the atypical antipsychotics .
O O O O O O O
Collaborative Working Group on Clinical Trial Evaluations .
O O O O O O O O
Adverse effects of antipsychotics often lead to noncompliance .
O O O O O O O O O
Thus , clinicians should address patients ' concerns about adverse effects and attempt to choose medications that will improve their patients ' quality of life as well as overall health
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The side effect profiles of the atypical antipsychotics are more advantageous than those of the conventional neuroleptics .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Conventional agents are associated with unwanted central nervous system effects , including extrapyramidal symptoms ( EPS ) , tardive dyskinesia , sedation , and possible impairment of some cognitive measures
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, as well as cardiac effects , orthostatic hypotension , hepatic changes , anticholinergic side effects , sexual dysfunction , and weight gain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The newer atypical agents have a lower risk of EPS , but are associated in varying degrees with sedation , cardiovascular effects , anticholinergic effects , weight gain , sexual
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dysfunction , hepatic effects , lowered seizure threshold ( primarily clozapine ) , and agranulocytosis ( clozapine only ) .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O
Since the incidence and severity of specific adverse effects differ among the various atypicals , the clinician should carefully consider which side effects are most likely to lead to the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
individual 's dissatisfaction and noncompliance before choosing an antipsychotic for a particular patient .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effects of tetrandrine and fangchinoline on experimental thrombosis in mice and human platelet aggregation .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
Tetrandrine ( TET ) and fangchinoline ( FAN ) are two naturally occurring analogues with a bisbenzylisoquinoline structure .
B O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O B O O
The present study was undertaken to investigate the effects of TET and FAN on the experimental thrombosis induced by collagen plus epinephrine ( EP ) in mice , and platelet
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
aggregation and blood coagulation in vitro .
O O O O O O O
In the in vivo study , the administration ( 50 mg / kg , i . p . )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of TET and FAN in mice showed the inhibition of thrombosis by 55 % and 35 % , respectively , while acetylsalicylic acid ( ASA , 50 mg / kg
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O
, i . p . ) , a positive control , showed only 30 % inhibition .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the vitro human platelet aggregations induced by the agonists used in tests , TET and FAN showed the inhibitions dose dependently .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
In addition , neither TET nor FAN showed any anticoagulation activities in the measurement of the activated partial thromboplastin time ( APTT ) , prothrombin time ( PT ) and
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
thrombin time ( TT ) using human - citrated plasma .
O O O O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that antithrombosis of TET and FAN in mice may be mainly related to the antiplatelet aggregation activities .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Gemcitabine plus vinorelbine in nonsmall cell lung carcinoma patients age 70 years or older or patients who can not receive cisplatin .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Oncopaz Cooperative Group .
O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Although the prevalence of nonsmall cell lung carcinoma ( NSCLC ) is high among elderly patients , few data are available regarding the efficacy and toxicity of chemotherapy in this
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
group of patients .
O O O O
Recent reports indicate that single agent therapy with vinorelbine ( VNB ) or gemcitabine ( GEM ) may obtain a response rate of 20 - 30 % in elderly patients
O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, with acceptable toxicity and improvement in symptoms and quality of life .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the current study the efficacy and toxicity of the combination of GEM and VNB in elderly patients with advanced NSCLC or those with some contraindication to receiving cisplatin were
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
assessed .
O O
METHODS :
O O
Forty - nine patients with advanced NSCLC were included , 38 of whom were age >
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
/ =
O O
70 years and 11 were age < 70 years but who had some contraindication to receiving cisplatin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
All patients were evaluable for response and toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O
Treatment was comprised of VNB , 25 mg / m ( 2 ) , plus GEM , 1000 mg / m ( 2 ) , both on Days 1 ,
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
8 , and 15 every 28 days .
O O O O O O O O
Patients received a minimum of three courses unless progressive disease was detected .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
One hundred sixty - five courses were administered , with a median of 3 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
6 courses per patient .
O O O O O
The overall response rate was 26 % ( 95 % confidence interval , 15 - 41 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two patients attained a complete response ( 4 % ) and 11 patients ( 22 % ) achieved a partial response .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status improved in 35 % of those patients with an initial value > 0 , whereas relief of at least 1 symptom without worsening of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
other symptoms was noted in 27 patients ( 55 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The median time to progression was 16 weeks and the 1 - year survival rate was 33 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Toxicity was mild .
O O O O
Six patients ( 12 % ) had World Health Organization Grade 3 - 4 neutropenia , 2 patients ( 4 % ) had Grade 3 - 4 thrombocytopenia , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 patients ( 4 % ) had Grade 3 neurotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Three patients with severe neutropenia ( 6 % ) died of sepsis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The median age of those patients developing Grade 3 - 4 neutropenia was significantly higher than that of the remaining patients ( 75 years vs . 72 years ; P
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
= 0 . 047 ) .
O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The combination of GEM and VNB is moderately active and well tolerated except in patients age > / = 75 years .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This age group had an increased risk of myelosuppression .
O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore the prophylactic use of granulocyte - colony stimulating factor should be considered with this treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
New chemotherapy combinations with higher activity and lower toxicity are needed for elderly patients with advanced NSCLC .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Warfarin - induced artery calcification is accelerated by growth and vitamin D .
B O O O O O O O O O B I O
The present studies demonstrate that growth and vitamin D treatment enhance the extent of artery calcification in rats given sufficient doses of Warfarin to inhibit gamma - carboxylation of matrix
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Gla protein , a calcification inhibitor known to be expressed by smooth muscle cells and macrophages in the artery wall .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The first series of experiments examined the influence of age and growth status on artery calcification in Warfarin - treated rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Treatment for 2 weeks with Warfarin caused massive focal calcification of the artery media in 20 - day - old rats and less extensive focal calcification in 42 - day
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- old rats .
O O O O
In contrast , no artery calcification could be detected in 10 - month - old adult rats even after 4 weeks of Warfarin treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
To directly examine the importance of growth to Warfarin - induced artery calcification in animals of the same age , 20 - day - old rats were fed for 2
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
weeks either an ad libitum diet or a 6 - g / d restricted diet that maintains weight but prevents growth .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Concurrent treatment of both dietary groups with Warfarin produced massive focal calcification of the artery media in the ad libitum - fed rats but no detectable artery calcification in the
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
restricted - diet , growth - inhibited group .
O O O O O O O O O
Although the explanation for the association between artery calcification and growth status can not be determined from the present study , there was a relationship between higher serum phosphate and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
susceptibility to artery calcification , with 30 % higher levels of serum phosphate in young , ad libitum - fed rats compared with either of the groups that was resistant
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to Warfarin - induced artery calcification , ie , the 10 - month - old rats and the restricted - diet , growth - inhibited young rats .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This observation suggests that increased susceptibility to Warfarin - induced artery calcification could be related to higher serum phosphate levels .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The second set of experiments examined the possible synergy between vitamin D and Warfarin in artery calcification .
O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O
High doses of vitamin D are known to cause calcification of the artery media in as little as 3 to 4 days .
O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
High doses of the vitamin K antagonist Warfarin are also known to cause calcification of the artery media , but at treatment times of 2 weeks or longer yet not
O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
at 1 week .
O O O O
