In the current study , we investigated the synergy between these 2 treatments and found that concurrent Warfarin administration dramatically increased the extent of calcification in the media of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
vitamin D - treated rats at 3 and 4 days .
B I O O O O O O O O O
There was a close parallel between the effect of vitamin D dose on artery calcification and the effect of vitamin D dose on the elevation of serum calcium , which
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O B O O
suggests that vitamin D may induce artery calcification through its effect on serum calcium .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O B O
Because Warfarin treatment had no effect on the elevation in serum calcium produced by vitamin D , the synergy between Warfarin and vitamin D is probably best explained by the
O B O O O O O O O O O B O O B I O O O O B O B I O O O O O O
hypothesis that Warfarin inhibits the activity of matrix Gla protein as a calcification inhibitor .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
High levels of matrix Gla protein are found at sites of artery calcification in rats treated with vitamin D plus Warfarin , and chemical analysis showed that the protein that
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O
accumulated was indeed not gamma - carboxylated .
O O O O B I I O
These observations indicate that although the gamma - carboxyglutamate residues of matrix Gla protein are apparently required for its function as a calcification inhibitor , they are not required for
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
its accumulation at calcification sites .
O O O O O O
Antidepressant - induced mania in bipolar patients : identification of risk factors .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : Concerns about possible risks of switching to mania associated with antidepressants continue to interfere with the establishment of an optimal treatment paradigm for bipolar depression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHOD :
O O
The response of 44 patients meeting DSM - IV criteria for bipolar disorder to naturalistic treatment was assessed for at least 6 weeks using the Montgomery - Asberg Depression Rating
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Scale and the Bech - Rafaelson Mania Rating Scale .
O O O O O O O O O O
Patients who experienced a manic or hypomanic switch were compared with those who did not on several variables including age , sex , diagnosis ( DSM - IV bipolar I
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
vs . bipolar II ) , number of previous manic episodes , type of antidepressant therapy used ( electroconvulsive therapy vs . antidepressant drugs and , more particularly , selective
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
serotonin reuptake inhibitors [ SSRIs ] ) , use and type of mood stabilizers ( lithium vs . anticonvulsants ) , and temperament of the patient , assessed during a
B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
normothymic period using the hyperthymia component of the Semi - structured Affective Temperament Interview .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Switches to hypomania or mania occurred in 27 % of all patients ( N = 12 ) ( and in 24 % of the subgroup of patients treated with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
SSRIs [ 8 / 33 ] ) ; 16 % ( N = 7 ) experienced manic episodes , and 11 % ( N = 5 ) experienced hypomanic episodes
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Sex , age , diagnosis ( bipolar I vs . bipolar II ) , and additional treatment did not affect the risk of switching .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of mood switches seemed not to differ between patients receiving an anticonvulsant and those receiving no mood stabilizer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , mood switches were less frequent in patients receiving lithium ( 15 % , 4 / 26 ) than in patients not treated with lithium ( 44 %
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
, 8 / 18 ; p = . 04 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The number of previous manic episodes did not affect the probability of switching , whereas a high score on the hyperthymia component of the Semistructured Affective Temperament Interview was associated
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with a greater risk of switching ( p = . 008 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
The frequency of mood switching associated with acute antidepressant therapy may be reduced by lithium treatment .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O
Particular attention should be paid to patients with a hyperthymic temperament , who have a greater risk of mood switches .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Caffeine - induced cardiac arrhythmia : an unrecognised danger of healthfood products .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
We describe a 25 - year - old woman with pre - existing mitral valve prolapse who developed intractable ventricular fibrillation after consuming a """" natural energy """" guarana health
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
drink containing a high concentration of caffeine .
O O O O O O B O
This case highlights the need for adequate labelling and regulation of such products .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bladder retention of urine as a result of continuous intravenous infusion of fentanyl : 2 case reports .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Sedation has been commonly used in the neonate to decrease the stress and pain from the noxious stimuli and invasive procedures in the neonatal intensive care unit , as well
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
as to facilitate synchrony between ventilator and spontaneous breaths .
O O O O O O O O O O
Fentanyl , an opioid analgesic , is frequently used in the neonatal intensive care unit setting for these very purposes .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Various reported side effects of fentanyl administration include chest wall rigidity , hypotension , respiratory depression , and bradycardia .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Here , 2 cases of urinary bladder retention leading to renal pelvocalyceal dilatation mimicking hydronephrosis as a result of continuous infusion of fentanyl are reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Combined antiretroviral therapy causes cardiomyopathy and elevates plasma lactate in transgenic AIDS mice .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Highly active antiretroviral therapy ( HAART ) is implicated in cardiomyopathy ( CM ) and in elevated plasma lactate ( LA ) in AIDS through mechanisms of mitochondrial dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
To determine mitochondrial events from HAART in vivo , 8 - week - old hemizygous transgenic AIDS mice ( NL4 - 3Delta gag / pol ; TG ) and wild
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- type FVB / n littermates were treated with the HAART combination of zidovudine , lamivudine , and indinavir or vehicle control for 10 days or 35 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O
At termination of the experiments , mice underwent echocardiography , quantitation of abundance of molecular markers of CM ( ventricular mRNA encoding atrial natriuretic factor [ ANF ] and sarcoplasmic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
calcium ATPase [ SERCA2 ] ) , and determination of plasma LA .
B O O O O O O O O O O B O
Myocardial histologic features were analyzed semiquantitatively and results were confirmed by transmission electron microscopy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After 35 days in the TG + HAART cohort , left ventricular mass increased 160 % by echocardiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Molecularly , ANF mRNA increased 250 % and SERCA2 mRNA decreased 57 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Biochemically , LA was elevated ( 8 . 5 + / -
O O B O O O O O O O O O
2 . 0 mM ) .
O O O O O O
Pathologically , granular cytoplasmic changes were found in cardiac myocytes , indicating enlarged , damaged mitochondria .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Findings were confirmed ultrastructurally .
O O O O O
No changes were found in other cohorts .
O O O O O O O O
After 10 days , only ANF was elevated , and only in the TG + HAART cohort .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Results show that cumulative HAART caused mitochondrial CM with elevated LA in AIDS transgenic mice .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Oral contraceptives and the risk of myocardial infarction .
B I O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
An association between the use of oral contraceptives and the risk of myocardial infarction has been found in some , but not all , studies .
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We investigated this association , according to the type of progestagen included in third - generation ( i . e . , desogestrel or gestodene ) and second - generation
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
( i . e . , levonorgestrel ) oral contraceptives , the dose of estrogen , and the presence or absence of prothrombotic mutations METHODS :
O O O O O O B O B I O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In a nationwide , population - based , case - control study , we identified and enrolled 248 women 18 through 49 years of age who had had a first
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
myocardial infarction between 1990 and 1995 and 925 control women who had not had a myocardial infarction and who were matched for age , calendar year of the index event
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and area of residence .
O O O O O O
Subjects supplied information on oral - contraceptive use and major cardiovascular risk factors .
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O
An analysis for factor V Leiden and the G20210A mutation in the prothrombin gene was conducted in 217 patients and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
763 controls RESULTS :
O O O O
The odds ratio for myocardial infarction among women who used any type of combined oral contraceptive , as compared with nonusers , was 2 . 0 ( 95 percent confidence
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
interval , 1 . 5 to 2 . 8 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The adjusted odds ratio was 2 . 5 ( 95 percent confidence interval , 1 . 5 to 4 . 1 ) among women who used second - generation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
oral contraceptives and 1 . 3 ( 95 percent confidence interval , 0 . 7 to 2 . 5 ) among those who used third - generation oral contraceptives .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Among women who used oral contraceptives , the odds ratio was 2 . 1 ( 95 percent confidence interval , 1 . 5 to 3 . 0 ) for those
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
without a prothrombotic mutation and 1 . 9 ( 95 percent confidence interval , 0 . 6 to 5 . 5 ) for those with a mutation CONCLUSIONS : The
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
risk of myocardial infarction was increased among women who used second - generation oral contraceptives .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
The results with respect to the use of third - generation oral contraceptives were inconclusive but suggested that the risk was lower than the risk associated with second - generation
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
oral contraceptives .
B I O
The risk of myocardial infarction was similar among women who used oral contraceptives whether or not they had a prothrombotic mutation .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O
Effects of 5 - HT1B receptor ligands microinjected into the accumbal shell or core on the cocaine - induced locomotor hyperactivity in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The present study was designed to examine the effect of 5 - HT1B receptor ligands microinjected into the subregions of the nucleus accumbens ( the shell and the core )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
on the locomotor hyperactivity induced by cocaine in rats .
O O O O O O B O O O
Male Wistar rats were implanted bilaterally with cannulae into the accumbens shell or core , and then were locally injected with GR 55562 ( an antagonist of 5 - HT1B
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
receptors ) or CP 93129 ( an agonist of 5 - HT1B receptors ) .
O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
Given alone to any accumbal subregion , GR 55562 ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg / side ) or CP 93129 ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg /
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
side ) did not change basal locomotor activity .
O O O O O O O O O
Systemic cocaine ( 10 mg / kg ) significantly increased the locomotor activity of rats .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
GR 55562 ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg / side )
B I O O O O O O O O O O
, administered intra - accumbens shell prior to cocaine , dose - dependently attenuated the psychostimulant - induced locomotor hyperactivity .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Such attenuation was not found in animals which had been injected with GR 55562 into the accumbens core .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
When injected into the accumbens shell ( but not the core ) before cocaine , CP 93129 ( 0 . 1 - 10 microg / side ) enhanced the locomotor
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
response to cocaine ; the maximum effect being observed after 10 microg / side of the agonist .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The later enhancement was attenuated after intra - accumbens shell treatment with GR 55562 ( 1 microg / side ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
Our findings indicate that cocaine induced hyperlocomotion is modified by 5 - HT1B receptor ligands microinjected into the accumbens shell , but not core , this modification consisting in inhibitory
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and facilitatory effects of the 5 - HT1B receptor antagonist ( GR 55562 ) and agonist ( CP 93129 ) , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O B I O O O O
In other words , the present results suggest that the accumbal shell 5 - HT1B receptors play a permissive role in the behavioural response to the psychostimulant .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ticlopidine - induced cholestatic hepatitis .
B O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To report 2 cases of ticlopidine - induced cholestatic hepatitis , investigate its mechanism , and compare the observed main characteristics with those of the published cases .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CASE SUMMARIES :
O O O
Two patients developed prolonged cholestatic hepatitis after receiving ticlopidine following percutaneous coronary angioplasty , with complete remission during the follow - up period .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
T - cell stimulation by therapeutic concentration of ticlopidine was demonstrated in vitro in the patients , but not in healthy controls .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
Cholestatic hepatitis is a rare complication of the antiplatelet agent ticlopidine ; several cases have been reported but few in the English literature .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our patients developed jaundice following treatment with ticlopidine and showed the clinical and laboratory characteristics of cholestatic hepatitis , which resolved after discontinuation of the drug .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hepatitis may develop weeks after discontinuation of the drug and may run a prolonged course , but complete remission was observed in all reported cases .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An objective causality assessment revealed that the adverse drug event was probably related to the use of ticlopidine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The mechanisms of this ticlopidine - induced cholestasis are unclear .
O O O O B O O O O O O
Immune mechanisms may be involved in the drug 's hepatotoxicity , as suggested by the T - cell stimulation study reported here .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Cholestatic hepatitis is a rare adverse effect of ticlopidine that may be immune mediated .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Patients receiving the drug should be monitored with liver function tests along with complete blood cell counts .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This complication will be observed even less often in the future as ticlopidine is being replaced by the newer antiplatelet agent clopidogrel .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O
Epithelial sodium channel ( ENaC ) subunit mRNA and protein expression in rats with puromycin aminonucleoside - induced nephrotic syndrome .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
In experimental nephrotic syndrome , urinary sodium excretion is decreased during the early phase of the disease .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The molecular mechanism ( s ) leading to salt retention has not been completely elucidated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The rate - limiting constituent of collecting duct sodium transport is the epithelial sodium channel ( ENaC ) .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O
We examined the abundance of ENaC subunit mRNAs and proteins in puromycin aminonucleoside ( PAN ) - induced nephrotic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O
The time courses of urinary sodium excretion , plasma aldosterone concentration and proteinuria were studied in male Sprague - Dawley rats treated with a single dose of either PAN or
O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
vehicle .
O O
The relative amounts of alphaENaC , betaENaC and gammaENaC mRNAs were determined in kidneys from these rats by real - time quantitative TaqMan PCR , and the amounts of proteins
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
by Western blot .
O O O O
The kinetics of urinary sodium excretion and the appearance of proteinuria were comparable with those reported previously .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sodium retention occurred on days 2 , 3 and 6 after PAN injection .
B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
A significant up - regulation of alphaENaC and betaENaC mRNA abundance on days 1 and 2 preceded sodium retention on days 2 and 3 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Conversely , down - regulation of alphaENaC , betaENaC and gammaENaC mRNA expression on day 3 occurred in the presence of high aldosterone concentrations , and was followed by a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
return of sodium excretion to control values .
O O B O O O O O
The amounts of alphaENaC , betaENaC and gammaENaC proteins were not increased during PAN - induced sodium retention .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O
In conclusion , ENaC mRNA expression , especially alphaENaC , is increased in the very early phase of the experimental model of PAN - induced nephrotic syndrome in rats ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
but appears to escape from the regulation by aldosterone after day 3 .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
NO - induced migraine attack : strong increase in plasma calcitonin gene - related peptide ( CGRP ) concentration and negative correlation with platelet serotonin release .
B O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O B O O O O O O O B O O
The aim of the present study was to investigate changes in the plasma calcitonin gene - related peptide ( CGRP ) concentration and platelet serotonin ( 5 - hydroxytriptamine ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O B O O O O B O B I I O
5 - HT ) content during the immediate headache and the delayed genuine migraine attack provoked by nitroglycerin .
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Fifteen female migraineurs ( without aura ) and eight controls participated in the study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sublingual nitroglycerin ( 0 . 5 mg ) was administered .
O B O O O O O O O O O
Blood was collected from the antecubital vein four times : 60 min before and after the nitroglycerin application , and 60 and 120 min after the beginning of the migraine
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
attack ( mean 344 and 404 min ; 12 subjects ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
In those subjects who had no migraine attack ( 11 subjects ) a similar time schedule was used .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Plasma CGRP concentration increased significantly ( P < 0 . 01 ) during the migraine attack and returned to baseline after the cessation of the migraine .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , both change and peak , showed significant positive correlations with migraine headache intensity ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , plasma CGRP concentrations failed to change during immediate headache and in the subjects with no migraine attack .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Basal CGRP concentration was significantly higher and platelet 5 - HT content tended to be lower in subjects who experienced a migraine attack .
O B O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Platelet serotonin content decreased significantly ( P < 0 . 01 ) after nitroglycerin in subjects with no migraine attack but no consistent change was observed in patients with migraine
O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
attack .
O O
In conclusion , the fact that plasma CGRP concentration correlates with the timing and severity of a migraine headache suggests a direct relationship between CGRP and migraine .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
In contrast , serotonin release from platelets does not provoke migraine , it may even counteract the headache and the concomitant CGRP release in this model .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Coronary aneurysm after implantation of a paclitaxel - eluting stent .
O O O O O O B O O O O
Formation of coronary aneurysm is a rare complication of stenting with bare metal stents , but based on experimental studies drug - eluting stents may induce toxic effects on the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
vessel wall with incomplete stent apposition , aneurysm formation and with the potential of stent thrombosis or vessel rupture .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We present a 43 - year - old man who developed a coronary aneurysm in the right coronary artery 6 months after receiving a paclitaxel - eluting stent .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The patient was asymptomatic and the aneurysm was detected in a routine control .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Angiography and intracoronary ultrasound demonstrated lack of contact between stent and vessel wall in a 15 - mm long segment with maximal aneurysm diameter of 6 . 0 mm .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient was successfully treated with a graft stent .
O O O O O O O O O O
Behavioral effects of urotensin - II centrally administered in mice .
O O O B I I O O O O O
Urotensin - II ( U - II ) receptors are widely distributed in the central nervous system .
B I I O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O
Intracerebroventricular ( i . c . v . ) injection of U - II causes hypertension and bradycardia and stimulates prolactin and thyrotropin secretion .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O
However , the behavioral effects of centrally administered U - II have received little attention .
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O
In the present study , we tested the effects of i . c . v .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
injections of U - II on behavioral , metabolic , and endocrine responses in mice .
O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O
Administration of graded doses of U - II ( 1 - 10 , 000 ng / mouse ) provoked : ( 1 ) a dose - dependent reduction in the
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
number of head dips in the hole - board test ; ( 2 ) a dose - dependent reduction in the number of entries in the white chamber in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
black - and - white compartment test , and in the number of entries in the central platform and open arms in the plus - maze test ; and (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
3 ) a dose - dependent increase in the duration of immobility in the forced - swimming test and tail suspension test .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intracerebroventricular injection of U - II also caused an increase in : food intake at doses of 100 and 1 , 000 ng / mouse , water intake at doses
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of 100 - 10 , 000 ng / mouse , and horizontal locomotion activity at a dose of 10 , 000 ng / mouse .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Whatever was the dose , the central administration of U - II had no effect on body temperature , nociception , apomorphine - induced penile erection and climbing behavior ,
O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
and stress - induced plasma corticosterone level .
O O O O O B O O
Taken together , the present study demonstrates that the central injection of U - II at doses of 1 - 10 , 000 ng / mouse induces anxiogenic - and
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
depressant - like effects in mouse .
O O O O O O O
These data suggest that U - II may be involved in some aspects of psychiatric disorders .
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
Recurrent dysphonia and acitretin .
O O O B O
We report the case of a woman complaining of dysphonia while she was treated by acitretin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Her symptoms totally regressed after drug withdrawal and reappeared when acitretin was reintroduced .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
To our knowledge , this is the first case of acitretin - induced dysphonia .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
This effect may be related to the pharmacological effect of this drug on mucous membranes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pharmacological modulation of pain - related brain activity during normal and central sensitization states in humans .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Abnormal processing of somatosensory inputs in the central nervous system ( central sensitization ) is the mechanism accounting for the enhanced pain sensitivity in the skin surrounding tissue injury (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
secondary hyperalgesia ) .
O O O O
Secondary hyperalgesia shares clinical characteristics with neurogenic hyperalgesia in patients with neuropathic pain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Abnormal brain responses to somatosensory stimuli have been found in patients with hyperalgesia as well as in normal subjects during experimental central sensitization .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aim of this study was to assess the effects of gabapentin , a drug effective in neuropathic pain patients , on brain processing of nociceptive information in normal and
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
central sensitization states .
O O O O
Using functional magnetic resonance imaging ( fMRI ) in normal volunteers , we studied the gabapentin - induced modulation of brain activity in response to nociceptive mechanical stimulation of normal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
skin and capsaicin - induced secondary hyperalgesia .
O O B O O O O O
The dose of gabapentin was 1 , 800 mg per os , in a single administration .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We found that ( i ) gabapentin reduced the activations in the bilateral operculoinsular cortex , independently of the presence of central sensitization ; ( ii ) gabapentin reduced the
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
activation in the brainstem , only during central sensitization ; ( iii ) gabapentin suppressed stimulus - induced deactivations , only during central sensitization ; this effect was more robust
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
than the effect on brain activation .
O O O O O O O
The observed drug - induced effects were not due to changes in the baseline fMRI signal .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings indicate that gabapentin has a measurable antinociceptive effect and a stronger antihyperalgesic effect most evident in the brain areas undergoing deactivation , thus supporting the concept that
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
gabapentin is more effective in modulating nociceptive transmission when central sensitization is present .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MDMA polydrug users show process - specific central executive impairments coupled with impaired social and emotional judgement processes .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In recent years working memory deficits have been reported in users of MDMA ( 3 , 4 - methylenedioxymethamphetamine , ecstasy ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I I I O B O O
The current study aimed to assess the impact of MDMA use on three separate central executive processes ( set shifting , inhibition and memory updating ) and also on """"
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
prefrontal """" mediated social and emotional judgement processes .
O O O O O O O O O
Fifteen polydrug ecstasy users and 15 polydrug non - ecstasy user controls completed a general drug use questionnaire , the Brixton Spatial Anticipation task ( set shifting ) , Backward
O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Digit Span procedure ( memory updating ) , Inhibition of Return ( inhibition ) , an emotional intelligence scale , the Tromso Social Intelligence Scale and the Dysexecutive Questionnaire (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DEX ) .
O O O
Compared with MDMA - free polydrug controls , MDMA polydrug users showed impairments in set shifting and memory updating , and also in social and emotional judgement processes .
O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The latter two deficits remained significant after controlling for other drug use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These data lend further support to the proposal that cognitive processes mediated by the prefrontal cortex may be impaired by recreational ecstasy use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Severe citrate toxicity complicating volunteer apheresis platelet donation .
O B O O O O O O O
We report a case of severe citrate toxicity during volunteer donor apheresis platelet collection .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The donor was a 40 - year - old female , first - time apheresis platelet donor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Past medical history was remarkable for hypertension , hyperlipidemia , and depression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reported medications included bumetanide , pravastatin , and paroxetine .
O O O B O B O O B O
Thirty minutes from the start of the procedure , the donor noted tingling around the mouth , hands , and feet .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
She then very rapidly developed acute onset of severe facial and extremity tetany .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Empirical treatment with intravenous calcium gluconate was initiated , and muscle contractions slowly subsided over approximately 10 to 15 minutes .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The events are consistent with a severe reaction to calcium chelation by sodium citrate anticoagulant resulting in symptomatic systemic hypocalcemia .
O O O O O O O O O B O O B I O O O O O O O
Upon additional retrospective analysis , it was noted that bumetanide is a loop diuretic that may cause significant hypocalcemia .
O O O O O O O O O B O O B I O O O O O O
We conclude that careful screening for medications and underlying conditions predisposing to hypocalcemia is recommended to help prevent severe reactions due to citrate toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Laboratory measurement of pre - procedure serum calcium levels in selected donors may identify cases requiring heightened vigilance .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The case also illustrates the importance of maintaining preparedness for managing rare but serious reactions in volunteer apheresis blood donors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Proteinuria after conversion to sirolimus in renal transplant recipients .
O O O O B O O O O O
Sirolimus ( SRL ) is a new , potent immunosuppressive agent .
B O B O O O O O O O O O
More recently , proteinuria has been reported as a consequence of sirolimus therapy , although the mechanism has remained unclear .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
We retrospectively examined the records of 25 renal transplant patients , who developed or displayed increased proteinuria after SRL conversion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The patient cohort ( 14 men , 11 women ) was treated with SRL as conversion therapy , due to chronic allograft nephropathy ( CAN ) ( n = 15
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) neoplasia ( n = 8 ) ; Kaposi 's sarcoma , Four skin cancers , One intestinal tumors , One renal cell carsinom ) or BK virus nephropathy (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
n = 2 ) .
O O O O O
SRL was started at a mean of 78 + / -
B O O O O O O O O O O
42 ( 15 to 163 ) months after transplantation .
O O O O O O O O O O
Mean follow - up on SRL therapy was 20 + / -
O O O O O B O O O O O O
12 ( 6 to 43 ) months .
O O O O O O O O
Proteinuria increased from 0 . 445 ( 0 to 1 . 5 ) g / d before conversion to 3 . 2 g / dL ( 0 . 2 to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
12 ) after conversion ( P = 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Before conversion 8 ( 32 % ) patients had no proteinuria , whereas afterwards all patients had proteinuria .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 28 % of patients proteinuria remained unchanged , whereas it increased in 68 % of patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 40 % it increased by more than 100 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Twenty - eight percent of patients showed increased proteinuria to the nephrotic range .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Biopsies performed in five patients revealed new pathological changes : One membranoproliferative glomerulopathy and interstitial nephritis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These patients showed persistently good graft function .
O O O O O O O O
Serum creatinine values did not change significantly : 1 . 98 + / -
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 8 mg / dL before SRL therapy and 2 . 53 + / -
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
1 . 9 mg / dL at last follow - up
O O O O O O O O O O O
( P = . 14 ) .
O O O O O O O
Five grafts were lost and the patients returned to dialysis .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Five patients displayed CAN and Kaposi 's sarcoma .
O O O O O O O O O
Mean urinary protein of patients who returned to dialysis was 1 . 26 ( 0 . 5 to 3 . 5 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
g
O
/ d before and 4 . 7 ( 3 to 12 ) g / d after conversion ( P = . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mean serum creatinine level before conversion was 2 . 21 mg / dL and thereafter , 4 . 93 mg / dL ( P = . 02 ) .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Heavy proteinuria was common after the use of SRL as rescue therapy for renal transplantation .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Therefore , conversion should be considered for patients who have not developed advanced CAN and proteinuria .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The possibility of de novo glomerular pathology under SRL treatment requires further investigation by renal biopsy .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
In vitro characterization of parasympathetic and sympathetic responses in cyclophosphamide - induced cystitis in the rat .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
In cyclophosphamide - induced cystitis in the rat , detrusor function is impaired and the expression and effects of muscarinic receptors altered .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Whether or not the neuronal transmission may be affected by cystitis was presently investigated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Responses of urinary strip preparations from control and cyclophosphamide - pretreated rats to electrical field stimulation and to agonists were assessed in the absence and presence of muscarinic , adrenergic
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and purinergic receptor antagonists .
O O O O O
Generally , atropine reduced contractions , but in contrast to controls , it also reduced responses to low electrical field stimulation intensity ( 1 - 5 Hz ) in inflamed
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
preparations .
O O
In both types , purinoceptor desensitization with alpha , beta - methylene adenosine - 5' - triphosphate ( alpha , beta - meATP ) caused further reductions at low frequencies
O O O O O O O B I I I I I I I I I O B I I I I O O O O O O O
( < 10 Hz ) .
O O O O O O
The muscarinic receptor antagonists atropine , 4 - diphenylacetoxy - N - methylpiperidine ( 4 - DAMP ) ( ' M ( 1 ) / M ( 3 ) /
O O O O B O B I I I I I I O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
M ( 5 ) - selective ' ) , methoctramine ( ' M ( 2 ) - selective ' ) and pirenzepine ( ' M ( 1 ) - selective
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
' ) antagonized the tonic component of the electrical field stimulation - evoked contractile response more potently than the phasic component .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 - DAMP inhibited the tonic contractions in controls more potently than methoctramine and pirenzepine .
B I I O O O O O O O O O B O B O
In inflamed preparations , the muscarinic receptor antagonism on the phasic component of the electrical field stimulation - evoked contraction was decreased and the pirenzepine and 4 - DAMP antagonism
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I O
on the tonic component was much less efficient than in controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast to controls , methoctramine increased - - instead of decreased - - the tonic responses at high frequencies .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
While contractions to carbachol and ATP were the same in inflamed and in control strips when related to a reference potassium response , isoprenaline - induced relaxations were smaller in
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O
inflamed strips .
O O O
Thus , in cystitis substantial changes of the efferent functional responses occur .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
While postjunctional beta - adrenoceptor - mediated relaxations are reduced , effects by prejunctional inhibitory muscarinic receptors may be increased .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Associations between use of benzodiazepines or related drugs and health , physical abilities and cognitive function : a non - randomised clinical study in the elderly .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To describe associations between the use of benzodiazepines or related drugs ( BZDs / RDs ) and health , functional abilities and cognitive function in the elderly .
O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
A non - randomised clinical study of patients aged > or = 65 years admitted to acute hospital wards during 1 month .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
164 patients ( mean age + / -
O O O O O O O O
standard deviation [ SD ] 81 . 6 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O
6 . 8 years ) were admitted .
O O O O O O O O
Of these , nearly half ( n = 78 ) had used BZDs / RDs before admission , and the remainder ( n = 86 ) were non - users
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Cognitive ability was assessed by the Mini - Mental State Examination ( MMSE ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients scoring > or = 20 MMSE sum points were interviewed ( n = 79 ) and questioned regarding symptoms and functional abilities during the week prior to admission .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Data on use of BZDs / RDs before admission , current medications and discharge diagnoses were collected from medical records .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Health , physical abilities and cognitive function were compared between BZD / RD users and non - users , and adjustments were made for confounding variables .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The residual serum concentrations of oxazepam , temazepam and zopiclone were analysed .
O O O O O B O B O B O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The mean + / -
O O O O O
SD duration of BZD / RD use was 7 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O
7 years ( range 1 - 31 ) .
O O O O O O O O O
Two or three BZDs / RDs were concomitantly taken by 26 % of users ( n = 20 ) .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Long - term use of these drugs was associated with female sex and use of a higher number of drugs with effects on the CNS , which tended to be
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
related to diagnosed dementia .
O O O O O
After adjustment for these variables as confounders , use of BZDs / RDs was not associated with cognitive function as measured by the MMSE .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , use of BZDs / RDs was associated with dizziness , inability to sleep after awaking at night and tiredness in the mornings during the week prior to admission
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and with stronger depressive symptoms measured at the beginning of the hospital stay .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Use of BZDs / RDs tended to be associated with a reduced ability to walk and shorter night - time sleep during the week prior to admission .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A higher residual serum concentration of temazepam correlated with a lower MMSE sum score after adjustment for confounding variables .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Long - term use and concomitant use of more than one BZD / RD were common in elderly patients hospitalised because of acute illnesses .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Long - term use was associated with daytime and night - time symptoms indicative of poorer health and potentially caused by the adverse effects of these drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute vocal fold palsy after acute disulfiram intoxication .
O O O O O O B O O
Acute peripheral neuropathy caused by a disulfiram overdose is very rare and there is no report of it leading to vocal fold palsy .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A 49 - year - old woman was transferred to our department because of quadriparesis , lancinating pain , sensory loss , and paresthesia of the distal limbs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One month previously , she had taken a single high dose of disulfiram ( 130 tablets of ALCOHOL STOP TAB , Shin - Poong Pharm .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Co . , Ansan , Korea ) in a suicide attempt .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
She was not an alcoholic .
O O O O O O
For the first few days after ingestion , she was in a confused state and had mild to moderate ataxia and giddiness .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
She noticed hoarseness and distally accentuated motor and sensory dysfunction after she had recovered from this state .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A nerve conduction study was consistent with severe sensorimotor axonal polyneuropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Laryngeal electromyography ( thyroarytenoid muscle ) showed ample denervation potentials .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Laryngoscopy revealed asymmetric vocal fold movements during phonation .
O O O O O O O O O
Her vocal change and weakness began to improve spontaneously about 3 weeks after transfer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This was a case of acute palsy of the recurrent laryngeal nerve and superimposed severe acute sensorimotor axonal polyneuropathy caused by high - dose disulfiram intoxication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Higher optical density of an antigen assay predicts thrombosis in patients with heparin - induced thrombocytopenia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
To correlate optical density and percent inhibition of a two - step heparin - induced thrombocytopenia ( HIT ) antigen assay with thrombosis ; the assay utilizes reaction inhibition characteristics
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of a high heparin concentration .
O O O B O O
PATIENTS AND METHODS :
O O O O
Patients with more than 50 % decrease in platelet count or thrombocytopenia ( < 150 x 10 ( 9 ) / L ) after exposure to heparin , who had
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
a positive two - step antigen assay [ optical density ( OD ) > 0 . 4 and > 50 inhibition with high concentration of heparin ] were included in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
the study .
O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Forty of 94 HIT patients had thrombosis at diagnosis ; 54 / 94 had isolated - HIT without thrombosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Eight of the isolated - HIT patients developed thrombosis within the next 30 d ; thus , a total of 48 patients had thrombosis at day 30 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At diagnosis there was no significant difference in OD between HIT patients with thrombosis and those with isolated - HIT .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , OD was significantly higher in all patients with thrombosis ( n = 48 , 1 . 34 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 89 ) , including isolated - HIT patients who later developed thrombosis within 30 d ( n = 8 , 1 . 84 + / - 0 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
64 )
O O
as compared to isolated - HIT patients who did not develop thrombosis ( 0 . 96 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 75 ; P = 0 . 011 and P = 0 . 008 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Receiver Operative Characteristic Curve showed that OD > 1 . 27 in the isolated - HIT group had a significantly higher chance of developing thrombosis by day 30 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
None of these groups showed significant difference in percent inhibition .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Multivariate analysis showed a 2 . 8 - fold increased risk of thrombosis in females .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Similarly , thrombotic risk increased with age and OD values .
O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Higher OD is associated with significant risk of subsequent thrombosis in patients with isolated - HIT ; percent inhibition , however , was not predictive .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Central retinal vein occlusion associated with clomiphene - induced ovulation .
O O O O O O B O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To report a case of central retinal vein occlusion associated with clomiphene citrate ( CC ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O
DESIGN :
O O
Case study .
O O O
SETTING :
O O
Ophthalmology clinic of an academic hospital .
O O O O O O O
PATIENT ( S )
O O O O
: A 36 - year - old woman referred from the infertility clinic for blurred vision .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
INTERVENTION ( S ) :
O O O O O
Ophthalmic examination after CC therapy .
O O O B O O
MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE ( S ) :
O O O O O O O
Central retinal vein occlusion after ovulation induction with CC .
O O O O O O O O B O
RESULT ( S ) :
O O O O O
A 36 - year - old Chinese woman developed central retinal vein occlusion after eight courses of CC .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
A search of the literature on the thromboembolic complications of CC does not include this severe ophthalmic complication , although mild visual disturbance after CC intake is not uncommon .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
CONCLUSION ( S )
O O O O
: This is the first reported case of central retinal vein occlusion after treatment with CC .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Extra caution is warranted in treating infertility patients with CC , and patients should be well informed of this side effect before commencement of therapy .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nicotine - induced nystagmus correlates with midpontine activation .
B O O O O O O O O
The pathomechanism of nicotine - induced nystagmus ( NIN ) is unknown .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The aim of this study was to delineate brain structures that are involved in NIN generation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Eight healthy volunteers inhaled nicotine in darkness during a functional magnetic resonance imaging ( fMRI ) experiment ; eye movements were registered using video - oculography .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NIN correlated with blood oxygen level - dependent ( BOLD ) activity levels in a midpontine site in the posterior basis pontis .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NIN - induced midpontine activation may correspond to activation of the dorsomedial pontine nuclei and the nucleus reticularis tegmenti pontis , structures known to participate in the generation of multidirectional
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
saccades and smooth pursuit eye movements .
O O O O O O O
Protective effect of verapamil on gastric hemorrhagic ulcers in severe atherosclerotic rats .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Studies concerning with pathogenesis of gastric hemorrhage and mucosal ulceration produced in atherosclerotic rats are lacking .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aim of this study is to examine the role of gastric acid back - diffusion , mast cell histamine release , lipid peroxide ( LPO ) generation and mucosal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
microvascular permeability in modulating gastric hemorrhage and ulcer in rats with atherosclerosis induced by coadministration of vitamin D2 and cholesterol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O
Additionally , the protective effect of verapamil on this ulcer model was evaluated .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Male Wistar rats were challenged intragastrically once daily for 9 days with 1 . 0 ml / kg of corn oil containing vitamin D2 and cholesterol to induce atherosclerosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O
Control rats received corn oil only .
O O O O O O O
After gastric surgery , rat stomachs were irrigated for 3 h with either simulated gastric juice or normal saline .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Gastric acid back - diffusion , mucosal LPO generation , histamine concentration , microvascular permeability , luminal hemoglobin content and ulcer areas were determined .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Elevated atherosclerotic parameters , such as serum calcium , total cholesterol and low - density lipoprotein concentration were obtained in atherosclerotic rats .
O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Severe gastric ulcers accompanied with increased ulcerogenic factors , including gastric acid back - diffusion , histamine release , LPO generation and luminal hemoglobin content were also observed in these
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O
rats .
O O
Moreover , a positive correlation of histamine to gastric hemorrhage and to ulcer was found in those atherosclerotic rats .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This hemorrhagic ulcer and various ulcerogenic parameters were dose - dependently ameliorated by daily intragastric verapamil .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Atherosclerosis could produce gastric hemorrhagic ulcer via aggravation of gastric acid back - diffusion , LPO generation , histamine release and microvascular permeability that could be ameliorated by verapamil in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O
rats .
O O
Adriamycin - induced autophagic cardiomyocyte death plays a pathogenic role in a rat model of heart failure .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
The mechanisms underlying heart failure induced by adriamycin are very complicated and still unclear .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The aim of this study was to investigate whether autophagy was involved in the progression of heart failure induced by adriamycin , so that we can develop a novel treatment
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
strategy for heart failure .
O O O O O
METHODS : 3 - methyladenine
O O B I I
( 3MA ) , a specific inhibitor on autophagy was used in a heart failure model of rats induced by adriamycin .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Neonatal cardiomyocytes were isolated from Sprague - Dawley rat hearts and randomly divided into controls , an adriamycin - treated group , and a 3MA plus adriamycin - treated group
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O O
.
O
We then examined the morphology , expression of beclin 1 gene , mitochondrial permeability transition ( MPT ) , and Na + - K + ATPase activity in vivo .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
We also assessed cell viability , mitochondrial membrane potential changes and counted autophagic vacuoles in cultured cardiomyocytes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , we analyzed the expression of autophagy associated gene , beclin 1 using RT - PCR and Western blotting in an animal model .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
3MA significantly improved cardiac function and reduced mitochondrial injury .
B O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , adriamycin induced the formation of autophagic vacuoles , and 3MA strongly downregulated the expression of beclin 1 in adriamycin - induced failing heart and inhibited the formation of
O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
autophagic vacuoles .
O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Autophagic cardiomyocyte death plays an important role in the pathogenesis of heart failure in rats induced by adriamycin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Mitochondrial injury may be involved in the progression of heart failure caused by adriamycin via the autophagy pathway .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Confusion , a rather serious adverse drug reaction with valproic acid : a review of the French Pharmacovigilance database .
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O
INTRODUCTION :
O O
Confusion is an adverse drug reaction frequently observed with valproic acid .
O O O O O O O O O B I O
Some case reports are published in the literature but no systematic study from a sample of patients has been published .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We performed this study in order to describe the main characteristics of this adverse drug reaction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Using the French Pharmacovigilance database , we selected the cases of confusion reported since 1985 with valproic acid .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
RESULTS :
O O
272 cases of confusion were reported with valproic acid : 153 women and 119 men .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
Confusion mostly occurred during the two first weeks following valproic acid exposure ( 39 . 7 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
It was """" serious """" for almost 2 / 3 of the patients ( 62 . 5 % ) and its outcome favourable in most of the cases ( 82
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% ) .
O O O
The occurrence of this ADR was more frequent in patients aged between 61 and 80 years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
This work shows that confusion with valproic acid is a serious , rather frequent but reversible adverse drug reaction .
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
It occurs especially in older patients and during the first two weeks of treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Learning and memory deficits in ecstasy users and their neural correlates during a face - learning task .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
It has been consistently shown that ecstasy users display impairments in learning and memory performance .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
In addition , working memory processing in ecstasy users has been shown to be associated with neural alterations in hippocampal and / or cortical regions as measured by functional magnetic
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
resonance imaging ( fMRI ) .
O O O O O O
Using functional imaging and a face - learning task , we investigated neural correlates of encoding and recalling face - name associations in 20 recreational drug users whose predominant drug
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
use was ecstasy and 20 controls .
O O B O O O O
To address the potential confounding effects of the cannabis use of the ecstasy using group , a second analysis included 14 previously tested cannabis users ( Nestor , L .
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
, Roberts , G . , Garavan , H . , Hester , R . , 2008 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Deficits in learning and memory : parahippocampal hyperactivity and frontocortical hypoactivity in cannabis users .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Neuroimage 40 , 1328 - 1339 ) .
O O O O O O O O
Ecstasy users performed significantly worse in learning and memory compared to controls and cannabis users .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
A conjunction analysis of the encode and recall phases of the task revealed ecstasy - specific hyperactivity in bilateral frontal regions , left temporal , right parietal , bilateral temporal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and bilateral occipital brain regions .
O O O O O O O
Ecstasy - specific hypoactivity was evident in the right dorsal anterior cingulated cortex ( ACC ) and left posterior cingulated cortex .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In both ecstasy and cannabis groups brain activation was decreased in the right medial frontal gyrus , left parahippocampal gyrus , left dorsal cingulate gyrus , and left caudate .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results elucidated ecstasy - related deficits , only some of which might be attributed to cannabis use .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
These ecstasy - specific effects may be related to the vulnerability of isocortical and allocortical regions to the neurotoxic effects of ecstasy .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Prolonged elevation of plasma argatroban in a cardiac transplant patient with a suspected history of heparin - induced thrombocytopenia with thrombosis .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Direct thrombin inhibitors ( DTIs ) provide an alternative method of anticoagulation for patients with a history of heparin - induced thrombocytopenia ( HIT ) or HIT with thrombosis (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
HITT ) undergoing cardiopulmonary bypass ( CPB ) .
O O O O O O O O O
In the following report , a 65 - year - old critically ill patient with a suspected history of HITT was administered argatroban for anticoagulation on bypass during heart transplantation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
.
O
The patient required massive transfusion support ( 55 units of red blood cells , 42 units of fresh - frozen plasma , 40 units of cryoprecipitate , 40 units of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
platelets , and three doses of recombinant Factor VIIa ) for severe intraoperative and postoperative bleeding .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
STUDY DESIGN AND METHODS : Plasma samples from before and
O O O O O O O O O O
after CPB were analyzed postoperatively for argatroban concentration using a modified ecarin clotting time ( ECT ) assay .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Unexpectedly high concentrations of argatroban were measured in these samples ( range , 0 - 32 microg / mL ) , and a prolonged plasma argatroban half life ( t
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
( 1 / 2 ) ) of 514 minutes was observed ( published elimination t ( 1 / 2 ) is 39 - 51 minutes [ < or = 181
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
minutes with hepatic impairment ] ) .
O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Correlation of plasma argatroban concentration versus the patient 's coagulation variables and clinical course suggest that prolonged elevated levels of plasma argatroban may have contributed to the patient 's extended
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
coagulopathy .
O O
Because DTIs do not have reversal agents , surgical teams and transfusion services should remain aware of the possibility of massive transfusion events during anticoagulation with these agents .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This is the first report to measure plasma argatroban concentration in the context of CPB and extended coagulopathy .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Antituberculosis therapy - induced acute liver failure : magnitude , profile , prognosis , and predictors of outcome .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Antituberculosis therapy ( ATT ) - associated acute liver failure ( ATT - ALF ) is the commonest drug - induced ALF in South Asia .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prospective studies on ATT - ALF are lacking .
O O O O O O O O O
The current study prospectively evaluated the magnitude , clinical course , outcome , and prognostic factors in ATT - ALF .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
From January 1986 to January 2009 , 1223 consecutive ALF patients were evaluated : ATT alone was the cause in 70 ( 5 . 7 % ) patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Another 15 ( 1 . 2 % ) had ATT and simultaneous hepatitis virus infection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 44 ( 62 . 8 % ) patients , ATT was prescribed empirically without definitive evidence of tuberculosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ATT - ALF patients were younger ( 32 . 87 [ + / - 15 . 8 ] years ) , and 49 ( 70 % ) of them were
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
women .
O O
Most had hyperacute presentation ; the median icterus encephalopathy interval was 4 . 5 ( 0 - 30 ) days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The median duration of ATT before ALF was 30 ( 7 - 350 ) days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At presentation , advanced encephalopathy and cerebral edema were present in 51 ( 76 % ) and 29 ( 41 . 4 % ) patients , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Gastrointestinal bleed , seizures , infection , and acute renal failure were documented in seven ( 10 % ) , five ( 7 . 1 % ) , 26 (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
37 . 1 % ) , and seven ( 10 % ) patients , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Compared with hepatitis E virus ( HEV ) and non - A non - E - induced ALF , ATT - ALF patients had nearly similar presentations except for older
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
age and less elevation of liver enzymes .
O O O O O O O O
The mortality rate among patients with ATT - ALF was high ( 67 . 1 % , n = 47 ) , and only 23 ( 32 . 9 %
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) patients recovered with medical treatment .
O O O O O O O
In multivariate analysis , three factors independently predicted mortality : serum bilirubin ( > or = 10 . 8 mg / dL ) , prothrombin time ( PT ) prolongation
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( > or = 26 seconds ) , and grade III / IV encephalopathy at presentation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
ATT - ALF constituted 5 . 7 % of ALF at our center and had a high mortality rate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because the mortality rate is so high , determining which factors are predictors is less important .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A high proportion of patients had consumed ATT empirically , which could have been prevented .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Central nervous system complications during treatment of acute lymphoblastic leukemia in a single pediatric institution .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Central nervous system ( CNS ) complications during treatment of childhood acute lymphoblastic leukemia ( ALL ) remain a challenging clinical problem .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Outcome improvement with more intensive chemotherapy has significantly increased the incidence and severity of adverse events .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This study analyzed the incidence of neurological complications during ALL treatment in a single pediatric institution , focusing on clinical , radiological , and electrophysiological findings .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Exclusion criteria included CNS leukemic infiltration at diagnosis , therapy - related peripheral neuropathy , late - onset encephalopathy , or long - term neurocognitive defects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
During a 9 - year period , we retrospectively collected 27 neurological events ( 11 % ) in as many patients , from 253 children enrolled in the ALL front
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- line protocol .
O O O O
CNS complications included posterior reversible leukoencephalopathy syndrome ( n = 10 ) , stroke ( n = 5 ) , temporal lobe epilepsy ( n = 2 ) , high
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- dose methotrexate toxicity ( n = 2 ) , syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion ( n = 1 ) , and other unclassified events ( n = 7
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
In conclusion , CNS complications are frequent events during ALL therapy , and require rapid detection and prompt treatment to limit permanent damage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Safety of capecitabine : a review .
O O B O O O O
IMPORTANCE OF THE FIELD :
O O O O O
Fluoropyrimidines , in particular 5 - fluorouracil ( 5 - FU ) , have been the mainstay of treatment for several solid tumors , including colorectal , breast and head
B O O O B I I O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and neck cancers , for > 40 years .
O O O O O O O O O
AREAS
O
COVERED IN THIS REVIEW
O O O O
: This article reviews the pharmacology and efficacy of capecitabine with a special emphasis on its safety .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
WHAT THE READER WILL GAIN :
O O O O O O
The reader will gain better insight into the safety of capecitabine in special populations such as patients with advanced age , renal and kidney disease .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We also explore different dosing and schedules of capecitabine administration .
O O O O O O O O B O O
TAKE HOME MESSAGE :
O O O O
Capecitabine is an oral prodrug of 5 - FU and was developed to fulfill the need for a more convenient therapy and provide an improved safety / efficacy profile .
B O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It has shown promising results alone or in combination with other chemotherapeutic agents in colorectal , breast , pancreaticobiliary , gastric , renal cell and head and neck cancers .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The most commonly reported toxic effects of capecitabine are diarrhea , nausea , vomiting , stomatitis and hand - foot syndrome .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Capecitabine has a well - established safety profile and can be given safely to patients with advanced age , hepatic and renal dysfunctions .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effects of pallidal neurotensin on haloperidol - induced parkinsonian catalepsy : behavioral and electrophysiological studies .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : The globus pallidus plays a critical role in movement regulation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Previous studies have indicated that the globus pallidus receives neurotensinergic innervation from the striatum , and systemic administration of a neurotensin analog could produce antiparkinsonian effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The present study aimed to investigate the effects of pallidal neurotensin on haloperidol - induced parkinsonian symptoms .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Behavioral experiments and electrophysiological recordings were performed in the present study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Bilateral infusions of neurotensin into the globus pallidus reversed haloperidol - induced parkinsonian catalepsy in rats .
O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Electrophysiological recordings showed that microinjection of neurotensin induced excitation of pallidal neurons in the presence of systemic haloperidol administration .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The neurotensin type - 1 receptor antagonist SR48692 blocked both the behavioral and the electrophysiological effects induced by neurotensin .
O B I I I I I B O O O O O O O O O O B O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Activation of pallidal neurotensin receptors may be involved in neurotensin - induced antiparkinsonian effects .
O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O
Antihypertensive drugs and depression : a reappraisal .
O O O O O O O O
Eighty - nine new referral hypertensive out - patients and 46 new referral non - hypertensive chronically physically ill out - patients completed a mood rating scale at regular intervals
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
for one year .
O O O O
The results showed a high prevalence of depression in both groups of patients , with no preponderance in the hypertensive group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hypertensive patients with psychiatric histories had a higher prevalence of depression than the comparison patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This was accounted for by a significant number of depressions occurring in methyl dopa treated patients with psychiatric histories .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O
Pulmonary shunt and cardiovascular responses to CPAP during nitroprusside - induced hypotension .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The effects of continuous positive airway pressure ( CPAP ) on cardiovascular dynamics and pulmonary shunt ( QS / QT ) were investigated in 12 dogs before and during
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
sodium nitroprusside infusion that decreased mean arterial blood pressure 40 - 50 per cent .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Before nitroprusside infusion , 5 cm H2O CPAP significantly , P less than . 05 , decreased arterial blood pressure , but did not significantly alter heart rate , cardiac
O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
output , systemic vascular resistance , or QS / QT .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Ten cm H2O CPAP before nitroprusside infusion produced a further decrease in arterial blood pressure and significantly increased heart rate and decreased cardiac output and QS / QT .
O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nitroprusside caused significant decreases in arterial blood pressure and systemic vascular resistance and increases in heart rate , but did not change cardiac output or QS / QT .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Five cm H2O CPAP during nitroprusside did not further alter any of the above - mentioned variables .
O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , 10 cm H2O CPAP decreased arterial blood pressure , cardiac output , and QS / QT .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These data indicate that nitroprusside infusion rates that decrease mean arterial blood pressure by 40 - 50 per cent do not change cardiac output or QS / QT .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
During nitroprusside infusion low levels of CPAP do not markedly alter cardiovascular dynamics , but high levels of CPAP ( 10 cm H2O ) , while decreasing QS / QT
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
, produce marked decreases in arterial blood pressure and cardiac output .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mediation of enhanced reflex vagal bradycardia by L - dopa via central dopamine formation in dogs .
O O O O O O O B I I O O B O O O O
L - Dopa ( 5 mg / kg i . v . )
B I I O O O O O O O O O O
decreased blood pressure and heart rate after extracerebral decarboxylase inhibition with MK - 486 ( 25 mg / kg i . v . )
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
in anesthetize MAO - inhibited dogs .
O O B O O O O
In addition , reflex bradycardia caused by injected norepinephrine was significantly enhanced by L - dopa , DL - Threo - dihydroxyphenylserine had no effect on blood pressure , heart
O O O O O O O O B O O O O B I I O B I I I I O O O O O O O O
rate or reflex responses to norepinephrine .
O O O O O B O
FLA - 63 , a dopamine - beta - oxidase inhibitor , did not have any effect on the hypotension , bradycardia or reflex - enhancing effect of
B I I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
L - dopa .
B I I O
Pimozide did not affect the actions of L - dopa on blood pressure and heart rate but completely blocked the enhancement of reflexes .
B O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Removal of the carotid sinuses caused an elevation blood pressure and heart rate and abolished the negative chronotropic effect of norepinephrine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
However , L - dopa restored the bradycardia caused by norepinephrine in addition to decreasing blood pressure and heart rate .
O O B I I O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
5 - HTP ( 5 mg / kg i . v . )
B I I O O O O O O O O O O
decreased blood pressure and heart rate and decreased the reflex bradycardia to norepinephrine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
It is concluded that L - dopa enhances reflex bradycardia through central alpha - receptor stimulation .
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , the effects are mediated through dopamine rather than norepinephrine and do not require the carotid sinus baroreceptors .
O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O
Cocaine - induced myocardial infarction : clinical observations and pathogenetic considerations .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical and experimental data published to date suggest several possible mechanisms by which cocaine may result in acute myocardial infarction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
In individuals with preexisting , high - grade coronary arterial narrowing , acute myocardial infarction may result from an increase in myocardial oxygen demand associated with cocaine - induced increase
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O
in rate - pressure product .
O O O O O O
In other individuals with no underlying atherosclerotic obstruction , coronary occlusion may be due to spasm , thrombus , or both .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
With regard to spasm , the clinical findings are largely circumstantial , and the locus of cocaine - induced vasoconstriction remains speculative .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Although certain clinical and experimental findings support the hypothesis that spasm involves the epicardial , medium - size vessels , other data suggest intramural vasoconstriction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diffuse intramural vasoconstriction is not consistent with reports of segmental , discrete infarction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Whereas certain in vivo data suggest that these effects are alpha - mediated , other in vitro data suggest the opposite .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The finding of cocaine - induced vasoconstriction in segments of ( noninnervated ) human umbilical artery suggests that the presence or absence of intact innervation is not sufficient to explain
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the discrepant data involving the possibility of alpha - mediated effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Finally , the contribution of a primary , thrombotic effect of cocaine has not been excluded .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Rabbit syndrome , antidepressant use , and cerebral perfusion SPECT scan findings .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The rabbit syndrome is an extrapyramidal side effect associated with chronic neuroleptic therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Its occurrence in a patient being treated with imipramine is described , representing the first reported case of this syndrome in conjunction with antidepressants .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Repeated cerebral perfusion SPECT scans revealed decreased basal ganglia perfusion while the movement disorder was present , and a return to normal perfusion when the rabbit syndrome resolved .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute bronchodilating effects of ipratropium bromide and theophylline in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease .
O O O O B I O B O O O O O O
The bronchodilator effects of a single dose of ipratropium bromide aerosol ( 36 micrograms ) and short - acting theophylline tablets (
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O B O O
dose titrated to produce serum levels of 10 - 20 micrograms / mL ) were compared in a double - blind , placebo - controlled crossover study in 21 patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with stable , chronic obstructive pulmonary disease .
O O O O O O O O
Mean peak forced expiratory volume in 1 second ( FEV1 ) increases over baseline and the proportion of patients attaining at least a 15 % increase in the FEV1 (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
responders ) were 31 % and 90 % , respectively , for ipratropium and 17 % and 50 % , respectively , for theophylline .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
The average FEV1 increases during the 6 - hour observation period were 18 % for ipratropium and 8 % for theophylline .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
The mean duration of action was 3 . 8 hours with ipratropium and 2 . 4 hours with theophylline .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O
While side effects were rare , those experienced after theophylline use did involve the cardiovascular and gastrointestinal systems .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
These results show that ipratropium is a more potent bronchodilator than oral theophylline in patients with chronic airflow obstruction .
O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Irreversible damage to the medullary interstitium in experimental analgesic nephropathy in F344 rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal papillary necrosis ( RPN ) and a decreased urinary concentrating ability developed during continuous long - term treatment with aspirin and paracetamol in female Fischer 344 rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
Renal structure and concentrating ability were examined after a recovery period of up to 18 weeks , when no analgesics were given , to investigate whether the analgesic - induced
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
changes were reversible .
O O O O
There was no evidence of repair to the damaged medullary interstitial matrix , or proliferation of remaining undamaged type 1 medullary interstitial cells after the recovery period following analgesic treatment
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The recovery of urinary concentrating ability was related to the length of analgesic treatment and the extent of the resulting inner medullary structural damage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
