During the early stages of analgesic treatment , the changes in urinary concentrating ability were reversible , but after prolonged analgesic treatment , maximum urinary concentrating ability failed to recover
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
This study shows that prolonged analgesic treatment in Fischer 344 rats causes progressive and irreversible damage to the interstitial matrix and type 1 interstitial cells leading to RPN .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The associated urinary concentrating defect is reversible only during the early stages of structural damage to the inner medulla .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Less frequent lithium administration and lower urine volume .
O O B O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : This study was designed to determine whether patients maintained on a regimen of lithium on a once - per - day schedule have lower urine volumes than do
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
patients receiving multiple doses per day .
O O O O O O O
METHOD :
O O
This was a cross - sectional study of 85 patients from a lithium clinic who received different dose schedules .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Patients were admitted to the hospital for measurement of lithium level , creatinine clearance , urine volume , and maximum osmolality .
O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Multiple daily doses of lithium were associated with higher urine volumes .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
The dosing schedule , duration of lithium treatment , and daily dose of lithium did not affect maximum osmolality or creatinine clearance .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Urine volume can be reduced by giving lithium once daily and / or by lowering the total daily dose .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lithium - induced polyuria seems to be related to extrarenal as well as to renal effects .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of adriamycin combined with whole body hyperthermia on tumor and normal tissues .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Thermal enhancement of Adriamycin - mediated antitumor activity and normal tissue toxicities by whole body hyperthermia were compared using a F344 rat model .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Antitumor activity was studied using a tumor growth delay assay .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute normal tissue toxicities ( i . e . , leukopenia and thrombocytopenia ) and late normal tissue toxicities ( i . e . , myocardial and kidney injury )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
were evaluated by functional / physiological assays and by morphological techniques .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Whole body hyperthermia ( 120 min at 41 . 5 degrees C ) enhanced both Adriamycin - mediated antitumor activity and toxic side effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The thermal enhancement ratio calculated for antitumor activity was 1 . 6 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thermal enhancement ratios estimated for """" acute """" hematological changes were 1 . 3 , whereas those estimated for """" late """" damage ( based on morphological cardiac and renal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
lesions ) varied between 2 . 4 and 4 . 3 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thus , while whole body hyperthermia enhances Adriamycin - mediated antitumor effect , normal tissue toxicity is also increased , and the potential therapeutic gain of the combined modality treatment
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
is eroded .
O O O
Prazosin - induced stress incontinence .
B O O O O O
A case of genuine stress incontinence due to prazosin , a common antihypertensive drug , is presented .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Prazosin exerts its antihypertensive effects through vasodilatation caused by selective blockade of postsynaptic alpha - 1 adrenergic receptors .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As an alpha - blocker , it also exerts a significant relaxant effect on the bladder neck and urethra .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient 's clinical course is described and correlated with initial urodynamic studies while on prazosin and subsequent studies while taking verapamil .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O
Her incontinence resolved with the change of medication .
O O O O O O O O O
The restoration of continence was accompanied by a substantial rise in maximum urethral pressure , maximum urethral closure pressure , and functional urethral length .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients who present with stress incontinence while taking prazosin should change their antihypertensive medication before considering surgery , because their incontinence may resolve spontaneously with a change in drug therapy
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Myocardial infarction following sublingual administration of isosorbide dinitrate .
O O O O O O B I O
A 78 - year - old with healed septal necrosis suffered a recurrent myocardial infarction of the anterior wall following the administration of isosorbide dinitrate 5 mg sublingually .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
After detailing the course of events , we discuss the role of paradoxical coronary spasm and hypotension - mediated myocardial ischemia occurring downstream to significant coronary arterial stenosis in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pathophysiology of acute coronary insufficiency .
O O O O O O
Fluoxetine - induced akathisia : clinical and theoretical implications .
B O O O O O O O O O
Five patients receiving fluoxetine for the treatment of obsessive compulsive disorder or major depression developed akathisia .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The typical fluoxetine - induced symptoms of restlessness , constant pacing , purposeless movements of the feet and legs , and marked anxiety were indistinguishable from those of neuroleptic -
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
induced akathisia .
O O O
Three patients who had experienced neuroleptic - induced akathisia in the past reported that the symptoms of fluoxetine - induced akathisia were identical , although somewhat milder .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Akathisia appeared to be a common side effect of fluoxetine and generally responded well to treatment with the beta - adrenergic antagonist propranolol , dose reduction , or both .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The authors suggest that fluoxetine - induced akathisia may be caused by serotonergically mediated inhibition of dopaminergic neurotransmission and that the pathophysiology of fluoxetine - induced akathisia and tricyclic
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
antidepressant - induced """" jitteriness """" may be identical .
B O O O O O O O O O
Chronic active hepatitis associated with diclofenac sodium therapy .
O O O O O B I O O
Diclofenac sodium ( Voltarol , Geigy Pharmaceuticals ) is a non - steroidal anti - inflammatory derivative of phenylacetic acid .
B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Although generally well - tolerated , asymptomatic abnormalities of liver function have been recorded and , less commonly , severe hepatitis induced by diclofenac .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The patient described developed chronic active hepatitis after six months therapy with diclofenac sodium which progressed despite the withdrawal of the drug , a finding not previously reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Stroke associated with cocaine use .
O O O B O O
We describe eight patients in whom cocaine use was related to stroke and review 39 cases from the literature .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Among these 47 patients the mean ( + / - SD ) age was 32 . 5 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
12 . 1 years ; 76 % ( 34 / 45 ) were men .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Stroke followed cocaine use by inhalation , intranasal , intravenous , and intramuscular routes .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intracranial aneurysms or arteriovenous malformations were present in 17 of 32 patients studied angiographically or at autopsy ; cerebral vasculitis was present in two patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cerebral infarction occurred in 10 patients ( 22 % ) , intracerebral hemorrhage in 22 ( 49 % ) , and subarachnoid hemorrhage in 13 ( 29 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These data indicate that ( 1 ) the apparent incidence of stroke related to cocaine use is increasing ; ( 2 ) cocaine - associated stroke occurs primarily in young
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
adults ; ( 3 ) stroke may follow any route of cocaine administration ; ( 4 ) stroke after cocaine use is frequently associated with intracranial aneurysms and arteriovenous malformations
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
; and ( 5 ) in cocaine - associated stroke , the frequency of intracranial hemorrhage exceeds that of cerebral infarction .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Glyburide - induced hepatitis .
B O O O O
Drug - induced hepatotoxicity , although common , has been reported only infrequently with sulfonylureas .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
For glyburide , a second - generation sulfonylurea , only two brief reports of hepatotoxicity exist .
O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Two patients with type II diabetes mellitus developed an acute hepatitis - like syndrome soon after initiation of glyburide therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
There was no serologic evidence of viral infection , and a liver biopsy sample showed a histologic pattern consistent with drug - induced hepatitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both patients recovered quickly after stopping glyburide therapy and have remained well for a follow - up period of 1 year .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Glyburide can produce an acute hepatitis - like illness in some persons .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Systolic pressure variation is greater during hemorrhage than during sodium nitroprusside - induced hypotension in ventilated dogs .
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
The systolic pressure variation ( SPV ) , which is the difference between the maximal and minimal values of the systolic blood pressure ( SBP ) after one positive -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pressure breath , was studied in ventilated dogs subjected to hypotension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mean arterial pressure was decreased to 50 mm Hg for 30 minutes either by hemorrhage ( HEM , n = 7 ) or by continuous infusion of sodium nitroprusside (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
SNP , n = 7 ) .
B O O O O O O
During HEM - induced hypotension the cardiac output was significantly lower and systemic vascular resistance higher compared with that in the SNP group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The systemic , central venous , pulmonary capillary wedge pressures , and heart rates , were similar in the two groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Analysis of the respiratory changes in the arterial pressure waveform enabled differentiation between the two groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The SPV during hypotension was 15 . 7 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O
6 . 7 mm Hg in the HEM group , compared with 9 . 1 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 0 mm Hg in the SNP group ( P less than 0 . 02 ) .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The delta down , which is the measure of decrease of SBP after a mechanical breath , was 20 . 3 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
8 . 4 and 10 . 1 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O
3 . 8 mm Hg in the HEM and SNP groups , respectively , during hypotension ( P less than 0 . 02 ) .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is concluded that increases in the SPV and the delta down are characteristic of a hypotensive state due to a predominant decrease in preload .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
They are thus more important during absolute hypovolemia than during deliberate hypotension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Drug - induced arterial spasm relieved by lidocaine .
O O O O O O O B O
Case report .
O O O
Following major intracranial surgery in a 35 - year - old man , sodium pentothal was intravenously infused to minimize cerebral ischaemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
Intense vasospasm with threatened gangrene arose in the arm used for the infusion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Since the cranial condition precluded use of more usual methods , lidocaine was given intra - arterially , with careful cardiovascular monitoring , to counteract the vasospasm .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The treatment was rapidly successful .
O O O O O O
Cerebral blood flow and metabolism during isoflurane - induced hypotension in patients subjected to surgery for cerebral aneurysms .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cerebral blood flow and cerebral metabolic rate for oxygen were measured during isoflurane - induced hypotension in 10 patients subjected to craniotomy for clipping of a cerebral aneurysm .
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Flow and metabolism were measured 5 - 13 days after the subarachnoid haemorrhage by a modification of the classical Kety - Schmidt technique using xenon - 133 i . v
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
.
O
Anaesthesia was maintained with an inspired isoflurane concentration of 0 . 75 % ( plus 67 % nitrous oxide in oxygen ) , during which CBF and CMRO2 were 34
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O
. 3 + / -
O O O O O
2 . 1 ml / 100 g min - 1 and 2 . 32 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 16 ml / 100 g min - 1 at PaCO2 4 . 1 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

O O O O O O O O O
SEM ) .
O O O
Controlled hypotension to an average MAP of 50 - 55 mm
O O O O O O O O O O O
Hg was induced by increasing the dose of isoflurane , and maintained at an inspired concentration of 2 . 2 + / -
B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 2 % .
O O O O O
This resulted in a significant decrease in CMRO2 ( to 1 . 73 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 16 ml / 100 g min - 1 ) , while CBF was unchanged .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After the clipping of the aneurysm the isoflurane concentration was reduced to 0 . 75 % .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
There was a significant increase in CBF , although CMRO2 was unchanged , compared with pre - hypotensive values .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These changes might offer protection to brain tissue during periods of induced hypotension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Allergic reaction to 5 - fluorouracil infusion .
O O O B I I O O
An allergic reaction consisting of angioneurotic edema secondary to continuous infusion 5 - fluorouracil occurred in a patient with recurrent carcinoma of the oral cavity , cirrhosis , and
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cisplatin - induced impaired renal function .
B O O O O O O
This reaction occurred during the sixth and seventh courses of infusional chemotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Oral diphenhydramine and prednisone were ineffective in preventing the recurrence of the allergic reaction .
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Discontinuance of effective chemotherapy in this patient during partial remission resulted in fatal disease progression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Amiodarone - induced sinoatrial block .
B O O O O O
We observed sinoatrial block due to chronic amiodarone administration in a 5 - year - old boy with primary cardiomyopathy , Wolff - Parkinson - White syndrome and supraventricular tachycardia
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Reduction in the dosage of amiodarone resulted in the disappearance of the sinoatrial block and the persistence of asymptomatic sinus bradycardia .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Possible teratogenicity of sulphasalazine .
O O O B O
Three infants , born of two mothers with inflammatory bowel disease who received treatment with sulphasalazine throughout pregnancy , were found to have major congenital anomalies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In the singleton pregnancy , the mother had ulcerative colitis , and the infant , a male , had coarctation of the aorta and a ventricular septal defect .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the twin pregnancy , the mother had Crohn 's disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The first twin , a female , had a left Potter - type IIa polycystic kidney and a rudimentary left uterine cornu .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The second twin , a male , had some features of Potter 's facies , hypoplastic lungs , absent kidneys and ureters , and talipes equinovarus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Despite reports to the contrary , it is suggested that sulphasalazine may be teratogenic .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Veno - occlusive liver disease after dacarbazine therapy ( DTIC ) for melanoma .
O O O O O O B O O B O O O O
A case of veno - occlusive disease of the liver with fatal outcome after dacarbazine ( DTIC ) therapy for melanoma is reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
There was a fulminant clinical course from start of symptoms until death .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At autopsy the liver was enlarged and firm with signs of venous congestion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Small - and medium - sized hepatic veins were blocked by thrombosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Eosinophilic infiltrations were found around the vessels .
O O O O O O O O
Published cases from the literature are reviewed and pertinent features discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
A case of tardive dyskinesia caused by metoclopramide .
O O O O O O O B O
Abnormal involuntary movements appeared in the mouth , tongue , neck and abdomen of a 64 - year - old male patient after he took metoclopramide for gastrointestinal disorder in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
a regimen of 30 mg per day for a total of about 260 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The symptoms exacerbated to a maximum in a month .
O O O O O O O O O O
When the metoclopramide administration was discontinued , the abnormal movements gradually improved to a considerable extent .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Attention to the possible induction of specific tardive dyskinesia is called for in the use of this drug .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Further observations on the electrophysiologic effects of oral amiodarone therapy .
O O O O O O O O B O O
A case is presented of a reversible intra - Hisian block occurring under amiodarone treatment for atrial tachycardia in a patient without clear intraventricular conduction abnormalities .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
His bundle recordings showed an atrial tachycardia with intermittent exit block and greatly prolonged BH and HV intervals ( 40 and 100 msec , respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thirty days after amiodarone discontinuation , His bundle electrograms showed atrial flutter without intra - Hisian or infra - Hisian delay .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Amiodarone should be used with caution during long - term oral therapy in patients with or without clear intraventricular conduction defects .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Busulfan - induced hemorrhagic cystitis .
B O O O O O
A case of a busulfan - induced hemorrhage cystitis is reported .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
Spontaneous resolution occurred following cessation of the drug .
O O O O O O O O O
The similarity between the histologic appearances of busulfan cystitis and both radiation and cyclophosphamide - induced cystitis is discussed and the world literature reviewed .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In view of the known tendency of busulfan to induce cellular atypia and carcinoma in other sites , periodic urinary cytology is suggested in patients on long - term therapy
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Rebound hypertensive after sodium nitroprusside prevented by saralasin in rats .
O O O B I O O B O O O
The role of the renin - - angiotensin system in the maintenance of blood pressure during halothane anesthesia and sodium nitroprusside ( SNP ) - induced hypotension was evaluated .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O B I O B O O O O O O O
Control rats received halothane anesthesia ( 1 MAC ) for one hour , followed by SNP infusion , 40 microgram / kg / min , for 30 min , followed
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
by a 30 - min recovery period .
O O O O O O O O
A second group of rats was treated identically and , in addition , received an infusion of saralasin ( a competitive inhibitor of angiotensin II ) throughout the experimental period
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B I O O O O O
.
O
In each group , SNP infusion resulted in an initial decrease in blood pressure from 86 torr and 83 torr , respectively , to 48 torr .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
During the SNP infusion the control animals demonstrated a progressive increase in blood pressure to 61 torr , whereas the saralasin - treated animals showed no change .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Following discontinuation of SNP , blood pressure in the control animals rebounded to 94 torr , as compared with 78 torr in the saralasin - treated rats .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
This study indicates that with stable halothane anesthesia , the partial recovery of blood pressure during SNP infusion and the post - SNP rebound of blood pressure can be completely
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O
blocked by saralasin .
O O B O
This demonstrates the participation of the renin - - angiotensin system in antagonizing the combined hypotensive effects of halothane and SNP .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O B O
Toxic hepatitis induced by antithyroid drugs : four cases including one with cross - reactivity between carbimazole and benzylthiouracil .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
OBJECTIVE : This study was conducted to assess the occurrence of hepatic adverse effects encountered with antithyroid drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Retrospective review of medical records of 236 patients with hyperthyroidism admitted in our department ( in - or out - patients ) from 1986 to 1992 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Four patients ( 1 . 7 % ) were identified with toxic hepatitis which could reasonably be attributed to the use of antithyroid agent .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two patients had a cholestatic hepatitis induced by carbimazole ( N omercazole ) .
O O O O O O O O B O B I O O
Two others had a mixed ( cholestatic and cytolytic ) hepatitis following carbimazole .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
One of the latter two patients further experienced a cytolytic hepatitis which appeared after Benzylthiouracil ( Basd ne ) had replaced carbimazole .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I O O O B O
Biological features of hepatitis disappeared in all cases after cessation of the incriminated drug , while biliary , viral and immunological searches were negative .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Only 2 patients of our retrospective study experienced a mild or severe neutropenia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Toxic hepatitis is a potential adverse effect of antithyroid drugs which warrants , as for haematological disturbances , a pre - therapeutic determination and a careful follow - up of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
relevant biological markers .
O O O O
Moreover , hepatotoxicity may not be restricted to one class of antithyroid agents .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Study of the role of vitamin B12 and folinic acid supplementation in preventing hematologic toxicity of zidovudine .
O O O O O B I O B I O O O O O O B O
A prospective , randomized study was conducted to evaluate the role of vitamin B12 and folinic acid supplementation in preventing zidovudine ( ZDV ) - induced bone marrow suppression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B I O O O B O B O O O O O O O
Seventy - five human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) - infected patients with CD4 + cell counts < 500 / mm3 were randomized to receive either ZDV ( 500 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
daily ) alone ( group I , n = 38 ) or in combination with folinic acid ( 15 mg daily ) and intramascular vitamin B12 ( 1000 micrograms monthly
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O B I O O O O
) ( group II , n = 37 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
Finally , 15 patients were excluded from the study ( noncompliance 14 , death 1 ) ; thus , 60 patients ( 31 in group I and 29 in group
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
II ) were eligible for analysis .
O O O O O O O
No significant differences between groups were found at enrollment .
O O O O O O O O O O
During the study , vitamin B12 and folate levels were significantly higher in group II patients ; however , no differences in hemoglobin , hematocrit , mean corpuscular volume ,
O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and white - cell , neutrophil and platelet counts were observed between groups at 3 , 6 , 9 and 12 months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Severe hematologic toxicity ( neutrophil count < 1000 / mm3
O O O O O O O O O O
and / or hemoglobin < 8 g / dl ) occurred in 4 patients assigned to group
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
I and 7 assigned to group II .
O O O O O O O O
There was no correlation between vitamin B12 or folate levels and development of myelosuppression .
O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O
Vitamin B12 and folinic acid supplementation of ZDV therapy does not seem useful in preventing or reducing ZDV - induced myelotoxicity in the overall treated population , although a beneficial
B I O B I O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
effect in certain subgroups of patients can not be excluded .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute confusion induced by a high - dose infusion of 5 - fluorouracil and folinic acid .
O O O O O O O O O O B I I O B I O
A 61 - year - old man was treated with combination chemotherapy incorporating cisplatinum , etoposide , high - dose 5 - fluorouracil ( 2 , 250 mg / m2
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O B I I O O O O O O O
/ 24 hours ) and folinic acid for an inoperable gastric adenocarcinoma .
O O O O O B I O O O O O O
He developed acute neurologic symptoms of mental confusion , disorientation and irritability , and then lapsed into a deep coma , lasting for approximately 40 hours during the first dose
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( day 2 ) of 5 - fluorouracil and folinic acid infusion .
O O O O O B I I O B I O O
This complication reappeared on day 25 during the second dose of 5 - fluorouracil and folinic acid , which were then the only drugs given .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O B I O O O O O O O O O
Because folinic acid was unlikely to be associated with this condition , neurotoxicity due to high - dose 5 - fluorouracil was highly suspected .
O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O
The pathogenesis of 5 - fluorouracil neurotoxicity may be due to a Krebs cycle blockade by fluoroacetate and fluorocitrate , thiamine deficiency , or dihydrouracil dehydrogenase deficiency .
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O B O O O
High - dose 5 - fluorouracil / folinic acid infusion therapy has recently become a popular regimen for various cancers .
O O O B I I O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is necessary that both oncologists and neurologists be fully aware of this unusual complication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of switching carbamazepine to oxcarbazepine on the plasma levels of neuroleptics .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O
A case report .
O O O O
Carbamazepine was switched to its 10 - keto analogue oxcarbazepine among six difficult - to - treat schizophrenic or organic psychotic patients using concomitantly haloperidol , chlorpromazine or clozapine .
B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O
This change resulted within 2 - 4 weeks in the 50 - 200 % increase in the plasma levels of these neuroleptics and the appearance of extrapyramidal symptoms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
None of the patients showed any clinical deteriotation during the following 3 - 6 months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results of this case report support the idea that in contrast with carbamazepine oxcarbazepine does not induce the hepatic microsomal enzyme systems regulating the inactivation of antipsychotic drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Erythema multiforme and hypersensitivity myocarditis caused by ampicillin .
O O O O O O O B O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To report a case of erythema multiforme and hypersensitivity myocarditis caused by ampicillin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
CASE SUMMARY :
O O O
A 13 - year - old boy was treated with ampicillin and gentamicin because of suspected septicemia .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
Medications were discontinued when erythema multiforme and congestive heart failure caused by myocarditis occurred .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient was treated with methylprednisolone and gradually improved .
O O O O O B O O O O
Macrophage - migration inhibition ( MIF ) test with ampicillin was positive .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
After most infections causing erythema multiforme and myocarditis were ruled out , a drug - induced allergic reaction was suspected .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Positive MIF test for ampicillin showed sensitization of the patient 's lymphocytes to ampicillin .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Hypersensitivity myocarditis is a rare and dangerous manifestation of allergy to penicillins .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Immediate allergic reactions to amoxicillin .
O O O O B O
A large group of patients with suspected allergic reactions to beta - lactam antibiotics was evaluated .
O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O
A detailed clinical history , together with skin tests , RAST ( radioallergosorbent test ) , and controlled challenge tests , was used to establish whether patients allergic to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
beta - lactam antibiotics had selective immediate allergic responses to amoxicillin ( AX ) or were cross - reacting with other penicillin derivatives .
B I I O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O B O O
Skin tests were performed with benzylpenicilloyl - poly - L - lysine ( BPO - PLL ) , benzylpenicilloate , benzylpenicillin ( PG ) , ampicillin ( AMP ) ,
O O O O O B I I I I I I O B I I O O B O B O B O O B O B O O
and AX .
O B O
RAST for BPO - PLL and AX - PLL was done .
O O B I I O B O O O O O
When both skin test and RAST for BPO were negative , single - blind , placebo - controlled challenge tests were done to ensure tolerance of PG or sensitivity to
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
AX .
B O
A total of 177 patients were diagnosed as allergic to beta - lactam antibiotics .
O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O
We selected the 54 ( 30 . 5 % ) cases of immediate AX allergy with good tolerance of PG .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O
Anaphylaxis was seen in 37 patients ( 69 % ) , the other 17 ( 31 % ) having urticaria and / or angioedema .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All the patients were skin test negative to BPO ; 49 of 51 ( 96 % ) were also negative to MDM , and 44 of 46 ( 96 %
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) to PG .
O O B O
Skin tests with AX were positive in 34 ( 63 % ) patients .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
RAST was positive for AX in 22 patients ( 41 % ) and to BPO in just 5 ( 9 % ) .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
None of the sera with negative RAST for AX were positive to BPO .
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O
Challenge tests with AX were performed in 23 subjects ( 43 % ) to establish the diagnosis of immediate allergic reaction to AX , and in 15 cases ( 28
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
% ) both skin test and RAST for AX were negative .
O O O O O O O O B O O O
PG was well tolerated by all 54 patients .
B O O O O O O O O
We describe the largest group of AX - allergic patients who have tolerated PG reported so far .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O
Diagnosis of these patients can be achieved only if specific AX - related reagents are employed .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Further studies are necessary to determine the exact extent of this problem and to improve the efficacy of diagnostic methods .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Persistent paralysis after prolonged use of atracurium in the absence of corticosteroids .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Neuromuscular blocking agents ( NMBAs ) are often used for patients requiring prolonged mechanical ventilation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reports of persistent paralysis after the discontinuance of these drugs have most often involved aminosteroid - based NMBAs such as vecuronium bromide , especially when used in conjunction with corticosteroids
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
.
O
Atracurium besylate , a short - acting benzylisoquinolinium NMBA that is eliminated independently of renal or hepatic function , has also been associated with persistent paralysis , but only when
B I O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
used with corticosteroids .
O O O O
We report a case of atracurium - related paralysis persisting for approximately 50 hours in a patient who was not treated with corticosteroids .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Habitual use of acetaminophen as a risk factor for chronic renal failure : a comparison with phenacetin .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Six epidemiologic studies in the United States and Europe indicate that habitual use of phenacetin is associated with the development of chronic renal failure and end - stage renal disease
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( ESRD ) , with a relative risk in the range of 4 to 19 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As a result of these and other studies , phenacetin has now been withdrawn from the market in most countries .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
However , three case control studies , one each in North Carolina , northern Maryland , and West Berlin , Germany , showed that habitual use of acetaminophen is also
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
associated with chronic renal failure and ESRD , with a relative risk in the range of 2 to 4 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These studies suggest that both phenacetin and acetaminophen may contribute to the burden of ESRD , with the risk of the latter being somewhat less than that of the former
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
This apparent difference in risk may not be due to differences in nephrotoxic potential of the drugs themselves .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A lower relative risk would be expected for acetaminophen if the risk of both drugs in combination with other analgesics was higher than the risk of either agent alone .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thus , acetaminophen has been used both as a single agent and in combination with other analgesics , whereas phenacetin was available only in combinations .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The possibility that habitual use of acetaminophen alone increases the risk of ESRD has not been clearly demonstrated , but can not be dismissed .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reduction of heparan sulphate - associated anionic sites in the glomerular basement membrane of rats with streptozotocin - induced diabetic nephropathy .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Heparan sulphate - associated anionic sites in the glomerular basement membrane were studied in rats 8 months after induction of diabetes by streptozotocin and in age - adn sex -
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
matched control rats , employing the cationic dye cuprolinic blue .
O O O O O O O O B I O
Morphometric analysis at the ultrastructural level was performed using a computerized image processor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The heparan sulphate specificity of the cuprolinic blue staining was demonstrated by glycosaminoglycan - degrading enzymes , showing that pretreatment of the sections with heparitinase abolished all staining , whereas
O B I O O O B I O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
chondroitinase ABC had no effect .
O O O O O O
The majority of anionic sites ( 74 % in diabetic and 81 % in control rats ) were found within the lamina rara externa of the glomerular basement membrane .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A minority of anionic sites were scattered throughout the lamina densa and lamina rara interna , and were significantly smaller than those in the lamina rara externa of the glomerular
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
basement membrane ( p < 0 . 001 and p < 0 . 01 for diabetic and control rats , respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diabetic rats progressively developed albuminuria reaching 40 . 3 ( 32 . 2 - 62 . 0 ) mg / 24
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
h after 8 months in contrast to the control animals ( 0 . 8 ( 0 . 2 - 0 . 9 ) mg / 24 h , p <
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 002 ) .
O O O O O
At the same time , the number of heparan sulphate anionic sites and the total anionic site surface ( number of anionic sites x mean anionic site surface ) in
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the lamina rara externa of the glomerular basement membrane was reduced by 19 % ( p < 0 . 021 ) and by 26 % ( p < 0 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
02 ) , respectively .
O O O O O
Number and total anionic site surface in the remaining part of the glomerular basement membrane ( lamina densa and lamina rara interna ) were not significantly changed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We conclude that in streptozotocin - diabetic rats with an increased urinary albumin excretion , a reduced heparan sulphate charge barrier / density is found at the lamina rara externa
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O
of the glomerular basement membrane .
O O O O O O
Effect of some anticancer drugs and combined chemotherapy on renal toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The nephrotoxic action of anticancer drugs such as nitrogranulogen ( NG ) , methotrexate ( MTX ) , 5 - fluorouracil ( 5 - FU ) and cyclophosphamide (
O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O B O O B I I O B I I O O B O
CY ) administered alone or in combination [ MTX + 5 - FU + CY ( CMF ) ] was evaluated in experiments on Wistar rats .
B O O O O O O O B O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
After drug administration , creatinine concentrations in the plasma and in the urine of the rats were determined , as well as creatinine clearance .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Histopathologic evaluation of the kidneys was also performed .
O O O O O O O O O
After MTX administration a significant increase ( p = 0 . 0228 ) in the plasma creatinine concentration and a significant ( p = 0 . 0001 ) decrease in
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
creatinine clearance was noted compared to controls .
B O O O O O O O
After the administration of NG , 5 - FU and CY neither a statistically significant increase in creatinine concentration nor an increase in creatinine clearance was observed compared to the
O O O O B O B I I O B O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O
group receiving no cytostatics .
O O O O O
Following polytherapy according to the CMF regimen , a statistically significant decrease ( p = 0 . 0343 ) in creatinine clearance was found , but creatinine concentration did not
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O
increase significantly compared to controls .
O O O O O O
CY caused hemorrhagic cystitis in 40 % of rats , but it did not cause this complication when combined with 5 - FU and MTX .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O B O
Histologic changes were found in rat kidneys after administration of MTX , CY and NG , while no such change was observed after 5 - FU and joint administration of
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O
MTX + 5 - FU + CY compared to controls .
B O B I I O B O O O O
Our studies indicate that nephrotoxicity of MTX + 5 - FU + CY administered jointly is lower than in monotherapy .
O O O O O O B O B I I O B O O O O O O O O
Lithium - associated cognitive and functional deficits reduced by a switch to divalproex sodium : a case series .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Lithium remains a first - line treatment for the acute and maintenance treatment of bipolar disorder .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although much has been written about the management of the more common adverse effects of lithium , such as polyuria and tremor , more subtle lithium side effects such as
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
cognitive deficits , loss of creativity , and functional impairments remain understudied .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This report summarizes our experience in switching bipolar patients from lithium to divalproex sodium to alleviate such cognitive and functional impairments .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B I O O O O O O O O
METHOD :
O O
Open , case series design .
O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
We report seven cases where substitution of lithium , either fully or partially , with divalproex sodium was extremely helpful in reducing the cognitive , motivational , or creative deficits
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
attributed to lithium in our bipolar patients .
O O B O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
In this preliminary report , divalproex sodium was a superior alternative to lithium in bipolar patients experiencing cognitive deficits , loss of creativity , and functional impairments .
O O O O O B I O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment of previously treated metastatic breast cancer by mitoxantrone and 48 - hour continuous infusion of high - dose 5 - FU and leucovorin ( MFL ) : low palliative
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B I I O B O B O O O O
benefit and high treatment - related toxicity .
O O O O O O O O
For previously treated advanced breast cancer , there is no standard second - line therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Combination chemotherapy with mitoxantrone , high - dose 5 - fluorouracil ( 5 - FU ) and leucovorin ( MFL regimen ) had been reported as an effective and well
O O O B O O O O B I I O B I I O O B O B I O O O O O O O O O
tolerated regimen .
O O O
From October 1993 to November 1995 , we treated 13 patients with previously chemotherapy - treated metastatic breast cancer by mitoxantrone , 12 mg / m2 , on day 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
and continuous infusion of 5 - FU , 3000 mg / m2 , together with leucovorin , 300 mg / m2 , for 48 h from day 1 to 2
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Each course of chemotherapy was given every 4 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O
Most of these patients had more than two metastatic sites , with lung metastasis predominant .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Seven patients had been treated with anthracycline .
O O O O O O B O
Seven patients had previously received radiotherapy and seven had received hormone therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Median number of courses of MFL regimen given was six and the median cumulative dose of mitoxantrone was
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O B O
68 . 35 mg / m2 .
O O O O O O O
One patient had complete response , seven had stable disease , none had partial response and five had progressive disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The overall objective response rate was 7 . 6 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The median follow - up period was 14 months .
O O O O O O O O O O
Median survival was 16 months .
O O O O O O
Median progression - free survival was 5 months .
O O O O O O O O O
A complete responder had relapse - free survival up to 17 months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Major toxicities were cardiotoxicity and leukopenia .
O O O O O O O
Eight patients were dead in the last follow - up ; two of them died of treatment - related toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The MFL regimen achieves little palliative benefit and induces severe toxicity at a fairly high rate .
O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Administration of this regimen to breast cancer patients who have been treated by chemotherapy and those with impaired heart function requires careful attention .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Upregulation of the expression of vasopressin gene in the paraventricular and supraoptic nuclei of the lithium - induced diabetes insipidus rat .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The expression of arginine vasopressin ( AVP ) gene in the paraventricular ( PVN ) and supraoptic nuclei ( SON ) was investigated in rats with lithium ( Li )
O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
- induced polyuria , using in situ hybridization histochemistry and radioimmunoassay .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The male Wistar rats consuming a diet that contained LiCl ( 60 mmol / kg ) for 4 weeks developed marked polyuria .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Li - treated rats produced a large volume of hypotonic urine with low ionic concentrations .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Plasma sodium concentrations were found to be slightly increased in the Li - treated rats compared with those in controls .
O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Plasma concentration of AVP and transcripts of AVP gene in the PVN and SON were significantly increased in the Li - treated rats compared with controls .
O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
These results suggest that dehydration and / or the activation of visceral afferent inputs may contribute to the elevation of plasma AVP and the upregulation of AVP gene expression in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O
the PVN and the SON of the Li - induced diabetes insipidus rat .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Suxamethonium - induced cardiac arrest and death following 5 days of immobilization .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
The present report describes a case of cardiac arrest and subsequent death as a result of hyperkalaemia following the use of suxamethonium in a 23 - year - old Malawian
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
woman .
O O
Five days after the onset of the symptoms of meningitis , the patient aspirated stomach contents and needed endotracheal intubation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Forty seconds after injection of suxamethonium , bradycardia and cardiac arrest occurred .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Attempts to resuscitate the patient were not successful .
O O O O O O O O O
The serum level of potassium was observed to be 8 . 4 mequiv L - 1 .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Apart from the reduction in the patient 's level of consciousness , there were no signs of motor neurone damage or of any of the other known predisposing conditions for
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
hyperkalaemia following the administration of suxamethonium .
O O O O O B O
It is postulated that her death was caused by hypersensitivity to suxamethonium , associated with her 5 - day immobilization .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
An unusual toxic reaction to axillary block by mepivacaine with adrenaline .
O O O O O O O O B O B O
An increase in blood pressure , accompanied by atrial fibrillation , agitation , incomprehensible shouts and loss of consciousness , was observed in an elderly , ASA classification group II
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, cardiovascularly medicated male , 12 min after performance of axillary block with mepivacaine 850 mg containing adrenaline 0 . 225 mg , for correction of Dupuytren 's contracture .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
After intravenous administration of labetalol , metoprolol and midazolam the patient 's condition improved , and 15 min later he woke up .
O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The block was successful and surgery was conducted as scheduled despite persisting atrial fibrillation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Postoperatively , the patient refused DC cardioversion and was treated medically .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both the temporal relationship of events and the response to treatment suggest that a rapid systemic absorption of mepivacaine with adrenaline
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B
and / or interaction of these drugs with the patient 's cardiovascular medications were responsible for the perioperative complications .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical and histopathologic examination of renal allografts treated with tacrolimus ( FK506 ) for at least one year .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
We clinically and pathologically analyzed renal allografts from 1 9 renal transplant patients treated with tacrolimus ( FK506 ) for more than 1 year .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Twenty - six renal allograft biopsy specimens from 1 9 renal transplant patients who underwent transplantations between 1991 and 1993 were evaluated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thirteen biopsies were performed from stable functioning renal allografts with informed consent ( nonepisode biopsy ) and the other 13 were from dysfunctional renal allografts with a clinical indication for
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
biopsy ( episode biopsy ) .
O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The main pathologic diagnoses ( some overlap ) were acute rejection ( AR ; n = 4 ) , chronic rejection ( CR ; n = 5 ) , AR
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
+ CR ( n = 4 ) , recurrent IgA nephropathy ( n = 5 ) , normal findings ( n = 2 ) , minimal - type chronic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
FK506 nephropathy ( n = 9 ) , and mild - type FK506 nephropathy ( n = 11 ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Of the nonepisode biopsies , 7 and 4 biopsies showed minimal - type and mild - type chronic FK506 nephropathy , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Chronic FK506 nephropathy consisted of rough and foamy tubular vacuolization ( 5 biopsies ) , arteriolopathy ( angiodegeneration of the arteriolar wall ; 20 biopsies ) , focal segmental glomerulosclerosis
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 4 biopsies ) and the striped form of interstitial fibrosis ( 11 biopsies ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The serum creatinine levels of patients in the mild - type chronic FK506 nephropathy group , which included 7 episode biopsies , were statistically higher than those in the minimum
O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- type chronic FK506 - nephropathy group ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
This study demonstrates that chronic FK506 nephropathy consists primarily of arteriolopathy manifesting as insudative hyalinosis of the arteriolar wall , and suggests that mild - type chronic FK506 nephropathy is
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
a condition which may lead to deterioration of renal allograft function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Memory facilitation and stimulation of endogenous nerve growth factor synthesis by the acetylcholine releaser PG - 9 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I O
The effects of PG - 9 ( 3alpha - tropyl 2 - ( p - bromophenyl ) propionate ) , the acetylcholine releaser , on memory processes and nerve growth
O O O B I I O B I I I I I I I I I I O O O B O O O O O O O O
factor ( NGF ) synthesis were evaluated .
O O O O O O O O
In the mouse passive - avoidance test , PG - 9 ( 10 - 30 mg / kg , i . p . ) , administered 20 min before the
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
training session , prevented amnesia induced by both the non selective antimuscarinic drug scopolamine and the M1 - selective antagonist S - ( - ) - ET - 126 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B I I I I I I I I O
In the same experimental conditions , PG - 9 ( 5 - 20 microg per mouse , i . c . v . ) was also able to prevent antimuscarine
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- induced amnesia , demonstrating a central localization of the activity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
At the highest effective doses , PG - 9 did not produce any collateral symptoms as revealed by the Irwin test , and it did not modify spontaneous motility and
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
inspection activity , as revealed by the hole - board test .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
PG - 9 was also able to increase the amount of NGF secreted in vitro by astrocytes in a dose - dependent manner .
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The maximal NGF contents obtained by PG - 9 were 17 . 6 - fold of the control value .
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O
During culture , no morphological changes were found at effective concentrations of PG - 9 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O
The current work indicates the ability of PG - 9 to induce beneficial effects on cognitive processes and stimulate activity of NGF synthesis in astroglial cells .
O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , PG - 9 could represent a potential useful drug able to improve the function of impaired cognitive processes .
O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Angioedema due to ACE inhibitors : common and inadequately diagnosed .
O O O B I O O O O O O
The estimated incidence of angioedema during angiotensin - converting enzyme ( ACE ) inhibitor treatment is between 1 and 7 per thousand patients .
O O O O O O B I I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O
This potentially serious adverse effect is often preceded by minor manifestations that may serve as a warning .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recurarization in the recovery room .
O O O O O O
A case of recurarization in the recovery room is reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Accumulation of atracurium in the intravenous line led to recurarization after flushing the line in the recovery room .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A respiratory arrest with severe desaturation and bradycardia occurred .
O O O O O O O O O O
Circumstances leading to this event and the mechanisms enabling a neuromuscular blockade to occur , following the administration of a small dose of relaxant , are discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recurrent use of newer oral contraceptives and the risk of venous thromboembolism .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O
The epidemiological studies that assessed the risk of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) associated with newer oral contraceptives ( OC ) did not distinguish between patterns of OC use ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O B O O
namely first - time users , repeaters and switchers .
O O O O O O O O O O
Data from a Transnational case - control study were used to assess the risk of VTE for the latter patterns of use , while accounting for duration of use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Over the period 1993 - 1996 , 551 cases of VTE were identified in Germany and the UK along with 2066 controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Totals of 128 cases and 650 controls were analysed for repeat use and 135 cases and 622 controls for switching patterns .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The adjusted rate ratio of VTE for repeat users of third generation OC was 0 . 6 ( 95 % CI : 0 . 3 - 1 . 2 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
relative to repeat users of second generation pills , whereas it was 1 . 3 ( 95 % CI : 0 . 7 - 2 . 4 ) for switchers
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
from second to third generation pills relative to switchers from third to second generation pills .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We conclude that second and third generation agents are associated with equivalent risks of VTE when the same agent is used repeatedly after interruption periods or when users are switched
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
between the two generations of pills .
O O O O O O O
These analyses suggest that the higher risk observed for the newer OC in other studies may be the result of inadequate comparisons of pill users with different patterns of pill
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
use .
O O
Development of apomorphine - induced aggressive behavior : comparison of adult male and female Wistar rats .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The development of apomorphine - induced ( 1 . 0 mg / kg s . c .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
once daily ) aggressive behavior of adult male and female Wistar rats obtained from the same breeder was studied in two consecutive sets .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In male animals , repeated apomorphine treatment induced a gradual development of aggressive behavior as evidenced by the increased intensity of aggressiveness and shortened latency before the first attack toward
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the opponent .
O O O
In female rats , only a weak tendency toward aggressiveness was found .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion , the present study demonstrates gender differences in the development of the apomorphine - induced aggressive behavior and indicates that the female rats do not fill the validation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
criteria for use in this method .
O O O O O O O
Serotonergic antidepressants and urinary incontinence .
B I O O O O
Many new serotonergic antidepressants have been introduced over the past decade .
O O B I O O O O O O O O
Although urinary incontinence is listed as one side effect of these drugs in their package inserts there is only one report in the literature .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This concerns 2 male patients who experienced incontinence while taking venlafaxine .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
In the present paper the authors describe 2 female patients who developed incontinence secondary to the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors paroxetine and sertraline , as well as a third who
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O B O O O O O O O
developed this side effect on venlafaxine .
O O O O O B O
In 2 of the 3 cases the patients were also taking lithium carbonate and beta - blockers , both of which could have contributed to the incontinence .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Animal studies suggest that incontinence secondary to serotonergic antidepressants could be mediated by the 5HT4 receptors found on the bladder .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
Further research is needed to delineate the frequency of this troubling side effect and how best to treat it .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hypotension following the initiation of tizanidine in a patient treated with an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor for chronic hypertension .
O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Centrally acting alpha - 2 adrenergic agonists are one of several pharmacologic agents used in the treatment of spasticity related to disorders of the central nervous system .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition to their effects on spasticity , certain adverse cardiorespiratory effects have been reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adults chronically treated with angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors may have a limited ability to respond to hypotension when the sympathetic response is simultaneously blocked .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The authors present a 10 - year - old boy chronically treated with lisinopril , an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor , to control hypertension who developed hypotension following the addition
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of tizanidine , an alpha - 2 agonist , for the treatment of spasticity .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The possible interaction of tizanidine and other antihypertensive agents should be kept in mind when prescribing therapy to treat either hypertension or spasticity in such patients .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Peritubular capillary basement membrane reduplication in allografts and native kidney disease : a clinicopathologic study of 278 consecutive renal specimens .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
An association has been found between transplant glomerulopathy ( TG ) and reduplication of peritubular capillary basement membranes ( PTCR ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although such an association is of practical and theoretical importance , only one prospective study has tried to confirm it .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We examined 278 consecutive renal specimens ( from 135 transplants and 143 native kidneys ) for ultrastructural evidence of PTCR .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition to renal allografts with TG , we also examined grafts with acute rejection , recurrent glomerulonephritis , chronic allograft nephropathy and stable grafts ( """" protocol biopsies """"
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
Native kidney specimens included a wide range of glomerulopathies as well as cases of thrombotic microangiopathy , malignant hypertension , acute interstitial nephritis , and acute tubular necrosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
We found PTCR in 14 of 15 cases of TG , in 7 transplant biopsy specimens without TG , and in 13 of 143 native kidney biopsy specimens .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These 13 included cases of malignant hypertension , thrombotic microangiopathy , lupus nephritis , Henoch - Schonlein nephritis , crescentic glomerulonephritis , and cocaine - related acute renal failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Mild PTCR in allografts without TG did not predict renal failure or significant proteinuria after follow - up periods of between 3 months and 1 year .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
We conclude that in transplants , there is a strong association between well - developed PTCR and TG , while the significance of mild PTCR and its predictive value in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the absence of TG is unclear .
O O O O O O O
PTCR also occurs in certain native kidney diseases , though the association is not as strong as that for TG .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We suggest that repeated endothelial injury , including immunologic injury , may be the cause of this lesion both in allografts and native kidneys .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Conformationally restricted analogs of BD1008 and an antisense oligodeoxynucleotide targeting sigma1 receptors produce anti - cocaine effects in mice .
O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O
Cocaine 's ability to interact with sigma receptors suggests that these proteins mediate some of its behavioral effects .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , three novel sigma receptor ligands with antagonist activity were evaluated in Swiss Webster mice : BD1018 (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
3S
B
- 1 - [ 2 - ( 3 , 4 - dichlorophenyl ) ethyl ] - 1 , 4 - diazabicyclo [ 4 . 3 . 0 ] nonane )
I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O
, BD1063 ( 1 - [ 2 - ( 3 , 4 - dichlorophenyl ) ethyl ] - 4 - methylpiperazine ) , and LR132
O B O B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O O O B
( 1R , 2S - ( + ) - cis - N - [ 2 - ( 3 , 4 - dichlorophenyl ) ethyl ] - 2 - ( 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- pyrrolidinyl ) cyclohexylamine ) .
O O O O O O
Competition binding assays demonstrated that all three compounds have high affinities for sigma1 receptors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The three compounds vary in their affinities for sigma2 receptors and exhibit negligible affinities for dopamine , opioid , GABA ( A ) and NMDA receptors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O B O O
In behavioral studies , pre - treatment of mice with BD1018 , BD1063 , or LR132 significantly attenuated cocaine - induced convulsions and lethality .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O B O O O O O O
Moreover , post - treatment with LR132 prevented cocaine - induced lethality in a significant proportion of animals .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast to the protection provided by the putative antagonists , the well - characterized sigma receptor agonist di - o - tolylguanidine ( DTG ) and the novel sigma
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O B O O O O O
receptor agonist BD1031 (
O O B O
3R
B
- 1 - [ 2 - ( 3 , 4 - dichlorophenyl ) ethyl ] - 1 , 4 - diazabicyclo [ 4 . 3 . 0 ] nonane )
I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O
each worsened the behavioral toxicity of cocaine .
O O O O O O B O
At doses where alone , they produced no significant effects on locomotion , BD1018 , BD1063 and LR132 significantly attenuated the locomotor stimulatory effects of cocaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O B O
To further validate the hypothesis that the anti - cocaine effects of the novel ligands involved antagonism of sigma receptors , an antisense oligodeoxynucleotide against sigma1 receptors was also shown
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
to significantly attenuate the convulsive and locomotor stimulatory effects of cocaine .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
Together , the data suggests that functional antagonism of sigma receptors is capable of attenuating a number of cocaine - induced behaviors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Pharmacokinetic / pharmacodynamic assessment of the effects of E4031 , cisapride , terfenadine and terodiline on monophasic action potential duration in dog .
O O O O O O O O B O B O B O B O O O O O O O O
1 .
O O
Torsades de pointes ( TDP ) is a potentially fatal ventricular tachycardia associated with increases in QT interval and monophasic action potential duration ( MAPD ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
TDP is a side - effect that has led to withdrawal of several drugs from the market ( e . g . terfenadine and terodiline ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
2 .
O O
The potential of compounds to cause TDP was evaluated by monitoring their effects on MAPD in dog .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Four compounds known to increase QT interval and cause TDP were investigated : terfenadine , terodiline , cisapride and E4031 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O B O
On the basis that only free drug in the systemic circulation will elicit a pharmacological response target , free concentrations in plasma were selected to mimic the free drug exposures
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in man .
O O O
Infusion regimens were designed that rapidly achieved and maintained target - free concentrations of these drugs in plasma and data on the relationship between free concentration and changes in MAPD
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
were obtained for these compounds .
O O O O O O
3 .
O O
These data indicate that the free ED50 in plasma for terfenadine ( 1 . 9 nM ) , terodiline ( 76 nM ) , cisapride ( 11 nM ) and
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O
E4031 ( 1 . 9 nM ) closely correlate with the free concentration in man causing QT effects .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
For compounds that have shown TDP in the clinic ( terfenadine , terodiline , cisapride ) there is little differentiation between the dog ED50 and the efficacious free plasma concentrations
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in man ( < 10 - fold ) reflecting their limited safety margins .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These data underline the need to maximize the therapeutic ratio with respect to TDP in potential development candidates and the importance of using free drug concentrations in pharmacokinetic / pharmacodynamic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
studies .
O O
Fatal myeloencephalopathy due to accidental intrathecal vincristin administration : a report of two cases .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
We report on two fatal cases of accidental intrathecal vincristine instillation in a 5 - year old girl with recurrent acute lymphoblastic leucemia and a 57 - year old man
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with lymphoblastic lymphoma .
O O O O
The girl died seven days , the man four weeks after intrathecal injection of vincristine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Clinically , the onset was characterized by the signs of opistothonus , sensory and motor dysfunction and ascending paralysis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Histological and immunohistochemical investigations ( HE - LFB , CD - 68 , Neurofilament ) revealed degeneration of myelin and axons as well as pseudocystic transformation in areas exposed to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
vincristine , accompanied by secondary changes with numerous prominent macrophages .
B O O O O O O O O O O
The clinical course and histopathological results of the two cases are presented .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A review of all reported cases in the literature is given .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
A better controlled regimen for administering vincristine and intrathecal chemotherapy is recommended .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Intravenous administration of prochlorperazine by 15 - minute infusion versus 2 - minute bolus does not affect the incidence of akathisia : a prospective , randomized , controlled trial .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
STUDY OBJECTIVE : We sought to compare the rate of akathisia after administration of intravenous prochlorperazine as a 2 - minute bolus or 15 - minute infusion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We conducted a prospective , randomized , double - blind study in the emergency department of a central - city teaching hospital .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients aged 18 years or older treated with prochlorperazine for headache , nausea , or vomiting were eligible for inclusion .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Study participants were randomized to receive 10 mg of prochlorperazine administered intravenously by means of 2 - minute push ( bolus group ) or 10 mg diluted in 50 mL
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of normal saline solution administered by means of intravenous infusion during a 15 - minute period ( infusion group ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The main outcome was the number of study participants experiencing akathisia within 60 minutes of administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Akathisia was defined as either a spontaneous report of restlessness or agitation or a change of 2 or more in the patient - reported akathisia rating scale and a change
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of at least 1 in the investigator - observed akathisia rating scale .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The intensity of headache and nausea was measured with a 100 - mm visual analog scale .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
One hundred patients were enrolled .
O O O O O O
One study participant was excluded after protocol violation .
O O O O O O O O O
Seventy - three percent ( 73 / 99 ) of the study participants were treated for headache and 70 % ( 70 / 99 ) for nausea .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the bolus group , 26 . 0 % ( 13 / 50 ) had akathisia compared with 32 . 7 % ( 16 / 49 ) in the infusion
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
group ( Delta = - 6 . 7 % ; 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] - 24 . 6 % to 11 . 2 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The difference between the bolus and infusion groups in the percentage of participants who saw a 50 % reduction in their headache intensity within 30 minutes was 11 . 8
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% ( 95 % CI - 9 . 6 % to 33 . 3 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The difference in the percentage of patients with a 50 % reduction in their nausea was 12 . 6 % ( 95 % CI - 4 . 6 % to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
29 . 8 % ) .
O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
A 50 % reduction in the incidence of akathisia when prochlorperazine was administered by means of 15 - minute intravenous infusion versus a 2 - minute intravenous push was not
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
detected .
O O
The efficacy of prochlorperazine in the treatment of headache and nausea likewise did not appear to be affected by the rate of administration , although no formal statistical comparisons were
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
made .
O O
Antithymocyte globulin in the treatment of D - penicillamine - induced aplastic anemia .
B I O O O O B I I O O O O O
A patient who received antithymocyte globulin therapy for aplastic anemia due to D - penicillamine therapy is described .
O O O O B I O O O O O O B I I O O O O
Bone marrow recovery and peripheral blood recovery were complete 1 month and 3 months , respectively , after treatment , and blood transfusion or other therapies were not necessary in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a follow - up period of more than 2 years .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Use of antithymocyte globulin may be the optimal treatment of D - penicillamine - induced aplastic anemia .
O O B I O O O O O O B I I O O O O O
The relationship between hippocampal acetylcholine release and cholinergic convulsant sensitivity in withdrawal seizure - prone and withdrawal seizure - resistant selected mouse lines .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
The septo - hippocampal cholinergic pathway has been implicated in epileptogenesis , and genetic factors influence the response to cholinergic agents , but limited data are available on cholinergic involvement
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in alcohol withdrawal severity .
O B O O O
Thus , the relationship between cholinergic activity and responsiveness and alcohol withdrawal was investigated in a genetic animal model of ethanol withdrawal severity .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O
METHODS :
O O
Cholinergic convulsant sensitivity was examined in alcohol - na ve Withdrawal Seizure - Prone ( WSP ) and - Resistant ( WSR ) mice .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Animals were administered nicotine , carbachol , or neostigmine via timed tail vein infusion , and the latencies to onset of tremor and clonus were recorded and converted to threshold
O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dose .
O O
We also used microdialysis to measure basal and potassium - stimulated acetylcholine ( ACh ) release in the CA1 region of the hippocampus .
O O O O O O O O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
Potassium was applied by reverse dialysis twice , separated by 75 min .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hippocampal ACh also was measured during testing for handling - induced convulsions .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Sensitivity to several convulsion endpoints induced by nicotine , carbachol , and neostigmine were significantly greater in WSR versus WSP mice .
O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O
In microdialysis experiments , the lines did not differ in basal release of ACh , and 50 mM KCl increased ACh output in both lines of mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
However , the increase in release of ACh produced by the first application of KCl was 2 - fold higher in WSP versus WSR mice .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
When hippocampal ACh was measured during testing for handling - induced convulsions , extracellular ACh was significantly elevated ( 192 % ) in WSP mice , but was nonsignificantly elevated
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 59 % ) in WSR mice .
O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
These results suggest that differences in cholinergic activity and postsynaptic sensitivity to cholinergic convulsants may be associated with ethanol withdrawal severity and implicate cholinergic mechanisms in alcohol withdrawal .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O
Specifically , WSP mice may have lower sensitivity to cholinergic convulsants compared with WSR because of postsynaptic receptor desensitization brought on by higher activity of cholinergic neurons .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prenatal dexamethasone programs hypertension and renal injury in the rat .
O B O O O O O O O O O
Dexamethasone is frequently administered to the developing fetus to accelerate pulmonary development .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of the present study was to determine if prenatal dexamethasone programmed a progressive increase in blood pressure and renal injury in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pregnant rats were given either vehicle or 2 daily intraperitoneal injections of dexamethasone ( 0 . 2 mg / kg body weight ) on gestational days 11 and 12 ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
13 and 14 , 15 and 16 , 17 and 18 , or 19 and 20 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Offspring of rats administered dexamethasone on days 15 and 16 gestation had a 20 % reduction in glomerular number compared with control at 6 to 9 months of age (
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
22 527 + / - 509 versus 28 050 + / - 561 , P < 0 . 05 ) , which was comparable to the percent reduction in glomeruli
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
measured at 3 weeks of age .
O O O O O O O
Six - to 9 - month old rats receiving prenatal dexamethasone on days 17 and 18 of gestation
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
had a 17 % reduction in glomeruli ( 23 380 + / - 587 ) compared with control rats ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Male rats that received prenatal dexamethasone on days 15 and 16 , 17 and 18 , and 13 and 14 of gestation had elevated blood pressures at 6 months of
