O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
age ; the latter group did not have a reduction in glomerular number .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adult rats given dexamethasone on days 15 and 16 of gestation had more glomeruli with glomerulosclerosis than control rats .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This study shows that prenatal dexamethasone in rats results in a reduction in glomerular number , glomerulosclerosis , and hypertension when administered at specific points during gestation .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hypertension was observed in animals that had a reduction in glomeruli as well as in a group that did not have a reduction in glomerular number , suggesting that a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
reduction in glomerular number is not the sole cause for the development of hypertension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The risk of venous thromboembolism in women prescribed cyproterone acetate in combination with ethinyl estradiol : a nested cohort analysis and case - control study .
O O O O O O O O B I O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Cyproterone acetate combined with ethinyl estradiol ( CPA / EE ) is licensed in the UK for the treatment of women with acne and hirsutism and is also a treatment
B I O O B I O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
option for polycystic ovary syndrome ( PCOS ) .
O O O O O O O O O
Previous studies have demonstrated an increased risk of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) associated with CPA / EE compared with conventional combined oral contraceptives ( COCs ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O B I O O O O
We believe the results of those studies may have been affected by residual confounding .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Using the General Practice Research Database we conducted a cohort analysis and case - control study nested within a population of women aged between 15 and 39 years with acne
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, hirsutism or PCOS to estimate the risk of VTE associated with CPA / EE .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
RESULTS :
O O
The age - adjusted incidence rate ratio for CPA / EE versus conventional COCs was 2 . 20 [ 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) 1 . 35 -
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
3 . 58 ] .
O O O O O
Using as the reference group women who were not using oral contraception , had no recent pregnancy or menopausal symptoms , the case - control analysis gave an adjusted odds
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ratio ( OR ( adj ) ) of 7 . 44 ( 95 % CI 3 . 67 - 15 . 08 ) for CPA / EE use compared with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
an OR ( adj ) of 2 . 58 ( 95 % CI 1 . 60 - 4 . 18 ) for use of conventional COCs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
We have demonstrated an increased risk of VTE associated with the use of CPA / EE in women with acne , hirsutism or PCOS although residual confounding by indication can
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
not be excluded .
O O O O
Pseudoacromegaly induced by the long - term use of minoxidil .
O O O O O O O O O B O
Acromegaly is an endocrine disorder caused by chronic excessive growth hormone secretion from the anterior pituitary gland .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Significant disfiguring changes occur as a result of bone , cartilage , and soft tissue hypertrophy , including the thickening of the skin , coarsening of facial features , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cutis verticis gyrata .
O O O O
Pseudoacromegaly , on the other hand , is the presence of similar acromegaloid features in the absence of elevated growth hormone or insulin - like growth factor levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We present a patient with pseudoacromegaly that resulted from the long - term use of minoxidil at an unusually high dose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
This is the first case report of pseudoacromegaly as a side effect of minoxidil use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Combined androgen blockade - induced anemia in prostate cancer patients without bone involvement .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
To determine the onset and extent of combined androgen blockade ( CAB ) - induced anemia in prostate cancer patients without bone involvement .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS AND METHODS :
O O O O
Forty - two patients with biopsy - proven prostatic adenocarcinoma [ 26 with stage C ( T3N0M0 ) and 16 with stage D1 ( T3N1M0 ) ] were included in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
this study .
O O O
All patients received CAB [ leuprolide acetate ( LHRH - A ) 3 . 75 mg , intramuscularly , every 28 days plus 250 mg flutamide , tid , per
O O O O O B I O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Os ] and were evaluated for anemia by physical examination and laboratory tests at baseline and 4 subsequent intervals ( 1 , 2 , 3 and 6 months post -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CAB ) .
O O O
Hb , PSA and Testosterone measurements were recorded .
O O O O B O O O O
Patients with stage D2 - 3 disease , abnormal hemoglobin level or renal and liver function tests that were higher than the upper limits were excluded from the study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The duration of the study was six months .
O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The mean hemoglobin ( Hb ) levels were significantly declined in all patients from baseline of 14 . 2 g / dl to 14 . 0 g / dl ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
13 . 5 g / dl , 13 . 2 g / dl and 12 . 7 g / dl at 1 , 2 , 3 and 6 months post
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- CAB , respectively .
O O O O O
Severe and clinically evident anemia of Hb
O O O O O O O
< 11 g / dl with clinical symptoms was detected in 6 patients ( 14 . 3 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This CAB - induced anemia was normochromic and normocytic .
O O O O O O O O O O
At six months post - CAB , patients with severe anemia had a Hb mean value of 10 . 2 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 1 g / dl ( X + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O
SE ) , whereas the other patients had mild anemia with Hb mean value of 13 . 2 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 17 ( X + / - SE ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The development of severe anemia at 6 months post - CAB was predictable by the reduction of Hb baseline value of more than 2 . 5 g / dl after
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
3 months of CAB ( p = 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The development of severe CAB - induced anemia in prostate cancer patients did not correlate with T baseline values ( T < 3 ng / ml versus T > or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
= 3 ng / ml ) , with age ( < 76 yrs versus > or = 76 yrs ) , and clinical stage ( stage C versus stage D1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
Severe and clinically evident anemia was easily corrected by subcutaneous injections ( 3 times / week for 1 month ) of recombinant erythropoietin ( rHuEPO - beta ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Our data suggest that rHuEPO - beta correctable CAB - induced anemia occurs in 14 . 3 % of prostate cancer patients after 6 months of therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reversible dilated cardiomyopathy related to amphotericin B therapy .
O O O O O B I O O
We describe a patient who developed dilated cardiomyopathy and clinical congestive heart failure after 2 months of therapy with amphotericin B ( AmB ) for disseminated coccidioidomycosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O
His echocardiographic abnormalities and heart failure resolved after posaconazole was substituted for AmB .
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O
It is important to recognize the rare and potentially reversible toxicity of AmB .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Risks of the consumption of beverages containing quinine .
O O O O O O O B O
Although the United States Food and Drug Administration banned its use for nocturnal leg cramps due to lack of safety and efficacy , quinine is widely available in beverages including
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
tonic water and bitter lemon .
O O O O O O
Numerous anecdotal reports suggest that products containing quinine may produce neurological complications , including confusion , altered mental status , seizures , and coma , particularly in older women .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Psychologists need to inquire about consumption of quinine - containing beverages as part of an evaluation process .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Organophosphate - induced convulsions and prevention of neuropathological damages .
B O O O O O O O O O
Such organophosphorus ( OP ) compounds as diisopropylfluorophosphate ( DFP ) , sarin and soman are potent inhibitors of acetylcholinesterases ( AChEs ) and butyrylcholinesterases ( BChEs ) .
O B O B O O O B O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The acute toxicity of OPs is the result of their irreversible binding with AChEs in the central nervous system ( CNS ) , which elevates acetylcholine ( ACh ) levels
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
.
O
The protective action of subcutaneously ( SC ) administered antidotes or their combinations in DFP ( 2 . 0 mg / kg BW ) intoxication was studied in 9 -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
10 - weeks - old Han - Wistar male rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The rats received AChE reactivator pralidoxime - 2 - chloride ( 2PAM ) ( 30 . 0 mg / kg BW ) , anticonvulsant diazepam ( 2 . 0 mg
O O O O O B I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
/ kg BW ) , A ( 1 ) - adenosine receptor agonist N ( 6 ) - cyclopentyl adenosine ( CPA ) ( 2 . 0 mg / kg
O O O O O O O O O O B O O B I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O
BW ) , NMDA - receptor antagonist dizocilpine maleate ( + - MK801 hydrogen maleate ) ( 2 . 0 mg / kg BW ) or their combinations with cholinolytic
O O O B O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
drug atropine sulfate ( 50 . 0 mg / kg BW ) immediately or 30 min after the single SC injection of DFP .
O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The control rats received atropine sulfate , but also saline and olive oil instead of other antidotes and DFP , respectively .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
All rats were terminated either 24 h or 3 weeks after the DFP injection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The rats treated with DFP - atropine showed severe typical OP - induced toxicity signs .
O O O O B O B O O O B O O O O O
When CPA , diazepam or 2PAM was given immediately after DFP - atropine , these treatments prevented , delayed or shortened the occurrence of serious signs of poisoning .
O B O B O B O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Atropine - MK801 did not offer any additional protection against DFP toxicity .
B O B O O O O O O O B O O
In conclusion , CPA , diazepam and 2PAM in combination with atropine prevented the occurrence of serious signs of poisoning and thus reduced the toxicity of DFP in rat .
O O O B O B O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Differential modulation by estrogen of alpha2 - adrenergic and I1 - imidazoline receptor - mediated hypotension in female rats .
O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
We have recently shown that estrogen negatively modulates the hypotensive effect of clonidine ( mixed alpha2 - / I1 - receptor agonist ) in female rats and implicates the cardiovascular
O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
autonomic control in this interaction .
O O O O O O
The present study investigated whether this effect of estrogen involves interaction with alpha2 -
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
and / or I1 - receptors .
O O O O O O O
Changes evoked by a single intraperitoneal injection of rilmenidine ( 600 microg / kg ) or alpha - methyldopa ( 100 mg / kg ) , selective I1 - and
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O
alpha2 - receptor agonists , respectively , in blood pressure , hemodynamic variability , and locomotor activity were assessed in radiotelemetered sham - operated and ovariectomized ( Ovx ) Sprague
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- Dawley female rats with or without 12 - wk estrogen replacement .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Three time domain indexes of hemodynamic variability were employed : the standard deviation of mean arterial pressure as a measure of blood pressure variability and the standard deviation of beat
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- to - beat intervals ( SDRR ) and
O O O O O O O O O
the root mean square of successive differences in R - wave - to - R - wave intervals as measures of heart rate variability .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In sham - operated rats , rilmenidine or alpha - methyldopa elicited similar hypotension that lasted at least 5 h and was associated with reductions in standard deviation of mean
O O O O O O B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
arterial pressure .
O O O
SDRR was reduced only by alpha - methyldopa .
O O O O O B I I O
Ovx significantly enhanced the hypotensive response to alpha - methyldopa , in contrast to no effect on rilmenidine hypotension .
O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O B O O
The enhanced alpha - methyldopa hypotension in Ovx rats was paralleled with further reduction in SDRR and a reduced locomotor activity .
O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Estrogen replacement ( 17beta - estradiol subcutaneous pellet , 14 . 2 microg / day , 12 wk ) of Ovx rats restored the hemodynamic and locomotor effects of
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
alpha - methyldopa to sham - operated levels .
B I I O O O O O O
These findings suggest that estrogen downregulates alpha2 - but not I1 - receptor - mediated hypotension and highlight a role for the cardiac autonomic control in alpha - methyldopa -
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O
estrogen interaction .
B O O
Cardioprotective effect of tincture of Crataegus on isoproterenol - induced myocardial infarction in rats .
O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O
Tincture of Crataegus ( TCR ) , an alcoholic extract of the berries of hawthorn ( Crataegus oxycantha ) , is used in herbal and homeopathic medicine .
B I I O B O O O B I I I I I I O B I O O O O O O O O O O
The present study was done to investigate the protective effect of TCR on experimentally induced myocardial infarction in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Pretreatment of TCR , at a dose of 0 . 5 mL / 100 g bodyweight per day , orally for 30 days , prevented the increase in lipid peroxidation
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and activity of marker enzymes observed in isoproterenol - induced rats ( 85 mg kg ( - 1 )
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
s .
O O
c . for 2 days at an interval of 24 h ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
TCR prevented the isoproterenol - induced decrease in antioxidant enzymes in the heart and increased the rate of ADP - stimulated oxygen uptake and respiratory coupling ratio .
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O
TCR protected against pathological changes induced by isoproterenol in rat heart .
B O O O O O O B O O O O
The results show that pretreatment with TCR may be useful in preventing the damage induced by isoproterenol in rat heart .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Safety and adverse effects associated with raloxifene : multiple outcomes of raloxifene evaluation .
O O O O O O B O O O O B O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To examine the effect of raloxifene on major adverse events that occur with postmenopausal estrogen therapy or tamoxifen .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O B O
METHODS :
O O
The Multiple Outcomes of Raloxifene Evaluation , a multicenter , randomized , double - blind trial , enrolled 7 , 705 postmenopausal women with osteoporosis .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Women were randomly assigned to raloxifene 60 mg / d or 120 mg / d or placebo .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Outcomes included venous thromboembolism , cataracts , gallbladder disease , and endometrial hyperplasia or cancer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
During a mean follow - up of 3 . 3 years , raloxifene was associated with an increased risk for venous thromboembolism ( relative risk [ RR ] 2 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 ; 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] 1 . 2 - 3 . 8 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The excess event rate was 1 . 8 per 1 , 000 woman - years ( 95 % CI - 0 . 5 - 4 . 1 ) , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the number needed to treat to cause 1 event was 170 ( 95 % CI 100 - 582 ) over 3 . 3 years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Risk in the raloxifene group was higher than in the placebo group for the first 2 years , but decreased to about the same rate as in the placebo group
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
thereafter .
O O
Raloxifene did not increase risk for cataracts ( RR 0 . 9 ; 95 % CI 0 . 8 - 1 . 1 ) , gallbladder disease ( RR 1
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 0 ; 95 % CI 0 . 7 - 1 . 3 ) , endometrial hyperplasia ( RR 1 . 3 ; 95 % CI 0 . 4 -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 . 1 ) , or endometrial cancer ( RR 0 . 9 ; 95 % CI 0 . 3 - 2 . 7 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Raloxifene was associated with an increased risk for venous thromboembolism , but there was no increased risk for cataracts , gallbladder disease , endometrial hyperplasia , or endometrial cancer .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
LEVEL OF EVIDENCE :
O O O O
I
O
Ceftriaxone - associated biliary pseudolithiasis in paediatric surgical patients .
B O O O O O O O O O
It is well known that ceftriaxone leads to pseudolithiasis in some patients .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Clinical and experimental studies also suggest that situations causing gallbladder dysfunction , such as fasting , may have a role for the development of pseudolithiasis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this study , we prospectively evaluated the incidence and clinical importance of pseudolithiasis in paediatric surgical patients receiving ceftriaxone treatment , who often had to fast in the post
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
- operative period .
O O O O
Fifty children who were given ceftriaxone were evaluated by serial abdominal sonograms .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Of those , 13 ( 26 % ) developed biliary pathology .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Comparison of the patients with or without pseudolithiasis revealed no significant difference with respect to age , sex , duration of the treatment and starvation variables .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After cessation of the treatment , pseudolithiasis resolved spontaneously within a short period .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of pseudolithiasis is not affected by fasting .
O O O O O O O O O O
Evaluation of the anticocaine monoclonal antibody GNC92H2 as an immunotherapy for cocaine overdose .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The illicit use of cocaine continues in epidemic proportions and treatment for cocaine overdose remains elusive .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Current protein - based technology offers a new therapeutic venue by which antibodies bind the drug in the blood stream , inactivating its toxic effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The therapeutic potential of the anticocaine antibody GNC92H2 was examined using a model of cocaine overdose .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Swiss albino mice prepared with intrajugular catheters were tested in photocell cages after administration of 93 mg / kg ( LD50 ) of cocaine and GNC92H2 infusions ranging from 30
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
to 190 mg / kg .
O O O O O O
GNC92H2 was delivered 30 min before , concomitantly or 3 min after cocaine treatment .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Significant blockade of cocaine toxicity was observed with the higher dose of GNC92H2 ( 190 mg / kg ) , where premorbid behaviors were reduced up to 40 % ,
O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
seizures up to 77 % and death by 72 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Importantly , GNC92H2 prevented death even post - cocaine injection .
O O B O O O O O B O O
The results support the important potential of GNC92H2 as a therapeutic tool against cocaine overdose .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The effects of short - term raloxifene therapy on fibrinolysis markers : TAFI , tPA , and PAI - 1 .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : Markers of fibrinolysis , thrombin - activatable fibrinolysis inhibitor ( TAFI ) , tissue - type plasminogen activator ( tPA ) , and plasminogen activator inhibitor - 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( PAI - 1 ) levels were studied for the evaluation of short - term effects of raloxifene administration in postmenopausal women .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Thirty - nine postmenopausal women with osteopenia or osteoporosis were included in this prospective , controlled clinical study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Twenty - five women were given raloxifene hydrochloride ( 60 mg / day ) plus calcium ( 500 mg / day ) .
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Age - matched controls ( n = 14 ) were given only calcium .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Plasma TAFI , tPA , and PAI - 1
O O O O O O O O O
antigen levels were measured at baseline and after 3 months of treatment by commercially available ELISA kits .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Variations of individuals were assessed by Wilcoxon 's test .
O O O O O O O O O O
Relationship between those markers and demographic characteristics were investigated .
O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Three months of raloxifene treatment was associated with a significant decrease in the plasma TAFI antigen concentrations ( 16 % change , P < 0 . 01 ) , and
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a significant increase in tPA antigen concentrations ( 25 % change , P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A significant correlation was found between baseline TAFI antigen concentrations and the duration of amenorrhea ( P < 0 . 05 ; r = 0 . 33 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
We suggest that the increased risk of venous thromboembolism due to raloxifene treatment may be related to increased tPA levels , but not TAFI levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ketoconazole induced torsades de pointes without concomitant use of QT interval - prolonging drug .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ketoconazole is not known to be proarrhythmic without concomitant use of QT interval - prolonging drugs .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report a woman with coronary artery disease who developed a markedly prolonged QT interval and torsades de pointes ( TdP ) after taking ketoconazole for treatment of fungal infection
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
.
O
Her QT interval returned to normal upon withdrawal of ketoconazole .
O O O O O O O O O B O
Genetic study did not find any mutation in her genes that encode cardiac IKr channel proteins .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We postulate that by virtue of its direct blocking action on IKr , ketoconazole alone may prolong QT interval and induce TdP .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
This calls for attention when ketoconazole is administered to patients with risk factors for acquired long QT syndrome .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pharmacological evidence for the potential of Daucus carota in the management of cognitive dysfunctions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The present study was aimed at investigating the effects of Daucus carota seeds on cognitive functions , total serum cholesterol levels and brain cholinesterase activity in mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The ethanolic extract of Daucus carota seeds ( DCE ) was administered orally in three doses ( 100 , 200 , 400 mg / kg ) for seven successive days
O O B I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to different groups of young and aged mice .
O O O O O O O O O
Elevated plus maze and passive avoidance apparatus served as the exteroceptive behavioral models for testing memory .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diazepam - , scopolamine - and ageing - induced amnesia served as the interoceptive behavioral models .
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DCE ( 200 , 400 mg / kg , p . o . ) showed significant improvement in memory scores of young and aged mice .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The extent of memory improvement evoked by DCE was 23 % at the dose of 200 mg / kg and 35 % at the dose of 400 mg / kg
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in young mice using elevated plus maze .
O O O O O O O O
Similarly , significant improvements in memory scores were observed using passive avoidance apparatus and aged mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , DCE reversed the amnesia induced by scopolamine ( 0 . 4 mg / kg , i . p . ) and diazepam ( 1 mg / kg ,
O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
i . p . ) .
O O O O O O
Daucus carota extract ( 200 , 400 mg / kg , p . o . )
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
reduced significantly the brain acetylcholinesterase activity and cholesterol levels in young and aged mice .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The extent of inhibition of brain cholinesterase activity evoked by DCE at the dose of 400 mg / kg was 22 % in young and 19 % in aged mice
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
There was a remarkable reduction in total cholesterol level as well , to the extent of 23 % in young and 21 % in aged animals with this dose of
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DCE .
B O
Therefore , DCE may prove to be a useful remedy for the management of cognitive dysfunctions on account of its multifarious beneficial effects such as , memory improving property ,
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cholesterol lowering property and anticholinesterase activity .
B O O O O O O
Cauda equina syndrome after epidural steroid injection : a case report .
O O O O O B O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : Conventional treatment methods of lumbusacral radiculopathy are physical therapy , epidural steroid injections , oral medications , and spinal manipulative therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Cauda equina syndrome is a rare complication of epidural anesthesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The following case is a report of cauda equina syndrome possibly caused by epidural injection of triamcinolone and bupivacaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
CLINICAL FEATURES :
O O O
A 50 - year - old woman with low back and right leg pain was scheduled for epidural steroid injection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
INTERVENTION AND OUTCOME :
O O O O
An 18 - gauge Touhy needle was inserted until loss of resistance occurred at the L4 - 5 level .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Spread of the contrast medium within the epidural space was determined by radiographic imaging .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After verifying the epidural space , bupivacaine and triamcinolone diacetate were injected .
O O O O O O B O B I O O O
After the injection , there was a reduction in radicular symptoms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Three hours later , she complained of perineal numbness and lower extremity weakness .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The neurologic evaluation revealed loss of sensation in the saddle area and medial aspect of her right leg .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was a decrease in the perception of pinprick test .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Deep - tendon reflexes were decreased especially in the right leg .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
She was unable to urinate .
O O O O O O
The patient 's symptoms improved slightly over the next few hours .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
She had a gradual return of motor function and ability of feeling Foley catheter .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All of the symptoms were completely resolved over the next 8 hours .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Complications associated with epidural steroid injections are rare .
O O O O B O O O O
Clinical examination and continued vigilance for neurologic deterioration after epidural steroid injections is important .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
High - dose testosterone is associated with atherosclerosis in postmenopausal women .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
To study the long - term effects of androgen treatment on atherosclerosis in postmenopausal women .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
In a population - based study in 513 naturally postmenopausal women aged 54 - 67 years , we studied the association between self - reported intramuscularly administered high - dose
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
estrogen - testosterone therapy ( estradiol - and testosterone esters ) and aortic atherosclerosis .
B O B O O B I I I I O O O O O
Aortic atherosclerosis was diagnosed by radiographic detection of calcified deposits in the abdominal aorta , which have been shown to reflect intima atherosclerosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hormone therapy users were compared with never users .
O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Intramuscular hormone therapy use for 1 year or longer was reported by 25 women .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In almost half of these women severe atherosclerosis of the aorta was present ( n = 11 ) , while in women without hormone use severe atherosclerosis of the aorta
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
was present in less than 20 % ( OR 3 . 1 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 1 - 8 . 5 , adjusted for age , years
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
since menopause , smoking , and body mass index ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The association remained after additional adjustment for diabetes , cholesterol level , systolic blood pressure , or alcohol use .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O
No association was found for hormone use less than 1 year .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Our results suggest that high - dose testosterone therapy may adversely affect atherosclerosis in postmenopausal women and indicate that androgen replacement in these women may not be harmless .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sirolimus - associated proteinuria and renal dysfunction .
B O O O O O O O
Sirolimus is a novel immunosuppressant with potent antiproliferative actions through its ability to inhibit the raptor - containing mammalian target of rapamycin protein kinase .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Sirolimus represents a major therapeutic advance in the prevention of acute renal allograft rejection and chronic allograft nephropathy .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Its role in the therapy of glomerulonephritis , autoimmunity , cystic renal diseases and renal cancer is under investigation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because sirolimus does not share the vasomotor renal adverse effects exhibited by calcineurin inhibitors , it has been designated a ' non - nephrotoxic drug ' .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , clinical reports suggest that , under some circumstances , sirolimus is associated with proteinuria and acute renal dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
A common risk factor appears to be presence of pre - existing chronic renal damage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mechanisms of sirolimus - associated proteinuria are multifactorial and may be due to an increase in glomerular capillary pressure following calcineurin inhibitor withdrawal .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It has also been suggested that sirolimus directly causes increased glomerular permeability / injury , but evidence for this mechanism is currently inconclusive .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The acute renal dysfunction associated with sirolimus ( such as in delayed graft function ) may be due to suppression of compensatory renal cell proliferation and survival / repair processes
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Although these adverse effects occur in some patients , their occurrence could be minimised by knowledge of the molecular effects of sirolimus on the kidney , the use of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
sirolimus in appropriate patient populations , close monitoring of proteinuria and renal function , use of angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitors or angiotensin II receptor blockers if proteinuria occurs and
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B I O O O O O O
withdrawal if needed .
O O O O
Further long - term analysis of renal allograft studies using sirolimus as de novo immunosuppression along with clinical and laboratory studies will refine these issues in the future .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Progressive myopathy with up - regulation of MHC -
O O O O O O O O O
I associated with statin therapy .
O O O B O O
Statins can cause a necrotizing myopathy and hyperCKaemia which is reversible on cessation of the drug .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
What is less well known is a phenomenon whereby statins may induce a myopathy , which persists or may progress after stopping the drug .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We investigated the muscle pathology in 8 such cases .
O O O O O O O O O O
All had myofibre necrosis but only 3 had an inflammatory infiltrate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
In all cases there was diffuse or multifocal up - regulation of MHC - I expression even in non - necrotic fibres .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Progressive improvement occurred in 7 cases after commencement of prednisolone and methotrexate , and in one case spontaneously .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
These observations suggest that statins may initiate an immune - mediated myopathy that persists after withdrawal of the drug and responds to immunosuppressive therapy .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mechanism of this myopathy is uncertain but may involve the induction by statins of an endoplasmic reticulum stress response with associated up - regulation of MHC - I expression
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and antigen presentation by muscle fibres .
O O O O O O O
Direct inhibition of cardiac hyperpolarization - activated cyclic nucleotide - gated pacemaker channels by clonidine .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O B O
BACKGROUND : Inhibition of cardiac sympathetic tone represents an important strategy for treatment of cardiovascular disease , including arrhythmia , coronary heart disease , and chronic heart failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Activation of presynaptic alpha2 - adrenoceptors is the most widely accepted mechanism of action of the antisympathetic drug clonidine ; however , other target proteins have been postulated to contribute
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
to the in vivo actions of clonidine .
O O O O O O B O
METHODS AND RESULTS :
O O O O
To test whether clonidine elicits pharmacological effects independent of alpha2 - adrenoceptors , we have generated mice with a targeted deletion of all 3 alpha2 - adrenoceptor subtypes ( alpha2ABC
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- / - ) .
O O O O O
Alpha2ABC - / - mice were completely unresponsive to the analgesic and hypnotic effects of clonidine ; however , clonidine significantly lowered heart rate in alpha2ABC - / - mice
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
by up to 150 bpm .
O O O O O O
Clonidine - induced bradycardia in conscious alpha2ABC - / - mice was 32 . 3 % ( 10 microg / kg ) and 26 . 6 % ( 100 microg
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
/ kg ) of the effect in wild - type mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
A similar bradycardic effect of clonidine was observed in isolated spontaneously beating right atria from alpha2ABC - knockout and wild - type mice .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clonidine inhibited the native pacemaker current ( I ( f ) ) in isolated sinoatrial node pacemaker cells and the I ( f ) - generating hyperpolarization - activated
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cyclic nucleotide - gated ( HCN ) 2 and HCN4 channels in transfected HEK293 cells .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As a consequence of blocking I ( f ) , clonidine reduced the slope of the diastolic depolarization and the frequency of pacemaker potentials in sinoatrial node cells from wild
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- type and alpha2ABC - knockout mice .
O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Direct inhibition of cardiac HCN pacemaker channels contributes to the bradycardic effects of clonidine gene - targeted mice in vivo , and thus , clonidine - like drugs represent novel
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
structures for future HCN channel inhibitors .
O O O O O O O
Influence of smoking on developing cochlea .
O O B O O O O
Does smoking during pregnancy affect the amplitudes of transient evoked otoacoustic emissions in newborns ?
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : Maternal tobacco smoking has negative effects on fetal growth .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
The influence of smoking during pregnancy on the developing cochlea has not been estimated , although smoking has been positively associated with hearing loss in adults .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The objective of this study was to determine the effects of maternal smoking on transient evoked otoacoustic emissions ( TEOAEs ) of healthy neonates .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
This study was undertaken as part of neonatal screening for hearing impairment and involved both ears of 200 newborns .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Newborns whose mothers reported smoking during pregnancy ( n = 200 ears ) were compared to a control group of newborns ( n = 200 ears ) , whose mothers
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
were non - smokers .
O O O O O
Exposure to tobacco was characterized as low ( < 5 cigarettes per day , n = 88 ears ) , moderate ( 5 < or = cigarettes per day <
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
10 , n = 76 ) or high ( > or = 10 cigarettes per day , n = 36 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
In exposed neonates , TEOAEs mean response ( across frequency ) and mean amplitude at 4000Hz was significantly lower than in non - exposed neonates .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Comparisons between exposed newborns ' subgroups revealed no significant differences .
O O O O O O O O O O O
However , by comparing each subgroup to control group , we found statistically significant decreases of TEOAEs amplitudes at 4000Hz for all three groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mean TEOAEs responses of highly exposed newborns were also significantly lower in comparison to our control group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
In utero , exposure to tobacco smoking seems to have a small impact on outer hair cells .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
These effects seem to be equally true for all exposed newborns , regardless of the degree of exposure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Further studies are needed in order to establish a potential negative effect of maternal smoking on the neonate 's hearing acuity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Neuroinflammation and behavioral abnormalities after neonatal terbutaline treatment in rats : implications for autism .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder presenting before 3 years of age with deficits in communication and social skills and repetitive behaviors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition to genetic influences , recent studies suggest that prenatal drug or chemical exposures are risk factors for autism .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Terbutaline , a beta2 - adrenoceptor agonist used to arrest preterm labor , has been associated with increased concordance for autism in dizygotic twins .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We studied the effects of terbutaline on microglial activation in different brain regions and behavioral outcomes in developing rats .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Newborn rats were given terbutaline ( 10 mg / kg ) daily on postnatal days ( PN ) 2 to 5 or PN 11 to 14 and examined 24 h
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
after the last dose and at PN 30 .
O O O O O O O O O
Immunohistochemical studies showed that administration of terbutaline on PN 2 to 5 produced a robust increase in microglial activation on PN 30 in the cerebral cortex , as well as
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in cerebellar and cerebrocortical white matter .
O O O O O O O
None of these effects occurred in animals given terbutaline on PN 11 to 14 .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
In behavioral tests , animals treated with terbutaline on PN 2 to 5 showed consistent patterns of hyper - reactivity to novelty and aversive stimuli when assessed in a novel
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
open field , as well as in the acoustic startle response test .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our findings indicate that beta2 - adrenoceptor overstimulation during an early critical period results in microglial activation associated with innate neuroinflammatory pathways and behavioral abnormalities , similar to those described
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in autism .
O O O
This study provides a useful animal model for understanding the neuropathological processes underlying autism spectrum disorders .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute myocarditis associated with clozapine .
O O O O B O
OBJECTIVE : A case of acute myocarditis associated with the commencement of clozapine is described , highlighting the onset , course and possible contributing factors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There is an urgent need to raise awareness about this potentially fatal complication of clozapine use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
RESULTS :
O O
A 20 - year - old male with schizophrenia developed a sudden onset of myocarditis after commencement of clozapine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The patient recovered with intensive medical support .
O O O O O O O O
The symptoms occurred around 2 weeks after starting clozapine in an inpatient setting .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Possible contributing factors may have been concomitant antidepressant use and unaccustomed physical activity .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Myocarditis is an increasingly recognized complication associated with the use of clozapine .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
It can be fatal if not recognized and treated early .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Considering that clozapine remains the gold standard in treatment of resistant psychosis , there is an urgent need to raise awareness among medical and paramedical staff involved in the care
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of these patients .
O O O O
There are also implications for recommendations and regulations regarding the use of clozapine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Encephalopathy induced by levetiracetam added to valproate .
O O O B O O B O
BACKGROUND :
O O
We report on the manifestation of a levetiracetam ( LEV ) - induced encephalopathy .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
FINDINGS :
O O
A 28 - year - old man suffering from idiopathic epilepsy with generalized seizures was treated with LEV ( 3000 mg ) added to valproate ( VPA ) ( 2000
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O O
mg ) .
O O O
Frequency of generalized tonic - clonic seizures increased from one per 6 months to two per month .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neuropsychological testing showed impaired word fluency , psychomotor speed and working memory .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The interictal electroencephalogram ( EEG ) showed a generalized slowing to 5 per second theta rhythms with bilateral generalized high - amplitude discharges .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OUTCOME :
O O
Following discontinuation of LEV , EEG and neuropsychological findings improved and seizure frequency decreased .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Norepinephrine signaling through beta - adrenergic receptors is critical for expression of cocaine - induced anxiety .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Cocaine is a widely abused psychostimulant that has both rewarding and aversive properties .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
While the mechanisms underlying cocaine 's rewarding effects have been studied extensively , less attention has been paid to the unpleasant behavioral states induced by cocaine , such as anxiety
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
.
O
METHODS :
O O
In this study , we evaluated the performance of dopamine beta - hydroxylase knockout ( Dbh - / - ) mice , which lack norepinephrine ( NE ) , in
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
the elevated plus maze ( EPM ) to examine the contribution of noradrenergic signaling to cocaine - induced anxiety .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
We found that cocaine dose - dependently increased anxiety - like behavior in control ( Dbh + / -
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) mice , as measured by a decrease in open arm exploration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Dbh - / - mice had normal baseline performance in the EPM but were completely resistant to the anxiogenic effects of cocaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Cocaine - induced anxiety was also attenuated in Dbh + / -
B O O O O O O O O O O O
mice following administration of disulfiram , a dopamine beta - hydroxylase ( DBH ) inhibitor .
O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O
In experiments using specific adrenergic antagonists , we found that pretreatment with the beta - adrenergic receptor antagonist propranolol blocked cocaine - induced anxiety - like behavior in Dbh +
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
/ -
O O
and wild - type C57BL6 / J mice , while the alpha ( 1 ) antagonist prazosin and the alpha ( 2 ) antagonist yohimbine had no effect .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
These results indicate that noradrenergic signaling via beta - adrenergic receptors is required for cocaine - induced anxiety in mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Clonidine for attention - deficit / hyperactivity disorder : II .
B O O O O O O O O O O
ECG changes and adverse events analysis .
O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To examine the safety and tolerability of clonidine used alone or with methylphenidate in children with attention - deficit / hyperactivity disorder ( ADHD ) .
O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHOD :
O O
In a 16 - week multicenter , double - blind trial , 122 children with ADHD were randomly assigned to clonidine ( n = 31 ) , methylphenidate ( n
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O
= 29 ) , clonidine and methylphenidate ( n = 32 ) , or placebo ( n = 30 ) .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Doses were flexibly titrated up to 0 . 6 mg / day for clonidine and 60 mg / day for methylphenidate ( both with divided dosing ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Groups were compared regarding adverse events and changes from baseline to week 16 in electrocardiograms and vital signs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
There were more incidents of bradycardia in subjects treated with clonidine compared with those not treated with clonidine ( 17 . 5 % versus 3 . 4 % ; p
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
= . 02 ) , but no other significant group differences regarding electrocardiogram and other cardiovascular outcomes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There were no suggestions of interactions between clonidine and methylphenidate regarding cardiovascular outcomes .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
Moderate or severe adverse events were more common in subjects on clonidine ( 79 . 4 % versus 49 . 2 % ; p = . 0006 ) but not
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
associated with higher rates of early study withdrawal .
O O O O O O O O O
Drowsiness was common on clonidine , but generally resolved by 6 to 8 weeks .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Clonidine , used alone or with methylphenidate , appears safe and well tolerated in childhood ADHD .
B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Physicians prescribing clonidine should monitor for bradycardia and advise patients about the high likelihood of initial drowsiness .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thalidomide has limited single - agent activity in relapsed or refractory indolent non - Hodgkin lymphomas : a phase II trial of the Cancer and Leukemia Group B .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thalidomide is an immunomodulatory agent with demonstrated activity in multiple myeloma , mantle cell lymphoma and lymphoplasmacytic lymphoma .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Its activity is believed to be due modulation of the tumour milieu , including downregulation of angiogenesis and inflammatory cytokines .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Between July 2001 and April 2004 , 24 patients with relapsed / refractory indolent lymphomas received thalidomide 200 mg daily with escalation by 100 mg daily every 1 - 2
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
weeks as tolerated , up to a maximum of 800 mg daily .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients had received a median of 2 ( range , 1 - 4 ) prior regimens .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of 24 evaluable patients , two achieved a complete remission and one achieved a partial remission for an overall response rate of 12 . 5 % ( 95 % confidence
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
interval : 2 . 6 - 32 . 4 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Eleven patients progressed during therapy .
O O O O O O
Grade 3 - 4 adverse effects included myelosuppression , fatigue , somnolence / depressed mood , neuropathy and dyspnea .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of concern was the occurrence of four thromboembolic events .
O O O O O O O O O O
Our results failed to demonstrate an important response rate to single agent thalidomide in indolent lymphomas and contrast with the higher activity level reported with the second generation immunomodulatory agent
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, lenalidomide .
O B O
Intracavernous epinephrine : a minimally invasive treatment for priapism in the emergency department .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Priapism is the prolonged erection of the penis in the absence of sexual arousal .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A 45 - year - old man , an admitted frequent cocaine user , presented to the Emergency Department ( ED ) on two separate occasions with a history of
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
priapism after cocaine use .
O O B O O
The management options in the ED , as exemplified by four individual case reports , in particular the use of a minimally invasive method of intracorporal epinephrine instillation , are
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
discussed .
O O
Effect of green tea and vitamin E combination in isoproterenol induced myocardial infarction in rats .
O O B I O B I O O B O O O O O O
The present study was aimed to investigate the combined effects of green tea and vitamin E on heart weight , body weight , serum marker enzymes , lipid peroxidation ,
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
endogenous antioxidants and membrane bound ATPases in isoproterenol ( ISO ) - induced myocardial infarction in rats .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
Adult male albino rats , treated with ISO ( 200 mg / kg , s . c . ) for 2 days at an interval of 24 h caused a
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
significant ( P < 0 . 05 ) elevation of heart weight , serum marker enzymes , lipid peroxidation and Ca + 2 ATPase level whereas there was a significant
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
( P < 0 . 05 ) decrease in body weight , endogenous antioxidants , Na + / K + ATPase and Mg + 2 ATPase levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O B O O O O O
Administration of green tea ( 100 mg / kg / day , p . o . ) and vitamin E ( 100 mg / kg / day , p .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
o . ) together for 30 consecutive days and challenged with ISO on the day 29th and 30th , showed a significant ( P < 0 . 05 ) decrease
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in heart weight , serum marker enzymes , lipid peroxidation , Ca + 2 ATPase and a significant increase in the body weight , endogenous antioxidants , Na + /
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
K + ATPase and Mg + 2 ATPase when compared with ISO treated group and green tea or vitamin E alone treated groups .
B O O O B O O O O O O B O O O B I O B I O O O O
These findings indicate the synergistic protective effect of green tea and vitamin E during ISO induced myocardial infarction in rats .
O O O O O O O O B I O B I O B O O O O O O
Development of ocular myasthenia during pegylated interferon and ribavirin treatment for chronic hepatitis C . A 63 - year - old male experienced sudden diplopia after 9 weeks of administration
O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of pegylated interferon ( IFN ) alpha - 2b and ribavirin for chronic hepatitis C ( CHC ) .
O B I I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O
Ophthalmologic examinations showed ptosis on the right upper lid and restricted right eye movement without any other neurological signs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A brain imaging study and repetitive nerve stimulation test indicated no abnormality .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The acetylcholine receptor antibody titer and response to acetylcholinesterase inhibitors were negative , and the results of thyroid function tests were normal .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient 's ophthalmological symptoms improved rapidly 3 weeks after discontinuation of pegylated IFN alpha - 2b and ribavirin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O B O
The ocular myasthenia associated with combination therapy of pegylated IFN alpha - 2b and ribavirin for CHC is very rarely reported ; therefore , we present this case with a
O O O O O O O O B I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
review of the various eye complications of IFN therapy .
O O O O O O O B O O
The glycine transporter - 1 inhibitor SSR103800 displays a selective and specific antipsychotic - like profile in normal and transgenic mice .
O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Schizophrenia has been initially associated with dysfunction in dopamine neurotransmission .
O O O O O O O O B O O
However , the observation that antagonists of the glutamate N - methyl - D - aspartate ( NMDA ) receptor produce schizophrenic - like symptoms in humans has led to
O O O O O O O O B B I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
the idea of a dysfunctioning of the glutamatergic system via its NMDA receptor .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
As a result , there is a growing interest in the development of pharmacological agents with potential antipsychotic properties that enhance the activity of the glutamatergic system via a modulation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of the NMDA receptor .
O O B O O
Among them are glycine transporter - 1
O O O B O O O
( GlyT1 ) inhibitors such as SSR103800 , which indirectly enhance NMDA receptor function by increasing the glycine ( a co - agonist for the NMDA receptor ) levels in
O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O
the synapse .
O O O
This study aimed at investigating the potential antipsychotic - like properties of SSR103800 , with a particular focus on models of hyperactivity , involving either drug challenge ( ie ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
amphetamine and MK - 801 ) or transgenic mice ( ie , NMDA Nr1 ( neo - / - ) and DAT ( - / - ) ) .
B O B I I O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Results showed that SSR103800 ( 10 - 30 mg / kg p . o . )
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
blocked hyperactivity induced by the non - competitive NMDA receptor antagonist , MK - 801 and partially reversed spontaneous hyperactivity of NMDA Nr1 ( neo - / - ) mice
O O O O O O O O B O O O B I I O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
.
O
In contrast , SSR103800 failed to affect hyperactivity induced by amphetamine or naturally observed in dopamine transporter ( DAT ( - / - ) ) knockout mice
O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
( 10 - 30 mg / kg p . o . ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Importantly , both classical ( haloperidol ) and atypical ( olanzapine , clozapine and aripiprazole ) antipsychotics were effective in all these models of hyperactivity .
O O O O O B O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
However , unlike these latter , SSR103800 did not produce catalepsy ( retention on the bar test ) up to 30 mg / kg p . o .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Together these findings show that the GlyT1 inhibitor , SSR103800 , produces antipsychotic - like effects , which differ from those observed with compounds primarily targeting the dopaminergic system ,
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and has a reduced side - effect potential as compared with these latter drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

B O O B O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : Vasopressor agents are used to correct anesthesia - induced hypotension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We describe the effect of phenylephrine and ephedrine on frontal lobe oxygenation ( S ( c ) O ( 2 ) ) following anesthesia - induced hypotension .

O O

.
O

( 2 ) ) were registered .

O O
Induction of anesthesia was followed by a decrease in MAP , HR , SV , and CO concomitant with an elevation in S ( c ) O ( 2 )

.
O
After administration of phenylephrine , MAP increased ( 51 + / -
O O O B O O O O O O O O
12 to 81 + / -
O O O O O O
13 mmHg ; P < 0 . 001 ; mean + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
SD ) .
O O O
However , a 14 % ( from 70 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O
8 % to 60 + / -
O O O O O O O
7 % ) reduction in S ( c ) O ( 2 )

O O
The utilization of phenylephrine to correct hypotension induced by anesthesia has a negative impact on S ( c ) O ( 2 ) while ephedrine maintains frontal lobe oxygenation potentially
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
related to an increase in CO .
O O O O O O O
A novel , multiple symptom model of obsessive - compulsive - like behaviors in animals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Current animal models of obsessive - compulsive disorder ( OCD ) typically involve acute , drug - induced symptom provocation or a genetic association with stereotypies or anxiety .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
None of these current models demonstrate multiple OCD - like behaviors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Neonatal rats were treated with the tricyclic antidepressant clomipramine or vehicle between days 9 and 16 twice daily and behaviorally tested in adulthood .
O O O O O O O B B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Clomipramine exposure in immature rats produced significant behavioral and biochemical changes that include enhanced anxiety ( elevated plus maze and marble burying ) , behavioral inflexibility ( perseveration in the
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
spontaneous alternation task and impaired reversal learning ) , working memory impairment ( e . g . , win - shift paradigm ) , hoarding , and corticostriatal dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dopamine D2 receptors were elevated in the striatum , whereas serotonin 2C , but not serotonin 1A , receptors were elevated in the orbital frontal cortex .
B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
This is the first demonstration of multiple symptoms consistent with an OCD - like profile in animals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Moreover , these behaviors are accompanied by biochemical changes in brain regions previously identified as relevant to OCD .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This novel model of OCD demonstrates that drug exposure during a sensitive period can program disease - like systems permanently , which could have implications for current and future therapeutic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
strategies for this and other psychiatric disorders .
O O O O O O O O
Late recovery of renal function in a woman with the hemolytic uremic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A case is reported of the hemolytic uremic syndrome ( HUS ) in a woman taking oral contraceptives .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
She was treated with heparin , dipyridamole and hemodialysis ; and after more than three months , her urinary output rose above 500 ml ; and six months after the
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
onset of anuria , dialysis treatment was stopped .
O O O O O O O O O
This case emphasizes the possibility that HUS in adults is not invariably irreversible and that , despite prolonged oliguria , recovery of renal function can be obtained .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , in adult patients affected by HUS , dialysis should not be discontinued prematurely ; moreover , bilateral nephrectomy , for treatment of severe hypertension and microangiopathic hemolytic anemia
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, should be performed with caution .
O O O O O O O
Effects of acetylsalicylic acid , dipyridamole , and hydrocortisone on epinephrine - induced myocardial injury in dogs .

A reproducible model for producing diffuse myocardial injury ( epinephrine infusion ) has been developed to study the cardioprotective effects of agents or maneuvers which might alter the evolution of

O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
showing the most consistent changes when compared to saline - infused control animals ( 4 , 957 vs . 827 counts per minute per gram of dried tissue or fraction
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O

of fat - free dry weight ) .
O O O O O O O O
Infusions of calcium chloride sufficient to raise serum calcium concentrations 2 mEq .
O O B I O O O O B O O O O
per liter failed to increase calcium influx into the myocardial cell .
O O O O O B O O O O O O
Mitochondrial radiocalcium uptakes were significantly decreased in animals pretreated with acetylsalicylic acid or dipyridamole or when hydrocortisone was added to the epinephrine infusion ( 2 , 682 , 2 ,
O B O O O O O O O O B I O B O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O
803 , and 3 , 424 counts per minute per gram of dried fraction , respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Myocardial calcium concentrations also were decreased ( 11 . 2 , 8 . 3 , and 8 . 9 mg .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
per 100 Gm .
O O O O
of fat - free dry weight , respectively ) in the three treatment groups , being significantly decreased only in the last two .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Evidence of microscopic damage was graded as less severe in the three treatment groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acetylsalicylic acid , dipyridamole , and hydrocortisone all appear to have cardioprotective effects when tested in this model .
B I O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Changes in depressive status associated with topical beta - blockers .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Depression and sexual dysfunction have been related to side effects of topical beta - blockers .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We performed a preliminary study in order to determine any difference between a non selective beta - blocker ( timolol ) and a selective beta - blocker ( betaxolol )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O
regarding CNS side effects .
O O O O O
Eight glaucomatous patients chronically treated with timolol 0 . 5 % / 12h , suffering from depression diagnosed through DMS - III - R criteria , were included in the
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
study .
O O
During the six - month follow up , depression was quantified through the Beck and Zung - Conde scales every two months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In a double blind cross - over study with control group , the patients under timolol treatment presented higher depression values measured through the Beck and the Zung - Conde
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
scales ( p < 0 . 001 vs control ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that betaxolol could be less of a depression - inducer than timolol in predisposed patients .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Long - term follow - up of ifosfamide renal toxicity in children treated for malignant mesenchymal tumors : an International Society of Pediatric Oncology report .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The renal function of 74 children with malignant mesenchymal tumors in complete remission and who have received the same ifosfamide chemotherapy protocol ( International Society of Pediatric Oncology Malignant Mesenchymal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Tumor Study 84 [ SIOP MMT 84 ] ) were studied 1 year after the completion of treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Total cumulative doses were 36 or 60 g / m2 of ifosfamide ( six or 10 cycles of ifosfamide , vincristine , and dactinomycin [ IVA ] ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B I I I I I O B O O O
None of them had received cisplatin chemotherapy .
O O O O O B O O
Ages ranged from 4 months to 17 years ; 58 patients were males and 42 females .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The most common primary tumor site was the head and neck .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal function was investigated by measuring plasma and urinary electrolytes , glucosuria , proteinuria , aminoaciduria , urinary pH , osmolarity , creatinine clearance , phosphate tubular reabsorption , beta
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O
2 microglobulinuria , and lysozymuria .
O O O O O O
Fifty - eight patients ( 78 % ) had normal renal tests , whereas 16 patients ( 22 % ) had renal abnormalities .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two subsets of patients were identified from this latter group : the first included four patients ( 5 % of the total population ) who developed major toxicity resulting in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fanconi 's syndrome ( TDFS ) ; and the second group included five patients with elevated beta 2 microglobulinuria and low phosphate reabsorption .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The remaining seven patients had isolated beta 2 microglobulinuria .
O O O O O O O O O O
Severe toxicity was correlated with the higher cumulative dose of 60 g / m2 of ifosfamide , a younger age ( less than 2 1 / 2 years old )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and a predominance of vesicoprostatic tumor involvement .
O O O O O O O O O
This low percentage ( 5 % ) of TDFS must be evaluated with respect to the efficacy of ifosfamide in the treatment of mesenchymal tumors in children .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Evidence for an involvement of D1 and D2 dopamine receptors in mediating nicotine - induced hyperactivity in rats .
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O
Previous studies have suggested that repeated exposure of rats to the drug or to the experimental environment is necessary to observe nicotine - induced locomotor stimulation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
In the present study the role of habituation to the experimental environment on the stimulant effect of nicotine in rats was examined .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
In addition , the role of dopamine receptors in mediating nicotine - induced locomotor stimulation was investigated by examining the effects of selective D1 and D2 dopamine receptor antagonists on
O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
activity induced by nicotine .
O O O B O
Locomotor activity was assessed in male Sprague - Dawley rats tested in photocell cages .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nicotine ( 1 . 0 mg / kg ) caused a significant increase in locomotor activity in rats that were habituated to the test environment , but had only a
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
weak and delayed stimulant action in rats that were unfamiliar with the test environment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The stimulant action of nicotine was blocked by the central nicotinic antagonist mecamylamine but not by the peripheral nicotinic blocker hexamethonium , indicating that the response is probably mediated by
O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
central nicotinic receptors .
O O O O
Nicotine - induced hyperactivity was blocked by the selective D1 antagonist SCH 23390 , the selective D2 antagonist raclopride and the D1 / D2 antagonist fluphenazine .
B O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O B O O O O O O B O
Pretreatment with the D2 agonist PHNO enhanced nicotine - induced hyperactivity , whereas the D1 agonist SKF 38393 had no effect .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
The results indicate that acute nicotine injection induces a pronounced hyperactivity in rats habituated to the test environment .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effect appears to be mediated by central nicotine receptors , possibly located on dopaminergic neurons , and also requires the activation of both D1 and D2 dopamine receptors .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Neuropsychiatric side effects after the use of mefloquine .
O O O O O O O B O
This study describes neuropsychiatric side effects in patients after treatment with mefloquine .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Reactions consisted mainly of seizures , acute psychoses , anxiety neurosis , and major disturbances of sleep - wake rhythm .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Side effects occurred after both therapeutic and prophylactic intake and were graded from moderate to severe .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In a risk analysis of neuropsychiatric side effects in Germany , it is estimated that one of 8 , 000 mefloquine users suffers from such reactions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The incidence calculation revealed that one of 215 therapeutic users had reactions , compared with one of 13 , 000 in the prophylaxis group , making the risk of neuropsychiatric
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
reactions after mefloquine treatment 60 times higher than after prophylaxis .
O O B O O O O O O O O
Therefore , certain limitations for malaria prophylaxis and treatment with mefloquine are recommended .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Reduction in injection pain using buffered lidocaine as a local anesthetic before cardiac catheterization .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Previous reports have suggested that pain associated with the injection of lidocaine is related to the acidic pH of the solution .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
To determine if the addition of a buffering solution to adjust the pH of lidocaine into the physiologic range would reduce pain during injection , we performed a blinded randomized
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
study in patients undergoing cardiac catheterization .
O O O O O O O
Twenty patients were asked to quantify the severity of pain after receiving standard lidocaine in one femoral area and buffered lidocaine in the opposite femoral area .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The mean pain score for buffered lidocaine was significantly lower than the mean score for standard lidocaine ( 2 . 7 + / -
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
1 . 9 vs . 3 . 8 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 2 , P = 0 . 03 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The pH adjustment of standard lidocaine can be accomplished easily in the catheterization laboratory before injection and results in a reduction of the pain occurring during the infiltration of tissues
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Randomized , double - blind trial of mazindol in Duchenne dystrophy .
O O O O O O O B O O O O
There is evidence that growth hormone may be related to the progression of weakness in Duchenne dystrophy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We conducted a 12 - month controlled trial of mazindol , a putative growth hormone secretion inhibitor , in 83 boys with Duchenne dystrophy .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Muscle strength , contractures , functional ability and pulmonary function were tested at baseline , and 6 and 12 months after treatment with mazindol ( 3 mg / d )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
or placebo .
O O O
The study was designed to have a power of greater than 0 . 90 to detect a slowing to 25 % of the expected rate of progression of weakness at
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
P less than 0 . 05 .
O O O O O O O
Mazindol did not benefit strength at any point in the study .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Side effects attributable to mazindol included decreased appetite ( 36 % ) , dry mouth ( 10 % ) , behavioral change ( 22 % ) , and gastrointestinal symptoms
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 18 % ) ; mazindol dosage was reduced in 43 % of patients .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The effect of mazindol on GH secretion was estimated indirectly by comparing the postabsorptive IGF - I levels obtained following 3 , 6 , 9 , and 12 months in
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the mazindol treated to those in the placebo groups .
O B O O O O O O O O
Although mazindol - treated patients gained less weight and height than placebo - treated patients , no significant effect on IGF - I levels was observed .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mazindol doses not slow the progression of weakness in Duchenne dystrophy .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Pentoxifylline ( Trental ) does not inhibit dipyridamole - induced coronary hyperemia : implications for dipyridamole - thallium - 201 myocardial imaging .
B O B O O O O B O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
Dipyridamole - thallium - 201 imaging is often performed in patients unable to exercise because of peripheral vascular disease .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Many of these patients are taking pentoxifylline ( Trental ) , a methylxanthine derivative which may improve intermittent claudication .
O O O O O O B O B O O O B O O O O O O O
Whether pentoxifylline inhibits dipyridamole - induced coronary hyperemia like other methylxanthines such as theophylline and should be stopped prior to dipyridamole - thallium - 201 imaging is unknown .
O B O B O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
Therefore , we studied the hyperemic response to dipyridamole in seven open - chest anesthetized dogs after pretreatment with either pentoxifylline ( 0 , 7 . 5 , or 15
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
mg / kg i . v . ) or theophylline ( 3 mg / kg i . v . ) .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Baseline circumflex coronary blood flows did not differ significantly among treatment groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dipyridamole significantly increased coronary blood flow before and after 7 . 5 or 15 mm / kg i . v .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pentoxifylline ( p less than 0 . 002 ) .
B O O O O O O O O O
Neither dose of pentoxifylline significantly decreased the dipyridamole - induced hyperemia , while peak coronary blood flow was significantly lower after theophylline ( p less than 0 . 01 )
O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
.
O
We conclude that pentoxyifylline does not inhibit dipyridamole - induced coronary hyperemia even at high doses .
O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Cause of death among patients with Parkinson 's disease : a rare mortality due to cerebral haemorrhage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Causes of death , with special reference to cerebral haemorrhage , among 240 patients with pathologically verified Parkinson 's disease were investigated using the Annuals of the Pathological Autopsy Cases
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in Japan from 1981 to 1985 .
O O O O O O O
The leading causes of death were pneumonia and bronchitis ( 44 . 1 % ) , malignant neoplasms ( 11 . 6 % ) , heart diseases ( 4 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 % ) , cerebral infarction ( 3 . 7 % ) and septicaemia ( 3 . 3 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cerebral haemorrhage was the 11th most frequent cause of death , accounting for only 0 . 8 % of deaths among the patients , whereas it was the 5th most
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
common cause of death among the Japanese general population in 1985 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The low incidence of cerebral haemorrhage as a cause of death in patients with Parkinson 's disease may reflect the hypotensive effect of levodopa and a hypotensive mechanism due to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
reduced noradrenaline levels in the parkinsonian brain .
O B O O O O O O
Tolerance and antiviral effect of ribavirin in patients with Argentine hemorrhagic fever .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Tolerance and antiviral effect of ribavirin was studied in 6 patients with Argentine hemorrhagic fever ( AHF ) of more than 8 days of evolution .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Administration of ribavirin resulted in a neutralization of viremia and a drop of endogenous interferon titers .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The average time of death was delayed .
O O O O O O O O
A reversible anemia was the only adverse effect observed .
O O O O O O O O O O
From these results , we conclude that ribavirin has an antiviral effect in advanced cases of AHF , and that anemia , the only secondary reaction observed , can be
