O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
easily managed .
O O O
The possible beneficial effect of ribavirin during the initial days of AHF is discussed .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Dipyridamole - induced myocardial ischemia .
B O O O O O
Angina and ischemic electrocardiographic changes occurred after administration of oral dipyridamole in four patients awaiting urgent myocardial revascularization procedures .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
To our knowledge , this has not previously been reported as a side effect of preoperative dipyridamole therapy , although dipyridamole - induced myocardial ischemia has been demonstrated to occur
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O
in animals and humans with coronary artery disease .
O O O O O O O O O
Epicardial coronary collateral vessels were demonstrated in all four patients ; a coronary """" steal """" phenomenon may be the mechanism of the dipyridamole - induced ischemia observed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Inhibition of immunoreactive corticotropin - releasing factor secretion into the hypophysial - portal circulation by delayed glucocorticoid feedback .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nitroprusside - induced hypotension evokes
B O O O O
ACTH secretion which is primarily mediated by enhanced secretion of immunoreactive corticotropin - releasing factor ( irCRF ) into the hypophysial - portal circulation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Portal plasma concentrations of neither arginine vasopressin nor oxytocin are significantly altered in this paradigm .
O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O
Application of a delayed feedback signal , in the form of a 2 - h systemic corticosterone infusion in urethane - anesthetized rats with pharmacological blockade of glucocorticoid synthesis ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O
is without effect on the resting secretion of arginine vasopressin and oxytocin at any corticosterone feedback dose tested .
O O O O O O O O B I O B O O B O O O O
Resting irCRF levels are suppressed only at the highest corticosterone infusion rate , which resulted in systemic corticosterone levels of 40 micrograms / dl .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Suppression of irCRF secretion in response to nitroprusside - induced hypotension is observed and occurs at a plasma corticosterone level between 8 - 12 micrograms / dl .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
These studies provide further evidence for a strong central component of the delayed feedback process which is mediated by modulation of irCRF release .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Noradrenergic involvement in catalepsy induced by delta 9 - tetrahydrocannabinol .
O O O O O O B I I I O
In order to elucidate the role of the catecholaminergic system in the cataleptogenic effect of delta 9 - tetrahydrocannabinol ( THC ) , the effect of pretreatment with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O B O O O O O O O
6 - hydroxydopamine ( 6 - OHDA ) or with desipramine and 6 - OHDA and lesions of the locus coeruleus were investigated in rats .
B I I O B I I O O O B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O
The cataleptogenic effect of THC was significantly reduced in rats treated with 6 - OHDA and in rats with lesions of the locus coeruleus but not in rats treated with
O O O O B O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
desipramine and 6 - OHDA , as compared with control rats .
B O B I I O O O O O O O
On the contrary , the cataleptogenic effect of haloperidol was significantly reduced in rats treated with desipramine and 6 - OHDA but not in rats treated with
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O O O O
6 - OHDA or in rats with lesions of the locus coeruleus .
B I I O O O O O O O O O O
These results indicate that noradrenergic neurons have an important role in the manifestation of catalepsy induced by THC , whereas dopaminergic neurons are important in catalepsy induced by haloperidol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
Intracranial pressure increases during alfentanil - induced rigidity .
O O O O B O O O O
Intracranial pressure ( ICP ) was measured during alfentanil - induced rigidity in rats .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Ten rats had arterial , central venous ( CVP ) , and subdural cannulae inserted under halothane anesthesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The animals were mechanically ventilated to achieve normocarbia ( PCO2 = 42 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 mmHg , mean + / -
O O O O O O O
SE ) .
O O O
Following instrumentation , halothane was discontinued and alfentanil ( 125 mu / kg ) administered iv during emergence from halothane anesthesia .
O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
In the five rats that developed somatic rigidity , ICP and CVP increased significantly above baseline ( delta ICP 7 . 5 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 . 0 mmHg , delta CVP 5 . 9 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 . 3 mmHg ) .
O O O O O O
These variables returned to baseline when rigidity was abolished with metocurine .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
In five rats that did not become rigid , ICP and CVP did not change following alfentanil .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
These observations suggest that rigidity should be prevented when alfentanil , and , presumably , other opiates , are used in the anesthetic management of patients with ICP problems .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adverse cardiac effects during induction chemotherapy treatment with cis - platin and 5 - fluorouracil .
O O O O O O O O B I I O B I I O
Survival for patients with advanced head and neck carcinoma and esophageal carcinoma is poor with radiotherapy and / or surgery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Obviously , there is a need for effective chemotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O
In the present study , cis - platin ( 80 - 120 mg / m2BSA ) and 5 - FU ( 1000 mg / m2BSA daily as a continuous infusion
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
during 5 days ) were given to 76 patients before radiotherapy and surgery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aim of the study was to clarify the incidence and severity of adverse cardiac effects to this treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Before treatment all patients had a cardiac evaluation and during treatment serial ECG recordings were performed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the pre - treatment evaluation , signs of cardiovascular disease were found in 33 patients ( 43 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
During treatment , adverse cardiac effects were observed in 14 patients ( 18 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean age of these patients was the same as for the entire group , 64 years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of cardiotoxicity was not higher in patients with signs of cardiovascular disease than in those without in the pre - treatment evaluation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The most common signs of cardiotoxicity were chest pain , ST - T wave changes and atrial fibrillation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This was followed by ventricular fibrillation in one patient and sudden death in another .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is concluded that patients on 5 - FU treatment should be under close supervision and that the treatment should be discontinued if chest pain or tachyarrhythmia is observed .
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Verapamil - induced carbamazepine neurotoxicity .
B O O B O O
A report of two cases .
O O O O O O
Two patients with signs of carbamazepine neurotoxicity after combined treatment with verapamil showed complete recovery after discontinuation of the calcium entry blocker .
O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O
Use of verapamil in combination with carbamazepine should either be avoided or prescribed only with appropriate adjustment of the carbamazepine dose ( usually reduction of the carbamazepine dose by one
O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O
half ) .
O O O
Serial studies of auditory neurotoxicity in patients receiving deferoxamine therapy .
O O O O O O O O B O O
Visual and auditory neurotoxicity was previously documented in 42 of 89 patients with transfusion - dependent anemia who were receiving iron chelation therapy with daily subcutaneous deferoxamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O
Twenty - two patients in the affected group had abnormal audiograms with deficits mostly in the high frequency range of 4 , 000 to 8 , 000 Hz and in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the hearing threshold levels of 30 to 100 decibels .
O O O O O O O O O O
When deferoxamine therapy was discontinued and serial studies were performed , audiograms in seven cases reverted to normal or near normal within two to three weeks , and nine of
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
13 patients with symptoms became asymptomatic .
O O O O O O O
Audiograms from 15 patients remained abnormal and four patients required hearing aids because of permanent disability .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Since 18 of the 22 patients were initially receiving deferoxamine doses in excess of the commonly recommended 50 mg / kg per dose , therapy was restarted with lower doses
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, usually 50 mg / kg per dose or less depending on the degree of auditory abnormality , and with the exception of two cases no further toxicity was demonstrated
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Auditory deterioration and improvement , demonstrated serially in individual patients receiving and not receiving deferoxamine , respectively , provided convincing evidence for a cause - and - effect relation between
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
deferoxamine administration and ototoxicity .
B O O O O
Based on these data , a plan of management was developed that allows effective yet safe administration of deferoxamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
A dose of 50 mg / kg is recommended in those without audiogram abnormalities .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
With mild toxicity , a reduction to 30 or 40 mg / kg per dose should result in a reversal of the abnormal results to normal within four weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Moderate abnormalities require a reduction of deferoxamine to 25 mg / kg per dose with careful monitoring .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In those with symptoms of hearing loss , the drug should be stopped for four weeks , and when the audiogram is stable or improved , therapy should be restarted
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
at 10 to 25 mg / kg per dose .
O O O O O O O O O O
Serial audiograms should be performed every six months in those without problems and more frequently in young patients with normal serum ferritin values and in those with auditory dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Flurbiprofen in the treatment of juvenile rheumatoid arthritis .
B O O O O O O O O
Thirty - four patients with juvenile rheumatoid arthritis , who were treated with flurbiprofen at a maximum dose of 4 mg / kg / day , had statistically significant decreases
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
from baseline in 6 arthritis indices after 12 weeks of treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Improvements were seen in the number of tender joints , the severity of swelling and tenderness , the time of walk 50 feet , the duration of morning stiffness and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the circumference of the left knee .
O O O O O O O
The most frequently observed side effect was fecal occult blood ( 25 % of patients ) ; however , there was no other evidence of gastrointestinal ( GI ) bleeding
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in these patients .
O O O O
One patient was prematurely discontinued from the study for severe headache and abdominal pain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Most side effects were mild and related to the GI tract .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The correlation between neurotoxic esterase inhibition and mipafox - induced neuropathic damage in rats .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The correlation between neuropathic damage and inhibition of neurotoxic esterase or neuropathy target enzyme ( NTE ) was examined in rats acutely exposed to Mipafox (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
N , N' - diisopropylphosphorodiamidofluoridate ) , a neurotoxic organophosphate .
B I I I I O O O O B O
Brain and spinal cord NTE activities were measured in Long - Evans male rats 1 hr post - exposure to various dosages of Mipafox ( ip , 1 - 15
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
mg / kg ) .
O O O O O
These data were correlated with histologically scored cervical cord damage in a separate group of similarly dosed rats sampled 14 - 21 days post - exposure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Those dosages ( greater than or equal to 10 mg / kg ) that inhibited mean NTE activity in the spinal cord greater than or equal to 73 % and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
brain greater than or equal to 67 % of control values produced severe ( greater than or equal to 3 ) cervical cord pathology in 85 % of the rats
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
In contrast , dosages of Mipafox ( less than or equal to 5 mg / kg ) which inhibited mean NTE activity in spinal cord less than or equal to
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
61 % and brain less than or equal to 60 % produced this degree of cord damage in only 9 % of the animals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These data indicate that a critical percentage of NTE inhibition in brain and spinal cord sampled shortly after Mipafox exposure can predict neuropathic damage in rats several weeks later .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Cerebral infarction with a single oral dose of phenylpropanolamine .
O O O O O O O O B O
Phenylpropanolamine ( PPA ) , a synthetic sympathomimetic that is structurally similar to amphetamine , is available over the counter in anorectics , nasal congestants , and cold preparations .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Its prolonged use or overuse has been associated with seizures , intracerebral hemorrhage , neuropsychiatric symptoms , and nonhemorrhagic cerebral infarction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report the case of a young woman who suffered a cerebral infarction after taking a single oral dose of PPA .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Treatment of psoriasis with azathioprine .
O O O O B O
Azathioprine treatment benefited 19 ( 66 % ) out of 29 patients suffering from severe psoriasis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Haematological complications were not troublesome and results of biochemical liver function tests remained normal .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Minimal cholestasis was seen in two cases and portal fibrosis of a reversible degree in eight .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Liver biopsies should be undertaken at regular intervals if azathioprine therapy is continued so that structural liver damage may be detected at an early and reversible stage .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Maternal lithium and neonatal
O B O O
Ebstein 's anomaly : evaluation with cross - sectional echocardiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Cross - sectional echocardiography was used to evaluate two neonates whose mothers ingested lithium during pregnancy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
In one infant , Ebstein 's anomaly of the tricuspid valve was identified .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the other infant cross - sectional echocardiography provided reassurance that the infant did not have Ebstein 's anomaly .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cross - sectional echocardiographic screening of newborns exposed to lithium during gestation can provide highly accurate , noninvasive assessment of the presence or absence of lithium - induced cardiac malformations
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
.
O
Effects of training on the extent of experimental myocardial infarction in aging rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effects of exercise on the severity of isoproterenol - induced myocardial infarction were studied in female albino rats of 20 , 40 , 60 and 80 weeks of age
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The rats were trained to swim for a specific duration and for a particular period .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The occurrence of infarcts were confirmed by histological methods .
O O O O O O O O O O
Elevations in the serum GOT and GPT were maximum in the sedentary - isoproterenols and minimum in the exercise - controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
These changes in the serum transaminases were associated with corresponding depletions in the cardiac GOT and GPT .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , age was seen to interfere with the responses exhibited by the young and old rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Studies dealing with myocardial infarction are more informative when dealt with age .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of polyethylene glycol 400 on adriamycin toxicity in mice .
O O B I I O B O O O O
The effect of a widely used organic solvent , polyethylene glycol 400 ( PEG 400 ) , on the toxic action of an acute or chronic treatment with adriamycin (
O O O O O O O O O B I I O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
ADR ) was evaluated in mice .
B O O O O O O
PEG 400 impressively decreased both acute high - dose and chronic low - dose - ADR - associated lethality .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Light microscopic analysis showed a significant protection against ADR - induced cardiac morphological alterations .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Such treatment did not diminish the ADR antitumor activity in L1210 leukemia and in Ehrlich ascites tumor .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Intra - arterial BCNU chemotherapy for treatment of malignant gliomas of the central nervous system .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because of the rapid systemic clearance of BCNU ( 1 , 3 - bis - ( 2 - chloroethyl ) - 1 - nitrosourea ) , intra - arterial administration
O O O O O O O B O B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O O O
should provide a substantial advantage over intravenous administration for the treatment of malignant gliomas .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thirty - six patients were treated with BCNU every 6 to 8 weeks , either by transfemoral catheterization of the internal carotid or vertebral artery or through a fully implantable
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
intracarotid drug delivery system , beginning with a dose of 200 mg / sq m body surface area .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Twelve patients with Grade III or IV astrocytomas were treated after partial resection of the tumor without prior radiation therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After two to seven cycles of chemotherapy , nine patients showed a decrease in tumor size and surrounding edema on contrast - enhanced computerized tomography scans .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the nine responders , median duration of chemotherapy response from the time of operation was 25 weeks ( range 12 to more than 91 weeks ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The median duration of survival in the 12 patients was 54 weeks ( range 21 to more than 156 weeks ) , with an 18 - month survival rate of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
42 % .
O O O
Twenty - four patients with recurrent Grade
O O O O O O O
I to IV astrocytomas , whose resection and irradiation therapy had failed , received two to eight courses of intra - arterial BCNU therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Seventeen of these had a response or were stable for a median of 20 weeks ( range 6 to more than 66 weeks ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The catheterization procedure is safe , with no immediate complication in 111 infusions of BCNU .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
A delayed complication in nine patients has been unilateral loss of vision secondary to a retinal vasculitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The frequency of visual loss decreased after the concentration of the ethanol diluent was lowered .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Blood pressure response to chronic low - dose intrarenal noradrenaline infusion in conscious rats .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Sodium chloride solution ( 0 . 9 % ) or noradrenaline in doses of 4 , 12 and 36 micrograms h - 1 kg - 1 was infused for five
B I O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
consecutive days , either intrarenally ( by a new technique ) or intravenously into rats with one kidney removed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intrarenal infusion of noradrenaline caused hypertension at doses which did not do so when infused intravenously .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intrarenal compared with intravenous infusion of noradrenaline caused higher plasma noradrenaline concentrations and a shift of the plasma noradrenaline concentration - blood pressure effect curve towards lower plasma noradrenaline levels
O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O
.
O
These results suggest that hypertension after chronic intrarenal noradrenaline infusion is produced by relatively higher levels of circulating noradrenaline and by triggering of an additional intrarenal pressor mechanism .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Age and renal clearance of cimetidine .
O O O O O B O
In 35 patients ( ages 20 to 86 yr ) receiving cimetidine therapeutically two serum samples and all urine formed in the interim were collected for analysis of cimetidine by
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
high - pressure liquid chromatography and for creatinine .
O O O O O O O B O
Cimetidine clearance decreased with age .
B O O O O O
The extrapolated 6 - hr serum concentration of cimetidine per unit dose , after intravenous cimetidine , increased with age of the patients .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The ratio of cimetidine clearance to creatinine clearance ( Rc ) averaged 4 . 8 + / -
O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 0 , indicating net tubular secretion for cimetidine .
O O O O O O O O O B O
Rc seemed to be independent of age and decreased with increasing serum concentration of cimetidine , suggesting that secretion of cimetidine is a saturable process .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O
There was only one case of dementia possibly due to cimetidine ( with a drug level of 1 . 9 microgram / ml 6 hr after a dose ) in
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a group of 13 patients without liver or kidney disease who had cimetidine levels above 1 . 25 microgram / ml .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Thus , high cimetidine levels alone do not always induce dementia .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
Development of clear cell adenocarcinoma in DES - exposed offspring under observation .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Two cases of clear cell adenocarcinoma of the vagina detected at follow - up in young women exposed in utero to diethylstilbestrol are reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
One patient , aged 23 , had been followed for 2 years before carcinoma was diagnosed ; the second patient , aged 22 , had been seen on a regular
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
basis for 5 years , 8 months .
O O O O O O O O
In both instances , suspicion of the presence of carcinoma was aroused by the palpation of a small nodule in the vaginal fornix .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hysterosalpingography was performed on both patients and , in 1 instance , an abnormal x - ray film was reflected by the gross appearance of the uterine cavity found in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the surgical specimen .
O O O O
Phenobarbitone - induced enlargement of the liver in the rat : its relationship to carbon tetrachloride - induced cirrhosis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
The yield of severe cirrhosis of the liver ( defined as a shrunken finely nodular liver with micronodular histology , ascites greater than 30 ml , plasma albumin less than
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 2 g / dl , splenomegaly 2 - 3 times normal , and testicular atrophy approximately half normal weight ) after 12 doses of carbon tetrachloride given intragastrically
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
in the phenobarbitone - primed rat was increased from 25 % to 56 % by giving the initial """" calibrating """" dose of carbon tetrachloride at the peak of the
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
phenobarbitone - induced enlargement of the liver .
B O O O O O O O
At this point it was assumed that the cytochrome P450 / CCl4 toxic state was both maximal and stable .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The optimal rat size to begin phenobarbitone was determined as 100 g , and this size as a group had a mean maximum relative liver weight increase 47 % greater
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
than normal rats of the same body weight .
O O O O O O O O O
The optimal time for the initial dose of carbon tetrachloride was after 14 days on phenobarbitone .
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O B O
Attenuation of the lithium - induced diabetes - insipidus - like syndrome by amiloride in rats .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O
The effect of amiloride on lithium - induced polydipsia and polyuria and on the lithium concentration in the plasma , brain , kidney , thyroid and red blood cells was
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
investigated in rats , chronically treated with LiCl .
O O O O O O O B O
Amiloride reduced the drinking and urine volume of rats in an acute ( 6 or 12 h ) and a subacute ( 3 days ) experiment .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
6 h after the administration of amiloride , a reduction was observed in the lithium content of the renal medulla but not in the other organs studied .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At 12 h , all the tissues showed a slight increase in lithium levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
After 3 days of combined treatment , a marked elevation in plasma and tissue lithium levels accompanied a reduction in water intake .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
In all the experiments , the attenuation of the lithium - induced diabetes - insipidus - like syndrome by amiloride was accompanied by a reduction of the ratio between the
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
lithium concentration in the renal medulla and its levels in the blood and an elevation in the plasma potassium level .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
It is concluded that acute amiloride administration to lithium - treated patients suffering from polydipsia and polyuria might relieve these patients but prolonged amiloride supplementation would result in elevated
O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
lithium levels and might be hazardous .
B O O O O O O
Safety and side - effects of alprazolam .
O O O O O O B O
Controlled study in agoraphobia with panic disorder .
O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
The widespread use of benzodiazepines has led to increasing recognition of their unwanted effects .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The efficacy of alprazolam and placebo in panic disorder with agoraphobia , and the side - effect and adverse effect profiles of both drug groups were measured .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHOD :
O O
In London and Toronto 154 patients who met DSM - III criteria for panic disorder with agoraphobia were randomised to alprazolam or placebo .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Subjects in each drug group also received either exposure or relaxation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment was from weeks 0 to 8 and was then tapered from weeks 8 to 16 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Mean alprazolam dose was 5 mg daily .
O B O O O O O O
Compared with placebo subjects , alprazolam patients developed more adverse reactions ( 21 % v . 0 % ) of depression , enuresis , disinhibition and aggression ; and more
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
side - effects , particularly sedation , irritability , impaired memory , weight loss and ataxia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Side - effects tended to diminish during treatment but remained significant at week 8 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Despite this , the drop - out rate was low .
O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Alprazolam caused side - effects and adverse effects during treatment but many patients were willing to accept these .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dup 753 prevents the development of puromycin aminonucleoside - induced nephrosis .
B I O O O O B I O O O O
The appearance of nephrotic syndromes such as proteinuria , hypoalbuminemia , hypercholesterolemia and increase in blood nitrogen urea , induced in rats by injection of puromycin aminonucleoside was markedly inhibited
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O B I O O O
by oral administration of Dup 753 ( losartan ) , a novel angiotensin II receptor antagonist , at a dose of 1 or 2 mg / kg per day .
O O O O B I O B O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results suggest a possible involvement of the renin - angiotensin system in the development of puromycin aminonucleoside - induced nephrosis .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B I O O O O
Sodium bicarbonate alleviates penile pain induced by intracavernous injections for erectile dysfunction .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O
In an attempt to determine whether penile pain associated with intracorporeal injections could be due to the acidity of the medication , we performed a randomized study comparing the incidence
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of penile pain following intracorporeal injections with or without the addition of sodium bicarbonate to the intracorporeal medications .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
A total of 38 consecutive patients who presented to our clinic with impotence received 0 . 2 ml .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of a combination of 3 drugs : 6 mg . papaverine , 100 micrograms .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
phentolamine and 10 micrograms .
B O O O O
prostaglandin E1 with ( pH 7 . 05 ) or without ( pH 4 . 17 )
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the addition of sodium bicarbonate ( 0 . 03 mEq . )
O O O B I O O O O O O O
.
O
Of the 19 patients without sodium bicarbonate added to the medication 11 ( 58 % ) complained of penile pain due to the medication , while only 1 of the
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
19 men ( 5 % ) who received sodium bicarbonate complained of penile pain .
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
From these data we conclude that the penile pain following intracorporeal injections is most likely due to the acidity of the medication , which can be overcome by elevating the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pH to a neutral level .
O O O O O O
Prospective study of the long - term effects of somatostatin analog ( octreotide ) on gallbladder function and gallstone formation in Chinese acromegalic patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
This article reports the changes in gallbladder function examined by ultrasonography in 20 Chinese patients with active acromegaly treated with sc injection of the somatostatin analog octreotide in dosages of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
300 - 1500 micrograms / day for a mean of 24 . 2 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
13 . 9 months .
O O O O O
During treatment with octreotide , 17 patients developed sludge , 10 had gallstones , and 1 developed acute cholecystitis requiring surgery .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In all of 7 patients examined acutely , gallbladder contractility was inhibited after a single 100 - micrograms injection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 8 patients followed for 24 weeks , gallbladder contractility remained depressed throughout therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After withdrawal of octreotide in 10 patients without gallstones , 8 patients assessed had return of normal gallbladder contractility within 1 month .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 8 of the remaining 10 patients who developed gallstones during treatment , gallbladder contractility normalized in 5 patients ( 3 of whom has disappearance of their stones within 3
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
weeks ) , and remained depressed in 3 ( 2 of whom had stones present at 6 months ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our results suggest that the suppression of gallbladder contractility is the cause of the successive formation of bile sludge , gallstones , and cholecystitis during octreotide therapy in Chinese acromegalic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
patients .
O O
It is therefore very important to follow the changes of gallbladder function during long - term octreotide therapy of acromegalic patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Improvement of levodopa - induced dyskinesia by propranolol in Parkinson 's disease .
O O B O O O O B O O O O O
Seven patients suffering from Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) with severely disabling dyskinesia received low - dose propranolol as an adjunct to the currently used medical treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
There was a significant 40 % improvement in the dyskinesia score without increase of parkinsonian motor disability .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ballistic and choreic dyskinesia were markedly ameliorated , whereas dystonia was not .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This study suggests that administration of low doses of beta - blockers may improve levodopa - induced ballistic and choreic dyskinesia in PD .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Morphological features of encephalopathy after chronic administration of the antiepileptic drug valproate to rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
A transmission electron microscopic study of capillaries in the cerebellar cortex .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Long - term intragastric application of the antiepileptic drug sodium valproate ( Vupral """" Polfa """" ) at the effective dose of 200 mg / kg b .
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
w . once daily to rats for 1 , 3 , 6 , 9 and 12 months revealed neurological disorders indicating cerebellum damage ( """" valproate encephalopathy """" ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The first ultrastructural changes in structural elements of the blood - brain - barrier ( BBB ) in the cerebellar cortex were detectable after 3 months of the experiment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
They became more severe in the later months of the experiment , and were most severe after 12 months , located mainly in the molecular layer of the cerebellar cortex
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Lesions of the capillary included necrosis of endothelial cells .
O O O O O O O O O O
Organelles of these cells , in particular the mitochondria ( increased number and size , distinct degeneration of their matrix and cristae ) and Golgi apparatus were altered .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reduced size of capillary lumen and occlusion were caused by swollen endothelial cells which had luminal protrusions and swollen microvilli .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Pressure on the vessel wall was produced by enlarged perivascular astrocytic processes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fragments of necrotic endothelial cells were in the vascular lumens and in these there was loosening and breaking of tight cellular junctions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Damage to the vascular basement lamina was also observed .
O O O O O O O O O O
Damage to the capillary was accompanied by marked damage to neuroglial cells , mainly to perivascular processes of astrocytes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The proliferation of astrocytes ( Bergmann 's in particular ) and occasionally of oligodendrocytes was found .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Alterations in the structural elements of the BBB coexisted with marked lesions of neurons of the cerebellum ( Purkinje cells are earliest ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In electron micrographs both luminal and antiluminal sides of the BBB of the cerebellar cortex had similar lesions .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The possible influence of the hepatic damage , mainly hyperammonemia , upon the development of valproate encephalopathy is discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Macula toxicity after intravitreal amikacin .
O O O O B O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Although intravitreal aminoglycosides have substantially improved visual prognosis in endophthalmitis , macular infarction may impair full visual recovery .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We present a case of presumed amikacin retinal toxicity following treatment with amikacin and vancomycin for alpha - haemolytic streptococcal endophthalmitis .
O O O O O O B O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Endophthalmitis resolved with improvement in visual acuity to 6 / 24 at three months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fundus fluorescein angiography confirmed macular capillary closure and telangiectasis .
O B O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Currently accepted intravitreal antibiotic regimens may cause retinal toxicity and macular ischaemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment strategies aimed at avoiding retinal toxicity are discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O
Iatrogenically induced intractable atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia after verapamil and catheter ablation in a patient with Wolff - Parkinson - White syndrome and idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In a patient with WPW syndrome and idiopathic dilated cardiomyopathy , intractable atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia ( AVRT ) was iatrogenically induced .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
QRS without preexcitation , caused by junctional escape beats after verapamil or unidirectional antegrade block of accessory pathway after catheter ablation , established frequent AVRT attack .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Epidemic of liver disease caused by hydrochlorofluorocarbons used as ozone - sparing substitutes of chlorofluorocarbons .
O O O O O O B O O B O O O O B O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Hydrochlorofluorocarbons ( HCFCs ) are used increasingly in industry as substitutes for ozone - depleting chlorofluorocarbons ( CFCs ) .
B O B O O O O O O O O O B O O B O B O O
Limited studies in animals indicate potential hepatotoxicity of some of these compounds .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We investigated an epidemic of liver disease in nine industrial workers who had had repeated accidental exposure to a mixture of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 , 1 - dichloro - 2 , 2 , 2 - trifluoroethane ( HCFC 123 ) and
B I I I I I I I I I I I I O B I O O
1 - chloro - 1 , 2 , 2 , 2 - tetrafluoroethane ( HCFC 124 ) .
B I I I I I I I I I I I I O B I O O
All nine exposed workers were affected to various degrees .
O O O O O O O O O O
Both compounds are metabolised in the same way as 1 - bromo - 1 - chloro - 2 , 2 , 2 - trifluoroethane ( halothane ) to form reactive
O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O B O O O O
trifluoroacetyl halide intermediates , which have been implicated in the hepatotoxicity of halothane .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
We aimed to test whether HCFCs 123 and 124 can result in serious liver disease .
O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
For one severely affected worker liver biopsy and immunohistochemical stainings for the presence of trifluoroacetyl protein adducts were done .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
The serum of six affected workers and five controls was tested for autoantibodies that react with human liver cytochrome - P450 2E1 ( P450 2E1 ) and P58 protein disulphide
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
isomerase isoform ( P58 ) .
O O O O O O
FINDINGS :
O O
The liver biopsy sample showed hepatocellular necrosis which was prominent in perivenular zone three and extended focally from portal tracts to portal tracts and centrilobular areas ( bridging necrosis )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Trifluoroacetyl - adducted proteins were detected in surviving hepatocytes .
B O O O O O O O O O
Autoantibodies against P450 2E1 or P58 , previously associated with halothane hepatitis , were detected in the serum of five affected workers .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
INTERPRETATION :
O O
Repeated exposure of human beings to HCFCs 123 and 124 can result in serious liver injury in a large proportion of the exposed population .
O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although the exact mechanism of hepatotoxicity of these agents is not known , the results suggest that trifluoroacetyl - altered liver proteins are involved .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
In view of the potentially widespread use of these compounds , there is an urgent need to develop safer alternatives .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effect of different anaesthetic agents in hearing loss following spinal anaesthesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The cause of hearing loss after spinal anaesthesia is unknown .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Up until now , the only factor studied has been the effect of the diameter of the spinal needle on post - operative sensorineural hearing loss .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aim of this study was to describe this hearing loss and to investigate other factors influencing the degree of hearing loss .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two groups of 22 similar patients were studied : one group received 6 mL prilocaine 2 % ; and the other received 3 mL bupivacaine 0 . 5 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Patients given prilocaine were more likely to develop hearing loss ( 10 out of 22 ) than those given bupivacaine ( 4 out of 22 ) ( P < 0
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
. 05 ) .
O O O O
The average hearing loss for speech frequencies was about 10 dB after prilocaine and 15 dB after bupivacaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
None of the patients complained of subjective hearing loss .
O O O O O O O O O O
Long - term follow - up of the patients was not possible .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A transient neurological deficit following intrathecal injection of 1 % hyperbaric bupivacaine for unilateral spinal anaesthesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
We describe a case of transient neurological deficit that occurred after unilateral spinal anaesthesia with 8 mg of 1 % hyperbaric bupivacaine slowly injected through a 25 - gauge pencil
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
- point spinal needle .
O O O O O
The surgery and anaesthesia were uneventful , but 3 days after surgery , the patient reported an area of hypoaesthesia over L3 - L4 dermatomes of the leg which had
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
been operated on ( loss of pinprick sensation ) without reduction in muscular strength .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sensation in this area returned to normal over the following 2 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prospective multicentre studies with a large population and a long follow - up should be performed in order to evaluate the incidence of this unusual side effect .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , we suggest that a low solution concentration should be preferred for unilateral spinal anaesthesia with a hyperbaric anaesthetic solution ( if pencil - point needle and slow injection
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rate are employed ) , in order to minimize the risk of a localized high peak anaesthetic concentration , which might lead to a transient neurological deficit .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pethidine - associated seizure in a healthy adolescent receiving pethidine for postoperative pain control .
B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
A healthy 17 - year - old male received standard intermittent doses of pethidine via a patient - controlled analgesia ( PCA ) pump for management of postoperative pain control
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Twenty - three h postoperatively he developed a brief self - limited seizure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both plasma pethidine and norpethidine were elevated in the range associated with clinical manifestations of central nervous system excitation .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No other risk factors for CNS toxicity were identified .
O O O O O O O O O O
This method allowed frequent self - dosing of pethidine at short time intervals and rapid accumulation of pethidine and norpethidine .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O B O
The routine use of pethidine via PCA even for a brief postoperative analgesia should be reconsidered .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Drug - associated acute - onset vanishing bile duct and Stevens - Johnson syndromes in a child .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute vanishing bile duct syndrome is a rare but established cause of progressive cholestasis in adults , is most often drug or toxin related , and is of unknown pathogenesis
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
It has not been reported previously in children .
O O O O O O O O O
Stevens - Johnson syndrome is a well - recognized immune complex - mediated hypersensitivity reaction that affects all age groups , is drug or infection induced , and has classic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
systemic , mucosal , and dermatologic manifestations .
O O O O O O O O
A previously healthy child who developed acute , severe , rapidly progressive vanishing bile duct syndrome shortly after Stevens - Johnson syndrome is described ; this was temporally associated with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ibuprofen use .
B O O
Despite therapy with ursodeoxycholic acid , prednisone , and then tacrolimus , her cholestatic disease was unrelenting , with cirrhosis shown by biopsy 6 months after presentation .
O O O B I O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This case documents acute drug - related vanishing bile duct syndrome in the pediatric age group and suggests shared immune mechanisms in the pathogenesis of both Stevens - Johnson syndrome
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and vanishing bile duct syndrome .
O O O O O O
High incidence of primary pulmonary hypertension associated with appetite suppressants in Belgium .
O O O O O O O O B I O O O
Primary pulmonary hypertension is a rare , progressive and incurable disease , which has been associated with the intake of appetite suppressant drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
The importance of this association was evaluated in Belgium while this country still had no restriction on the prescription of appetite suppressants .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Thirty - five patients with primary pulmonary hypertension and 85 matched controls were recruited over 32 months ( 1992 - 1994 ) in Belgium .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Exposure to appetite - suppressants was assessed on the basis of hospital records and standardized interview .
O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O
Twenty - three of the patients had previously taken appetite suppressants , mainly fenfluramines , as compared with only 5 of the controls ( 66 versus 6 % , p
O O O O O O O O O B I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
< 0 . 0001 ) .
O O O O O O
Five patients died before the interview , all of them had taken appetite suppressants .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
In 8 patients the diagnosis of primary pulmonary hypertension was uncertain , 5 of them had taken appetite suppressants .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
The patients who had been exposed to appetite suppressants tended to be on average more severely ill , and to have a shorter median delay between onset of symptoms and
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
diagnosis .
O O
A policy of unrestricted prescription of appetite suppressants may lead to a high incidence of associated primary pulmonary hypertension .
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intake of appetite suppressants may accelerate the progression of the disease .
O O B I O O O O O O O O
Choreoathetoid movements associated with rapid adjustment to methadone .
O O O O O O O B O
Choreatiform hyperkinesias are known to be occasional movement abnormalities during intoxications with cocaine but not opiates .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
This is a case report of euphoria and choreoathetoid movements both transiently induced by rapid adjustment to the selective mu - opioid receptor agonist methadone in an inpatient previously abusing
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
heroine and cocaine .
B O B O
In addition , minor EEG abnormalities occurred .
O O O O O O O O
Possible underlying neurobiological phenomena are discussed .
O O O O O O O
Cocaine - induced mood disorder : prevalence rates and psychiatric symptoms in an outpatient cocaine - dependent sample .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
This paper attempts to examine and compare prevalence rates and symptom patterns of DSM substance - induced and other mood disorders .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
243 cocaine - dependent outpatients with cocaine - induced mood disorder ( CIMD ) , other mood disorders , or no mood disorder were compared on measures of psychiatric symptoms
O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The prevalence rate for CIMD was 12 % at baseline .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Introduction of the DSM - IV diagnosis of CIMD did not substantially affect rates of the other depressive disorders .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients with CIMD had symptom severity levels between those of patients with and without a mood disorder .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings suggest some validity for the new DSM - IV diagnosis of CIMD , but also suggest that it requires further specification and replication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hemolysis of human erythrocytes induced by tamoxifen is related to disruption of membrane structure .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Tamoxifen ( TAM ) , the antiestrogenic drug most widely prescribed in the chemotherapy of breast cancer , induces changes in normal discoid shape of erythrocytes and hemolytic anemia .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This work evaluates the effects of TAM on isolated human erythrocytes , attempting to identify the underlying mechanisms on TAM - induced hemolytic anemia and the involvement of biomembranes in
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
its cytostatic action mechanisms .
O O O O O
TAM induces hemolysis of erythrocytes as a function of concentration .
B O O O O O O O O O O
The extension of hemolysis is variable with erythrocyte samples , but 12 . 5 microM TAM induces total hemolysis of all tested suspensions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Despite inducing extensive erythrocyte lysis , TAM does not shift the osmotic fragility curves of erythrocytes .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The hemolytic effect of TAM is prevented by low concentrations of alpha - tocopherol ( alpha - T ) and alpha - tocopherol acetate ( alpha - TAc ) (
O O O O B O O O O O O B I I O B I I O O B I I I O B I I O O
inactivated functional hydroxyl ) indicating that TAM - induced hemolysis is not related to oxidative membrane damage .
O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
This was further evidenced by absence of oxygen consumption and hemoglobin oxidation both determined in parallel with TAM - induced hemolysis .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Furthermore , it was observed that TAM inhibits the peroxidation of human erythrocytes induced by AAPH , thus ruling out TAM - induced cell oxidative stress .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O
Hemolysis caused by TAM was not preceded by the leakage of K ( + ) from the cells , also excluding a colloid - osmotic type mechanism of hemolysis ,
O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
according to the effects on osmotic fragility curves .
O O O O O O O O O
However , TAM induces release of peripheral proteins of membrane - cytoskeleton and cytosol proteins essentially bound to band 3 .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Either alpha - T or alpha - TAc increases membrane packing and prevents TAM partition into model membranes .
O B I I O B I I O O O O O B O O O O O
These effects suggest that the protection from hemolysis by tocopherols is related to a decreased TAM incorporation in condensed membranes and the structural damage of the erythrocyte membrane is consequently
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
avoided .
O O
Therefore , TAM - induced hemolysis results from a structural perturbation of red cell membrane , leading to changes in the framework of the erythrocyte membrane and its cytoskeleton caused
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
by its high partition in the membrane .
O O O O O O O O
These defects explain the abnormal erythrocyte shape and decreased mechanical stability promoted by TAM , resulting in hemolytic anemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Additionally , since membrane leakage is a final stage of cytotoxicity , the disruption of the structural characteristics of biomembranes by TAM may contribute to the multiple mechanisms of its
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
anticancer action .
O O O
Changes of sodium and ATP affinities of the cardiac ( Na , K ) - ATPase during and after nitric oxide deficient hypertension .
O O B O B O O O O O B O B O O O O O O B I O O O
In the cardiovascular system , NO is involved in the regulation of a variety of functions .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Inhibition of NO synthesis induces sustained hypertension .
O O B O O O O O
In several models of hypertension , elevation of intracellular sodium level was documented in cardiac tissue .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
To assess the molecular basis of disturbances in transmembraneous transport of Na + , we studied the response of cardiac ( Na , K ) - ATPase to NO -
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O B O
deficient hypertension induced in rats by NO - synthase inhibition with 40 mg / kg / day N ( G ) - nitro - L - arginine methyl ester (
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I I I I I I O
L - NAME ) for 4 four weeks .
B I I O O O O O O
After 4 - week administration of L - NAME , the systolic blood pressure ( SBP ) increased by 36 % .
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two weeks after terminating the treatment , the SBP recovered to control value .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When activating the ( Na , K ) - ATPase with its substrate ATP , no changes in Km and Vmax values were observed in NO - deficient rats .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
During activation with Na + , the Vmax remained unchanged , however the K ( Na ) increased by 50 % , indicating a profound decrease in the affinity of
O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the Na + - binding site in NO - deficient rats .
O B O O O O O B O O O O
After recovery from hypertension , the activity of ( Na , K ) - ATPase increased , due to higher affinity of the ATP - binding site , as revealed
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
from the lowered Km value for ATP .
O O O O O O B O
The K ( Na ) value for Na + returned to control value .
O B O B O O O B O O O O O O
Inhibition of NO - synthase induced a reversible hypertension accompanied by depressed Na + - extrusion from cardiac cells as a consequence of deteriorated Na + - binding properties of
O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
the ( Na , K ) - ATPase .
O O B O B O O O O
After recovery of blood pressure to control values , the extrusion of Na + from cardiac cells was normalized , as revealed by restoration of the ( Na ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
K ) - ATPase activity .
B O O O O O
Effects of long - term pretreatment with isoproterenol on bromocriptine - induced tachycardia in conscious rats .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
It has been shown that bromocriptine - induced tachycardia , which persisted after adrenalectomy , is ( i ) mediated by central dopamine D2 receptor activation and ( ii )
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
reduced by 5 - day isoproterenol pretreatment , supporting therefore the hypothesis that this effect is dependent on sympathetic outflow to the heart .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This study was conducted to examine whether prolonged pretreatment with isoproterenol could abolish bromocriptine - induced tachycardia in conscious rats .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O
Isoproterenol pretreatment for 15 days caused cardiac hypertrophy without affecting baseline blood pressure and heart rate .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In control rats , intravenous bromocriptine ( 150 microg / kg ) induced significant hypotension and tachycardia .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bromocriptine - induced hypotension was unaffected by isoproterenol pretreatment , while tachycardia was reversed to significant bradycardia , an effect that was partly reduced by i . v .
B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
domperidone ( 0 . 5 mg / kg ) .
B O O O O O O O O O
Neither cardiac vagal nor sympathetic tone was altered by isoproterenol pretreatment .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
In isolated perfused heart preparations from isoproterenol - pretreated rats , the isoproterenol - induced maximal increase in left ventricular systolic pressure was significantly reduced , compared with saline -
O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pretreated rats ( the EC50 of the isoproterenol - induced increase in left ventricular systolic pressure was enhanced approximately 22 - fold ) .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results show that 15 - day isoproterenol pretreatment not only abolished but reversed bromocriptine - induced tachycardia to bradycardia , an effect that is mainly related to further cardiac
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
beta - adrenoceptor desensitization rather than to impairment of autonomic regulation of the heart .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
They suggest that , in normal conscious rats , the central tachycardia of bromocriptine appears to predominate and to mask the bradycardia of this agonist at peripheral dopamine D2 receptors
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
.
O
A developmental analysis of clonidine 's effects on cardiac rate and ultrasound production in infant rats .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Under controlled conditions , infant rats emit ultrasonic vocalizations during extreme cold exposure and after administration of the alpha ( 2 ) adrenoceptor agonist , clonidine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Previous investigations have determined that , in response to clonidine , ultrasound production increases through the 2nd - week postpartum and decreases thereafter .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Given that sympathetic neural dominance exhibits a similar developmental pattern , and given that clonidine induces sympathetic withdrawal and bradycardia , we hypothesized that clonidine 's developmental effects on cardiac
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
rate and ultrasound production would mirror each other .
O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , in the present experiment , the effects of clonidine administration ( 0 . 5 mg / kg ) on cardiac rate and ultrasound production were examined in 2
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- , 8 - , 15 - , and 20 - day - old rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Age - related changes in ultrasound production corresponded with changes in cardiovascular variables , including baseline cardiac rate and clonidine - induced bradycardia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
This experiment is discussed with regard to the hypothesis that ultrasound production is the acoustic by - product of a physiological maneuver that compensates for clonidine 's detrimental effects on
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
cardiovascular function .
O O O
Differential effects of systemically administered ketamine and lidocaine on dynamic and static hyperalgesia induced by intradermal capsaicin in humans .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O B O O O
We have examined the effect of systemic administration of ketamine and lidocaine on brush - evoked ( dynamic ) pain and punctate - evoked ( static ) hyperalgesia induced by
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
capsaicin .
B O
In a randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled , crossover study , we studied 12 volunteers in three experiments .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Capsaicin 100 micrograms was injected intradermally on the volar forearm followed by an i . v .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
infusion of ketamine ( bolus 0 . 1 mg kg - 1 over 10 min followed by infusion of 7 micrograms kg - 1 min - 1 ) ,
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
lidocaine 5 mg kg - 1 or saline for 50 min .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Infusion started 15 min after injection of capsaicin .
O O O O O O O B O
The following were measured : spontaneous pain , pain evoked by punctate and brush stimuli ( VAS ) , and areas of brush - evoked and punctate - evoked hyperalgesia
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Ketamine reduced both the area of brush - evoked and punctate - evoked hyperalgesia significantly and it tended to reduce brush - evoked pain .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lidocaine reduced the area of punctate - evoked hyperalgesia significantly .
B O O O O O O O O O O
It tended to reduce VAS scores of spontaneous pain but had no effect on evoked pain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The differential effects of ketamine and lidocaine on static and dynamic hyperalgesia suggest that the two types of hyperalgesia are mediated by separate mechanisms and have a distinct pharmacology .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cyclosporine and tacrolimus - associated thrombotic microangiopathy .
B O B O O O O O
The development of thrombotic microangiopathy ( TMA ) associated with the use of cyclosporine has been well documented .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Treatments have included discontinuation or reduction of cyclosporine dose with or without concurrent plasma exchange , plasma infusion , anticoagulation , and intravenous immunoglobulin G infusion .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , for recipients of organ transplantation , removing the inciting agent is not without the attendant risk of precipitating acute rejection and graft loss .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The last decade has seen the emergence of tacrolimus as a potent immunosuppressive agent with mechanisms of action virtually identical to those of cyclosporine .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
As a result , switching to tacrolimus has been reported to be a viable therapeutic option in the setting of cyclosporine - induced TMA .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
With the more widespread application of tacrolimus in organ transplantation , tacrolimus - associated TMA has also been recognized .
O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O
However , literature regarding the incidence of the recurrence of TMA in patients exposed sequentially to cyclosporine and tacrolimus is limited .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
We report a case of a living donor renal transplant recipient who developed cyclosporine - induced TMA that responded to the withdrawal of cyclosporine in conjunction with plasmapheresis and fresh
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
frozen plasma replacement therapy .
O O O O O
Introduction of tacrolimus as an alternative immunosuppressive agent resulted in the recurrence of TMA and the subsequent loss of the renal allograft .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients who are switched from cyclosporine to tacrolimus or vice versa should be closely monitored for the signs and symptoms of recurrent TMA .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Repeated transient anuria following losartan administration in a patient with a solitary kidney .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
We report the case of a 70 - year - old hypertensive man with a solitary kidney and chronic renal insufficiency who developed two episodes of transient anuria after
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
losartan administration .
B O O
He was hospitalized for a myocardial infarction with pulmonary edema , treated with high - dose diuretics .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Due to severe systolic dysfunction losartan was prescribed .
O O O O O B O O O
Surprisingly , the first dose of 50 mg of losartan resulted in a sudden anuria , which lasted eight hours despite high - dose furosemide and amine infusion .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
One week later , by mistake , losartan was prescribed again and after the second dose of 50 mg , the patient developed a second episode of transient anuria lasting
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
10 hours .
O O O
During these two episodes , his blood pressure diminished but no severe hypotension was noted .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ultimately , an arteriography showed a 70 - 80 % renal artery stenosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this patient , renal artery stenosis combined with heart failure and diuretic therapy certainly resulted in a strong activation of the renin - angiotensin system ( RAS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Under such conditions , angiotensin II receptor blockade by losartan probably induced a critical fall in glomerular filtration pressure .
O O O O B I O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
This case report highlights the fact that the angiotensin II receptor antagonist losartan can cause serious unexpected complications in patients with renovascular disease and should be used with extreme caution
O O O O O O O O B I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in this setting .
O O O O
In vivo protection of dna damage associated apoptotic and necrotic cell deaths during acetaminophen - induced nephrotoxicity , amiodarone - induced lung toxicity and doxorubicin - induced cardiotoxicity by a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O
novel IH636 grape seed proanthocyanidin extract .
O B I I I I O
Grape seed extract , primarily a mixture of proanthocyanidins , has been shown to modulate a wide - range of biological , pharmacological and toxicological effects which are mainly cytoprotective
B I I O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
This study assessed the ability of IH636 grape seed proanthocyanidin extract ( GSPE ) to prevent acetaminophen ( AAP ) - induced nephrotoxicity , amiodarone ( AMI ) - induced
O O O O O O B I I I I O B O O O B O B O O O O O B O B O O O
lung toxicity , and doxorubicin ( DOX ) - induced cardiotoxicity in mice .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
Experimental design consisted of four groups : control ( vehicle alone ) , GSPE alone , drug alone and GSPE + drug .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O
For the cytoprotection study , animals were orally gavaged 100 mg / Kg GSPE for 7 - 10 days followed by i . p .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
injections of organ specific three drugs ( AAP : 500 mg / Kg for 24 h ; AMI : 50 mg / Kg / day for four days ;
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
DOX : 20 mg / Kg for 48 h ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Parameters of study included analysis of serum chemistry ( ALT , BUN and CPK ) , and orderly fragmentation of genomic DNA ( both endonuclease - dependent and independent )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in addition to microscopic evaluation of damage and / or protection in corresponding PAS stained tissues .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Results indicate that GSPE preexposure prior to AAP , AMI and DOX , provided near complete protection in terms of serum chemistry changes ( ALT , BUN and CPK )
O O O B O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and significantly reduced DNA fragmentation .
O O O O O O O
Histopathological examination of kidney , heart and lung sections revealed moderate to massive tissue damage with a variety of morphological aberrations by all the three drugs in the absence of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
GSPE preexposure than in its presence .
B O O O O O O
GSPE + drug exposed tissues exhibited minor residual damage or near total recovery .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Additionally , histopathological alterations mirrored both serum chemistry changes and the pattern of DNA fragmentation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Interestingly , all the drugs , such as , AAP , AMI and DOX induced apoptotic death in addition to necrosis in the respective organs which was very effectively blocked
O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
by GSPE .
O B O
Since AAP , AMI and DOX undergo biotransformation and are known to produce damaging radicals in vivo , the protection by GSPE may be linked to both inhibition of metabolism
O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
and / or detoxification of cytotoxic radicals .
O O O O O O O O
In addition , its ' presumed contribution to DNA repair may be another important attribute , which played a role in the chemoprevention process .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Additionally , this may have been the first report on AMI - induced apoptotic death in the lung tissue .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Taken together , these events undoubtedly establish GSPE 's abundant bioavailability , and the power to defend multiple target organs from toxic assaults induced by structurally diverse and functionally different
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
entities in vivo .
O O O O
Palpebral twitching in a depressed adolescent on citalopram .
O O O O O O O B O
Current estimates suggest that between 0 . 4 % and 8 . 3 % of children and adolescents are affected by major depression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report a favorable response to treatment with citalopram by a 15 - year - old boy with major depression who exhibited palpebral twitching during his first 2 weeks of
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
treatment .
O O
This may have been a side effect of citalopram as it remitted with redistribution of doses .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Metamizol potentiates morphine antinociception but not constipation after chronic treatment .
B O B O O O O O O O O
This work evaluates the antinociceptive and constipating effects of the combination of 3 . 2 mg / kg s . c .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
morphine with 177 . 8 mg / kg s . c .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
metamizol in acutely and chronically treated ( once a day for 12 days ) rats .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On the 13th day , antinociceptive effects were assessed using a model of inflammatory nociception , pain - induced functional impairment model , and the charcoal meal test was used
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
to evaluate the intestinal transit .
O O O O O O
Simultaneous administration of morphine with metamizol resulted in a markedly antinociceptive potentiation and an increasing of the duration of action after a single ( 298 + / - 7 vs
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 139 + / - 36 units area ( ua ) ; P < 0 . 001 ) and repeated administration ( 280 + / - 17 vs . 131
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
+ / - 22 ua ; P < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Antinociceptive effect of morphine was reduced in chronically treated rats ( 39 + / - 10 vs . 18 + / - 5 au ) while the combination - induced
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
antinociception was remained similar as an acute treatment ( 298 + / - 7 vs . 280 + / - 17 au ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute antinociceptive effects of the combination were partially prevented by 3 . 2 mg / kg naloxone s . c .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
( P < 0 . 05 ) , suggesting the partial involvement of the opioidergic system in the synergism observed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In independent groups , morphine inhibited the intestinal transit in 48 + / - 4 % and 38 + / - 4 % after acute and chronic treatment , respectively
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, suggesting that tolerance did not develop to the constipating effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The combination inhibited intestinal transit similar to that produced by morphine regardless of the time of treatment , suggesting that metamizol did not potentiate morphine - induced constipation .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O
These findings show a significant interaction between morphine and metamizol in chronically treated rats , suggesting that this combination could be useful for the treatment of chronic pain .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ifosfamide encephalopathy presenting with asterixis .
B O O O O O
CNS toxic effects of the antineoplastic agent ifosfamide ( IFX ) are frequent and include a variety of neurological symptoms that can limit drug use .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report a case of a 51 - year - old man who developed severe , disabling negative myoclonus of the upper and lower extremities after the infusion of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ifosfamide for plasmacytoma .
B O O O
He was awake , revealed no changes of mental status and at rest there were no further motor symptoms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cranial magnetic resonance imaging and extensive laboratory studies failed to reveal structural lesions of the brain and metabolic abnormalities .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An electroencephalogram showed continuous , generalized irregular slowing with admixed periodic triphasic waves indicating symptomatic encephalopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The administration of ifosfamide was discontinued and within 12 h the asterixis resolved completely .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In the patient described , the presence of asterixis during infusion of ifosfamide , normal laboratory findings and imaging studies and the resolution of symptoms following the discontinuation of the
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
drug suggest that negative myoclonus is associated with the use of IFX .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Sub - chronic low dose gamma - vinyl GABA ( vigabatrin ) inhibits cocaine - induced increases in nucleus accumbens dopamine .
O O O O O B I I I O B O O B O O O O O O B O
RATIONALE : gamma - Vinyl GABA ( GVG )
O O B I I I O B O
irreversibly inhibits GABA - transaminase .
O O B O O O
This non - receptor mediated inhibition requires de novo synthesis for restoration of functional GABA catabolism .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
Given its preclinical success for treating substance abuse and the increased risk of visual field defects ( VFD ) associated with cumulative lifetime exposure , we explored the effects of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
sub - chronic low dose GVG on cocaine - induced increases in nucleus accumbens ( NAcc ) dopamine ( DA ) .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
METHODS :
O O
Using in vivo microdialysis , we compared acute exposure ( 450 mg / kg ) to an identical sub - chronic exposure ( 150 mg / kg per day for
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
3 days ) , followed by 1 - or 3 - day washout .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Finally , we examined the low dose of 150 mg / kg ( 50 mg / kg per day ) using a similar washout period .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Sub - chronic GVG exposure inhibited the effect of cocaine for 3 days , which exceeded in magnitude and duration the identical acute dose .
O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Sub - chronic low dose GVG potentiates and extends the inhibition of cocaine - induced increases in dopamine , effectively reducing cumulative exposures and the risk for VFDS .
O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Amount of bleeding and hematoma size in the collagenase - induced intracerebral hemorrhage rat model .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aggravated risk on intracerebral hemorrhage ( ICH ) with drugs used for stroke patients should be estimated carefully .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We therefore established sensitive quantification methods and provided a rat ICH model for detection of ICH deterioration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In ICH intrastriatally induced by 0 . 014 - unit , 0 . 070 - unit , and 0 . 350 - unit collagenase ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the amount of bleeding was measured using a hemoglobin assay developed in the present study and was compared with the morphologically determined hematoma volume .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The blood amounts and hematoma volumes were significantly correlated , and the hematoma induced by 0 . 014 - unit collagenase was adequate to detect ICH deterioration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In ICH induction using 0 . 014 - unit collagenase , heparin enhanced the hematoma volume 3 . 4 - fold over that seen in control ICH animals and the
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
bleeding 7 . 6 - fold .
O O O O O O O
