Data suggest that this sensitive hemoglobin assay is useful for ICH detection , and that a model with a small ICH induced with a low - dose collagenase should be
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
used for evaluation of drugs that may affect ICH .
O O O O O O O O O O
Estradiol reduces seizure - induced hippocampal injury in ovariectomized female but not in male rats .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Estrogens protect ovariectomized rats from hippocampal injury induced by kainic acid - induced status epilepticus ( SE ) .
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
We compared the effects of 17beta - estradiol in adult male and ovariectomized female rats subjected to lithium - pilocarpine - induced SE .
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
Rats received subcutaneous injections of 17beta - estradiol ( 2 microg / rat ) or oil once daily for four consecutive days .
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
SE was induced 20 h following the second injection and terminated 3 h later .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The extent of silver - stained CA3 and CA1 hippocampal neurons was evaluated 2 days after SE .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
17beta - Estradiol did not alter the onset of first clonus in ovariectomized rats but accelerated it in males .
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
17beta - Estradiol reduced the argyrophilic neurons in the CA1 and CA3 - C sectors of ovariectomized rats .
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In males , estradiol increased the total damage score .
O O O B O O O O O O
These findings suggest that the effects of estradiol on seizure threshold and damage may be altered by sex - related differences in the hormonal environment .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Delirium during clozapine treatment : incidence and associated risk factors .
O O B O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Incidence and risk factors for delirium during clozapine treatment require further clarification .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We used computerized pharmacy records to identify all adult psychiatric inpatients treated with clozapine ( 1995 - 96 ) , reviewed their medical records to score incidence and severity of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
delirium , and tested associations with potential risk factors .
O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Subjects ( n = 139 ) were 72 women and 67 men , aged 40 . 8 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
12 . 1 years , hospitalized for 24 . 9 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
23 . 3 days , and given clozapine , gradually increased to an average daily dose of 282 + / -
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
203 mg ( 3 . 45 + / -
O O O O O O O O O
2 . 45 mg / kg ) for 18 . 9 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
16 . 4 days .
O O O O O
Delirium was diagnosed in 14 ( 10 . 1 % incidence , or 1 . 48 cases / person - years of exposure ) ; 71 . 4 % of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cases were moderate or severe .
O O O O O O
Associated factors were co - treatment with other centrally antimuscarinic agents , poor clinical outcome , older age , and longer hospitalization ( by 17 . 5 days , increasing
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cost ) ; sex , diagnosis or medical co - morbidity , and daily clozapine dose , which fell with age , were unrelated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Delirium was found in 10 % of clozapine - treated inpatients , particularly in older patients exposed to other central anticholinergics .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Delirium was inconsistently recognized clinically in milder cases and was associated with increased length - of - stay and higher costs , and inferior clinical outcome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ketoconazole - induced neurologic sequelae .
B O O O O O
A 77 - y - old patient developed weakness of extremities , legs paralysis , dysarthria and tremor 1 h after ingestion of 200 mg ketoconazole for the first time
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
in his life .
O O O O
All complaints faded away within 24 h .
O O O O O O O O
Few days later , the patient used another 200 mg ketoconazole tablet , and within an hour experienced a similar clinical picture , which resolved again spontaneously within hours .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Laboratory evaluations , including head CT scan , were normal .
O O O O O O O O O O O
This case illustrates the need for close vigilance in adverse drug reactions , particularly in the elderly .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Noxious chemical stimulation of rat facial mucosa increases intracranial blood flow through a trigemino - parasympathetic reflex - - an experimental model for vascular dysfunctions in cluster headache .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cluster headache is characterized by typical autonomic dysfunctions including facial and intracranial vascular disturbances .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both the trigeminal and the cranial parasympathetic systems may be involved in mediating these dysfunctions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An experimental model was developed in the rat to measure changes in lacrimation and intracranial blood flow following noxious chemical stimulation of facial mucosa .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Blood flow was monitored in arteries of the exposed cranial dura mater and the parietal cortex using laser Doppler flowmetry .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Capsaicin ( 0 . 01 - 1 mm ) applied to oral or nasal mucosa induced increases in dural and cortical blood flow and provoked lacrimation .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These responses were blocked by systemic pre - administration of hexamethonium chloride ( 20 mg / kg ) .
O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
The evoked increases in dural blood flow were also abolished by topical pre - administration of atropine ( 1 mm ) and [ Lys1 , Pro2 , 5 , Arg3
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, 4 , Tyr6 ] - VIP ( 0 . 1 mm ) , a vasoactive intestinal polypeptide ( VIP ) antagonist , onto the exposed dura mater .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We conclude that noxious stimulation of facial mucosa increases intracranial blood flow and lacrimation via a trigemino - parasympathetic reflex .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The blood flow responses seem to be mediated by the release of acetylcholine and VIP within the meninges .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Similar mechanisms may be involved in the pathogenesis of cluster headache .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recurrent excitation in the dentate gyrus of a murine model of temporal lobe epilepsy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Similar to rats , systemic pilocarpine injection causes status epilepticus ( SE ) and the eventual development of spontaneous seizures and mossy fiber sprouting in C57BL / 6 and CD1
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mice , but the physiological correlates of these events have not been identified in mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Population responses in granule cells of the dentate gyrus were examined in transverse slices of the ventral hippocampus from pilocarpine - treated and untreated mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
In Mg ( 2 + ) - free bathing medium containing bicuculline , conditions designed to increase excitability in the slices , electrical stimulation of the hilus resulted in a
O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
single population spike in granule cells from control mice and pilocarpine - treated mice that did not experience SE .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
In SE survivors , similar stimulation resulted in a population spike followed , at a variable latency , by negative DC shifts and repetitive afterdischarges of 3 - 60 s
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
duration , which were blocked by ionotropic glutamate receptor antagonists .
O O O O O O O B O O O
Focal glutamate photostimulation of the granule cell layer at sites distant from the recording pipette resulted in population responses of 1 - 30 s duration in slices from SE survivors
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
but not other groups .
O O O O O
These data support the hypothesis that SE - induced mossy fiber sprouting and synaptic reorganization are relevant characteristics of seizure development in these murine strains , resembling rat models of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
human temporal lobe epilepsy .
O O O O O
The alpha3 and beta4 nicotinic acetylcholine receptor subunits are necessary for nicotine - induced seizures and hypolocomotion in mice .
O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Binding of nicotine to nicotinic acetylcholine receptors ( nAChRs ) elicits a series of dose - dependent behaviors that go from altered exploration , sedation , and tremors , to
O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
seizures and death .
O O O O
nAChRs are pentameric ion channels usually composed of alpha and beta subunits .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A gene cluster comprises the alpha3 , alpha5 and beta4 subunits , which coassemble to form functional receptors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We examined the role of the beta4 subunits in nicotine - induced seizures and hypolocomotion in beta4 homozygous null ( beta4 - / - ) and alpha3 heterozygous ( +
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
/ - ) mice .
O O O O O
beta4 - / - mice were less sensitive to the effects of nicotine both at low doses , measured as decreased exploration in an open field , and at high
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
doses , measured as sensitivity to nicotine - induced seizures .
O O O O O O B O O O O
Using in situ hybridization probes for the alpha3 and alpha5 subunits , we showed that alpha5 mRNA levels are unchanged , whereas alpha3 mRNA levels are selectively decreased in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mitral cell layer of the olfactory bulb , and the inferior and the superior colliculus of beta4 - / - brains .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
alpha3 + / -
O O O O
mice were partially resistant to nicotine - induced seizures when compared to wild - type littermates .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
mRNA levels for the alpha5 and the beta4 subunits were unchanged in alpha3 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
brains .
O O
Together , these results suggest that the beta4 and the alpha3 subunits are mediators of nicotine - induced seizures and hypolocomotion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Recurrent acute interstitial nephritis induced by azithromycin .
O O O O O O B O
A 14 - year - old girl is reported with recurrent , azithromycin - induced , acute interstitial nephritis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The second episode was more severe than the first ; and although both were treated with intensive corticosteroid therapy , renal function remained impaired .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although most cases of antibiotic induced acute interstitial nephritis are benign and self - limited , some patients are at risk for permanent renal injury .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Valproate - induced encephalopathy .
B O O O O
Valproate - induced encephalopathy is a rare syndrome that may manifest in otherwise normal epileptic individuals .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It may even present in patients who have tolerated this medicine well in the past .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is usually but not necessarily associated with hyperammonemia .
O O O O O O O O O O
The EEG shows characteristic triphasic waves in most patients with this complication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A case of valproate - induced encephalopathy is presented .
O O O B O O O O O O
The problems in diagnosing this condition are subsequently discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O
Nitro - L - arginine methyl ester : a potential protector against gentamicin ototoxicity .
B I I I I I I O O O O O B O O
The nitric oxide ( NO ) inhibitor nitro - L - arginine methyl ester ( L - NAME ) may act as an otoprotectant against high - frequency hearing loss
O B I O B O O B I I I I I I O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O
caused by gentamicin , but further studies are needed to confirm this .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Aminoglycoside antibiotics are still widely used by virtue of their efficacy and low cost .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Their ototoxicity is a serious health problem and , as their ototoxic mechanism involves the production of NO , we need to assess the use of NO inhibitors for the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O
prevention of aminoglycoside - induced sensorineural hearing loss .
O O B O O O O O O
In this experimental study we used 30 Sprague - Dawley rats , 27 of which had gentamicin instilled into the middle ear .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The otoprotectant L - NAME was administered topically to 12 / 27 animals .
O O B I I O O O O O O O O O
Its effect was determined in terms of attenuation of hearing loss , measured by shifts in the auditory brainstem response threshold .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
L - NAME reduced gentamicin - induced hearing loss in the high - frequency range , but gave no protection in the middle or low frequencies .
B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cerebral vasculitis following oral methylphenidate intake in an adult : a case report .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Methylphenidate is structurally and functionally similar to amphetamine .
B O O O O O O B O
Cerebral vasculitis associated with amphetamine abuse is well documented , and in rare cases ischaemic stroke has been reported after methylphenidate intake in children .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
We report the case of a 63 - year - old female who was treated with methylphenidate due to hyperactivity and suffered from multiple ischaemic strokes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
We consider drug - induced cerebral vasculitis as the most likely cause of recurrent ischaemic strokes in the absence of any pathological findings during the diagnostic work - up .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We conclude that methylphenidate mediated vasculitis should be considered in patients with neurological symptoms and a history of methylphenidate therapy .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
This potential side - effect , though very rare , represents one more reason to be very restrictive in the use of methylphenidate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Cerebral haemorrhage induced by warfarin - the influence of drug - drug interactions .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
To evaluate the frequency , severity and preventability of warfarin - induced cerebral haemorrhages due to warfarin and warfarin - drug interactions in patients living in the county of Osterg
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
tland , Sweden .
O O O O
METHODS :
O O
All patients with a diagnosed cerebral haemorrhage at three hospitals during the period 2000 - 2002 were identified .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Medical records were studied retrospectively to evaluate whether warfarin and warfarin - drug interactions could have caused the cerebral haemorrhage .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
The proportion of possibly avoidable cases due to drug interactions was estimated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Among 593 patients with cerebral haemorrhage , 59 ( 10 % ) were assessed as related to warfarin treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
This imply an incidence of 1 . 7 / 100 , 000 treatment years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of the 59 cases , 26 ( 44 % ) had a fatal outcome , compared to 136 ( 25 % ) among the non - warfarin patients ( p
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
< 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O
A warfarin - drug interaction could have contributed to the haemorrhage in 24 ( 41 % ) of the warfarin patients and in 7 of these ( 12 % )
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
the bleeding complication was considered being possible to avoid .
O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Warfarin - induced cerebral haemorrhages are a major clinical problem with a high fatality rate .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Almost half of the cases was related to a warfarin - drug interaction .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
A significant proportion of warfarin - related cerebral haemorrhages might have been prevented if greater caution had been taken when prescribing drugs known to interact with warfarin .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Side effects of postoperative administration of methylprednisolone and gentamicin into the posterior sub - Tenon 's space .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
To assess the incidence of postoperative emetic side effects after the administration of methylprednisolone and gentamicin into the posterior sub - Tenon 's space at the end of routine cataract
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
surgery .
O O
SETTING :
O O
St . Luke 's Hospital , Gwardamangia , Malta .
O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
A double - blind double - armed prospective study comprised 40 patients who had uneventful sutureless phacoemulsification under sub - Tenon 's local infiltration of 3 mL of plain
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
lignocaine .
B O
At the end of the procedure , Group A ( n = 20 ) had 20 mg / 0 . 5 mL of methylprednisolone and 10 mg / 0 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
5 mL of gentamicin injected into the posterior sub - Tenon 's space and Group B ( n = 20 ) had the same combination injected into the anterior sub
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- Tenon 's space .
O O O O O
Postoperatively , all patients were assessed for symptoms of nausea , vomiting , and headache .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A chi - square test was used to assess the statistical significance of results .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Sixty percent in Group A developed postoperative emetic symptoms , headache , or both ; 1 patient in Group B developed symptoms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The administration of methylprednisolone and gentamicin in the posterior sub - Tenon 's space was related to a high incidence of side effects including nausea , vomiting , and headache
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
All adverse effects were self - limiting .
O O O O O O O O
Cardiac Angiography in Renally Impaired Patients ( CARE ) study : a randomized double - blind trial of contrast - induced nephropathy in patients with chronic kidney disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
No direct comparisons exist of the renal tolerability of the low - osmolality contrast medium iopamidol with that of the iso - osmolality contrast medium iodixanol in high - risk
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I B O O O O O O O B I B O O O O
patients .
O O
METHODS AND RESULTS :
O O O O
The present study is a multicenter , randomized , double - blind comparison of iopamidol and iodixanol in patients with chronic kidney disease ( estimated glomerular filtration rate , 20
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to 59 mL / min ) who underwent cardiac angiography or percutaneous coronary interventions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Serum creatinine ( SCr ) levels and estimated glomerular filtration rate were assessed at baseline and 2 to 5 days after receiving medications .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The primary outcome was a postdose SCr increase > or = 0 . 5 mg / dL ( 44 . 2 micromol / L ) over baseline .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Secondary outcomes were a postdose SCr increase > or = 25 % , a postdose estimated glomerular filtration rate decrease of > or = 25 % , and the mean
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
peak change in SCr .
O O O O O
In 414 patients , contrast volume , presence of diabetes mellitus , use of N - acetylcysteine , mean baseline SCr , and estimated glomerular filtration rate were comparable in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the 2 groups .
O O O O
SCr increases > or = 0 . 5 mg / dL occurred in 4 . 4 % ( 9 of 204 patients ) after iopamidol and 6 . 7 %
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
( 14 of 210 patients ) after iodixanol ( P = 0 . 39 ) , whereas rates of SCr increases > or = 25 % were 9 . 8
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% and 12 . 4 % , respectively ( P = 0 . 44 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In patients with diabetes , SCr increases > or = 0 . 5 mg / dL were 5 . 1 % ( 4 of 78 patients ) with iopamidol and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
13 . 0 % ( 12 of 92 patients ) with iodixanol ( P = 0 . 11 ) , whereas SCr increases > or = 25 % were 10
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 3 % and 15 . 2 % , respectively ( P = 0 . 37 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mean post - SCr increases were significantly less with iopamidol ( all patients : 0 . 07 versus 0 . 12 mg / dL , 6 . 2 versus 10
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 6 micromol / L , P = 0 . 03 ; patients with diabetes : 0 . 07 versus 0 . 16 mg / dL , 6 . 2
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
versus 14 . 1 micromol / L , P = 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The rate of contrast - induced nephropathy , defined by multiple end points , is not statistically different after the intraarterial administration of iopamidol or iodixanol to high - risk
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
patients , with or without diabetes mellitus .
O O O O O O O O
Any true difference between the agents is small and not likely to be clinically significant .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A novel compound , maltolyl p - coumarate , attenuates cognitive deficits and shows neuroprotective effects in vitro and in vivo dementia models .
O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To develop a novel and effective drug that could enhance cognitive function and neuroprotection , we newly synthesized maltolyl p - coumarate by the esterification of maltol and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O B O
p - coumaric acid .
B I I I O
In the present study , we investigated whether maltolyl p - coumarate could improve cognitive decline in scopolamine - injected rats and in
O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O B O O O O O
amyloid beta peptide ( 1 - 42 ) - infused rats .
B I I I I I I I O O O O
Maltolyl p - coumarate was found to attenuate cognitive deficits in both rat models using passive avoidance test and to reduce apoptotic cell death observed in the hippocampus of the
B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
amyloid beta peptide ( 1 - 42 ) - infused rats .
B I I I I I I I O O O O
We also examined the neuroprotective effects of maltolyl p - coumarate in vitro using SH - SY5Y cells .
O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O
Cells were pretreated with maltolyl p - coumarate , before exposed to amyloid beta peptide ( 1 - 42 ) , glutamate or H2O2 .
O O O O B I I I O O O O B I I I I I I I O B O B O
We found that maltolyl p - coumarate significantly decreased apoptotic cell death and reduced reactive oxygen species , cytochrome c release , and caspase 3 activation .
O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Taking these in vitro and in vivo results together , our study suggests that maltolyl p - coumarate is a potentially effective candidate against Alzheimer 's disease that is characterized
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O
by wide spread neuronal death and progressive decline of cognitive function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Interaction between warfarin and levofloxacin : case series .
O O B O B O O O O
Warfarin is the most widely used oral anticoagulant and is indicated for many clinical conditions .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Levofloxacin , a fluoroquinolone , is one of the most commonly prescribed antibiotics in clinical practice and is effective against Gram - positive , Gram - negative , and atypical
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
bacteria .
O O
While small prospective studies have not revealed any significant drug - drug interaction between warfarin and levofloxacin , several case reports have indicated that levofloxacin may significantly potentiate the anticoagulation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O
effect of warfarin .
O O B O
We report 3 cases of serious bleeding complications that appear to be the result of the interaction between warfarin and levofloxacin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Physicians should be aware of this potential interaction and use caution when prescribing levofloxacin to patients taking warfarin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O
Mutations associated with lamivudine - resistance in therapy - na ve hepatitis B virus ( HBV ) infected patients with and without HIV co - infection : implications for antiretroviral
O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
therapy in HBV and HIV co - infected South African patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
This was an exploratory study to investigate lamivudine - resistant hepatitis B virus ( HBV ) strains in selected lamivudine - na ve HBV carriers with and without human immunodeficiency
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
virus ( HIV ) co - infection in South African patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thirty - five lamivudine - na
O O O B O B
ve HBV infected patients with or without
O O O O O O O
HIV co - infection were studied : 15 chronic HBV mono - infected patients and 20 HBV - HIV co - infected patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The latter group was further sub - divided into 13 occult HBV ( HBsAg - negative ) and 7 overt HBV ( HBsAg - positive ) patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
HBsAg , anti - HBs , anti - HBc , and anti - HIV 1 / 2 were determined as part of routine diagnosis using Axsym assays ( Abbott Laboratories
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, North Chicago , IL ) .
O O O O O O O
Serum samples were PCR amplified with HBV reverse transcriptase ( RT ) primers , followed by direct sequencing across the tyrosine - methionine - aspartate - aspartate ( YMDD )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O B O O O
motif of the major catalytic region in the C domain of the HBV RT enzyme .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
HBV viral load was performed with Amplicor HBV Monitor test v2 . 0 ( Roche Diagnostics , Penzberg , Germany ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
HBV lamivudine - resistant strains were detected in 3 of 15 mono - infected chronic hepatitis B patients and 10 of 20 HBV - HIV co - infected patients .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To the best of our knowledge , this constitutes the first report of HBV lamivudine - resistant strains in therapy - na ve HBV - HIV co - infected patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
.
O
The HBV viral loads for mono - infected and co - infected patients ranged from 3 . 32 x 10 ( 2 ) to 3 . 82 x 10 (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
7 ) and < 200 to 4 . 40 x 10 ( 3 ) copies / ml , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It remains to be seen whether such pre - existing antiviral mutations could result in widespread emergence of HBV resistant strains when lamivudine - containing highly active antiretroviral ( ARV
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
) treatment ( HAART ) regimens become widely applied in South Africa , as this is likely to have potential implications in the management of HBV - HIV co -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
infected patients .
O O O
Sex differences in NMDA antagonist enhancement of morphine antihyperalgesia in a capsaicin model of persistent pain : comparisons to two models of acute pain .
O O O B O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In acute pain models , N - methyl - D - aspartate ( NMDA ) antagonists enhance the antinociceptive effects of morphine to a greater extent in males than females
O O O O O B I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
.
O
The purpose of this investigation was to extend these findings to a persistent pain model which could be distinguished from acute pain models on the basis of the nociceptive fibers
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
activated , neurochemical substrates , and duration of the nociceptive stimulus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
To this end , persistent hyperalgesia was induced by administration of capsaicin in the tail of gonadally intact F344 rats , following which the tail was immersed in a mildly
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
noxious thermal stimulus , and tail - withdrawal latencies measured .
O O O O O O O O O O O
For comparison , tests were conducted in two acute pain models , the hotplate and warm water tail - withdrawal procedures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In males , the non - competitive NMDA antagonist dextromethorphan enhanced the antihyperalgesic effect of low to moderate doses of morphine in a dose - and time - dependent manner
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Across the doses and pretreatment times examined , enhancement was not observed in females .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Enhancement of morphine antinociception by dextromethorphan was seen in both males and females in the acute pain models , with the magnitude of this effect being greater in males .
O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings demonstrate a sexually - dimorphic interaction between NMDA antagonists and morphine in a persistent pain model that can be distinguished from those observed in acute pain models .
O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Development of proteinuria after switch to sirolimus - based immunosuppression in long - term cardiac transplant patients .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Calcineurin - inhibitor therapy can lead to renal dysfunction in heart transplantation patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The novel immunosuppressive ( IS ) drug sirolmus ( Srl ) lacks nephrotoxic effects ; however , proteinuria associated with Srl has been reported following renal transplantation .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
In cardiac transplantation , the incidence of proteinuria associated with Srl is unknown .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
In this study , long - term cardiac transplant patients were switched from cyclosporine to Srl - based IS .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
Concomitant IS consisted of mycophenolate mofetil + / -
O O O O B I O O O
steroids .
B O
Proteinuria increased significantly from a median of 0 . 13 g / day ( range 0 - 5 . 7 ) preswitch to 0 . 23 g / day (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 - 9 . 88 ) at 24 months postswitch ( p = 0 . 0024 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Before the switch , 11 . 5 % of patients had high - grade proteinuria ( > 1 . 0 g / day ) ; this increased to 22 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
9 % postswitch ( p = 0 . 006 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
ACE inhibitor and angiotensin - releasing blocker ( ARB ) therapy reduced proteinuria development .
B I O B I I I O B O O O O O O
Patients without proteinuria had increased renal function ( median 42 . 5 vs . 64 . 1 , p = 0 . 25 ) , whereas patients who developed high
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- grade proteinuria showed decreased renal function at the end of follow - up ( median 39 . 6 vs . 29 . 2 , p = 0 . 125
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
Thus , proteinuria may develop in cardiac transplant patients after switch to Srl , which may have an adverse effect on renal function in these patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Srl should be used with ACEi / ARB therapy and patients monitored for proteinuria and increased renal dysfunction .
B O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Synthesis of N - pyrimidinyl - 2 - phenoxyacetamides as adenosine A2A receptor antagonists .
O O B I I I I I I O B O O O O
A series of N - pyrimidinyl - 2 - phenoxyacetamide adenosine A ( 2A ) antagonists is described .
O O O B I I I I I I B O O O O O O O O
SAR studies led to compound 14 with excellent potency ( K ( i ) = 0 . 4 nM ) , selectivity ( A ( 1 ) / A (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2A ) > 100 ) , and efficacy ( MED 10 mg / kg p . o . ) in the rat haloperidol - induced catalepsy model for Parkinson 's
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
disease .
O O
Methamphetamine - induced neurotoxicity and microglial activation are not mediated by fractalkine receptor signaling .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Methamphetamine ( METH ) damages dopamine ( DA ) nerve endings by a process that has been linked to microglial activation but the signaling pathways that mediate this response have
B O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
not yet been delineated .
O O O O O
Cardona et al .
O O O O
[ Nat .
O O O
Neurosci .
O O
9 ( 2006 ) ,
O O O O O
917 ] recently identified the microglial - specific fractalkine receptor ( CX3CR1 ) as an important mediator of MPTP - induced neurodegeneration of DA neurons .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O
Because the CNS damage caused by METH and MPTP is highly selective for the DA neuronal system in mouse models of neurotoxicity , we hypothesized that the CX3CR1 plays a
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
role in METH - induced neurotoxicity and microglial activation .
O O B O O O O O O O
Mice in which the CX3CR1 gene has been deleted and replaced with a cDNA encoding enhanced green fluorescent protein ( eGFP ) were treated with METH and examined for striatal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
neurotoxicity .
O O
METH depleted DA , caused microglial activation , and increased body temperature in CX3CR1 knockout mice to the same extent and over the same time course seen in wild -
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
type controls .
O O O
The effects of METH in CX3CR1 knockout mice were not gender - dependent and did not extend beyond the striatum .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Striatal microglia expressing eGFP constitutively show morphological changes after METH that are characteristic of activation .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
This response was restricted to the striatum and contrasted sharply with unresponsive eGFP - microglia in surrounding brain areas that are not damaged by METH .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
We conclude from these studies that CX3CR1 signaling does not modulate METH neurotoxicity or microglial activation .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Furthermore , it appears that striatal - resident microglia respond to METH with an activation cascade and then return to a surveying state without undergoing apoptosis or migration .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recovery of tacrolimus - associated brachial neuritis after conversion to everolimus in a pediatric renal transplant recipient - - case report and review of the literature .
O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
TAC has been shown to be a potent immunosuppressive agent for solid organ transplantation in pediatrics .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neurotoxicity is a potentially serious toxic effect .
O O O O O O O O
It is characterized by encephalopathy , headaches , seizures , or neurological deficits .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Here , we describe an eight - and - a - half - yr - old male renal transplant recipient with right BN .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MRI demonstrated hyperintense T2 signals in the cervical cord and right brachial plexus roots indicative of both myelitis and right brachial plexitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Symptoms persisted for three months despite TAC dose reduction , administration of IVIG and four doses of methylprednisolone pulse therapy .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Improvement and eventually full recovery only occurred after TAC was completely discontinued and successfully replaced by everolimus .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O
Valvular heart disease in patients with Parkinson 's disease treated with pergolide .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Course following treatment modifications .
O O O O O
Valvular heart abnormalities have been reported in patients with Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) treated with pergolide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
However , the incidence and severity of these abnormalities vary from study to study and their course after drug withdrawal has not been systematically assessed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
To estimate the frequency and severity of valvular heart abnormality and its possible reversibility after drug withdrawal in a case - control study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
All PD patients in the Amiens area treated with pergolide were invited to attend a cardiologic assessment including transthoracic echocardiography .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Thirty PD patients participated in the study .
O O O O O O O O
A second echocardiography was performed ( median interval : 13 months ) after pergolide withdrawal ( n = 10 patients ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Controls were age - and sex - matched non - PD patients referred to the cardiology department .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Compared to controls , aortic regurgitation ( OR : 3 . 1 ; 95 % IC :
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 . 1 - 8 . 8 ) and mitral regurgitation ( OR : 10 . 7 ; 95 % IC : 2 . 1 - 53 ) were more
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
frequent in PD patients ( tricuspid : NS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
The number of affected valves ( n = 2 . 4 + / - 0 . 7 ) and the sum of regurgitation grades ( n = 2 . 8
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
+ / - 1 . 09 ) were higher ( p = 0 . 008 and p = 0 . 006 , respectively ) in the pergolide group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Severity of regurgitation was not correlated with pergolide cumulative dose .
O O O O O O O B O O O
A restrictive pattern of valvular regurgitation , suggestive of the role of pergolide , was observed in 12 / 30 ( 40 % ) patients including two with heart failure
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Pergolide was discontinued in 10 patients with valvular heart disease , resulting in a lower regurgitation grade ( p = 0 . 01 ) at the second transthoracic echocardiography and
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the two patients with heart failure returned to nearly normal clinical examination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This study supports the high frequency of restrictive valve regurgitation in PD patients treated with pergolide and reveals that a significant improvement is usual when the treatment is converted to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
non - ergot dopamine agonists .
O O O B O O
Adverse effects of topical papaverine on auditory nerve function .
O O O O B O O O O O
BACKGROUND : Papaverine hydrochloride is a direct - acting vasodilator used to manage vasospasm during various neurosurgical operations .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Transient cranial nerve dysfunction has been described in a few cases with topical papaverine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
This study supports previous reports and provides neurophysiological evidence of an adverse effect on the auditory nerve .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We conducted a retrospective review of 70 consecutive microvascular decompression operations and studied those patients who received topical papaverine for vasospasm .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Topical papaverine was used as a direct therapeutic action to manage vasospasm in a total of 11 patients .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The timing of papaverine application and ongoing operative events was reviewed relative to changes in neurophysiological recordings .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Brainstem auditory evoked potentials ( BAEPs ) were routinely used to monitor cochlear nerve function during these operations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
FINDINGS :
O O
A temporal relationship was found between topical papaverine and BAEP changes leading to complete waveform loss .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The average temporal delay between papaverine and the onset of an adverse BAEP change was 5 min .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 10 of 11 patients , BAEP waves II / III - V completely disappeared within 2 to 25 min after papaverine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Eight of these 10 patients had complete loss of BAEP waveforms within 10 min .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One patient showed no recovery of later waves and a delayed profound sensorineural hearing loss .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The average recovery time of BAEP waveforms to pre - papaverine baseline values was 39 min .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Topical papaverine for the treatment of vasospasm was associated with the onset of a transient disturbance in neurophysiological function of the ascending auditory brainstem pathway .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The complete disappearance of BAEP waveforms with a consistent temporal delay suggests a possible adverse effect on the proximal eighth nerve .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recommendations to avoid potential cranial nerve deficits from papaverine are provided .
O O O O O O O O B O O O
Massive proteinuria and acute renal failure after oral bisphosphonate ( alendronate ) administration in a patient with focal segmental glomerulosclerosis .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
A 61 - year - old Japanese man with nephrotic syndrome due to focal segmental glomerulosclerosis was initially responding well to steroid therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The amount of daily urinary protein decreased from 15 . 6 to 2 . 8 g . Within 14 days of the oral bisphosphonate ( alendronate sodium ) administration ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I O O O
the amount of daily urinary protein increased rapidly up to 12 . 8 g with acute renal failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After discontinuing the oral alendronate , the patient underwent six cycles of hemodialysis and four cycles of LDL apheresis .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urinary volume and serum creatinine levels recovered to the normal range , with urinary protein disappearing completely within 40 days .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This report demonstrates that not only intravenous , but also oral bisphosphonates can aggravate proteinuria and acute renal failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Serum - and glucocorticoid - inducible kinase 1 in doxorubicin - induced nephrotic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Doxorubicin - induced nephropathy leads to epithelial sodium channel ( ENaC ) - dependent volume retention and renal fibrosis .
B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aldosterone - sensitive serum - and glucocorticoid - inducible kinase SGK1 has been shown to participate in the stimulation of ENaC and to mediate renal fibrosis following mineralocorticoid and
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
salt excess .
O O O
The present study was performed to elucidate the role of SGK1 in the volume retention and fibrosis during nephrotic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To this end , doxorubicin ( 15 mug / g body wt ) was injected intravenously into gene - targeted mice lacking SGK1 ( sgk1 ( - / - )
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) and their wild - type littermates ( sgk1 ( + / + ) ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Doxorubicin treatment resulted in heavy proteinuria ( > 100 mg protein / mg crea ) in 15 / 44 of sgk1 ( + / + ) and 15 / 44
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of sgk1 ( - / - ) mice leading to severe nephrotic syndrome with ascites , lipidemia , and hypoalbuminemia in both genotypes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Plasma aldosterone levels increased in nephrotic mice of both genotypes and was followed by increased SGK1 protein expression in sgk1 ( + / + ) mice .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urinary sodium excretion reached signficantly lower values in sgk1 ( + / + ) mice ( 15 + / -
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 mumol / mg crea ) than in sgk1 ( - / - )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mice ( 35 + / -
O O O O O O
5 mumol / mg crea ) and was associated with a significantly higher body weight gain in sgk1 ( + / + ) compared with sgk1 ( - / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) mice ( + 6 . 6 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 7 vs . + 4 . 1 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 8 g ) .
O O O O O O
During the course of nephrotic syndrome , serum urea concentrations increased significantly faster in sgk1 ( - / - ) mice than in sgk1 ( + / + ) mice
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
leading to uremia and a reduced median survival in sgk1 ( - / - ) mice ( 29 vs . 40 days in sgk1 ( + / + ) mice
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
In conclusion , gene - targeted mice lacking SGK1 showed blunted volume retention , yet were not protected against renal fibrosis during experimental nephrotic syndrome .

Severe and long lasting cholestasis after high - dose co - trimoxazole treatment for Pneumocystis pneumonia in HIV - infected patients - - a report of two cases .
O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pneumocystis pneumonia ( PCP ) , a common opportunistic infection in HIV - infected individuals , is generally treated with high doses of co - trimoxazole .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O
However , treatment is often limited by adverse effects .
O O O O O O O O O O
Here , we report two cases of severely immunocompromised HIV - infected patients who developed severe intrahepatic cholestasis , and in one patient lesions mimicking liver abscess formation on radiologic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
exams , during co - trimoxazole treatment for PCP .
O O O B I I O O O O
Whereas patient 1 showed lesions of up to 1 cm readily detectable on magnetic resonance imaging under prolonged co - trimoxazole treatment , therapy of patient 2 was switched early
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Clinically significant proteinuria following the administration of sirolimus to renal transplant recipients .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Sirolimus is the latest immunosuppressive agent used to prevent rejection , and may have less nephrotoxicity than calcineurin inhibitor ( CNI ) - based regimens .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To date there has been little documentation of clinically significant proteinuria linked with the use of sirolimus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
We have encountered several patients who developed substantial proteinuria associated with sirolimus use .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
In each patient , the close temporal association between the commencement of sirolimus therapy and proteinuria implicated sirolimus as the most likely etiology of the proteinuria .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We analyzed the clinical and laboratory information available for all 119 patients transplanted at the Washington Hospital Center between 1999 - 2003 for whom sirolimus was a component of their
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
immunosuppressant regimen .
O O O
In these patients , the magnitude of proteinuria was assessed on morning urine samples by turbidometric measurement or random urine protein : creatinine ratios , an estimate of grams of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
proteinuria / day .
O O O O
Laboratory results were compared between prior , during and following sirolimus use .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
RESULTS :
O O
Twenty - eight patients ( 24 % ) developed increased proteinuria from baseline during their post - transplantation course .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 21 patients an alternative cause of proteinuria was either obvious or insufficient data was available to be conclusive .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 7 of the 28 patients there was a striking temporal association between the initiation of sirolimus and the development of nephrotic - range proteinuria .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Proteinuria correlated most strongly with sirolimus therapy when compared to other demographic and clinical variables .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
In most patients , discontinuation of sirolimus resulted in a decrease , but not resolution , of proteinuria .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Sirolimus induces or aggravates pre - existing proteinuria in an unpredictable subset of renal allograft recipients .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Proteinuria may improve , but does not resolve , when sirolimus is withdrawn .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Comparative cognitive and subjective side effects of immediate - release oxycodone in healthy middle - aged and older adults .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
This study measured the objective and subjective neurocognitive effects of a single 10 - mg dose of immediate - release oxycodone in healthy , older ( > 65 years )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
, and middle - aged ( 35 to 55 years ) adults who were not suffering from chronic or significant daily pain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Seventy - one participants completed 2 separate study days and were blind to medication condition ( placebo , 10 - mg oxycodone ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Plasma oxycodone concentration peaked between 60 and 90 minutes postdose ( P < . 01 ) and pupil size , an indication of physiological effects of the medication , peaked
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
at approximately 90 to 120 minutes postdose ( P < . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Significant declines in simple and sustained attention , working memory , and verbal memory were observed at 1 hour postdose compared to baseline for both age groups with a trend
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
toward return to baseline by 5 hours postdose .
O O O O O O O O O
For almost all cognitive measures , there were no medication by age - interaction effects , which indicates that the 2 age groups exhibited similar responses to the medication challenge
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
This study suggests that for healthy older adults who are not suffering from chronic pain , neurocognitive and pharmacodynamic changes in response to a 10 - mg dose of immediate
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- release oxycodone are similar to those observed for middle - aged adults .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
PERSPECTIVE : Study findings indicate that the metabolism , neurocognitive effects , and physical side effects of oral oxycodone are similar for healthy middle - aged and older adults .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , clinicians should not avoid prescribing oral opioids to older adults based on the belief that older adults are at higher risk for side effects than younger adults .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Normalizing effects of modafinil on sleep in chronic cocaine users .
O O O B O O O O B O O
OBJECTIVE : The purpose of the present study was to determine the effect of morning - dosed modafinil on sleep and daytime sleepiness in chronic cocaine users .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O
METHOD :
O O
Twenty cocaine - dependent participants were randomly assigned to receive modafinil , 400 mg ( N = 10 ) , or placebo ( N = 10 ) every morning at
O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
7 : 30 a . m . for 16 days in an inpatient , double - blind randomized trial .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Participants underwent polysomnographic sleep recordings on days 1 to 3 , 7 to 9 , and 14 to 16 ( first , second , and third weeks of abstinence )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The Multiple Sleep Latency Test was performed at 11 : 30 a . m . , 2 : 00 p . m . , and 4 : 30 p .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
m . on days 2 , 8 , and 15 .
O O O O O O O O O O O
For comparison of sleep architecture variables , 12 healthy comparison participants underwent a single night of experimental polysomnography that followed 1 night of accommodation polysomnography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Progressive abstinence from cocaine was associated with worsening of all measured polysomnographic sleep outcomes .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Compared with placebo , modafinil decreased nighttime sleep latency and increased slow - wave sleep time in cocaine - dependent participants .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The effect of modafinil interacted with the abstinence week and was associated with longer total sleep time and shorter REM sleep latency in the third week of abstinence .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Comparison of slow - wave sleep time , total sleep time , and sleep latency in cocaine - dependent and healthy participants revealed a normalizing effect of modafinil in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
cocaine - dependent participants .
B O O O O
Modafinil was associated with increased daytime sleep latency , as measured by the Multiple Sleep Latency Test , and a nearly significant decrease in subjective daytime sleepiness .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Morning - dosed modafinil promotes nocturnal sleep , normalizes sleep architecture , and decreases daytime sleepiness in abstinent cocaine users .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
These effects may be relevant in the treatment of cocaine dependence .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
Efficacy and safety of asenapine in a placebo - and haloperidol - controlled trial in patients with acute exacerbation of schizophrenia .
O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Asenapine is approved by the Food and Drugs Administration in adults for acute treatment of schizophrenia or of manic or mixed episodes associated with bipolar I disorder with or without
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
psychotic features .
O O O
In a double - blind 6 - week trial , 458 patients with acute schizophrenia were randomly assigned to fixed - dose treatment with asenapine at 5 mg twice daily
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
( BID ) , asenapine at 10 mg BID , placebo , or haloperidol at 4 mg BID ( to verify assay sensitivity ) .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
With last observations carried forward ( LOCF ) , mean Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale total score reductions from baseline to endpoint were significantly greater with asenapine at 5 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
BID ( - 16 . 2 ) and haloperidol ( - 15 . 4 ) than placebo ( - 10 . 7 ; both P < 0 . 05 )
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
;
O
using mixed model for repeated measures ( MMRM ) , changes at day 42 were significantly greater with asenapine at 5 and 10 mg BID ( - 21 . 3
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
and - 19 . 4 , respectively ) and haloperidol ( - 20 . 0 ) than placebo ( - 14 . 6 ; all P < 0 . 05
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
On the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale positive subscale , all treatments were superior to placebo with LOCF and MMRM ; asenapine at 5 mg BID was superior to placebo
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
on the negative subscale with MMRM and on the general psychopathology subscale with LOCF and MMRM .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment - related adverse events ( AEs ) occurred in 44 % and 52 % , 57 % , and 41 % of the asenapine at 5 and 10 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
BID , haloperidol , and placebo groups , respectively .
O O B O O O O O O O
Extrapyramidal symptoms reported as AEs occurred in 15 % and 18 % , 34 % , and 10 % of the asenapine at 5 and 10 mg BID ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
haloperidol , and placebo groups , respectively .
B O O O O O O O
Across all groups , no more than 5 % of patients had clinically significant weight change .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Post hoc analyses indicated that efficacy was similar with asenapine and haloperidol ; greater contrasts were seen in AEs , especially extrapyramidal symptoms .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Permeability , ultrastructural changes , and distribution of novel proteins in the glomerular barrier in early puromycin aminonucleoside nephrosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
BACKGROUND / AIMS :
O O O O
It is still unclear what happens in the glomerulus when proteinuria starts .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Using puromycin aminonucleoside nephrosis ( PAN ) rats , we studied early ultrastructural and permeability changes in relation to the expression of the podocyte - associated molecules nephrin , a
O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- actinin , dendrin , and plekhh2 , the last two of which were only recently discovered in podocytes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Using immune stainings , semiquantitative measurement was performed under the electron microscope .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Permeability was assessed using isolated kidney perfusion with tracers .
O O O O O O O O O O
Possible effects of ACE inhibition were tested .
O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
By day 2 , some patchy foot process effacement , but no proteinuria , appeared .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The amount of nephrin was reduced in both diseased and normal areas .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The other proteins showed few changes , which were limited to diseased areas .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
By day 4 , foot process effacement was complete and proteinuria appeared in parallel with signs of size barrier damage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nephrin decreased further , while dendrin and plekhh2 also decreased but a - actinin remained unchanged .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ACE inhibition had no significant protective effect .
O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
PAN glomeruli already showed significant pathology by day 4 , despite relatively mild proteinuria .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This was preceded by altered nephrin expression , supporting its pivotal role in podocyte morphology .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The novel proteins dendrin and plekhh2 were both reduced , suggesting roles in PAN , whereas a - actinin was unchanged .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Twin preterm neonates with cardiac toxicity related to lopinavir / ritonavir therapy .
O O O O O O O O B I I O O
We report twin neonates who were born prematurely at 32 weeks of gestation to a mother with human immunodeficiency virus infection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One of the twins developed complete heart block and dilated cardiomyopathy related to lopinavir / ritonavir therapy , a boosted protease - inhibitor agent , while the other twin developed
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mild bradycardia .
O O O
We recommend caution in the use of lopinavir / ritonavir in the immediate neonatal period .
O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O
Learning of rats under amnesia caused by pentobarbital .
O O O O O O O B O
Dissociated learning of rats in the normal state and the state of amnesia produced by pentobarbital ( 15 mg / kg , ip ) was carried out .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Rats were trained to approach a shelf where they received food reinforcement .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In Group 1 the rats were trained under the influence of pentobarbital to run to the same shelf as in the normal state .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
In Group 2 the rats were trained to approach different shelves in different drug states .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It was shown that memory dissociation occurred in both groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Differences in the parameters of training under the influence of pentobarbital between Groups 1 and 2 were revealed .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
These findings show that the brain - dissociated state induced by pentobarbital is formed with the participation of the mechanisms of information perception .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Angiosarcoma of the liver associated with diethylstilbestrol .
O O O O O O B O
Angiosarcoma of the liver occurred in a 76 - year - old man who had been treated for a well - differentiated adenocarcinoma of the liver with diethylstilbestrol for 13
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
years .
O O
Angiosarcoma was also present within pulmonary and renal arteries .
O O O O O O O O O O
The possibility that the intraarterial lesions might represent independent primary tumors is considered .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Role of xanthine oxidase in dexamethasone - induced hypertension in rats .
O O B O O B O O O O O O
1 .
O O
Glucocorticoid - induced hypertension ( GC - HT ) in the rat is associated with nitric oxide - redox imbalance .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
2 .
O O
We studied the role of xanthine oxidase ( XO ) , which is implicated in the production of reactive oxygen species , in dexamethasone - induced hypertension ( dex -
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
HT ) .
O O O
3 .
O O
Thirty male Sprague - Dawley rats were divided randomly into four treatment groups : saline , dexamethasone ( dex ) , allopurinol plus saline , and allopurinol plus dex .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O B O B O
4 .
O O
Systolic blood pressures ( SBP ) and bodyweights were recorded each alternate day .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thymus weight was used as a marker of glucocorticoid activity , and serum urate to assess XO inhibition .

5 .
O O

B O O O O O O O
2 - 126 + / -

3 mmHg ; P < 0 . 001 ) and decreased thymus ( P < 0 . 001 ) and bodyweights ( P """" < 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

B O O B O O O O O
5 to 30 + / -

3 micromol / L ( P < 0 . 001 ) in saline and from 84 + / -

O O

O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in the rat .
O O O O
Extrapyramidal side effects with risperidone and haloperidol at comparable D2 receptor occupancy levels .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
Risperidone is an antipsychotic drug with high affinity at dopamine D2 and serotonin 5 - HT2 receptors .
B O O O O O O O O B O O B I I I O O
Previous clinical studies have proposed that risperidone 's pharmacologic profile may produce improved efficacy for negative psychotic symptoms and decreased propensity for extrapyramidal side effects ; features shared by so
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- called ' atypical ' neuroleptics .
O O O O O O O
To determine if routine risperidone treatment is associated with a unique degree of D2 receptor occupancy and pattern of clinical effects , we used [ 123I ] IBZM SPECT to
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
determine D2 occupancy in subjects treated with routine clinical doses of risperidone ( n = 12 ) or haloperidol ( n = 7 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Both risperidone and haloperidol produced D2 occupancy levels between approximately 60 and 90 % at standard clinical doses .
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was no significant difference between occupancy levels obtained with haloperidol or risperidone .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Drug - induced parkinsonism was observed in subjects treated with risperidone ( 42 % ) and haloperidol ( 29 % ) and was observed at occupancy levels above 60 %
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Based on these observations , it is concluded that 5 - HT2 blockade obtained with risperidone at D2 occupancy rates of 60 % and above does not appear to protect
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
against the risk for extrapyramidal side effects .
O O O O O O O O
Simvastatin - ezetimibe - induced hepatic failure necessitating liver transplantation .
B I I O O O O O O O O
Abstract Serum aminotransferase elevations are a commonly known adverse effect of 3 - hydroxy - 3 - methylglutaryl coenzyme A reductase inhibitor ( statin ) therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
However , hepatotoxic events have not been widely published with ezetimibe or the combination agent simvastatin - ezetimibe .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B I I O
We describe a 70 - year - old Hispanic woman who developed fulminant hepatic failure necessitating liver transplantation 10 weeks after conversion from simvastatin 40 mg / day to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
simvastatin 10 mg - ezetimibe 40 mg / day .
B I I I I I I O O O
The patient 's lipid panel had been maintained with simvastatin for 18 months before the conversion without evidence of hepatotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
A routine laboratory work - up 10 weeks after conversion revealed elevated serum aminotransferase levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Simvastatinezetimibe and escitalopram ( which she was taking for depression ) were discontinued , and other potential causes of hepatotoxicity were excluded .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A repeat work - up revealed further elevations in aminotransferase levels , and liver biopsy revealed evidence of moderate - to - severe drug toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
She underwent liver transplantation with an uneventful postoperative course .
O O O O O O O O O O
Her aminotransferase levels returned to normal by postoperative day 23 , and her 2 - year follow - up showed no adverse events .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ezetimibe undergoes extensive glucuronidation by uridine diphosphate glucoronosyltransferases ( UGT ) in the intestine and liver and may have inhibited the glucuronidation of simvastatin hydroxy acid , resulting in increased
B O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O
simvastatin exposure and subsequent hepatotoxicity .
B O O O O O
To our knowledge , this is the first case report of simvastatin - ezetimibe - induced liver failure that resulted in liver transplantation .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
We postulate that the mechanism of the simvastatinezetimibe - induced hepatotoxicity is the increased simvastatin exposure by ezetimibe inhibition of UGT enzymes .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O
Clinicians should be aware of potential hepatotoxicity with simvastatin - ezetimibe especially in elderly patients and should carefully monitor serum aminotransferase levels when starting therapy and titrating the dosage .
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Oral manifestations of """" meth mouth """" : a case report .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
AIM :
O O
The aim of the documentation of this clinical case is to make clinicians aware of """" meth mouth """" and the medical risks associated with this serious condition .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Methamphetamine is a very addictive , powerful stimulant that increases wakefulness and physical activity and can produce other effects such as cardiac dysrhythmias , hypertension , hallucinations , and violent
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
behavior .
O O
Dental patients abusing methamphetamine can present with poor oral hygiene , xerostomia , rampant caries ( """" meth mouth """" ) , and excessive tooth wear .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Oral rehabilitation of patients using methamphetamine can be challenging .
O O O O O B O O O O
CASE DESCRIPTION :
O O O
A 30 - year - old Caucasian woman presented with dental pain , bad breath , and self - reported poor esthetics .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A comprehensive examination including her medical history , panoramic radiograph , and intraoral examination revealed 19 carious lesions , which is not very common for a healthy adult .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
She reported her use of methamphetamine for five years and had not experienced any major carious episodes before she started using the drug .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
SUMMARY :
O O
The patient 's medical and dental histories along with radiographic and clinical findings lead to a diagnosis of """" meth mouth . """"
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although three different dental treatment modalities ( either conventional or implant - supported ) have been offered to the patient since August 2007 , the patient has yet to initiate
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
any treatment .
O O O
CLINICAL SIGNIFICANCE :
O O O
This clinical case showing oral manifestations of meth mouth was presented to help dental practitioners recognize and manage patients who may be abusing methamphetamines .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Dental practitioners also may be skeptical about the reliability of appointment keeping by these patients , as they frequently miss their appointments without reasonable justification .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thyroxine abuse : an unusual case of thyrotoxicosis in pregnancy .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Eating disorders and the associated behavioural problems and drug abuse are uncommon in pregnancy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When they do occur they are often unrecognized because of denial but when significant may pose a risk to both the mother and her fetus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This case illustrates a number of problems that may be encountered in women with eating disorders in pregnancy , including prolonged and recurrent metabolic disturbances and diuretic abuse .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In particular it illustrates the derangements of thyroid function seen in pregnant women with eating disorders and reminds us that when a cause for thyrotoxicosis remains obscure , thyroxine abuse
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
should be considered and explored .
O O O O O O
Attenuation of methamphetamine - induced nigrostriatal dopaminergic neurotoxicity in mice by lipopolysaccharide pretreatment .
O O B O O O O O O O O B O O
Immunological activation has been proposed to play a role in methamphetamine - induced dopaminergic terminal damage .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
In this study , we examined the roles of lipopolysaccharide , a pro - inflammatory and inflammatory factor , treatment in modulating the methamphetamine - induced nigrostriatal dopamine neurotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O
Lipopolysaccharide pretreatment did not affect the basal body temperature or methamphetamine - elicited hyperthermia three days later .
B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Such systemic lipopolysaccharide treatment mitigated methamphetamine - induced striatal dopamine and 3 , 4 - dihydroxyphenylacetic acid depletions in a dose - dependent manner .
O O B O O B O O O B O B I I I I I O O O O O O O O
As the most potent dose ( 1 mg / kg ) of lipopolysaccharide was administered two weeks , one day before or after the methamphetamine dosing regimen , methamphetamine -
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O
induced striatal dopamine and 3 , 4 - dihydroxyphenylacetic acid depletions remained unaltered .
O O B O B I I I I I O O O O
Moreover , systemic lipopolysaccharide pretreatment ( 1 mg / kg ) attenuated local methamphetamine infusion - produced dopamine and 3 , 4 - dihydroxyphenylacetic acid depletions in the striatum ,
O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O B I I I I I O O O O O
indicating that the protective effect of lipopolysaccharide is less likely due to interrupted peripheral distribution or metabolism of methamphetamine .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
We concluded a critical time window for systemic lipopolysaccharide pretreatment in exerting effective protection against methamphetamine - induced nigrostriatal dopamine neurotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O B O O
Effect of converting enzyme inhibition on the course of adriamycin - induced nephropathy .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The effect of the converting enzyme inhibitor ( CEI ) enalapril was assessed in Munich - Wistar rats with established adriamycin nephrosis .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O
Rats were given a single dose of adriamycin and one month later divided into four groups matched for albuminuria , blood pressure , and plasma albumin concentration .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Groups 1 and 3 remained untreated while groups 2 and 4 received enalapril .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O

O O O O O O O O O O O
These short - term studies showed that enalapril reduced arterial blood pressure ( 101 + / -

Butyrylcholinesterase gene mutations in patients with prolonged apnea after succinylcholine for electroconvulsive therapy .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
BACKGROUND : patients undergoing electroconvulsive therapy ( ECT ) often receive succinylcholine as part of the anesthetic procedure .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The duration of action may be prolonged in patients with genetic variants of the butyrylcholinesterase enzyme ( BChE ) , the most common being the K - and the A
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- variants .
O O O
The aim of the study was to assess the clinical significance of genetic variants in butyrylcholinesterase gene ( BCHE ) in patients with a suspected prolonged duration of action of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
succinylcholine after ECT .
B O O O
METHODS :
O O
a total of 13 patients were referred to the Danish Cholinesterase Research Unit after ECT during 38 months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We determined the BChE activity and the BCHE genotype using molecular genetic methods , the duration of apnea , time to sufficient spontaneous ventilation and whether neuromuscular monitoring was used
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The duration of apnea was compared with published data on normal subjects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
in 11 patients , mutations were found in the BCHE gene , the K - variant being the most frequent .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The duration of apnea was 5 - 15 min compared with 3 - 5 . 3 min from the literature .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Severe distress was noted in the recovery phase in two patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neuromuscular monitoring was used in two patients .
O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION : eleven of 13 patients with a prolonged duration of action of succinylcholine
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B
had mutations in BCHE , indicating that this is the possible reason for a prolonged period of apnea .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We recommend objective neuromuscular monitoring during the first ECT .
O O O O O O O O O O
Ketamine sedation for the reduction of children 's fractures in the emergency department .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
There recently has been a resurgence in the utilization of ketamine , a unique anesthetic , for emergency - department procedures requiring sedation .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of the present study was to examine the safety and efficacy of ketamine for sedation in the treatment of children 's fractures in the emergency department .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
One hundred and fourteen children ( average age , 5 . 3 years ; range , twelve months to ten years and ten months ) who underwent closed reduction of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
an isolated fracture or dislocation in the emergency department at a level - I trauma center were prospectively evaluated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ketamine hydrochloride was administered intravenously ( at a dose of two milligrams per kilogram of body weight ) in ninety - nine of the patients and intramuscularly ( at a
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dose of four milligrams per kilogram of body weight ) in the other fifteen .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A board - certified emergency physician skilled in airway management supervised administration of the anesthetic , and the patients were monitored by a registered nurse .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Any pain during the reduction was rated by the orthopaedic surgeon treating the patient according to the Children 's Hospital of Eastern Ontario Pain Scale ( CHEOPS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The average time from intravenous administration of ketamine to manipulation of the fracture or dislocation was one minute and thirty - six seconds ( range , twenty seconds to five
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
minutes ) , and the average time from intramuscular administration to manipulation was four minutes and forty - two seconds ( range , sixty seconds to fifteen minutes ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The average score according to the Children 's Hospital of Eastern Ontario Pain Scale was 6 . 4 points ( range , 5 to 10 points ) , reflecting minimal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
or no pain during fracture reduction .
O O O O O O O
