Adequate fracture reduction was obtained in 111 of the children .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Ninety - nine percent ( sixty - eight ) of the sixty - nine parents present during the reduction were pleased with the sedation and would allow it to be
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
used again in a similar situation .
O O O O O O O
Patency of the airway and independent respiration were maintained in all of the patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Blood pressure and heart rate remained stable .
O O O O O O O O
Minor side effects included nausea ( thirteen patients ) , emesis ( eight of the thirteen patients with nausea ) , clumsiness ( evident as ataxic movements in ten patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) , and dysphoric reaction ( one patient ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
No long - term sequelae were noted , and no patients had hallucinations or nightmares .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Ketamine reliably , safely , and quickly provided adequate sedation to effectively facilitate the reduction of children 's fractures in the emergency department at our institution .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ketamine should only be used in an environment such as the emergency department , where proper one - on - one monitoring is used and board - certified physicians skilled
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in airway management are directly involved in the care of the patient .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prophylactic use of lamivudine with chronic immunosuppressive therapy for rheumatologic disorders .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
The objective of this study was to report our experience concerning the effectiveness of the prophylactic administration of lamivudine in hepatitis B virus surface antigen ( HBs Ag ) positive
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I I I O B I O O
patients with rheumatologic disease .
O O O O O
From June 2004 to October 2006 , 11 HBs Ag positive patients with rheumatologic diseases , who were on both immunosuppressive and prophylactic lamivudine therapies , were retrospectively assessed .
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Liver function tests , hepatitis B virus ( HBV ) serologic markers , and HBV DNA levels of the patients during follow - up were obtained from hospital file records
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Eleven patients ( six male ) with median age 47 years ( range 27 - 73 ) , median disease duration 50 months ( range 9 - 178 ) and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
median follow - up period of patients 13 . 8 months ( range 5 - 27 ) were enrolled in this study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lamivudine therapy was started 3 - 7 days prior to immunosuppressive therapy in all patients .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Baseline , liver function tests were elevated in two patients ( fourth patient : ALT : 122 IU / l , AST : 111 IU / l , tenth patient
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
: ALT : 294
O O O O
IU / l , AST : 274 IU
O O O O O O O O
/ l , with minimal changes in the liver biopsy in both ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Shortly after treatment their tests normalized and during follow - up period none of the patients had abnormal liver function tests .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In four patients HBV DNA levels were higher than normal at baseline .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two of these normalized and the others increased later .
O O O O O O O O O O
In three additional patients , HBV DNA levels were increased during follow - up .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
None of the patients had significant clinical sings of HBV activation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lamivudine was well tolerated and was continued in all patients .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Prophylactic administration of lamivudine in patients who required immunosuppressive therapy seems to be safe , well tolerated and effective in preventing HBV reactivation .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Safety of transesophageal echocardiography in adults : study in a multidisciplinary hospital .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : TEE is a semi - invasive tool broadly used and its utilization associated to sedatives drugs might to affect the procedure safety .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : to analyze aspects of TEE safety associated to the use of Midazolan ( MZ ) and Flumazenil ( FL ) and the influence of the clinical variables on
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
the event rate .
O O O O
METHOD : prospective study with 137 patients that underwent TEE with MZ associated to moderate sedation .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
We analyzed the following events : complications related with the topical anesthesia , with MZ use and with the procedure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Uni - and multivariate analyses were used to test the influence of the clinical variables : age , sex , stroke , myocardiopathy ( MP ) , duration of the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
test , mitral regurgitation ( MR ) and the MZ dose .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
RESULTS :
O O
All patients ( 65 + / - 16 yrs ; 58 % males ) finished the examination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean doses of MZ and FL were 4 . 3 + / - 1 . 9 mg and 0 . 28 + / - 0 . 2 mg ,
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
respectively .
O O
The duration of the examination and the mean ejection fraction ( EF ) were 16 . 4 + / - 6 . 1 minutes and 60 + / - 9
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% , respectively .
O O O O
Mild hypoxia ( SO2 < 90 % ) was the most common event ( 11 patients ) ; 3 patients ( 2 % ) presented transient hypoxia due to upper
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
airway obstruction by probe introduction and 8 ( 5 . 8 % ) due to hypoxia caused by MZ use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Transient hypotension ( SAP < 90mmHg ) occurred in 1 patient ( 0 . 7 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The multivariate analysis showed that severe MR , MP ( EF < 45 % ) and high doses of MZ ( > 5 mg ) were associated with events (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
p < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O
The EF was 40 % , in the group with MP and 44 % in the group with severe MR and it can be a factor associated with clinical events
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in the last group .
O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
TEE with sedation presents a low rate of events .
O O O O O O O O O O
There were no severe events and there was no need to interrupt the examinations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effects of calcium channel blockers on bupivacaine - induced toxicity .
O O B O O O B O O O O
The purpose of this study was to investigate the influence of calcium channel blockers on bupivacaine - induced acute toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O
For each of the three tested calcium channel blockers ( diltiazem , verapamil and bepridil ) 6 groups of mice were treated by two different doses , i . e
O O O O O O B O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 2 and 10 mg / kg / i . p . , or an equal volume of saline for the control group ( n = 20 ) ; 15
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
minutes later , all the animals were injected with a single 50 mg / kg / i . p .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dose of bupivacaine .
O O B O
The convulsant activity , the time of latency to convulse and the mortality rate were assessed in each group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The local anesthetic - induced mortality was significantly increased by the three different calcium channel blockers .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
The convulsant activity of bupivacaine was not significantly modified but calcium channel blockers decreased the time of latency to obtain bupivacaine - induced convulsions ; this effect was less pronounced
O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
with bepridil .
O B O
Selegiline - induced postural hypotension in Parkinson 's disease : a longitudinal study on the effects of drug withdrawal .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
The United Kingdom Parkinson 's Disease Research Group ( UKPDRG ) trial found an increased mortality in patients with Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) randomized to receive 10 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
selegiline per day and L - dopa compared with those taking L - dopa alone .
B O O O B I I O O O O B I I O O
Recently , we found that therapy with selegiline and L - dopa was associated with selective systolic orthostatic hypotension which was abolished by withdrawal of selegiline .
O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
This unwanted effect on postural blood pressure was not the result of underlying autonomic failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aims of this study were to confirm our previous findings in a separate cohort of patients and to determine the time course of the cardiovascular consequences of stopping
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
selegiline in the expectation that this might shed light on the mechanisms by which the drug causes orthostatic hypotension .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
The cardiovascular responses to standing and head - up tilt were studied repeatedly in PD patients receiving selegiline and as the drug was withdrawn .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Head - up tilt caused systolic orthostatic hypotension which was marked in six of 20 PD patients on selegiline , one of whom lost consciousness with unrecordable blood pressures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
A lesser degree of orthostatic hypotension occurred with standing .
O O O O O O O O O O
Orthostatic hypotension was ameliorated 4 days after withdrawal of selegiline and totally abolished 7 days after discontinuation of the drug .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Stopping selegiline also significantly reduced the supine systolic and diastolic blood pressures consistent with a previously undescribed supine pressor action .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
This study confirms our previous finding that selegiline in combination with L - dopa is associated with selective orthostatic hypotension .
O O O O O O O B O O O B I I O O O O O O O
The possibilities that these cardiovascular findings might be the result of non - selective inhibition of monoamine oxidase or of amphetamine and metamphetamine are discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
Explicit episodic memory for sensory - discriminative components of capsaicin - induced pain : immediate and delayed ratings .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Pain memory is thought to affect future pain sensitivity and thus contribute to clinical pain conditions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Systematic investigations of the human capacity to remember sensory features of experimental pain are sparse .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In order to address long - term pain memory , nine healthy male volunteers received intradermal injections of three doses of capsaicin ( 0 . 05 , 1 and 20
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
microg , separated by 15 min breaks ) , each given three times in a balanced design across three sessions at one week intervals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pain rating was performed using a computerized visual analogue scale ( 0 - 100 ) digitized at 1 / s , either immediately online or one hour or one day
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
after injection .
O O O
Subjects also recalled their pains one week later .
O O O O O O O O O
Capsaicin injection reliably induced a dose - dependent flare ( p < 0 . 001 ) without any difference within or across sessions .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The strong burning pain decayed exponentially within a few minutes .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Subjects were able to reliably discriminate pain magnitude and duration across capsaicin doses ( both p < 0 . 001 ) , regardless of whether first - time ratings were
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
requested immediately , after one hour or after one day .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Pain recall after one week was similarly precise ( magnitude : p < 0 . 01 , duration : p < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Correlation with rating recall after one week was best when first - time ratings were requested as late as one day after injection ( R ( 2 ) = 0
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 79 ) indicating that both rating retrievals utilized similar memory traces .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results indicate a reliable memory for magnitude and duration of experimentally induced pain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The data further suggest that the consolidation of this memory is an important interim stage , and may take up to one day .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reversibility of captopril - induced renal insufficiency after prolonged use in an unusual case of renovascular hypertension .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report a case of severe hypertension with an occluded renal artery to a solitary kidney , who developed sudden deterioration of renal function following treatment with captopril .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
His renal function remained impaired but stable during 2 years ' treatment with captopril but returned to pre - treatment levels soon after cessation of the drug .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This indicates reversibility in captopril - induced renal failure even after its prolonged use and suggests that no organic damage occurs to glomerular arterioles following chronic ACE inhibition .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Liver disease caused by propylthiouracil .
O O O O B O
This report presents the clinical , laboratory , and light and electron microscopic observations on a patient with chronic active ( aggressive ) hepatitis caused by the administration of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
propylthiouracil .
B O
This is an addition to the list of drugs that must be considered in the evaluation of chronic liver disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Capsaicin - induced muscle pain alters the excitability of the human jaw - stretch reflex .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The pathophysiology of painful temporomandibular disorders is not fully understood , but evidence suggests that muscle pain modulates motor function in characteristic ways .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This study tested the hypothesis that activation of nociceptive muscle afferent fibers would be linked to an increased excitability of the human jaw - stretch reflex and whether this process
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
would be sensitive to length and velocity of the stretch .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Capsaicin ( 10 micro g ) was injected into the masseter muscle to induce pain in 11 healthy volunteers .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Short - latency reflex responses were evoked in the masseter and temporalis muscles by a stretch device with different velocities and displacements before , during , and after the pain
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The normalized reflex amplitude increased with an increase in velocity at a given displacement , but remained constant with different displacements at a given velocity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The normalized reflex amplitude was significantly higher during pain , but only at faster stretches in the painful muscle .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Increased sensitivity of the fusimotor system during acute muscle pain could be one likely mechanism to explain the findings .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation for levodopa - induced dyskinesias in Parkinson 's disease .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
In a placebo - controlled , single - blinded , crossover study , we assessed the effect of """" real """" repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( rTMS ) versus """"
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
sham """" rTMS ( placebo ) on peak dose dyskinesias in patients with Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ten patients with PD and prominent dyskinesias had rTMS ( 1 , 800 pulses ; 1 Hz rate ) delivered over the motor cortex for 4 consecutive days twice ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
once real stimuli and once sham stimulation were used ; evaluations were done at the baseline and 1 day after the end of each of the treatment series .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Direct comparison between sham and real rTMS effects showed no significant difference in clinician - assessed dyskinesia severity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , comparison with the baseline showed small but significant reduction in dyskinesia severity following real rTMS but not placebo .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The major effect was on dystonia subscore .
O O O O O O O O
Similarly , in patient diaries , although both treatments caused reduction in subjective dyskinesia scores during the days of intervention , the effect was sustained for 3 days after the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
intervention for the real rTMS only .
O O O O O O O
Following rTMS , no side effects and no adverse effects on motor function and PD symptoms were noted .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results suggest the existence of residual beneficial clinical aftereffects of consecutive daily applications of low - frequency rTMS on dyskinesias in PD .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effects may be further exploited for potential therapeutic uses .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Disulfiram - like syndrome after hydrogen cyanamide professional skin exposure : two case reports in France .
B O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
Hydrogen cyanamide is a plant growth regulator used in agriculture to induce bud break in fruit trees .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Contact with the skin can result in percutaneous absorption of the substance that inhibits aldehyde dehydrogenase and can induce acetaldehyde syndrome in case of alcohol use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O B O O
The purpose of this report is to describe two cases of a disulfiram - like syndrome following occupational exposure to hydrogen cyanamide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B I O
The first case involved a 59 - year - old man who used Dormex , which contains hydrogen cyanamide , without protection after consuming a large amount of alcohol during
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B I O O O O O O O O O B O
a meal .
O O O
In less than 1 hour after the ingestion of alcohol , he developed malaise with flushing of the face , tachycardia , and dyspnea .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Manifestations regressed spontaneously under surveillance in the hospital .
O O O O O O O O O
The second case occurred in a 55 - year - old farmer following cutaneous contact with Dormex .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Five hours after exposure , he developed disulfiram - like syndrome with flushing , tachycardia , and arterial hypotension after consuming three glasses of wine .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient recovered spontaneously in 3 hours under surveillance in the hospital .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These cases confirm the necessity of avoiding alcohol consumption as recommended in the instructions for use of Dormex and of preventing cutaneous contact during use .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Repeated trimipramine induces dopamine D2 / D3 and alpha1 - adrenergic up - regulation .
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Trimipramine ( TRI ) , which shows a clinical antidepressant activity , is chemically related to imipramine but does not inhibit the reuptake of noradrenaline and 5 - hydroxytryptamine ,
B O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O B I I O
nor does it induce beta - adrenergic down - regulation .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The mechanism of its antidepressant activity is still unknown .
O O O O B O O O O O
The aim of the present study was to find out whether TRI given repeatedly was able to induce adaptive changes in the dopaminergic and alpha1 - adrenergic systems , demonstrated
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
by us previously for various antidepressants .
O O O O O B O
TRI was given to male Wistar rats and male Albino Swiss mice perorally twice daily for 14 days .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the acute experiment TRI ( given i . p . ) does not antagonize the reserpine hypothermia in mice and does not potentiate the 5 - hydroxytryptophan head twitches
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B I I O O
in rats .
O O O
TRI given repeatedly to rats increases the locomotor hyperactivity induced by d - amphetamine , quinpirole and ( + ) - 7 - hydroxy - dipropyloaminotetralin ( dopamine D2 and
B O O O O O O O O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
D3 effects ) .
O O O O
The stereotypies induced by d - amphetamine or apomorphine are not potentiated by TRI .
O O O O B I I O B O O O O B O
It increases the behaviour stimulation evoked by phenylephrine ( given intraventricularly ) in rats , evaluated in the open field test as well as the aggressiveness evoked by clonidine in
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
mice , both these effects being mediated by an alpha1 - adrenergic receptor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It may be concluded that , like other tricyclic antidepressants studied previously , TRI given repeatedly increases the responsiveness of brain dopamine D2 and D3 ( locomotor activity but not
O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
stereotypy ) as well as alpha1 - adrenergic receptors to their agonists .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A question arises whether the reuptake inhibition is of any importance to the adaptive changes induced by repeated antidepressants , suggested to be responsible for the antidepressant activity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O
Ranitidine - induced acute interstitial nephritis in a cadaveric renal allograft .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Ranitidine frequently is used for preventing peptic ulceration after renal transplantation .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
This drug occasionally has been associated with acute interstitial nephritis in native kidneys .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There are no similar reports with renal transplantation .
O O O O O O O O O
We report a case of ranitidine - induced acute interstitial nephritis in a recipient of a cadaveric renal allograft presenting with acute allograft dysfunction within 48 hours of exposure to
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the drug .
O O O
The biopsy specimen showed pathognomonic features , including eosinophilic infiltration of the interstitial compartment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Allograft function improved rapidly and returned to baseline after stopping the drug .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Late , late doxorubicin cardiotoxicity .
O O O B O O
Cardiac toxicity is a major complication which limits the use of adriamycin as a chemotherapeutic agent .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Cardiomyopathy is frequent when the total dose exceeds 600 mg / m2 and occurs within one to six months after cessation of therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A patient is reported who developed progressive cardiomyopathy two and one - half years after receiving 580 mg / m2 which apparently represents late , late cardiotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acetazolamide - induced nephrolithiasis : implications for treatment of neuromuscular disorders .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Carbonic anhydrase inhibitors can cause nephrolithiasis .
O O O O O O O
We studied 20 patients receiving long - term carbonic anhydrase inhibitor treatment for periodic paralysis and myotonia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Three patients on acetazolamide ( 15 % ) developed renal calculi .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
Extracorporeal lithotripsy successfully removed a renal calculus in one patient and surgery removed a staghorn calculus in another , permitting continued treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal function remained normal in all patients .
O O O O O O O O
Nephrolithiasis is a complication of acetazolamide but does not preclude its use .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Is the treatment of scabies hazardous ?
O O O O O O O
Treatment for scabies is usually initiated by general practitioners ; most consider lindane ( gamma benzene hexachloride ) the treatment of choice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O O O O
Lindane is also widely used as an agricultural and industrial pesticide , and as a result the toxic profile of this insecticide is well understood .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Evidence is accumulating that lindane can be toxic to the central nervous system and may be associated with aplastic anaemia .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Preparations containing lindane continue to be sold over the counter and may represent a hazard to poorly informed patients .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This literature review suggests that general practitioners should prescribe scabicides with increased caution for certain at - risk groups , and give adequate warnings regarding potential toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Anaesthetists ' nightmare : masseter spasm after induction in an undiagnosed case of myotonia congenita .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report an undiagnosed case of myotonia congenita in a 24 - year - old previously healthy primigravida , who developed life threatening masseter spasm following a standard dose of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
intravenous suxamethonium for induction of anaesthesia .
O B O O O O O
Neither the patient nor the anaesthetist was aware of the diagnosis before this potentially lethal complication occurred .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Toxicity in rhesus monkeys following administration of the
O O O O O O O O
8
B
-
I
aminoquinoline
I
8
B
- [ ( 4 - amino - l - methylbutyl ) amino ] - 5 - ( l - hexyloxy ) - 6 - methoxy - 4 - methylquinoline (
I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O
WR242511 ) .
B O O
INTRODUCTION :
O O
Many substances that form methemoglobin ( MHb ) effectively counter cyanide ( CN ) toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although MHb formers are generally applied as treatments for CN poisoning , it has been proposed that a stable , long - acting MHb former could serve as a CN
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pretreatment .
O O
Using this rationale , the 8 - aminoquinoline WR242511 , a potent long - lasting MHb former in rodents and beagle dogs , was studied in the rhesus monkey for
O O O O O B I I B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
advanced development as a potential CN pretreatment .
O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
In this study , WR242511 was administered intravenously ( IV ) in 2 female and 4 male rhesus monkeys in doses of 3 . 5 and / or 7 .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 mg / kg ; a single male also received WR242511 orally ( PO ) at 7 . 0 mg / kg .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Health status and MHb levels were monitored following exposure .
O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The selected doses of WR242511 , which produced significant methemoglobinemia in beagle dogs in earlier studies conducted elsewhere , produced very little MHb ( mean < 2 . 0 %
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) in the rhesus monkey .
O O O O O O
Furthermore , transient hemoglobinuria was noted approximately 60 minutes postinjection of WR242511 ( 3 . 5 or 7 . 0 mg / kg ) , and 2 lethalities occurred (
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
one IV and one PO ) following the 7 . 0 mg / kg dose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Myoglobinuria was also observed following the 7 . 0 mg / kg dose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Histopathology analyses in the 2 animals that died revealed liver and kidney toxicity , with greater severity in the orally - treated animal .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
These data demonstrate direct and / or indirect drug - induced toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is concluded that WR242511 should not be pursued as a pretreatment for CN poisoning unless the anti - CN characteristics of this compound can be successfully dissociated from those
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
producing undesirable toxicity .
O O O O
Neuroplasticity of the adult primate auditory cortex following cochlear hearing loss .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tonotopic organization is an essential feature of the primary auditory area ( A1 ) of primate cortex .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In A1 of macaque monkeys , low frequencies are represented rostrolaterally and high frequencies are represented caudomedially .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of this study was to determine if changes occur in this tonotopic organization following cochlear hearing loss .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Under anesthesia , the superior temporal gyrus of adult macaque monkeys was exposed , and the tonotopic organization of A1 was mapped using conventional microelectrode recording techniques .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Following recovery , the monkeys were selectively deafened for high frequencies using kanamycin and furosemide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
The actual frequencies deafened were determined by the loss of tone - burst elicited auditory brainstem responses .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Three months after deafening , A1 was remapped .
O O O O O O O O O
Postmortem cytoarchitectural features identifying A1 were correlated with the electrophysiologic data .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results indicate that the deprived area of A1 undergoes extensive reorganization and becomes responsive to intact cochlear frequencies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The region of cortex that represents the low frequencies was not obviously affected by the cochlear hearing loss .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The site of common side effects of sumatriptan .
O O O O O O O B O
Atypical sensations following the use of subcutaneous sumatriptan are common , but of uncertain origin .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
They are almost always benign , but can be mistaken for a serious adverse event by the patient .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two patients are presented with tingling or burning sensations limited to areas of heat exposure or sunburn .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In these individuals , side effects are most likely generated superficially in the skin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tremor side effects of salbutamol , quantified by a laser pointer technique .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To study tremor side effects of salbutamol an easily applicable , quick and low - priced method is needed .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A new method using a commercially available , pen - shaped laser pointer was developed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Aim of the study was to determine sensitivity , reproducibility , reference values and the agreement with a questionnaire .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Tremor was measured using a laser pointer technique .
O O O O O O O O O
To determine sensitivity we assessed tremor in 44 patients with obstructive lung disease after administration of cumulative doses of salbutamol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Subjects were asked to aim at the centre of a target , subdivided in concentric circles , from 5 m distance .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The circle in which the participant succeeded to aim was recorded in millimetres radius .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In another series of measurements , reproducibility and reference values of the tremor was assessed in 65 healthy subjects in three sessions , at 9 a . m . ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 p . m . and 9 a . m . , respectively , 1 week later .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Postural tremor was measured with the arm horizontally outstretched rest tremor with the arm supported by an armrest and finally tremor was measured after holding a 2 - kg weight
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
until exhaustion .
O O O
Inter - observer variability was measured in a series of 10 healthy subjects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tremor was measured simultaneously by two independent observers .
O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Salbutamol significantly increased tremor severity in patients in a dose - dependent way .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Within healthy adults no age - dependency could be found ( b = 0 . 262 mm / year ; P = 0 . 72 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was no agreement between the questionnaire and tremor severity ( r = 0 . 093 ; P = 0 . 53 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Postural tremor showed no significant difference between the first and third session ( P = 0 . 07 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Support of the arm decreased tremor severity , exhaustion increased tremor severity significantly .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A good agreement was found between two independent observers ( interclass correlation coefficient 0 . 72 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
Quantifying tremor by using an inexpensive laser pointer is , with the exception of children ( < 12 years ) a sensitive and reproducible method .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Increased frequency of venous thromboembolism with the combination of docetaxel and thalidomide in patients with metastatic androgen - independent prostate cancer .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
STUDY OBJECTIVE :
O O O
To evaluate the frequency of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) in patients with advanced androgen - independent prostate cancer who were treated with docetaxel alone or in combination with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
thalidomide .
B O
DESIGN :
O O
Retrospective analysis of a randomized phase II trial .
O O O O O O O O O
SETTING : National Institutes of Health clinical research center .
O O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS :
O O
Seventy men , aged 50 - 80 years , with advanced androgen - independent prostate cancer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
INTERVENTION :
O O
Each patient received either intravenous docetaxel 30 mg / m2 / week for 3 consecutive weeks , followed by 1 week off , or the combination of continuous oral
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
thalidomide 200 mg every evening plus the same docetaxel regimen .
B O O O O O O O B O O
This 4 - week cycle was repeated until there was evidence of excessive toxicity or disease progression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MEASUREMENTS AND MAIN RESULTS :
O O O O O
None of 23 patients who received docetaxel alone developed VTE , whereas 9 of 47 patients ( 19 % ) who received docetaxel plus thalidomide developed VTE ( p =
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
0 . 025 ) .
O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
The addition of thalidomide to docetaxel in the treatment of prostate cancer significantly increases the frequency of VTE .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinicians should be aware of this potential complication when adding thalidomide to chemotherapeutic regimens .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Sublingual absorption of the quaternary ammonium antiarrhythmic agent , UM - 272 . UM - 272 ( N , N - dimethylpropranolol ) , a quaternary antiarrhythmic agent , was
O O O O B I O O O B I I O B I I O B I I I I O O O O O O O O
administered sublingually to dogs with ouabain - induced ventricular tachycardias .
O O O O O B O O O O O
Both anti - arrhythmic efficacy and bioavailability were compared to oral drug .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sublingual UM - 272 converted ventricular tachycardia to sinus rhythm in all 5 dogs .
O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O
The area under the plasma concentration time curve at 90 min was 4 - 12 times greater than for oral drug , suggesting the existence of an absorption - limiting
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
process in the intestine , and providing an alternate form of administration for quaternary drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Severe thrombocytopenia and haemolytic anaemia associated with ciprofloxacin : a case report with fatal outcome .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Haematological adverse reactions associated with fatal outcome are rare during treatment with ciprofloxacin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
A 30 - year old Caucasian man reported with abdominal pain and jaundice after 3 - day administration of oral ciprofloxacin for a suspect of urinary tract infection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Clinical evaluations suggested an initial diagnosis of severe thrombocytopenia and haemolysis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient progressively developed petechiae and purpura on thorax and lower limbs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Despite pharmacological and supportive interventions , laboratory parameters worsened and the patient died 17 hours after admission .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An accurate autopsy revealed most organs with diffuse petechial haemorrhages .
O O O O O O O O O O O
No signs of bone marrow depression were found .
O O O O O O O O O
No thrombi or signs of microangiopathies were observed in arterial vessels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Blood and urine cultures did not show any bacterial growth .
O O O O O O O O O O O
This case report shows that ciprofloxacin may precipitate life - threatening thrombocytopenia and haemolytic anaemia , even in the early phases of treatment and without apparent previous exposures .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Simvastatin - induced bilateral leg compartment syndrome and myonecrosis associated with hypothyroidism .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
A 54 - year - old hypothyroid male taking thyroxine and simvastatin presented with bilateral leg compartment syndrome and myonecrosis .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
Urgent fasciotomies were performed and the patient made an uneventful recovery with the withdrawal of simvastatin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
It is likely that this complication will be seen more often with the increased worldwide use of this drug and its approval for all arteriopathic patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bile duct hamartoma occurring in association with long - term treatment with danazol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
We report a case of bile duct hamartoma which developed in a patient who had been on long - term danazol treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Such patients should be under close follow - up , preferably with periodic ultrasound examination of the liver .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
If the patient develops a liver mass , because of non - specific clinical features and imaging appearances , biopsy may be the only way to achieve a definitive diagnosis
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Granulomatous hepatitis due to combination of amoxicillin and clavulanic acid .
O O O O B I I I I I O
We report the case of a patient with amoxicillin - clavulanic acid - induced hepatitis with histologic multiple granulomas .
O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O
This type of lesion broadens the spectrum of liver injury due to this drug combination , mainly represented by a benign cholestatic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The association of granulomas and eosinophilia favor an immunoallergic mechanism .
O O O O O O O O O O O
As penicillin derivatives and amoxicillin alone are known to induce such types of lesions , the amoxicillin component , with or without a potentiating effect of clavulanic acid , might
O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B I O O
have a major role .
O O O O O
Intracranial aneurysms and cocaine abuse : analysis of prognostic indicators .
O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : The outcome of subarachnoid hemorrhage associated with cocaine abuse is reportedly poor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , no study in the literature has reported the use of a statistical model to analyze the variables that influence outcome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
A review of admissions during a 6 - year period revealed 14 patients with cocaine - related aneurysms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
This group was compared with a control group of 135 patients with ruptured aneurysms and no history of cocaine abuse .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Age at presentation , time of ictus after intoxication , Hunt and Hess grade of subarachnoid hemorrhage , size of the aneurysm , location of the aneurysm , and the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Glasgow Outcome Scale score were assessed and compared .
O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The patients in the study group were significantly younger than the patients in the control group ( P < 0 . 002 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In patients in the study group , all aneurysms were located in the anterior circulation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The majority of these aneurysms were smaller than those of the control group ( 8 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
6 . 08 mm versus 11 + / -
O O O O O O O O O
5 . 4 mm ; P = 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The differences in mortality and morbidity between the two groups were not significant .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hunt and Hess grade ( P < 0 . 005 ) and age ( P < 0 . 007 ) were significant predictors of outcome for the patients with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cocaine - related aneurysms .
B O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Cocaine use predisposed aneurysmal rupture at a significantly earlier age and in much smaller aneurysms .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Contrary to the published literature , this group did reasonably well with aggressive management .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Anti - epileptic drugs - induced de novo absence seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The authors present three patients with de novo absence epilepsy after administration of carbamazepine and vigabatrin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Despite the underlying diseases , the prognosis for drug - induced de novo absence seizure is good because it subsides rapidly after discontinuing the use of the offending drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The gamma - aminobutyric acid - transmitted thalamocortical circuitry accounts for a major part of the underlying neurophysiology of the absence epilepsy .
O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because drug - induced de novo absence seizure is rare , pro - absence drugs can only be considered a promoting factor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The underlying epileptogenecity of the patients or the synergistic effects of the accompanying drugs is required to trigger the de novo absence seizure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The possibility of drug - induced aggravation should be considered whenever an unexpected increase in seizure frequency and / or new seizure types appear following a change in drug treatment
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
By understanding the underlying mechanism of absence epilepsy , we can avoid the inappropriate use of anticonvulsants in children with epilepsy and prevent drug - induced absence seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Procainamide - induced polymorphous ventricular tachycardia .
B O O O O O O
Seven cases of procainamide - induced polymorphous ventricular tachycardia are presented .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
In four patients , polymorphous ventricular tachycardia appeared after intravenous administration of 200 to 400 mg of procainamide for the treatment of sustained ventricular tachycardia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
In the remaining three patients , procainamide was administered orally for treatment of chronic premature ventricular contractions or atrial flutter .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These patients had Q - T prolongation and recurrent syncope due to polymorphous ventricular tachycardia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In four patients , the arrhythmia was rapidly diagnosed and treated with disappearance of further episodes of the arrhythmia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In two patients , the arrhythmia degenerated into irreversible ventricular fibrillation and both patients died .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the seventh patient , a permanent ventricular pacemaker was inserted and , despite continuation of procainamide therapy , polymorphous ventricular tachycardia did not reoccur .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
These seven cases demonstrate that procainamide can produce an acquired prolonged Q - T syndrome with polymorphous ventricular tachycardia .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Role of activation of bradykinin B2 receptors in disruption of the blood - brain barrier during acute hypertension .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cellular mechanisms which account for disruption the blood - brain barrier during acute hypertension are not clear .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The goal of this study was to determine the role of synthesis / release of bradykinin to activate B2 receptors in disruption of the blood - brain barrier during acute
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
hypertension .
O O
Permeability of the blood - brain barrier was quantitated by clearance of fluorescent - labeled dextran before and during phenylephrine - induced acute hypertension in rats treated with vehicle and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Hoe - 140 ( 0 . 1 microM ) .
B I I O O O O O O O
Phenylephrine infusion increased arterial pressure , arteriolar diameter and clearance of fluorescent dextran by a similar magnitude in both groups .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
These findings suggest that disruption of the blood - brain barrier during acute hypertension is not related to the synthesis / release of bradykinin to activate B2 receptors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
5 - azacytidine potentiates initiation induced by carcinogens in rat liver .
B I I O O O O O O O O O
To test the validity of the hypothesis that hypomethylation of DNA plays an important role in the initiation of carcinogenic process , 5 - azacytidine ( 5 - AzC )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O B I I O
( 10 mg / kg ) , an inhibitor of DNA methylation , was given to rats during the phase of repair synthesis induced by the three carcinogens ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
benzo [ a ] - pyrene ( 200 mg / kg ) , N - methyl - N - nitrosourea ( 60 mg / kg ) and
B I I I I I O O O O O O O B I I I I I I O O O O O O O
1 , 2 - dimethylhydrazine ( 1 , 2 - DMH ) ( 100 mg / kg ) .
B I I I I O B I I I I O O O O O O O O
The initiated hepatocytes in the liver were assayed as the gamma - glutamyltransferase ( gamma - GT ) positive foci formed following a 2 - week selection regimen consisting of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dietary 0 . 02 % 2 - acetylaminofluorene coupled with a necrogenic dose of CCl4 .
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O B O
The results obtained indicate that with all three carcinogens , administration of 5 - AzC during repair synthesis increased the incidence of initiated hepatocytes , for example 10 - 20
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
foci / cm2 in 5 - AzC and carcinogen - treated rats compared with 3 - 5 foci / cm2 in rats treated with carcinogen only .
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Administration of [ 3H ] - 5 - azadeoxycytidine during the repair synthesis induced by 1 , 2 - DMH further showed that 0 . 019 mol % of
O O B I I I I I I O O O O O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O O
cytosine residues in DNA were substituted by the analogue , indicating that incorporation of 5 - AzC occurs during repair synthesis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O
In the absence of the carcinogen , 5 - AzC given after a two thirds partial hepatectomy , when its incorporation should be maximum , failed to induce any gamma
O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- GT positive foci .
O O O O O
The results suggest that hypomethylation of DNA per se may not be sufficient for initiation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Perhaps two events might be necessary for initiation , the first caused by the carcinogen and a second involving hypomethylation of DNA .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Withdrawal - emergent rabbit syndrome during dose reduction of risperidone .
O O O O O O O O O B O
Rabbit syndrome ( RS ) is a rare extrapyramidal side effect caused by prolonged neuroleptic medication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Here we present a case of withdrawal - emergent RS , which is the first of its kind to be reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient developed RS during dose reduction of risperidone .
O O O O O O O O B O
The symptom was treated successfully with trihexyphenidyl anticholinergic therapy .
O O O O O O B O O O
The underlying mechanism of withdrawal - emergent RS in the present case may have been related to the pharmacological profile of risperidone , a serotonin - dopamine antagonist , suggesting
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O B O O O
the pathophysiologic influence of the serotonin system in the development of RS .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Verapamil withdrawal as a possible cause of myocardial infarction in a hypertensive woman with a normal coronary angiogram .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Verapamil is an effective and relatively - safe antihypertensive drug .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Serious adverse effects are uncommon and mainly have been related to the depression of cardiac contractility and conduction , especially when the drug is combined with beta - blocking agents
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
We report a case in which myocardial infarction coincided with the introduction of captopril and the withdrawal of verapamil in a previously asymptomatic woman with severe hypertension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Possible mechanisms that involve a verapamil - related increase in platelet and / or vascular alpha 2 - adrenoreceptor affinity for catecholamines are discussed .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Remission induction of meningeal leukemia with high - dose intravenous methotrexate .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
Twenty children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia who developed meningeal disease were treated with a high - dose intravenous methotrexate regimen that was designed to achieve and maintain CSF methotrexate concentrations
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O
of 10 ( - 5 ) mol /
O O O O O O O O
L without the need for concomitant intrathecal dosing .
O O O O O O O O O
The methotrexate was administered as a loading dose of 6 , 000 mg / m2 for a period of one hour followed by an infusion of 1 , 200 mg
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
/ m2 / h for 23 hours .
O O O O O O O O
Leucovorin rescue was initiated 12 hours after the end of the infusion with a loading dose of 200 mg / m2 followed by 12 mg / m2 every three hours
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
for six doses and then every six hours until the plasma methotrexate level decreased to less than 1 X 10 ( - 7 ) mol / L .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean steady - state plasma and CSF methotrexate concentrations achieved were 1 . 1 X 10 ( - 3 ) mol / L and 3 . 6 X 10
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( - 5 ) mol / L , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O
All 20 patients responded to this regimen , 16 / 20 ( 80 % ) achieved a complete remission , and 20 % obtained a partial remission .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The most common toxicities encountered were transient serum transaminase and bilirubin elevations , neutropenia , and mucositis .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
One patient had focal seizures and transient hemiparesis but recovered completely .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
High - dose intravenous methotrexate is an effective treatment for the induction of remission after meningeal relapse in acute lymphoblastic leukemia .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hypersensitivity to carbamazepine presenting with a leukemoid reaction , eosinophilia , erythroderma , and renal failure .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report a patient in whom hypersensitivity to carbamazepine presented with generalized erythroderma , a severe leukemoid reaction , eosinophilia , hyponatremia , and renal failure .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This is the first report of such an unusual reaction to carbamazepine .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The interpeduncular nucleus regulates nicotine 's effects on free - field activity .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Partial lesions were made with kainic acid in the interpeduncular nucleus of the ventral midbrain of the rat .
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
Compared with sham - operated controls , lesions significantly ( p < 0 . 25 ) blunted the early ( < 60 min ) free - field locomotor hypoactivity caused
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
by nicotine ( 0 . 5 mg kg ( - 1 ) , i . m . ) , enhanced the later ( 60 - 120 min ) nicotine -
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
induced hyperactivity , and raised spontaneous nocturnal activity .
O O O O O O O O O
Lesions reduced the extent of immunohistological staining for choline acetyltransferase in the interpeduncular nucleus ( p < 0 . 025 ) , but not for tyrosine hydroxylase in the surrounding
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
catecholaminergic A10 region .
O O O O
We conclude that the interpeduncular nucleus mediates nicotinic depression of locomotor activity and dampens nicotinic arousal mechanisms located elsewhere in the brain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Assessment of a new non - invasive index of cardiac performance for detection of dobutamine - induced myocardial ischemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Electrocardiography has a very low sensitivity in detecting dobutamine - induced myocardial ischemia .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
To assess the added diagnostic value of a new cardiac performance index ( dP / dtejc ) measurement , based on brachial artery flow changes , as compared to standard
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
12 - lead ECG , for detecting dobutamine - induced myocardial ischemia , using Tc99m - Sestamibi single - photon emission computed tomography as the gold standard of comparison to
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
assess the presence or absence of ischemia .
O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
The study group comprised 40 patients undergoing Sestamibi - SPECT / dobutamine stress test .
O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O
Simultaneous measurements of ECG and brachial artery dP / dtejc were performed at each dobutamine level .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
In 19 of the 40 patients perfusion defects compatible with ischemia were detected on SPECT .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The increase in dP / dtejc during infusion of dobutamine in this group was severely impaired as compared to the non - ischemic group .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dP / dtejc outcome was combined with the ECG results , giving an ECG - enhanced value , and compared to ECG alone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The sensitivity improved dramatically from 16 % to 79 % , positive predictive value increased from 60 % to 68 % and negative predictive value from 54 % to 78
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% , and specificity decreased from 90 % to 67 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
If ECG alone is used for specificity , the combination with dP / dtejc improved the sensitivity of the test and could be a cost - savings alternative to cardiac
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
imaging or perfusion studies to detect myocardial ischemia , especially in patients unable to exercise .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute liver failure in two patients with regular alcohol consumption ingesting paracetamol at therapeutic dosage .
O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
The possible role of alcohol in the development of hepatotoxicity associated with therapeutic doses of paracetamol ( acetaminophen ) is currently debated .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
CASE REPORT :
O O O
We describe 2 patients who were regular consumers of alcohol and who developed liver failure within 3 - 5 days after hospitalization and stopping alcohol consumption while being treated with
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
4 g paracetamol / day .
O O B O O O
A paracetamol serum level obtained in one of these patients was not in the toxic range .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Possible risk factors for the development of hepatotoxicity in patients treated with therapeutic doses of paracetamol are discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
In patients with risk factors , e . g . regular consumption of alcohol , liver failure is possible when therapeutic doses are ingested .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
We propose that the paracetamol dose should not exceed 2 g / day in such patients and that their liver function should be monitored closely while being treated with
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
paracetamol .
B O
Cocaine related chest pain :
B O O O O
are we seeing the tip of an iceberg ?
O O O O O O O O O
The recreational use of cocaine is on the increase .
O O O O B O O O O O
The emergency nurse ought to be familiar with some of the cardiovascular consequences of cocaine use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
In particular , the tendency of cocaine to produce chest pain ought to be in the mind of the emergency nurse when faced with a young victim of chest pain
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
who is otherwise at low risk .
O O O O O O O
The mechanism of chest pain related to cocaine use is discussed and treatment dilemmas are discussed .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Finally , moral issues relating to the testing of potential cocaine users will be addressed .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Severe rhabdomyolysis and acute renal failure secondary to concomitant use of simvastatin , amiodarone , and atazanavir .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To report a case of a severe interaction between simvastatin , amiodarone , and atazanavir resulting in rhabdomyolysis and acute renal failure .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
A 72 - year - old white man with underlying human immunodeficiency virus , atrial fibrillation , coronary artery disease , and hyperlipidemia presented with generalized pain , fatigue ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and dark orange urine for 3 days .
O O O O O O O O
The patient was taking 80 mg simvastatin at bedtime ( initiated 27 days earlier ) ; amiodarone at a dose of 400 mg daily for 7 days , then 200
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mg daily ( initiated 19 days earlier ) ; and 400 mg atazanavir daily ( initiated at least 2 years previously ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Laboratory evaluation revealed 66 , 680 U / L creatine kinase , 93 mg / dL blood urea nitrogen , 4 . 6 mg / dL creatinine , 1579 U
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O B O O O
/ L aspartate aminotransferase , and 738 U / L alanine aminotransferase .
O O B O O O O O O O B O O
Simvastatin , amiodarone , and the patient 's human immunodeficiency virus medications were all temporarily discontinued and the patient was given forced alkaline diuresis and started on dialysis .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nine days later the patient 's creatine kinase had dropped to 1695 U / L and creatinine was 3 . 3 mg / dL . The patient was discharged and
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
continued outpatient dialysis for 1 month until his renal function recovered .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
The risk of rhabdomyolysis is increased in the presence of concomitant drugs that inhibit simvastatin metabolism .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Simvastatin is metabolized by CYP3A4 .
B O O O O O
Amiodarone and atazanavir are recognized CYP3A4 inhibitors .
B O B O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Pharmacokinetic differences in statins are an important consideration for assessing the risk of potential drug interactions .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In patients requiring the concurrent use of statins and CYP3A4 inhibitors , pravastatin , fluvastatin , and rosuvastatin carry the lowest risk of drug interactions ; atorvastatin carries moderate risk
O O O O O O O B O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O
, whereas simvastatin and lovastatin have the highest risk and should be avoided in patients taking concomitant CYP3A4 inhibitors .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Phase II trial of vinorelbine in metastatic squamous cell esophageal carcinoma .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Gastrointestinal Treat Cancer Cooperative Group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
To evaluate the response rate and toxic effects of vinorelbine ( VNB ) administered as a single agent in metastatic squamous cell esophageal carcinoma .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS AND METHODS :
O O O O
Forty - six eligible patients with measurable lesions were included and were stratified according to previous chemotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thirty patients without prior chemotherapy and 16 pretreated with cisplatin - based chemotherapy were assessable for toxicity and response .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
VNB was administered weekly as a 25 - mg / m2 short intravenous ( i . v . ) infusion .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Six of 30 patients ( 20 % ) without prior chemotherapy achieved a partial response ( PR ) ( 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] , 8 % to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
39 % ) .
O O O O
The median duration of response was 21 weeks ( range , 17 to 28 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One of 16 patients ( 6 % ) with prior chemotherapy had a complete response ( CR ) of 31 weeks ' duration ( 95 % CI , 0 %
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to 30 % ) .
O O O O O
The overall response rate ( World Health Organization [ WHO ] criteria ) was 15 % ( CR , 2 % ; PR 13 % ; 95 % CI ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
6 % to 29 % ) .
O O O O O O O
The median dose - intensity ( DI ) was 20 mg / m2 / wk .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
VNB was well tolerated and zero instances of WHO grade 4 nonhematologic toxicity occurred .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At least one episode of grade 3 or 4 granulocytopenia was seen in 59 % of patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A grade 2 or 3 infection occurred in 16 % of patients , but no toxic deaths occurred .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Other side effects were rare , and peripheral neurotoxicity has been minor ( 26 % grade 1 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
These data indicate that VNB is an active agent in metastatic esophageal squamous cell carcinoma .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Given its excellent tolerance profile and low toxicity , further evaluation of VNB in combination therapy is warranted .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Paclitaxel , cisplatin , and gemcitabine combination chemotherapy within a multidisciplinary therapeutic approach in metastatic nonsmall cell lung carcinoma .
B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Cisplatin - based chemotherapy combinations improve quality of life and survival in advanced nonsmall cell lung carcinoma ( NSCLC ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The emergence of new active drugs might translate into more effective regimens for the treatment of this disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
The objective of this study was to determine the feasibility , response rate , and toxicity of a paclitaxel , cisplatin , and gemcitabine combination to treat metastatic NSCLC .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O
Thirty - five consecutive chemotherapy - naive patients with Stage IV NSCLC and an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group performance status of 0 - 2 were treated with a combination of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
paclitaxel ( 135 mg / m ( 2 ) given intravenously in 3 hours ) on Day 1 , cisplatin ( 120 mg / m ( 2 ) given intravenously
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
in 6 hours ) on Day 1 , and gemcitabine ( 800 mg / m ( 2 ) given intravenously in 30 minutes ) on Days 1 and 8 ,
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
every 4 weeks .
O O O O
Although responding patients were scheduled to receive consolidation radiotherapy and 24 patients received preplanned second - line chemotherapy after disease progression , the response and toxicity rates reported refer only
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to the chemotherapy regimen given .
O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
All the patients were examined for toxicity ; 34 were examinable for response .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An objective response was observed in 73 . 5 % of the patients ( 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] , 55 . 6 - 87 . 1 %
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) , including 4 complete responses ( 11 . 7 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
According to intention - to - treat , the overall response rate was 71 . 4 % ( 95 % CI , 53 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
7 - 85 . 4 % ) .
O O O O O O O O
After 154 courses of therapy , the median dose intensity was 131 mg / m ( 2 ) for paclitaxel ( 97 . 3 % ) , 117 mg /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
m ( 2 ) for cisplatin ( 97 . 3 % ) , and 1378 mg / m ( 2 ) for gemcitabine ( 86 . 2 % ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
World Health Organization Grade 3 - 4 neutropenia and thrombocytopenia occurred in 39 . 9 % and 11 . 4 % of patients , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was one treatment - related death .
O O O O O O O O
Nonhematologic toxicities were mild .
O O O O O
After a median follow - up of 22 months , the median progression free survival rate was 7 months , and the median survival time was 16 months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The combination of paclitaxel , cisplatin , and gemcitabine is well tolerated and shows high activity in metastatic NSCLC .
O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
This treatment merits further comparison with other cisplatin - based regimens .
O O O O O O O B O O O O
Evaluation of adverse reactions of aponidine hydrochloride ophthalmic solution .
O O O O O B I O O O
We prospectively evaluated the adverse reactions of apraclonidine in 20 normal volunteers by instilling a single drop of 1 % apraclonidine in their right eyes .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Examinations , including blood pressure , pulse rate , conjunctiva and cornea , intraocular pressure ( IOP ) , pupil diameter , basal tear secretion and margin reflex distance of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
both upper and lower eyelids , were performed prior to entry and at 1 , 3 , 5 and 7 hours after instillation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The ocular hypotensive effects were statistically significant for apraclonidine - treated eyes throughout the study and also statistically significant for contralateral eyes from three hours after topical administration of 1
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% apraclonidine .
O B O
Decreases in systolic blood pressure were statistically , but not clinically , significant .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No significant changes in diastolic blood pressure , pulse rate and basal tear secretion were noted .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Conjunctival blanching and mydriasis were commonly found .
O O O O O O O O
Upper lid retraction was frequently noted .
O O O O O O O
While the elevations of the upper lid margin in most subjects were not more than 2 mm and did not cause noticeable change in appearance , one subject suffered from
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mechanical entropion and marked corneal abrasion 3 hours after instillation of the medication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This may well be a particularly notable finding in Asian people .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Carmofur - induced organic mental disorders .
B O O O O O O
Organic mental disorder was observed in a 29 - year - old female in the prognostic period after the onset of carmofur - induced leukoencephalopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Symptoms such as euphoria , emotional lability and puerile attitude noted in the patient were diagnosed as organic personality syndrome according to the criteria defined in the DSM - III
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- R .
O O O
It is referred to as a frontal lobe syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O
Brain CT revealed a periventricular low density area in the frontal white matter and moderate dilatation of the lateral ventricles especially at the bilateral anterior horns .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Consequently , carmofur - induced leukoencephalopathy may uncommonly result in organic personality syndrome in the residual state .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It may be attributed to the structural damage to the frontal lobe .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
International mexiletine and placebo antiarrhythmic coronary trial : I . Report on arrhythmia and other findings .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Impact Research Group .
O O O O
The antiarrhythmic effects of the sustained release form of mexiletine ( Mexitil - Perlongets ) were evaluated in a double - blind placebo trial in 630 patients with recent documented
O O O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
myocardial infarction .
O O O
The primary response variable was based on central reading of 24 hour ambulatory electrocardiographic recordings and was defined as the occurrence of 30 or more single premature ventricular complexes in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
any two consecutive 30 minute blocks or one or more runs of two or more premature ventricular complexes in the entire 24 hour electrocardiographic recording .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Large differences , regarded as statistically significant , between the mexiletine and placebo groups were noted in that end point at months 1 and 4 , but only trends were
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
observed at month 12 .
O O O O O
These differences were observed even though the serum mexiletine levels obtained in this study were generally lower than those observed in studies that have used the regular form of the
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
drug .
O O
There were more deaths in the mexiletine group ( 7 . 6 % ) than in the placebo group ( 4 . 8 % ) ; the difference was not
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
statistically significant .
O O O
The incidence of coronary events was similar in both groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Previously recognized side effects , particularly tremor and gastrointestinal problems , were more frequent in the mexiletine group than in the placebo group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Regional localization of the antagonism of amphetamine - induced hyperactivity by intracerebral calcitonin injections .
O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O
Calcitonin receptors are found in the brain , and intracerebral infusions of calcitonin can produce behavioral effects .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Among these behavioral effects are decreases in food intake and decreases in amphetamine - induced locomotor activity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
In previous experiments we found that decreases in food intake were induced by local administration of calcitonin into several hypothalamic sites and into the nucleus accumbens .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
In the present experiment calcitonin decreased locomotor activity when locally injected into the same sites where it decreases food intake .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The areas where calcitonin is most effective in decreasing locomotor activity are located in the hypothalamus and nucleus accumbens , suggesting that these areas are the major sites of action
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of calcitonin in inhibiting amphetamine - induced locomotor activity .
O B O O B O O O O O
Fatal intracranial bleeding associated with prehospital use of epinephrine .
O O O O O O O O B O
We present a case of paramedic misjudgment in the execution of a protocol for the treatment of allergic reaction in a case of pulmonary edema with wheezing .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The sudden onset of respiratory distress , rash , and a history of a new medicine led the two paramedics on the scene to administer subcutaneous epinephrine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Subsequently , acute cardiac arrest and fatal subarachnoid hemorrhage occurred .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Epinephrine has a proven role in cardiac arrest in prehospital care ; however , use by paramedics in patients with suspected allergic reaction and severe hypertension should be viewed with
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
caution .
O O
A case of massive rhabdomyolysis following molindone administration .
O O O O O O B O O
Rhabdomyolysis is a potentially lethal syndrome that psychiatric patients seem predisposed to develop .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The clinical signs and symptoms , typical laboratory features , and complications of rhabdomyolysis are presented .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The case of a schizophrenic patient is reported to illustrate massive rhabdomyolysis and subsequent acute renal failure following molindone administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Physicians who prescribe molindone should be aware of this reaction .
O O O B O O O O O O O
Cardiovascular alterations in rat fetuses exposed to calcium channel blockers .
O O O O O O O B O O O
Preclinical toxicologic investigation suggested that a new calcium channel blocker , Ro 40 - 5967 , induced cardiovascular alterations in rat fetuses exposed to this agent during organogenesis .
O O O O O O O B O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The present study was designed to investigate the hypothesis that calcium channel blockers in general induce cardiovascular malformations indicating a pharmacologic class effect .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We studied three calcium channel blockers of different structure , nifedipine , diltiazem , and verapamil , along with the new agent .
O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O
Pregnant rats were administered one of these calcium channel blockers during the period of cardiac morphogenesis and the offspring examined on day 20 of gestation for cardiovascular malformations .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A low incidence of cardiovascular malformations was observed after exposure to each of the four calcium channel blockers , but this incidence was statistically significant only for verapamil and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
nifedipine .
B O
All four agents were associated with aortic arch branching variants , although significantly increased only for Ro 40 - 5967 and verapamil .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O B O
Differential impact of immune escape mutations G145R and P120 T on the replication of lamivudine - resistant hepatitis B virus e antigen - positive and - negative strains .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B I I I I O O O O O O O
Immune escape variants of the hepatitis B virus ( HBV ) represent an emerging clinical challenge , because they can be associated with vaccine escape , HBV reactivation , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
failure of diagnostic tests .
O O O O O
Recent data suggest a preferential selection of immune escape mutants in distinct peripheral blood leukocyte compartments of infected individuals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We therefore systematically analyzed the functional impact of the most prevalent immune escape variants , the sG145R and sP120 T mutants , on the viral replication efficacy and antiviral drug
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
susceptibility of common treatment - associated mutants with resistance to lamivudine ( LAM ) and / or HBeAg negativity .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O B O O
Replication - competent HBV strains with sG145R or sP120 T and LAM resistance ( rtM204I or rtL180M / rtM204V ) were generated on an HBeAg - positive and an
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
HBeAg - negative background with precore ( PC ) and basal core promoter ( BCP ) mutants .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The sG145R mutation strongly reduced HBsAg levels and was able to fully restore the impaired replication of LAM - resistant HBV mutants to the levels of wild - type HBV
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and PC or BCP mutations further enhanced viral replication .
