O O O O O O O O O O O
Although the sP120 T substitution also impaired HBsAg secretion , it did not enhance the replication of LAM - resistant clones .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
However , the concomitant occurrence of HBeAg negativity ( PC / BCP ) , sP120 T , and LAM resistance resulted in the restoration of replication to levels of wild
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
- type HBV .
O O O O
In all clones with combined immune escape and LAM resistance mutations , the nucleotide analogues adefovir and tenofovir remained effective in suppressing viral replication in vitro .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O
These findings reveal the differential impact of immune escape variants on the replication and drug susceptibility of complex HBV mutants , supporting the need of close surveillance and treatment adjustment
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in response to the selection of distinct mutational patterns .
O O O O O O O O O O
The effects of sevoflurane on lidocaine - induced convulsions .
O O O B O B O O O O
The influence of sevoflurane on lidocaine - induced convulsions was studied in cats .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O

O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Anti - oxidant effects of atorvastatin in dexamethasone - induced hypertension in the rat .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
1 .
O O
Dexamethasone ( Dex ) - induced hypertension is characterized by endothelial dysfunction associated with nitric oxide ( NO ) deficiency and increased superoxide ( O2 - ) production .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O B O B I O O O
Atorvastatin ( Ato ) possesses pleiotropic properties that have been reported to improve endothelial function through increased availability of NO and reduced O2 - production in various forms of hypertension
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B I O O O O O O
.
O
In the present study , we investigated whether 50 mg / kg per day , p . o . , Ato could prevent endothelial NO synthase ( eNOS ) downregulation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O
and the increase in O2 - in Sprague - Dawley ( SD ) rats , thereby reducing blood pressure .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 .
O O
Male SD rats ( n = 30 ) were treated with Ato ( 50 mg / kg per day in drinking water ) or tap water for 15 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dexamethasone ( 10 microg / kg per day , s . c . ) or saline was started after 4 days in Ato - treated and non - treated rats
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
and continued for 11 - 13 days .
O O O O O O O O
Systolic blood pressure ( SBP ) was measured on alternate days using the tail - cuff method .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Endothelial function was assessed by acetylcholine - induced vasorelaxation and phenylephrine - induced vasoconstriction in aortic segments .
O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O
Vascular eNOS mRNA was assessed by semi - quantitative reverse transcription - polymerase chain reaction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
3 .
O O
In rats treated with Dex alone , SBP was increased from 109 + / -
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
2 to 133 + / -
O O O O O O
2 mmHg on Days 4 and Day 14 , respectively ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the Ato + Dex group , SBP was increased from 113 + / -
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
2 to 119 + / -
O O O O O O
2 mmHg on Days 4 to 14 , respectively ( P < 0 . 001 ) , but was significantly lower than SBP in the group treated with Dex alone
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
( P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O
Endothelial - dependent relaxation and eNOS mRNA expression were greater in the Dex + Ato group than in the Dex only group ( P < 0 . 05 and P
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
< 0 . 0001 , respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O
Aortic superoxide production was lower in the Dex + Ato group compared with the group treated with Dex alone ( P < 0 . 0001 ) .
O B O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
4 .
O O
Treatment with Ato improved endothelial function , reduced superoxide production and reduced SBP in Dex - treated SD rats .
O O B O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O
99mTc - glucarate for detection of isoproterenol - induced myocardial infarction in rats .
B I I O O O B O O O O O O O
Infarct - avid radiopharmaceuticals are necessary for rapid and timely diagnosis of acute myocardial infarction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The animal model used to produce infarction implies artery ligation but chemical induction can be easily obtained with isoproterenol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
A new infarct - avid radiopharmaceutical based on glucaric acid was prepared in the hospital radiopharmacy of the INCMNSZ .
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
99mTc - glucarate was easy to prepare , stable for 96 h and was used to study its biodistribution in rats with isoproterenol - induced acute myocardial infarction .
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Histological studies demonstrated that the rats developed an infarct 18 h after isoproterenol administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The rat biodistribution studies showed a rapid blood clearance via the kidneys .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thirty minutes after 99mTc - glucarate administration the standardised heart uptake value S ( h ) UV was 4 . 7 in infarcted rat heart which is six times more
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
than in normal rats .
O O O O O
ROIs drawn over the gamma camera images showed a ratio of 4 . 4 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The high image quality suggests that high contrast images can be obtained in humans and the 96 h stability makes it an ideal agent to detect , in patients ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
early cardiac infarction .
O O O O
A randomized , placebo - controlled dose - comparison trial of haloperidol for psychosis and disruptive behaviors in Alzheimer 's disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : The goal of this study was to compare the efficacy and side effects of two doses of haloperidol and placebo in the treatment of psychosis and disruptive behaviors
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
in patients with Alzheimer 's disease .
O O O O O O O
METHOD :
O O
In a 6 - week random - assignment , double - blind , placebo - controlled trial ( phase A ) , haloperidol , 2 - 3 mg / day
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
( standard dose ) , and haloperidol , 0 . 50 - 0 . 75 mg / day ( low dose ) , were compared in 71 outpatients with Alzheimer
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
's disease .
O O O
For the subsequent 6 - week double - blind crossover phase ( phase B ) , patients taking standard - or low - dose haloperidol were switched to placebo ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
and patients taking placebo were randomly assigned to standard - or low - dose haloperidol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
RESULTS :
O O
For the 60 patients who completed phase A , standard - dose haloperidol was efficacious and superior to both low - dose haloperidol and placebo for scores on the Brief
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Psychiatric Rating Scale psychosis factor and on psychomotor agitation .
O O O O O O O O O O
Response rates according to three sets of criteria were greater with the standard dose ( 55 % - 60 % ) than the low dose ( 25 % - 35
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% ) and placebo ( 25 % - 30 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The advantage of standard dose over low dose was replicated in phase B .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In phase A , extrapyramidal signs tended to be greater with the standard dose than in the other two conditions , primarily because of a subgroup ( 20 % )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
who developed moderate to severe signs .
O O O O O O O
Low - dose haloperidol did not differ from placebo on any measure of efficacy or side effects .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The results indicated a favorable therapeutic profile for haloperidol in doses of 2 - 3 mg / day , although a subgroup developed moderate to severe extrapyramidal signs .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A starting dose of 1 mg / day with gradual , upward dose titration is recommended .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The narrow therapeutic window observed with haloperidol may also apply to other neuroleptics used in Alzheimer 's disease patients with psychosis and disruptive behaviors .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Individual differences in renal ACE activity in healthy rats predict susceptibility to adriamycin - induced renal damage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
In man , differences in angiotensin - converting enzyme ( ACE ) levels , related to ACE ( I / D ) genotype , are associated with renal prognosis .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This raises the hypothesis that individual differences in renal ACE activity are involved in renal susceptibility to inflicted damage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , we studied the predictive effect of renal ACE activity for the severity of renal damage induced by a single injection of adriamycin in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
METHODS :
O O
Renal ACE activity ( Hip - His - Leu cleavage by cortical homogenates ) was determined by renal biopsy in 27 adult male Wistar rats .
O O O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After 1 week of recovery , proteinuria was induced by adriamycin [ 1 . 5 mg / kg intravenously ( i . v . )
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
n = 18 ; controls , saline i . v .
O O O O O O O O O O O
n = 9 ] .
O O O O O
Proteinuria was measured every 2 weeks .
O O O O O O O
After 12 weeks , rats were sacrificed and their kidneys harvested .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
As anticipated , adriamycin elicited nephrotic range proteinuria , renal interstitial damage and mild focal glomerulosclerosis .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Baseline renal ACE positively correlated with the relative rise in proteinuria after adriamycin ( r = 0 . 62 , P < 0 . 01 ) , renal interstitial alpha
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- smooth muscle actin ( r = 0 . 49 , P < 0 . 05 ) , interstitial macrophage influx ( r = 0 . 56 , P <
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 05 ) , interstitial collagen III ( r = 0 . 53 , P < 0 . 05 ) , glomerular alpha - smooth muscle actin ( r
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
= 0 . 74 , P < 0 . 01 ) and glomerular desmin ( r = 0 . 48 , P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Baseline renal ACE did not correlate with focal glomerulosclerosis ( r = 0 . 22 , NS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In controls , no predictive values for renal parameters were observed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Individual differences in renal ACE activity predict the severity of adriamycin - induced renal damage in this outbred rat strain .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
This supports the assumption that differences in renal ACE activity predispose to a less favourable course of renal damage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical nephrotoxicity of tobramycin and gentamicin .
O O O B O B O
A prospective study .
O O O O
Nearly 3 . 2 million people in this country receive aminoglycoside antibiotics annually .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Gentamicin sulfate and tobramycin sulfate continue to demonstrate ototoxicity and nephrotoxicity in both animal and clinical studies .
B I O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this study , 62 patients with confirmed initial normal renal function and treated with 2 to 5 mg / kg / day of gentamicin sulfate or tobramycin sulfate for
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B I O
a minimum of seven days were followed up prospectively for the development of aminoglycoside - related renal failure , defined as at least a one - third reduction in renal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
function .
O O
In these 62 patients , no other causes for renal failure could be identified .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Five of 33 ( 15 % ) of the tobramycin - treated patients and 16 of 29 ( 55 . 2 % ) of the gentamicin - treated patients had
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
renal failure .
O O O
Thus , gentamicin was associated with renal failure more than three times as often as was tobramycin .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Neuroprotective action of MPEP , a selective mGluR5 antagonist , in methamphetamine - induced dopaminergic neurotoxicity is associated with a decrease in dopamine outflow and inhibition of hyperthermia in rats
O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
.
O
The aim of this study was to examine the role of metabotropic glutamate receptor 5 ( mGluR5 ) in the toxic action of methamphetamine on dopaminergic neurones in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Methamphetamine ( 10 mg / kg sc ) , administered five times , reduced the levels of dopamine and its metabolites in striatal tissue when measured 72 h after the
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
last injection .
O O O
A selective antagonist of mGluR5 , 2 - methyl - 6 - ( phenylethynyl ) pyridine ( MPEP ; 5 mg / kg ip ) , when administered five times
O O O O O O B I I I I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
immediately before each methamphetamine injection reversed the above - mentioned methamphetamine effects .
O O O B O O O O O O B O O
A single MPEP ( 5 mg / kg ip ) injection reduced the basal extracellular dopamine level in the striatum , as well as dopamine release stimulated either by
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O
methamphetamine ( 10 mg / kg sc ) or by intrastriatally administered veratridine ( 100 microM ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Moreover , it transiently diminished the methamphetamine ( 10 mg / kg sc ) - induced hyperthermia and reduced basal body temperature .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MPEP administered into the striatum at high concentrations ( 500 microM ) increased extracellular dopamine levels , while lower concentrations ( 50 - 100 microM ) were devoid of any
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
effect .
O O
The results of this study suggest that the blockade of mGluR5 by MPEP may protect dopaminergic neurones against methamphetamine - induced toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O
Neuroprotection rendered by MPEP may be associated with the reduction of the methamphetamine - induced dopamine efflux in the striatum due to the blockade of extrastriatal mGluR5 , and with
O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a decrease in hyperthermia .
O O O O O
Pharmacokinetics of desipramine HCl when administered with cinacalcet HCl .
O O B I O O O B I O
OBJECTIVE : In vitro work has demonstrated that cinacalcet is a strong inhibitor of cytochrome P450 isoenzyme ( CYP ) 2D6 .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of this study was to evaluate the effect of cinacalcet on CYP2D6 activity , using desipramine as a probe substrate , in healthy subjects .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Seventeen subjects who were genotyped as CYP2D6 extensive metabolizers were enrolled in this randomized , open - label , crossover study to receive a single oral dose of desipramine (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
50 mg ) on two separate occasions , once alone and once after multiple doses of cinacalcet ( 90 mg for 7 days ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Blood samples were obtained predose and up to 72 h postdose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Fourteen subjects completed both treatment arms .
O O O O O O O
Relative to desipramine alone , mean AUC and C ( max ) of desipramine increased 3 . 6 - and 1 . 8 - fold when coadministered with cinacalcet .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The t ( 1 / 2 , z ) of desipramine was longer when desipramine was coadministered with cinacalcet ( 21 . 0 versus 43 . 3 hs ) .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The t ( max ) was similar between the regimens .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Fewer subjects reported adverse events following treatment with desipramine alone than when receiving desipramine with cinacalcet ( 33 versus 86 % ) , the most frequent of which ( nausea
O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and headache ) have been reported for patients treated with either desipramine or cinacalcet .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
CONCLUSION :
O O
This study demonstrates that cinacalcet is a strong inhibitor of CYP2D6 .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
These data suggest that during concomitant treatment with cinacalcet , dose adjustment may be necessary for drugs that demonstrate a narrow therapeutic index and are metabolized by CYP2D6 .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Proteomic analysis of striatal proteins in the rat model of L - DOPA - induced dyskinesia .
O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O
L - DOPA - induced dyskinesia ( LID ) is among the motor complications that arise in Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) patients after a prolonged treatment with
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
L - DOPA .
B I I O
To this day , transcriptome analysis has been performed in a rat model of LID [ Neurobiol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dis .
O O
, 17 ( 2004 ) , 219 ] but information regarding the proteome is still lacking .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the present study , we investigated the changes occurring at the protein level in striatal samples obtained from the unilaterally 6 - hydroxydopamine - lesion rat model of PD
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O
treated with saline , L - DOPA or bromocriptine using two - dimensional difference gel electrophoresis and mass spectrometry ( MS ) .
O O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Rats treated with L - DOPA were allocated to two groups based on the presence or absence of LID .
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Among the 2000 spots compared for statistical difference , 67 spots were significantly changed in abundance and identified using matrix - assisted laser desorption / ionization time - of -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
flight MS , atmospheric pressure matrix - assisted laser desorption / ionization and HPLC coupled tandem MS ( LC / MS / MS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Out of these 67 proteins , LID significantly changed the expression level of five proteins : alphabeta - crystalin , gamma - enolase , guanidoacetate methyltransferase , vinculin , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
proteasome alpha - 2 subunit .
O O O O O O
Complementary techniques such as western immunoblotting and immunohistochemistry were performed to investigate the validity of the data obtained using the proteomic approach .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion , this study provides new insights into the protein changes occurring in LID .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pseudo - allergic reactions to corticosteroids : diagnosis and alternatives .
O O O O O B O O O O O
Two patients treated with parenteral paramethasone ( Triniol ) and dexamethasone ( Sedionbel ) are described .
O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O
A few minutes after administration of the drugs , they presented urticaria ( patients 1 and 2 ) and conjunctivitis ( patient 1 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of our study was to determine the cause of the patients ' reactions , the immunological mechanisms involved and whether these patients would be able to tolerate any
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
kind of corticoid .
O O O O
Clinical examinations and skin , oral and parenteral challenges with different corticosteroids and ELISA tests were performed .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
In the two patients , skin and ELISA tests with paramethasone were negative , as was the prick test with each of its excipients .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A single - blind parenteral challenge with Triniol was positive in both patients after the administration of 1 ml of the drug , and negative with its excipients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We also carried out oral and parenteral challenges with other corticosteroids and found intolerance to some of them .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that paramethasone caused pseudoallergic reactions in our patients .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
Corticosteroids different from paramethasone also produced hypersensitivity reactions in these patients ; however , a few of them were tolerated .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The basic mechanisms of those reactions are not yet fully understood .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
To our knowledge , this is the first report of a pseudo - allergy caused by paramethasone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Valproic acid induced encephalopathy - - 19 new cases in Germany from 1994 to 2003 - - a side effect associated to VPA - therapy not only in young children
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
.
O
Valproic acid ( VPA ) is a broad - spectrum antiepileptic drug and is usually well - tolerated .
B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Rare serious complications may occur in some patients , including haemorrhagic pancreatitis , bone marrow suppression , VPA - induced hepatotoxicity and VPA - induced encephalopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O
The typical signs of VPA - induced encephalopathy are impaired consciousness , sometimes marked EEG background slowing , increased seizure frequency , with or without hyperammonemia .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There is still no proof of causative effect of VPA in patients with encephalopathy , but only of an association with an assumed causal relation .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report 19 patients with VPA - associated encephalopathy in Germany from the years 1994 to 2003 , none of whom had been published previously .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Haemolytic - uraemic syndrome after treatment with metronidazole .
O O O O O O O B O
This paper describes the clinical features of six children who developed the haemolytic - uraemic syndrome after treatment with metronidazole .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
These children were older and were more likely to have undergone recent bowel surgery than are other children with this condition .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
While the involvement of metronidazole in the aetiology of the haemolytic - uraemic syndrome is not established firmly , the action of this drug in sensitizing tissues to oxidation injury
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and the reported evidence of oxidation changes in the haemolytic - uraemic syndrome suggest a possible link between metronidazole treatment and some cases of the haemolytic - uraemic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Risk factors of sensorineural hearing loss in preterm infants .
O O O O O O O O O O
Among 547 preterm infants of < or = 34 weeks gestation born between 1987 and 1991 , 8 children ( 1 . 46 % ) developed severe progressive and bilateral
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
sensorineural hearing loss .
O O O O
Perinatal risk factors of infants with hearing loss were compared with those of two control groups matched for gestation and birth weight and for perinatal complications .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our observations demonstrated an association of hearing loss with a higher incidence of perinatal complications .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ototoxicity appeared closely related to a prolonged administration and higher total dose of ototoxic drugs , particularly aminoglycosides and furosemide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Finally , we strongly recommend to prospectively and regularly perform audiologic assessment in sick preterm children as hearing loss is of delayed onset and in most cases bilateral and severe
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Pharmacokinetic and clinical studies in patients with cimetidine - associated mental confusion .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
15 cases of cimetidine - associated mental confusion have been reported .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
In order that this syndrome might be investigated changes in mental status ( M . S . ) were correlated with serum concentrations and renal and hepatic function in 36
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
patients , 30 patients had no M . S . change on cimetidine and 6 had moderate to severe changes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
These 6 patients had both renal and liver dysfunction ( P less than 0 . 05 ) , as well as cimetidine trough - concentrations of more than 1 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
25 microgram / ml ( P less than 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The severity of M . S . changes increased as trough - concentrations rose , 5 patients had lumbar puncture .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The cerebrospinal fluid : serum ratio of cimetidine concentrations was 0 . 24 : 1 and indicates that cimetidine passes the blood - brain barrier ; it also raises the
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
possibility that M . S . changes are due to blockade of histamine H2 - receptors in the central nervous system .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Patients likely to have both raised trough - concentrations and mental confusion are those with both severe renal and hepatic dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
They should be closely observed and should be given reduced doses of cimetidine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Different lobular distributions of altered hepatocyte tight junctions in rat models of intrahepatic and extrahepatic cholestasis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hepatocyte tight junctions ( TJs ) , the only intercellular barrier between the sinusoidal and the canalicular spaces , play a key role in bile formation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although hepatocyte TJs are impaired in cholestasis , attempts to localize the precise site of hepatocyte TJ damage by freeze - fracture electron microscopy have produced limited information .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recently , several TJ - associated proteins like ZO - 1 and 7H6 have been identified and characterized .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Immunolocalization of 7H6 appears to closely correlate with paracellular permeability .
O O O O O O O O O O O
We used rat models of intrahepatic cholestasis by ethinyl estradiol ( EE ) treatment and extrahepatic cholestasis by bile duct ligation ( BDL ) to precisely determine the site of
O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
TJ damage .
O O O
Alterations in hepatocyte TJs were assessed by double - immunolabeling for 7H6 and ZO - 1 using a confocal laser scanning microscope .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In control rats , immunostaining for 7H6 and ZO - 1 colocalized to outline bile canaliculi in a continuous fashion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , 7H6 and ZO - 1 immunostaining was more discontinuous , outlining the bile canaliculi after BDL .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Immunostaining for 7H6 , not ZO - 1 , decreased and predominantly appeared as discrete signals in the submembranous cytoplasm of periportal hepatocytes after BDL .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After EE treatment , changes in immunostaining for 7H6 and ZO - 1 were similar to those seen in periportal hepatocytes after BDL , but distributed more diffusely throughout the
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
lobule .
O O
This study is the first to demonstrate that impairment of hepatocyte TJs occurs heterogenously in the liver lobule after BDL and suggests that BDL and EE treatments produce different lobular
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
distributions of increased paracellular permeability .
O O O O O O
Long term audiological evaluation of beta - thalassemic patients .
O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : The objective of this study was to identify the incidence and to monitor the progression of hearing loss in children and young adults with beta - thalassemia major
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
METHODS :
O O
One hundred and four ( 104 ) patients aged 6 - 35 years ( mean 17 , 2 years ) participated in the study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All patients were on a regular transfusion - chelation program maintaining a mean hemoglobin level of 9 . 5 gr / dl .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Subjects were receiving desferrioxamine ( DFO ) chelation treatment with a mean daily dose of 50 - 60 mg / kg , 5 - 6 days a week during the
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
first six years of the study , which was then reduced to 40 - 50 mg / kg for the following eight years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients were followed for 8 - 14 years .
O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Overall , 21 out of 104 patients ( 20 . 2 % ) presented with high frequency sensorineural hearing loss ( SNHL ) , either unilateral or bilateral .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No ototoxic factor , other than DFO , was present in any of the patients .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Patients with SNHL presented with relatively lower serum ferritin levels than those with normal hearing , however , no statistically significant difference was observed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Subjects with SNHL were submitted to DFO reduction or temporary withdrawal .
O O O O O O B O O O O O
Following intervention , 7 out of 21 affected patients recovered , 10 remained stable and 4 demonstrated aggravation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
The findings are indicative of DFO 's contributing role in the development of hearing impairment .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Regular audiologic evaluation is imperative in all thalassemic patients so that early changes may be recognized and treatment may be judiciously adjusted in order to prevent or reverse hearing impairment
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Design and analysis of the HYPREN - trial : safety of enalapril and prazosin in the initial treatment phase of patients with congestive heart failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Since the introduction of angiotensin converting enzyme ( ACE ) inhibitors into the adjunctive treatment of patients with congestive heart failure , cases of severe hypotension , especially on the
O O O O B I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
first day of treatment , have occasionally been reported .
O O O O O O O O O O
To assess the safety of the ACE inhibitor enalapril a multicenter , randomized , prazosin - controlled trial was designed that compared the incidence and severity of symptomatic hypotension on
O O O O O O B I B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the first day of treatment .
O O O O O O
Trial medication was 2 . 5 mg enalapril or 0 . 5 prazosin .
O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
Subjects were 1210 inpatients with New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) functional class II and III .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients who received enalapril experienced clinically and statistically significantly less symptomatic hypotension ( 5 . 2 % ) than the patients who received prazosin ( 12 . 9 % )
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
.
O
All patients recovered .
O O O O
It was concluded that treatment with enalapril was well tolerated and it is , therefore , unreasonable to restrict the initiation of treatment with enalapril to inpatients .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Antagonism between interleukin 3 and erythropoietin in mice with azidothymidine - induced anemia and in bone marrow endothelial cells .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Azidothymidine ( AZT ) - induced anemia in mice can be reversed by the administration of IGF - IL - 3 ( fusion protein of insulin - like growth factor
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
II ( IGF II ) and interleukin 3 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
Although interleukin 3 ( IL - 3 ) and erythropoietin ( EPO ) are known to act synergistically on hematopoietic cell proliferation in vitro , injection of IGF - IL
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- 3 and EPO in AZT - treated mice resulted in a reduction of red cells and an increase of plasma EPO levels as compared to animals treated with IGF
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- IL - 3 or EPO alone .
O O O O O O O O
We tested the hypothesis that the antagonistic effect of IL - 3 and EPO on erythroid cells may be mediated by endothelial cells .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bovine liver erythroid cells were cultured on monolayers of human bone marrow endothelial cells previously treated with EPO and IGF - IL - 3 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was a significant reduction of thymidine incorporation into both erythroid and endothelial cells in cultures pre - treated with IGF - IL - 3 and EPO .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Endothelial cell culture supernatants separated by ultrafiltration and ultracentrifugation from cells treated with EPO and IL - 3 significantly reduced thymidine incorporation into erythroid cells as compared to identical fractions
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
obtained from the media of cells cultured with EPO alone .
O O O O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that endothelial cells treated simultaneously with EPO and IL - 3 have a negative effect on erythroid cell production .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O

O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O

O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Basal frequency ( BF ) evaluated by surface electrogram was 223 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 beats / min .
O O O O O
in control Krebs - Ringer containing 137 mM Na and 1 . 35 mM Ca ( N ) .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O
It decreased by 16 + / -
O O O O O O O

O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O

O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O

O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O

O O O
All negative chronotropic effects were BF - dependent .
O O O O O O O O O

O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O

N .
O O
The results indicate that rat atrial spontaneous beating is more dependent on [ Na ] o than on [ Ca ] o in a range of + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
50 % of their normal concentration .
O O O O O O O
Also the enhancement of verapamil effects on atrial beating was more pronounced at LNa than at LCa . ( ABSTRACT TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS )
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sodium status influences chronic amphotericin B nephrotoxicity in rats .
B O O O B I O O O O
The nephrotoxic potential of amphotericin B ( 5 mg / kg per day intraperitoneally for 3 weeks ) has been investigated in salt - depleted , normal - salt ,
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and salt - loaded rats .
O O O O O O
In salt - depleted rats , amphotericin B decreased creatinine clearance linearly with time , with an 85 % reduction by week 3 .
O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , in normal - salt rats creatinine clearance was decreased but to a lesser extent at week 2 and 3 , and in salt - loaded rats
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
creatinine clearance did not change for 2 weeks and was decreased by 43 % at week 3 .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All rats in the sodium - depleted group had histopathological evidence of patchy tubular cytoplasmic degeneration in tubules that was not observed in any normal - salt or salt -
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
loaded rat .
O O O
Concentrations of amphotericin B in plasma were not significantly different among the three groups at any time during the study .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , at the end of 3 weeks , amphotericin B levels in the kidneys and liver were significantly higher in salt - depleted and normal - salt rats than
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
those in salt - loaded rats , with plasma / kidney ratios of 21 , 14 , and 8 in salt - depleted , normal - salt , and salt
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- loaded rats , respectively .
O O O O O O
In conclusion , reductions in creatinine clearance and renal amphotericin B accumulation after chronic amphotericin B administration were enhanced by salt depletion and attenuated by sodium loading in rats .
O O O O O B O O O B I O O O B I O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Reversible inferior colliculus lesion in metronidazole - induced encephalopathy : magnetic resonance findings on diffusion - weighted and fluid attenuated inversion recovery imaging .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
This is to present reversible inferior colliculus lesions in metronidazole - induced encephalopathy , to focus on the diffusion - weighted imaging ( DWI ) and fluid attenuated inversion recovery
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( FLAIR ) imaging .
O O O O O
MATERIALS AND METHODS :
O O O O
From November 2005 to September 2007 , 8 patients ( 5 men and 3 women ) were diagnosed as having metronidazole - induced encephalopathy ( age range ; 43 -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
78 years ) .
O O O O
They had been taking metronidazole ( total dosage , 45 - 120 g ; duration , 30 days to 2 months ) to treat the infection in various organs .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Initial brain magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) were obtained after the hospitalization , including DWI ( 8 / 8 ) , apparent diffusion coefficient ( ADC ) map (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 / 8 ) , FLAIR ( 7 / 8 ) , and T2 - weighted image ( 8 / 8 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Follow - up MRIs were performed on 5 patients from third to 14th days after discontinuation of metronidazole administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Findings of initial and follow - up MRIs were retrospectively evaluated by 2 neuroradiologists by consensus , to analyze the presence of abnormal signal intensities , their locations , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
signal changes on follow - up images .
O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Initial MRIs showed abnormal high signal intensities on DWI and FLAIR ( or T2 - weighted image ) at the dentate nucleus ( 8 / 8 ) , inferior colliculus
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 6 / 8 ) , corpus callosum ( 2 / 8 ) , pons ( 2 / 8 ) , medulla ( 1 / 8 ) , and bilateral
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cerebral white matter ( 1 / 8 ) .
O O O O O O O O O
High - signal intensity lesions on DWI tended to show low signal intensity on ADC map ( 3 / 4 ) , but in one patient , high signal intensity
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
was shown at bilateral dentate nuclei on not only DWI but also ADC map .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All the lesions in dentate , inferior colliculus , pons , and medullas had been resolved completely on follow - up MRIs in 5 patients , but in 1 patient
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of them , corpus callosal lesion persisted .
O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Reversible inferior colliculus lesions could be considered as the characteristic for metronidazole - induced encephalopathy , next to the dentate nucleus involvement .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Comparison of the respiratory effects of i . v .
O O O O O O O O O O
infusions of morphine and regional analgesia by extradural block .
O O B O O O O O O O
The incidence of postoperative respiratory apnoea was compared between five patients receiving a continuous i . v .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
infusion of morphine ( mean 73 . 6 mg ) and five patients receiving a continuous extradural infusion of 0 . 25 % bupivacaine ( mean 192 mg ) in
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
the 24 - h period following upper abdominal surgery .
O O O O O O O O O O
Monitoring consisted of airflow detection by a carbon dioxide analyser , chest wall movement detected by pneumatic capsules , and continuous electrocardiograph recorded with a Holter ambulatory monitor .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both obstructive ( P less than 0 . 05 ) and central apnoea ( P less than 0 . 05 ) occurred more frequently in patients who had a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
morphine infusion .
B O O
There was also a higher incidence of tachyarrhythmias ( P less than 0 . 05 ) and ventricular ectopic beats ( P less than 0 . 05 ) in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
morphine infusion group .
B O O O
Magnetic resonance volumetry of the cerebellum in epileptic patients after phenytoin overdosages .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The aim of this study was to evaluate the relationship between phenytoin medication and cerebellar atrophy in patients who had experienced clinical intoxication .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Five females and 6 males , 21 - 59 years of age , were examined with a 1 . 5 - T whole - body system using a circular polarized
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
head coil .
O O O
Conventional spin echo images were acquired in the sagittal and transverse orientation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , we performed a high - resolution 3D gradient echo , T1 - weighted sequences at a 1 - mm slice thickness .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The images were subsequently processed to obtain volumetric data for the cerebellum .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cerebellar volume for the patient group ranged between 67 . 66 and 131 . 08 ml ( mean 108 . 9 ml ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition 3D gradient echo data sets from 10 healthy male and
O O O O O O O O O O O O
10 healthy female age - matched volunteers were used to compare cerebellar volumes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Using linear regression we found that no correlation exists between seizure duration , elevation of phenytoin serum levels and cerebellar volume .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
However , multiple regression for the daily dosage , duration of phenytoin treatment and cerebellar volume revealed a correlation of these parameters .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
We conclude that phenytoin overdosage does not necessarily result in cerebellar atrophy and it is unlikely that phenytoin medication was the only cause of cerebellar atrophy in the remaining patients
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Quantitative morphometric studies of the cerebellum provide valuable insights into the pathogenesis of cerebellar disorders .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Evaluation of cardiac troponin I and T levels as markers of myocardial damage in doxorubicin - induced cardiomyopathy rats , and their relationship with echocardiographic and histological findings .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Cardiac troponins I ( cTnI ) and T
O O O O O O O O
( cTnT ) have been shown to be highly sensitive and specific markers of myocardial cell injury .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We investigated the diagnostic value of cTnI and cTnT for the diagnosis of myocardial damage in a rat model of doxorubicin ( DOX ) - induced cardiomyopathy , and we
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
examined the relationship between serial cTnI
O O O O O O
and cTnT with the development of cardiac disorders monitored by echocardiography and histological examinations in this model .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Thirty - five Wistar rats were given 1 . 5 mg / kg DOX , i . v . , weekly for up to 8 weeks for a total cumulative
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dose of 12 mg / kg BW .
O O O O O O O O
Ten rats received saline as a control group .
O O O O O O O O O
cTnI was measured with Access ( R )
O O O O O O O O
( ng / ml ) and a research immunoassay ( pg / ml ) , and compared with cTnT
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, CK - MB mass and CK .
O O O O O O O O
By using transthoracic echocardiography , anterior and posterior wall thickness , LV diameters and LV fractional shortening ( FS ) were measured in all rats before DOX or saline ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
and at weeks 6 and 9 after treatment in all surviving rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Histology was performed in DOX - rats at 6 and 9 weeks after the last DOX dose and in all controls .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Eighteen of the DOX rats died prematurely of general toxicity during the 9 - week period .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
End - diastolic ( ED ) and end - systolic ( ES ) LV diameters / BW significantly increased , whereas LV FS was decreased after 9 weeks in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DOX group ( p < 0 . 001 ) .
B O O O O O O O O O
These parameters remained unchanged in controls .
O O O O O O O
Histological evaluation of hearts from all rats given DOX revealed significant slight degrees of perivascular and interstitial fibrosis .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
In 7 of the 18 rats , degeneration and myocyte vacuolisation were found .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Only five of the controls exhibited evidence of very slight perivascular fibrosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A significant rise in cTnT was found in DOX rats after cumulative doses of 7 . 5 and 12 mg / kg in comparison with baseline ( p < 0
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 05 ) .
O O O O
cTnT
O
found in rats after 12 mg / kg were significantly greater than that found after 7 . 5 mg / kg DOX .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Maximal cTnI ( pg / ml ) and cTnT
O O O O O O O O O
levels were significantly increased in DOX rats compared with controls ( p = 0 . 006 , 0 . 007 ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cTnI
O
( ng / ml ) , CK - MB mass and CK remained unchanged in DOX rats compared with controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
All markers remained stable in controls .
O O O O O O O
Analysis of data revealed a significant correlation between maximal cTnT and ED and ES LV diameters / BW ( r = 0 . 81 and 0 . 65 ; p
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
< 0 . 0001 ) .
O O O O O O
A significant relationship was observed between maximal cTnT
O O O O O O O O
and the extent of myocardial morphological changes , and between LV diameters / BW and histological findings .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Among markers of ischemic injury after DOX in rats , cTnT showed the greatest ability to detect myocardial damage assessed by echocardiographic detection and histological changes .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although there was a discrepancy between the amount of cTnI and cTnT after DOX , probably due to heterogeneity in cross - reactivities of mAbs to various cTnI and cTnT
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
forms , it is likely that cTnT in rats after DOX indicates cell damage determined by the magnitude of injury induced and that cTnT should be a useful marker for
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the prediction of experimentally induced cardiotoxicity and possibly for cardioprotective experiments .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Calcineurin - inhibitor induced pain syndrome ( CIPS ) : a severe disabling complication after organ transplantation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bone pain after transplantation is a frequent complication that can be caused by several diseases .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment strategies depend on the correct diagnosis of the pain .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Nine patients with severe pain in their feet , which was registered after transplantation , were investigated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bone scans showed an increased tracer uptake of the foot bones .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Magnetic resonance imaging demonstrated bone marrow oedema in the painful bones .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pain was not explained by other diseases causing foot pain , like reflex sympathetic dystrophy , polyneuropathy , Morton 's neuralgia , gout , osteoporosis , avascular necrosis , intermittent
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
claudication , orthopaedic foot deformities , stress fractures , and hyperparathyroidism .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The reduction of cyclosporine - or tacrolimus trough levels and the administration of calcium channel blockers led to relief of pain .
O O O B O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The Calcineurin - inhibitor Induced Pain Syndrome ( CIPS ) is a rare but severe side effect of cyclosporine or tacrolimus and is accurately diagnosed by its typical presentation ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
magnetic resonance imaging and bone scans .
O O O O O O O
Incorrect diagnosis of the syndrome will lead to a significant reduction of life quality in patients suffering from CIPS .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The haemodynamic effects of propofol in combination with ephedrine in elderly patients ( ASA groups 3 and 4 ) .
O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The marked vasodilator and negative inotropic effects of propofol are disadvantages in frail elderly patients .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
We investigated the safety and efficacy of adding different doses of ephedrine to propofol in order to obtund the hypotensive response .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
The haemodynamic effects of adding 15 , 20 or 25 mg of ephedrine to 200 mg of propofol were compared to control in 40 ASA 3 / 4 patients over
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
60 years presenting for genito - urinary surgery .
O O O O O O O O O
The addition of ephedrine to propofol appears to be an effective method of obtunding the hypotensive response to propofol at all doses used in this study .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
However , marked tachycardia associated with the use of ephedrine in combination with propofol occurred in the majority of patients , occasionally reaching high levels in individual patients .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Due to the risk of this tachycardia inducing myocardial ischemia , we would not recommend the use in elderly patients of any of the ephedrine / propofol / mixtures studied
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
.
O
Neurotoxicity of halogenated hydroxyquinolines : clinical analysis of cases reported outside Japan .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O
An analysis is presented of 220 cases of possible neurotoxic reactions to halogenated hydroxyquinolines reported from outside Japan .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
In 80 cases insufficient information was available for adequate comment and in 29 a relationship to the administration of clioquinol could be excluded .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Of the remainder , a relationship to clioquinol was considered probable in 42 and possible in 69 cases .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In six of the probable cases the neurological disturbance consisted of an acute reversible encephalopathy usually related to the ingestion of a high dose of clioquinol over a short period
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
.
O
The most common manifestation , observed in 15 further cases , was isolated optic atrophy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This was most frequently found in children , many of whom had received clioquinol as treatment for acrodermatitis enteropathica .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
In the remaining cases , a combination of myelopathy , visual disturbance , and peripheral neuropathy was the most common manifestation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Isolated myelopathy or peripheral neuropathy , or these manifestations occurring together , were infrequent .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The onset of all manifestations ( except toxic encephalopathy ) was usually subacute , with subsequent partial recovery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Older subjects tended to display more side effects .
O O O O O O O O O
The full syndrome of subacute myelo - optic neuropathy was more frequent in women , but they tended to have taken greater quantities of the drug .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Epileptic seizures following cortical application of fibrin sealants containing tranexamic acid in rats .
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Fibrin sealants ( FS ) derived from human plasma are frequently used in neurosurgery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In order to increase clot stability , FS typically contain aprotinin , a natural fibrinolysis inhibitor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recently , synthetic fibrinolysis inhibitors such as tranexamic acid ( tAMCA ) have been considered as substitutes for aprotinin .
O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O
However , tAMCA has been shown to cause epileptic seizures .
O O B O O O O O O O O
We wanted to study whether tAMCA retains its convulsive action if incorporated into a FS .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
METHOD :
O O
FS containing aprotinin or different concentrations of tAMCA ( 0 . 5 - 47 . 5 mg / ml ) were applied to the pial surface of the cortex of
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
anaesthetized rats .
O O O
The response of the animals was evaluated using electroencephalography and by monitoring the clinical behaviour during and after recovery from anaesthesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
FINDINGS : FS containing tAMCA caused paroxysmal brain activity which was associated with distinct convulsive behaviours .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
The degree of these seizures increased with increasing concentration of tAMCA .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
Thus , FS containing 47 . 5 mg / ml tAMCA evoked generalized seizures in all tested rats ( n = 6 ) while the lowest concentration of tAMCA (
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
0 . 5 mg / ml ) only evoked brief episodes of jerk - correlated convulsive potentials in 1 of 6 rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , FS containing aprotinin did not evoke any paroxysmal activity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
INTERPRETATION :
O O
Tranexamic acid retains its convulsive action within FS .
B I O O O O O O O
Thus , use of FS containing tAMCA for surgery within or close to the CNS may pose a substantial risk to the patient .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A diet promoting sugar dependency causes behavioral cross - sensitization to a low dose of amphetamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Previous research in this laboratory has shown that a diet of intermittent excessive sugar consumption produces a state with neurochemical and behavioral similarities to drug dependency .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The present study examined whether female rats on various regimens of sugar access would show behavioral cross - sensitization to a low dose of amphetamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
After a 30 - min baseline measure of locomotor activity ( day 0 ) , animals were maintained on a cyclic diet of 12 - h deprivation followed by 12
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- h access to 10 % sucrose solution and chow pellets ( 12 h access starting 4 h after onset of the dark period ) for 21 days .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Locomotor activity was measured again for 30 min at the beginning of days 1 and 21 of sugar access .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Beginning on day 22 , all rats were maintained on ad libitum chow .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nine days later locomotor activity was measured in response to a single low dose of amphetamine ( 0 . 5 mg / kg ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The animals that had experienced cyclic sucrose and chow were hyperactive in response to amphetamine compared with four control groups ( ad libitum 10 % sucrose and chow followed by
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
amphetamine injection , cyclic chow followed by amphetamine injection , ad libitum chow with amphetamine , or cyclic 10 % sucrose and chow with a saline injection ) .
B O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that a diet comprised of alternating deprivation and access to a sugar solution and chow produces bingeing on sugar that leads to a long lasting state of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
increased sensitivity to amphetamine , possibly due to a lasting alteration in the dopamine system .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O
D - penicillamine - induced angiopathy in rats .
B I I O O O O O O
The effect of high dose D - penicillamine treatment on aortic permeability to albumin and on the ultrastructure of the vessel .
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Male Sprague - Dawley rats were treated with D - penicillamine ( D - pen ) 500 mg / kg / day for 10 or 42 days .
O O O O O O O O B I I O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pair fed rats served as controls .
O O O O O O O
Changes in aortic morphology were examined by light - and transmission - electron microscopy ( TEM ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , the endothelial permeability and the penetration through the aortic wall of albumin were studied 10 minutes , 24 and 48 hours after i . v . injection
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of human serum 131I - albumin ( 131I - HSA ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
TEM revealed extensive elastolysis in the arterial wall of D - pen - treated rats , consistent with an inhibitory effect on crosslink formation .
O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In experimental animals excess deposition of collagen and glycoaminoglycans was observed in the subendothelial and medial layer of the aortic wall , together with prominent basal membrane substance around aortic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
smooth muscle cells .
O O O O
The aorta / serum - ratio and the radioactive build - up 24 and 48 hours after injection of 131I - HSA was reduced in animals treated with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
D - pen for 42 days , indicating an impeded transmural transport of tracer which may be caused by a steric exclusion effect of abundant hyaluronate .
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The endothelial ultrastructure was unaffected by D - pen , and no differences in aortic 131I - HSA radioactivity or aorta / serum - ratio were recorded between experimental and
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
control groups 10 minutes after tracer injection , indicating that the permeability of the endothelial barrier to albumin remained unaffected by D - pen treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O
These observations support the hypothesis that treatment with high doses of D - pen may induce a fibroproliferative response in rat aorta , possibly by an inhibitory effect on the
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cross - linking of collagen and elastin .
O O O O O O O O
Brain natriuretic peptide is a predictor of anthracycline - induced cardiotoxicity .
O O O O O O O B O O O O
Anthracyclines are effective antineoplastic drugs , but they frequently cause dose - related cardiotoxicity .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The cardiotoxicity of conventional anthracycline therapy highlights a need to search for methods that are highly sensitive and capable of predicting cardiac dysfunction .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We measured the plasma level of brain natriuretic peptide ( BNP ) to determine whether BNP might serve as a simple diagnostic indicator of anthracycline - induced cardiotoxicity in patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
with acute leukemia treated with a daunorubicin ( DNR ) - containing regimen .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
Thirteen patients with acute leukemia were treated with a DNR - containing regimen .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Cardiac functions were evaluated with radionuclide angiography before chemotherapies .
O O O O O O O O O O
The plasma levels of atrial natriuretic peptide ( ANP ) and BNP were measured at the time of radionuclide angiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Three patients developed congestive heart failure after the completion of chemotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Five patients were diagnosed as having subclinical heart failure after the completion of chemotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The plasma levels of BNP in all the patients with clinical and subclinical heart failure increased above the normal limit ( 40 pg / ml ) before the detection of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
clinical or subclinical heart failure by radionuclide angiography .
O O O O O O O O O
On the other hand , BNP did not increase in the patients without heart failure given DNR , even at more than 700 mg / m ( 2 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The plasma level of ANP did not always increase in all the patients with clinical and subclinical heart failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These preliminary results suggest that BNP may be useful as an early and sensitive indicator of anthracycline - induced cardiotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Antibacterial medication use during pregnancy and risk of birth defects : National Birth Defects Prevention Study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To estimate the association between antibacterial medications and selected birth defects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
DESIGN , SETTING , AND PARTICIPANTS : Population - based , multisite , case - control study of women who had pregnancies affected by 1 of more than 30 eligible
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
major birth defects identified via birth defect surveillance programs in 10 states ( n = 13 155 ) and control women randomly selected from the same geographical regions ( n
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
= 4941 ) .
O O O O
MAIN EXPOSURE :
O O O
Reported maternal use of antibacterials ( 1 month before pregnancy through the end of the first trimester ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE :
O O O O
Odds ratios ( ORs ) measuring the association between antibacterial use and selected birth defects adjusted for potential confounders .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The reported use of antibacterials increased during pregnancy , peaking during the third month .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sulfonamides were associated with anencephaly ( adjusted OR [ AOR ] =
B O O O O O O O O O O O
3 . 4 ; 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] , 1 . 3 - 8 . 8 ) , hypoplastic left heart syndrome ( AOR = 3 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 3 - 7 . 6 ) , coarctation of the aorta ( AOR = 2 . 7 ; 95 % CI ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 . 3 - 5 . 6 ) , choanal atresia ( AOR = 8 . 0 ; 95 % CI , 2 . 7 - 23 . 5 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, transverse limb deficiency ( AOR = 2 . 5 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 0 - 5 . 9 ) , and diaphragmatic hernia ( AOR =
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 4 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 1 - 5 . 4 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nitrofurantoins were associated with anophthalmia or microphthalmos ( AOR = 3 . 7 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 1 - 12 . 2 ) , hypoplastic left heart
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
syndrome ( AOR = 4 . 2 ; 95 % CI , 1 . 9 - 9 . 1 ) , atrial septal defects ( AOR = 1 . 9
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
; 95 % CI , 1 . 1 - 3 . 4 ) , and cleft lip with cleft palate ( AOR = 2 . 1 ; 95 % CI
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, 1 . 2 - 3 . 9 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
Other antibacterial agents that showed associations included erythromycins ( 2 defects ) , penicillins ( 1 defect ) , cephalosporins ( 1 defect ) , and quinolones ( 1 defect
O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O
) .
O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Reassuringly , penicillins , erythromycins , and cephalosporins , although used commonly by pregnant women , were not associated with many birth defects .
O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sulfonamides and nitrofurantoins were associated with several birth defects , indicating a need for additional scrutiny .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Incidence of neoplasms in patients with rheumatoid arthritis exposed to different treatment regimens .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Immunosuppressive drugs have been used during the last 30 years in treatment of patients with severe rheumatoid arthritis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The drugs commonly used are cyclophosphamide and chlorambucil ( alkylating agents ) , azathioprine ( purine analogue ) , and methotrexate ( folic acid analogue ) .
O O O O O B O B O B I O O B O B O O O O B O B I O O O
There is evidence that all four immunosuppressive drugs can reduce synovitis , but disease activity almost always recurs after therapy is stopped .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Since adverse reactions are frequent , less than 50 percent of patients are able to continue a particular drug for more than one year .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Since it takes three to 12 months to achieve maximal effects , those patients who are unable to continue the drug receive little benefit from it .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients treated with alkylating agents have an increased risk of development of acute nonlymphocytic leukemia , and both alkylating agents and azathioprine are associated with the development of non -
O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O
Hodgkin 's lymphoma .
O O O O
Cyclophosphamide therapy increases the risk of carcinoma of the bladder .
B O O O O O O O O O O
There have been several long - term studies of patients with rheumatoid arthritis treated with azathioprine and cyclophosphamide and the incidence of most of the common cancers is not increased
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Data on the possible increased risk of malignancy in rheumatoid arthritis are still being collected , and until further information is available , the use of immunosuppressive drugs , particularly
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
alkylating agents , in the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis should be reserved for patients with severe progressive disease or life - threatening complications .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patterns of hepatic injury induced by methyldopa .
O O O O O O B O
Twelve patients with liver disease related to methyldopa were seen between 1967 and 1977 .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Illness occurred within 1 - - 9 weeks of commencement of therapy in 9 patients , the remaining 3 patients having received the drug for 13 months , 15 months
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and 7 years before experiencing symptoms .
O O O O O O O
Jaundice with tender hepatomegaly , usually preceded by symptoms of malaise , anorexia , nausea and vomiting , and associated with upper abdominal pain , was an invariable finding in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
all patients .
O O O
Biochemical liver function tests indicated hepatocellular necrosis and correlated with histopathological evidence of hepatic injury , the spectrum of which ranged from fatty change and focal hepatocellular necrosis to massive
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
hepatic necrosis .
O O O
Most patients showed moderate to severe acute hepatitis or chronic active hepatitis with associated cholestasis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The drug was withdrawn on presentation to hospital in 11 patients , with rapid clinical improvement in 9 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One patient died , having presented in hepatic failure , and another , who had been taking methyldopa for 7 years , showed slower clinical and biochemical resolution over a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
period of several months .
O O O O O
The remaining patient in the series developed fulminant hepatitis when the drug was accidentally recommenced 1 year after a prior episode of methyldopa - induced hepatitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
In this latter patient , and in 2 others , the causal relationship between methyldopa and hepatic dysfunction was proved with the recurrence of hepatitis within 2 weeks of re
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- exposure to the drug .
O O O O O O
A phase I / II study of paclitaxel plus cisplatin as first - line therapy for head and neck cancers : preliminary results .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Improved outcomes among patients with head and neck carcinomas require investigations of new drugs for induction therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Preliminary results of an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group study of single - agent paclitaxel (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Taxol ; Bristol - Myers Squibb Company , Princeton , NJ ) reported a 37 % response rate in patients with head and neck cancer , and the paclitaxel /
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
cisplatin combination has been used successfully and has significantly improved median response duration in ovarian cancer patients .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We initiated a phase I / II trial to determine the response and toxicity of escalating paclitaxel doses combined with fixed - dose cisplatin with granulocyte colony - stimulating factor
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O
support in patients with untreated locally advanced inoperable head and neck carcinoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To date , 23 men with a median age of 50 years and good performance status have entered the trial .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Primary tumor sites were oropharynx , 10 patients ; hypopharynx , four ; larynx , two ; oral cavity , three ; unknown primary , two ; and nasal cavity
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and parotid gland , one each .
O O O O O O O
Of 20 patients evaluable for toxicity , four had stage III and 16 had stage IV disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment , given every 21 days for a maximum of three cycles , consisted of paclitaxel by 3 - hour infusion followed the next day by a fixed dose of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cisplatin ( 75 mg / m2 ) .
B O O O O O O O
The dose levels incorporate escalating paclitaxel doses , and intrapatient escalations within a given dose level are permitted if toxicity permits .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At the time of this writing , dose level 4 ( 260 , 270 , and 280 mg / m2 ) is being evaluated ; three patients from this level
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
are evaluable .
O O O
With paclitaxel doses of 200 mg / m2 and higher , granulocyte colony - stimulating factor 5 micrograms / kg / d is given ( days 4 through 12 )
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Of 18 patients evaluable for response , seven ( 39 % ) achieved a complete response and six ( 33 % ) achieved a partial response .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Three patients had no change and disease progressed in two .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The overall response rate is 72 % .
O O O O O O O O
Eleven responding patients had subsequent surgery / radiotherapy or radical radiotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two pathologic complete responses were observed in patients who had achieved clinical complete responses .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Alopecia , paresthesias , and arthralgias / myalgias have occurred frequently , but with one exception ( a grade 3 myalgia ) they have been grade 1 or 2 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No dose - limiting hematologic toxicity has been seen .
O O O O O O O O O O
Paclitaxel / cisplatin is an effective first - line regimen for locoregionally advanced head and neck cancer and continued study is warranted .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Results thus far suggest no dose - response effect for paclitaxel doses above 200 mg / m2 .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
A phase I study of 4' - 0 - tetrahydropyranyladriamycin .
O O O O O B I I I I O
Clinical pharmacology and pharmacokinetics .
O O O O O
A Phase I study of intravenous ( IV ) bolus 4' - 0 - tetrahydropyranyladriamycin ( Pirarubicin ) was done in 55 patients in good performance status with refractory tumors
O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Twenty - six had minimal prior therapy ( good risk ) , 23 had extensive prior therapy ( poor risk ) , and six had renal and / or hepatic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dysfunction .
O O
A total of 167 courses at doses of 15 to 70 mg / m2 were evaluable .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Maximum tolerated dose in good - risk patients was 70 mg / m2 , and in poor - risk patients , 60 mg / m2 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The dose - limiting toxic effect was transient noncumulative granulocytopenia .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Granulocyte nadir was on day 14 ( range , 4 - 22 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Less frequent toxic effects included thrombocytopenia , anemia , nausea , mild alopecia , phlebitis , and mucositis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Myelosuppression was more in patients with hepatic dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O
Pharmacokinetic analyses in 21 patients revealed Pirarubicin plasma T 1 / 2 alpha ( + / -
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
SE ) of 2 . 5 + / -
O O O O O O O O O
0 . 85 minutes , T beta 1 / 2 of 25 . 6 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
6 . 5 minutes , and T 1 / 2 gamma of 23 . 6 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
7 . 6 hours .
O O O O O
The area under the curve was 537 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O
149 ng / ml x hours , volume of distribution ( Vd ) 3504 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
644 l / m2 , and total clearance ( ClT ) was 204 + 39 . 3 l / hour / m2 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adriamycinol , doxorubicin , adriamycinone , and
B O B O B O O
tetrahydropyranyladriamycinol were the metabolites detected in plasma and the amount of doxorubicin was less than or equal to 10 % of the total metabolites .
B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urinary excretion of Pirarubicin in the first 24 hours was less than or equal to 10 % .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Activity was noted in mesothelioma , leiomyosarcoma , and basal cell carcinoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The recommended starting dose for Phase II trials is 60 mg / m2 IV bolus every 3 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Differential effects of gamma - hexachlorocyclohexane ( lindane ) on pharmacologically - induced seizures .
O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O
Gamma - hexachlorocyclohexane ( gamma - HCH ) , the active ingredient of the insecticide lindane , has been shown to decrease seizure threshold to pentylenetrazol ( PTZ ) 3
B I I O B I I O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
h after exposure to gamma - HCH and conversely increase threshold to PTZ - induced seizures 24 h after exposure to gamma - HCH ( Vohland et al . 1981
O O O O B I I O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O
) .
O O
In this study , the severity of response to other seizure - inducing agents was tested in mice 1 and 24 h after intraperitoneal administration of 80 mg / kg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
gamma - HCH .
B I I O
One hour after the administration of gamma - HCH , the activity of seizure - inducing agents was increased , regardless of their mechanism , while 24 h after
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
gamma - HCH a differential response was observed .
B I I O O O O O O
Seizure activity due to PTZ and picrotoxin ( PTX ) was significantly decreased ; however , seizure activity due to 3 - mercaptopropionic acid ( MPA ) , bicuculline (
O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O B O O B O
BCC ) , methyl 6 , 7 - dimethoxy - 4 - ethyl - B - carboline - 3 - carboxylate ( DMCM ) , or strychnine ( STR )
B O O B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O B O O O B O B O
was not different from control .
O O O O O O
In vitro , gamma - HCH , pentylenetetrazol and picrotoxin were shown to inhibit 3H - TBOB binding in mouse whole brain , with IC50 values of 4 . 6
O O O B I I O B O B O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, 404 and 9 . 4 microM , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O
MPA , BCC , DMCM , and STR showed no inhibition of 3H - TBOB ( t - butyl bicyclo - orthobenzoate ) binding at concentrations of 100 micron .
B O B O B O O B O O O O B I I O B I I I I I O O O O O O O O
The pharmacological challenge data suggest that tolerance may occur to seizure activity induced by PTZ and PTX 24 h after gamma - HCH , since the response to only these
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O B I I O O O O O O O
two seizure - inducing agents is decreased .
O O O O O O O O
The in vitro data suggest that the site responsible for the decrease in seizure activity 24 h after gamma - HCH may be the GABA - A receptor - linked
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O B O O O O O
chloride channel .
O O O
