Severe ocular and orbital toxicity after intracarotid injection of carboplatin for recurrent glioblastomas .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Glioblastoma is a malignant tumor that occurs in the cerebrum during adulthood .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
With current treatment regimens including combined surgery , radiation and chemotherapy , the average life expectancy of the patients is limited to approximately 1 year .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , patients with glioblastoma sometimes have intracarotid injection of carcinostatics added to the treatment regimen .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Generally , carboplatin is said to have milder side effects than cisplatin , whose ocular and orbital toxicity are well known .
O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
However , we experienced a case of severe ocular and orbital toxicity after intracarotid injection of carboplatin , which is infrequently reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
CASE :
O O
A 58 - year - old man received an intracarotid injection of carboplatin for recurrent glioblastomas in his left temporal lobe .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
He complained of pain and visual disturbance in the ipsilateral eye 30 h after the injection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Various ocular symptoms and findings caused by carboplatin toxicity were seen .
O O O O O O O B O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
He was treated with intravenous administration of corticosteroids and glycerin for 6 days after the injection .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Although the intraocular pressure elevation caused by secondary acute angle - closure glaucoma decreased and ocular pain diminished , inexorable papilledema and exudative retinal detachment continued for 3 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Finally , 6 weeks later , diffuse chorioretinal atrophy with optic atrophy occurred and the vision in his left eye was lost .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
When performing intracarotid injection of carboplatin , we must be aware of its potentially blinding ocular toxicity .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is recommended that further studies and investigations are undertaken in the effort to minimize such severe side effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Phase II study of the amsacrine analogue CI - 921
O O O O O B O B I I
( NSC 343499 ) in non - small cell lung cancer .
O B I O O O O O O O O O
CI - 921
B I I
( NSC 343499 ;
O B I O
9
B
- [ [ 2 - methoxy - 4 - [ ( methylsulphonyl ) amino ] phenyl ] amino ] - N , 5 - dimethyl - 4 - acridinecarboxamide )
I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O
is a topoisomerase II poison with high experimental antitumour activity .
O O O O O O O O O O O
It was administered by 15 min infusion to 16 evaluable patients with non - small cell lung cancer ( NSCLC ) ( 7 with no prior treatment , 9 patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in relapse following surgery / radiotherapy ) at a dose ( 648 mg / m2 divided over 3 days , repeated every 3 weeks ) determined by phase I trial
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Patients had a median performance status of 1 ( WHO ) , and median age of 61 years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The histology comprised squamous carcinoma ( 11 ) , adenocarcinoma ( 1 ) , mixed histology ( 2 ) , bronchio - alveolar carcinoma ( 1 ) and large cell
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
undifferentiated carcinoma ( 1 ) .
O O O O O O
Neutropenia grade greater than or equal to 3 was seen in 15 patients , infections with recovery in 3 , and grand mal seizures in 1 patient .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Grade less than or equal to 2 nausea and vomiting occurred in 66 % courses and phlebitis in the infusion arm in 37 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 patient with squamous cell carcinoma achieved a partial response lasting 5 months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Further testing in this and other tumour types using multiple daily schedules is warranted .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Alpha - lipoic acid prevents mitochondrial damage and neurotoxicity in experimental chemotherapy neuropathy .
B I I I O O O O O O O O O O
The study investigates if alpha - lipoic acid is neuroprotective against chemotherapy induced neurotoxicity , if mitochondrial damage plays a critical role in toxic neurodegenerative cascade , and if neuroprotective
O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
effects of alpha - lipoic acid depend on mitochondria protection .
O O B I I I O O O O O
We used an in vitro model of chemotherapy induced peripheral neuropathy that closely mimic the in vivo condition by exposing primary cultures of dorsal root ganglion ( DRG ) sensory
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
neurons to paclitaxel and cisplatin , two widely used and highly effective chemotherapeutic drugs .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
This approach allowed investigating the efficacy of alpha - lipoic acid in preventing axonal damage and apoptosis and the function and ultrastructural morphology of mitochondria after exposure to toxic agents
O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and alpha - lipoic acid .
O B I I I O
Our results demonstrate that both cisplatin and paclitaxel cause early mitochondrial impairment with loss of membrane potential and induction of autophagic vacuoles in neurons .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Alpha - lipoic acid exerts neuroprotective effects against chemotherapy induced neurotoxicity in sensory neurons : it rescues the mitochondrial toxicity and induces the expression of frataxin , an essential mitochondrial
B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
protein with anti - oxidant and chaperone properties .
O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion mitochondrial toxicity is an early common event both in paclitaxel and cisplatin induced neurotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
Alpha - lipoic acid protects sensory neurons through its anti - oxidant and mitochondrial regulatory functions , possibly inducing the expression of frataxin .
B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings suggest that alpha - lipoic acid might reduce the risk of developing peripheral nerve toxicity in patients undergoing chemotherapy and encourage further confirmatory clinical trials .
O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Optimising stroke prevention in non - valvular atrial fibrillation .
O O O O O O O O O O
Atrial fibrillation is associated with substantial morbidity and mortality .
O O O O O O O O O O
Pooled data from trials comparing antithrombotic treatment with placebo have shown that warfarin reduces the risk of stroke by 62 % , and that aspirin alone reduces the risk by
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
22 % .
O O O
Overall , in high - risk patients , warfarin is superior to aspirin in preventing strokes , with a relative risk reduction of 36 % .
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ximelagatran , an oral direct thrombin inhibitor , was found to be as efficient as vitamin K antagonist drugs in the prevention of embolic events , but has been recently
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
withdrawn because of abnormal liver function tests .
O O O O O O O O
The ACTIVE - W ( Atrial Fibrillation Clopidogrel Trial with Irbesartan for Prevention of Vascular Events ) study has demonstrated that warfarin is superior to platelet therapy ( clopidogrel plus
O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O
aspirin ) in the prevention af embolic events .
B O O O O O O O O
Idraparinux , a Factor Xa inhibitor , is being evaluated in patients with atrial fibrillation .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitors and angiotensin II receptor - blocking drugs hold promise in atrial fibrillation through cardiac remodelling .
B O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Preliminary studies suggest that statins could interfere with the risk of recurrence after electrical cardioversion .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Finally , percutaneous methods for the exclusion of left atrial appendage are under investigation in high - risk patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Interaction of cyclosporin A with antineoplastic agents .
O O B I O O O O
A synergistic effect of etoposide and cyclosporin A was observed in a patient with acute T - lymphocytic leukemia in relapse .
O O O O B O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The concomitant administration of etoposide and cyclosporin A resulted in eradication of hitherto refractory leukemic infiltration of bone marrow .
O O O O B O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
Severe side effects in terms of mental confusion and progressive hyperbilirubinemia , however , point to an enhancement not only of antineoplastic effects but also of toxicity in normal tissues
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
This report demonstrates for the first time that the pharmacodynamic properties of cyclosporin A may not be confined strictly to suppression of normal T - cell functions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The hematologic effects of cefonicid and cefazedone in the dog : a potential model of cephalosporin hematotoxicity in man .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Cephalosporin antibiotics cause a variety of hematologic disturbances in man , the pathogeneses and hematopathology of which remain poorly characterized .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There is a need for a well - defined animal model in which these blood dyscrasias can be studied .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In four subacute toxicity studies , the intravenous administration of cefonicid or cefazedone to beagle dogs caused a dose - dependent incidence of anemia , neutropenia , and thrombocytopenia after
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 - 3 months of treatment .
O O O O O O O
A nonregenerative anemia was the most compromising of the cytopenias and occurred in approximately 50 % of dogs receiving 400 - 500 mg / kg cefonicid or 540 - 840
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
mg / kg cefazedone .
O O O B O
All three cytopenias were completely reversible following cessation of treatment ; the time required for recovery of the erythron ( approximately 1 month ) was considerably longer than that of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the granulocytes and platelets ( hours to a few days ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Upon rechallenge with either cephalosporin , the hematologic syndrome was reproduced in most dogs tested ; cefonicid ( but not cefazedone ) - treated dogs showed a substantially reduced induction
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O
period ( 15 + / -
O O O O O O
5 days ) compared to that of the first exposure to the drug ( 61 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
24 days ) .
O O O O
This observation , along with the rapid rate of decline in red cell mass parameters of affected dogs , suggests that a hemolytic component complicated the red cell production problem
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and that multiple toxicologic mechanisms contributed to the cytopenia .
O O O O O O O O O O
We conclude that the administration of high doses of cefonicid or cefazedone to dogs can induce hematotoxicity similar to the cephalosporin - induced blood dyscrasias described in man and thus
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
provides a useful model for studying the mechanisms of these disorders .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
A pyridoxine - dependent behavioral disorder unmasked by isoniazid .
O B O O O O O O B O
A 3 - year - old girl had behavioral deterioration , with hyperkinesis , irritability , and sleeping difficulties after the therapeutic administration of isoniazid .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The administration of pharmacologic doses of pyridoxine hydrochloride led to a disappearance of symptoms .
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
After discontinuing isoniazid therapy a similar pattern of behavior was noted that was controlled by pyridoxine .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
A placebo had no effect , but niacinamide was as effective as pyridoxine .
O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
Periodic withdrawal of pyridoxine was associated with return of the hyperkinesis .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
The level of pyridoxal in the blood was normal during the periods of relapse .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Metabolic studies suggested a block in the kynurenine pathway of tryptophan metabolism .
O O O O O O O B O O B O O
The patient has been followed for six years and has required pharmacologic doses of pyridoxine to control her behavior .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
A selective dopamine D4 receptor antagonist , NRA0160 : a preclinical neuropharmacological profile .
O O B O O O O B O O O O O O
NRA0160 ,
B O
5
B
-
I
[
I
2
I
-
I
( 4 - ( 3 - fluorobenzylidene ) piperidin - 1 - yl ) ethyl ] - 4 - ( 4 - fluorophenyl ) thiazole - 2 - carboxamide ,
I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O
has a high affinity for human cloned dopamine D4 . 2 , D4 . 4
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
and D4 . 7 receptors , with Ki values of 0 . 5 , 0 . 9 and 2 . 7 nM , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NRA0160 is over 20 , 000fold more potent at the dopamine D4 . 2 receptor compared with the human cloned dopamine D2L receptor .
B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O
NRA0160 has negligible affinity for the human cloned dopamine D3 receptor ( Ki = 39 nM ) , rat serotonin ( 5 - HT ) 2A receptors ( Ki =
B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O O O O
180 nM ) and rat alpha1 adrenoceptor ( Ki = 237 nM ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NRA0160 and clozapine antagonized locomotor hyperactivity induced by methamphetamine ( MAP ) in mice .
B O B O O O O O B O B O O O O
NRA0160 and clozapine antagonized MAP - induced stereotyped behavior in mice , although their effects did not exceed 50 % inhibition , even at the highest dose given .
B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NRA0160 and clozapine significantly induced catalepsy in rats , although their effects did not exceed 50 % induction even at the highest dose given .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NRA0160 and clozapine significantly reversed the disruption of prepulse inhibition ( PPI ) in rats produced by apomorphine .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
NRA0160 and clozapine significantly shortened the phencyclidine ( PCP ) - induced prolonged swimming latency in rats in a water maze task .
B O B O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings suggest that NRA0160 may have unique antipsychotic activities without the liability of motor side effects typical of classical antipsychotics .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prolonged cholestasis after troleandomycin - induced acute hepatitis .
O O O B O O O O O
We report the case of a patient in whom troleandomycin - induced hepatitis was followed by prolonged anicteric cholestasis .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Jaundice occurred after administration of troleandomycin for 7 days and was associated with hypereosinophilia .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Jaundice disappeared within 3 months but was followed by prolonged anicteric cholestasis marked by pruritus and high levels of alkaline phosphatase and gammaglutamyltransferase activities .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Finally , pruritus disappeared within 19 months , and liver tests returned to normal 27 months after the onset of hepatitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This observation demonstrates that prolonged cholestasis can follow troleandomycin - induced acute hepatitis .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
HMG CoA reductase inhibitors .
O O O O O
Current clinical experience .
O O O O
Lovastatin and simvastatin are the 2 best - known members of the class of hypolipidaemic agents known as HMG CoA reductase inhibitors .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical experience with lovastatin includes over 5000 patients , 700 of whom have been treated for 2 years or more , and experience with simvastatin includes over 3500 patients ,
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
of whom 350 have been treated for 18 months or more .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lovastatin has been marketed in the United States for over 6 months .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both agents show substantial clinical efficacy , with reductions in total cholesterol of over 30 % and in LDL - cholesterol of 40 % in clinical studies .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Modest increases in HDL - cholesterol levels of about 10 % are also reported .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Clinical tolerability of both agents has been good , with fewer than 3 % of patients withdrawn from treatment because of clinical adverse experiences .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ophthalmological examinations in over 1100 patients treated with one or the other agent have revealed no evidence of significant short term ( up to 2 years ) cataractogenic potential .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One to 2 % of patients have elevations of serum transaminases to greater than 3 times the upper limit of normal .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These episodes are asymptomatic and reversible when therapy is discontinued .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Minor elevations of creatine kinase levels are reported in about 5 % of patients .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Myopathy , associated in some cases with myoglobinuria , and in 2 cases with transient renal failure , has been rarely reported with lovastatin , especially in patients concomitantly treated
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
with cyclosporin , gemfibrozil or niacin .
O B O B O B O
Lovastatin and simvastatin are both effective and well - tolerated agents for lowering elevated levels of serum cholesterol .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
As wider use confirms their safety profile , they will gain increasing importance in the therapeutic approach to hypercholesterolaemia and its consequences .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sulfasalazine - induced lupus erythematosus .
B O O O O O
Pneumonitis , bilateral pleural effusions , echocardiographic evidence of cardiac tamponade , and positive autoantibodies developed in a 43 - year - old man , who was receiving long -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
term sulfasalazine therapy for chronic ulcerative colitis .
O B O O O O O O
After cessation of the sulfasalazine and completion of a six - week course of corticosteroids , these problems resolved over a period of four to six months .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is suggested that the patient had sulfasalazine - induced lupus , which manifested with serositis and pulmonary parenchymal involvement in the absence of joint symptoms .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Physicians who use sulfasalazine to treat patients with inflammatory bowel disease should be aware of the signs of sulfasalazine - induced lupus syndrome .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Optimization of levodopa therapy .
O O B O O
While there is no single correct starting dose for levodopa therapy , many individuals can be started on either the 25 / 100 or controlled - release formula , following
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the general rule not to attempt to titrate carbidopa - levodopa to the point of """" normality , """" which can lead to toxicity .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The physician should also determine the proper use of any adjunctive medications ; such combined therapy has become the standard approach to treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Following the initial period of therapy , emerging difficulties require a reassessment of therapeutic approaches , such as dosage adjustment or introduction of a dopamine agonist .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Other possible adverse effects - - such as gastrointestinal disorders , orthostatic hypotension , levodopa - induced psychosis , sleep disturbances or parasomnias , or drug interactions - - also
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
require carefully monitored individual treatment .
O O O O O O
Nonpharmacologic concerns can help the Parkinson 's disease patient achieve and maintain optimal functioning , including daily exercise , physical therapy , and involvement with support groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Alpha and beta coma in drug intoxication uncomplicated by cerebral hypoxia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Four patients who were rendered comatose or stuporous by drug intoxication , but who were not hypoxic , are described .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Three patients received high doses of chlormethiazole for alcohol withdrawal symptoms , and one took a suicidal overdose of nitrazepam .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
The patient with nitrazepam overdose and two of those with chlormethiazole intoxication conformed to the criteria of ' alpha coma ' , showing non - reactive generalized or frontally predominant
O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
alpha activity in the EEG .
O O O O O O
The fourth patient who was unconscious after chlormethiazole administration exhibite generalized non - reactive activity in the slow beta range .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All four recovered completely without neurological sequelae following the withdrawal of the offending agents .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The similarities between the effects of structural lesions and pharmacological depression of the brain stem reticular formation are discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is suggested that in both situations disturbed reticulo - thalamic interactions are important in the pathogenesis of alpha coma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is concluded that when this electroencephalographic and behavioural picture is seen in drug intoxication , in the absence of significant hypoxaemia , a favourable outcome may be anticipated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Omitting fentanyl reduces nausea and vomiting , without increasing pain , after sevoflurane for day surgery .
O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
BACKGROUND AND OBJECTIVE : Despite advantages of induction and maintenance of anaesthesia with sevoflurane , postoperative nausea and vomiting occurs frequently .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Fentanyl is a commonly used supplement that may contribute to this , although it may also improve analgesia .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
This double - blind study examined the incidence and severity of postoperative nausea and vomiting and pain in the first 24 h after sevoflurane anaesthesia in 216 adult day surgery
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
patients .
O O
Patients were randomly allocated to either receive or not receive 1 1 fentanyl , while a third group received dexamethasone in addition to fentanyl .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O B O
RESULTS :
O O
Omission of fentanyl did not reduce the overall incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting , but did reduce the incidence of vomiting and / or moderate to severe nausea prior
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to discharge from 20 % and 17 % with fentanyl and fentanyl - dexamethasone , respectively , to 5 % ( P = 0 . 013 ) .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Antiemetic requirements were reduced from 24 % and 31 % to 7 % ( P = 0 . 0012 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dexamethasone had no significant effect on the incidence or severity of postoperative nausea and vomiting .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Combining the two fentanyl groups revealed further significant benefits from the avoidance of opioids , reducing postoperative nausea and vomiting and nausea prior to discharge from 35 % and 33
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% to 22 % and 19 % ( P = 0 . 049 and P = 0 . 035 ) , respectively , while nausea in the first 24 h
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
was decreased from 42 % to 27 % ( P = 0 . 034 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pain severity and analgesic requirements were unaffected by the omission of fentanyl .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Fentanyl did reduce minor intraoperative movement but had no sevoflurane - sparing effect and increased respiratory depression , hypotension and bradycardia .
B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
As fentanyl exacerbated postoperative nausea and vomiting without an improvement in postoperative pain and also had adverse cardiorespiratory effects , it appears to be an unnecessary and possibly detrimental supplement
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to sevoflurane in day surgery .
O B O O O O
Renal Fanconi syndrome and myopathy after liver transplantation : drug - related mitochondrial cytopathy ?
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Advances in the field of transplantation provide a better quality of life and allow more favorable conditions for growth and development in children .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , combinations of different therapeutic regimens require consideration of potential adverse reactions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We describe a 15 - yr - old girl who had orthotopic liver transplantation because of Wilson 's disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tacrolimus , MMF , and steroids were given as immunosuppressant .
B O B O O B O O O O O
Lamivudine was added because of de nova hepatitis B infection during her follow - up .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Three yr after transplantation she developed renal Fanconi syndrome with severe metabolic acidosis , hypophosphatemia , glycosuria , and aminoaciduria .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although tacrolimus was suspected to be the cause of late post - transplant renal acidosis and was replaced by sirolimus , acidosis , and electrolyte imbalance got worse .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Proximal muscle weakness has developed during her follow - up .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Fanconi syndrome , as well as myopathy , is well recognized in patients with mitochondrial disorders and caused by depletion of mtDNA .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We suggest that our patient 's tubular dysfunction and myopathy may have resulted from mitochondrial dysfunction which is triggered by tacrolimus and augmented by lamivudine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O
Antipsychotic - like profile of thioperamide , a selective H3 - receptor antagonist in mice .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Experimental and clinical evidence points to a role of central histaminergic system in the pathogenesis of schizophrenia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The present study was designed to study the effect of histamine H ( 3 ) - receptor ligands on neuroleptic - induced catalepsy , apomorphine - induced climbing behavior and
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
amphetamine - induced locomotor activities in mice .
B O O O O O O O
Catalepsy was induced by haloperidol ( 2 mg / kg p . o . ) , while apomorphine ( 1 . 5 mg / kg s . c . )
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
and amphetamine ( 2 mg / kg s . c . ) were used for studying climbing behavior and locomotor activities , respectively .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( R ) - alpha - methylhistamine ( RAMH ) ( 5 microg i . c . v . ) and thioperamide ( THP ) (
B I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
15 mg / kg i . p . )
O O O O O O O O O
, per se did not cause catalepsy .
O O O O O O O O
Administration of THP ( 3 . 75 , 7 . 5 and 15 mg / kg
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
i . p . )
O O O O O
1 h prior to haloperidol resulted in a dose - dependent increase in the catalepsy times ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , pretreatment with RAMH significantly reversed such an effect of THP ( 15 mg / kg i . p . ) .
O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
RAMH per se showed significant reduction in locomotor time , distance traveled and average speed but THP ( 15 mg / kg
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
i . p . )
O O O O O
per se had no effect on these parameters .
O O O O O O O O O
On amphetamine - induced hyperactivity , THP ( 3 . 75 and 7 . 5 mg / kg i . p . ) reduced locomotor time , distance traveled and
O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
average speed ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
Pretreatment with RAMH ( 5 microg i . c . v . ) could partially reverse such effects of THP ( 3 . 75 mg / kg i . p
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
. ) .
O O O
Climbing behavior induced by apomorphine was reduced in animals treated with THP .
O O O O B O O O O O O B O
Such an effect was , however , reversed in presence of RAMH .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
THP exhibited an antipsychotic - like profile by potentiating haloperidol - induced catalepsy , reducing amphetamine - induced hyperactivity and reducing apomorphine - induced climbing in mice .
B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O
Such effects of THP were reversed by RAMH indicating the involvement of histamine H ( 3 ) - receptors .
O O O B O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O
Findings suggest a potential for H ( 3 ) - receptor antagonists in improving the refractory cases of schizophrenia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Transient platypnea - orthodeoxia - like syndrome induced by propafenone overdose in a young woman with Ebstein 's anomaly .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
In this report we describe the case of a 37 - year - old white woman with Ebstein 's anomaly , who developed a rare syndrome called platypnea - orthodeoxia
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, characterized by massive right - to - left interatrial shunting with transient profound hypoxia and cyanosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This shunt of blood via a patent foramen ovale occurred in the presence of a normal pulmonary artery pressure , and was probably precipitated by a propafenone overdose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
This drug caused biventricular dysfunction , due to its negative inotropic effect , and hypotension , due to its peripheral vasodilatory effect .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These effects gave rise to an increase in the right atrial pressure and a decrease in the left one with a consequent stretching of the foramen ovale and the creation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of massive right - to - left shunting .
O O O O O O O O O
In our case this interatrial shunt was very accurately detected at bubble contrast echocardiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A Phase II trial of cisplatin plus WR - 2721 ( amifostine ) for metastatic breast carcinoma : an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Study ( E8188 ) .
O O O O O B O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Cisplatin has minimal antitumor activity when used as second - or third - line treatment of metastatic breast carcinoma .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Older reports suggest an objective response rate of 8 % when 60 - 120 mg / m2 of cisplatin is administered every 3 - 4 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Although a dose - response effect has been observed with cisplatin , the dose - limiting toxicities associated with cisplatin ( e . g . , nephrotoxicity , ototoxicity ,
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
and neurotoxicity ) have limited its use as a treatment for breast carcinoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
WR - 2721 or amifostine initially was developed to protect military personnel in the event of nuclear war .
B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Amifostine subsequently was shown to protect normal tissues from the toxic effects of alkylating agents and cisplatin without decreasing the antitumor effect of the chemotherapy .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O
Early trials of cisplatin and amifostine also suggested that the incidence and severity of cisplatin - induced nephrotoxicity , ototoxicity , and neuropathy were reduced .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
A Phase II study of the combination of cisplatin plus amifostine was conducted in patients with progressive metastatic breast carcinoma who had received one , but not more than one
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, chemotherapy regimen for metastatic disease .
O O O O O O O
Patients received amifostine , 910 mg / m2 intravenously over 15 minutes .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O
After completion of the amifostine infusion , cisplatin 120 mg / m2 was administered over 30 minutes .
O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Intravenous hydration and mannitol was administered before and after cisplatin .
O O O B O O O O O B O
Treatment was administered every 3 weeks until disease progression .
O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Forty - four patients were enrolled in the study of which 7 ( 16 % ) were ineligible .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A median of 2 cycles of therapy was administered to the 37 eligible patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Six partial responses were observed for an overall response rate of 16 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Most patients ( 57 % ) stopped treatment because of disease progression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neurologic toxicity was reported in 52 % of patients .
O O O O O O O O O O
Seven different life - threatening toxicities were observed in patients while receiving treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The combination of cisplatin and amifostine in this study resulted in an overall response rate of 16 % .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neither a tumor - protective effect nor reduced toxicity to normal tissues was observed with the addition of amifostine to cisplatin in this trial .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
Warfarin - induced iliopsoas hemorrhage with subsequent femoral nerve palsy .
B O O O O O O O O O O
We present the case of a 28 - year - old man on chronic warfarin therapy who sustained a minor muscle tear and developed increasing pain and a flexure contracture
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of the right hip .
O O O O O
Surgical exploration revealed an iliopsoas hematoma and femoral nerve entrapment , resulting in a femoral nerve palsy and partial loss of quadriceps functions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Anticoagulant - induced femoral nerve palsy represents the most common form of warfarin - induced peripheral neuropathy ; it is characterized by severe pain in the inguinal region , varying
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
degrees of motor and sensory impairment , and flexure contracture of the involved extremity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Myasthenia gravis caused by penicillamine and chloroquine therapy for rheumatoid arthritis .
O O O O B O B O O O O O
We have described a unique patient who had reversible and dose - related myasthenia gravis after penicillamine and chloroquine therapy for rheumatoid arthritis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
Although acetylcholine receptor antibodies were not detectable , the time course was consistent with an autoimmune process .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nephrotoxicity of combined cephalothin - gentamicin regimen .
O O O B O B O O
Two patients developed acute tubular necrosis , characterized clinically by acute oliguric renal failure , while they were receiving a combination of cephalothin sodium and gentamicin sulfate therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B I O O
Patients who are given this drug regimen should be observed very carefully for early signs of nephrotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
High doses of this antibiotic combination should be avoided especially in elderly patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients with renal insufficiency should not be given this regimen .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Components of lemon essential oil attenuate dementia induced by scopolamine .
O O O O O O O O O B O
The anti - dementia effects of s - limonene and s - perillyl alcohol were observed using the passive avoidance test ( PA ) and the open field habituation test
O O O O O O B I I O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( OFH ) .
O O O O
These lemon essential oils showed strong ability to improve memory impaired by scopolamine ; however , s - perillyl alcohol relieved the deficit of associative memory in PA only ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O
and did not improve non - associative memory significantly in OFH .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Analysis of neurotransmitter concentration in some brain regions on the test day showed that dopamine concentration of the vehicle / scopolamine group was significantly lower than that of the vehicle
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
/ vehicle group , but this phenomenon was reversed when s - limonene or s - perillyl alcohol were administered before the injection of scopolamine .
O O O O O O O O O O B I I O B I I I O O O O O O B O
Simultaneously , we found that these two lemon essential oil components could inhibit acetylcholinesterase activity in vitro using the Ellman method .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The selective 5 - HT6 receptor antagonist Ro4368554 restores memory performance in cholinergic and serotonergic models of memory deficiency in the rat .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Antagonists at serotonin type 6 ( 5 - HT ( 6 ) ) receptors show activity in models of learning and memory .
O O B O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although the underlying mechanism ( s ) are not well understood , these effects may involve an increase in acetylcholine ( ACh ) levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
The present study sought to characterize the cognitive - enhancing effects of the 5 - HT ( 6 ) antagonist Ro4368554 (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O B O
3 - benzenesulfonyl - 7 - ( 4 - methyl - piperazin - 1 - yl ) 1H - indole ) in a rat object recognition task employing a cholinergic
B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O
( scopolamine pretreatment ) and a serotonergic - ( tryptophan ( TRP ) depletion ) deficient model , and compared its pattern of action with that of the acetylcholinesterase inhibitor
O B O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
metrifonate .
B O
Initial testing in a time - dependent forgetting task employing a 24 - h delay between training and testing showed that metrifonate improved object recognition ( at 10 and 30
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
mg / kg , p . o . ) , whereas Ro4368554 was inactive .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Both , Ro4368554 ( 3 and 10 mg / kg , intraperitoneally ( i . p . ) ) and metrifonate ( 10 mg / kg , p . o
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
. , respectively ) reversed memory deficits induced by scopolamine and TRP depletion ( 10 mg / kg , i . p .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
, and 3 mg / kg , p . o . , respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion , although Ro4368554 did not improve a time - related retention deficit , it reversed a cholinergic and a serotonergic memory deficit , suggesting that both mechanisms may
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
be involved in the facilitation of object memory by Ro4368554 and , possibly , other 5 - HT ( 6 ) receptor antagonists .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B I I O O O O O O
Lone atrial fibrillation associated with creatine monohydrate supplementation .
O O O O O B O O O
Atrial fibrillation in young patients without structural heart disease is rare .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , when the arrhythmia is present in this population , reversible causes must be identified and resolved .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thyroid disorders , illicit drug or stimulant use , and acute alcohol intoxication are among these causes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report the case of a 30 - year - old Caucasian man who came to the emergency department in atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular response .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
His medical history was unremarkable , except for minor fractures of the fingers and foot .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thyroid - stimulating hormone , magnesium , and potassium levels were within normal limits , urine drug screen was negative , and alcohol use was denied .
O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
However , when the patient was questioned about use of herbal products and supplements , the use of creatine monohydrate was revealed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The patient was admitted to the hospital , anticoagulated with unfractionated heparin , and given intravenous diltiazem for rate control and intravenous amiodarone for rate and rhythm control .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O
When discharged less than 24 hours later , he was receiving metoprolol and aspirin , with follow - up plans for echocardiography and nuclear imaging to assess perfusion .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Exogenous creatine is used by athletes to theoretically improve exercise performance .
O B O O O O O O O O O O
Vegetarians may also take creatine to replace what they are not consuming from meat , fish , and other animal products .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Previous anecdotal reports have linked creatine to the development of arrhythmia .
O O O O O B O O O O O O
Clinicians must be diligent when interviewing patients about their drug therapy histories and include questions about their use of herbal products and dietary supplements .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , it is important to report adverse effects associated with frequently consumed supplements and herbal products to the Food and Drug Administration and in the literature .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Comparison of developmental toxicity of selective and non - selective cyclooxygenase - 2 inhibitors in CRL : ( WI ) WUBR Wistar rats - - DFU and piroxicam study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Cyclooxygenase ( COX ) inhibitors are one of the most often ingested drugs during pregnancy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Unlike general toxicity data , their prenatal toxic effects were not extensively studied before .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aim of the experiment was to evaluate the developmental toxicity of the non - selective ( piroxicam ) and selective ( DFU ;
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
5 , 5 - dimethyl - 3 - ( 3 - fluorophenyl ) - 4 - ( 4 - methylsulphonyl ) phenyl - 2 ( 5H ) - furanon )
B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O
COX - 2 inhibitors .
O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Drugs were separately , orally once daily dosed to pregnant rats from day 8 to 21 ( GD1 = plug day ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Doses were set at 0 . 3 , 3 . 0 and 30 . 0mg / kg for piroxicam and 0 . 2 , 2 . 0 and 20 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
0mg / kg for DFU .
O O O O B O
Fetuses were delivered on GD 21 and routinely examined .
O O O O O O O O O O
Comprehensive clinical and developmental measurements were done .
O O O O O O O O
The pooled statistical analysis for ventricular septal ( VSD ) and midline ( MD ) defects was performed for rat fetuses exposed to piroxicam , selective and non - selective
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
COX - 2 inhibitor based on present and historic data .
O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Maternal toxicity , intrauterine growth retardation , and increase of external and skeletal variations were found in rats treated with the highest dose of piroxicam .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Decrease of fetal length was the only signs of the DFU developmental toxicity observed in pups exposed to the highest compound dose .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lack of teratogenicity was found in piroxicam and DFU - exposed groups .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O
Prenatal exposure to non - selective COX inhibitors increases the risk of VSD and MD when compared to historic control but not with selective COX - 2 inhibitors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Both selective and non - selective COX - 2 inhibitors were toxic for rats fetuses when administered in the highest dose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Unlike DFU , piroxicam was also highly toxic to the dams .
O B O B O O O O O O O O
Prenatal exposure to selective COX - 2 inhibitors does not increase the risk of ventricular septal and midline defects in rat when compared to non - selective drugs and historic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
control .
O O
Protective efficacy of neuroactive steroids against cocaine kindled - seizures in mice .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O
Neuroactive steroids demonstrate pharmacological actions that have relevance for a host of neurological and psychiatric disorders .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
They offer protection against seizures in a range of models and seem to inhibit certain stages of drug dependence in preclinical assessments .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The present study was designed to evaluate two endogenous and one synthetic neuroactive steroid that positively modulate the gamma - aminobutyric acid ( GABA ( A ) ) receptor against
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B I I I O B O O O O O O
the increase in sensitivity to the convulsant effects of cocaine engendered by repeated cocaine administration ( seizure kindling ) .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O
Allopregnanolone ( 3alpha - hydroxy - 5alpha - pregnan - 20 - one ) , pregnanolone ( 3alpha - hydroxy - 5beta - pregnan - 20 - one ) and
B O B I I I I I I I I I I O O B O B I I I I I I I I I I O O
ganaxolone ( a synthetic derivative of allopregnanolone 3alpha - hydroxy - 3beta - methyl - 5alpha - pregnan - 20 - one ) were tested for their ability to suppress
B O O O O O B B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O O O O O
the expression ( anticonvulsant effect ) and development ( antiepileptogenic effect ) of cocaine - kindled seizures in male , Swiss - Webster mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Kindled seizures were induced by daily administration of 60 mg / kg cocaine for 5 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
All of these positive GABA ( A ) modulators suppressed the expression of kindled seizures , whereas only allopregnanolone and ganaxolone inhibited the development of kindling .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
Allopregnanolone and pregnanolone , but not ganaxolone , also reduced cumulative lethality associated with kindling .
B O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O
These findings demonstrate that some neuroactive steroids attenuate convulsant and sensitizing properties of cocaine and add to a growing literature on their potential use in the modulation of effects of
O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
drugs of abuse .
O O O O
Kidney function and morphology after short - term combination therapy with cyclosporine A , tacrolimus and sirolimus in the rat .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O B O O O O
BACKGROUND : Sirolimus ( SRL ) may supplement calcineurin inhibitors in clinical organ transplantation .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
These are nephrotoxic , but SRL seems to act differently displaying only minor nephrotoxic effects , although this question is still open .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In a number of treatment protocols where SRL was combined with a calcineurin inhibitor indications of a synergistic nephrotoxic effect were described .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aim of this study was to examine further the renal function , including morphological analysis of the kidneys of male Sprague - Dawley rats treated with either
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cyclosporine A ( CsA ) , tacrolimus ( FK506 ) or SRL as monotherapies or in different combinations .
B I O B O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
For a period of 2 weeks , CsA 15 mg / kg / day ( given orally ) , FK506 3 . 0 mg / kg / day ( given
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
orally ) or SRL 0 . 4 mg / kg / day ( given intraperitoneally ) was administered once a day as these doses have earlier been found to achieve
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a significant immunosuppressive effect in Sprague - Dawley rats .
O O O O O O O O O O
In the ' conscious catheterized rat ' model , the glomerular filtration rate ( GFR ) was measured as the clearance of Cr ( EDTA ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The morphological analysis of the kidneys included a semi - quantitative scoring system analysing the degree of striped fibrosis , subcapsular fibrosis and the number of basophilic tubules , plus
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
an additional stereological analysis of the total grade of fibrosis in the cortex stained with Sirius Red .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS : CsA , FK506 and SRL
O O B O B O B
all significantly decreased the GFR .
O O O O O O
A further deterioration was seen when CsA was combined with either FK506 or SRL , whereas the GFR remained unchanged in the group treated with FK506 plus SRL when compared
O O O O O O B O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
with treatment with any of the single substances .
O O O O O O O O O
The morphological changes presented a similar pattern .
O O O O O O O O
The semi - quantitative scoring was significantly worst in the group treated with CsA plus SRL ( P < 0 . 001 compared with controls ) and the analysis of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the total grade of fibrosis also showed the highest proportion in the same group and was significantly different from controls ( P < 0 . 02 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The FK506 plus SRL combination showed only a marginally higher degree of fibrosis as compared with controls ( P = 0 . 05 ) .
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
This rat study demonstrated a synergistic nephrotoxic effect of CsA plus SRL , whereas FK506 plus SRL was better tolerated .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O B O O O O
Effect of fucoidan treatment on collagenase - induced intracerebral hemorrhage in rats .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Inflammatory cells are postulated to mediate some of the brain damage following ischemic stroke .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intracerebral hemorrhage is associated with more inflammation than ischemic stroke .
O O O O O O O O O O O
We tested the sulfated polysaccharide fucoidan , which has been reported to reduce inflammatory brain damage , in a rat model of intracerebral hemorrhage induced by injection of bacterial collagenase
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
into the caudate nucleus .
O O O O O
Rats were treated with seven day intravenous infusion of fucoidan ( 30 micrograms h - 1 ) or vehicle .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The hematoma was assessed in vivo by magnetic resonance imaging .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Motor behavior , passive avoidance , and skilled forelimb function were tested repeatedly for six weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fucoidan - treated rats exhibited evidence of impaired blood clotting and hemodilution , had larger hematomas , and tended to have less inflammation in the vicinity of the hematoma after
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
three days .
O O O
They showed significantly more rapid improvement of motor function in the first week following hemorrhage and better memory retention in the passive avoidance test .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute white matter edema and eventual neuronal loss in the striatum adjacent to the hematoma did not differ between the two groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Investigation of more specific anti - inflammatory agents and hemodiluting agents are warranted in intracerebral hemorrhage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Paracetamol - associated coma , metabolic acidosis , renal and hepatic failure .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
A case of metabolic acidosis , acute renal failure and hepatic failure following paracetamol ingestion is presented .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The diagnostic difficulty at presentation is highlighted .
O O O O O O O O
Continuous arteriovenous haemofiltration proved a valuable means of maintaining fluid and electrolyte balance .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient recovered .
O O O O
Hepatic reactions associated with ketoconazole in the United Kingdom .
O O O O B O O O O O
Ketoconazole was introduced in the United Kingdom in 1981 .
B O O O O O O O O O
By November 1984 the Committee on Safety of Medicines had received 82 reports of possible hepatotoxicity associated with the drug , including five deaths .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An analysis of the 75 cases that had been adequately followed up suggested that 16 , including three deaths , were probably related to treatment with the drug .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of the remainder , 48 were possibly related to treatment , five were unlikely to be so , and six were unclassifiable .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean age of patients in the 16 probable cases was 57 . 9 , with hepatotoxicity being more common in women .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The average duration of treatment before the onset of jaundice was 61 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
None of these well validated cases occurred within the first 10 days after treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results of serum liver function tests suggested hepatocellular injury in 10 ( 63 % ) ; the rest showed a mixed pattern .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , the results of histological examination of the liver often showed evidence of cholestasis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The characteristics of the 48 patients in the possible cases were similar .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Allergic manifestations such as rash and eosinophilia were rare .
O O O O O O O O O O
Hepatitis was usually reversible when treatment was stopped , with the results of liver function tests returning to normal after an average of 3 . 1 months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In two of the three deaths probably associated with ketoconazole treatment the drug had been continued after the onset of jaundice and other symptoms of hepatitis .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical and biochemical monitoring at regular intervals for evidence of hepatitis is advised during long term treatment with ketoconazole to prevent possible serious hepatic injury .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Combined effects of prolonged prostaglandin E1 - induced hypotension and haemodilution on human hepatic function .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
Combined effects of prolonged prostaglandin E1 ( PGE1 ) - induced hypotension and haemodilution on hepatic function were studied in 30 patients undergoing hip surgery .
O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patients were randomly allocated to one of three groups ; those in group A ( n = 10 ) were subjected to controlled hypotension alone , those in group
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
B ( n = 10 ) to haemodilution alone and those in group C ( n = 10 ) to both controlled hypotension and haemodilution .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Haemodilution in groups B and C was produced by withdrawing approximately 1000 mL of blood and replacing it with the same amount of dextran solution , and final haematocrit values
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
were 21 or 22 % .
O O O O O O
Controlled hypotension in groups A and C was induced with PGE1 to maintain mean arterial blood pressure at 55 mmHg for 180 min .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Measurements included arterial ketone body ratio ( AKBR , aceto - acetate / 3 - hydroxybutyrate ) and clinical hepatic function parameters .
O O O O O O O O O B I I O B I I O O O O O O O
AKBR and biological hepatic function tests showed no change throughout the time course in groups A and B .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In group C , AKBR showed a significant decrease at 120 min ( - 40 % ) and at 180 min ( - 49 % ) after the start of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
hypotension and at 60 min ( - 32 % ) after recovery of normotension , and SGOT , SGPT , LDH and total bilirubin showed significant increases after operation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The results suggest that a prolonged combination of more than 120 min of PGE1 - induced hypotension and moderate haemodilution would cause impairment of hepatic function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Levodopa - induced dyskinesias in patients with Parkinson 's disease : filling the bench - to - bedside gap .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Levodopa is the most effective drug for the treatment of Parkinson 's disease .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , the long - term use of this dopamine precursor is complicated by highly disabling fluctuations and dyskinesias .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Although preclinical and clinical findings suggest pulsatile stimulation of striatal postsynaptic receptors as a key mechanism underlying levodopa - induced dyskinesias , their pathogenesis is still unclear .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
In recent years , evidence from animal models of Parkinson 's disease has provided important information to understand the effect of specific receptor and post - receptor molecular mechanisms underlying
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the development of dyskinetic movements .
O O O O O O
Recent preclinical and clinical data from promising lines of research focus on the differential role of presynaptic versus postsynaptic mechanisms , dopamine receptor subtypes , ionotropic and metabotropic glutamate receptors
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O
, and non - dopaminergic neurotransmitter systems in the pathophysiology of levodopa - induced dyskinesias .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Prevention of seizures and reorganization of hippocampal functions by transplantation of bone marrow cells in the acute phase of experimental epilepsy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this study , we investigated the therapeutic potential of bone marrow mononuclear cells ( BMCs ) in a model of epilepsy induced by pilocarpine in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
BMCs obtained from green fluorescent protein ( GFP ) transgenic mice or rats were transplanted intravenously after induction of status epilepticus ( SE ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Spontaneous recurrent seizures ( SRS ) were monitored using Racine 's seizure severity scale .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All of the rats in the saline - treated epileptic control group developed SRS , whereas none of the BMC - treated epileptic animals had seizures in the short term
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 15 days after transplantation ) , regardless of the BMC source .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Over the long - term chronic phase ( 120 days after transplantation ) , only 25 % of BMC - treated epileptic animals had seizures , but with a lower
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
frequency and duration compared to the epileptic control group .
O O O O O O O O O O
The density of hippocampal neurons in the brains of animals treated with BMCs was markedly preserved .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At hippocampal Schaeffer collateral - CA1 synapses , long - term potentiation was preserved in BMC - transplanted rats compared to epileptic controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The donor - derived GFP ( + ) cells were rarely found in the brains of transplanted epileptic rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion , treatment with BMCs can prevent the development of chronic seizures , reduce neuronal loss , and influence the reorganization of the hippocampal neuronal network .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cardioprotective effect of salvianolic acid A on isoproterenol - induced myocardial infarction in rats .
O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O
The present study was designed to evaluate the cardioprotective potential of salvianolic acid A on isoproterenol - induced myocardial infarction in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O
Hemodynamic parameters and lead II electrocardiograph were monitored and recorded continuously .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cardiac marker enzymes and antioxidative parameters in serum and heart tissues were measured .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Assay for mitochondrial respiratory function and histopathological examination of heart tissues were performed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Isoproterenol - treated rats showed significant increases in the levels of lactate dehydrogenase , aspartate transaminase , creatine kinase and malondialdehyde and significant decreases in the activities of superoxide dismutase
B O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O B O O B O O O O O O O B O
, catalase and glutathione peroxidase in serum and heart .
O O O B O O O O O O
These rats also showed declines in left ventricular systolic pressure , maximum and minimum rate of developed left ventricular pressure , and elevation of left ventricular end - diastolic pressure
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and ST - segment .
O O O O O
In addition , mitochondrial respiratory dysfunction characterized by decreased respiratory control ratio and ADP / O was observed in isoproterenol - treated rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O
Administration of salvianolic acid A for a period of 8 days significantly attenuated isoproterenol - induced cardiac dysfunction and myocardial injury and improved mitochondrial respiratory function .
O O B I I O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The protective role of salvianolic acid A against isoproterenol - induced myocardial damage was further confirmed by histopathological examination .
O O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The results of our study suggest that salvianolic acid A possessing antioxidant activity has a significant protective effect against isoproterenol - induced myocardial infarction .
O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Acute effects of N - ( 2 - propylpentanoyl ) urea on hippocampal amino acid neurotransmitters in pilocarpine - induced seizure in rats .
O O O B I I I I I I I O O B I O O B O O O O O O
The present study aimed to investigate the anticonvulsant activity as well as the effects on the level of hippocampal amino acid neurotransmitters ( glutamate , aspartate , glycine and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O B O B O B O
GABA ) of N - ( 2 - propylpentanoyl ) urea ( VPU ) in comparison to its parent compound , valproic acid ( VPA ) .
B O O B I I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O B I O B O O
VPU was more potent than VPA , exhibiting the median effective dose ( ED ( 50 ) ) of 49 mg / kg in protecting rats against pilocarpine - induced
B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
seizure whereas the corresponding value for VPA was 322 mg / kg .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O
In vivo microdialysis demonstrated that an intraperitoneal administration of pilocarpine induced a pronounced increment of hippocampal glutamate and aspartate whereas no significant change was observed on the level of
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
glycine and GABA .
B O B O
Pretreatment with either VPU ( 50 and 100 mg / kg ) or VPA ( 300 and 600 mg / kg ) completely abolished pilocarpine - evoked increases in extracellular
O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
glutamate and aspartate .
B O B O
In addition , a statistically significant reduction was also observed on the level of GABA and glycine but less than a drastic reduction of glutamate and aspartate level .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O B O B O O
Based on the finding that VPU and VPA could protect the animals against pilocarpine - induced seizure it is suggested that the reduction of inhibitory amino acid neurotransmitters was comparatively
O O O O O B O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O
minor and offset by a pronounced reduction of glutamate and aspartate .
O O O O O O O O B O B O
Therefore , like VPA , the finding that VPU could drastically reduce pilocarpine - induced increases in glutamate and aspartate should account , at least partly , for its anticonvulsant
O O O B O O O O B O O O B O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
activity observed in pilocarpine - induced seizure in experimental animals .
O O O B O O O O O O O
Some other mechanism than those being reported herein should be further investigated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute hepatitis attack after exposure to telithromycin .
O O O O O O B O
INTRODUCTION :
O O
Antibiotic - associated hepatotoxicity is rare .
O O O O O O O
With widespread use of antimicrobial agents , however , hepatic injury occurs frequently , and among adverse drug reactions , idiosyncratic reactions are the most serious .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CASE SUMMARY :
O O O
A 25 - year - old male patient , with a height of 175 cm and weight of 72 kg presented to Marmara University Hospital Emergency Department , Istanbul ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Turkey , with 5 days ' history of jaundice , malaise , nausea , and vomiting .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He had been prescribed telithromycin 400 mg / d PO to treat an upper respiratory tract infection 7 days prior .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Admission laboratory tests were as follows :
O O O O O O O
alanine aminotransferase , 67 U / L ( reference range , 10 - 37 U / L ) ; aspartate aminotransferase , 98 U / L ( 10 - 40
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
U / L ) ; alkaline phosphatase , 513 U / L ( 0 - 270 U / L ) ; gamma - glutamyltransferase , 32 U / L (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
7 - 49 U / L ) ; amylase , 46 U / L ( 0 - 220 U / L ) ; total bilirubin , 20 . 1 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
/ dL ( 0 . 2 - 1 . 0 mg / dL ) ; direct bilirubin , 14 . 8 mg / dL
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
( 0 - 0 . 3 mg / dL ) ; and albumin , 4 . 7 mg / dL ( 3 . 5 - 5 . 4 mg /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dL ) .
O O O
No toxin , alcohol , or other drugs were reported .
O O O B O O O O O O O
The patient had suffered a previous episode of """" acute hepatitis of unknown origin , """" that occurred after telithromycin usage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Both incidents occurred within a year .
O O O O O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
Telithromycin is the first of the ketolide antibacterials to receive US Food and Drug Administration approval for clinical use .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It has been associated with infrequent and usually reversible severe hepatic dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Based on a score of 8 on the Naranjo adverse drug reaction probability scale , telithromycin was the probable cause of acute hepatitis in this patient , and pathological findings
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
suggested drug - induced toxic hepatitis .
O O O O O O O
Recurrence of hepatitis attack might have been avoided if the initial incident had been communicated to the attending physician who prescribed telithromycin the second time .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Here we report a case of acute hepatitis probably associated with the administration of telithromycin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Spironolactone - induced renal insufficiency and hyperkalemia in patients with heart failure .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
A previous randomized controlled trial evaluating the use of spironolactone in heart failure patients reported a low risk of hyperkalemia ( 2 % ) and renal insufficiency ( 0 %
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
Because treatments for heart failure have changed since the benefits of spironolactone were reported , the prevalence of these complications may differ in current clinical practice .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We therefore sought to determine the prevalence and clinical associations of hyperkalemia and renal insufficiency in heart failure patients treated with spironolactone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
METHODS :
O O
We performed a case control study of heart failure patients treated with spironolactone in our clinical practice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Cases were patients who developed hyperkalemia ( K ( + ) > 5 . 0 mEq / L ) or renal insufficiency ( Cr > or = 2 . 5
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
mg / dL ) , and they were compared to 2 randomly selected controls per case .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical characteristics , medications , and serum chemistries at baseline and follow - up time periods were compared .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Sixty - seven of 926 patients ( 7 . 2 % ) required discontinuation of spironolactone due to hyperkalemia ( n = 33 ) or renal failure ( n =
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
34 ) .
O O O
Patients who developed hyperkalemia were older and more likely to have diabetes , had higher baseline serum potassium levels and lower baseline potassium supplement doses , and were more likely
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O
to be treated with beta - blockers than controls ( n = 134 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients who developed renal insufficiency had lower baseline body weight and higher baseline serum creatinine , required higher doses of loop diuretics , and were more likely to be treated
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with thiazide diuretics than controls .
O B O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Spironolactone - induced hyperkalemia and renal insufficiency are more common in our clinical experience than reported previously .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This difference is explained by patient comorbidities and more frequent use of beta - blockers .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
End - stage renal disease ( ESRD ) after orthotopic liver transplantation ( OLTX ) using calcineurin - based immunotherapy : risk of development and treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
The calcineurin inhibitors cyclosporine and tacrolimus are both known to be nephrotoxic .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O
Their use in orthotopic liver transplantation ( OLTX ) has dramatically improved success rates .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recently , however , we have had an increase of patients who are presenting after OLTX with end - stage renal disease ( ESRD ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This retrospective study examines the incidence and treatment of ESRD and chronic renal failure ( CRF ) in OLTX patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Patients receiving an OLTX only from June 1985 through December of 1994 who survived 6 months postoperatively were studied ( n = 834 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our prospectively collected database was the source of information .
O O O O O O O O O O
Patients were divided into three groups : Controls , no CRF or ESRD , n = 748 ; CRF , sustained serum creatinine > 2 . 5 mg / dl
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
, n = 41 ; and ESRD , n = 45 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Groups were compared for preoperative laboratory variables , diagnosis , postoperative variables , survival , type of ESRD therapy , and survival from onset of ESRD .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
At 13 years after OLTX , the incidence of severe renal dysfunction was 18 . 1 % ( CRF 8 . 6 % and ESRD 9 . 5 % )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Compared with control patients , CRF and ESRD patients had higher preoperative serum creatinine levels , a greater percentage of patients with hepatorenal syndrome , higher percentage requirement for dialysis
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in the first 3 months postoperatively , and a higher 1 - year serum creatinine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Multivariate stepwise logistic regression analysis using preoperative and postoperative variables identified that an increase of serum creatinine compared with average at 1 year , 3 months , and 4 weeks
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
postoperatively were independent risk factors for the development of CRF or ESRD with odds ratios of 2 . 6 , 2 . 2 , and 1 . 6 , respectively
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Overall survival from the time of OLTX was not significantly different among groups , but by year 13 , the survival of the patients who had ESRD was only 28
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 2 % compared with 54 . 6 % in the control group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients developing ESRD had a 6 - year survival after onset of ESRD of 27 % for the patients receiving hemodialysis versus 71 . 4 % for the patients developing
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ESRD who subsequently received kidney transplants .
O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Patients who are more than 10 years post - OLTX have CRF and ESRD at a high rate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The development of ESRD decreases survival , particularly in those patients treated with dialysis only .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients who develop ESRD have a higher preoperative and 1 - year serum creatinine and are more likely to have hepatorenal syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
However , an increase of serum creatinine at various times postoperatively is more predictive of the development of CRF or ESRD .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
New strategies for long - term immunosuppression may be needed to decrease this complication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of intravenous nimodipine on blood pressure and outcome after acute stroke .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND AND PURPOSE :
O O O O
The Intravenous Nimodipine West European Stroke Trial ( INWEST ) found a correlation between nimodipine - induced reduction in blood pressure ( BP ) and an unfavorable outcome in acute
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
stroke .
O O
We sought to confirm this correlation with and without adjustment for prognostic variables and to investigate outcome in subgroups with increasing levels of BP reduction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Patients with a clinical diagnosis of ischemic stroke ( within 24 hours ) were consecutively allocated to receive placebo ( n = 100 ) , 1 mg / h (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
low - dose ) nimodipine ( n = 101 ) , or 2 mg / h ( high - dose ) nimodipine ( n = 94 ) .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The correlation between average BP change during the first 2 days and the outcome at day 21 was analyzed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Two hundred sixty - five patients were included in this analysis ( n = 92 , 93 , and 80 for placebo , low dose , and high dose ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
respectively ) .
O O O
Nimodipine treatment resulted in a statistically significant reduction in systolic BP ( SBP ) and diastolic BP ( DBP ) from baseline compared with placebo during the first few days
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
In multivariate analysis , a significant correlation between DBP reduction and worsening of the neurological score was found for the high - dose group ( beta = 0 . 49
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, P = 0 . 048 ) .
O O O O O O O O
Patients with a DBP reduction of > or = 20 % in the high - dose group had a significantly increased adjusted OR for the compound outcome variable death or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dependency ( Barthel Index < 60 ) ( n / N = 25 / 26 , OR 10 . 16 , 95 % CI 1 . 02 to 101 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
74 ) and death alone ( n / N = 9 / 26 , OR 4 . 336 , 95 % CI 1 . 131 16 . 619 ) compared
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with all placebo patients ( n / N = 62 / 92 and 14 / 92 , respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was no correlation between SBP change and outcome .
O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS : DBP , but not SBP ,
O O O O O O O O
reduction was associated with neurological worsening after the intravenous administration of high - dose nimodipine after acute stroke .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
For low - dose nimodipine , the results were not conclusive .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
These results do not confirm or exclude a neuroprotective property of nimodipine .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Transient neurologic symptoms after spinal anesthesia : a lower incidence with prilocaine and bupivacaine than with lidocaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Recent evidence suggests that transient neurologic symptoms ( TNSs ) frequently follow lidocaine spinal anesthesia but are infrequent with bupivacaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O
However , identification of a short - acting local anesthetic to substitute for lidocaine for brief surgical procedures remains an important goal .
