O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Prilocaine is an amide local anesthetic with a duration of action similar to that of lidocaine .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Accordingly , the present , prospective double - blind study compares prilocaine with lidocaine and bupivacaine with respect to duration of action and relative risk of TNSs .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Ninety patients classified as American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status
O O O O O O O O O O
I or II who were scheduled for short gynecologic procedures under spinal anesthesia were randomly allocated to receive 2 . 5 ml 2 % lidocaine in 7 . 5 %
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
glucose , 2 % prilocaine in 7 . 5 % glucose , or 0 . 5 % bupivacaine in 7 . 5 % glucose .
B O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O B O
All solutions were provided in blinded vials by the hospital pharmacy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Details of spinal puncture , extension and regression of spinal block , and the times to reach discharge criteria were noted .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the evening of postoperative day 1 , patients were evaluated for TNSs by a physician unaware of the drug administered and the details of the anesthetic procedure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Nine of 30 patients receiving lidocaine experienced TNSs , 1 of 30 patients receiving prilocaine ( P = 0 . 03 ) had them , and none of 30 patients
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
receiving bupivacaine had TNSs .
O B O O O
Times to ambulate and to void were similar after lidocaine and prilocaine ( 150 vs . 165 min and 238 vs . 253 min , respectively ) but prolonged after
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
bupivacaine ( 200 and 299 min , respectively ; P < 0 . 05 ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Prilocaine may be preferable to lidocaine for short surgical procedures because it has a similar duration of action but a lower incidence of TNSs .
B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The role of nicotine in smoking - related cardiovascular disease .
O O O B O O O O O O O
Nicotine activates the sympathetic nervous system and in this way could contribute to cardiovascular disease .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Animal studies and mechanistic studies indicate that nicotine could play a role in accelerating atherosclerosis , but evidence among humans is too inadequate to be definitive about such an effect
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Almost certainly , nicotine via its hemodynamic effects contributes to acute cardiovascular events , although current evidence suggests that the effects of nicotine are much less important than are the
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
prothrombotic effects of cigarette smoking or the effects of carbon monoxide .
O O O O O O O O O B I O
Nicotine does not appear to enhance thrombosis among humans .
B O O O O O O O O O
Clinical studies of pipe smokers and people using transdermal nicotine support the idea that toxins other than nicotine are the most important causes of acute cardiovascular events .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Finally , the dose response for cardiovascular events of nicotine appears to be flat , suggesting that if nicotine is involved , adverse effects might be seen with relatively low
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
- level cigarette exposures .
O O O O O
Seizure resulting from a venlafaxine overdose .
O O O O B O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To report a case of venlafaxine overdose .
O O O O O B O O
CASE SUMMARY :
O O O
A 40 - year - old woman with major depression took an overdose of venlafaxine in an apparent suicide attempt .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
After the ingestion of 26 venlafaxine 50 - mg tablets , the patient experienced a witnessed generalized seizure .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
She was admitted to the medical intensive care unit , venlafaxine was discontinued , and no further sequelae were seen .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
To our knowledge , this is the first reported case of venlafaxine overdose that resulted in a generalized seizure .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Based on nonoverdose pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of venlafaxine and the potential risks of available interventions , no emergent therapy was instituted .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The venlafaxine overdose in our patient resulted in a single episode of generalized seizure but elicited no further sequelae .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of nifedipine on renal function in liver transplant recipients receiving tacrolimus .
O O B O O O O O O O O B O
The effect of nifedipine on renal function in liver transplant recipients who were receiving tacrolimus was evaluated between January 1992 and January 1996 .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Two groups of patients receiving tacrolimus were compared over a period of 1 year , one group comprising hypertensive patients who were receiving nifedipine , and the other comprising nonhypertensive
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
patients not receiving nifedipine .
O O O B O
The time from transplant to baseline was similar in all patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nifedipine significantly improved kidney function as indicated by a significant lowering of serum creatinine levels at 6 and 12 months .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The observed positive impact of nifedipine on reducing the nephrotoxicity associated with tacrolimus in liver transplant recipients should be an important factor in selecting an agent to treat hypertension in
O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
this population .
O O O
Sinus arrest associated with continuous - infusion cimetidine .
O O O O O O O B O
The administration of intermittent intravenous infusions of cimetidine is infrequently associated with the development of bradyarrhythmias .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
A 40 - year - old man with leukemia and no history of cardiac disease developed recurrent , brief episodes of apparent sinus arrest while receiving continuous - infusion
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cimetidine 50 mg / hour .
B O O O O O
The arrhythmias were temporally related to cimetidine administration , disappeared after dechallenge , and did not recur during ranitidine treatment .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
This is the first reported case of sinus arrest associated with continuous - infusion cimetidine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Composition of gall bladder stones associated with octreotide : response to oral ursodeoxycholic acid .
O O O O O O O B O O O O B I O
Octreotide , an effective treatment for acromegaly , induces gall bladder stones in 13 - 60 % of patients .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because knowledge of stone composition is essential for studies of their pathogenesis , treatment , and prevention , this was investigated by direct and indirect methods in 14 octreotide treated
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
acromegalic patients with gall stones .
O O O O O O
Chemical analysis of gall stones retrieved at cholecystectomy from two patients , showed that they contained 71 % and 87 % cholesterol by weight .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
In the remaining 12 patients , localised computed tomography of the gall bladder showed that eight had stones with maximum attenuation scores of < 100 Hounsfield units ( values of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
< 100 HU predict cholesterol rich , dissolvable stones ) .
O O O O B O O O O O O
Gall bladder bile was obtained by ultrasound guided , fine needle puncture from six patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All six patients had supersaturated bile ( mean ( SEM ) cholesterol saturation index of 1 . 19 ( 0 . 08 ) ( range 1 . 01 - 1
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 53 ) ) and all had abnormally rapid cholesterol microcrystal nucleation times ( < 4 days ( range 1 - 4 ) ) , whilst in four , the
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
bile contained cholesterol microcrystals immediately after sampling .
O O B O O O O O
Of the 12 patients considered for oral ursodeoxycholic acid ( UDCA ) treatment , two had a blocked cystic duct and were not started on UDCA while one was lost
O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
to follow up .
O O O O
After one year of treatment , five of the remaining nine patients showed either partial ( n = 3 ) or complete ( n = 2 ) gall stone dissolution
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, suggesting that their stones were cholesterol rich .
O O O O O O B O O
This corresponds , by actuarial ( life table ) analysis , to a combined gall stone dissolution rate of 58 . 3 ( 15 . 9 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion , octreotide induced gall stones are generally small , multiple , and cholesterol rich although , in common with spontaneous gall stone disease , at presentation some patients
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
will have a blocked cystic duct and some gall stones containing calcium .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Cardiovascular complications associated with terbutaline treatment for preterm labor .
O O O O B O O O O O
Severe cardiovascular complications occurred in eight of 160 patients treated with terbutaline for preterm labor .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Associated corticosteroid therapy and twin gestations appear to be predisposing factors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Potential mechanisms of the pathophysiology are briefly discussed .
O O O O O O O O O
Neurologic effects of subarachnoid administration of 2 - chloroprocaine - CE , bupivacaine , and low pH normal saline in dogs .
O O O O O O B I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of this study was to evaluate the neurologic consequences of deliberate subarachnoid injection of large volumes of 2 - chloroprocaine - CE in experimental animals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O O O O
The possible role of low pH as well as total volume as potential factors in causing neurotoxicity was evaluated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The 65 dogs in the study received injections in the subarachnoid space as follows : 6 to 8 ml of bupivacaine ( N = 15 ) ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
2 - chloroprocaine - CE ( N = 20 ) , low pH normal saline ( pH 3 . 0 )
B I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( N = 20 ) , or normal saline ( N = 10 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of the 20 animals that received subarachnoid injection of 2 - chloroprocaine - CE seven ( 35 % ) developed hind - limb paralysis .
O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O
None of the animals that received bupivacaine , normal saline , or normal saline titrated to a pH 3 . 0 developed hind - limb paralysis .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of the 15 spinal cords of the animals that received 2 - chloroprocaine - CE , 13 showed subpial necrosis ; the nerve roots and subarachnoid vessels were normal .
O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The spinal cords of the animals that received bupivacaine , low pH normal saline ( pH 3 . 0 ) , or normal saline did not show abnormal findings .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Early adjuvant adriamycin in superficial bladder carcinoma .
O O B O O O O O
A multicenter study was performed in 110 patients with superficial transitional cell carcinoma of the bladder .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adriamycin ( 50 mg / 50 ml ) was administered intravesically within 24 h after transurethral resection of TA - T1 ( O - A ) bladder tumors .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Instillation was repeated twice during the first week , then weekly during the first month and afterwards monthly for 1 year .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The tolerance was evaluated in these 110 patients , and 29 patients presented with local side - effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 24 of these patients chemical cystitis was severe enough for them to drop out of the study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No systemic side - effects were observed .
O O O O O O O O
Recurrence was studied in 82 evaluable patients after 1 year of follow - up and in 72 patients followed for 2 - 3 years ( mean 32 months ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of the 82 patients studied after 1 year , 23 had primary and 59 recurrent disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of the 82 evaluable patients , 50 did not show any recurrence after 1 year ( 61 % ) , while 32 presented with one or more recurrences ( 39
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% ) .
O O O
Of these recurrences , 27 were T1 tumors while five progressed to more highly invasive lesions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In patients that were free of recurrence during the first year , 80 % remained tumor - free during the 2 - to 3 - year follow - up period
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Of the patients developing one or more recurrences during the first year , only 50 % presented with further recurrence once the instillations were stopped .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The beneficial effect of Adriamycin appears obvious and might be related to the drug itself , the early and repeated instillations after TUR , or both .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hyperkalemia associated with sulindac therapy .
O O O B O O
Hyperkalemia has recently been recognized as a complication of nonsteroidal antiinflammatory agents ( NSAID ) such as indomethacin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Several recent studies have stressed the renal sparing features of sulindac , owing to its lack of interference with renal prostacyclin synthesis .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O
We describe 4 patients in whom hyperkalemia ranging from 6 . 1 to 6 . 9 mEq / l developed within 3 to 8 days of sulindac administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
In all of them normal serum potassium levels reached within 2 to 4 days of stopping sulindac .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O
As no other medications known to effect serum potassium had been given concomitantly , this course of events is suggestive of a cause - and - effect relationship between
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
sulindac and hyperkalemia .
B O O O
These observations indicate that initial hopes that sulindac may not be associated with the adverse renal effects of other NSAID are probably not justified .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ventricular tachyarrhythmias during cesarean section after ritodrine therapy : interaction with anesthetics .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O
This case illustrates that patients receiving ritodrine for preterm labor may risk interactions between the residual betamimetic effects of ritodrine and the effects of anesthetics during cesarean section .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Such interactions may result in serious cardiovascular complications even after cessation of an infusion of ritodrine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Preoperative assessment should focus on cardiovascular status and serum potassium level .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
Delaying induction of anesthesia should be considered whenever possible .
O O O O O O O O O O
Careful fluid administration and cautious use of titrated doses of ephedrine are advised .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
After delivery of the infant , there should be no contraindication to the use of an alpha - adrenergic vasopressor such as phenylephrine to treat hypotensive patients with tachycardia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Immunohistochemical , electron microscopic and morphometric studies of estrogen - induced rat prolactinomas after bromocriptine treatment .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O
To clarify the effects of bromocriptine on prolactinoma cells in vivo , immunohistochemical , ultrastructural and morphometrical analyses were applied to estrogen - induced rat prolactinoma cells 1 h and
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
6 h after injection of bromocriptine ( 3 mg / kg of body weight ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
One h after treatment , serum prolactin levels decreased markedly .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Electron microscopy disclosed many secretory granules , slightly distorted rough endoplasmic reticulum , and partially dilated Golgi cisternae in the prolactinoma cells .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Morphometric analysis revealed that the volume density of secretory granules increased , while the volume density of cytoplasmic microtubules decreased .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings suggest that lowered serum prolactin levels in the early phase of bromocriptine treatment may result from an impaired secretion of prolactin due to decreasing numbers of cytoplasmic microtubules
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
At 6 h after injection , serum prolactin levels were still considerably lower than in controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The prolactinoma cells at this time were well granulated , with vesiculated rough endoplasmic reticulum and markedly dilated Golgi cisternae .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Electron microscopical immunohistochemistry revealed positive reaction products noted on the secretory granules , Golgi cisternae , and endoplasmic reticulum of the untreated rat prolactinoma cells .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , only secretory granules showed the positive reaction products for prolactin 6 h after bromocriptine treatment of the adenoma cells .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
An increase in the volume density of secretory granules and a decrease in the volume densities of rough endoplasmic reticulum and microtubules was determined by morphometric analysis , suggesting that
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
bromocriptine inhibits protein synthesis as well as bringing about a disturbance of the prolactin secretion .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On two paradoxical side - effects of prednisolone in rats , ribosomal RNA biosyntheses , and a mechanism of action .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Liver enlargement and muscle wastage occurred in Wistar rats following the subcutaneous administration of prednisolone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
In the liver both the content of RNA and the biosynthesis of ribosomal RNA increased while both the RNA content and ribosomal RNA biosynthesis were reduced in the gastrocnemius muscle
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
It is suggested that the drug acted in a selective and tissue - specific manner to enhance ribosomal RNA synthesis in the liver and depress such synthesis in the muscle
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
This view supports the contention that the liver and muscle are independent sites of prednisolone action .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Possible intramuscular midazolam - associated cardiorespiratory arrest and death .
O O B O O O O O O O
Midazolam hydrochloride is commonly used for dental or endoscopic procedures .
B I O O O O O O O O O
Although generally consisted safe when given intramuscularly , intravenous administration is known to cause respiratory and cardiovascular depression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This report describes the first published case of cardiorespiratory arrest and death associated with intramuscular administration of midazolam .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Information regarding midazolam use is reviewed to provide recommendation for safe administration .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Serial epilepsy caused by levodopa / carbidopa administration in two patients on hemodialysis .
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O
Two patients with similar clinical features are presented : both patients had chronic renal failure , on hemodialysis for many years but recently begun on a high - flux dialyzer
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
; both had been receiving a carbidopa / levodopa preparation ; and both had the onset of hallucinosis and recurrent seizures , which were refractory to anticonvulsants .
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The first patient died without a diagnosis ; the second patient had a dramatic recovery following the administration of vitamin B6 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Neither patient was considered to have a renal state sufficiently severe enough to explain their presentation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of L - alpha - glyceryl - phosphorylcholine on amnesia caused by scopolamine .
O O B I I I I I I O O O O B O
The present study was carried out to test the effects of L - alpha - glycerylphosphorylcholine ( L - alpha - GFC ) on memory impairment induced by scopolamine in
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O B I I I I O O O O O O B O
man .
O O
Thirty - two healthy young volunteers were randomly allocated to four different groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
They were given a ten day pretreatment with either L - alpha - GFC or placebo , p . o . , and on the eleventh day either scopolamine or
O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
placebo , i . m .
O O O O O O
Before and 0 . 5 , 1 , 2 , 3 , and 6 h after injection the subjects were given attention and mnemonic tests .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The findings of this study indicate that the drug is able to antagonize impairment of attention and memory induced by scopolamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Seizures induced by the cocaine metabolite benzoylecgonine in rats .
O O O O B O B O O O
The half - life ( t1 / 2 ) of cocaine is relatively short , but some of the consequences of its use , such as seizures and strokes ,
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
can occur hours after exposure .
O O O O O O
This led us to hypothesize that a metabolite of cocaine may be responsible for some of those delayed sequelae .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
We evaluated the potential of the major metabolite of cocaine , benzoylecgonine ( BE ) , to cause seizures .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O
Two separate equimolar doses ( 0 . 2 and 0 . 4 mumol ) of either cocaine or BE were injected ventricularly in unanesthetized juvenile rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
Treated rats were then evaluated for incidence , latency , and seizure pattern or for locomotor activity in animals without seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BE - Induced seizures occurred more frequently and had significantly longer latencies than those induced by equimolar amounts of cocaine .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Whereas cocaine - induced seizures were best characterized as brief , generalized , and tonic and resulted in death , those induced by BE were prolonged , often multiple and
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
mixed in type , and rarely resulted in death .
O O O O O O O O O O
Electrical recordings from the hippocampus showed a rhythmic progression in EEG frequency and voltage with clinical seizure expression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BE - Injected rats that did not have seizures had significantly more locomotor activity than cocaine - injected animals without seizures .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The finding that cocaine - and BE - induced seizures differ in several respects suggests more than one mechanism for cocaine - induced seizures and emphasizes the importance of a
O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
cocaine metabolite , BE .
B O O B O
Protection against amphetamine - induced neurotoxicity toward striatal dopamine neurons in rodents by LY274614 , an excitatory amino acid antagonist .
O O B O O O O O B O O O O B O O O B I O O
LY274614 , 3SR , 4aRS , 6SR , 8aRS - 6 - [ phosphonomethyl ] decahydr oisoquinoline - 3 -
B O B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I
carboxylic acid , has been described as a potent antagonist of the N - methyl - D - aspartate ( NMDA ) subtype of glutamate receptor .
I I O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I O B O O O B O O
Here its ability to antagonize the prolonged depletion of dopamine in the striatum by amphetamine in iprindole - treated rats is reported .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O B O O O O O O
A single 18 . 4 mg / kg ( i . p . ) dose of ( + / - ) - amphetamine hemisulfate , given to rats pretreated with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
iprindole , resulted in persistent depletion of dopamine in the striatum 1 week later .
B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
This prolonged depletion of dopamine in the striatum was antagonized by dizocilpine ( MK - 801 , a non - competitive antagonist of NMDA receptors ) or by LY274614 (
O O O O B O O O O O O B O B I I O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
a competitive antagonist of NMDA receptors ) .
O O O O B O O O
The protective effect of LY274614 was dose - dependent , being maximum at 10 - 40 mgkg ( i . p . ) .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A 10 mg / kg dose of LY274614 was effective in antagonizing the depletion of dopamine in the striatum , when given as long as 8 hr prior to
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
amphetamine but not when given 24 hr prior to amphetamine .
B O O O O O O O O B O
Depletion of dopamine in the striatum was also antagonized when LY274614 was given after the injection of amphetamine ; LY274614 protected when given up to 4 hr after but not
O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
when given 8 or 24 hr after amphetamine .
O O O O O O O B O
The prolonged depletion of dopamine in the striatum in mice , given multiple injections of methamphetamine , was also antagonized dose - dependently and completely by LY274614 .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
The data strengthen the evidence that the neurotoxic effect of amphetamine and related compounds toward nigrostriatal dopamine neurons involves NMDA receptors and that LY274614 is an NMDA receptor antagonist with
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O B O O O B O O B O O O
long - lasting in vivo effects in rats .
O O O O O O O O O
Neonatal pyridoxine responsive convulsions due to isoniazid therapy .
O B O O O O B O O
A 17 - day - old infant on isoniazid therapy 13 mg / kg daily from birth because of maternal tuberculosis was admitted after 4 days of clonic fits .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No underlying infective or biochemical cause could be found .
O O O O O O O O O O
The fits ceased within 4 hours of administering intramuscular pyridoxine , suggesting an aetiology of pyridoxine deficiency secondary to isoniazid medication .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O B O O
Reversal by phenylephrine of the beneficial effects of intravenous nitroglycerin in patients with acute myocardial infarction .
O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Nitroglycerin has been shown to reduce ST - segment elevation during acute myocardial infarction , an effect potentiated in the dog by agents that reverse nitroglycerin - induced hypotension .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Our study was designed to determine the effects of combined nitroglycerin and phenylephrine therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
Ten patients with acute transmural myocardial infarctions received intravenous nitroglycerin , sufficient to reduce mean arterial pressure from 107 + / -
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
6 to 85 + / -
O O O O O O
6 mm Hg ( P less than 0 . 001 ) , for 60 minutes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Left ventricular filling pressure decreased from 19 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O
2 to 11 + / -
O O O O O O
2 mm Hg ( P less than 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
SigmaST , the sum of ST - segment elevations in 16 precordial leads , decreased ( P less than 0 . 02 ) with intravenous nitroglycerin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Subsequent addition of phenylephrine infusion , sufficient to re - elevate mean arterial pressure to 106 + / -
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 mm Hg ( P less than 0 . 001 ) for 30 minutes , increased left ventricular filling pressure to 17 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 mm Hg ( P less than 0 . 05 ) and also significantly increased sigmaST ( P less than 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our results suggest that addition of phenylephrine to nitroglycerin is not beneficial in the treatment of patients with acute myocardial infarction .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Elevation of ADAM10 , ADAM17 , MMP - 2 and MMP - 9 expression with media degeneration features CaCl2 - induced thoracic aortic aneurysm in a rat model .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
This study was designed to establish a rat model of thoracic aortic aneurysm ( TAA ) by calcium chloride ( CaCl ( 2 ) ) - induced arterial injury and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B I I I O O O O O O
to explore the potential role of a disintegrin and metalloproteinase ( ADAM ) , matrix metalloproteinases ( MMPs ) and their endogenous inhibitors ( TIMPs ) in TAA formation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Thoracic aorta of male Sprague - Dawley rats was exposed to 0 . 5 M CaCl ( 2 ) or normal saline ( NaCl ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O B O O
After 12weeks , animals were euthanized , and CaCl ( 2 ) - treated , CaCl ( 2 ) - untreated ( n = 12 ) and NaCl - treated
O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O B O O
aortic segments ( n = 12 ) were collected for histological and molecular assessments .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MMP - TIMP and ADAM mRNAs were semi - quantitatively analyzed and protein expressions were determined by immunohistochemistry .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Despite similar external diameters among CaCl ( 2 ) - treated , non - CaCl ( 2 ) - treated and NaCl - treated segments , aneurymal alteration ( n
O O O O O B I I I O O O O O B I I I O O O B O O O O O O O O
= 6 , 50 % ) , media degeneration with regional disruption , fragmentation of elastic fiber , and increased collagen deposition ( n = 12 , 100 % )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
were demonstrated in CaCl ( 2 ) - treated segments .
O O O B I I I O O O O
MMP - 2 , MMP - 9 , ADAM - 10 and ADAM - 17 mRNA levels were increased in CaCl ( 2 ) - treated segments ( all p
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O
< 0 . 01 ) , with trends of elevation in CaCl ( 2 ) - untreated segments , as compared with NaCl - treated segments .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O B O O O O
Immunohistochemistry displayed significantly increased expressions of MMP - 2 , MMP - 9 , ADAM - 10 and ADAM - 17 ( all p < 0 . 01 ) in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
intima and media for CaCl ( 2 ) - treated segments .
O O O O B I I I O O O O
TIMP mRNA and tissue levels did not differ obviously among the three aortic segments .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
This study establishes a TAA model by periarterial CaCl ( 2 ) exposure in rats , and demonstrates a significant elevation of expression of MMP - 2 , MMP -
O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
9 , ADAM10 and ADAM17 in the pathogenesis of vascular remodeling .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
When drugs disappear from the patient : elimination of intravenous medication by hemodiafiltration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Twenty - three hours after heart transplantation , life - threatening acute right heart failure was diagnosed in a patient requiring continuous venovenous hemodiafiltration ( CVVHDF ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Increasing doses of catecholamines , sedatives , and muscle relaxants administered through a central venous catheter were ineffective .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , a bolus of epinephrine injected through an alternative catheter provoked a hypertensive crisis .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Thus , interference with the central venous infusion by the dialysis catheter was suspected .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The catheters were changed , and hemodynamics stabilized at lower catecholamine doses .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
When the effects of IV drugs are inadequate in patients receiving CVVHDF , interference with adjacent catheters resulting in elimination of the drug by CVVHDF should be suspected .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Long - term glutamate supplementation failed to protect against peripheral neurotoxicity of paclitaxel .
O O O B O O O O O O O O B O
Toxic peripheral neuropathy is still a significant limiting factor for chemotherapy with paclitaxel ( PAC ) , although glutamate and its closely related amino acid glutamine were claimed to ameliorate
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O B O O O O B I B O O O O
PAC neurotoxicity .
B O O
This pilot trial aimed to evaluate the role of glutamate supplementation for preventing PAC - induced peripheral neuropathy in a randomized , placebo - controlled , double - blinded clinical
O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and electro - diagnostic study .
O O O O O O
Forty - three ovarian cancer patients were available for analysis following six cycles of the same PAC - containing regimen : 23 had been supplemented by glutamate all along the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O
treatment period , at a daily dose of three times 500 mg ( group G ) , and 20 had received a placebo ( group P ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients were evaluated by neurological examinations , questionnaires and sensory - motor nerve conduction studies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was no significant difference in the frequency of signs or symptoms between the two groups although neurotoxicity symptoms presented mostly with lower scores of severity in group G .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , this difference reached statistical significance only with regard to reported pain sensation ( P = 0 . 011 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Also the frequency of abnormal electro - diagnostic findings showed similarity between the two groups ( G : 7 / 23 = 30 . 4 % ; P : 6
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
/ 20 = 30 % ) .
O O O O O O O
This pilot study leads to the conclusion that glutamate supplementation at the chosen regimen fails to protect against peripheral neurotoxicity of PAC .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Attentional modulation of perceived pain intensity in capsaicin - induced secondary hyperalgesia .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Perceived pain intensity is modulated by attention .
O O O O O O O O
However , it is not known that how pain intensity ratings are affected by attention in capsaicin - induced secondary hyperalgesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Here we show that perceived pain intensity in secondary hyperalgesia is decreased when attention is distracted away from the painful pinprick stimulus with a visual task .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , it was found that the magnitude of attentional modulation in secondary hyperalgesia is very similar to that of capsaicin - untreated , control condition .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Our findings , showing no interaction between capsaicin treatment and attentional modulation suggest that capsaicin - induced secondary hyperalgesia and attention might affect mechanical pain through independent mechanisms .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Testosterone - dependent hypertension and upregulation of intrarenal angiotensinogen in Dahl salt - sensitive rats .
B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Blood pressure ( BP ) is more salt sensitive in men than in premenopausal women .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
In Dahl salt - sensitive rats ( DS ) , high - salt ( HS ) diet increases BP more in males than females .
O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast to the systemic renin - angiotensin system , which is suppressed in response to HS in male DS , intrarenal angiotensinogen expression is increased , and intrarenal levels
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of ANG II are not suppressed .
O O O O O O O
In this study , the hypothesis was tested that there is a sexual dimorphism in HS - induced upregulation of intrarenal angiotensinogen mediated by testosterone that also causes increases in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
BP and renal injury .
O O O O O
On a low - salt ( LS ) diet , male DS had higher levels of intrarenal angiotensinogen mRNA than females .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
HS diet for 4 wk increased renal cortical angiotensinogen mRNA and protein only in male DS , which was prevented by castration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ovariectomy of female DS had no effect on intrarenal angiotensinogen expression on either diet .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Radiotelemetric BP was similar between males and castrated rats on LS diet .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
HS diet for 4 wk caused a progressive increase in BP , protein and albumin excretion , and glomerular sclerosis in male DS rats , which were attenuated by castration
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Testosterone replacement in castrated DS rats increased BP , renal injury , and upregulation of renal angiotensinogen associated with HS diet .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Testosterone contributes to the development of hypertension and renal injury in male DS rats on HS diet possibly through upregulation of the intrarenal renin - angiotensin system .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Prenatal protein deprivation alters dopamine - mediated behaviors and dopaminergic and glutamatergic receptor binding .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Epidemiological evidence indicates that prenatal nutritional deprivation may increase the risk of schizophrenia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The goal of these studies was to use an animal model to examine the effects of prenatal protein deprivation on behaviors and receptor binding with relevance to schizophrenia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report that prenatally protein deprived ( PD ) female rats showed an increased stereotypic response to apomorphine and an increased locomotor response to amphetamine in adulthood .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O
These differences were not observed during puberty .
O O O O O O O O
No changes in haloperidol - induced catalepsy or MK - 801 - induced locomotion were seen following PD .
O O O B O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O
In addition , PD female rats showed increased ( 3 ) H - MK - 801 binding in the striatum and hippocampus , but not in the cortex .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PD female rats also showed increased ( 3 ) H - haloperidol binding and decreased dopamine transporter binding in striatum .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O B O O O O O
No statistically significant changes in behavior or receptor binding were found in PD males with the exception of increased ( 3 ) H - MK - 801 binding in cortex
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O
.
O
This animal model may be useful to explore the mechanisms by which prenatal nutritional deficiency enhances risk for schizophrenia in humans and may also have implications for developmental processes leading
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to differential sensitivity to drugs of abuse .
O O O O O O O O
mToR inhibitors - induced proteinuria : mechanisms , significance , and management .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Massive urinary protein excretion has been observed after conversion from calcineurin inhibitors to mammalian target of rapamycin ( mToR ) inhibitors , especially sirolimus , in renal transplant recipients with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O
chronic allograft nephropathy .
O O O O
Because proteinuria is a major predictive factor of poor transplantation outcome , many studies focused on this adverse event during the past years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Whether proteinuria was due to sirolimus or only a consequence of calcineurin inhibitors withdrawal remained unsolved until high range proteinuria has been observed during sirolimus therapy in islet transplantation and
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
in patients who received sirolimus de novo .
O O O O B O O O
Podocyte injury and focal segmental glomerulosclerosis have been related to mToR inhibition in some patients , but the pathways underlying these lesions remain hypothetic .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We discuss herein the possible mechanisms and the significance of mToR blockade - induced proteinuria .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hypothalamic prolactin receptor messenger ribonucleic acid levels , prolactin signaling , and hyperprolactinemic inhibition of pulsatile luteinizing hormone secretion are dependent on estradiol .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Hyperprolactinemia can reduce fertility and libido .
O O O O O O O
Although central prolactin actions are thought to contribute to this , the mechanisms are poorly understood .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We first tested whether chronic hyperprolactinemia inhibited two neuroendocrine parameters necessary for female fertility : pulsatile LH secretion and the estrogen - induced LH surge .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Chronic hyperprolactinemia induced by the dopamine antagonist sulpiride caused a 40 % reduction LH pulse frequency in ovariectomized rats , but only in the presence of chronic low levels of
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
estradiol .
B O
Sulpiride did not affect the magnitude of a steroid - induced LH surge or the percentage of GnRH neurons activated during the surge .
B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Estradiol is known to influence expression of the long form of prolactin receptors ( PRL - R ) and components of prolactin 's signaling pathway .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To test the hypothesis that estrogen increases PRL - R expression and sensitivity to prolactin , we next demonstrated that estradiol greatly augments prolactin - induced STAT5 activation .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Lastly , we measured PRL - R and suppressor of cytokine signaling ( SOCS - 1 and - 3 and CIS , which reflect the level of prolactin signaling )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mRNAs in response to sulpiride and estradiol .
O O O O B O B O
Sulpiride induced only SOCS - 1 in the medial preoptic area , where GnRH neurons are regulated , but in the arcuate nucleus and choroid plexus , PRL - R
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, SOCS - 3 , and CIS mRNA levels were also induced .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Estradiol enhanced these effects on SOCS - 3 and CIS .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Interestingly , estradiol also induced PRL - R , SOCS - 3 , and CIS mRNA levels independently .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These data show that GnRH pulse frequency is inhibited by chronic hyperprolactinemia in a steroid - dependent manner .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
They also provide evidence for estradiol - dependent and brain region - specific regulation of PRL - R expression and signaling responses by prolactin .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Estrogen prevents cholesteryl ester accumulation in macrophages induced by the HIV protease inhibitor ritonavir .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O B O
Individuals with HIV can now live long lives with drug therapy that often includes protease inhibitors such as ritonavir .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Many patients , however , develop negative long - term side effects such as premature atherosclerosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We have previously demonstrated that ritonavir treatment increases atherosclerotic lesion formation in male mice to a greater extent than in female mice .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , peripheral blood monocytes isolated from ritonavir - treated females had less cholesteryl ester accumulation .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O B I O O
In the present study , we have investigated the molecular mechanisms by which female hormones influence cholesterol metabolism in macrophages in response to the HIV protease inhibitor ritonavir .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
We have utilized the human monocyte cell line ,
O O O O O O O O O
THP - 1 as a model to address this question .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Briefly , cells were differentiated for 72 h with 100 nM PMA to obtain a macrophage - like phenotype in the presence or absence of 1 nM
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
17beta - estradiol ( E2 ) , 100 nM progesterone or vehicle ( 0 . 01 % ethanol ) .
B I I O B O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O
Cells were then treated with 30 ng / ml ritonavir or vehicle in the presence of aggregated LDL for 24 h . Cell extracts were harvested , and lipid or
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
total RNA was isolated .
O O O O O
E2 decreased the accumulation of cholesteryl esters in macrophages following ritonavir treatment .
B O O O O B I O O O B O O
Ritonavir increased the expression of the scavenger receptor , CD36 mRNA , responsible for the uptake of LDL .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Additionally , ritonavir treatment selectively increased the relative levels of PPARgamma mRNA , a transcription factor responsible for the regulation of CD36 mRNA expression .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment with E2 , however , failed to prevent these increases at the mRNA level .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
E2 did , however , significantly suppress CD36 protein levels as measured by fluorescent immunocytochemistry .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This data suggests that E2 modifies the expression of CD36 at the level of protein expression in monocyte - derived macrophages resulting in reduced cholesteryl ester accumulation following ritonavir treatment
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O B O
.
O
Upregulation of brain expression of P - glycoprotein in MRP2 - deficient TR ( - ) rats resembles seizure - induced up - regulation of this drug efflux transporter in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
normal rats .
O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
The multidrug resistance protein 2 ( MRP2 ) is a drug efflux transporter that is expressed predominantly at the apical domain of hepatocytes but seems also to be expressed at
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the apical membrane of brain capillary endothelial cells that form the blood - brain barrier ( BBB ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MRP2 is absent in the transport - deficient ( TR ( - ) )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Wistar rat mutant , so that this rat strain was very helpful in defining substrates of MRP2 by comparing tissue concentrations or functional activities of compounds in MRP2 - deficient
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rats with those in transport - competent Wistar rats .
O O O O O O O O O O
By using this strategy to study the involvement of MRP2 in brain access of antiepileptic drugs ( AEDs ) , we recently reported that phenytoin is a substrate for MRP2
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
in the BBB .
O O O O
However , one drawback of such studies in genetically deficient rats is the fact that compensatory changes with upregulation of other transporters can occur .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This prompted us to study the brain expression of P - glycoprotein ( Pgp ) , a major drug efflux transporter in many tissues , including the BBB , in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
TR ( - ) rats compared with nonmutant ( wild - type ) Wistar rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
The expression of MRP2 and Pgp in brain and liver sections of TR ( - ) rats and normal Wistar rats was determined with immunohistochemistry , by using a novel
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, highly selective monoclonal MRP2 antibody and the monoclonal Pgp antibody C219 , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Immunofluorescence staining with the MRP2 antibody was found to label a high number of microvessels throughout the brain in normal Wistar rats , whereas such labeling was absent in TR
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( - ) rats .
O O O O O
TR ( - ) rats exhibited a significant up - regulation of Pgp in brain capillary endothelial cells compared with wild - type controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No such obvious upregulation of Pgp was observed in liver sections .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
A comparable overexpression of Pgp in the BBB was obtained after pilocarpine - induced seizures in wild - type Wistar rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Experiments with systemic administration of the Pgp substrate phenobarbital and the selective Pgp inhibitor tariquidar in TR ( - ) rats substantiated that Pgp is functional and compensates for the
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
lack of MRP2 in the BBB .
O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The data on TR ( - ) rats indicate that Pgp plays an important role in the compensation of MRP2 deficiency in the BBB .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because such a compensatory mechanism most likely occurs to reduce injury to the brain from cytotoxic compounds , the present data substantiate the concept that MRP2 performs a protective role
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in the BBB .
O O O O
Furthermore , our data suggest that TR ( - ) rats are an interesting tool to study consequences of overexpression of Pgp in the BBB on access of drugs in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the brain , without the need of inducing seizures or other Pgp - enhancing events for this purpose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Use of chromosome substitution strains to identify seizure susceptibility loci in mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Seizure susceptibility varies among inbred mouse strains .
O O O O O O O O
Chromosome substitution strains ( CSS ) , in which a single chromosome from one inbred strain ( donor ) has been transferred onto a second strain ( host ) by
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
repeated backcrossing , may be used to identify quantitative trait loci ( QTLs ) that contribute to seizure susceptibility .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
QTLs for susceptibility to pilocarpine - induced seizures , a model of temporal lobe epilepsy , have not been reported , and CSS have not previously been used to localize
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
seizure susceptibility genes .
O O O O
We report QTLs identified using a B6 ( host ) x
O O O O O O O O O O O
A / J ( donor ) CSS panel to localize genes involved in susceptibility to pilocarpine - induced seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Three hundred fifty - five adult male CSS mice , 58 B6 , and 39 A / J were tested for susceptibility to pilocarpine - induced seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Highest stage reached and latency to each stage were recorded for all mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
B6 mice were resistant to seizures and slower to reach stages compared to A / J mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The CSS for Chromosomes 10 and 18 progressed to the most severe stages , diverging dramatically from the B6 phenotype .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Latencies to stages were also significantly shorter for CSS10 and CSS18 mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CSS mapping suggests seizure susceptibility loci on mouse Chromosomes 10 and 18 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This approach provides a framework for identifying potentially novel homologous candidate genes for human temporal lobe epilepsy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Investigation of mitochondrial involvement in the experimental model of epilepsy induced by pilocarpine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Mitochondrial abnormalities have been associated with several aspects of epileptogenesis , such as energy generation , control of cell death , neurotransmitter synthesis , and free radical ( FR )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
production .
O O
Increased production of FRs may cause mtDNA damage leading to decreased activities of oxidative phosphorylation complexes containing mtDNA - encoded subunits .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this study , we investigated whether increased generation of FR during status epilepticus would be sufficient to provoke abnormalities in mtDNA and in the expression and activity of cytochrome
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
c oxidase ( CCO ) , complex IV of the respiratory chain , in the chronic phase of the pilocarpine model of temporal lobe epilepsy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
DNA analysis revealed low amounts of a 4 . 8 kb mtDNA deletion but with no differences in frequency or quantity in the control and experimental groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We did not find abnormalities in the expression and distribution of an mtDNA - encoded subunit of CCO ( CCO - I ) or a relative decrease in CCO -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
I when compared with nuclear - encoded subunits ( CCO - IV and SDH - fp ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No abnormality in CCO activity was observed through histochemistry .
O O O O O O O O O O
Although evidences of mitochondrial abnormalities were found in previously published studies , our results do not suggest that the FRs , generated during the acute phase , determined important abnormalities
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in mtDNA , in expression of CCO - I , and in CCO activity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Causes of acute thrombotic microangiopathy in patients receiving kidney transplantation .
O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
Thrombotic microangiopathy is a well - known problem in patients following renal transplantation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In postrenal transplantation , thrombotic microangiopathy is often a reflection of hemolytic uremic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We aimed to determine the causes of thrombotic microangiopathy in a population of renal transplantation recipients and discuss the literature .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MATERIALS AND METHODS :
O O O O
We investigated the causes of thrombotic microangiopathy during a 1 - year period , from June 2003 to June 2004 , at the King Fahad National Guard Hospital in Riyadh
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, Saudi Arabia , by reviewing the slides of all transplant biopsies ( n = 25 ) performed during this interval .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pre - and posttransplant crossmatching was done when possible .
O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Five cases of thrombotic microangiopathy were found .
O O O O O O O O
Three of these cases were from the 25 transplantations performed at King Fahad National Guard Hospital , while the other 2 transplantations had been performed abroad and were referred to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
us for follow - up .
O O O O O O
Three cases were related to cyclosporine , and 1 case was secondary to both cyclosporine and tacrolimus .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O B O
The fifth case had features of thrombotic microangiopathy related to an antiphospholipid syndrome in a patient with systemic lupus erythematosus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
In the literature , the most - frequent cause of hemolytic uremic syndrome in patients following renal transplantation is recurrence of the hemolytic uremic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Other causes include drug - related ( cyclosporine , tacrolimus ) toxicity , procoagulant status , and antibody - mediated rejection .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
We found that the most - frequent cause of thrombotic microangiopathy was drug related , secondary mainly to cyclosporine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
In the current study , the frequency of thrombotic microangiopathy was similar to the percentage reported in the literature ( 20 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Severe reversible left ventricular systolic and diastolic dysfunction due to accidental iatrogenic epinephrine overdose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Catecholamine - induced cardiomyopathy due to chronic excess of endogenous catecholamines has been recognized for decades as a clinical phenomenon .
B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , reports of myocardial dysfunction due to acute iatrogenic overdose are rare .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A 35 - year - old woman whose cervix uteri was inadvertently injected with 8 mg of epinephrine developed myocardial stunning that was characterized by severe hemodynamic compromise , profound
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
, albeit transient , left ventricular systolic and diastolic dysfunction , and only modestly elevated biochemical markers of myocardial necrosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our case illustrates the serious consequences of medical errors that can be avoided through improved medication labeling and staff supervision .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urinary bladder cancer in Wegener 's granulomatosis : risks and relation to cyclophosphamide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To assess and characterise the risk of bladder cancer , and its relation to cyclophosphamide , in patients with Wegener 's granulomatosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
In the population based , nationwide Swedish Inpatient Register a cohort of 1065 patients with Wegener 's granulomatosis , 1969 - 95 , was identified .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Through linkage with the Swedish Cancer Register , all subjects in this cohort diagnosed with bladder cancer were identified .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nested within the cohort , a matched case - control study was performed to estimate the association between cyclophosphamide and bladder cancer using odds ratios ( ORs ) as relative
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
risk .
O O
In the cohort the cumulative risk of bladder cancer after Wegener 's granulomatosis , and the relative prevalence of a history of bladder cancer at the time of diagnosis of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Wegener 's granulomatosis , were also estimated .
O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The median cumulative doses of cyclophosphamide among cases ( n = 11 ) and controls ( n = 25 ) were 113 g and 25 g , respectively .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The risk of bladder cancer doubled for every 10 g increment in cyclophosphamide ( OR = 2 . 0 , 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) 0 . 8
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to 4 . 9 ) .
O O O O O O
Treatment duration longer than 1 year was associated with an eightfold increased risk ( OR = 7 . 7 , 95 % CI 0 . 9 to 69 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The absolute risk for bladder cancer in the cohort reached 10 % 16 years after diagnosis of Wegener 's granulomatosis , and a history of bladder cancer was ( non
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- significantly ) twice as common as expected at the time of diagnosis of Wegener 's granulomatosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
The results indicate a dose - response relationship between cyclophosphamide and the risk of bladder cancer , high cumulative risks in the entire cohort , and also the possibility of
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
risk factors operating even before Wegener 's granulomatosis .
O O O O O O O O O
L - arginine transport in humans with cortisol - induced hypertension .
B I I O O O O B O O O O
A deficient L - arginine - nitric oxide system is implicated in cortisol - induced hypertension .
O O B I I O B I O O O O B O O O O
We investigate whether abnormalities in L - arginine uptake contribute to this deficiency .
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O
Eight healthy men were recruited .
O O O O O O
Hydrocortisone acetate ( 50 mg ) was given orally every 6 hours for 24 hours after a 5 - day fixed - salt diet ( 150 mmol / d )
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Crossover studies were performed 2 weeks apart .
O O O O O O O O
Thirty milliliters of blood was obtained for isolation of peripheral blood mononuclear cells after each treatment period .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
L - arginine uptake was assessed in mononuclear cells incubated with L - arginine ( 1 to 300 micromol / L ) , incorporating 100 nmol / L
B I I O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
[ 3H ] - l - arginine for a period of 5 minutes at 37 degrees C . Forearm [ 3H ] - L - arginine extraction was calculated after
B I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I O O O O
infusion of [ 3H ] - L - arginine into the brachial artery at a rate of 100 nCi / min for 80 minutes .
O O B I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Deep forearm venous samples were collected for determination of L - arginine extraction .
O O O O O O O O O B I I O O
Plasma cortisol concentrations were significantly raised during the active phase ( 323 + / - 43 to 1082 + / - 245 mmol / L , P < 0 .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
05 ) .
O O O
Systolic blood pressure was elevated by an average of 7 mm Hg .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neither L - arginine transport into mononuclear cells ( placebo vs active , 26 . 3 + / - 3 . 6 vs 29 . 0 + / - 2
O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 1 pmol / 10 000 cells per 5 minutes , respectively , at an l - arginine concentration of 300 micromol / L ) nor L - arginine extraction
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O B I I O
in the forearm ( at 80 minutes , placebo vs active , 1 868 904 + / - 434 962 vs 2 013 910 + / - 770 619 disintegrations
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
per minute ) was affected by cortisol treatment ; ie , that L - arginine uptake is not affected by short - term cortisol treatment .
O O O O O O B O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O B O O
We conclude that cortisol - induced increases in blood pressure are not associated with abnormalities in the l - arginine transport system .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O
MR imaging with quantitative diffusion mapping of tacrolimus - induced neurotoxicity in organ transplant patients .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Our objective was to investigate brain MR imaging findings and the utility of diffusion - weighted ( DW ) imaging in organ transplant patients who developed neurologic symptoms during
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
tacrolimus therapy .
B O O
Brain MR studies , including DW imaging , were prospectively performed in 14 organ transplant patients receiving tacrolimus who developed neurologic complications .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
In each patient who had abnormalities on the initial MR study , a follow - up MR study was performed 1 month later .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Apparent diffusion coefficient ( ADC ) values on the initial MR study were correlated with reversibility of the lesions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of the 14 patients , 5 ( 35 . 7 % ) had white matter abnormalities , 1 ( 7 . 1 % ) had putaminal hemorrhage , and 8
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 57 . 1 % ) had normal findings on initial MR images .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Among the 5 patients with white matter abnormalities , 4 patients ( 80 . 0 % ) showed higher than normal ADC values on initial MR images , and all
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
showed complete resolution on follow - up images .
O O O O O O O O O
The remaining 1 patient ( 20 . 0 % ) showed lower than normal ADC value and showed incomplete resolution with cortical laminar necrosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diffusion - weighted imaging may be useful in predicting the outcomes of the lesions of tacrolimus - induced neurotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Octreotide - induced hypoxemia and pulmonary hypertension in premature neonates .
B O O O O O O O O O O
The authors report 2 cases of premature neonates who had enterocutaneous fistula complicating necrotizing enterocolitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pulmonary hypertension developed after administration of a somatostatin analogue , octreotide , to enhance resolution of the fistula .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The authors discuss the mechanism of the occurrence of this complication and recommend caution of its use in high - risk premature neonates .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sequential observations of exencephaly and subsequent morphological changes by mouse exo utero development system : analysis of the mechanism of transformation from exencephaly to anencephaly .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Anencephaly has been suggested to develop from exencephaly ; however , there is little direct experimental evidence to support this , and the mechanism of transformation remains unclear .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We examined this theory using the exo utero development system that allows direct and sequential observations of mid - to late - gestation mouse embryos .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We observed the exencephaly induced by 5 - azacytidine at embryonic day 13 . 5 ( E13 . 5 ) , let the embryos develop exo utero until E18 .
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 , and re - observed the same embryos at E18 . 5 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We confirmed several cases of transformation from exencephaly to anencephaly .
O O O O O O O O O O O
However , in many cases , the exencephalic brain tissue was preserved with more or less reduction during this period .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To analyze the transformation patterns , we classified the exencephaly by size and shape of the exencephalic tissue into several types at E13 . 5 and E18 . 5 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It was found that the transformation of exencephalic tissue was not simply size - dependent , and all cases of anencephaly at E18 . 5 resulted from embryos with a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
large amount of exencephalic tissue at E13 . 5 .
O O O O O O O O O O
Microscopic observation showed the configuration of exencephaly at E13 . 5 , frequent hemorrhaging and detachment of the neural plate from surface ectoderm in the exencephalic head at E15 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 , and multiple modes of reduction in the exencephalic tissue at E18 . 5 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
From observations of the vasculature , altered distribution patterns of vessels were identified in the exencephalic head .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings suggest that overgrowth of the exencephalic neural tissue causes the altered distribution patterns of vessels , subsequent peripheral circulatory failure and / or hemorrhaging in various parts of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the exencephalic head , leading to the multiple modes of tissue reduction during transformation from exencephaly to anencephaly .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute cocaine - induced seizures : differential sensitivity of six inbred mouse strains .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mature male and female mice from six inbred stains were tested for susceptibility to behavioral seizures induced by a single injection of cocaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Cocaine was injected ip over a range of doses ( 50 - 100 mg / kg ) and behavior was monitored for 20 minutes .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Seizure end points included latency to forelimb or hindlimb clonus , latency to clonic running seizure and latency to jumping bouncing seizure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A range of strain specific sensitivities was documented with A / J and SJL mice being most sensitive and C57BL / 6J most resistant .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DBA / 2J , BALB / cByJ and NZW / LacJ strains exhibited intermediate sensitivity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
EEG recordings were made in SJL , A / J and C57BL / 6J mice revealing a close correspondence between electrical activity and behavior .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Additionally , levels of cocaine determined in hippocampus and cortex were not different between sensitive and resistant strains .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Additional studies of these murine strains may be useful for investigating genetic influences on cocaine - induced seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Microangiopathic hemolytic anemia complicating FK506 ( tacrolimus ) therapy .
O O O O B O B O O O
We describe 3 episodes of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia ( MAHA ) in 2 solid organ recipients under FK506 ( tacrolimus ) therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
In both cases , discontinuation of FK506 and treatment with plasma exchange , fresh frozen plasma replacement , corticosteroids , aspirin , and dipyridamole led to resolution of MAHA .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O
In one patient , reintroduction of FK506 led to rapid recurrence of MAHA .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
FK506 - associated MAHA is probably rare but physicians must be aware of this severe complication .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In our experience and according to the literature , FK506 does not seem to cross - react with cyclosporin A ( CyA ) , an immuno - suppressive drug already
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O
known to induce MAHA .
O O O O O
Variant ventricular tachycardia in desipramine toxicity .
O O O O B O O
We report a case of variant ventricular tachycardia induced by desipramine toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Unusual features of the arrhythmia are repetitive group beating , progressive shortening of the R - R interval , progressive widening of the QRS complex with eventual failure of intraventricular
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
conduction , and changes in direction of the QRS axis .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Recognition of variant ventricular tachycardia is important because therapy differs from that of classic ventricular tachycardia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Desipramine - induced delirium at """" subtherapeutic """" concentrations : a case report .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An elderly patient treated with low dose Desipramine developed a delirium while her plasma level was in the """" subtherapeutic """" range .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Delirium , which may be induced by tricyclic drug therapy in the elderly , can be caused by tricyclics with low anticholinergic potency .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therapeutic ranges for antidepressants that have been derived from general adult population studies may not be appropriate for the elderly .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Further studies of specifically elderly patients are now required to establish safer and more appropriate guidelines for drug therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mouse strain - dependent effect of amantadine on motility and brain biogenic amines .
O O O O O O B O O O O O B O
The effect of amantadine hydrochloride , injected i . p .
O O O B I O O O O O O
in 6 increments of 100 mg / kg each over 30 hr , on mouse motility and whole brain content of selected biogenic amines and major metabolites was studied in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
4 strains of mice .
O O O O O
These were the albino Sprague - Dawley ICR and BALB / C , the black C57BL / 6 and the brown CDF - I mouse strains .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Amantadine treatment produced a biphasic effect on mouse motility .
B O O O O O O O O O
The initial dose of amantadine depressed locomotor activity in all mouse strains studied with the BALB / C mice being the most sensitive .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Subsequent amantadine treatments produced enhancement of motility from corresponding control in all mouse strains with the BALB / C mice being the least sensitive .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The locomotor activity was decreased from corresponding controls in all strains studied , except for the ICR mice , during an overnight drug - free period following the fourth
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
amantadine treatment .
B O O
Readministration of amantadine , after a drug - free overnight period , increased motility from respective saline control in all strains with exception of the BALB / C mice where
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
suppression of motility occurred .
O O O O O
Treatment with amantadine did not alter whole brain dopamine levels but decreased the amounts of 3 , 4 - dihydroxyphenylacetic acid in the BALB / C mice compared to saline
O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O B I I I I I O O O O O O O O O
control .
O O
Conversely , brain normetanephrine concentration was increased from saline control by amantadine in the BALB / C mice .
O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The results suggest a strain - dependent effect of amantadine on motility and indicate a differential response to the acute and multiple dose regimens used .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The BALB / C mouse was the most sensitive strain and could serve as the strain of choice for evaluating the side effects of amantadine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The biochemical results of brain biogenic amines of BALB / C mouse strain suggest a probable decrease of catecholamine turnover rate and / or metabolism by monoamine oxidase and a
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
resulting increase in O - methylation of norepinephrine which may account for a behavioral depression caused by amantadine in the BALB / C mice .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
No enhancement by phenobarbital of the hepatocarcinogenicity of a choline - devoid diet in the rat .
O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O
An experiment was performed to test whether inclusion of phenobarbital in a choline - devoid diet would increase the hepatocarcinogenicity of the diet .
O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Groups of 5 - week old male Fischer - 344 rats were fed for 7 - 25 months semipurified choline - devoid or choline - supplemented diets , containing or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O
not 0 . 06 % phenobarbital .
O O O O O B O
No hepatic preneoplastic nodules or hepatocellular carcinomas developed in rats fed the plain choline - supplemented diet , while one preneoplastic nodule and one hepatocellular carcinoma developed in two rats
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
fed the same diet containing phenobarbital .
O O O O O B O
The incidence of preneoplastic nodules and of hepatocellular carcinomas was 10 % and 37 % , respectively , in rats fed the plain choline - devoid diet , and 17
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
% and 30 % , in rats fed the phenobarbital - containing choline - devoid diet .
O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O
The results evinced no enhancement of the hepatocarcinogenicity of the choline - devoid diet by phenobarbital .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
Sporadic neoplastic lesions were observed in organs other than the liver of some of the animals , irrespective of the diet fed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of direct intracoronary administration of methylergonovine in patients with and without variant angina .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The effects of intracoronary administration of methylergonovine were studied in 21 patients with variant angina and 22 patients with atypical chest pain and in others without angina pectoris ( control
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
group ) .
O O O
Methylergonovine was administered continuously at a rate of 10 micrograms / min up to 50 micrograms .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In all patients with variant angina , coronary spasm was provoked at a mean dose of 28 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
13 micrograms ( mean + / -
O O O O O O O
SD ) .
O O O
In the control group neither ischemic ST change nor localized spasm occurred .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The basal tone of the right coronary artery was significantly lower than that of the left coronary artery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The percentage of vasoconstriction of the right coronary artery was significantly higher than that of the left coronary artery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that spasm provocation tests , which use an intracoronary injection of a relatively low dose of methylergonovine , have a high sensitivity in variant angina and the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
vasoreactivity of the right coronary artery may be greater than that of the other coronary arteries .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dobutamine stress echocardiography : a sensitive indicator of diminished myocardial function in asymptomatic doxorubicin - treated long - term survivors of childhood cancer .
