B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Doxorubicin is an effective anticancer chemotherapeutic agent known to cause acute and chronic cardiomyopathy .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To develop a more sensitive echocardiographic screening test for cardiac damage due to doxorubicin , a cohort study was performed using dobutamine infusion to differentiate asymptomatic long - term survivors
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
of childhood cancer treated with doxorubicin from healthy control subjects .
O O O O O B O O O O O
Echocardiographic data from the experimental group of 21 patients ( mean age 16 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 years ) treated from 1 . 6 to 14 . 3 years ( median 5 . 3 ) before this study with 27 to 532 mg / m2 of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
doxorubicin ( mean 196 ) were compared with echocardiographic data from 12 normal age - matched control subjects .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Graded dobutamine infusions of 0 . 5 , 2 . 5 , 5 and 10 micrograms / kg per min were administered .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Echocardiographic Doppler studies were performed before infusion and after 15 min of infusion at each rate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dobutamine infusion at 10 micrograms / kg per min was discontinued after six studies secondary to a 50 % incidence rate of adverse symptoms .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The most important findings were that compared with values in control subjects , end - systolic left ventricular posterior wall dimension and percent of left ventricular posterior wall thickening in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
doxorubicin - treated patients were decreased at baseline study and these findings were more clearly delineated with dobutamine stimulation .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
End - systolic left ventricular posterior wall dimension at baseline for the doxorubicin - treated group was 11 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
1 . 9 mm versus 13 . 1 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O
1 . 5 mm for control subjects ( p less than 0 . 01 ) .

O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O
/ -
O O

2 . 6 mm for control subjects ( p less than 0 . 01 ) . ( ABSTRACT

O O O O O
Effects of aminophylline on the threshold for initiating ventricular fibrillation during respiratory failure .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Cardiac arrhythmias have frequently been reported in association with respiratory failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The possible additive role of pharmacologic agents in precipitating cardiac disturbances in patients with respiratory failure has only recently been emphasized .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effects of aminophylline on the ventricular fibrillation threshold during normal acid - base conditions and during respiratory failure were studied in anesthetized open chest dogs .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The ventricular fibrillation threshold was measured by passing a gated train of 12 constant current pulses through the ventricular myocardium during the vulnerable period of the cardiac cycle .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
During the infusion of aminophylline , the ventricular fibrillation threshold was reduced by 30 to 40 percent of the control when pH and partial pressures of oxygen ( PO2 )
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
and carbon dioxide ( CO2 ) were kept within normal limits .
O B I O B O O O O O O O
When respiratory failure was produced by hypoventilation ( pH 7 . 05 to 7 . 25 ; PC02 70 to 100 mm Hg : P02 20 to 40 mm Hg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) , infusion of aminophylline resulted in an even greater decrease in ventricular fibrillation threshold to 60 percent of the control level .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These experiments suggest that although many factors may contribute to the increased incidence of ventricular arrhythmias in respiratory failure , pharmacologic agents , particularly aminophylline , may play a significant
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
role .
O O
Case report : acute unintentional carbachol intoxication .
O O O O O B O O
INTRODUCTION :
O O
Intoxications with carbachol , a muscarinic cholinergic receptor agonist are rare .
O O B O O O O O O O O O
We report an interesting case investigating a ( near ) fatal poisoning .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
The son of an 84 - year - old male discovered a newspaper report stating clinical success with plant extracts in Alzheimer 's disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mode of action was said to be comparable to that of the synthetic compound ' carbamylcholin ' ; that is , carbachol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O
He bought 25 g of carbachol as pure substance in a pharmacy , and the father was administered 400 to 500 mg .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Carbachol concentrations in serum and urine on day 1 and 2 of hospital admission were analysed by HPLC - mass spectrometry .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Minutes after oral administration , the patient developed nausea , sweating and hypotension , and finally collapsed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bradycardia , cholinergic symptoms and asystole occurred .
O O O O O O O O
Initial cardiopulmonary resuscitation and immediate treatment with adrenaline ( epinephrine ) , atropine and furosemide was successful .
O O O O O O O B O B O O B O B O O O
On hospital admission , blood pressure of the intubated , bradyarrhythmic patient was 100 / 65 mmHg .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Further signs were hyperhidrosis , hypersalivation , bronchorrhoea , and severe miosis ; the electrocardiographic finding was atrio - ventricular dissociation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
High doses of atropine
O O O B
( up to 50 mg per 24 hours ) , adrenaline and dopamine were necessary .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
The patient was extubated 1 week later .
O O O O O O O O
However , increased dyspnoea and bronchospasm necessitated reintubation .
O O O O O O O O O
Respiratory insufficiency was further worsened by Proteus mirabilis infection and severe bronchoconstriction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One week later , the patient was again extubated and 3 days later was transferred to a peripheral ward .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On the next day he died , probably as a result of heart failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Serum samples from the first and second days contained 3 . 6 and 1 . 9 mg / l carbachol , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
The corresponding urine concentrations amounted to 374 and 554 mg / l .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
This case started with a media report in a popular newspaper , initiated by published , peer - reviewed research on herbals , and involved human failure in a case
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
history , medical examination and clinical treatment .
O O O O O O O O
For the first time , an analytical method for the determination of carbachol in plasma and urine has been developed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The analysed carbachol concentration exceeded the supposed serum level resulting from a therapeutic dose by a factor of 130 to 260 .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Especially in old patients , intensivists should consider intoxications ( with cholinergics ) as a cause of acute cardiovascular failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Crossover comparison of efficacy and preference for rizatriptan 10 mg versus ergotamine / caffeine in migraine .
O O O O O O O B O O O B O B O O O
Rizatriptan is a selective 5 - HT ( 1B / 1D ) receptor agonist with rapid oral absorption and early onset of action in the acute treatment of migraine .
B O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This randomized double - blind crossover outpatient study assessed the preference for 1 rizatriptan 10 mg tablet to 2 ergotamine 1 mg / caffeine 100 mg tablets in 439 patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O
treating a single migraine attack with each therapy .
O O O O O O O O O
Of patients expressing a preference ( 89 . 1 % ) , more than twice as many preferred rizatriptan to ergotamine / caffeine ( 69 . 9 vs . 30
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O
. 1 % , p < or = 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Faster relief of headache was the most important reason for preference , cited by 67 . 3 % of patients preferring rizatriptan and 54 . 2 % of patients who
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
preferred ergotamine / caffeine .
O B O B O
The co - primary endpoint of being pain free at 2 h was also in favor of rizatriptan .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Forty - nine percent of patients were pain free 2 h after rizatriptan , compared with 24 . 3 % treated with ergotamine / caffeine ( p < or =
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
0 . 001 ) , rizatriptan being superior within 1 h of treatment .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Headache relief at 2 h was 75 . 9 % for rizatriptan and 47 . 3 % for ergotamine / caffeine ( p < or = 0 . 001 )
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
, with rizatriptan being superior to ergotamine / caffeine within 30 min of dosing .
O O B O O O B O B O O O O O O
Almost 36 % of patients taking rizatriptan were pain free at 2 h and had no recurrence or need for additional medication within 24 h , compared to 20 %
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of patients on ergotamine / caffeine ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
Rizatriptan was also superior to ergotamine / caffeine in the proportions of patients with no nausea , vomiting , phonophobia or photophobia and for patients with normal function 2 h
B O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
after drug intake ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
More patients were ( completely , very or somewhat ) satisfied 2 h after treatment with rizatriptan ( 69 . 8 % ) than at 2 h after treatment with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ergotamine / caffeine ( 38 . 6 % , p < or = 0 . 001 ) .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recurrence rates were 31 . 4 % with rizatriptan and 15 . 3 % with ergotamine / caffeine .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B O
Both active treatments were well tolerated .
O O O O O O O
The most common adverse events ( incidence > or = 5 % in one group ) after rizatriptan and ergotamine / caffeine , respectively , were dizziness ( 6 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O
7 and 5 . 3 % ) , nausea ( 4 . 2 and 8 . 5 % ) and somnolence ( 5 . 5 and 2 . 3 %
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
Thrombotic microangiopathy and renal failure associated with antineoplastic chemotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O
Five patients with carcinoma developed thrombotic microangiopathy ( characterized by renal insufficiency , microangiopathic hemolytic anemia , and usually thrombocytopenia ) after treatment with cisplatin , bleomycin , and a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
vinca alkaloid .
B I O
One patient had thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura , three the hemolytic - uremic syndrome , and one an apparent forme fruste of one of these disorders .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Histologic examination of the renal tissue showed evidence of intravascular coagulation , primarily affecting the small arteries , arterioles , and glomeruli .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because each patient was tumor - free or had only a small tumor at the onset of this syndrome , the thrombotic microangiopathy may have been induced by chemotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diagnosis of this potentially fatal complication may be delayed or missed if renal tissue or the peripheral blood smear is not examined , because renal failure may be ascribed to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cisplatin nephrotoxicity and the anemia and thrombocytopenia to drug - induced bone marrow suppression .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Salvage therapy with nelarabine , etoposide , and cyclophosphamide in relapsed / refractory paediatric T - cell lymphoblastic leukaemia and lymphoma .
O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A combination of 5 d of nelarabine ( AraG ) with 5 d of etoposide ( VP ) and cyclophosphamide ( CPM ) and prophylactic intrathecal chemotherapy was used as
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O B O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O
salvage therapy in seven children with refractory or relapsed T - cell leukaemia or lymphoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The most common side effects attributable to the AraG included Grade 2 and 3 sensory and motor neuropathy and musculoskeletal pain .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Haematological toxicity was greater for the combination than AraG alone , although median time to neutrophil and platelet recovery was consistent with other salvage therapies .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All patients had some response to the combined therapy and five of the seven went into complete remission after one or two courses of AraG / VP / CPM .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O
Our experience supports the safety of giving AraG as salvage therapy in synchrony with etoposide and cyclophosphamide , although neurological toxicity must be closely monitored .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
The 3 - week sulphasalazine syndrome strikes again .
O O O O B O O O O
A 34 - year - old lady developed a constellation of dermatitis , fever , lymphadenopathy and hepatitis , beginning on the 17th day of a course of oral
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
sulphasalazine for sero - negative rheumatoid arthritis .
B O O O O O O O
Cervical and inguinal lymph node biopsies showed the features of severe necrotising lymphadenitis , associated with erythrophagocytosis and prominent eosinophilic infiltrates , without viral inclusion bodies , suggestive of an
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
adverse drug reaction .
O O O O
A week later , fulminant drug - induced hepatitis , associated with the presence of anti - nuclear autoantibodies ( but not with other markers of autoimmunity ) , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
accompanied by multi - organ failure and sepsis , supervened .
O O O O O O O O O O O
She subsequently died some 5 weeks after the commencement of her drug therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Post - mortem examination showed evidence of massive hepatocellular necrosis , acute hypersensitivity myocarditis , focal acute tubulo - interstitial nephritis and extensive bone marrow necrosis , with no evidence
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of malignancy .
O O O
It is thought that the clinico - pathological features and chronology of this case bore the hallmarks of the so - called """" 3 - week sulphasalazine syndrome """" ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
a rare , but often fatal , immunoallergic reaction to sulphasalazine .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
Bupropion ( Zyban ) toxicity .
B O B O O O
Bupropion is a monocyclic antidepressant structurally related to amphetamine .
B O O O B O O O B O
Zyban , a sustained - release formulation of bupropion hydrochloride , was recently released in Ireland , as a smoking cessation aid .
B O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the initial 6 months since it 's introduction , 12 overdose cases have been reported to The National Poisons Information Centre .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
8 patients developed symptoms of toxicity .
O O O O O O O
Common features included tachycardia , drowsiness , hallucinations and convulsions .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Two patients developed severe cardiac arrhythmias , including one patient who was resuscitated following a cardiac arrest .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All patients recovered without sequelae .
O O O O O O
We report a case of a 31 year old female who required admission to the Intensive Care Unit for ventilation and full supportive therapy , following ingestion of 13 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 g bupropion .
O O B O
Recurrent seizures were treated with diazepam and broad complex tachycardia was successfully treated with adenosine .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O
Zyban caused significant neurological and cardiovascular toxicity in overdose .
B O O O O O O O O O
The potential toxic effects should be considered when prescribing it as a smoking cessation aid .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Survey of complications of indocyanine green angiography in Japan .
O O O O B I O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
We evaluated the safety of indocyanine green for use in fundus angiography .
O O O O O B I O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We sent a questionnaire concerning complications of indocyanine green to 32 institutions in Japan , which were selected on the basis of the client list from the Topcon Company ,
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
which manufactures the indocyanine green fundus camera .
O O O B I O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Ophthalmologists at 15 institutions responded , reporting a total of 3 , 774 indocyanine green angiograms performed on 2 , 820 patients between June 1984 and September 1992 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Before angiography , intradermal or intravenous indocyanine green testing , or both was performed at 13 of 15 institutions .
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
For three patients , the decision was made not to proceed with angiography after positive preangiographic testing .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The dosage of indocyanine green used for angiography varied from 25 to 75 mg , depending upon the institution .
O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There were 13 cases of adverse reactions ( 0 . 34 % ) , ten of which were mild reactions such as nausea , exanthema , urtication , itchiness ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and urgency to defecate , and did not require treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Also recorded were one case of pain of the vein , which required treatment , and two cases of hypotension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The two hypotensive patients required treatment for shock .
O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
A comparison of frequency of adverse reactions to indocyanine green with the previously reported frequency of such reactions to fluorescein sodium indicated that indocyanine green is a safe as
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O B I O O B I O O O O
fluorescein for use in angiography .
B O O O O O
Bradykinin receptors antagonists and nitric oxide synthase inhibitors in vincristine and streptozotocin induced hyperalgesia in chemotherapy and diabetic neuropathy rat model .
B O O O B I O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
The influence of an irreversible inhibitor of constitutive NO synthase ( L - NOArg ; 1 . 0 mg / kg ip ) , a relatively selective inhibitor of inducible
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NO synthase ( L - NIL ; 1 . 0 mg / kg ip ) and a relatively specific inhibitor of neuronal NO synthase ( 7 - NI ; 0
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
. 1 mg / kg ip ) , on antihyperalgesic action of selective antagonists of B2 and B1 receptors : D - Arg - [ Hyp3 , Thi5 , D
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- Tic7 , Oic8 ] bradykinin ( HOE 140 ; 70 nmol / kg ip ) or des
O O O O O B O B I O O O O O O O O B
Arg10 HOE 140 ( 70 nmol / kg ip ) respectively , in model of diabetic ( streptozotocin - induced ) and toxic ( vincristine - induced ) neuropathy was
I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
investigated .
O O
METHODS :
O O
The changes in pain thresholds were determined using mechanical stimuli - - the modification of the classic paw withdrawal test described by Randall - Selitto .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The results of this paper confirm that inhibition of bradykinin receptors and inducible NO synthase but not neuronal
O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O
NO synthase activity reduces diabetic hyperalgesia .
B O O O O O O
Pretreatment with L - NOArg and L - NIL but not 7 - NI , significantly increases antihyperalgesic activity both HOE 140 and des Arg10 HOE 140 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B I I I O
It was also shown that both products of inducible NO synthase and neuronal NO synthase activation as well as bradykinin are involved in hyperalgesia produced by vincristine .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O B O
Moreover , L - NOArg and 7 - NI but not L - NIL intensify antihyperalgesic activity of HOE 140 or des - Arg10HOE 140 in toxic neuropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B I I I O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Results of these studies suggest that B1 and B2 receptors are engaged in transmission of nociceptive stimuli in both diabetic and toxic neuropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In streptozotocin - induced hyperalgesia , inducible NO synthase participates in pronociceptive activity of bradykinin , whereas in vincristine - induced hyperalgesia bradykinin seemed to activate neuronal NO synthase pathway
O B O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O B O O O B O O O O B O O
.
O
Therefore , concomitant administration of small doses of bradykinin receptor antagonists and NO synthase inhibitors can be effective in alleviation of neuropathic pain , even in hospital care .
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cardiac toxicity observed in association with high - dose cyclophosphamide - based chemotherapy for metastatic breast cancer .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
INTRODUCTION :
O O
Cyclophosphamide is an alkylating agent given frequently as a component of many conditioning regimens .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In high doses , its nonhematological dose - limiting toxicity is cardiomyopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
STUDY DESIGN :
O O O
We combined paclitaxel , melphalan and high - dose cyclophosphamide , thiotepa , and carboplatin in a triple sequential high - dose regimen for patients with metastatic breast cancer .
O O B O B O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Analysis was performed on 61 women with chemotherapy - responsive metastatic breast cancer receiving 96 - h infusional cyclophosphamide as part of a triple sequential high - dose regimen to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
assess association between presence of peritransplant congestive heart failure ( CHF ) and the following pretreatment characteristics : presence of electrocardiogram ( EKG ) abnormalities , age , hypertension ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
prior cardiac history , smoking , diabetes mellitus , prior use of anthracyclines , and left - sided chest irradiation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Six of 61 women ( 10 % ) developed clinically reversible grade 3 CHF following infusional cyclophosphamide with a median percent decline in ejection fraction of 31 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Incidence of transient cyclophosphamide - related cardiac toxicity ( 10 % ) is comparable to previous recorded literature .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Older age was significantly correlated with the CHF development ; with median ages for the entire group and for patients developing CHF of 45 and 59 , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No association was found with other pretreatment characteristics .
O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
As a result of these findings , oncologists should carefully monitor fluid balance in older patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Routine EKG monitoring during infusional cyclophosphamide did not predict CHF development .
O O O O O B O O O O O O
Inappropriate use of carbamazepine and vigabatrin in typical absence seizures .
O O O B O B O O O O O
Carbamazepine and vigabatrin are contraindicated in typical absence seizures .
B O B O O O O O O O
Of 18 consecutive referrals of children with resistant typical absences only , eight were erroneously treated with carbamazepine either as monotherapy or as an add - on .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Vigabatrin was also used in the treatment of two children .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Frequency of absences increased in four children treated with carbamazepine and two of these developed myoclonic jerks , which resolved on withdrawal of carbamazepine .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Absences were aggravated in both cases where vigabatrin was added on to concurrent treatment .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Optimal control of the absences was achieved with sodium valproate , lamotrigine , or ethosuximide alone or in combination .
O O O O O O O O B I O B O O B O O O O O
Hemolytic anemia associated with the use of omeprazole .
O O O O O O O B O
Omeprazole is the first drug designed to block the final step in the acid secretory process within the parietal cell .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It has been shown to be extremely effective in the treatment of peptic ulcer disease , reflux esophagitis , and the Zollinger - Ellison syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although clinical experience with omeprazole is still limited , many controlled studies have established the short - term safety of this drug .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report the first case of a serious short - term adverse reaction with the use of omeprazole : hemolytic anemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The patient developed weakness , lethargy , and shortness of breath 2 days after starting therapy with omeprazole .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Two weeks after the initiation of therapy , her hematocrit had decreased from 44 . 1 % to 20 . 4 % , and she had a positive direct Coombs
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
antiglobulin test and an elevated indirect bilirubin .
O O O O O O B O
After she discontinued the omeprazole , her hemoglobin and hematocrit gradually returned to normal .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The mechanism by which omeprazole caused the patient 's hemolytic anemia is uncertain , but physicians should be alerted to this possible adverse effect .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The use and toxicity of didanosine ( ddI ) in HIV antibody - positive individuals intolerant to zidovudine ( AZT )
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O
One hundred and fifty - one patients intolerant to zidovudine ( AZT ) received didanosine ( ddI ) to a maximum dose of 12 . 5 mg / kg /
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
day .
O O
Patient response was assessed using changes in CD4 + lymphocyte subset count , HIV p24 antigen , weight , and quality of life .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Seventy patients developed major opportunistic infections whilst on therapy ; this was the first AIDS diagnosis in 17 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Only minor changes in CD4 + lymphocyte subset count were observed in AIDS patients , although a more significant rise occurred in those with earlier stages of disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of those positive for p24 antigen at the commencement of the study 67 % showed a positive response , and this was most likely in those with CD4 + lymphocyte
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
subset counts above 100 mm3 .
O O O O O O
A positive weight response was seen in 16 % of patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Most patients showed improvement in individual parameters and global score of quality of life .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adverse reactions possibly attributable to didanosine were common .
O O O O O B O O O
The most common side - effect was diarrhoea , which resulted in cessation of therapy in 19 individuals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Peripheral neuropathy occurred in 12 patients and pancreatitis in six .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Thirteen patients developed a raised serum amylase without abdominal pain .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Seven patients developed glucose tolerance curves characteristic of diabetes but these were mild , did not require treatment and returned to normal on ceasing didanosine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Can angiogenesis be a target of treatment for ribavirin associated hemolytic anemia ?
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
BACKGROUND / AIMS :
O O O O
Recently ribavirin has been found to inhibit angiogenesis and a number of angiogenesis inhibitors such as sunitinib and sorafenib have been found to cause acute hemolysis .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
We aimed to investigate whether there is a relation between hemoglobin , haptoglobin and angiogenesis soluble markers which are modifiable and can help in developing strategies against anemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Fourteen patients chronically infected with hepatitis C virus were treated by pegylated interferon alpha 2a and ribavirin .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O B O
Serum hemoglobin , haptoglobin and angiogenesis markers of vascular endothelial growth factor and angiopoetin - 2 were investigated before and after therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
We observed a significant decrease in haptoglobin levels at the end of the treatment period .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hemoglobin levels also decreased but insignificantly by treatment .
O O O O O O O O O
In contrast with the literature , serum levels of angiogenesis factors did not change significantly by pegylated interferon and ribavirin therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O
We found no correlation of angiogenesis soluble markers with either hemoglobin or haptoglobin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
This is the first study in the literature investigating a link between angiogenesis soluble markers and ribavirin induced anemia in patients with hepatitis C and we could not find any
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
relation .
O O
Future research with larger number of patients is needed to find out modifiable factors that will improve the safety of ribavirin therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Cocaine causes memory and learning impairments in rats : involvement of nuclear factor kappa B and oxidative stress , and prevention by topiramate .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Different mechanisms have been suggested for cocaine toxicity including an increase in oxidative stress but the association between oxidative status in the brain and cocaine induced - behaviour is poorly
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
understood .
O O
Nuclear factor kappa B ( NFkappaB ) is a sensor of oxidative stress and participates in memory formation that could be involved in drug toxicity and addiction mechanisms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore NFkappaB activity , oxidative stress , neuronal nitric oxide synthase ( nNOS ) activity , spatial learning and memory as well as the effect of topiramate , a previously
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
proposed therapy for cocaine addiction , were evaluated in an experimental model of cocaine administration in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
NFkappaB activity was decreased in the frontal cortex of cocaine treated rats , as well as GSH concentration and glutathione peroxidase activity in the hippocampus , whereas nNOS activity in
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O
the hippocampus was increased .
O O O O O
Memory retrieval of experiences acquired prior to cocaine administration was impaired and negatively correlated with NFkappaB activity in the frontal cortex .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , learning of new tasks was enhanced and correlated with the increase of nNOS activity and the decrease of glutathione peroxidase .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
These results provide evidence for a possible mechanistic role of oxidative and nitrosative stress and NFkappaB in the alterations induced by cocaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Topiramate prevented all the alterations observed , showing novel neuroprotective properties .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Antinociceptive and antiamnesic properties of the presynaptic cholinergic amplifier PG - 9 .
O O O O O O O O O B I I O
The antinociceptive effect of 3 alpha - tropyl 2 - ( p - bromophenyl ) propionate [ ( + / - ) - PG - 9 ]
O O O O B I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O O O O B I I O
( 10 - 40 mg kg - 1 s . c . ;
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
30 - 60 mg kg - 1
O O O O O O O
p . o .
O O O O
; 10 - 30 mg kg - 1 i . v .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
; 10 - 30 micrograms / mouse i . c . v . ) was examined in mice , rats and guinea pigs by use of the hot - plate
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, abdominal - constriction , tail - flick and paw - pressure tests .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
(
O
+ / - ) - PG - 9 antinociception peaked 15 min after injection and then slowly diminished .
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O
The antinociception produced by ( + / - ) - PG - 9 was prevented by the unselective muscarinic antagonist atropine , the M1 - selective antagonists pirenzepine and
O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O
dicyclomine and the acetylcholine depletor hemicholinium - 3 , but not by the opioid antagonist naloxone , the gamma - aminobutyric acidB antagonist
B O O B O B I I O O O O O O O B O O B I I I O
3 - aminopropyl - diethoxy - methyl - phosphinic acid , the H3 agonist R - ( alpha ) - methylhistamine , the D2 antagonist quinpirole , the
B I I I I I I I I I O O O O B I I I I I I O O O O B O O
5 - hydroxytryptamine4 antagonist 2 - methoxy - 4 - amino - 5 - chlorobenzoic acid 2 - ( diethylamino ) ethyl ester hydrochloride , the 5 - hydroxytryptamin1A antagonist
B I I O B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O O O B I I O
1 - ( 2 - methoxyphenyl ) - 4 - [ 4 - ( 2 - phthalimido ) butyl ] piperazine hydrobromide and the polyamines depletor reserpine .
B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O O B O
Based on these data , it can be postulated that ( + / - ) - PG - 9 exerted an antinociceptive effect mediated by a central potentiation of cholinergic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O
transmission .
O O
( + / - ) - PG - 9 ( 10 - 40 mg kg - 1 i . p . ) was able to prevent amnesia induced by
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
scopolamine ( 1 mg kg - 1 i . p . ) and dicyclomine ( 2 mg kg - 1 i . p . ) in the mouse passive -
B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
avoidance test .
O O O
Affinity profiles of ( + / - ) - PG - 9 for muscarinic receptor subtypes , determined by functional studies ( rabbit vas deferens for M1 , guinea pig
O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
atrium for M2 , guinea pig ileum for M3 and immature guinea pig uterus for putative M4 ) , have shown an M4 / M1 selectivity ratio of 10 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 that might be responsible for the antinociception and the anti - amnesic effect induced by ( + / - ) - PG - 9 through an increase in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O
acetylcholine extracellular levels .
B O O O
In the antinociceptive and antiamnesic dose range , ( + / - ) - PG - 9 did not impair mouse performance evaluated by the rota - rod test and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Animex apparatus .
O O O
Hyperbaric oxygen therapy for control of intractable cyclophosphamide - induced hemorrhagic cystitis .
O B O O O O O B O O O O O
We report a case of intractable hemorrhagic cystitis due to cyclophosphamide therapy for Wegener 's granulomatosis .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Conservative treatment , including bladder irrigation with physiological saline and instillation of prostaglandin F2 alpha , failed to totally control hemorrhage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O
We then used hyperbaric oxygen at an absolute pressure of 2 atm , 5 days a week for 8 consecutive weeks .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The bleeding ceased completely by the end of treatment and the patient remained free of hematuria thereafter .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No side effect was noted during the course of therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O
In future , this form of therapy can offer a safe alternative in the treatment of cyclophosphamide - induced hemorrhagic cystitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Further studies on effects of irrigation solutions on rat bladders .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Further studies on the effects of certain irrigating fluids on the rat bladder for 18 hours are reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results have shown that the degradation product p - choloroaniline is not a significant factor in chlorhexidine - digluconate associated erosive cystitis .
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O B I I O O O O
A high percentage of kanamycin - colistin and povidone - iodine irrigations were associated with erosive cystitis and suggested a possible complication with human usage .
O O O O B O B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Picloxydine irrigations appeared to have a lower incidence of erosive cystitis but further studies would have to be performed before it could be recommended for use in urological procedures .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical experiences in an open and a double - blind trial .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
A total of sixty patients were trated with bromperidol first in open conditions ( 20 patients ) , then on a double blind basis ( 40 patients ) with
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
haloperidol as the reference substance .
B O O O O O
The open study lasted for four weeks ; the drug was administrated in the form of 1 mg tablets .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The daily dose ( initial dose : 1 mg ; mean dose at the end of the trial : 4 . 47 mg ) was always administered in one single
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dose .
O O
Nineteen patients finished the trial , and in 18 cases the therapeutic result was considered very good to good .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results were confirmed by statistical analysis .
O O O O O O O O
Nine patients exhibited mild to moderate extrapyramidal concomitant symptoms ; no other side effects were observed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results of detailed laboratory tests and evaluations of various quantitative and qualitative tolerability parameters were not indicative of toxic effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the double blind study with haloperidol , both substances were found to be highly effective in the treatment of psychotic syndromes belonging predominantly to the schizophrenia group .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Certain clues , including the onset of action , seem to be indicative of the superiority of bromperidol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
No differences were observed with respect to side effects and general tolerability .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Curcumin ameliorates cognitive dysfunction and oxidative damage in phenobarbitone and carbamazepine administered rats .
B O O O O O O O B O B O O O
The antiepileptic drugs , phenobarbitone and carbamazepine are well known to cause cognitive impairment on chronic use .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The increase in free radical generation has been implicated as one of the important mechanisms of cognitive impairment by antiepileptic drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Curcumin has shown antioxidant , anti - inflammatory and neuro - protective properties .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , the present study was carried out to investigate the effect of chronic curcumin administration on phenobarbitone - and carbamazepine - induced cognitive impairment and oxidative stress in rats
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Pharmacokinetic interactions of curcumin with phenobarbitone and carbamazepine were also studied .
O O O B O B O B O O O O
Vehicle / drugs were administered daily for 21days to male Wistar rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Passive avoidance paradigm and elevated plus maze test were used to assess cognitive function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At the end of study period , serum phenobarbitone and carbamazepine , whole brain malondialdehyde and reduced glutathione levels were estimated .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O B O O B O O O O
The administration of phenobarbitone and carbamazepine for 21days caused a significant impairment of learning and memory as well as an increased oxidative stress .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Concomitant curcumin administration prevented the cognitive impairment and decreased the increased oxidative stress induced by these antiepileptic drugs .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Curcumin co - administration did not cause any significant alteration in the serum concentrations of both phenobarbitone as well as carbamazepine .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O
These results show that curcumin has beneficial effect in mitigating the deterioration of cognitive functions and oxidative damage in rats treated with phenobarbitone and carbamazepine without significantly altering their serum
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
concentrations .
O O
The findings suggest that curcumin can be considered as a potential safe and effective adjuvant to phenobarbitone and carbamazepine therapy in preventing cognitive impairment associated with these drugs .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
Pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate protects the piriform cortex in the pilocarpine status epilepticus model .
B I O O O O O O B O O O O
Pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( PDTC ) has a dual mechanism of action as an antioxidant and an inhibitor of the transcription factor kappa - beta .
B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both , production of reactive oxygen species as well as activation of NF - kappaB have been implicated in severe neuronal damage in different sub - regions of the hippocampus
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
as well as in the surrounding cortices .
O O O O O O O O
The effect of PDTC on status epilepticus - associated cell loss in the hippocampus and piriform cortex was evaluated in the rat fractionated pilocarpine model .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Treatment with 150 mg / kg PDTC before and following status epilepticus significantly increased the mortality rate to 100 % .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Administration of 50 mg / kg PDTC ( low - dose ) did not exert major effects on the development of a status epilepticus or the mortality rate .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In vehicle - treated rats , status epilepticus caused pronounced neuronal damage in the piriform cortex comprising both pyramidal cells and interneurons .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Low - dose PDTC treatment almost completely protected from lesions in the piriform cortex .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
A significant decrease in neuronal density of the hippocampal hilar formation was identified in vehicle - and PDTC - treated rats following status epilepticus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
In conclusion , the NF - kappaB inhibitor and antioxidant PDTC protected the piriform cortex , whereas it did not affect hilar neuronal loss .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These data might indicate that the generation of reactive oxygen species and activation of NF - kappaB plays a more central role in seizure - associated neuronal damage in the
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
temporal cortex as compared to the hippocampal hilus .
O O O O O O O O O
However , future investigations are necessary to exactly analyze the biochemical mechanisms by which PDTC exerted its beneficial effects in the piriform cortex .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Safety profile of a nicotine lozenge compared with that of nicotine gum in adult smokers with underlying medical conditions : a 12 - week , randomized , open - label
O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
study .
O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Nicotine polacrilex lozenges deliver 25 % to 27 % more nicotine compared with equivalent doses of nicotine polacrilex gum .
B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O
The increased nicotine exposure from the lozenge has raised questions about the relative safety of the lozenge and gum .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : The objective of this study was to compare the safety profiles of the 4 - mg nicotine lozenge and 4 - mg nicotine gum in smokers with selected
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O
label - restricted diseases .
O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
This was a multicenter , randomized , open - label study in adult smokers with heart disease , hypertension not controlled by medication , and / or diabetes mellitus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients were randomized in a 1 : 1 ratio to receive the 4 - mg nicotine lozenge or 4 - mg nicotine gum .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O
Safety assessments were made at baseline and at 2 , 4 , 6 , and 12 weeks after the start of product use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Nine hundred one patients were randomized to treatment , 447 who received the lozenge and 454 who received the gum ( safety population ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The majority were women ( 52 . 7 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients ' mean age was 53 . 9 years , their mean weight was 193 . 9 pounds , and they smoked a mean of 25 . 2 cigarettes per
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
day at baseline .
O O O O
Five hundred fifty - three patients , 264 taking the lozenge and 289 taking the gum , used the study product for > or = 4 days per week during
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the first 2 weeks ( evaluable population ) .
O O O O O O O O O
The nicotine lozenge and nicotine gum were equally well tolerated , despite increased nicotine exposure from the lozenge .
O B O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
The incidence of adverse events in the 2 groups was similar during the first 2 weeks of product use ( evaluation population : 55 . 3 % lozenge , 54
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 7 % gum ) , as well as during the entire study ( safety population : 63 . 8 % and 58 . 6 % , respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Stratification of patients by sex , age , extent of concurrent smoking , extent of product use , and severity of adverse events revealed no clinically significant differences between the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
lozenge and gum .
O O O O
The most common adverse events were nausea ( 17 . 2 % and 16 . 1 % ; 95 % CI , - 3 . 7 to 6 . 0
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) , hiccups ( 10 . 7 % and 6 . 6 % ; 95 % CI , 0 . 5 to 7 . 8 ) , and headache (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
8 . 7 % and 9 . 9 % ; 95 % Cl , - 5 . 0 to 2 . 6 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Serious adverse events were reported in 11 and 13 patients in the respective groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fewer than 6 % of patients in either group were considered by the investigator to have a worsening of their overall disease condition during the study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The majority of patients ( > 60 % ) experienced no change in their disease status from baseline .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
The 4 - mg nicotine lozenge and 4 - mg nicotine gum had comparable safety profiles in these patients with label - restricted medical conditions .
O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Development of levodopa - induced dyskinesias in parkinsonian monkeys may depend upon rate of symptom onset and / or duration of symptoms .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Levodopa - induced dyskinesias ( LIDs ) present a major problem for the long - term management of Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) patients .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Due to the interdependence of risk factors in clinical populations , it is difficult to independently examine factors that may influence the development of LIDs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Using macaque monkeys with different types of MPTP - induced parkinsonism , the current study evaluated the degree to which rate of symptom progression , symptom severity , and response
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to and duration of levodopa therapy may be involved in the development of LIDs .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Monkeys with acute ( short - term ) MPTP exposure , rapid symptom onset and short symptom duration prior to initiation of levodopa therapy developed dyskinesia between 11 and 24
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
days of daily levodopa administration .
O O O B O O
In contrast , monkeys with long - term MPTP exposure , slow symptom progression and / or long symptom duration prior to initiation of levodopa therapy were more resistant to
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
developing LIDs ( e . g . , dyskinesia developed no sooner than 146 days of chronic levodopa administration ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
All animals were similarly symptomatic at the start of levodopa treatment and had similar therapeutic responses to the drug .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
These data suggest distinct differences in the propensity to develop LIDs in monkeys with different rates of symptom progression or symptom durations prior to levodopa and demonstrate the value of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
these models for further studying the pathophysiology of LIDs .
O O O O O O O O O O
Propylthiouracil - induced perinuclear - staining antineutrophil cytoplasmic autoantibody - positive vasculitis in conjunction with pericarditis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To describe a case of propylthiouracil - induced vasculitis manifesting with pericarditis .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We present the first case report of a woman with hyperthyroidism treated with propylthiouracil in whom a syndrome of pericarditis , fever , and glomerulonephritis developed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Serologic testing and immunologic studies were done , and a pericardial biopsy was performed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
A 25 - year - old woman with Graves ' disease had a febrile illness and evidence of pericarditis , which was confirmed by biopsy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Serologic evaluation revealed the presence of perinuclear - staining antineutrophil cytoplasmic autoantibodies ( pANCA ) against myeloperoxidase ( MPO ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Propylthiouracil therapy was withdrawn , and she was treated with a 1 - month course of prednisone , which alleviated her symptoms .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
A literature review revealed no prior reports of pericarditis in anti - MPO pANCA - positive vasculitis associated with propylthio - uracil therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Pericarditis may be the initial manifestation of drug - induced vasculitis attributable to propylthio - uracil therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O
Two mouse lines selected for differential sensitivities to beta - carboline - induced seizures are also differentially sensitive to various pharmacological effects of other GABA ( A ) receptor ligands
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
.
O
Two mouse lines were selectively bred according to their sensitivity ( BS line ) or resistance ( BR line ) to seizures induced by a single i . p .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
injection of methyl beta - carboline - 3 - carboxylate ( beta - CCM ) , an inverse agonist of the GABA ( A ) receptor benzodiazepine site .
O O B I I I I I I I O B I I O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O
Our aim was to characterize both lines ' sensitivities to various physiological effects of other ligands of the GABA ( A ) receptor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
We measured diazepam - induced anxiolysis with the elevated plus - maze test , diazepam - induced sedation by recording the vigilance states , and picrotoxin - and pentylenetetrazol -
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O
induced seizures after i . p .
O O O O O O O
injections .
O O
Results presented here show that the differential sensitivities of BS and BR lines to beta - CCM can be extended to diazepam , picrotoxin , and pentylenetetrazol , suggesting a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O B O B O O B O O O
genetic selection of a general sensitivity and resistance to several ligands of the GABA ( A ) receptor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Analgesic effect of intravenous ketamine in cancer patients on morphine therapy : a randomized , controlled , double - blind , crossover , double - dose study .
O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pain not responsive to morphine is often problematic .
O O O O B O O O O
Animal and clinical studies have suggested that N - methyl - D - aspartate ( NMDA ) antagonists , such as ketamine , may be effective in improving opioid analgesia
O O O O O O O B I I I I I I O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
in difficult pain syndromes , such as neuropathic pain .
O O O O O O O O O O
A slow bolus of subhypnotic doses of ketamine ( 0 . 25 mg / kg or 0 . 50 mg / kg ) was given to 10 cancer patients whose
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pain was unrelieved by morphine in a randomized , double - blind , crossover , double - dose study .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pain intensity on a 0 to 10 numerical scale ; nausea and vomiting , drowsiness , confusion , and dry mouth , using a scale from 0 to 3 (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
not at all , slight , a lot , awful ) ; Mini - Mental State Examination ( MMSE ) ( 0 - 30 ) ; and arterial pressure were
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
recorded before administration of drugs ( T0 ) and after 30 minutes ( T30 ) , 60 minutes ( T60 ) , 120 minutes ( T120 ) , and 180
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
minutes ( T180 ) .
O O O O O
Ketamine , but not saline solution , significantly reduced the pain intensity in almost all the patients at both doses .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This effect was more relevant in patients treated with higher doses .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hallucinations occurred in 4 patients , and an unpleasant sensation ( """" empty head """" ) was also reported by 2 patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These episodes reversed after the administration of diazepam 1 mg intravenously .
O O O O O O O B O O O O
Significant increases in drowsiness were reported in patients treated with ketamine in both groups and were more marked with ketamine 0 . 50 mg / kg .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
A significant difference in MMSE was observed at T30 in patients who received 0 . 50 mg / kg of ketamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Ketamine can improve morphine analgesia in difficult pain syndromes , such as neuropathic pain .
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
However , the occurrence of central adverse effects should be taken into account , especially when using higher doses .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This observation should be tested in studies of prolonged ketamine administration .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
Endocrine screening in 1 , 022 men with erectile dysfunction : clinical significance and cost - effective strategy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
We reviewed the results of serum testosterone and prolactin determination in 1 , 022 patients referred because of erectile dysfunction and compared the data with history , results of physical
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
examination , other etiological investigations and effects of endocrine therapy to refine the rules of cost - effective endocrine screening and to pinpoint actual responsibility for hormonal abnormalities .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MATERIALS AND METHODS :
O O O O
Testosterone and prolactin were determined by radioimmunoassay .
B O O O O O O O
Every patient was screened for testosterone and 451 were screened for prolactin on the basis of low sexual desire , gynecomastia or testosterone
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B
less than 4 ng . / ml .
O O O O O O O O
Determination was repeated in case of abnormal first results .
O O O O O O O O O O
Prolactin results were compared with those of a previous personal cohort of 1 , 340 patients with erectile dysfunction and systematic prolactin determination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Main clinical criteria tested regarding efficiency in hormone determination were low sexual desire , small testes and gynecomastia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Endocrine therapy consisted of testosterone heptylate or human chorionic gonadotropin for hypogonadism and bromocriptine for hyperprolactinemia .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O B O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Testosterone was less than 3 ng . / ml .
B O O O O O O O O O
in 107 patients but normal in 40 % at repeat determination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The prevalence of repeatedly low testosterone increased with age ( 4 % before age 50 years and 9 % 50 years or older ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two pituitary tumors were discovered after testosterone determination .
O O O O O O B O O
Most of the other low testosterone levels seemed to result from nonorganic hypothalamic dysfunction because of normal serum luteinizing hormone and prolactin and to have only a small role in
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
erectile dysfunction ( definite improvement in only 16 of 44 [ 36 % ] after androgen therapy , normal morning or nocturnal erections in 30 % and definite vasculogenic contributions
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in 42 % ) .
O O O O O
Determining testosterone only in cases of low sexual desire or abnormal physical examination would have missed 40 % of the cases with low testosterone , including 37 % of those
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
subsequently improved by androgen therapy .
O O O O O O
Prolactin exceeded 20 ng . / ml .
O O O O O O O O
in 5 men and was normal in 2 at repeat determination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Only 1 prolactinoma was discovered .
O O O O O O
These data are lower than those we found during the last 2 decades ( overall prolactin greater than 20 ng . / ml .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in 1 . 86 % of 1 , 821 patients , prolactinomas in 7 , 0 . 38 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bromocriptine was definitely effective in cases with prolactin greater than 35 ng . / ml .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 8 of 12 compared to only 9 of 22 cases with prolactin between 20 and 35 ng . / ml . ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Testosterone was low in less than 50 % of cases with prolactin greater than 35 ng . / ml .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Low prevalences and effects of low testosterone and high prolactin in erectile dysfunction can not justify their routine determination .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , cost - effective screening strategies recommended so far missed 40 to 50 % of cases improved with endocrine therapy and the pituitary tumors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We now advocate that before age 50 years testosterone be determined only in cases of low sexual desire and abnormal physical examination but that it be measured in all men
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
older than 50 years .
O O O O O
Prolactin should be determined only in cases of low sexual desire , gynecomastia and / or testosterone less than 4 ng . / ml .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Thiopentone pretreatment for propofol injection pain in ambulatory patients .
B O O B O O O O O O
This study investigated propofol injection pain in patients undergoing ambulatory anaesthesia .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
In a randomized , double - blind trial , 90 women were allocated to receive one of three treatments prior to induction of anaesthesia with propofol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Patients in Group C received 2 ml normal saline , Group L , 2 ml , lidocaine 2 % ( 40 mg ) and Group T , 2 ml
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
thiopentone 2 . 5 % ( 50 mg ) .
B O O O O O O O O O
Venous discomfort was assessed with a visual analogue scale ( VAS ) 5 - 15 sec after commencing propofol administration using an infusion pump ( rate 1000 micrograms . kg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
- 1 . min - 1 ) .
O O O O O O O O
Loss of consciousness occurred in 60 - 90 sec .
O O O O O O O O O O
Visual analogue scores ( mean + / -
O O O O O O O O
SD ) during induction were lower in Groups L ( 3 . 3 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 5 ) and T ( 4 . 1 + / - 2 . 7 ) than in Group C ( 5 . 6 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 3 ) ; P = 0 . 0031 .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of venous discomfort was lower in Group L ( 76 . 6 % ; P < 0 . 05 ) than in Group C ( 100 % )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
but not different from Group T ( 90 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The VAS scores for recall of pain in the recovery room were correlated with the VAS scores during induction ( r = 0 . 7045 ; P < 0 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0001 ) .
O O O
Recovery room discharge times were similar : C ( 75 . 9 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
19 . 4 min ) ; L 73 . 6 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
21 . 6 min ) ; T ( 77 . 1 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
18 . 9 min ) .
O O O O O O
Assessing their overall satisfaction , 89 . 7 % would choose propofol anaesthesia again .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
We conclude that lidocaine reduces the incidence and severity of propofol injection pain in ambulatory patients whereas thiopentone only reduces its severity .

Comparison of i . v .
O O O O O O
glycopyrrolate and atropine in the prevention of bradycardia and arrhythmias following repeated doses of suxamethonium in children .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
The effectiveness of administration of glycopyrrolate 5 and 10 micrograms kg - 1 and atropine 10 and 20 micrograms kg - 1 i . v .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
immediately before the induction of anaesthesia , to prevent arrhythmia and bradycardia following repeated doses of suxamethonium in children , was studied .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
A control group was included for comparison with the lower dose range of glycopyrrolate and atropine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
A frequency of bradycardia of 50 % was noted in the control group , but this was not significantly different from the frequency with the active drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bradycardia ( defined as a decrease in heart rate to less than 50 beat min - 1 ) was prevented when the larger dose of either active drug was used
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
It is recommended that either glycopyrrolate 10 micrograms kg - 1 or atropine 20 micrograms kg - 1 i . v . should immediately precede induction of anaesthesia , in
O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
children , if the repeated administration of suxamethonium is anticipated .
O O O O O O O B O O O
Reduction in caffeine toxicity by acetaminophen .
O O B O O B O
A patient who allegedly consumed 100 tablets of an over - the - counter analgesic containing sodium acetylsalicylate , caffeine , and acetaminophen displayed no significant CNS stimulation despite the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O B O O O O O O O
presence of 175 micrograms of caffeine per mL of serum .
O O O O O B O O O O O
Because salicylates have been reported to augment the stimulatory effects of caffeine on the CNS , attention was focused on the possibility that the presence of acetaminophen ( 52 micrograms
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
/ mL ) reduced the CNS toxicity of caffeine .
O O O O O O O O B O
Studies in DBA / 2J mice showed that : 1 ) pretreatment with acetaminophen ( 100 mg / kg ) increased the interval between the administration of caffeine ( 300
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
to 450 mg / kg IP ) and the onset of fatal convulsions by a factor of about two ; and 2 ) pretreatment with acetaminophen ( 75 mg /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
kg ) reduced the incidence of audiogenic seizures produced in the presence of caffeine ( 12 . 5 to 75 mg / kg IP ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
The frequency of sound - induced seizures after 12 . 5 or 25 mg / kg caffeine was reduced from 50 to 5 % by acetaminophen .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O
In the absence of caffeine , acetaminophen ( up to 300 mg / kg ) did not modify the seizures induced by maximal electroshock and did not alter the convulsant
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dose of pentylenetetrezol in mice ( tests performed by the Anticonvulsant Screening Project of NINCDS ) .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acetaminophen ( up to 150 micrograms / mL ) did not retard the incorporation of radioactive adenosine into ATP in slices of rat cerebral cortex .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
Thus the mechanism by which acetaminophen antagonizes the actions of caffeine in the CNS remains unknown .
O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O
Flestolol : an ultra - short - acting beta - adrenergic blocking agent .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Flestolol ( ACC - 9089 ) is a nonselective , competitive , ultra - short - acting beta - adrenergic blocking agent , without any intrinsic sympathomimetic activity .
B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Flestolol is metabolized by plasma esterases and has an elimination half - life of approximately 6 . 5 minutes .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This agent was well tolerated in healthy volunteers at doses up to 100 micrograms / kg / min .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In long - term infusion studies , flestolol was well tolerated at the effective beta - blocking dose ( 5 micrograms / kg / min ) for up to seven
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
days .
O O
Flestolol blood concentrations increased linearly with increasing dose and good correlation exists between blood concentrations of flestolol and beta - adrenergic blockade .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Flestolol produced a dose - dependent attenuation of isoproterenol - induced tachycardia .
B O O O O O O O B O O O O
Electrophysiologic and hemodynamic effects of flestolol are similar to those of other beta blockers .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
In contrast with other beta blockers , flestolol - induced effects reverse rapidly ( within 30 minutes ) following discontinuation because of its short half - life .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Flestolol effectively reduced heart rate in patients with supraventricular tachyarrhythmia .
B O O O O O O O O O O
In patients with unstable angina , flestolol infusion was found to be safe and effective in controlling chest pain .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is concluded that flestolol is a potent , well - tolerated , ultra - short - acting beta - adrenergic blocking agent .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Use of flestolol in the critical care setting is currently undergoing investigation .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Adverse effect of the calcium channel blocker nitrendipine on nephrosclerosis in rats with renovascular hypertension .
O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O
The effect of a 6 - week treatment with the calcium channel blocker nitrendipine or the angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor enalapril on blood pressure , albuminuria , renal hemodynamics ,
O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O
and morphology of the nonclipped kidney was studied in rats with two - kidney , one clip renovascular hypertension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Six weeks after clipping of one renal artery , hypertensive rats ( 178 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 mm Hg ) were randomly assigned to three groups : untreated hypertensive controls ( n = 8 ) , enalapril - treated ( n = 8 ) , or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
nitrendipine - treated ( n = 10 ) .
B O O O O O O O O
Sham - operated rats served as normotensive controls ( 128 + / - 3 mm Hg , n = 8 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After 6 weeks of treatment , renal hemodynamics ( glomerular filtration rate and renal plasma flow ) were measured in the anesthetized rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal tissue was obtained for determination of glomerular size and sclerosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Enalapril but not nitrendipine reduced blood pressure significantly .
B O O B O O O O O
After 6 weeks of therapy , glomerular filtration rate was not different among the studied groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal plasma flow increased , but albumin excretion and glomerulosclerosis did not change after enalapril treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
In contrast , in the nitrendipine - treated group albuminuria increased from 12 . 8 + / -
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 progressively to 163 + / -
O O O O O O O
55 compared with 19 . 2 + / -
O O O O O O O O O
9 mg / 24 hr in the hypertensive controls .
O O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , glomerulosclerosis index was significantly increased in the nitrendipine - treated group compared with the hypertensive controls ( 0 . 38 + / -
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 1 versus 0 . 13 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 04 ) .
O O O O O
In addition , glomerular size was higher in the nitrendipine - treated group ( 14 . 9 + / -
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 17 10 ( - 3 ) mm2 ) but lower in the enalapril - treated group ( 11 . 5 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 15 10 ( - 3 ) mm2 ) compared with the hypertensive controls ( 12 . 1 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 17 10 ( - 3
O O O O O O O
) mm2 ) . ( ABSTRACT

O O O O O
Treatment of tinnitus by intratympanic instillation of lignocaine ( lidocaine ) 2 per cent through ventilation tubes .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
Idiopathic subjective tinnitus ( IST ) is one of the most obscure otological pathologies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This paper presents the results of treating IST by intratympanic instillation of lignocaine ( lidocaine ) 2 per cent through a grommet , for five weekly courses .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fifty - two patients suffering from intractable tinnitus entered this therapeutic trial , but only nine finished all five courses .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In one patient , the tinnitus was almost completely abolished , but in all the nine patients the decompensated tinnitus changed to a compensated one .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We suggest this mode of treatment for patients that were previously treated by drugs , acupuncture and biofeedback , with disappointing results .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients should be warned about the side effects of vertigo and vomiting , which subsides gradually with every new instillation , and that the tinnitus may not disappear but will
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
be alleviated , enabling them to cope more easily with the disease and lead a more normal life .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Perhexiline maleate and peripheral neuropathy .
B I O O O O
Peripheral neuropathy has been noted as a complication of therapy with perhexiline maleate , a drug widely used in France ( and in clinical trials in the United States )
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
for the prophylactic treatment of angina pectoris .
O O O O O O O O
In 24 patients with this complication , the marked slowing of motor nerve conduction velocity and the electromyographic changes imply mainly a demyelinating disorder .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Improvement was noted with cessation of therapy .
O O O O O O O O
In a few cases the presence of active denervation signified a poor prognosis , with only slight improvement .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The underlying mechanism causing the neuropathy is not yet fully known , although some evidence indicates that it may be a lipid storage process .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of humoral modulators of morphine - induced increase in locomotor activity of mice .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The effect of humoral modulators on the morphine - induced increase in locomotor activity of mice was studied .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The subcutaneous administration of 10 mg / kg of morphine - HC1 produced a marked increase in locomotor activity in mice .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
The morphine - induced hyperactivity was potentiated by scopolamine and attenuated by physostigmine .
O B O O O O O O B O O O B O
In contrast , both methscopolamine and neostigmine , which do not penetrate the blood - brain barrier , had no effect on the hyperactivity produced by morphine .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Pretreatment of mice with alpha - methyltyrosine ( 20 mg / kg
O O O O B I I O O O O O
i . p .
O O O O
, one hour ) , an inhibitor of tyrosine hydroxylase , significantly decreased the activity - increasing effects of morphine .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
On the other hand , pretreatment with p - chlorophenylalamine ( 3 X 320 mg / kg
O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O
i . p .
O O O O
, 24 hr ) , a serotonin depletor , caused no significant change in the hyperactivity .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The study suggests that the activity - increasing effects of morphine are mediated by the release of catecholamines from adrenergic neurons in the brain .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
And the results are consistent with the hypothesis that morphine acts by retarding the release of acetylcholine at some central cholinergic synapses .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O
It is also suggested from collected evidence that the activity - increasing effects of morphine in mice are mediated by mechanisms different from those which mediate the activity - increasing
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
effects of morphine in rats .
O O B O O O
Mechanisms of FK 506 - induced hypertension in the rat .
O O B I O O O O O O O
- Tacrolimus (
O B O
FK 506 ) is a powerful , widely used immunosuppressant .
B I O O O O O O O O O
The clinical utility of FK 506 is complicated by substantial hypertension and nephrotoxicity .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
To clarify the mechanisms of FK 506 - induced hypertension , we studied the chronic effects of FK 506 on the synthesis of endothelin - 1 ( ET - 1
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O
) , the expression of mRNA of ET - 1 and endothelin - converting enzyme - 1 ( ECE - 1 ) , the endothelial nitric oxide synthase ( eNOS
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O
) activity , and the expression of mRNA of eNOS and C - type natriuretic peptide ( CNP ) in rat blood vessels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , the effect of the specific endothelin type A receptor antagonist FR 139317 on FK 506 - induced hypertension in rats was studied .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B I O O O O O O O O
FK 506 , 5 mg .
B I O O O O
kg - 1 .
O O O O
d - 1 given for 4 weeks , elevated blood pressure from 102 + / - 13 to 152 + / - 15 mm Hg and increased the synthesis of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ET - 1 and the levels of ET - 1 mRNA in the mesenteric artery ( 240 % and 230 % , respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Little change was observed in the expression of ECE - 1 mRNA and CNP mRNA .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
FK 506 decreased eNOS activity and the levels of eNOS mRNA in the aorta ( 48 % and 55 % , respectively ) .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The administration of FR 139317 ( 10 mg .
O O O B I O O O O
kg - 1 .
O O O O
d - 1 ) prevented FK 506 - induced hypertension in rats .
O O O O O B I O O O O O O
These results indicate that FK 506 may increase blood pressure not only by increasing ET - 1 production but also by decreasing NO synthesis in the vasculature .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Suxamethonium induced prolonged apnea in a patient receiving electroconvulsive therapy .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Suxamethonium causes prolonged apnea in patients in whom pseudocholinesterase enzyme gets deactivated by organophosphorus ( OP ) poisons .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O
Here , we present a similar incident in a severely depressed patient who received electroconvulsive therapy ( ECT ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prolonged apnea in our case ensued because the information about suicidal attempt by OP compound was concealed from the treating team .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
The effects of the adjunctive bupropion on male sexual dysfunction induced by a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor : a double - blind placebo - controlled and randomized study .
