O O O O O B O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To determine the safety and efficacy of adjunctive bupropion sustained - release ( SR ) on male sexual dysfunction ( SD ) induced by a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O
SSRI ) , as SD is a common side - effect of SSRIs and the most effective treatments have yet to be determined .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS AND METHODS :
O O O O
The randomized sample consisted of 234 euthymic men who were receiving some type of SSRI .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The men were randomly assigned to bupropion SR ( 150 mg twice daily , 117 ) or placebo ( twice daily , 117 ) for 12 weeks .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Efficacy was evaluated using the Clinical Global Impression - Sexual Function ( CGI - SF ; the primary outcome measure ) , the International Index of Erectile Function ( IIEF
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) , Arizona Sexual Experience Scale ( ASEX ) , and Erectile Dysfunction Inventory of Treatment Satisfaction ( EDITS ) ( secondary outcome measures ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Participants were followed biweekly during study period .
O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
After 12 weeks of treatment , the mean ( sd ) scores for CGI - SF were significantly lower , i . e . better , in patients on
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
bupropion SR , at 2 . 4 ( 1 . 2 ) , than in the placebo group , at 3 . 9 ( 1 . 1 ) ( P
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
= 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O
Men who received bupropion had a significant increase in the total IIEF score ( 54 . 4 % vs 1 . 2 % ; P = 0 . 003 )
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and in the five different domains of the IIEF .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Total ASEX scores were significantly lower , i . e . better , among men who received bupropion than placebo , at 15 . 5 ( 4 . 3 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
vs 21 . 5 ( 4 . 7 ) ( P = 0 . 002 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The EDITS scores were 67 . 4 ( 10 . 2 ) for the bupropion and 36 . 3 ( 11 . 7 ) for the placebo group ( P
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
= 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O
The ASEX score and CGI - SF score were correlated ( P = 0 . 003 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In linear regression analyses the CGI - SF score was not affected significantly by the duration of SD , type of SSRI used and age .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Bupropion is an effective treatment for male SD induced by SSRIs .
B O O O O O O O O O B O
These results provide empirical support for conducting a further study of bupropion .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Lamivudine for the prevention of hepatitis B virus reactivation in hepatitis - B surface antigen ( HBSAG )
B O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O B O
seropositive cancer patients undergoing cytotoxic chemotherapy .
O O O O O O O
Hepatitis B virus ( HBV ) is one of the major causes of chronic liver disease worldwide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cancer patients who are chronic carriers of HBV have a higher hepatic complication rate while receiving cytotoxic chemotherapy ( CT ) and this has mainly been attributed to HBV reactivation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
In this study , cancer patients who have solid and hematological malignancies with chronic HBV infection received the antiviral agent lamivudine prior and during CT compared with historical control group
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
who did not receive lamivudine .
O O O O B O
The objectives were to assess the efficacy of lamivudine in reducing the incidence of HBV reactivation , and diminishing morbidity and mortality during CT .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two groups were compared in this study .
O O O O O O O O
The prophylactic lamivudin group consisted of 37 patients who received prophylactic lamivudine treatment .
O O B O O O O O O O O B O O
The historical controls consisted of 50 consecutive patients who underwent CT without prophylactic lamivudine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
They were followed up during and for 8 weeks after CT .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The outcomes were compared for both groups .
O O O O O O O O
Of our control group ( n = 50 ) , 21 patients ( 42 % ) were established hepatitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Twelve ( 24 % ) of them were evaluated as severe hepatitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the prophylactic lamivudine group severe hepatitis were observed only in 1 patient ( 2 . 7 % ) of 37 patients ( p < 0 . 006 ) .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Comparison of the mean ALT values revealed significantly higher mean alanine aminotransferase ( ALT ) values in the control group than the prophylactic lamivudine group ; 154 : 64 (
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
p < 0 . 32 ) .
O O O O O O O
Our study suggests that prophylactic lamivudine significantly decreases the incidence of HBV reactivation and overall morbidity in cancer patients during and after immunosuppressive therapy .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Further studies are needed to determine the most appropriate nucleoside or nucleotide analogue for antiviral prophylaxis during CT and the optimal duration of administration after completion of CT .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ginsenoside Rg1 restores the impairment of learning induced by chronic morphine administration in rats .
B I O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Rg1 , as a ginsenoside extracted from Panax ginseng , could ameliorate spatial learning impairment .
B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Previous studies have demonstrated that Rg1 might be a useful agent for the prevention and treatment of the adverse effects of morphine .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The aim of this study was to investigate the effect of Rg1 on learning impairment by chronic morphine administration and the mechanism responsible for this effect .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Male rats were subcutaneously injected with morphine ( 10 mg / kg ) twice a day at 12 hour intervals for 10 days , and Rg1 ( 30 mg /
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
kg ) was intraperitoneally injected 2 hours after the second injection of morphine once a day for 10 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Spatial learning capacity was assessed in the Morris water maze .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The results showed that rats treated with Morphine / Rg1 decreased escape latency and increased the time spent in platform quadrant and entering frequency .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
By implantation of electrodes and electrophysiological recording in vivo , the results showed that Rg1 restored the long - term potentiation ( LTP ) impaired by morphine in both freely
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
moving and anaesthetised rats .
O O O O O
The electrophysiological recording in vitro showed that Rg1 restored the LTP in slices from the rats treated with morphine , but not changed LTP in the slices from normal saline
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
- or morphine / Rg1 - treated rats ; this restoration could be inhibited by N - methyl - D - aspartate ( NMDA ) receptor antagonist MK801 .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I O B O O O B O
We conclude that Rg1 may significantly improve the spatial learning capacity impaired by chonic morphine administration and restore the morphine - inhibited LTP .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O
This effect is NMDA receptor dependent .
O O O B O O O
A study on the effect of the duration of subcutaneous heparin injection on bruising and pain .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
AIM :
O O
This study was carried out to determine the effect of injection duration on bruising and pain following the administration of the subcutaneous injection of heparin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Although different methods to prevent bruising and pain following the subcutaneous injection of heparin have been widely studied and described , the effect of injection duration on the occurrence of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
bruising and pain is little documented .
O O O O O O O
DESIGN :
O O
This study was designed as within - subject , quasi - experimental research .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHOD :
O O
The sample for the study consisted of 50 patients to whom subcutaneous heparin was administered .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Heparin was injected over 10 seconds on the right abdominal site and 30 seconds on the left abdominal site .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Injections areas were assessed for the presence of bruising at 48 and 72 hours after each injection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dimensions of the bruising on the heparin applied areas were measured using transparent millimetric measuring paper .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The visual analog scale ( VAS ) was used to measure pain intensity and a stop - watch was used to time the pain period .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Data were analysed using chi - square test , Mann - Whitney U , Wilcoxon signed ranks tests and correlation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The percentage of bruising occurrence was 64 % with the injection of 10 seconds duration and 42 % in the 30 - second injection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It was determined that the size of the bruising was smaller in the 30 - second injection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pain intensity and pain period were statistically significantly lower for the 30 - second injection than for the 10 - second injection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
It was determined that injection duration had an effect on bruising and pain following the subcutaneous administration of heparin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
This study should be repeated on a larger sample .
O O O O O O O O O O
RELEVANCE TO
O O
CLINICAL PRACTICE :
O O O
When administering subcutaneous heparin injections , it is important to extend the duration of the injection .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute reserpine and subchronic haloperidol treatments change synaptosomal brain glutamate uptake and elicit orofacial dyskinesia in rats .
O B O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Reserpine - and haloperidol - induced orofacial dyskinesia are putative animal models of tardive dyskinesia ( TD ) whose pathophysiology has been related to free radical generation and oxidative stress
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
In the present study , the authors induced orofacial dyskinesia by acute reserpine and subchronic haloperidol administration to rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O
Reserpine injection ( one dose of 1 mg / kg s . c . )
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
every other day for 3 days caused a significant increase in vacuous chewing , tongue protrusion and duration of facial twitching , compared to the control .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Haloperidol administration ( one dose of 12 mg / kg once a week s . c . ) for 4 weeks caused an increase in vacuous chewing , tongue protrusion
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and duration of facial twitching observed in four weekly evaluations .
O O O O O O O O O O O
After the treatments and behavioral observation , glutamate uptake by segments of the brain was analyzed .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
A decreased glutamate uptake was observed in the subcortical parts of animals treated with reserpine and haloperidol , compared to the control .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
Importantly , a decrease in glutamate uptake correlates negatively with an increase in the incidence of orofacial diskinesia .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results indicate that early changes in glutamate transport may be related to the development of vacuous chewing movements in rats .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute psychosis due to treatment with phenytoin in a nonepileptic patient .
O O O O O O B O O O O O
The development of psychosis related to antiepileptic drug treatment is usually attributed to the interaction between the epileptic brain substratum and the antiepileptic drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The case of a nonepileptic patient who developed psychosis following phenytoin treatment for trigeminal neuralgia is described .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
This case suggests that the psychotic symptoms that occur following phenytoin treatment in some epileptic patients may be the direct result of medication , unrelated to seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effect of treatment with gum Arabic on gentamicin nephrotoxicity in rats : a preliminary study .
O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O
In the present work we assessed the effect of treatment of rats with gum Arabic on acute renal failure induced by gentamicin ( GM ) nephrotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O B O B O O O
Rats were treated with the vehicle ( 2 mL / kg of distilled water and 5 % w / v cellulose , 10 days ) , gum Arabic ( 2
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
mL / kg of a 10 % w / v aqueous suspension of gum Arabic powder , orally for 10 days ) , or gum Arabic concomitantly with GM (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O B I O O B O
80mg / kg / day intramuscularly , during the last six days of the treatment period ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nephrotoxicity was assessed by measuring the concentrations of creatinine and urea in the plasma and reduced glutathione ( GSH ) in the kidney cortex , and by light microscopic examination
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
of kidney sections .
O O O O
The results indicated that concomitant treatment with gum Arabic and GM significantly increased creatinine and urea by about 183 and 239 % , respectively ( compared to 432 and 346
O O O O O O O B I O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% , respectively , in rats treated with cellulose and GM ) , and decreased that of cortical GSH by 21 % ( compared to 27 % in the cellulose
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
plus GM group )
O B O O
The GM - induced proximal tubular necrosis appeared to be slightly less severe in rats given GM together with gum Arabic than in those given GM and cellulose .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B I O O O O B O O O
It could be inferred that gum Arabic treatment has induced a modest amelioration of some of the histological and biochemical indices of GM nephrotoxicity .
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Further work is warranted on the effect of the treatments on renal functional aspects in models of chronic renal failure , and on the mechanism ( s ) involved .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Visual hallucinations associated with zonisamide .
O O O O B O
Zonisamide is a broad - spectrum antiepileptic drug used to treat various types of seizures .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although visual hallucinations have not been reported as an adverse effect of this agent , we describe three patients who experienced complex visual hallucinations and altered mental status after
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
zonisamide treatment was begun or its dosage increased .
B O O O O O O O O
All three had been diagnosed earlier with epilepsy , and their electroencephalogram ( EEG ) findings were abnormal .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
During monitoring , visual hallucinations did not correlate with EEG readings , nor did video recording capture any of the described events .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
None of the patients had experienced visual hallucinations before this event .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The only recent change in their treatment was the introduction or increased dosage of zonisamide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
With either discontinuation or decreased dosage of the drug the symptoms disappeared and did not recur .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Further observations and reports will help clarify this adverse effect .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Until then , clinicians need to be aware of this possible complication associated with zonisamide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
GLEPP1 receptor tyrosine phosphatase ( Ptpro ) in rat PAN nephrosis .
O O B O O O O O O B O O
A marker of acute podocyte injury .
O O O O O O O
Glomerular epithelial protein 1 ( GLEPP1 ) is a podocyte receptor membrane protein tyrosine phosphatase located on the apical cell membrane of visceral glomerular epithelial cell and foot processes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This receptor plays a role in regulating the structure and function of podocyte foot process .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To better understand the utility of GLEPP1 as a marker of glomerular injury , the amount and distribution of GLEPP1 protein and mRNA were examined by immunohistochemistry , Western blot
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and RNase protection assay in a model of podocyte injury in the rat .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Puromycin aminonucleoside nephrosis was induced by single intraperitoneal injection of puromycin aminonucleoside ( PAN , 20 mg / 100 g BW ) .
B I O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O
Tissues were analyzed at 0 , 5 , 7 , 11 , 21 , 45 , 80 and 126 days after PAN injection so as to include both the acute
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
phase of proteinuria associated with foot process effacement ( days 5 - 11 ) and the chronic phase of proteinuria associated with glomerulosclerosis ( days 45 - 126 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At day 5 , GLEPP1 protein and mRNA were reduced from the normal range ( 265 . 2 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
79 . 6 x 10 ( 6 ) moles / glomerulus and 100 % ) to 15 % of normal ( 41 . 8 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 . 8 x 10 ( 6 ) moles / glomerulus , p < 0 . 005 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This occurred in association with an increase in urinary protein content from 1 . 8 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 to 99 . 0 + / -
O O O O O O O O
61 mg / day ( p < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , podocalyxin did not change significantly at this time .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
By day 11 , GLEPP1 protein and mRNA had begun to return towards baseline .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
By day 45 - 126 , at a time when glomerular scarring was present , GLEPP1 was absent from glomerulosclerotic areas although the total glomerular content of GLEPP1 was not
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
different from normal .
O O O O
We conclude that GLEPP1 expression , unlike podocalyxin , reflects podocyte injury induced by PAN .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
GLEPP1 expression may be a useful marker of podocyte injury .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Ticlopidine - induced aplastic anemia : report of three Chinese patients and review of the literature .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this study , three Chinese patients with ticlopidine - induced aplastic anemia were reported and another 13 patients in the English literature were reviewed .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We attempted to find underlying similarities , evaluate the risk factors , and identify appropriate treatment for this complication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All but one of the patients were over 60 years old , and the 6 who died were all older than 65 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , old age may be a risk factor for developing this complication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Agranulocytosis occurred 3 - 20 weeks after initiation of ticlopidine , so frequent examination of white cell count during treatment is recommended .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There seemed to be no direct correlation between the dose or duration used and the severity of bone marrow suppression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment for ticlopidine - induced aplastic anemia with colony - stimulating factors seemed to have little effect .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The fact that 5 of the 6 patients who received concurrent calcium channel blockers died , should alert clinicians to be more cautious when using these two drugs simultaneously .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Facilitation of memory retrieval by pre - test morphine and its state dependency in the step - through type passive avoidance learning test in mice .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Amnesia produced by scopolamine and cycloheximide were reversed by morphine given 30 min before the test trial ( pre - test ) , and pre - test morphine also facilitated
O O O B O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
the memory retrieval in the animals administered naloxone during the training trial .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Similarly , pre - test scopolamine partially reversed the scopolamine - induced amnesia , but not significantly ; and pre - test cycloheximide failed to reverse the cycloheximide - induced
O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O
amnesia .
O O
These results suggest that the facilitation of memory retrieval by pre - test morphine might be the direct action of morphine rather than a state dependent effect .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Test conditions influence the response to a drug challenge in rodents .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
These studies were conducted to examine the differential response to a drug challenge under varied experimental test conditions routinely employed to study drug - induced behavioral and neurophysiological responses in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rodents .
O O
Apomorphine , a nonselective dopamine agonist , was selected due to its biphasic behavioral effects , its ability to induce hypothermia , and to produce distinct changes to dopamine turnover
B O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
in the rodent brain .
O O O O O
From such experiments there is evidence that characterization and detection of apomorphine - induced activity in rodents critically depends upon the test conditions employed .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In rats , detection of apomorphine - induced hyperactivity was facilitated by a period of acclimatization to the test conditions .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Moreover , test conditions can impact upon other physiological responses to apomorphine such as drug - induced hypothermia .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
In mice , apomorphine produced qualitatively different responses under novel conditions when compared to those behaviors elicited in the home test cage .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Drug - induced gross activity counts were increased in the novel exploratory box only , while measures of stereotypic behavior were similar in both .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
By contrast , apomorphine - induced locomotion was more prominent in the novel exploratory box .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dopamine turnover ratios ( DOPAC : DA and HVA : DA ) were found to be lower in those animals exposed to the exploratory box when compared to their home
B O O O B O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cage counterparts .
O O O
However , apomorphine - induced reductions in striatal dopamine turnover were detected in both novel and home cage environments .
O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The implications of these findings are discussed with particular emphasis upon conducting psychopharmacological challenge tests in rodents .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tricuspid valve regurgitation and lithium carbonate toxicity in a newborn infant .
O O O O B I O O O O O O
A newborn with massive tricuspid regurgitation , atrial flutter , congestive heart failure , and a high serum lithium level is described .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
This is the first patient to initially manifest tricuspid regurgitation and atrial flutter , and the 11th described patient with cardiac disease among infants exposed to lithium compounds in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
first trimester of pregnancy .
O O O O O
Sixty - three percent of these infants had tricuspid valve involvement .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lithium carbonate may be a factor in the increasing incidence of congenital heart disease when taken during early pregnancy .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It also causes neurologic depression , cyanosis , and cardiac arrhythmia when consumed prior to delivery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Phenobarbital - induced dyskinesia in a neurologically - impaired child .
B O O O O O O O O O O
A 2 - year - old child with known neurologic impairment developed a dyskinesia soon after starting phenobarbital therapy for seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Known causes of movement disorders were eliminated after evaluation .
O O O O O O O O O O
On repeat challenge with phenobarbital , the dyskinesia recurred .
O O O O B O O O O O
Phenobarbital should be added to the list of anticonvulsant drugs that can cause movement disorders .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute changes of blood ammonia may predict short - term adverse effects of valproic acid .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O B I O
Valproic acid ( VPA ) was given to 24 epileptic patients who were already being treated with other antiepileptic drugs .
B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A standardized loading dose of VPA was administered , and venous blood was sampled at 0 , 1 , 2 , 3 , and 4 hours .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ammonia ( NH3 ) was higher in patients who , during continuous therapy , complained of drowsiness ( 7 patients ) than in those who were symptom - free (
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
17 patients ) , although VPA plasma levels were similar in both groups .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
By measuring VPA - induced changes of blood NH3 content , it may be possible to identify patients at higher risk of obtundation when VPA is given chronically .
O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Effects of calcitonin on rat extrapyramidal motor system : behavioral and biochemical data .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effects of i . v . c .
O O O O O O O O O
injection of human and salmon calcitonin on biochemical and behavioral parameters related to the extrapyramidal motor system , were investigated in male rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Calcitonin injection resulted in a potentiation of haloperidol - induced catalepsy and a partial prevention of apomorphine - induced hyperactivity .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Moreover calcitonin induced a significant decrease in nigral GAD activity but no change in striatal DA and DOPAC concentration or GAD activity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
The results are discussed in view of a primary action of calcitonin on the striatonigral GABAergic pathway mediating the DA - related behavioral messages of striatal origin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Development of isoproterenol - induced cardiac hypertrophy .
O O B O O O O O
The development of cardiac hypertrophy was studied in adult female Wistar rats following daily subcutaneous injections of isoproterenol ( ISO ) ( 0 . 3 mg / kg body weight
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
A time course was established for the change in tissue mass , RNA and DNA content , as well as hydroxyproline content .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Heart weight increased 44 % after 8 days of treatment with a half time of 3 . 4 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ventricular RNA content was elevated 26 % after 24 h of a single injection and reached a maximal level following 8 days of therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The half time for RNA accumulation was 2 . 0 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The total content of hydroxyproline remained stable during the first 2 days of treatment but increased 46 % after 4 days of therapy .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ventricular DNA content was unchanged during the early stage ( 1 - 4 days ) of hypertrophic growth but increased to a new steady - state level 19 % above
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the controls after 8 days of treatment .
O O O O O O O O
Intraventricular pressures and coronary flow measures were similar for control and experimental animals following 4 days of developed hypertrophy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , dP / dt in the ISO - treated hearts was slightly but significantly
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
( P less than 0 . 05 ) elevated .
O O O O O O O O O O
These data indicate that the adaptive response to ISO shows an early hypertrophic phase ( 1 - 4 days ) characterized by a substantial increase in RNA content and cardiac
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mass in the absence of changes in DNA .
O O O O O O O O O
However , prolonged stimulation ( 8 - 12 days ) appears to represent a complex integration of both cellular hypertrophy and hyperplasia within the heart .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Co - carcinogenic effect of retinyl acetate on forestomach carcinogenesis of male F344 rats induced with butylated hydroxyanisole .
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O B I O
The potential modifying effect of retinyl acetate ( RA ) on butylated hydroxyanisole ( BHA ) - induced rat forestomach tumorigenesis was examined .
O O O O O B I O B O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O
Male F344 rats , 5 weeks of age , were maintained on diet containing 1 % or 2 % BHA by weight and simultaneously on drinking water supplemented with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
RA at various concentrations ( w / v ) for 52 weeks .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
In groups given 2 % BHA , although marked hyperplastic changes of the forestomach epithelium were observed in all animals , co - administration of 0 . 25 %
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RA significantly ( P less than 0 . 05 ) increased the incidence of forestomach tumors ( squamous cell papilloma and carcinoma ) to 60 % ( 9 / 15
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, 2 rats with carcinoma ) from 15 % ( 3 / 20 , one rat with carcinoma ) in the group given RA - free water .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
In rats given 1 % BHA , RA co - administered at a dose of 0 . 05 , 0 . 1 , 0 . 2 or 0 . 25
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% showed a dose - dependent enhancing effect on the development of the BHA - induced epithelial hyperplasia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Tumors , all papillomas , were induced in 3 rats ( 17 % ) with 0 . 25 % RA and in one rat ( 10 % ) with 0
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
. 05 % RA co - administration .
O O O B O O O O
RA alone did not induce hyperplastic changes in the forestomach .
B O O O O O O O O O O
These findings indicate that RA acted as a co - carcinogen in the BHA forestomach carcinogenesis of the rat .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Ketanserin pretreatment reverses alfentanil - induced muscle rigidity .
B O O B O O O O O
Systemic pretreatment with ketanserin , a relatively specific type - 2 serotonin receptor antagonist , significantly attenuated the muscle rigidity produced in rats by the potent short - acting opiate
O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
agonist alfentanil .
O B O
Following placement of subcutaneous electrodes in each animal 's left gastrocnemius muscle , rigidity was assessed by analyzing root - mean - square electromyographic activity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intraperitoneal ketanserin administration at doses of 0 . 63 and 2 . 5 mg / kg prevented the alfentanil - induced increase in electromyographic activity compared with animals pretreated with
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
saline .
O O
Chlordiazepoxide at doses up to 10 mg / kg failed to significantly influence the rigidity produced by alfentanil .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Despite the absence of rigidity , animals that received ketanserin ( greater than 0 . 31 mg / kg i . p . ) followed by alfentanil were motionless ,
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
flaccid , and less responsive to external stimuli than were animals receiving alfentanil alone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Rats that received ketanserin and alfentanil exhibited less rearing and exploratory behavior at the end of the 60 - min recording period than did animals that received ketanserin alone .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
These results , in combination with previous work , suggest that muscle rigidity , a clinically relevant side - effect of parenteral narcotic administration , may be partly mediated via
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
serotonergic pathways .
O O O
Pretreatment with type - 2 serotonin antagonists may be clinically useful in attenuating opiate - induced rigidity , although further studies will be necessary to assess the interaction of possibly
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
enhanced CNS , cardiovascular , and respiratory depression .
O O O O O O O O O
Glycopyrronium requirements for antagonism of the muscarinic side effects of edrophonium .
B O O O O O O O O O B O
We have compared , in 60 adult patients , the cardiovascular effects of glycopyrronium 5 micrograms kg - 1 and 10 micrograms kg - 1 given either simultaneously or 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
min before edrophonium 1 mg kg - 1 .
O O B O O O O O O
Significant differences between the four groups were detected ( P less than 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both groups receiving 10 micrograms kg - 1 showed increases in heart rate of up to 30 beat min - 1 ( 95 % confidence limits 28 - 32 beat
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
min - 1 ) .
O O O O O
Use of glycopyrronium 5 micrograms
O O B O O
kg - 1 provided greater cardiovascular stability and , given 1 min before the edrophonium , was sufficient to minimize early , edrophonium - induced bradycardias .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O
This low dose of glycopyrronium provided good control of oropharyngeal secretions .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
Involvement of locus coeruleus and noradrenergic neurotransmission in fentanyl - induced muscular rigidity in the rat .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Whereas muscular rigidity is a well - known side effect that is associated with high - dose fentanyl anesthesia , a paucity of information exists with regard to its underlying
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
mechanism ( s ) .
O O O O O
We investigated in this study the possible engagement of locus coeruleus of the pons in this phenomenon , using male Sprague - Dawley rats anesthetized with ketamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Under proper control of respiration , body temperature and end - tidal CO2 , intravenous administration of fentanyl ( 50 or 100 micrograms / kg ) consistently promoted an increase
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
in electromyographic activity recorded from the gastrocnemius and abdominal rectus muscles .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Such an induced muscular rigidity by the narcotic agent was significantly antagonized or even reduced by prior electrolytic lesions of the locus coeruleus or pretreatment with the alpha - adrenoceptor
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
blocker , prazosin .
O O B O
Microinjection of fentanyl ( 2 . 5 micrograms / 50 nl ) directly into this pontine nucleus , on the other hand , elicited discernible electromyographic excitation .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is speculated that the induction of muscular rigidity by fentanyl may involve the coerulospinal noradrenergic fibers to the spinal motoneurons .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Cerebral sinus thrombosis as a potential hazard of antifibrinolytic treatment in menorrhagia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We describe a 42 - year - old woman who developed superior sagittal and left transverse sinus thrombosis associated with prolonged epsilon - aminocaproic acid therapy for menorrhagia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O
This antifibrinolytic agent has been used in women with menorrhagia to promote clotting and reduce blood loss .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although increased risk of thromboembolic disease has been reported during treatment with epsilon - aminocaproic acid , cerebral sinus thrombosis has not been previously described .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O
Careful use of epsilon - aminocaproic acid therapy is recommended .
O O O B I I I O O O O
Hemorrhagic cystitis complicating bone marrow transplantation .
O O O O O O O
Hemorrhagic cystitis is a potentially serious complication of high - dose cyclophosphamide therapy administered before bone marrow transplantation .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
As standard practice at our institution , patients who are scheduled to receive a bone marrow transplant are treated prophylactically with forced hydration and bladder irrigation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In an attempt to obviate the inconvenience of bladder irrigation , we conducted a feasibility trial of uroprophylaxis with mesna , which neutralizes the hepatic metabolite of cyclophosphamide that causes
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O
hemorrhagic cystitis .
O O O
Of 97 patients who received standard prophylaxis , 4 had symptomatic hemorrhagic cystitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , two of four consecutive patients who received mesna uroprophylaxis before allogeneic bone marrow transplantation had severe hemorrhagic cystitis for at least 2 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because of this suboptimal result , we resumed the use of bladder irrigation and forced hydration to minimize the risk of hemorrhagic cystitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reversal of central benzodiazepine effects by flumazenil after intravenous conscious sedation with diazepam and opioids : report of a double - blind multicenter study .
O O O B O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Flumazenil in Intravenous Conscious Sedation with Diazepam Multicenter Study Group II .
O B O O O O O B O O O O O
The efficacy and safety of a new benzodiazepine antagonist , flumazenil , were assessed in a double - blind multicenter study .
O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Flumazenil ( mean dose , 0 . 76 mg ) or placebo ( mean dose , 8 . 9 ml ) was administered intravenously to 130 and 67 patients ,
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
respectively , who had been given diazepam in conjunction with an opioid ( fentanyl , meperidine , or morphine ) for the induction and maintenance of intravenous conscious sedation for
O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
diagnostic or therapeutic surgical procedures .
O O O O O O
The group assessable for efficacy comprised 122 patients treated with flumazenil and 64 patients given placebo .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
After 5 minutes , 80 / 115 ( 70 % ) flumazenil - treated patients , compared with 21 / 63 ( 33 % ) placebo - treated patients ,
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
were completely awake and alert , as indicated by a score of 5 on the Observer 's Assessment of Alertness / Sedation Scale .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ninety - five percent of patients in each group who attained a score of 5 at the 5 - minute assessment showed no loss of alertness throughout the 180 -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
minute assessment period .
O O O O
Flumazenil - treated patients also performed significantly better on the Finger - to - Nose Test and the recall of pictures shown at the 5 - minute assessment .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Flumazenil was well tolerated , with no serious adverse effects reported .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Thirty - nine ( 30 % ) of flumazenil - treated patients , compared with 17 ( 25 % ) of placebo - treated patients had one or more drug
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- related adverse experiences .
O O O O O
The most common adverse effects were nausea and vomiting in the flumazenil group and nausea and injection - site pain in the placebo group .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Flumazenil was found to promptly reverse sedation induced by diazepam in the presence of opioids .
B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Hepatic adenomas and focal nodular hyperplasia of the liver in young women on oral contraceptives : case reports .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
Two cases of hepatic adenoma and one of focal nodular hyperplasia presumably associated with the use of oral contraceptives , are reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
Special reference is made to their clinical presentation , which may be totally asymptomatic .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Liver - function tests are of little diagnostic value , but valuable information may be obtained from both liver scanning and hepatic angiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Histologic differences and clinical similarities between hepatic adenoma and focal nodular hyperplasia of the liver are discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Arterial thromboembolism in patients receiving systemic heparin therapy : a complication associated with heparin - induced thrombocytopenia .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O
Arterial thromboembolism is a recognized complication of systemic heparin therapy .
O O O O O O O O B O O
Characteristic of the entity is arterial occlusion by platelet - fibrin thrombi with distal ischemia occurring four to twenty days after the initiation of heparin therapy , preceded by profound
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
thrombocytopenia with platelet counts in the range of 30 , 000 to 40 , 000 per cubic millimeter .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The clinically apparent occlusion may be preceded by gastrointestinal and musculoskeletal symptoms that appear to be ischemic in origin , and might serve to warn the clinician of these complications
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Previous reports of these phenomena as well as recent studies of the effect of heparin are reviewed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
The common factor relating thromboembolism and thrombocytopenia is heparin - induced platelet aggregation .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Appropriate treatment consists of discontinuation of heparin , and anticoagulation with sodium warfarin if necessary .
O O O O O O B O O O O B I O O O
Vascular procedures are performed as indicated .
O O O O O O O
Long - term prognosis for transplant - free survivors of paracetamol - induced acute liver failure .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
The prognosis for transplant - free survivors of paracetamol - induced acute liver failure remains unknown .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
AIM :
O O
To examine whether paracetamol - induced acute liver failure increases long - term mortality .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We followed up all transplant - free survivors of paracetamol - induced acute liver injury , hospitalized in a Danish national referral centre during 1984 - 2004 .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We compared age - specific mortality rates from 1 year post - discharge through 2008 between those in whom the liver injury led to an acute liver failure and those
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in whom it did not .
O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
We included 641 patients .
O O O O O
On average , age - specific mortality rates were slightly higher for the 101 patients whose paracetamol - induced liver injury had caused an acute liver failure ( adjusted mortality
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rate ratio = 1 . 70 , 95 % CI 1 . 02 - 2 . 85 ) , but the association was age - dependent , and no survivors
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of acute liver failure died of liver disease , whereas suicides were frequent in both groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These observations speak against long - term effects of acute liver failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
More likely , the elevated mortality rate ratio resulted from incomplete adjustment for the greater prevalence of substance abuse among survivors of acute liver failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Paracetamol - induced acute liver failure did not affect long - term mortality .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical follow - up may be justified by the cause of the liver failure , but not by the liver failure itself .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Serotonin 6 receptor gene is associated with methamphetamine - induced psychosis in a Japanese population .
B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Altered serotonergic neural transmission is hypothesized to be a susceptibility factor for psychotic disorders such as schizophrenia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The serotonin 6 ( 5 - HT6 ) receptor is therapeutically targeted by several second generation antipsychotics , such as clozapine and olanzapine , and d - amphetamine - induced
O B O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B I I O O
hyperactivity in rats is corrected with the use of a selective 5 - HT6 receptor antagonist .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
In addition , the disrupted prepulse inhibition induced by d - amphetamine or phencyclidine was restored by 5 - HT6 receptor antagonist in an animal study using rats .
O O O O O O O O O B I I O B O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
These animal models were considered to reflect the positive symptoms of schizophrenia , and the above evidence suggests that altered 5 - HT6 receptors are involved in the pathophysiology of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
psychotic disorders .
O O O
The symptoms of methamphetamine ( METH ) - induced psychosis are similar to those of paranoid type schizophrenia .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , we conducted an analysis of the association of the 5 - HT6 gene ( HTR6 ) with METH - induced psychosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O B O O O O
METHOD :
O O
Using five tagging SNPs ( rs6693503 , rs1805054 , rs4912138 , rs3790757 and rs9659997 ) , we conducted a genetic association analysis of case - control samples ( 197
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METH - induced psychosis patients and 337 controls ) in the Japanese population .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The age and sex of the control subjects did not differ from those of the methamphetamine dependence patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
RESULTS :
O O
rs6693503 was associated with METH - induced psychosis patients in the allele / genotype - wise analysis .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Moreover , this association remained significant after Bonferroni correction .
O O O O O O O O O O
In the haplotype - wise analysis , we detected an association between two markers ( rs6693503 and rs1805054 ) and three markers ( rs6693503 , rs1805054 and rs4912138 ) in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
HTR6 and METH - induced psychosis patients , respectively .
O O B O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
HTR6 may play an important role in the pathophysiology of METH - induced psychosis in the Japanese population .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Effect of increasing intraperitoneal infusion rates on bupropion hydrochloride - induced seizures in mice .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : It is not known if there is a relationship between input rate and incidence of bupropion - induced seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
This is important , since different controlled release formulations of bupropion release the active drug at different rates .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We investigated the effect of varying the intraperitoneal infusion rates of bupropion HCl 120 mg / kg , a known convulsive dose 50 ( CD50 ) , on the incidence
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and severity of bupropion - induced convulsions in the Swiss albino mice .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
A total of 69 mice , approximately 7 weeks of age , and weighing 21 . 0 to 29 . 1 g were randomly assigned to bupropion HCl 120 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
/ kg treatment by intraperitoneal ( IP ) administration in 7 groups ( 9 to 10 animals per group ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bupropion HCl was infused through a surgically implanted IP dosing catheter with infusions in each group of 0 min , 15 min , 30 min , 60 min , 90
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
min , 120 min , and 240 min .
O O O O O O O O O
The number , time of onset , duration and the intensity of the convulsions or absence of convulsions were recorded .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The results showed that IP administration of bupropion HCl 120 mg / kg by bolus injection induced convulsions in 6 out of 10 mice ( 60 % of convulsing mice
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) in group 1 .
O O O O O
Logistic regression analysis revealed that infusion time was significant ( p = 0 . 0004 ; odds ratio = 0 . 974 ) and increasing the IP infusion time of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
bupropion HCl 120 mg / kg was associated with a 91 % reduced odds of convulsions at infusion times of 15 to 90 min compared to bolus injection .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Further increase in infusion time resulted in further reduction in the odds of convulsions to 99 . 8 % reduction at 240 min .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
In conclusion , the demonstration of an inverse relationship between infusion time of a fixed and convulsive dose of bupropion and the risk of convulsions in a prospective study is
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
novel .
O O
Detailed spectral profile analysis of penicillin - induced epileptiform activity in anesthetized rats .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Penicillin model is a widely used experimental model for epilepsy research .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
In the present study we aimed to portray a detailed spectral analysis of penicillin - induced epileptiform activity in comparison with basal brain activity in anesthetized Wistar rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Male Wistar rats were anesthetized with i . p .
O O O O O O O O O O
urethane and connected to an electrocorticogram setup .
B O O O O O O O
After a short period of basal activity recording , epileptic focus was induced by injecting 400IU / 2 microl penicillin - G potassium into the left lateral ventricle while the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O
cortical activity was continuously recorded .
O O O O O O
Basal activity , latent period and the penicillin - induced epileptiform activity periods were then analyzed using both conventional methods and spectral analysis .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Spectral analyses were conducted by dividing the whole spectrum into different frequency bands including delta , theta ( slow and fast ) , alpha - sigma , beta ( 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and 2 ) and gamma ( 1 and 2 ) bands .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our results show that the most affected frequency bands were delta , theta , beta - 2 and gamma - 2 bands during the epileptiform activity and there were marked
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
differences in terms of spectral densities between three investigated episodes ( basal activity , latent period and epileptiform activity ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our results may help to analyze novel data obtained using similar experimental models and the simple analysis method described here can be used in similar studies to investigate the basic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
neuronal mechanism of this or other types of experimental epilepsies .
O O O O O O O O O O O
High dose dexmedetomidine as the sole sedative for pediatric MRI .
O O B O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
This large - scale retrospective review evaluates the sedation profile of dexmedetomidine .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
AIM :
O O
To determine the hemodynamic responses , efficacy and adverse events associated with the use of high dose dexmedetomidine as the sole sedative for magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) studies
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Dexmedetomidine has been used at our institution since 2005 to provide sedation for pediatric radiological imaging studies .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Over time , an effective protocol utilizing high dose dexmedetomidine as the sole sedative agent has evolved .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
METHODS / MATERIALS :
O O O O
As part of the ongoing Quality Assurance process , data on all sedations are reviewed monthly and protocols modified as needed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Data were analyzed from all 747 consecutive patients who received dexmedetomidine for MRI sedation from April 2005 to April 2007 .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Since 2005 , the 10 - min loading dose of our dexmedetomidine protocol increased from 2 to 3 microg . kg ( - 1 ) , and the infusion rate
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
increased from 1 to 1 . 5 to 2 microg . kg ( - 1 ) . h ( - 1 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The current sedation protocol progressively increased the rate of successful sedation ( able to complete the imaging study ) when using dexmedetomidine alone from 91 . 8 % to 97
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
. 6 % ( P = 0 . 009 ) , reducing the requirement for adjuvant pentobarbital in the event of sedation failure with dexmedetomidine alone and decreased the mean
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O
recovery time by 10 min ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although dexmedetomidine sedation was associated with a 16 % incidence of bradycardia , all concomitant mean arterial blood pressures were within 20 % of age - adjusted normal range and
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
oxygen saturations were 95 % or higher .
B O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Dexmedetomidine in high doses provides adequate sedation for pediatric MRI studies .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
While use of high dose dexmedetomidine is associated with decreases in heart rate and blood pressure outside the established ' awake ' norms , this deviation is generally within 20
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% of norms , and is not associated with adverse sequelae .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dexmedetomidine is useful as the sole sedative for pediatric MRI .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Methamphetamine causes alterations in the MAP kinase - related pathways in the brains of mice that display increased aggressiveness .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Aggressive behaviors have been reported in patients who suffer from some psychiatric disorders , and are common in methamphetamine ( METH ) abusers .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
Herein , we report that multiple ( but not single ) injections of METH significantly increased aggressiveness in male CD - 1 mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
This increase in aggressiveness was not secondary to METH - induced hyperactivity .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Analysis of protein expression using antibody microarrays and Western blotting revealed differential changes in MAP kinase - related pathways after multiple and single METH injections .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
There were statistically significant ( p < 0 . 05 ) decreases in MEK1 , Erk2p , GSK3alpha , 14 - 3 - 3e , and MEK7 in the striata
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of mice after multiple injections of METH .
O O O O O O B O
MEK1 was significantly decreased also after a single injection of METH , but to a much lesser degree than after multiple injections of METH .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
In the frontal cortex , there was a statistically significant decrease in GSK3alpha after multiple ( but not single ) injections of METH .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
These findings suggest that alterations in MAP kinase - related pathways in the prefronto - striatal circuitries might be involved in the manifestation of aggressive behaviors in mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lamotrigine associated with exacerbation or de novo myoclonus in idiopathic generalized epilepsies .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Five patients with idiopathic generalized epilepsies ( IGE ) treated with lamotrigine ( LTG ) experienced exacerbation or de novo appearance of myoclonic jerks ( MJ ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In three patients , LTG exacerbated MJ in a dose - dependent manner with early aggravation during titration .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MJ disappeared when LTG dose was decreased by 25 to 50 % .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
In two patients , LTG exacerbated MJ in a delayed but more severe manner , with myoclonic status that only ceased after LTG withdrawal .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
rTMS of supplementary motor area modulates therapy - induced dyskinesias in Parkinson disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The neural mechanisms and circuitry involved in levodopa - induced dyskinesia are unclear .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Using repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation ( rTMS ) over the supplementary motor area ( SMA ) in a group of patients with advanced Parkinson disease , the authors investigated whether
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
modulation of SMA excitability may result in a modification of a dyskinetic state induced by continuous apomorphine infusion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
rTMS at 1 Hz was observed to markedly reduce drug - induced dyskinesias , whereas 5 - Hz rTMS induced a slight but not significant increase .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Assessment of the onset and persistence of amnesia during procedural sedation with propofol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
To assess patients ' ability to repeat and recall words presented to them while undergoing procedural sedation with propofol , and correlate their recall with their level of awareness as
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
measured by bispectral index ( BIS ) monitoring .
O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
This was a prospective , single - intervention study of consenting adult patients undergoing procedural sedation with propofol between December 28 , 2002 , and October 31 , 2003 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
BIS monitoring was initiated starting 3 minutes before the procedure and continuing until the patient had regained baseline mental status .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At 1 - minute intervals during the procedural sedation , until the patient regained baseline mental status at the end of the procedure , a word from a standardized list
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
was read aloud , and the patient was asked to immediately repeat the word to the investigator .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The BIS score at the time the word was read and the patient 's ability to repeat the word were recorded .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After the procedure , the patient was asked to state all of the words from the list that he or she could recall , and to identify the last word
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
recalled from prior to the start of the procedure and the first word recalled from after the procedure was completed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Seventy - five consenting patients were enrolled ; one patient was excluded from data analysis for a protocol violation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No serious adverse events were noted during the procedural sedations .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean ( + / - standard deviation ) time of data collection was 16 . 4 minutes ( + / - 7 . 1 ; range 5 to 34
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
minutes ) .
O O O
The mean initial ( preprocedure ) BIS score was 97 . 1 ( + / - 2 . 3 ; range 92 to 99 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean lowest BIS score occurring during these procedural sedations was 66 . 9 ( + / - 14 . 4 ; range 33 to 91 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean lowest BIS score corresponding to the ability of the patient to immediately repeat words read from the list was 77 . 1 ( 95 % CI = 74
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 3 to 80 . 0 ) .
O O O O O O O O
The mean highest BIS score corresponding to the inability to repeat words was 81 . 5 ( 95 % CI = 78 . 1 to 84 . 8 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean BIS score corresponding to the last word recalled from prior to the initiation of the sedation was 96 . 7 ( + / - 2 . 4 ;
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
range 84 to 98 ) .
O O O O O O
The mean BIS score corresponding to the first word recalled after the procedure was completed was 91 . 2 ( 95 % CI = 88 . 1 to 94 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
3 ) .
O O O
All patients recalled at least one word that had been read to them during the protocol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean lowest BIS score for any recalled word was 91 . 5 ( + / - 11 . 1 ; range 79 to 98 ) , and no words
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
were recalled when the corresponding BIS score was less than 90 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
There is a range of BIS scores during which sedated patients are able to repeat words read to them but are not able to subsequently recall these words .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , patients had no recall of words repeated prior to procedural sedation in BIS ranges associated with recall after procedural sedation , suggestive of retrograde amnesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Assessment of perinatal hepatitis B and rubella prevention in New Hampshire delivery hospitals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To evaluate current performance on recommended perinatal hepatitis B and rubella prevention practices in New Hampshire .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Data were extracted from 2021 paired mother - infant records for the year 2000 birth cohort in New Hampshire 's 25 delivery hospitals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Assessment was done on the following : prenatal screening for hepatitis B and rubella , administration of the hepatitis B vaccine birth dose to all infants , administration of hepatitis
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
B immune globulin to infants who were born to hepatitis B surface antigen - positive mothers , rubella immunity , and administration of in - hospital postpartum rubella vaccine to
O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rubella nonimmune women .
O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Prenatal screening rates for hepatitis B ( 98 . 8 % ) and rubella ( 99 . 4 % ) were high .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hepatitis B vaccine birth dose was administered to 76 . 2 % of all infants .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All infants who were born to hepatitis B surface antigen - positive mothers also received hepatitis B immune globulin .
O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O
Multivariate logistic regression showed that the month of delivery and infant birth weight were independent predictors of hepatitis B vaccination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The proportion of infants who were vaccinated in January and February 2000 ( 48 . 5 % and 67 . 5 % , respectively ) was less than any other
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
months , whereas the proportion who were vaccinated in December 2000 ( 88 . 2 % ) was the highest .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Women who were born between 1971 and 1975 had the highest rate of rubella nonimmunity ( 9 . 5 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In - hospital postpartum rubella vaccine administration was documented for 75 . 6 % of nonimmune women .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
This study documents good compliance in New Hampshire 's birthing hospitals with national guidelines for perinatal hepatitis B and rubella prevention and highlights potential areas for improvement .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Expression of p300 protects cardiac myocytes from apoptosis in vivo .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Doxorubicin is an anti - tumor agent that represses cardiac - specific gene expression and induces myocardial cell apoptosis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Doxorubicin depletes cardiac p300 , a transcriptional coactivator that is required for the maintenance of the differentiated phenotype of cardiac myocytes .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , the role of p300 in protection against doxorubicin - induced apoptosis is unknown .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Transgenic mice overexpressing p300 in the heart and wild - type mice were subjected to doxorubicin treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Compared with wild - type mice , transgenic mice exhibited higher survival rate as well as more preserved left ventricular function and cardiac expression of alpha - sarcomeric actin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Doxorubicin induced myocardial cell apoptosis in wild - type mice but not in transgenic mice .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Expression of p300 increased the cardiac level of bcl - 2 and mdm - 2 , but not that of p53 or other members of the bcl - 2 family
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
These findings demonstrate that overexpression of p300 protects cardiac myocytes from doxorubicin - induced apoptosis and reduces the extent of acute heart failure in adult mice in vivo .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mitochondrial DNA and its respiratory chain products are defective in doxorubicin nephrosis .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Doxorubicin induces a self - perpetuating nephropathy characterized by early glomerular and late - onset tubular lesions in rats .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We investigated the potential role of mitochondrial injury in the onset of these lesions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Rats were treated with intravenous doxorubicin ( 1 mg kg ( - 1 ) week ( - 1 ) ) for 7 weeks and were sacrificed either 1 week (
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
' short - term ' ) or 30 weeks ( ' long - term ' ) following the last dose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Additional rats received a single dose either 6 days or 2 h prior to euthanasia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All rats were killed at 48 weeks of age .
O O O O O O O O O O
Glomerular and tubular injury was monitored and correlated to the activity or expression of respiratory chain components .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Finally , we quantified both nuclear and mitochondrial DNA ( mtDNA ) as well as superoxide production and the 4834 base pair ' common ' mtDNA deletion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The ' long - term ' group had significant glomerular and tubular lesions , depressed activities of mtDNA - encoded NADH dehydrogenase and cytochrome - c oxidase ( COX )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and increased citrate synthase activity .
O O B O O O
In addition , expression of the mtDNA - encoded COX subunit I was reduced and mtDNA levels were decreased .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In ' short - term ' rats , there were fewer tubular lesions , but similar numbers of glomerular lesions activity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Among all animals , glomerular and tubular injury were inversely correlated with mtDNA levels , mtDNA - encoded respiratory chain activities and with the expression of the mtDNA - encoded
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
respiratory chain subunit COX - I . Injury was positively correlated with superoxide production and the activities of nucleus - encoded mitochondrial or cytoplasmic enzymes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Kidneys from the ' long - term ' group showed more mtDNA deletions than in ' short - term ' animals and these were not observed in the other groups
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
These results suggest an important role for quantitative and qualitative mtDNA alterations through the reduction of mtDNA - encoded respiratory chain function and induction of superoxide in doxorubicin - induced
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
renal lesions .
O O O
Amphotericin B - induced seizures in a patient with AIDS .
B I O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To report a case of multiple episodes of seizure activity in an AIDS patent following amphotericin B infusion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
CASE SUMMARY :
O O O
A 46 - year - old African - American man experienced recurrent grand mal seizures during intravenous infusion of amphotericin B , then petit mal seizures as the infusion was
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O
stopped and the drug concentrations decreased with time .
O O O O O O O O O
The patients concurrent medications included didanosine , hydroxyzine , promethazine , hydrocortisone , and prochlorperazine .
O O O O O B O B O B O B O O B O
Despite administration of phenytoin and lorazepam , the seizures persisted and occurred only during amphotercin B administration .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O B I O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
AIDS and cryptococcal meningitis , both of which the patient had , can potentially cause seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient had a history of alcohol abuse ; alcohol intake as well as withdrawal can also cause seizures .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Didanosine also has a potential for inducing seizures .
B O O O O O O O O
However , these other potential causes of seizure were ruled out .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The time course of events suggested that amphotericin B was the cause of the seizures in this AIDS patient .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Amphotericin B seems to be the probable cause of the seizures .
B I O O O O O O O O O O
To date , only three cases of seizures associated with amphotericin B have been reported in the literature , but healthcare providers should be aware of the potential for this
O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rare adverse effect .
O O O O
Therapeutic drug monitoring of tobramycin : once - daily versus twice - daily dosage schedules .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : To evaluate the effect of dosage regimen ( once - daily vs . twice - daily ) of tobramicyn on steady - state serum concentrations and toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
MATERIALS AND METHODS :
O O O O
Patients undergoing treatment with i . v .
O O O O O O O O
tobramycin ( 4 mg / kg / day ) were randomised to two groups .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Group OD ( n = 22 ) received a once - daily dose of tobramycin and group TD ( n = 21 ) received the same dose divided into two
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
doses daily .
O O O
Tobramycin serum concentrations ( peak and trough ) were measured by enzyme multiplied immunoassay .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The renal and auditory functions of the patients were monitored before , during and immediately after treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The two groups were comparable with respect to sex , age , body weight and renal function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No statistically significant differences were found in mean daily dose , duration of treatment , or cumulative dose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Trough concentrations were < 2 g / ml in the two groups ( 100 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Peak concentrations were > 6 microg / ml in 100 % of the OD group and in 67 % of the TD group ( P < 0 . 01 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Mean peak concentrations were markedly different :
O O O O O O O
11 . 00 + / - 2 . 89 microg / ml in OD vs . 6 . 53 + / - 1 . 45 microg / ml in TD
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( P < 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O
The pharmacokinetics parameters were : Ke , ( 0 . 15 + / - 0 . 03 / h in OD vs . 0 . 24 + / - 0
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 06 / h in TD ) , t1 / 2 , ( 4 . 95 + / - 1 . 41 h in OD vs . 3 . 07
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
+ / - 0 . 71 h in TD ) , Vd ( 0 . 35 + / - 0 . 11 l / kg in OD vs . 0
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 33 + / - 0 . 09 l / kg in TD ) , Cl ( 0 . 86 + / - 0 . 29 ml / min /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
kg in OD vs . 1 . 28 + / - 0 . 33 ml / min / kg in TD ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Increased serum creatinine was observed in 73 % of patients in OD versus 57 % of patients in TD , without evidence of nephrotoxicity .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In TD group , three patients developed decreased auditory function , of which one presented with an auditory loss of - 30 dB , whereas in the OD group only
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
one patient presented decreased auditory function .
O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
This small study suggests that a once - daily dosing regimen of tobramycin is at least as effective as and is no more and possibly less toxic than the twice
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- daily regimen .
O O O O
Using a single - dose therapy , peak concentration determination is not necessary , only trough samples should be monitored to ensure levels below 2 microg / ml .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Chronic effects of a novel synthetic anthracycline derivative ( SM - 5887 ) on normal heart and doxorubicin - induced cardiomyopathy in beagle dogs .
O O O O O O B O O B I I O O O O O B O O O O O O O
This study was designed to investigate the chronic cardiotoxic potential of SM - 5887 and a possible deteriorating effect of SM - 5887 on low - grade cardiotoxicity pre -
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O
induced by doxorubicin in beagle dogs .
O O B O O O O
In the chronic treatment , beagle dogs of each sex were given intravenously once every 3 weeks , either a sublethal dose of doxorubicin ( 1 . 5 mg /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
kg ) or SM - 5887 ( 2 . 5 mg / kg ) .
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O
The experiment was terminated 3 weeks after the ninth dosing .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Animals which received over six courses of doxorubicin demonstrated the electrocardiogram ( ECG ) changes , decrease of blood pressure and high - grade histopathological cardiomyopathy , while animals which
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
were terminally sacrificed after the SM - 5887 administration did not show any changes in ECG , blood pressure and histopathological examinations .
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To examine a possibly deteriorating cardiotoxic effect of SM - 5887 , low - grade cardiomyopathy was induced in dogs by four courses of doxorubicin ( 1 . 5 mg
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
/ kg ) .
O O O O
Nine weeks after pre - treatment , dogs were given four courses of either doxorubicin ( 1 . 5 mg / kg ) or SM - 5887 ( 2 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O
5 mg / kg ) once every 3 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O
The low - grade cardiotoxic changes were enhanced by the additional doxorubicin treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
On the contrary , the SM - 5887 treatment did not progress the grade of cardiomyopathy .
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion , SM - 5887 does not have any potential of chronic cardiotoxicity and deteriorating effect on doxorubicin - induced cardiotoxicity in dogs .
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Posteroventral medial pallidotomy in advanced Parkinson 's disease .
O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : Posteroventral medial pallidotomy sometimes produces striking improvement in patients with advanced Parkinson 's disease , but the studies to date have involved small numbers of patients and short
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- term follow - up .
O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Forty patients with Parkinson 's disease underwent serial , detailed assessments both after drug withdrawal ( """" off """" period ) and while taking their optimal medical regimens ( """"
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
on """" period ) .
O O O O O
All patients were examined preoperatively and 39 were examined at six months ; 27 of the patients were also examined at one year , and 11 at two years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
