The percent improvements at six months were as follows : off - period score for overall motor function , 28 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 19 to 38
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
percent ) , with most of the improvement in the contralateral limbs ; off - period score for activities of daily living , 29 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, 19 to 39 percent ) ; on - period score for contralateral dyskinesias , 82 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 72 to 91 percent ) ; and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
on - period score for ipsilateral dyskinesias , 44 percent ( 95 percent confidence interval , 29 to 59 percent ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The improvements in dyskinesias and the total scores for off - period parkinsonism , contralateral bradykinesia , and rigidity were sustained in the 11 patients examined at two years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The improvement in ipsilateral dyskinesias was lost after one year , and the improvements in postural stability and gait lasted only three to six months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Approximately half the patients who had been dependent on assistance in activities of daily living in the off period before surgery became independent after surgery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The complications of surgery were generally well tolerated , and there were no significant changes in the use of medication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
In late - stage Parkinson 's disease , pallidotomy significantly reduces levodopa - induced dyskinesias and off - period disability .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Much of the benefit is sustained at two years , although some improvements , such as those on the ipsilateral side and in axial symptoms , wane within the first
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
year .
O O
The on - period symptoms that are resistant to dopaminergic therapy do not respond to pallidotomy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neuropeptide - Y immunoreactivity in the pilocarpine model of temporal lobe epilepsy .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Neuropeptide - Y ( NPY ) is expressed by granule cells and mossy fibres of the hippocampal dentate gyrus during experimental temporal lobe epilepsy ( TLE ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This expression may represent an endogenous damping mechanism since NPY has been shown to block seizure - like events following high - frequency stimulation in hippocampal slices .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The pilocarpine ( PILO ) model of epilepsy is characterized by an acute period of status epilepticus followed by spontaneous recurrent seizures and related brain damage .
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report peroxidase - antiperoxidase immunostaining for NPY in several brain regions in this model .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PILO - injected animals exhibited NPY immunoreactivity in the region of the mossy fibre terminals , in the dentate gyrus inner molecular layer and , in a few cases ,
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
within presumed granule cells .
O O O O O
NPY immunoreactivity was also dramatically changed in the entorhinal cortex , amygdala and sensorimotor areas .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , PILO injected animals exhibited a reduction in the number of NPY - immunoreactive interneurons compared with controls .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results demonstrate that changes in NPY expression , including expression in the granule cells and mossy fibres and the loss of vulnerable NPY neurons , are present in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PILO model of TLE .
B O O O O
However , the significance of this changed synthesis of NPY remains to be determined .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of myopic excimer laser photorefractive keratectomy on the electrophysiologic function of the retina and optic nerve .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
To assess by electrophysiologic testing the effect of photorefractive keratectomy ( PRK ) on the retina and optic nerve .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
SETTING :
O O
Eye Clinic , S . Salvatore Hospital , L'Aquila University , Italy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Standard pattern electroretinograms ( P - ERGs ) and standard pattern visual evoked potentials ( P - VEPs ) were done in 25 eyes of 25 patients who had myopic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PRK for an attempted correction between 5 . 00 and 15 . 00 diopters ( D ) ( mean 8 . 00 D ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Testing was done preoperatively and 3 , 6 , 12 , and 18 months postoperatively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The contralateral eyes served as controls .
O O O O O O O
During the follow - up , 3 patients ( 12 % ) developed steroid - induced elevated intraocular pressure ( IOP ) that resolved after corticosteroid therapy was discontinued .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
No statistically significant differences were seen between treated and control eyes nor between treated eyes preoperatively and postoperatively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Myopic excimer laser PRK did not seem to affect the posterior segment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The transient steroid - induced IOP rise did not seem to cause functional impairment .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Liposomal daunorubicin in advanced Kaposi 's sarcoma : a phase II study .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O
We report a non - randomized Phase II clinical trial to assess the efficacy and safety of liposomal daunorubicin ( DaunoXome ) in the treatment of AIDS related Kaposi 's
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
sarcoma .
O O
Eleven homosexual men with advanced Kaposi 's sarcoma were entered in the trial .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Changes in size , colour and associated oedema of selected ' target ' lesions were measured .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical , biochemical and haematological toxicities were assessed .
O O O O O O O O O
Ten subjects were evaluated .
O O O O O
A partial response was achieved in four , of whom two subsequently relapsed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Stabilization of Kaposi 's sarcoma occurred in the remaining six , maintained until the end of the trial period in four .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The drug was generally well tolerated , with few mild symptoms of toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The main problem encountered was haematological toxicity , with three subjects experiencing severe neutropenia ( neutrophil count < 0 . 5 x 10 ( 9 ) / l ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was no evidence of cardiotoxicity .
O O O O O O O
In this small patient sample , liposomal daunorubicin was an effective and well tolerated agent in the treatment of Kaposi 's sarcoma .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Failure of ancrod in the treatment of heparin - induced arterial thrombosis .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
The morbidity and mortality associated with heparin - induced thrombosis remain high despite numerous empirical therapies .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Ancrod has been used successfully for prophylaxis against development of thrombosis in patients with heparin induced platelet aggregation who require brief reexposure to heparin , but its success in patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
who have developed the thrombosis syndrome is not well defined .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The authors present a case of failure of ancrod treatment in a patient with heparin - induced thrombosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Seizure after flumazenil administration in a pediatric patient .
O O B O O O O O O
Flumazenil is a benzodiazepine receptor antagonist used to reverse sedation and respiratory depression induced by benzodiazepines .
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Seizures and cardiac arrhythmias have complicated its use in adult patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Overdose patients who have coingested tricyclic antidepressants have a higher risk of these complications .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Little information exists concerning adverse effects of flumazenil in children .
O O O O O O O B O O O
We report the occurrence of a generalized tonic - clonic seizure in a pediatric patient following the administration of flumazenil .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Remodelling of nerve structure in experimental isoniazid neuropathy in the rat .
O O O O O O B O O O O O
The neuropathy caused by a single dose of isoniazid in rats was studied with a computer - assisted morphometric method .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Scatter diagrams of the g ratio ( quotient fibre diameter / axon diameter ) define regenerating fibres as a distinct population , distinguishable from the surviving fibres by reduced sheath
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
thickness and reduced axon calibre .
O O O O O O
There was also evidence of a subtle direct toxic effect on the entire fibre population , causing axon shrinkage masked by readjustment of the myelin sheath .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Selective injection of iopentol , iohexol and metrizoate into the left coronary artery of the dog .
O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O
Induction of ventricular fibrillation and decrease of aortic pressure .
O O O O O O O O O O
In twenty beagle dogs selective injections were made into the left coronary artery with iopentol , iohexol and metrizoate in doses of 4 ml , 8 ml and 16 ml
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Thirty - six iopentol injections , 35 iohexol injections and 37 metrizoate injections were made .
O O O B O O O B O O O B O O O O
Frequencies of ventricular fibrillation were significantly lower ( p less than 0 . 05 ) after iopentol ( 0 % ) and iohexol ( 3 % ) than after
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O
metrizoate ( 22 % ) .
B O O O O O
Iopentol and iohexol also produced significantly less decrease in aortic blood pressure than metrizoate at the different doses .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Magnetic resonance imaging of cerebral venous thrombosis secondary to """" low - dose """" birth control pills .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The clinical and radiographic features of cerebral deep venous thrombosis in a 21 - year - old white woman are presented .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This nulliparous patient presented with relatively mild clinical symptoms and progressing mental status changes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The only known risk factor was """" low - dose """" oral contraceptive pills .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
The magnetic resonance image ( MRI ) showed increased signal intensity from the internal cerebral veins , vein of Galen , and straight sinus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The diagnosis was confirmed by arterial angiography .
O O O O O O O O
Relation of perfusion defects observed with myocardial contrast echocardiography to the severity of coronary stenosis : correlation with thallium - 201 single - photon emission tomography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
It has been previously shown that myocardial contrast echocardiography is a valuable technique for delineating regions of myocardial underperfusion secondary to coronary occlusion and to critical coronary stenoses in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
presence of hyperemic stimulation .
O O O O O
The aim of this study was to determine whether myocardial contrast echocardiography performed with a stable solution of sonicated albumin could detect regions of myocardial underperfusion resulting from various degrees
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of coronary stenosis .
O O O O
The perfusion defect produced in 16 open chest dogs was compared with the anatomic area at risk measured by the postmortem dual - perfusion technique and with thallium - 201
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
single - photon emission tomography ( SPECT ) .
O O O O O O O O O
During a transient ( 20 - s ) coronary occlusion , a perfusion defect was observed with contrast echocardiography in 14 of the 15 dogs in which the occlusion was
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
produced .
O O
The perfusion defect correlated significantly with the anatomic area at risk ( r = 0 . 74 ; p less than 0 . 002 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
During dipyridamole - induced hyperemia , 12 of the 16 dogs with a partial coronary stenosis had a visible area of hypoperfusion by contrast echocardiography .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The four dogs without a perfusion defect had a stenosis that resulted in a mild ( 0 % to 50 % ) reduction in dipyridamole - induced hyperemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The size of the perfusion defect during stenosis correlated significantly with the anatomic area at risk ( r = 0 . 61 ; p = 0 . 02 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thallium - 201 SPECT demonstrated a perfusion defect in all 14 dogs analyzed during dipyridamole - induced hyperemia ; the size of the perfusion defect correlated with the anatomic area
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
at risk ( r = 0 . 58 ; p less than 0 . 03 ) and with the perfusion defect by contrast echocardiography ( r = 0 . 58
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
; p less than 0 . 03 ) .
O O O O O O O O O
Thus , myocardial contrast echocardiography can be used to visualize and quantitate the amount of jeopardized myocardium during moderate to severe degrees of coronary stenosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results obtained show a correlation with the anatomic area at risk similar to that obtained with thallium - 201 SPECT .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Potential deleterious effect of furosemide in radiocontrast nephropathy .
O O O O B O O O O
The purpose of the study was to determine the efficacy of furosemide in addition to intravenous fluids in the prevention of radiocontrast nephropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
18 patients , referred to a radiocontrast study , considered at risk because of preexisting renal insufficiency , were enrolled in a prospective , randomized , controlled trial , performed
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
at the secondary care center of a 1 , 100 - bed private university hospital .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition to fluids , the treatment group received furosemide ( mean dose 110 mg ) intravenously 30 min prior to the injection of contrast material .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The control group received fluids ( mean 3 liters ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Radiological studies were mostly angiographies performed with both ionic and non - ionic contrast material , at an average dose of 245 ml .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal function significantly deteriorated in the group pretreated with furosemide ( p < 0 . 005 by ANOVA ) , with a rise in serum creatinine from 145 + /
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
-
O
13 to 182 + / -
O O O O O O
16 mumol / l at 24 h , while no change occurred in the control group ( from 141 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
6 to 142 + / -
O O O O O O
7 mumol / l ) .
O O O O O O
Renal failure was associated with weight loss in the furosemide - treated group .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Furosemide may be deleterious in the prevention of radiocontrast nephropathy .
B O O O O O O O O O O
The renal pathology in a case of lithium - induced diabetes insipidus .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
A case of lithium - induced diabetes insipidus is reported .
O O O B O O O O O O O
At necropsy microscopy shoed unique and extensive damage to cells lining the distal nephron .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is suggested that these changes represent a specific toxic effect of lithium , reported here for the first time in man .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Etiologic factors in the pathogenesis of liver tumors associated with oral contraceptives .
O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Within the last several years , previously rare liver tumors have been seen in young women using oral contraceptive steroids .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I B O
The Registry for Liver Tumors Associated with Oral Contraceptives at the University of California , Irvine , has clearly identified 27 cases .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The recent literature contains 44 case reports .
O O O O O O O O
Common to these 71 cases has been a histopathologic diagnosis of focal nodular hyperplasia , adenoma , hamartoma , and hepatoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Significant statistical etiologic factors include prolonged uninterrupted usage of oral contraceptive steroids .
O O O O O O O O O B I B O
Eight deaths and liver rupture in 18 patients attest to the seriousness of this new potentially lethal adverse phenomenon .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Graft - versus - host disease prophylaxis with everolimus and tacrolimus is associated with a high incidence of sinusoidal obstruction syndrome and microangiopathy : results of the EVTAC trial .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A calcineurin inhibitor combined with methotrexate is the standard prophylaxis for graft - versus - host disease ( GVHD ) after allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation ( HSCT ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Everolimus , a derivative of sirolimus , seems to mediate antileukemia effects .
B O O O O B O O O O O O O
We report on a combination of everolimus and tacrolimus in 24 patients ( median age , 62 years ) with either myelodysplastic syndrome ( MDS ; n = 17 )
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
or acute myeloid leukemia ( AML ; n = 7 ) undergoing intensive conditioning followed by HSCT from related ( n = 4 ) or unrelated ( n = 20
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) donors .
O O O
All patients engrafted , and only 1 patient experienced grade IV mucositis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nine patients ( 37 % ) developed acute grade II - IV GVHD , and 11 of 17 evaluable patients ( 64 % ) developed chronic extensive GVHD .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Transplantation - associated microangiopathy ( TMA ) occurred in 7 patients ( 29 % ) , with 2 cases of acute renal failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The study was terminated prematurely because an additional 6 patients ( 25 % ) developed sinusoidal obstruction syndrome ( SOS ) , which was fatal in 2 cases .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
With a median follow - up of 26 months , the 2 - year overall survival rate was 47 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although this new combination appears to be effective as a prophylactic regimen for acute GVHD , the incidence of TMA and SOS is considerably higher than seen with other regimens
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Effect of some convulsants on the protective activity of loreclezole and its combinations with valproate or clonazepam in amygdala - kindled rats .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O B O O O O O O
Loreclezole ( 5 mg / kg ) exerted a significant protective action in amygdala - kindled rats , reducing both seizure and afterdischarge durations .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The combinations of loreclezole ( 2 . 5 mg / kg ) with valproate , clonazepam , or carbamazepine ( applied at their subprotective doses ) also exhibited antiseizure effect
O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
in this test .
O O O O
However , only two first combinations occurred to be of pharmacodynamic nature .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Among several chemoconvulsants , bicuculline , N - methyl - D - aspartic acid and BAY k - 8644 ( the opener of L - type calcium channels ) reversed
O O O O B O B I I I I I I I O B I I I O O O O O O O B O O O
the protective activity of loreclezole alone and its combination with valproate .
O O O O B O O O O O B O
On the other hand , bicuculline , aminophylline and BAY k - 8644 inhibited the anticonvulsive action of loreclezole combined with clonazepam .
O O O O O B O B O B I I I O O O O O B O O B O
The results support the hypothesis that the protective activity of loreclezole and its combinations with other antiepileptics may involve potentiation of GABAergic neurotransmission and blockade of L - type of
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
calcium channels .
B O O
Acute liver failure with concurrent bupropion and carbimazole therapy .
O O O O O B O B O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To report a case of fatal liver failure possibly associated with concurrent use of bupropion and carbimazole .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
CASE SUMMARY :
O O O
A 41 - year - old Chinese man with a history of hyperthyroidism had been treated with carbimazole and propranolol for the past 5 years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
He received a 10 - day course of bupropion as an aid for smoking cessation 10 weeks prior to presentation .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
He developed acute liver failure with rapid deterioration of renal function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Liver biopsy showed evidence of nonspecific drug - induced acute liver injury .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
His condition was further complicated by sepsis and coagulopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O
Death resulted 19 days after the onset of symptoms .
O O O O O O O O O O
The likelihood that bupropion induced hepatotoxicity in our patient was possible , based on the Naranjo probability scale .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
Although there is increasing evidence of hepatotoxicity induced by bupropion , this is the first case of fatality that could have resulted from acute liver failure in a patient receiving
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
bupropion while on concomitant treatment with carbimazole .
B O O O O O B O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Clinicians should be aware of the possibility of acute liver insult induced by bupropion given concurrently with other hepatotoxic drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Long term hormone therapy for perimenopausal and postmenopausal women .
O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Hormone therapy ( HT ) is widely used for controlling menopausal symptoms and has also been used for the management and prevention of cardiovascular disease , osteoporosis and dementia in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
older women .
O O O
This is an updated version of the original Cochrane review first published in 2005 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
To assess the effect of long - term HT on mortality , cardiovascular outcomes , cancer , gallbladder disease , cognition , fractures and quality of life .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
SEARCH STRATEGY :
O O O
We searched the following databases to November 2007 : Trials Register of the Cochrane Menstrual Disorders and Subfertility Group , Cochrane Central Register of Controlled Trials , MEDLINE , EMBASE
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, Biological Abstracts .
O O O O
Also relevant non - indexed journals and conference abstracts .
O O O O O O O O O O
SELECTION CRITERIA :
O O O
Randomised double - blind trials of HT versus placebo , taken for at least one year by perimenopausal or postmenopausal women .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
HT included oestrogens , with or without progestogens , via oral , transdermal , subcutaneous or transnasal routes .
O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS :
O O O O O
Two authors independently assessed trial quality and extracted data .
O O O O O O O O O O
MAIN RESULTS :
O O O
Nineteen trials involving 41 , 904 women were included .
O O O O O O O O O O
In relatively healthy women , combined continuous HT significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism or coronary event ( after one year 's use ) , stroke (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
after three years ) , breast cancer and gallbladder disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Long - term oestrogen - only HT significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism , stroke and gallbladder disease ( after one to two years , three years
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and seven years ' use respectively ) , but did not significantly increase the risk of breast cancer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The only statistically significant benefits of HT were a decreased incidence of fractures and ( for combined HT ) colon cancer , with long - term use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Among women aged over 65 who were relatively healthy ( i . e . generally fit , without overt disease ) and taking continuous combined HT , there was a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
statistically significant increase in the incidence of dementia .
O O O O O O O O O
Among women with cardiovascular disease , long - term use of combined continuous HT significantly increased the risk of venous thrombo - embolism .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One trial analysed subgroups of 2839 relatively healthy 50 to 59 year old women taking combined continuous HT and 1637 taking oestrogen - only HT , versus similar - sized
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
placebo groups .
O O O
The only significantly increased risk reported was for venous thrombo - embolism in women taking combined continuous HT : their absolute risk remained low , at less than 1 /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
500 .
O O
However , this study was not powered to detect differences between groups of younger women .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
AUTHORS ' CONCLUSIONS :
O O O O
HT is not indicated for the routine management of chronic disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
We need more evidence on the safety of HT for menopausal symptom control , though short - term use appears to be relatively safe for healthy younger women .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Passage of mannitol into the brain around gliomas : a potential cause of rebound phenomenon .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A study on 21 patients .
O O O O O O
AIM :
O O
Widespread use of mannitol to reduce brain edema and lower elevated ICP in brain tumor patients continues to be afflicted by the so - called rebound phenomenon .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Leakage of mannitol into the brain parenchyma through an altered BBB and secondary reversal of osmotic gradient is considered the major cause of rebound .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This has only been demonstrated experimentally in animals .
O O O O O O O O O
As a contribution to this issue we decided to research the possible passage of mannitol into the brain after administration to 21 brain tumor patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS : Mannitol ( 18 % solution ; 1 g / kg ) was administered as a bolus to patients ( ten had malignant glioma , seven brain metastases and
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
four meningioma ) about 30 minutes before craniotomy .
O O O O O O O O O
During resection , a sample of the surrounding edematous white matter was taken at the same time as a 10 ml venous blood sample .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mannitol concentrations were measured in plasma and white matter by a modified version of the enzyme assay of Blonquist et al .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
In most glioma patients , mannitol concentrations in white matter were 2 to 6 times higher than in plasma ( mean 3 . 5 times ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In meningioma and metastases patients plasma concentrations of mannitol were higher than white matter concentrations except in three cases with infiltration by neoplastic cells .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The results of our study show that even after a single bolus , mannitol may leak through the altered BBB near gliomas , reversing the initial plasma - to -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
blood osmotic gradient , aggravating peritumoral edema and promoting rebound of ICP .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Can lidocaine reduce succinylcholine induced postoperative myalgia ?
O B O B O O O O
This study was undertaken to determine the effect of lidocaine pretreatment on reduction of succinylcholine - induced myalgia in patients undergoing general anesthesia for gynecological surgery .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
One hundred and thirty - five patients were assigned to one of three groups in a prospective , double blind , randomized manner .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Group PS , the control group , received normal saline and succinylcholine 1 . 5 mg x kg ( - 1 ) ; Group LS , lidocaine 1 . 5
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
mg x kg ( - 1 ) and succinylcholine 1 . 5 mg x kg ( - 1 ) ; Group PR , normal saline and rocuronium 0 . 6
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
mg x kg ( - 1 ) .
O O O O O O O O
Morphine 0 . 1
B O O O
mg x kg ( - 1 )
O O O O O O O
iv was given for premedication and all patients were monitored with a noninvasive blood pressure monitor , ECG and pulse oximetry .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Anesthesia was induced with 5 mg . kg ( - 1 ) thiopental iv .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
followed by succinylcholine ( Group PS , LS ) or rocuronium ( Group PR ) for tracheal intubation .
O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Following administration of these agents , the presence , and degree of fasciculation were assessed visually on a four point scale by one investigator who was blinded to the drug
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
administered .
O O
The blood pressure and heart rate of each patient were monitored on nine occasions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Twenty - four hours later , any myalgia experienced was assessed according to a structured questionaire and graded by a four point scale by one investigator blinded to the intraoperative
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
management .
O O
The results indicate that muscle fasciculation was not found in Group PR while the patients in Group LS had a lower incidence of muscle fasciculation than those in Group PS
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( p < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O
At 24 h , the incidence of myalgia was higher in Group PS than in Group LS and PR ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A correlation was not found between the incidence of myalgia and the occurrence of muscle fasciculation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The changes in systolic and diastolic blood pressure and heart rate were not significant among the three groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion , where succinylcholine is used , lidocaine is proven to be the useful pretreatment agent for the reduction of postoperative myalgia .
O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Open - label assessment of levofloxacin for the treatment of acute bacterial sinusitis in adults .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
To evaluate the efficacy and safety of levofloxacin ( 500 mg orally once daily for 10 to 14 days ) in treating adult outpatients with acute bacterial sinusitis .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS AND METHODS :
O O O O
A total of 329 patients enrolled in the study at 24 centers .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All patients had a pre - therapy Gram 's stain and culture of sinus exudate obtained by antral puncture or nasal endoscopy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical response was assessed on the basis of signs and symptoms and sinus radiograph or computed tomography results .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Microbiologic cure rates were determined on the basis of presumed plus documented eradication of the pre - therapy pathogen ( s ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The most common pathogens were Haemophilus influenzae , Streptococcus pneumoniae , Staphylococcus aureus , and Moraxella catarrhalis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of 300 clinically evaluable patients , 175 ( 58 % ) were cured and 90 ( 30 % ) were improved at the post - therapy evaluation , resulting in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a clinical success rate of 88 % .
O O O O O O O O
Thirty - five patients ( 12 % ) clinically failed treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The microbiologic eradication rate ( presumed plus documented ) among 138 microbiologically evaluable patients was 92 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Microbiologic eradication rates ( presumed plus documented ) of the most common pathogens ranged from 93 % ( M . catarrhalis ) to 100 % ( S . pneumoniae )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
at the post - therapy visit .
O O O O O O O
All but one of the 265 patients who were cured or improved at post - therapy returned for a long - term follow - up visit ; 243 ( 92
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% ) remained well 4 to 6 weeks after therapy ; and 21 ( 8 % ) had a relapse of symptoms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adverse events considered to be related to levofloxacin administration were reported by 29 patients ( 9 % ) .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The most common drug - related adverse events were diarrhea , flatulence , and nausea ; most adverse events were mild to moderate in severity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
The results of this study indicate that levofloxacin 500 mg once daily is an effective and safe treatment for acute bacterial sinusitis .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical evaluation on combined administration of oral prostacyclin analogue beraprost and phosphodiesterase inhibitor cilostazol .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O B O
Among various oral antiplatelets , a combination of a novel prostacyclin analogue beraprost ( BPT ) and a potent phosphodiesterase inhibitor cilostazol ( CLZ ) may result in untoward clinical
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
effects due to possible synergistic elevation of intracellular cAMP ( cyclic adenosine 3' , 5' - monophosphate ) .
O O O O O O O O B O B I I I I I I O O
Thereby , a clinical study of the combined administration of the two agents was attempted .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Twelve healthy volunteers were assigned to take BPT / CLZ in the following schedule ; BPT : 40 micrograms at day 1 and 120 micrograms t . i . d
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. from day 7 to 14 , CLZ : 200 mg t . i . d . from day 3 to 14 .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At various time intervals , physical examination and blood collection for ex vivo platelet aggregation and determination of intraplatelet cAMP were performed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Throughout the observation period , no significant alteration in vital signs was observed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Seven out of 12 subjects experienced headache of a short duration accompanying facial flush in one and nausea in one , especially after ingestion of CLZ .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
All of these symptoms , probably caused by the vasodilating effect of the two agents , were of mild degree and no special treatment was required .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intraplatelet cAMP content was gradually but significantly increased to 9 . 84 + / -
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 . 59 pmol per 10 ( 9 ) platelets at day 14 in comparison with the initial value ( 6 . 87 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 25 pmol ) .
O O O O O O
The platelet aggregability was significantly suppressed at various time intervals but no additive or synergistic inhibitory effect by the combined administration was noted .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion , the combined administration of BPT / CLZ is safe at doses used in the study , though the beneficial clinical effect of the combined administration has yet
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to be elucidated .
O O O O
Gastrointestinal tolerability of etoricoxib in rheumatoid arthritis patients : results of the etoricoxib vs diclofenac sodium gastrointestinal tolerability and effectiveness trial ( EDGE - II ) .
O O O B O O O O O O O O B O B I O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
A randomised , double - blind study to compare the gastrointestinal ( GI ) tolerability , safety and efficacy of etoricoxib and diclofenac in patients with rheumatoid arthritis ( RA
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
) .
O O
PATIENTS AND METHODS :
O O O O
A total of 4086 patients ( mean age 60 . 8 years ) diagnosed with RA were enrolled and received etoricoxib 90 mg daily ( n = 2032 ) or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
diclofenac 75 mg twice daily ( n = 2054 ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Use of gastroprotective agents and low - dose aspirin was allowed .
O O O O O O O O B O O O
The prespecified primary end point consisted of the cumulative rate of patient discontinuations due to clinical and laboratory GI adverse experiences ( AEs ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
General safety was also assessed , including adjudicated thrombotic cardiovascular event data .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Efficacy was evaluated using the Patient Global Assessment of Disease Status ( PGADS ; 0 - 4 point scale ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Mean ( SD ; maximum ) duration of treatment was 19 . 3 ( 10 . 3 ; 32 . 9 ) and 19 . 1 ( 10 . 4
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
; 33 . 1 ) months in the etoricoxib and diclofenac groups , respectively .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
The cumulative discontinuation rate due to GI AEs was significantly lower with etoricoxib than diclofenac ( 5 . 2 vs 8 . 5 events per 100 patient - years ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
respectively ; hazard ratio 0 . 62 ( 95 % CI : 0 . 47 , 0 . 81 ; p < or = 0 . 001 ) ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of discontinuations for hypertension - related and oedema - related AEs were significantly higher with etoricoxib ( 2 . 5 % and 1 . 1 % respectively )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
compared with diclofenac ( 1 . 5 % and 0 . 4 % respectively ; p < 0 . 001 for hypertension and p < 0 . 01 for oedema
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
Etoricoxib and diclofenac treatment resulted in similar efficacy ( PGADS mean changes from baseline - 0 . 62 vs - 0 . 58 , respectively ) .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Etoricoxib 90 mg demonstrated a significantly lower risk for discontinuing treatment due to GI AEs compared with diclofenac 150 mg .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Discontinuations from renovascular AEs , although less common than discontinuations from GI AEs , were significantly higher with etoricoxib .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Placebo - level incidence of extrapyramidal symptoms ( EPS ) with quetiapine in controlled studies of patients with bipolar mania .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
To evaluate extrapyramidal symptoms ( EPS ) , including akathisia , with quetiapine in patients with bipolar mania .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Data were analyzed from four similarly designed , randomized , double - blind , 3 - to 12 - week studies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two studies evaluated quetiapine monotherapy ( up to 800 mg / day )
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
( n = 209 ) versus placebo ( n = 198 ) , with lithium or haloperidol monotherapy as respective active controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
Two studies evaluated quetiapine ( up to 800 mg / day ) in combination with a mood stabilizer ( lithium or divalproex , QTP + Li / DVP )
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O B O B O
( n = 196 ) compared to placebo and mood stabilizer ( PBO + Li / DVP )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
( n = 203 ) .
O O O O O O
Extrapyramidal symptoms were evaluated using the Simpson - Angus Scale ( SAS ) , the Barnes Akathisia Rating Scale ( BARS ) , adverse event reports and anticholinergic drug usage
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
RESULTS :
O O
The incidence of EPS - related adverse events , including akathisia , was no different with quetiapine monotherapy ( 12 . 9 % ) than with placebo ( 13 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 % ) .
O O O O
Similarly , EPS - related adverse events with QTP + Li / DVP ( 21 . 4 % ) were no different than with PBO + Li / DVP (
O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
19 . 2 % ) .
O O O O O O
Adverse events related to EPS occurred in 59 . 6 % of patients treated with haloperidol ( n = 99 ) monotherapy , whereas 26 . 5 % of patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
treated with lithium ( n = 98 ) monotherapy experienced adverse events related to EPS .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of akathisia was low and similar with quetiapine monotherapy ( 3 . 3 % ) and placebo ( 6 . 1 % ) , and with QTP +
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Li / DVP ( 3 . 6 % ) and PBO + Li / DVP ( 4 . 9 % ) .
B O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
Lithium was associated with a significantly higher incidence ( p < 0 . 05 ) of tremor ( 18 . 4 % ) than quetiapine ( 5 . 6 %
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
) ; cerebellar tremor , which is a known adverse effect of lithium , may have contributed to the elevated rate of tremor in patients receiving lithium therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Haloperidol induced a significantly higher incidence ( p < 0 . 001 ) of akathisia ( 33 . 3 % versus 5 . 9 % ) , tremor ( 30
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 3 % versus 7 . 8 % ) , and extrapyramidal syndrome ( 35 . 4 % versus 5 . 9 % ) than quetiapine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
No significant differences were observed between quetiapine and placebo on SAS and BARS scores .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Anticholinergic use was low and similar with quetiapine or placebo .
O O O O O O O B O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
In bipolar mania , the incidence of EPS , including akathisia , with quetiapine therapy is similar to that with placebo .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Contribution of the sympathetic nervous system to salt - sensitivity in lifetime captopril - treated spontaneously hypertensive rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To test the hypothesis that , in lifetime captopril - treated spontaneously hypertensive rats ( SHR ) , the sympathetic nervous system contributes importantly to the hypertensive effect of
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dietary sodium chloride supplementation .
B I I O O
METHODS :
O O
Male SHR ( aged 6 weeks ) that had been treated from conception onward with either captopril or vehicle remained on a basal sodium chloride diet or were fed a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B I O O O O O
high sodium chloride diet .
O B I O O
After 2 weeks , the rats were subjected to ganglionic blockade and 2 days later , an infusion of clonidine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
RESULTS :
O O
Lifetime captopril treatment significantly lowered mean arterial pressure in both groups .
O B O O O O O O O O O O
Intravenous infusion of the ganglionic blocker hexamethonium resulted in a rapid decline in MAP that eliminated the dietary sodium chloride - induced increase in MAP in both groups .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O
Infusion of the central nervous system alpha2 - adrenergic receptor agonist clonidine also resulted in a greater reduction in MAP in both groups of SHR that were fed the high
O O O O O O B I I I I B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( compared with the basal ) sodium chloride diet .
O O O O O O B I O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
In both lifetime captopril - treated and control SHR , the sympathetic nervous system contributes to the pressor effects of a high sodium chloride diet .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
Dose - related beneficial and adverse effects of dietary corticosterone on organophosphorus - induced delayed neuropathy in chickens .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
Tri - ortho - tolyl phosphate ( TOTP ) , 360 mg / kg , po , and 0 , 0' - diisopropyl phosphorofluoridate ( DFP ) , 1 mg
B I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I O B O O O O
/ kg sc , were administered to adult White Leghorn chickens 24 hr after they were placed on diets containing 0 to 300 ppm corticosterone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Supplemented diets were continued until clinical signs and lesions of delayed neuropathy appeared .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although low concentrations ( less than or equal to 50 ppm ) of corticosterone had beneficial effects on TOTP - induced neuropathy , greater than or equal to 200 ppm
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
exacerbated clinical signs in chickens given either TOTP or DFP .
O O O O O O O B O B O
Neurotoxic esterase activities 24 hr after TOTP or DFP were less than 20 % of values measured in chickens not given organophosphorous compounds .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Chickens given 200 ppm corticosterone without TOTP or DFP had significantly elevated activity of plasma cholinesterase and significantly inhibited activity of liver carboxylesterase .
O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Degenerating myelinated fibers were also evident in distal levels of the peripheral nerves of chickens given TOTP or DFP .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
In vivo characterization of a dual adenosine A2A / A1 receptor antagonist in animal models of Parkinson 's disease .
O O O O O O B I I I I I O O O O O O O O
The in vivo characterization of a dual adenosine A ( 2A ) / A ( 1 ) receptor antagonist in several animal models of Parkinson 's disease is described .
O O O O O O O B I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O
Discovery and scale - up syntheses of compound 1 are described in detail , highlighting optimization steps that increased the overall yield of 1 from 10 . 0 % to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
30 . 5 % .
O O O O O
Compound 1 is a potent A ( 2A ) / A ( 1 ) receptor antagonist in vitro ( A ( 2A ) K ( i ) =
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 . 1 nM ; A ( 1 ) K ( i ) =
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
17 . 0 nM ) that has excellent activity , after oral administration , across a number of animal models of Parkinson 's disease including mouse and rat models of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
haloperidol - induced catalepsy , mouse model of reserpine - induced akinesia , rat 6 - hydroxydopamine ( 6 - OHDA ) lesion model of drug - induced rotation ,
B O O O O O O O B O O O O O B I I O B I I O O O O O O O O O
and MPTP - treated non - human primate model .
O B O O O O O O O O
An extremely rare case of delusional parasitosis in a chronic hepatitis C patient during pegylated interferon alpha - 2b and ribavirin treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O B O O
During treatment of chronic hepatitis C patients with interferon and ribavirin , a lot of side effects are described .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Twenty - three percent to 44 % of patients develop depression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
A minority of patients evolve to psychosis .
O O O O O O O O
To the best of our knowledge , no cases of psychogenic parasitosis occurring during interferon therapy have been described in the literature .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We present a 49 - year - old woman who developed a delusional parasitosis during treatment with pegylated interferon alpha - 2b weekly and ribavirin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O O B O
She complained of seeing parasites and the larvae of fleas in her stools .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This could not be confirmed by any technical examination .
O O O O O O O O O O
All the complaints disappeared after stopping pegylated interferon alpha - 2b and reappeared after restarting it .
O O O O O O B I I I I O O O O O O
She had a complete sustained viral response .
O O O O O O O O
Possible neuroleptic malignant syndrome related to concomitant treatment with paroxetine and alprazolam .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O
A 74 - year - old man with depressive symptoms was admitted to a psychiatric hospital due to insomnia , loss of appetite , exhaustion , and agitation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Medical treatment was initiated at a daily dose of 20 mg paroxetine and 1 . 2 mg alprazolam .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O
On the 10th day of paroxetine and alprazolam treatment , the patient exhibited marked psychomotor retardation , disorientation , and severe muscle rigidity with tremors .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient had a fever ( 38 . 2 degrees C ) , fluctuating blood pressure ( between 165 / 90 and 130 / 70 mg mm Hg ) ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and severe extrapyramidal symptoms .
O O O O O
Laboratory tests showed an elevation of creatine phosphokinase ( 2218 IU / L ) , aspartate aminotransferase ( 134 IU / L ) , alanine aminotransferase ( 78 IU /
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
L ) , and BUN ( 27 . 9 mg / ml ) levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient received bromocriptine and diazepam to treat his symptoms .
O O O B O B O O O O O
7 days later , the fever disappeared and the patient 's serum CPK levels were normalized ( 175 IU / L ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This patient presented with symptoms of neuroleptic malignant syndrome ( NMS ) , thus demonstrating that NMS - like symptoms can occur after combined paroxetine and alprazolam treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
The adverse drug reaction score obtained by the Naranjo algorithm was 6 in our case , indicating a probable relationship between the patient 's NMS - like adverse symptoms and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the combined treatment used in this case .
O O O O O O O O
The involvement of physiologic and environmental aspects specific to this patient was suspected .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Several risk factors for NMS should be noted in elderly depressive patients whose symptoms often include dehydration , agitation , malnutrition , and exhaustion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Careful therapeutic intervention is necessary in cases involving elderly patients who suffer from depression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pilocarpine seizures cause age - dependent impairment in auditory location discrimination .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Children who have status epilepticus have continuous or rapidly repeating seizures that may be life - threatening and may cause life - long changes in brain and behavior .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The extent to which status epilepticus causes deficits in auditory discrimination is unknown .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A naturalistic auditory location discrimination method was used to evaluate this question using an animal model of status epilepticus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Male Sprague - Dawley rats were injected with saline on postnatal day ( P ) 20 , or a convulsant dose of pilocarpine on P20 or P45 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Pilocarpine on either day induced status epilepticus ; status epilepticus at P45 resulted in CA3 cell loss and spontaneous seizures , whereas P20 rats had no cell loss or spontaneous
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
seizures .
O O
Mature rats were trained with sound - source location and sound - silence discriminations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Control ( saline P20 ) rats acquired both discriminations immediately .
O O O O O O O O O O O
In status epilepticus ( P20 ) rats , acquisition of the sound - source location discrimination was moderately impaired .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Status epilepticus ( P45 ) rats failed to acquire either sound - source location or sound - silence discriminations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Status epilepticus in rat causes an age - dependent , long - term impairment in auditory discrimination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This impairment may explain one cause of impaired auditory location discrimination in humans .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cardiovascular risk with cyclooxygenase inhibitors : general problem with substance specific differences ?
O O O B I O O O O O O O O
Randomised clinical trials and observational studies have shown an increased risk of myocardial infarction , stroke , hypertension and heart failure during treatment with cyclooxygenase inhibitors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Adverse cardiovascular effects occurred mainly , but not exclusively , in patients with concomitant risk factors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cyclooxygenase inhibitors cause complex changes in renal , vascular and cardiac prostanoid profiles thereby increasing vascular resistance and fluid retention .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of cardiovascular adverse events tends to increase with the daily dose and total exposure time .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A comparison of individual selective and unselective cyclooxygenase inhibitors suggests substance - specific differences , which may depend on differences in pharmacokinetic parameters or inhibitory potency and may be contributed
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
by prostaglandin - independent effects .
O B O O O O
Diagnostic markers such as N - terminal pro brain natriuretic peptide ( NT - proBNP ) or high - sensitive C - reactive protein might help in the early identification
O O O O B I I I I I I O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of patients at risk , thus avoiding the occurrence of serious cardiovascular toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Predictors of decreased renal function in patients with heart failure during angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitor therapy : results from the studies of left ventricular dysfunction ( SOLVD ) BACKGROUND
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
: Although angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitor therapy reduces mortality rates in patients with congestive heart failure ( CHF ) , it may also cause decreased renal function .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Little information is available to predict which patients are at highest risk for this complication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To quantify specific clinical predictors of reduction in renal function in patients with CHF who are prescribed angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitor therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
METHOD :
O O
We analyzed data from the Studies of Left Ventricular Dysfunction ( SOLVD ) , a randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled trial of enalapril for the treatment
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
of CHF .
O O O
There were 3379 patients randomly assigned to enalapril with a median follow - up of 974 days and 3379 patients randomly assigned to placebo with a mean follow - up
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of 967 days .
O O O O
Decreased renal function was defined as a rise in serum creatinine > / = 0 . 5 mg / dL ( 44 micromol / L ) from baseline .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We used time - to - event analysis to identify potential predictors of decrease in renal function including age , baseline ejection fraction , baseline creatinine , low systolic blood
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
pressure ( < 100 mm Hg ) , history of hypertension , diabetes , and use of antiplatelet , diuretic , and beta - blocker therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Patients randomly assigned to enalapril had a 33 % greater likelihood of decreased renal function than controls ( P = . 003 ) .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
By multivariate analysis , in both the placebo and enalapril groups older age , diuretic therapy , and diabetes were associated with decreased renal function , whereas beta - blocker
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
therapy and higher ejection fraction were renoprotective .
O O O O O O O O
Older age was associated with a greater risk of developing decreased renal function in both groups , but significantly more so in the enalapril group ( enalapril : risk ratio
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O
[ RR ] 1 . 42 per 10 years , 95 % confidence interval [ CI ] 1 . 32 - 1 . 52 with enalapril ; placebo : RR
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
1 . 18 , 95 % CI 1 . 12 - 1 . 25 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diuretic therapy was likewise associated with a greater risk of decreased renal function in the enalapril group ( RR 1 . 89 , 95 % CI 1 . 70 -
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 08 ) than in the placebo group ( RR 1 . 35 , 95 % CI 1 . 09 - 1 . 66 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Conversely , enalapril had a relative renoprotective effect ( RR 1 . 33 , 95 % CI 1 . 13 - 1 . 53 ) compared with placebo ( RR
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 . 96 , 95 % CI 1 . 57 - 2 . 44 ) in patients with diabetes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A lower risk of renal impairment was seen in both groups with beta - blocker therapy ( RR 0 . 70 , 95 % CI 0 . 57 - 0
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 85 ) and higher baseline ejection fraction ( RR 0 . 93 per 5 % increment , 95 % CI 0 . 91 - 0 . 96 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Enalapril use caused a 33 % increase in the risk of decreased renal function in patients with CHF .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diuretic use and advanced age increased this risk .
B O O O O O O O O
Diabetes was associated with an increased risk of renal impairment in all patients with CHF , but this risk was reduced in the enalapril group compared with the placebo group
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
.
O
beta - Blocker therapy and higher ejection fraction were renoprotective in all patients regardless of therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pemoline induced acute choreoathetosis : case report and review of the literature .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : Pemoline is an oxazolidine derivative that is structurally different from amphetamines and used in the treatment of attention deficit disorder .
O O B O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Pemoline has not been commonly associated in the literature as a cause of acute movement disorders .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The following case describes two children acutely poisoned with pemoline who experienced profound choreoathetosis .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
CASE REPORT :
O O O
Two , 3 - year - old male , identical twin siblings presented to the emergency department after found playing with a an empty bottle of pemoline originally containing 59
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
tablets .
O O
The children had a medical history significant for attention deficit disorder previously treated with methylphenidate without success .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
This was their first day of pemoline therapy .
O O O O O O B O O
The choreoathetoid movements began 45 min to 1 h after ingestion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The children gave no history of prior movement disorders and there was no family history of movement disorders .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The children received gastrointestinal decontamination and high doses of intravenous benzodiazepines in an attempt to control the choreoathetoid movements .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Despite treatment , the children continued to have choreoathetosis for approximately 24 hours .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Forty - eight hours after admission , the children appeared to be at their baseline and were discharged home .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Pemoline associated movement disorder has been rarely reported in the acute toxicology literature .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The possibility of choreoathetoid movements should be considered in patients presenting after pemoline overdose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Continuous subcutaneous administration of mesna to prevent ifosfamide - induced hemorrhagic cystitis .
O O O O B O O B O O O O O
Hemorrhagic cystitis is a major potential toxicity of ifosfamide that can be prevented by administering mesna along with the cytotoxic agent .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Mesna is generally administered by the intravenous route , although experience with oral delivery of the drug has increased .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The continuous subcutaneous administration of mesna has the advantage of not requiring intravenous access .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
In addition , subcutaneous delivery of the neutralizing agent will not be associated with the risk of inadequate urinary mesna concentrations , such as in a patient taking oral
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
mesna who experiences severe ifosfamide - induced emesis and is unable to absorb the drug .
B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Limited clinical experience with continuous subcutaneous mesna administration suggests it is a safe , practical , and economic method of drug delivery that permits ifosfamide to be administered successfully in
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
the outpatient setting .
O O O O
Modification of drug action by hyperammonemia .
O O O O O O O
Pretreatment with ammonium acetate ( NH4Ac ) ( 6 mmol / kg s . c . ) approximately doubled the time morphine - treated mice remained on a hot surface
O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
and similarly increased muscular incoordination by diazepam , but NH4Ac treatment alone had no effect .
O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O
Thus , hyperammonemia is capable of altering drug action and must be considered along with impaired drug metabolism in enhanced drug responses associated with liver disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Experiments in vitro showed that acetylcholine - induced catecholamine release from bovine adrenal medulla is depressed as much as 50 % by 0 . 3 mM NH4Ac and KCl -
O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
induced contractions of guinea - pig ileum were inhibited 20 % by 5 mM NH4Ac .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Addition of excess calcium reversed the depression in both tissues , but calcium - independent catecholamine release by acetaldehyde was not blocked by NH4Ac .
O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O B O O B O O O O B O
These results suggested that ammonia blocks calcium channels .
O O O O B O B O O
Parallels in the actions of NH4Ac and the calcium channel blocker verapamil support this concept .
O O O O O B O O B O O B O O O O
Both verapamil ( 10 mg / kg i . p . )
O B O O O O O O O O O O
and NH4Ac pretreatment enhanced morphine
O B O O B
analgesia - and diazepam - induced muscular incoordination and antagonized amphetamine - induced motor activity , and neither verapamil nor NH4Ac affected the convulsant action of metrazol .
O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O B O
The data suggest that hyperammonemia exerts a calcium channel blocking action which enhances the effects of central nervous system depressants and certain opioid analgesics .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Risk of nephropathy after consumption of nonionic contrast media by children undergoing cardiac angiography : a prospective study .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
Despite increasing reports on nonionic contrast media - induced nephropathy ( CIN ) in hospitalized adult patients during cardiac procedures , the studies in pediatrics are limited , with even
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
less focus on possible predisposing factors and preventive measures for patients undergoing cardiac angiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This prospective study determined the incidence of CIN for two nonionic contrast media ( CM ) , iopromide and iohexol , among 80 patients younger than 18 years and compared
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
the rates for this complication in relation to the type and dosage of CM and the presence of cyanosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The 80 patients in the study consecutively received either iopromide ( group A , n = 40 ) or iohexol ( group B , n = 40 ) .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Serum sodium ( Na ) , potassium ( K ) , and creatinine ( Cr ) were measured 24 h before angiography as baseline values , then measured again at
O B O B O O B O B O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
12 - , 24 - , and 48 - h intervals after CM use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Urine samples for Na and Cr also were checked at the same intervals .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
Risk of renal failure , Injury to the kidney , Failure of kidney function , Loss of kidney function , and End - stage renal damage ( RIFLE criteria )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
were used to define CIN and its incidence in the study population .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Accordingly , among the 15 CIN patients ( 18 . 75 % ) , 7 . 5 % of the patients in group A had increased risk and 3 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
75 % had renal injury , whereas 5 % of group B had increased risk and 2 . 5 % had renal injury .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Whereas 33 . 3 % of the patients with CIN were among those who received the proper dosage of CM , the percentage increased to 66 . 6 % among
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
those who received larger doses , with a significant difference in the incidence of CIN related to the different dosages of CM ( p = 0 . 014 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Among the 15 patients with CIN , 6 had cyanotic congenital heart diseases , but the incidence did not differ significantly from that for the noncyanotic patients ( p =
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 243 ) .
O O O O O
Although clinically silent , CIN is not rare in pediatrics .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence depends on dosage but not on the type of consumed nonionic CM , nor on the presence of cyanosis , and although CIN usually is reversible , more
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
concern is needed for the prevention of such a complication in children .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A case of ventricular tachycardia related to caffeine pretreatment .
O O O O O O O B O O
Suboptimal seizure duration is commonly encountered in electroconvulsive therapy practice , especially in older patients with higher seizure thresholds .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intravenous caffeine is commonly used to improve seizure duration and quality in such patients and is generally well tolerated aside from occasional reports of relatively benign ventricular ectopy .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We describe a patient with no previous history of cardiac disease or arrhythmia who developed sustained bigeminy and 2 brief runs of ventricular tachycardia after caffeine administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Although intravenous caffeine is generally well tolerated , the clinician should be aware of the potential for unpredictable and serious ventricular arrhythmias .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Optical coherence tomography can measure axonal loss in patients with ethambutol - induced optic neuropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
To map and identify the pattern , in vivo , of axonal degeneration in ethambutol - induced optic neuropathy using optical coherence tomography ( OCT ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ethambutol is an antimycobacterial agent often used to treat tuberculosis .
B O O O O O O O O O O
A serious complication of ethambutol is an optic neuropathy that impairs visual acuity , contrast sensitivity , and color vision .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , early on , when the toxic optic neuropathy is mild and partly reversible , the funduscopic findings are often subtle and easy to miss .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Three subjects with a history of ethambutol ( EMB ) - induced optic neuropathy of short - , intermediate - , and long - term visual deficits were administered a
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
full neuro - ophthalmologic examination including visual acuity , color vision , contrast sensitivity , and fundus examination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , OCT ( OCT 3000 , Humphrey - Zeiss , Dublin , CA ) was performed on both eyes of each subject using the retinal nerve fiber layer
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( RNFL ) analysis protocol .
O O O O O O
OCT interpolates data from 100 points around the optic nerve to effectively map out the RNFL .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The results were compared to the calculated average RNFL of normal eyes accumulated from four prior studies using OCT , n = 661 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In all subjects with history of EMB - induced optic neuropathy , there was a mean loss of 72 % nerve fiber layer thickness in the temporal quadrant ( patient
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A , with eventual recovery of visual acuity and fields , 58 % loss ; patient B , with intermediate visual deficits , 68 % loss ; patient C ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with chronic visual deficits , 90 % loss ) , with an average mean optic nerve thickness of 26 + / - 16 microm .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was a combined mean loss of 46 % of fibers from the superior , inferior , and nasal quadrants in the ( six ) eyes of all three subjects
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( mean average thickness of 55 + / - 29 microm ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In both sets ( four ) of eyes of the subjects with persistent visual deficits ( patients B and C ) , there was an average loss of 79 %
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of nerve fiber thickness in the temporal quadrant .
O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The OCT results in these patients with EMB - induced optic neuropathy show considerable loss especially of the temporal fibers .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This is consistent with prior histopathological studies that show predominant loss of parvo - cellular axons ( or small - caliber axons ) within the papillo - macular bundle in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
toxic or hereditary optic neuropathies .
O O O O O O
OCT can be a valuable tool in the quantitative analysis of optic neuropathies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Additionally , in terms of management of EMB - induced optic neuropathy , it is important to properly manage ethambutol dosing in patients with renal impairment and to achieve proper
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
transition to a maintenance dose once an appropriate loading dose has been reached .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effects of the cyclooxygenase - 2 specific inhibitor valdecoxib versus nonsteroidal antiinflammatory agents and placebo on cardiovascular thrombotic events in patients with arthritis .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There have been concerns that the risk of cardiovascular thrombotic events may be higher with cyclooxygenase ( COX ) - 2 - specific inhibitors than nonselective nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NSAIDs ) .
O O O
We evaluated cardiovascular event data for valdecoxib , a new COX - 2 - specific inhibitor in approximately 8000 patients with osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis treated with this agent in
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
randomized clinical trials .
O O O O
The incidence of cardiovascular thrombotic events ( cardiac , cerebrovascular and peripheral vascular , or arterial thrombotic ) was determined by analyzing pooled valdecoxib ( 10 - 80 mg daily
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
) , nonselective NSAID ( diclofenac 75 mg bid , ibuprofen 800 mg tid , or naproxen 500 mg bid ) and placebo data from 10 randomized osteoarthritis and rheumatoid
O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
arthritis trials that were 6 - 52 weeks in duration .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence rates of events were determined in all patients ( n = 7934 ) and in users of low - dose ( < or = 325 mg daily )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
aspirin ( n = 1051 ) and nonusers of aspirin ( n = 6883 ) .
B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Crude and exposure - adjusted incidences of thrombotic events were similar for valdecoxib , NSAIDs , and placebo .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The risk of serious thrombotic events was also similar for each valdecoxib dose .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Thrombotic risk was consistently higher for users of aspirin users than nonusers of aspirin ( placebo , 1 . 4 % vs . 0 % ; valdecoxib , 1 .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
7 % vs . 0 . 2 % ; NSAIDs , 1 . 9 % vs . 0 . 5 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The rates of events in users of aspirin were similar for all 3 treatment groups and across valdecoxib doses .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O
Short - and intermediate - term treatment with therapeutic ( 10 or 20 mg daily ) and supratherapeutic ( 40 or 80 mg daily ) valdecoxib doses was not associated
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
with an increased incidence of thrombotic events relative to nonselective NSAIDs or placebo in osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis patients in controlled clinical trials .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A randomized , placebo - controlled , crossover study of ephedrine for SSRI - induced female sexual dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The objective of this study was to determine whether ephedrine , an alpha - and beta - adrenergic agonist previously shown to enhance genital blood flow in women , has
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
beneficial effects in reversing antidepressant - induced sexual dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O
Nineteen sexually dysfunctional women receiving either fluoxetine , sertraline , or paroxetine participated in an eight - week , double - blind , placebo - controlled , cross - over
O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
study of the effects of ephedrine ( 50 mg ) on self - report measures of sexual desire , arousal , orgasm , and sexual satisfaction .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although there were significant improvements relative to baseline in sexual desire and orgasm intensity / pleasure on 50 mg ephedrine 1 - hr prior to sexual activity , significant improvements
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
in these measures , as well as in sexual arousal and orgasmic ability also were noted with placebo .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings highlight the importance of conducting placebo - controlled trials for this condition .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Erectile dysfunction occurs following substantia nigra lesions in the rat .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Erectile function was assessed 6 weeks following uni - and bilateral injections of 6 - hydroxydopamine in the substantia nigra nucleus of the brain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O
Behavioral apomorphine - induced penile erections were reduced ( 5 / 8 ) and increased ( 3 / 8 ) in uni - and bilateral lesioned animals .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intracavernous pressures , following electrical stimulation of the cavernous nerve , decreased in lesioned animals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lesions of the substantia nigra were confirmed by histology .
O O O O O O O O O O
Concentration of dopamine and its metabolites were decreased in the striatum of substantia nigra lesioned rats .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lesions of the substantia nigra are therefore associated with erectile dysfunction in rats and may serve as a model to study erectile dysfunction in Parkinson 's disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Potential therapeutic use of the selective dopamine D1 receptor agonist , A - 86929 : an acute study in parkinsonian levodopa - primed monkeys .
O O O O O O B O O O O B I I O O O O O O B O O O O
The clinical utility of dopamine ( DA ) D1 receptor agonists in the treatment of Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) is still unclear .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The therapeutic use of selective DA D1 receptor agonists such as SKF - 82958 (

O B O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PD and merit further attention .
O O O O O O
Deaths from local anesthetic - induced convulsions in mice .
O O O O O O O O O O
