Median convulsant ( CD50 ) and median lethal
O O O O O O O O
( LD50 ) doses of three representative local anesthetics were determined in adult mice to evaluate the threat to life of local anesthetic - induced convulsions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The CD50 and LD50 , respectively , were 57 . 7 and 58 . 7 mg / kg for bupivacaine , 111 . 0 and 133 . 1 mg /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
kg for lidocaine , and 243 . 4 and 266 . 5 mg / kg for chloroprocaine .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
When given intraperitoneally , bupivacaine thus was only about twice as toxic as lidocaine and four times as toxic as chloroprocaine .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O
Convulsions always preceded death , except after precipitous cardiopulmonary arrest from extreme doses .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A CD50 dose of local anesthetic ( causing convulsions in 50 % of mice ) was fatal in 90 % of bupivacaine - induced seizures , in 57 % of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
the chloroprocaine group , and in 6 % of the lidocaine group .
O B O O O O O O O O B O O
The narrow gap between convulsant and lethal doses of local anesthetics indicates that untreated convulsions present much more of a threat to life than heretofore appreciated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Myoclonic , atonic , and absence seizures following institution of carbamazepine therapy in children .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Five children , aged 3 to 11 years , treated with carbamazepine for epilepsy , had an acute aberrant reaction characterized by the onset of myoclonic , atypical absence and
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
/ or atonic ( minor motor ) seizures within a few days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When the carbamazepine was discontinued , two of the children returned to their former state very quickly , two had the minor motor seizures resolve in 3 and 6 months
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and one had the seizures persist .
O O O O O O O O
The child in whom the seizures persisted was later found to have ceroid lipofuscinosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The other children are doing well on other anticonvulsants .
O O O O O O O O O O
Naloxone reversal of hypotension due to captopril overdose .
B O O O O O B O O
The hemodynamic effects of captopril and other angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitors may be mediated by the endogenous opioid system .
O O O O B O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O O
The opioid antagonist naloxone has been shown to block or reverse the hypotensive actions of captopril .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
We report a case of an intentional captopril overdose , manifested by marked hypotension , that resolved promptly with the administration of naloxone .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
To our knowledge , this is the first reported case of captopril - induced hypotension treated with naloxone .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O
Our experience demonstrates a possible role of naloxone in the reversal of hypotension resulting from captopril .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O
Carbamazepine - induced cardiac dysfunction .
B O O O O O
Characterization of two distinct clinical syndromes .
O O O O O O O
A patient with sinus bradycardia and atrioventricular block , induced by carbamazepine , prompted an extensive literature review of all previously reported cases .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
From the analysis of these cases , two distinct forms of carbamazepine - associated cardiac dysfunction emerged .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
One patient group developed sinus tachycardias in the setting of a massive carbamazepine
O O O O O O O O O O O O B
overdose .
O O
The second group consisted almost exclusively of elderly women who developed potentially life - threatening bradyarrhythmias or atrioventricular conduction delay , associated with either therapeutic or modestly elevated carbamazepine serum
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
levels .
O O
Because carbamazepine is widely used in the treatment of many neurologic and psychiatric conditions , the recognition of the latter syndrome has important implications for the use of this drug
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in elderly patients .
O O O O
Glutamatergic neurotransmission mediated by NMDA receptors in the inferior colliculus can modulate haloperidol - induced catalepsy .
O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O
The inferior colliculus ( IC ) is primarily involved in the processing of auditory information , but it is distinguished from other auditory nuclei in the brainstem by its connections
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with structures of the motor system .
O O O O O O O
Functional evidence relating the IC to motor behavior derives from experiments showing that activation of the IC by electrical stimulation or excitatory amino acid microinjection causes freezing , escape -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O
like behavior , and immobility .
O O O O O O
However , the nature of this immobility is still unclear .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The present study examined the influence of excitatory amino acid - mediated mechanisms in the IC on the catalepsy induced by the dopamine receptor blocker haloperidol administered systemically ( 1
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O
or 0 . 5 mg / kg ) in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Haloperidol - induced catalepsy was challenged with prior intracollicular microinjections of glutamate NMDA receptor antagonists , MK - 801
B O O O O O O O O O O B B O O O B I I
( 15 or 30 mmol / 0 . 5 microl ) and AP7 ( 10 or 20 nmol / 0 . 5 microl ) , or of the NMDA receptor
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
agonist N - methyl - d - aspartate ( NMDA , 20 or 30 nmol / 0 . 5 microl ) .
O B I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results showed that intracollicular microinjection of MK - 801 and AP7 previous to systemic injections of haloperidol significantly attenuated the catalepsy , as indicated by a reduced latency to
O O O O O O O B I I O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
step down from a horizontal bar .
O O O O O O O
Accordingly , intracollicular microinjection of NMDA increased the latency to step down the bar .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
These findings suggest that glutamate - mediated mechanisms in the neural circuits at the IC level influence haloperidol - induced catalepsy and participate in the regulation of motor activity .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Metabotropic glutamate 7 receptor subtype modulates motor symptoms in rodent models of Parkinson 's disease .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Metabotropic glutamate ( mGlu ) receptors modulate synaptic transmission in the central nervous system and represent promising therapeutic targets for symptomatic treatment of Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Among the eight mGlu receptor subtypes , mGlu7 receptor is prominently expressed in the basal ganglia , but its role in restoring motor function in animal models of PD is
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
not known .
O O O
The effects of N , N' - dibenzhydrylethane - 1 , 2 - diamine dihydrochloride ( AMN082 ) , the first selective allosteric activator of mGlu7 receptors , were thus
O O O B I I I I I I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
tested in different rodent models of PD .
O O O O O O O O
Here , we show that oral ( 5 mg / kg ) or intrastriatal administration ( 0 . 1 and 0 . 5 nmol ) of AMN082 reverses haloperidol -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
induced catalepsy in rats .
O O O O O
AMN082 ( 2 . 5 and 5 mg / kg ) reduces apomorphine - induced rotations in unilateral 6 - hydroxydopamine ( 6 - OHDA ) - lesioned rats .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B I I O B I I O O O O O
In a more complex task commonly used to evaluate major akinetic symptoms of PD patients , 5 mg / kg AMN082 reverses the increased reaction time to respond to a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
cue of bilateral 6 - OHDA - lesioned rats .
O O O B I I O O O O
In addition , AMN082 reduces the duration of haloperidol - induced catalepsy in a mGlu7 receptor - dependent manner in wild - type but not mGlu7 receptor knockout mice .
O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Higher doses of AMN082 ( 10 and 20 mg / kg p . o . ) have no effect on the same models of PD .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Overall these findings suggest that mGlu7 receptor activation can reverse motor dysfunction associated with reduced dopamine activity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Selective ligands of mGlu7 receptor subtypes may thus be considered as promising compounds for the development of antiparkinsonian therapeutic strategies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nimodipine prevents memory impairment caused by nitroglycerin - induced hypotension in adult mice .
B O O O O O B O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : Hypotension and a resultant decrease in cerebral blood flow have been implicated in the development of cognitive dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We tested the hypothesis that nimodipine ( NIMO ) administered at the onset of nitroglycerin ( NTG ) - induced hypotension would preserve long - term associative memory .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
The passive avoidance ( PA ) paradigm was used to assess memory retention .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
For PA training , latencies ( seconds ) were recorded for entry from a suspended platform into a Plexiglas tube where a shock was automatically delivered .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Latencies were recorded 48 h later for a testing trial .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Ninety - six Swiss - Webster mice ( 30 - 35 g , 6 - 8 wk ) , were randomized into 6 groups 1 ) saline ( control )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, 2 ) NTG immediately after learning , 3 ) NTG 3 h after learning , 4 ) NTG and NIMO , 5 ) vehicle , and 6 )
O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
NIMO alone .
B O O
The extent of hypotension and changes in brain tissue oxygenation ( PbtO ( 2 ) ) and in cerebral blood flow were studied in a separate group of animals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
All groups exhibited similar training latencies ( 17 . 0 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 . 6 s ) .
O O O O O O
Mice subjected to hypotensive episodes showed a significant decrease in latency time ( 178 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
156 s ) compared with those injected with saline , NTG + NIMO , or delayed NTG ( 580 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O B O O O O O
81 s , 557 + / - 67 s , and 493 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
146 s , respectively ) .
O O O O O O
A Kruskal - Wallis 1 - way analysis of variance indicated a significant difference among the 4 treatment groups ( H = 15 . 34 ; P < 0 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
001 ) .
O O O
In a separate group of mice not subjected to behavioral studies , the same dose of NTG ( n = 3 ) and NTG + NIMO ( n = 3
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O
) caused mean arterial blood pressure to decrease from 85 . 9 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
3 . 8 mm Hg sem to 31 . 6 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 8 mm Hg sem and from 86 . 2 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
3 . 7 mm Hg sem to 32 . 6 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 2 mm Hg sem , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O
Mean arterial blood pressure in mice treated with NIMO alone decreased from 88 . 1 + / -
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
3 . 8 mm Hg to 80 . 0 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 9 mm Hg .
O O O O O O
The intergroup difference was statistically significant ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PbtO ( 2 ) decreased from 51 . 7 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 . 5 mm Hg sem to 33 . 8 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 . 2 mm
O O O O
Hg sem in the NTG group and from 38 . 6 + / -
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
6 . 1 mm Hg sem to 25 . 4 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 0 mm Hg sem in the NTG + NIMO groups , respectively .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
There were no significant differences among groups .
O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
In a PA retention paradigm , the injection of NTG immediately after learning produced a significant impairment of long - term associative memory in mice , whereas delayed induced hypotension
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
had no effect .
O O O O
NIMO attenuated the disruption in consolidation of long - term memory caused by NTG but did not improve latency in the absence of hypotension .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The observed effect of NIMO may have been attributable to the preservation of calcium homeostasis during hypotension , because there were no differences in the PbtO ( 2 ) indices
O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
among groups .
O O O
Fatal haemopericardium and gastrointestinal haemorrhage due to possible interaction of cranberry juice with warfarin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
We report a case of fatal internal haemorrhage in an elderly man who consumed only cranberry juice for two weeks while maintaining his usual dosage of warfarin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
We propose that naturally occurring compounds such as flavonoids , which are present in fruit juices , may increase the potency of warfarin by competing for the enzymes that normally
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
inactivate warfarin .
O B O
While traditionally regarded as foodstuffs , consumption of fruit juices should be considered when patients develop adverse drug reactions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Isoproterenol induces primary loss of dystrophin in rat hearts : correlation with myocardial injury .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mechanism of isoproterenol - induced myocardial damage is unknown , but a mismatch of oxygen supply vs . demand following coronary hypotension and myocardial hyperactivity is the best explanation
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
for the complex morphological alterations observed .
O O O O O O O
Severe alterations in the structural integrity of the sarcolemma of cardiomyocytes have been demonstrated to be caused by isoproterenol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Taking into account that the sarcolemmal integrity is stabilized by the dystrophin - glycoprotein complex ( DGC ) that connects actin and laminin in contractile machinery and extracellular matrix and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
by integrins , this study tests the hypothesis that isoproterenol affects sarcolemmal stability through changes in the DGC and integrins .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
We found different sensitivity of the DGC and integrin to isoproterenol subcutaneous administration .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Immunofluorescent staining revealed that dystrophin is the most sensitive among the structures connecting the actin in the cardiomyocyte cytoskeleton and the extracellular matrix .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The sarcomeric actin dissolution occurred after the reduction or loss of dystrophin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Subsequently , after lysis of myofilaments , gamma - sarcoglycan , beta - dystroglycan , beta1 - integrin , and laminin alpha - 2 expressions were reduced followed by their
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
breakdown , as epiphenomena of the myocytolytic process .
O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion , administration of isoproterenol to rats results in primary loss of dystrophin , the most sensitive among the structural proteins that form the DGC that connects the extracellular
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
matrix and the cytoskeleton in cardiomyocyte .
O O O O O O O
These changes , related to ischaemic injury , explain the severe alterations in the structural integrity of the sarcolemma of cardiomyocytes and hence severe and irreversible injury induced by
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
isoproterenol .
B O
High fat diet - fed obese rats are highly sensitive to doxorubicin - induced cardiotoxicity .
O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Often , chemotherapy by doxorubicin ( Adriamycin ) is limited due to life threatening cardiotoxicity in patients during and posttherapy .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recently , we have shown that moderate diet restriction remarkably protects against doxorubicin - induced cardiotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
This cardioprotection is accompanied by decreased cardiac oxidative stress and triglycerides and increased cardiac fatty - acid oxidation , ATP synthesis , and upregulated JAK / STAT3 pathway .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
In the current study , we investigated whether a physiological intervention by feeding 40 % high fat diet ( HFD ) , which induces obesity in male Sprague - Dawley
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rats ( 250 - 275 g ) , sensitizes to doxorubicin - induced cardiotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
A LD ( 10 ) dose ( 8 mg doxorubicin / kg , ip ) administered on day 43 of the HFD feeding regimen led to higher cardiotoxicity , cardiac
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dysfunction , lipid peroxidation , and 80 % mortality in the obese ( OB ) rats in the absence of any significant renal or hepatic toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Doxorubicin toxicokinetics studies revealed no change in accumulation of doxorubicin and doxorubicinol ( toxic metabolite ) in the normal diet - fed ( ND ) and OB hearts .
B O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mechanistic studies revealed that OB rats are sensitized due to : ( 1 ) higher oxyradical stress leading to upregulation of uncoupling proteins 2 and 3 , ( 2 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
downregulation of cardiac peroxisome proliferators activated receptor - alpha , ( 3 ) decreased plasma adiponectin levels , ( 4 ) decreased cardiac fatty - acid oxidation ( 666 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
9 + / - 14 . 0 nmol / min / g heart in ND versus 400 . 2 + / - 11 . 8 nmol / min / g
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
heart in OB ) , ( 5 ) decreased mitochondrial AMP - alpha2 protein kinase , and ( 6 ) 86 % drop in cardiac ATP levels accompanied by decreased
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
ATP / ADP ratio after doxorubicin administration .
B O B O O B O O
Decreased cardiac erythropoietin and increased SOCS3 further downregulated the cardioprotective JAK / STAT3 pathway .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion , HFD - induced obese rats are highly sensitized to doxorubicin - induced cardiotoxicity by substantially downregulating cardiac mitochondrial ATP generation , increasing oxidative stress and downregulating the
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
JAK / STAT3 pathway .
O O O O O
Complete atrioventricular block secondary to lithium therapy .
O O O O O B O O
Sinus node dysfunction has been reported most frequently among the adverse cardiovascular effects of lithium .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
In the present case , complete atrioventricular ( AV ) block with syncopal attacks developed secondary to lithium therapy , necessitating permanent pacemaker implantation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Serum lithium levels remained under or within the therapeutic range during the syncopal attacks .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lithium should be used with extreme caution , especially in patients with mild disturbance of AV conduction .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neuroleptic malignant syndrome induced by ziprasidone on the second day of treatment .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Neuroleptic malignant syndrome ( NMS ) is the rarest and most serious of the neuroleptic - induced movement disorders .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We describe a case of neuroleptic malignant syndrome ( NMS ) associated with the use of ziprasidone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Although conventional neuroleptics are more frequently associated with NMS , atypical antipsychotic drugs like ziprasidone may also be a cause .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The patient is a 24 - year - old male with a history of schizophrenia who developed signs and symptoms of NMS after 2 days of treatment with an 80
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- mg / day dose of orally administrated ziprasidone .
O O O O O O O O B O
This case is the earliest ( second day of treatment )
O O O O O O O O O O O
NMS due to ziprasidone reported in the literature .
O O O B O O O O O
Role of mangiferin on biochemical alterations and antioxidant status in isoproterenol - induced myocardial infarction in rats .
O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The current study dealt with the protective role of mangiferin , a polyphenol from Mangifera indica Linn .
O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O
( Anacardiaceae ) , on isoproterenol ( ISPH ) - induced myocardial infarction ( MI ) in rats through its antioxidative mechanism .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Subcutaneous injection of ISPH ( 200 mg / kg body weight in 1 ml saline ) to rats for 2 consecutive days caused myocardial damage in rat heart , which
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
was determined by the increased activity of serum lactate dehydrogenase ( LDH ) and creatine phosphokinase isoenzymes ( CK - MB ) , increased uric acid level and reduced plasma
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
iron binding capacity .
B O O O
The protective role of mangiferin was analyzed by triphenyl tetrazolium chloride ( TTC ) test used for macroscopic enzyme mapping assay of the ischemic myocardium .
O O O O B O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The heart tissue antioxidant enzymes such as superoxide dismutase , catalase , glutathione peroxidase , glutathione transferase and glutathione reductase activities , non - enzymic antioxidants such as cerruloplasmin ,
O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Vitamin C , Vitamin E and glutathione levels were altered in MI rats .
B I O B I O B O O O O O O O
Upon pretreatment with mangiferin ( 100 mg / kg body weight suspended in 2 ml of dimethyl sulphoxide ) given intraperitoneally for 28 days to MI rats protected the above
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
- mentioned parameters to fall from the normal levels .
O O O O O O O O O O
Activities of heart tissue enzymic antioxidants and serum non - enzymic antioxidants levels rose significantly upon mangiferin administration as compared to ISPH - induced MI rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O
From the present study it is concluded that mangiferin exerts a beneficial effect against ISPH - induced MI due to its antioxidant potential , which regulated the tissues defense system
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
against cardiac damage .
O O O O
Remifentanil pretreatment reduces myoclonus after etomidate .
B O O O O B O
STUDY OBJECTIVE :
O O O
The aim of the study was to compare the effect of pretreatment with remifentanil 1 microg / kg and the effect of gender on the incidence of myoclonus after anesthesia
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
induction with etomidate .
O O B O
DESIGN :
O O
This was a randomized , double - blind study .
O O O O O O O O O O
SETTING :
O O
The study was conducted at a university hospital .
O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS :
O O
Sixty patients were pretreated in a randomized double - blinded fashion with remifentanil 1 microg / kg or placebo .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Two minutes after remifentanil or placebo injection , etomidate 0 . 3 mg / kg was given .
O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
MEASUREMENTS :
O O
Myoclonus was recorded with a scale of 0 to 3 .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The grade of sedation ( none , mild , moderate , severe ) , nausea , pruritus , and apnea were recorded after injection of both drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MAIN RESULTS :
O O O
The incidence of myoclonus was significantly lower in the remifentanil group ( 6 . 7 % ) than in the placebo group ( 70 % ) ( P < 0
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 001 ) .
O O O O
None of the patients experienced sedation , apnea , nausea , or pruritus after injection of both drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the placebo group , male patients were associated with significantly increased incidence of myoclonus after etomidate administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Pretreatment with remifentanil 1 microg / kg reduced myoclonus after etomidate induction without side effects such as sedation , apnea , nausea , or pruritus .
O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Men experience increased incidence of myoclonus than women after etomidate administration .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
Daidzein activates choline acetyltransferase from MC - IXC cells and improves drug - induced amnesia .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The choline acetyltransferase ( ChAT ) activator , which enhances cholinergic transmission via an augmentation of the enzymatic production of acetylcholine ( ACh ) , is an important factor in
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
the treatment of Alzheimer 's disease ( AD ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
Methanolic extracts from Pueraria thunbergiana exhibited an activation effect ( 46 % ) on ChAT in vitro .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Via the sequential isolation of Pueraria thunbergiana , the active component was ultimately identified as daidzein ( 4' , 7 - dihydroxy - isoflavone ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I I I I I O O
In order to investigate the effects of daidzein from Pueraria thunbergiana on scopolamine - induced impairments of learning and memory , we conducted a series of in vivo tests .
O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Administration of daidzein ( 4 . 5 mg / kg body weight ) to mice was shown significantly to reverse scopolamine - induced amnesia , according to the results of
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
a Y - maze test .
O O O O O O
Injections of scopolamine into mice resulted in impaired performance on Y - maze tests ( a 37 % decreases in alternation behavior ) .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
By way of contrast , mice treated with daidzein prior to the scopolamine injections were noticeably protected from this performance impairment ( an approximately 12 % - 21 % decrease
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in alternation behavior ) .
O O O O O
These results indicate that daidzein might play a role in acetylcholine biosynthesis as a ChAT activator , and that it also ameliorates scopolamine - induced amnesia .
O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Possible azithromycin - associated hiccups .
O B O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To report a case of persistent hiccups associated by azithromycin therapy .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
CASE SUMMARY :
O O O
A 76 - year - old man presented with persistent hiccups after beginning azithromycin for the treatment of pharyngitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Hiccups were persistent and exhausting .
O O O O O O
Discontinuation of azithromycin and therapy with baclofen finally resolved hiccups .
O O B O O O B O O O O
No organic cause of hiccups was identified despite extensive investigation .
O O O O O O O O O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
Pharmacotherapeutic agents have been uncommonly associated with hiccups .
O O O O O O O O O
Corticosteroids ( dexamethasone and methylprednisolone ) , benzodiazepines ( midazolam ) and general anaesthesia have been the specific agents mentioned most frequently in the literature as being associated with the
O O B O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
development of hiccups .
O O O O
Few cases of drug - induced hiccups have been reported related to macrolide antimicrobials .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Using the Naranjo adverse effect reaction probability scale this event could be classified as possible ( score 5 points ) , mostly because of the close temporal sequence , previous
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
reports on this reaction with other macrolides and the absence of any alternative explanation for hiccups .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Our hypothesis is that a vagal mechanism mediated by azithromycin could be the pathogenesis of hiccups in our patient .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Diagnosis of drug - induced hiccups is difficult and often achieved only by a process of elimination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , macrolide antimicrobials have been reported to be associated with hiccups and vagal mechanism could explain the development of this side - effect .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Time trends in warfarin - associated hemorrhage .
O O O B O O O O
The annual incidence of warfarin - related bleeding at Brigham and Women 's Hospital increased from 0 . 97 / 1 , 000 patient admissions in the first time period
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( January 1995 to October 1998 ) to 1 . 19 / 1 , 000 patient admissions in the second time period ( November 1998 to August 2002 ) of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
this study .
O O O
The proportion of patients with major and intracranial bleeding increased from 20 . 2 % and 1 . 9 % , respectively , in the first time period , to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
33 . 3 % and 7 . 8 % , respectively , in the second .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fatal haemorrhagic myocarditis secondary to cyclophosphamide therapy .
O O O O O B O O
Haemorrhagic myocarditis is a rare but important complication of cyclophosphamide therapy .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
Echocardiographic identification of the disorder can be made .
O O O O O O O O O
We believe that the ultrasound features of this disorder have not been previously reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Glyceryl trinitrate induces attacks of migraine without aura in sufferers of migraine with aura .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Migraine with aura and migraine without aura have the same pain phase , thus indicating that migraine with aura and migraine without aura share a common pathway of nociception .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In recent years , increasing evidence has suggested that the messenger molecule nitric oxide ( NO ) is involved in pain mechanisms of migraine without aura .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In order to clarify whether the same is true for migraine with aura , in the present study we examined the headache response to intravenous infusion of glyceryl trinitrate (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
GTN ) ( 0 . 5 microg / kg / min for 20 min ) in 12 sufferers of migraine with aura .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The specific aim was to elucidate whether an aura and / or an attack of migraine without aura could be induced .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fourteen healthy subjects served as controls .
O O O O O O O
Aura symptoms were not elicited in any subject .
O O O O O O O O O
Headache was more severe in migraineurs than in the controls during and immediately after GTN infusion ( p = 0 . 037 ) as well as during the following 11
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
h ( p = 0 . 008 ) .
O O O O O O O O O
In the controls , the GTN - induced headache gradually disappeared , whereas in migraineurs peak headache intensity occurred at a mean time of 240 min post - infusion .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At this time the induced headache in 6 of 12 migraineurs fulfilled the diagnostic criteria for migraine without aura of the International Headache Society .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results therefore suggest that NO is involved in the pain mechanisms of migraine with aura .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Since cortical spreading depression has been shown to liberate NO in animals , this finding may help our understanding of the coupling between cortical spreading depression and headache in migraine
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with aura .
O O O
Stroke and cocaine or amphetamine use .
O O B O B O O
The association of cocaine and amphetamine use with hemorrhagic and ischemic stroke is based almost solely on data from case series .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The limited number of epidemiologic studies of stroke and use of cocaine and / or amphetamine have been done in settings that serve mostly the poor and / or minorities
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
This case - control study was conducted in the defined population comprising members of Kaiser Permanente of Northern and Southern California .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We attempted to identify all incident strokes in women ages 15 - 44 years during a 3 - year period using hospital admission and discharge records , emergency department logs
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and payment requests for out - of - plan hospitalizations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
We selected controls , matched on age and facility of usual care , at random from healthy members of the health plan .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We obtained information in face - to - face interviews .
O O O O O O O O O O O
There were 347 confirmed stroke cases and 1 , 021 controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The univariate matched odds ratio for stroke in women who admitted to using cocaine and / or amphetamine was 8 . 5 ( 95 % confidence interval = 3 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
6 - 20 . 0 ) .
O O O O O O O
After further adjustment for potential confounders , the odds ratio in women who reported using cocaine and / or amphetamine was 7 . 0 ( 95 % confidence interval =
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 8 - 17 . 9 ) .
O O O O O O O O O
The use of cocaine and / or amphetamine is a strong risk factor for stroke in this socioeconomically heterogeneous , insured urban population .
O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prevention of breast cancer with tamoxifen : preliminary findings from the Italian randomised trial among hysterectomised women .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Italian Tamoxifen Prevention Study .
O B O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Tamoxifen is a candidate chemopreventive agent in breast cancer , although the drug may be associated with the development of endometrial cancer .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore we did a trial in hysterectomised women of tamoxifen as a chemopreventive .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
METHODS :
O O
In October , 1992 , we started a double - blind placebo - controlled , randomised trial of tamoxifen in women ( mainly in Italy ) who did not have
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
breast cancer and who had had a hysterectomy .
O O O O O O O O O
Women were randomised to receive tamoxifen 20 mg per day or placebo , both orally for 5 years .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The original plan was to follow the intervention phase by 5 years ' follow - up .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In June , 1997 , the trialists and the data - monitoring committee decided to end recruitment primarily because of the number of women dropping out of the study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recruitment ended on July 11 , 1997 , and the study will continue as planned .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The primary endpoints are the occurrence of and deaths from breast cancer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This preliminary interim analysis is based on intention - to - treat .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
FINDINGS :
O O
5408 women were randomised ; participating women have a median follow - up of 46 months for major endpoints .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
41 cases of breast cancer occurred so far ; there have been no deaths from breast cancer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There is no difference in breast - cancer frequency between the placebo ( 22 cases ) and tamoxifen ( 19 ) arms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
There is a statistically significant reduction of breast cancer among women receiving tamoxifen who also used hormone - replacement therapy during the trial : among 390 women on such therapy
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and allocated to placebo , we found eight cases of breast cancer compared with one case among 362 women allocated to tamoxifen .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Compared with the placebo group , there was a significantly increased risk of vascular events and hypertriglyceridaemia among women on tamoxifen .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
INTERPRETATION :
O O
Although this preliminary analysis has low power , in this cohort of women at low - to - normal risk of breast cancer , the postulated protective effects of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
tamoxifen are not yet apparent .
B O O O O O
Women using hormone - replacement therapy appear to have benefited from use of tamoxifen .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
There were no deaths from breast cancer recorded in women in the study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is essential to continue follow - up to quantify the long - term risks and benefits of tamoxifen therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
A measure of pupillary oscillation as a marker of cocaine - induced paranoia .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Cocaine - induced paranoia ( CIP ) remains an important drug - induced model of idiopathic paranoia for which no psychophysiologic marker has yet emerged .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Measures of pupillary oscillation were able to significantly distinguish a group of abstinent crack cocaine abusers endorsing past CIP ( n = 32 ) from another group of crack addicts
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
who denied past CIP ( n = 29 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
Seizures induced by combined levomepromazine - fluvoxamine treatment .
O O O O B O B O O
We report a case of combined levomepromazine - fluvoxamine treatment - induced seizures .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
It seems that combined treatment of fluvoxamine with phenothiazines may possess proconvulsive activity .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
Why may epsilon - aminocaproic acid ( EACA ) induce myopathy in man ?
O O B I I I O B O O O O O O
Report of a case and literature review .
O O O O O O O O
A case of necrotizing myopathy due to a short epsilon - aminocaproic acid ( EACA ) treatment in a 72 year - old patient with subarachnoid haemorrhage ( SAH )
O O O O O O O O O B I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
is described .
O O O
Pathogenetic hypotheses are discussed .
O O O O O
Comparison of the effectiveness of ranitidine and cimetidine in inhibiting acid secretion in patients with gastric hypersecretory states .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The H2 - histamine receptor antagonists ranitidine and cimetidine were compared for their abilities to control gastric acid hypersecretion on a short - and long - term basis in 22
O O O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
patients with gastric acid hypersecretory states .
O O O O O O O
Nineteen patients had Zollinger - Ellison syndrome , one patient had systemic mastocytosis , and two patients had idiopathic hypersecretion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The rates of onset of the action of cimetidine and ranitidine were the same .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
The actions of both drugs were increased by anticholinergic agents , and there was a close correlation between the daily maintenance dose of each drug needed to control acid secretion
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
However , ranitidine was threefold more potent than cimetidine both in acute inhibition studies and in the median maintenance dose needed ( 1 . 2 g per day for
O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ranitidine and 3 . 6 g per day for cimetidine ) .
B O O O O O O O O B O O
Sixty percent of the males developed breast changes or impotence while taking cimetidine and in all cases these changes disappeared when cimetidine was replaced by ranitidine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O B O
Treatment with high doses of cimetidine ( one to 60 months ; median , 11 months ) or ranitidine ( two to 31 months ; median , 14 months )
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
was not associated with hepatic or hematologic toxicity or alterations of serum gastrin concentrations , but ranitidine therapy was associated with a significantly lower serum creatinine level than seen with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O
cimetidine therapy .
B O O
The results show that both drugs can adequately inhibit acid secretion in patients with gastric hypersecretory states .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both are safe at high doses , but ranitidine is threefold more potent and does not cause the antiandrogen side effects frequently seen with high doses of cimetidine .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
A catch in the Reye .
O O O O O O
Twenty - six cases of Reye syndrome from The Children 's Hospital , Camperdown , Australia , occurring between 1973 and 1982 were reviewed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of these , 20 cases met the US Public Health Service Centers for Disease Control criteria for the diagnosis of Reye syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Aspirin or salicylate ingestion had occurred in only one of the 20 cases ( 5 % ) , and paracetamol ( acetaminophen ) had been administered in only six of
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
the cases ( 30 % ) .
O O O O O O O
Pathologic confirmation of the diagnosis of Reye syndrome was accomplished in 90 % of the cases .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of Reye syndrome in New South Wales , Australia , is estimated from this study to be approximately nine cases per 1 million children compared with recent US
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
data of ten to 20 cases per 1 million children and three to seven cases per 1 million children in Great Britain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mortality for these Reye syndrome cases in Australia was 45 % as compared with a 32 % case - fatality rate in the United States .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In Australia , the pediatric usage of aspirin has been extremely low for the past 25 years ( less than 1 % of total dosage units sold ) , with
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
paracetamol ( acetaminophen ) dominating the pediatric analgesic and antipyretic market .
B O B O O O O O O O O O
Reye syndrome may be disappearing from Australia despite a total lack of association with salicylates or aspirin ingestion , since there were no cases found at The Children 's Hospital
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in 1983 , 1984 , or 1985 .
O O O O O O O O
St . Anthony 's fire , then and now : a case report and historical review .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A rare case of morbid vasospasm , together with striking angiographic findings , is described secondary to the ingestion of methysergide by a 48 - year - old woman .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
A brief review of the literature on similar cases is presented .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
A discussion of the history of ergot includes its original discovery , the epidemics of gangrene that it has caused through the ages and its past and present role in
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the management of migraine headache .
O O O O O O
Despite the advent of calcium channel blockers and beta - adrenergic antagonists , ergot preparations continue to play a major role in migraine therapy , so that the danger of
O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
St . Anthony 's fire persists .
O O O O O O O
Beta - 2 - adrenoceptor - mediated hypokalemia and its abolishment by oxprenolol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The time course and concentration - effect relationship of terbutaline - induced hypokalemia was studied , using computer - aided pharmacokinetic - dynamic modeling .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Subsequently we investigated the efficacy of oxprenolol in antagonizing such hypokalemia , together with the pharmacokinetic interaction between both drugs .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Six healthy subjects were given a 0 . 5 mg subcutaneous dose of terbutaline on two occasions : 1 hour after oral administration of a placebo and 1 hour after
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
80 mg oxprenolol orally .
O O B O O
In the 7 - hour period after terbutaline administration , plasma samples were taken for determination of plasma potassium levels and drug concentrations .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
The sigmoid Emax model offered a good description of the relation between terbutaline concentrations and potassium effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O
Oxprenolol caused decreases of 65 % and 56 % of terbutaline volume of distribution and clearance , respectively , and an increase of 130 % of its AUC .
B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In spite of higher terbutaline concentrations after oxprenolol pretreatment , the hypokalemia was almost completely antagonized by the beta 2 - blocking action .
O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Midline B3 serotonin nerves in rat medulla are involved in hypotensive effect of methyldopa .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
Previous experiments in this laboratory have shown that microinjection of methyldopa onto the ventrolateral cells of the B3 serotonin neurons in the medulla elicits a hypotensive response mediated by a
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
projection descending into the spinal cord .
O O O O O O O
The present experiments were designed to investigate the role of the midline cells of the B3 serotonin neurons in the medulla , coinciding with the raphe magnus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In spontaneously hypertensive , stroke - prone rats , microinjection of methyldopa into the area of the midline B3 serotonin cell group in the ventral medulla caused a potent hypotension
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
of 30 - 40 mm Hg , which was maximal 2 - 3 h after administration and was abolished by the serotonin neurotoxin 5 , 7 - dihydroxytryptamine (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I I I O
5 , 7 - DHT ) injected intracerebroventricularly .
B I I I I O O O O
However , intraspinal injection of 5 , 7 - DHT to produce a more selective lesion of only descending serotonin projections in the spinal cord did not affect this hypotension
O O O O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Further , 5 , 7 - DHT lesion of serotonin nerves travelling in the median forebrain bundle , one of the main ascending pathways from the B3 serotonin cells ,
O O B I I I I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
did not affect the fall in blood pressure associated with a midline B3 serotonin methyldopa injection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B B O O
It is concluded therefore that , unlike the ventrolateral B3 cells which mediate a methyldopa - induced hypotension via descending projections , the midline serotonin B3 cells in the medulla
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
contribute to the hypotensive action of methyldopa , either by way of an ascending projection which does not pass through the median forebrain bundle , or through a projection restricted
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to the caudal brainstem .
O O O O O
Yohimbine treatment of sexual side effects induced by serotonin reuptake blockers .
B O O O O O O O B O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Preclinical and clinical studies suggest that yohimbine facilitates sexual behavior and may be helpful in the treatment of male impotence .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A single case report suggests that yohimbine may be used to treat the sexual side effects of clomipramine .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
This study evaluated yohimbine as a treatment for the sexual side effects caused by serotonin reuptake blockers .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
METHOD :
O O
Six patients with either obsessive compulsive disorder , trichotillomania , anxiety , or affective disorders who suffered sexual side effects after treatment with serotonin reuptake blockers were given yohimbine on
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
a p . r . n . basis in an open clinical trial .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Various doses of yohimbine were used to determine the ideal dose for each patient .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Five of the six patients experienced improved sexual functioning after taking yohimbine .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
One patient who failed to comply with yohimbine treatment had no therapeutic effects .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Side effects of yohimbine included excessive sweating , increased anxiety , and a wound - up feeling in some patients .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
The results of this study indicate that yohimbine may be an effective treatment for the sexual side effects caused by serotonin reuptake blockers .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Future controlled studies are needed to further investigate the effectiveness and safety of yohimbine for this indication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Hypersensitivity immune reaction as a mechanism for dilevalol - associated hepatitis .
O O O O O O O B O O O O
OBJECTIVE : To assess lymphocyte reactivity to dilevalol and to serum containing putative ex vivo dilevalol antigens or metabolites in a case of dilevalol - induced liver injury .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O
PATIENT :
O O
A 58 - year - old woman with a clinical diagnosis of dilevalol - induced liver injury .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Peripheral blood mononuclear cells collected from the patient were cultured in the presence of a solution of dilevalol and also with sera collected from a volunteer before and after
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
dilevalol intake .
B O O
A similar protocol was performed with lymphocytes from a healthy subject .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
No lymphocyte proliferation was observed either in the patient or in the healthy volunteer in the presence of dilevalol solutions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
A significant proliferative response to serum collected after dilevalol intake was observed in the case of the patient compared with the proliferative response to the serum collected before the drug
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
intake .
O O
No reactivity was found when lymphocytes from the healthy subject were tested under similar conditions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The methodology used allowed the detection of lymphocyte sensitization to sera containing ex vivo - prepared dilevalol antigens , suggesting the involvement of an immunologic mechanism in dilevalol - induced
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
liver injury .
O O O
Reversible myocardial hypertrophy induced by tacrolimus in a pediatric heart transplant recipient : case report .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Tacrolimus is a potent immunosuppressant that is frequently used in organ transplantation .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , adverse effects include cardiac toxicity .
O O O O O O O O
Herein we describe transient myocardial hypertrophy induced by tacrolimus after heart transplantation .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The hypertrophy caused no clinical symptoms but was noted because of elevation of plasma brain natriuretic peptide concentration and confirmed at echocardiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Initially , allograft rejection was feared ; however , myocardial biopsy samples revealed only interstitial edema and mild myocardial hypertrophy ; neither cellular nor humoral rejection was detected .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The blood tacrolimus concentration was higher than usual at that time ; thus , tacrolimus dosage was reduced .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Myocardial hypertrophy completely resolved upon reducing the target concentration of tacrolimus and did not recur , as confirmed at echocardiography and myocardial biopsy .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thus , we conclude that tacrolimus induces reversible myocardial hypertrophy .
O O O O O B O O O O O
In patients receiving tacrolimus therapy , blood concentration should be carefully controlled and extreme attention paid to cardiac involvement .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Comparison of unilateral pallidotomy and subthalamotomy findings in advanced idiopathic Parkinson 's disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A prospective , randomized , double - blind pilot study to compare the results of stereotactic unilateral pallidotomy and subthalamotomy in advanced idiopathic Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) refractory
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to medical treatment was designed .
O O O O O O
Ten consecutive patients ( mean age , 58 . 4 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
6 . 8 years ; 7 men , 3 women ) with similar characteristics at the duration of disease ( mean disease time , 8 . 4 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
3 . 5 years ) , disabling motor fluctuations ( Hoehn _ Yahr stage 3 - 5 in off - drug phases ) and levodopa - induced dyskinesias were selected
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
.
O
All patients had bilateral symptoms and their levodopa equivalent dosing were analysed .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Six patients were operated on in the globus pallidus interna ( GPi ) and four in the subthalamic nucleus ( STN ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical evaluation included the use of the Unified Parkinson 's Disease Rating Scale ( UPDRS ) , Hoehn_Yahr score and Schwab England activities of daily living ( ADL ) score
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in ' on' - and ' off' - drug conditions before surgery and 6 months after surgery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was statistically significant improvement in all contralateral major parkinsonian motor signs in all patients followed for 6 months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Levodopa equivalent daily intake was significantly reduced in the STN group .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Changes in UPDRS , Hoehn _ Yahr and Schwab England ADL scores were similar in both groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cognitive functions were unchanged in both groups .
O O O O O O O O
Complications were observed in two patients : one had a left homonymous hemianopsia after pallidotomy and another one developed left hemiballistic movements 3 days after subthalamotomy which partly improved within
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 month with Valproate 1000 mg / day .
O O O B O O O O O
The findings of this study suggest that lesions of the unilateral STN and GPi are equally effective treatment for patients with advanced PD refractory to medical treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Protective effects of antithrombin on puromycin aminonucleoside nephrosis in rats .
O O O O O B I O O O O
We investigated the effects of antithrombin , a plasma inhibitor of coagulation factors , in rats with puromycin aminonucleoside - induced nephrosis , which is an experimental model of human
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O
nephrotic syndrome .
O O O
Antithrombin ( 50 or 500 IU / kg / i . v . ) was administered to rats once a day for 10 days immediately after the injection of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
puromycin aminonucleoside ( 50 mg / kg / i . v . ) .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment with antithrombin attenuated the puromycin aminonucleoside - induced hematological abnormalities .
O O O O O B I O O O O O
Puromycin aminonucleoside - induced renal dysfunction and hyperlipidemia were also suppressed .
B I O O O O O O O O O O
Histopathological examination revealed severe renal damage such as proteinaceous casts in tubuli and tubular expansion in the kidney of control rats , while an improvement of the damage was seen
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in antithrombin - treated rats .
O O O O O O
In addition , antithrombin treatment markedly suppressed puromycin aminonucleoside - induced apoptosis of renal tubular epithelial cells .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , puromycin aminonucleoside - induced increases in renal cytokine content were also decreased .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings suggest that thrombin plays an important role in the pathogenesis of puromycin aminonucleoside - induced nephrotic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
Treatment with antithrombin may be clinically effective in patients with nephrotic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reverse or inverted left ventricular apical ballooning syndrome ( reverse Takotsubo cardiomyopathy ) in a young woman in the setting of amphetamine use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Transient left ventricular apical ballooning syndrome was first described in Japan as """" Takotsubo cardiomyopathy . """"
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This syndrome has been identified in many other countries .
O O O O O O O O O O
Many variations of this syndrome have been recently described in the literature .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One of the rarest is the reverse type of this syndrome , with hyperdynamic apex and complete akinesia of the base ( as opposed to the classic apical ballooning )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
In this article , we report an interesting case of a young woman who presented with this rare type of reverse apical ballooning syndrome occurring after amphetamine use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
This report is followed by review of the literature .
O O O O O O O O O O
Attenuated disruption of prepulse inhibition by dopaminergic stimulation after maternal deprivation and adolescent corticosterone treatment in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The development of schizophrenia may include an early neurodevelopmental stress component which increases vulnerability to later stressful life events , in combination leading to overt disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We investigated the effect of an early stress , in the form of maternal deprivation , combined with a later stress , simulated by chronic periadolescent corticosterone treatment , on
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
behaviour in rats .
O O O O
Acute treatment with apomorphine caused disruption of prepulse inhibition ( PPI ) in controls and in rats that had undergone either maternal deprivation or corticosterone treatment , but was surprisingly
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
absent in rats that had undergone the combined early and late stress .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Amphetamine treatment significantly disrupted PPI in both non - deprived groups , but was absent in both maternally deprived groups .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The serotonin - 1A receptor agonist , 8 - OH - DPAT , induced a significant disruption of PPI in all groups .
O B O O O O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O
Amphetamine - induced locomotor hyperactivity was similar in all groups .
B O O O O O O O O O O
These results show an inhibitory interaction of early stress , caused by maternal deprivation , combined with ' adolescent ' stress , simulated by corticosterone treatment , on dopaminergic regulation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
of PPI .
O O O
The altered effects of apomorphine and amphetamine could indicate differential changes in dopamine receptor signalling leading to functional desensitisation , or altered modulation of sensory gating in the nucleus accumbens
O O O O B O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
by limbic structures such as the hippocampus .
O O O O O O O O
Peripheral iron dextran induced degeneration of dopaminergic neurons in rat substantia nigra .
O B I O O O O O O O O O O
Iron accumulation is considered to be involved in the pathogenesis of Parkinson 's disease .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To demonstrate the relationship between peripheral iron overload and dopaminergic neuron loss in rat substantia nigra ( SN ) , in the present study we used fast cyclic voltammetry ,
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
tyrosine hydroxylase ( TH ) immunohistochemistry , Perls ' iron staining , and high performance liquid chromatography - electrochemical detection to study the degeneration of dopaminergic neurons and increased
B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
iron content in the SN of iron dextran overloaded animals .
B O O O O O B I O O O
The findings showed that peripheral iron dextran overload increased the iron staining positive cells and reduced the number of TH - immunoreactive neurons in the SN .
O O O O O B I O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As a result , dopamine release and content , as well as its metabolites contents were decreased in caudate putamen .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Even more dramatic changes were found in chronic overload group .
O O O O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that peripheral iron dextran can increase the iron level in the SN , where excessive iron causes the degeneration of dopaminergic neurons .
O O O O O B I O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The chronic iron overload may be more destructive to dopaminergic neurons than the acute iron overload .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Warfarin - induced leukocytoclastic vasculitis .
B O O O O O
Skin reactions associated with oral coumarin - derived anticoagulants are an uncommon occurrence .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Leukocytoclastic vasculitis ( LV ) is primarily a cutaneous small vessel vasculitis , though systemic involvement may be encountered .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report 4 patients with late - onset LV probably due to warfarin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
All 4 patients presented with skin eruptions that developed after receiving warfarin for several years .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The results of skin lesion biopsies were available in 3 patients , confirming LV Cutaneous lesions resolved in all patients after warfarin was discontinued .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
In 2 of the 4 patients , rechallenge with warfarin led to recurrence of the lesions .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
LV may be a late - onset adverse reaction associated with warfarin therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The activation of spinal N - methyl - D - aspartate receptors may contribute to degeneration of spinal motor neurons induced by neuraxial morphine after a noninjurious interval of spinal
O O O O B I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
cord ischemia .
O O O
We investigated the relationship between the degeneration of spinal motor neurons and activation of N - methyl - d - aspartate ( NMDA ) receptors after neuraxial morphine following a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I O B O O O O B O O
noninjurious interval of aortic occlusion in rats .
O O O O O O O O
Spinal cord ischemia was induced by aortic occlusion for 6 min with a balloon catheter .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In a microdialysis study , 10 muL of saline ( group C ; n = 8 ) or 30 mug of morphine ( group M ; n = 8 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
was injected intrathecally ( IT ) 0 . 5 h after reflow , and 30 mug of morphine ( group SM ; n = 8 ) or 10 muL of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
saline ( group SC ; n = 8 ) was injected IT 0 . 5 h after sham operation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Microdialysis samples were collected preischemia , before IT injection , and at 2 , 4 , 8 , 24 , and 48 h of reperfusion ( after IT injection )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Second , we investigated the effect of IT MK - 801 ( 30 mug ) on the histopathologic changes in the spinal cord after morphine - induced spastic paraparesis .
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
After IT morphine , the cerebrospinal fluid ( CSF ) glutamate concentration was increased in group M relative to both baseline and group C ( P < 0 . 05
O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
This increase persisted for 8 hrs .
O O O O O O O
IT MK - 801 significantly reduced the number of dark - stained alpha - motoneurons after morphine - induced spastic paraparesis compared with the saline group .
O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
These data indicate that IT morphine induces spastic paraparesis with a concomitant increase in CSF glutamate , which is involved in NMDA receptor activation .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O
We suggest that opioids may be neurotoxic in the setting of spinal cord ischemia via NMDA receptor activation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Reduced sodium channel density , altered voltage dependence of inactivation , and increased susceptibility to seizures in mice lacking sodium channel beta 2 - subunits .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Sodium channel beta - subunits modulate channel gating , assembly , and cell surface expression in heterologous cell systems .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We generated beta2 ( - / - ) mice to investigate the role of beta2 in control of sodium channel density , localization , and function in neurons in vivo
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Measurements of [ ( 3 ) H ] saxitoxin ( STX ) binding showed a significant reduction in the level of plasma membrane sodium channels in beta2 ( - /
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
- ) neurons .
O O O O
The loss of beta2 resulted in negative shifts in the voltage dependence of inactivation as well as significant decreases in sodium current density in acutely dissociated hippocampal neurons .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The integral of the compound action potential in optic nerve was significantly reduced , and the threshold for action potential generation was increased , indicating a reduction in the level
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of functional plasma membrane sodium channels .
O O O O B O O
In contrast , the conduction velocity , the number and size of axons in the optic nerve , and the specific localization of Na ( v ) 1 . 6
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
channels in the nodes of Ranvier were unchanged .
O O O O O O O O O
beta2 ( - / - )
O O O O O O
mice displayed increased susceptibility to seizures , as indicated by reduced latency and threshold for pilocarpine - induced seizures , but seemed normal in other neurological tests .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our observations show that beta2 - subunits play an important role in the regulation of sodium channel density and function in neurons in vivo and are required for normal action
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
potential generation and control of excitability .
O O O O O O O
Screening for stimulant use in adult emergency department seizure patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : The objective of this study was to determine the prevalence of positive plasma drug screening for cocaine or amphetamine in adult emergency department seizure patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
This prospective study evaluated consecutive eligible seizure patients who had a plasma sample collected as part of their clinical evaluation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Plasma was tested for amphetamine and the cocaine metabolite benzoylecgonine using enzyme - mediated immunoassay methodology .
O O O O B O O B O B O O O O O O O
Plasma samples with benzoylecgonine greater than 150 ng / mL or an amphetamine greater than 500 ng / mL were defined as positive .
O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Patient demographics , history of underlying drug or alcohol - related seizure disorder , estimated time from seizure to sample collection , history or suspicion of cocaine or amphetamine abuse
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, results of clinical urine testing for drugs of abuse , and assay results were recorded without patient identifiers .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Fourteen of 248 ( 5 . 6 % , 95 % CI 2 . 7 % - 8 . 5 % ) plasma samples were positive by immunoassay testing for
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
benzoylecgonine and no samples ( 0 % , 95 % CI 0 - 1 . 2 % ) were positive for amphetamine .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Positive test results were more common in patient visits where there was a history or suspicion of cocaine or amphetamine abuse ( p < 0 . 0005 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
During this study period , routine plasma screening for cocaine and amphetamines in adult seizure patients had a low yield .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
As a result , routine plasma screening would yield few cases of stimulant drug in which there was neither a history nor suspicion of drug abuse in this population .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Evidence of functional somatotopy in GPi from results of pallidotomy .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The objective of this study was to explore the functional anatomy of the globus pallidus internus ( GPi ) by studying the effects of unilateral pallidotomy on parkinsonian ' off
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
' signs and levodopa - induced dyskinesias ( LID ) .
O O O B O O O O O O O
We found significant positive correlations between the preoperative levodopa responsiveness of motor signs and the levodopa responsiveness of scores in timed tests ( Core Assessment Program for Intracerebral Transplantations )
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in the contralateral limbs and the improvement in these scores after surgery , whereas there was no correlation with the improvement in LID .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We also found a highly significant correlation ( P : < 0 . 0001 , r = 0 . 8 ) between the volume of the ventral lesion in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
GPi and the improvement in LID in the contralateral limbs , whereas there was no correlation between the ventral volume and the improvement in parkinsonian ' off ' signs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The volumes of the total lesion cylinder and the dorsal lesion did not correlate with the outcome of either dyskinesias or parkinsonian ' off ' signs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The differential predictive value of levodopa responsiveness for the outcome of parkinsonian ' off ' signs and LID and the different correlations of ventral lesion volume with dyskinesias and parkinsonian
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
' off ' signs indicate that different anatomical or pathophysiological substrates may be responsible for the generation of parkinsonian ' off ' signs and dyskinesias .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Whereas cells in a wider area of the GPi may be implicated in parkinsonism , the ventral GPi seems to be crucial for the manifestation of LID .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We suggest that our observations are additional proof of the functional somatotopy of the systems within the GPi that mediate parkinsonism and dyskinesias , especially along the dorsoventral trajectory used
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in pallidotomy .
O O O
The outcome of pallidotomy in which the lesion involves the ventral and dorsal GPi could be the net effect of alteration in the activity of pathways which mediate different symptoms
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and hence could be variable .
O O O O O O O
Pain responses in methadone - maintained opioid abusers .
O O O B O O O O O
Providing pain management for known opioid abusers is a challenging clinical task , in part because little is known about their pain experience and analgesic requirements .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This study was designed to describe pain tolerance and analgesic response in a sample of opioid addicts stabilized in methadone - maintenance ( MM ) treatment ( n = 60
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
) in comparison to matched nondependent control subjects ( n = 60 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
By using a placebo - controlled , two - way factorial design , tolerance to cold - pressor ( CP ) pain was examined , both before and after oral
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
administration of therapeutic doses of common opioid ( hydromorphone 2 mg ) and nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory ( ketorolac 10 mg ) analgesic agents .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Results showed that MM individuals were significantly less tolerant of CP pain than control subjects , replicating previous work .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Analgesic effects were significant neither for medication nor group .
O O O O O O O O O O
These data indicate that MM opioid abusers represent a pain - intolerant subset of clinical patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Their complaints of pain should be evaluated seriously and managed aggressively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urine N - acetyl - beta - D - glucosaminidase - - a marker of tubular damage ?
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Although an indicator of renal tubular dysfunction , an increased urinary N - acetyl - beta - D - glucosaminidase ( NAG ) activity might reflect increased lysosomal activity in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
renal tubular cells .
O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Puromycin aminonucleoside ( PAN ) was administered to Sprague Dawley rats to induce proteinuria .
B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Total protein , albumin , NAG activity and protein electrophoretic pattern were assessed in daily urine samples for 33 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The morphological appearance of the kidneys was examined on days three , four , six , eight and thirty three and the NAG isoenzyme patterns on days zero , four
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, eight and thirty three .
O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Following intravenous PAN urine volume and urine NAG activity increased significantly by day two , but returned to normal by day four .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After day four all treated animals exhibited a marked rise in urine albumin , total protein excretion and NAG activity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Electrophoresis showed a generalised increase in middle and high molecular weight urine proteins from day four onwards .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Protein droplets first appeared prominent in tubular cells on day four .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Peak urine NAG activity and a change in NAG isoenzyme pattern coincided with both the peak proteinuria and the reduction in intracellular protein and NAG droplets ( day six onwards
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
This animal model demonstrates that an increase in lysosomal turnover and hence urine NAG activity , occurs when increased protein is presented to the tubular cells .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urine NAG activity is thus a measure of altered function in the renal tubules and not simply an indicator of damage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Over expression of vascular endothelial growth factor and its receptor during the development of estrogen - induced rat pituitary tumors may mediate estrogen - initiated tumor angiogenesis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Estrogens , which have been associated with several types of human and animal cancers , can induce tumor angiogenesis in the pituitary of Fischer 344 rats .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mechanistic details of tumor angiogenesis induction , during estrogen carcinogenesis , are still unknown .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
To elucidate the role of estrogen in the regulation of tumor angiogenesis in the pituitary of female rats , the density of blood vessels was analysed using factor VIII related
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
antigen ( FVIIIRAg ) immunohistochemistry and the expression of vascular endothelial growth factor / vascular permeability factor ( VEGF / VPF ) was examined by Western blot and immunohistochemical analysis
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The expression of VEGF receptor ( VEGFR - 2 / Flk - 1 / KDR ) was also examined by immunohistochemistry .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results demonstrated that 17beta - estradiol ( E2 ) induces neovascularization , as well as the growth and enlargement of blood vessels after 7 days of exposure .
O O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The high tumor angiogenic potential was associated with an elevated VEGF / VPF protein expression in the E2 exposed pituitary of ovariectomized ( OVEX ) rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
