VEGF / VPF and FVIIIRAg immunohistochemistry and endothelial specific lectin ( UEA1 ) binding studies , indicate that the elevation of VEGF protein expression initially occurred in both blood vessels
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and non - endothelial cells .
O O O O O O
After 15 days of E2 exposure , VEGF / VPF protein expression , in the non - endothelial cell population , sharply declined and was restricted to the blood vessels
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The function of non - endothelial - derived VEGF is not clear .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , immunohistochemical studies demonstrated that VEGFR - 2 ( flk - 1 / KDR ) , expression was elevated significantly in the endothelial cells of microblood vessels after 7
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
days of E2 exposure .
O O B O O
These findings suggest that over expression of VEGF and its receptor ( VEGFR - 2 ) may play an important role in the initial step of the regulation of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
estrogen induced tumor angiogenesis in the rat pituitary .
B O O O O O O O O
Pravastatin - associated myopathy .
B O O O O
Report of a case .
O O O O O
A case of acute inflammatory myopathy associated with the use of pravastatin , a new hydrophilic 3 - hydroxy - 3 methylglutaril coenzyme A reductase inhibitor , is reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient , a 69 - year - old man was affected by non - insulin - dependent diabetes mellitus and hypertension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He assumed pravastatin ( 20 mg / day ) because of hypercholesterolemia .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O
He was admitted with acute myopathy of the lower limbs which resolved in a few days after pravastatin discontinuation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
A previously unknown hypothyroidism , probably due to chronic autoimmune thyroiditis , was evidenced .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Muscle biopsy ( left gastrocnemius ) revealed a perimysial and endomysial inflammatory infiltrate with a prevalence of CD4 + lymphocytes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
While lovastatin and simvastatin have been associated with toxic myopathy , pravastatin - associated myopathy could represent a distinct , inflammatory entity .
O B O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Dose - effect and structure - function relationships in doxorubicin cardiomyopathy .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
The cardiomyopathy ( CM ) produced by the anticancer drug doxorubicin ( DXR ) ( Adriamycin ) provides a unique opportunity to analyze dose - effect and structure - function
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
relationships during development of myocardial disease .
O O O O O O O
We measured the degree of morphologic damage by ultrastructural examination of endomyocardial biopsy and the degree of performance abnormally by right heart catheterization in patients receiving DXR .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Morphologic damage was variable but was proportional to the total cumulative DXR dose between 100 and 600 mg / m2 .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Performance abnormalities correlated weakly with dose , exhibited a curvilinear relationship , and had a """" threshold """" for expression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Catheterization abnormalities correlated well with morphologic damage ( r = 0 . 57 to 0 . 78 ) in a subgroup of patients in whom exercise hemodynamics were measured ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and this relationship also exhibited a curvilinear , threshold configuration .
O O O O O O O O O O O
In DXR - CM myocardial damage is proportional to the degree of cytotoxic insult ( DXR dose ) while myocardial function is preserved until a critical dose or degree of
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
damage is reached , after which myocardial performance deteriorates rapidly .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Fatal aplastic anemia following topical administration of ophthalmic chloramphenicol .
O O O O O O O O B O
A 73 - year - old woman died of aplastic anemia less than two months after undergoing cataract extraction and beginning topical therapy with chloramphenicol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The first signs of pancytopenia began within one month of the surgery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The pattern of the aplastic anemia was associated with an idiosyncratic response to chloramphenicol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
This was the second report of fatal aplastic anemia after topical treatment with chloramphenicol for ocular conditions , although two cases of reversible bone marrow hypoplasia have also been reported
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Any other suspected cases of ocular toxicity associated with topically applied chloramphenicol should be reported to the National Registry of Drug - Induced Ocular Side Effects , Oregon Health Sciences
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
University , Portland , OR 97201 .
O O O O O O O
Bradycardia due to trihexyphenidyl hydrochloride .
O O O B I O
A chronic schizophrenic patient was treated with an anticholinergic drug , trihexyphenidyl hydrochloride .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
The patient developed , paradoxically , sinus bradycardia .
O O O O O O O O O
The reaction was specific to trihexyphenidyl and not to other anticholinergic drugs .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
This antidyskinetic drug is widely used in clinical psychiatric practice and physicians should be aware of this side effect .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Experimental cyclosporine nephrotoxicity : risk of concomitant chemotherapy .
O B O O O O O O O
The role of cyclosporine ( CSA ) alone or in combination with various chemotherapeutics in the development of renal toxicity was evaluated in rats .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Administration of 20 mg / kg / day CSA for 4 weeks caused renal functional and structural changes similar to those reported in man .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The combined administration of CSA and various chemotherapeutic drugs with a nephrotoxic potential , such as gentamicin ( at therapeutic doses ) , amphothericin B and ketoconazole , which are
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B I O B O O O
frequently used in immunosuppressed patients , did not aggravate the CSA induced toxicity in the rat model .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Gentamicin at toxic doses , however , increased CSA nephrotoxicity .
B O O O O O O O B O O
Thus , the nephrotoxicity induced by CSA has a different pathogenetic mechanism .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Receptor mechanisms of nicotine - induced locomotor hyperactivity in chronic nicotine - treated rats .
O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O
Rats were pretreated with saline or nicotine ( 1 . 5 mg / kg per day ) by subcutaneously implanting each animal with an Alzet osmotic mini - pump which
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
continuously released saline or nicotine for 1 , 5 and 14 days .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O
At the end of each pretreatment period , animals were used for ( i ) determining their locomotor response to acutely injected nicotine ( 0 . 2 mg / kg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
, s . c . ) and ( ii ) measuring the density of L - [ 3H ] nicotine and [ 3H ] spiperone binding sites in the striatum
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O
.
O
We observed no changes in nicotine - induced locomotor response , striatal L - [ 3H ] nicotine and [ 3H ] spiperone binding in the animals pretreated with
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O
nicotine for 1 day .
B O O O O
In rats which were pretreated with nicotine for 5 days , there was a significant increase in the nicotine - stimulated locomotor response which was associated with an increase in
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
the number of L - [ 3H ] nicotine binding sites and also with an elevated dopamine ( DA ) level in the striatum .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
The number of striatal [ 3H ] spiperone binding sites was not affected .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
In animals pretreated with nicotine for 14 days , the nicotine - induced locomotor response remained to be potentiated .
O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
However , this response was correlated with an elevated number of striatal [ 3H ] spiperone binding sites , whereas the number of striatal L - [ 3H ]
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
nicotine binding sites and the striatal DA level were normal .
B O O O O O B O O O O
These results suggest that chronic nicotine - treated rats develop locomotor hyperactivity in response to nicotine initially due to increases of both the density of nicotinic receptors and DA concentration
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
, followed by inducing DA receptor supersensitivity in the striatum .
O O O O B O O O O O O
Hydrocortisone - induced hypertension in humans : pressor responsiveness and sympathetic function .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Oral hydrocortisone increases blood pressure and enhances pressor responsiveness in normal human subjects .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
We studied the effects of 1 week of oral hydrocortisone ( 200 mg / day ) on blood pressure , cardiac output , total peripheral resistance , forearm vascular resistance
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and norepinephrine spillover to plasma in eight healthy male volunteers .

Effects of suprofen on the isolated perfused rat kidney .
O O B O O O O O O O
Although suprofen has been associated with the development of acute renal failure in greater than 100 subjects , the mechanism of damage remains unclear .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The direct nephrotoxic effects of a single dose of 15 mg of suprofen were compared in the recirculating isolated rat kidney perfused with cell - free buffer with or without
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the addition of 5 mg / dL of uric acid .
O O O O O O O O B I O
There were no significant differences in renal sodium excretion , oxygen consumption , or urinary flow rates in kidneys perfused with suprofen compared with the drug - free control groups
O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
.
O
In contrast , a significant decline in glomerular filtration rate was found after the introduction of suprofen to the kidney perfused with uric acid ; no changes were found with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B I O O O O O O
suprofen in the absence of uric acid .
B O O O O B I O
A significant decrease in the baseline excretion rate of uric acid was found in rats given suprofen , compared with drug - free controls .
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
However , the fractional excretion of uric acid was unchanged between the groups over the experimental period .
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
In summary , suprofen causes acute declines in renal function , most likely by directly altering the intrarenal distribution of uric acid .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Cocaine - induced brainstem seizures and behavior .
B O O O O O O O
A variety of abnormal sensory / motor behaviors associated with electrical discharges recorded from the bilateral brainstem were induced in adult WKY rats by mechanical ( electrode implants ) and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DC electrical current stimulations and by acute and chronic administration of cocaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The electrode implant implicated one side or the other of the reticular system of the brainstem but subjects were not incapacitated by the stimulations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cocaine ( 40 mg / kg ) was injected subcutaneously for an acute experiment and subsequent 20 mg / kg doses twice daily for 3 days in a chronic study
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Cocaine generated more abnormal behaviors in the brainstem perturbation group , especially the electrically perturbated subjects .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The abnormal behaviors were yawning , retrocollis , hyperactivity , hypersensitivity , """" beating drum """" behavior , squealing , head bobbing , circling , sniffing , abnormal posturing ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and facial twitching .
O O O O
Shifts in the power frequency spectra of the discharge patterns were noted between quiet and pacing behavioral states .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hypersensitivity to various auditory , tactile , and visual stimulation was present and shifts in the brainstem ambient power spectral frequency occurred in response to tactile stimulation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings suggest that the brainstem generates and propagates pathological discharges that can be elicited by mechanical and DC electrical perturbation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cocaine was found to activate the discharge system and thus induce abnormal behaviors that are generated at the discharge site and at distant sites to which the discharge propagates .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cognitive functions may also be involved since dopaminergic and serotonergic cellular elements at the brainstem level are also implicated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Increased sulfation and decreased 7alpha - hydroxylation of deoxycholic acid in ethinyl estradiol - induced cholestasis in rats .
O O O O O O O O B I O B I O O O O O O
Deoxycholic acid conjugation , transport capacity , and metabolism were compared in control and ethinyl estradiol - treated rats .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
Control rats were found to have a lower capacity to transport deoxycholic acid than taurodeoxycholic acid , and both were decreased by ethinyl estradiol treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B I O O O O O O B I O O
During [ 24 - 14C ] sodium deoxycholate infusion , [ 14C ] biliary bile acid secretion increased , but bile flow did not change significantly in either control or
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ethinyl estradiol - treated rats .
B I O O O O
Ethinyl estradiol - treated animals excreted significantly less 14C as taurocholic acid than did control animals , consistent with an impairment of 7alpha - hydroxylation of taurodeoxycholic acid .
B I O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Ethinyl estradiol treatment did not impair conjugation of deoxycholic acid , but did result in an increase in sulfation of taurodeoxycholic acid from 1 . 5 % in controls to
B I O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
nearly 4 . 0 % ( P less than 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results are consistent with the hypothesis that the rat has a poorer tolerance for deoxycholic acid than do certain other species .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O
Furthermore , the rat converts deoxycholic acid , a poor choleretic , to taurocholic acid , a good choleretic .
O O O O O B I O O O O O O B I O O O O O
When this conversion is impaired with ethinyl estradiol treatment , sulfation may be an important alternate pathway for excretion of this potentially harmful bile acid .
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Effects of ouabain on myocardial oxygen supply and demand in patients with chronic coronary artery disease .
O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
A hemodynamic , volumetric , and metabolic study in patients without heart failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effects of digitalis glycosides on myocardial oxygen supply and demand are of particular interest in the presence of obstructive coronary artery disease , but have not been measured previously
O O O B I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in man .
O O O
We assessed the effects of ouabain ( 0 . 015 mg / kg body weight ) on hemodynamic , volumetric , and metabolic parameters in 11 patients with severe chronic
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
coronary artery disease without clinical congestive heart failure .
O O O O O O O O O
Because the protocol was long and involved interventions which might affect the determinations , we also studied in nine patients using an identical protocol except that ouabain administration was omitted
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
.
O
Left ventricular end - diastolic pressure and left ventricular end - diastolic volume fell in each patient given ouabain , even though they were initially elevated in only two patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Left ventricular end - diastolic pressure fell from 11 . 5 + / - 1 . 4 ( mean + / - SE ) to 5 . 6 + /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- 0 . 9 mm Hg ( P less than 0 . 001 ) and left ventricular end - diastolic volume fell from 100 + / - 17 to 82
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
+ / - 12 ml / m2 ( P less than 0 . 01 ) 1 h after ouabain infusion was completed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The maximum velocity of contractile element shortening increased from 1 . 68 + / - 0 . 11 ml / s to 2 . 18 + / - 0 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
21 muscle - lengths / s ( P less than 0 . 05 ) and is consistent with an increase in contractility .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No significant change in these parameters occurred in the control patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
No significant change in myocardial oxygen consumption occurred after ouabain administration but this may be related to a greater decrease in mean arterial pressure in the ouabain patients than in
O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
the control patients .
O O O O
We conclude that in patients with chronic coronary artery disease who are not in clinical congestive heart failure left ventricular end - diastolic volume falls after ouabain administration even when
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
it is initially normal .
O O O O O
Though this fall would be associated with a decrease in wall tension , and , therefore , of myocardial oxygen consumption , it may not be of sufficient magnitude to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
prevent a net increase in myocardial oxygen consumption .
O O O O O O B O O
Nevertheless , compensatory mechanisms prevent a deterioration of resting myocardial metabolism .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prolongation of the QT interval related to cisapride - diltiazem interaction .
O O O O O O O B O B O O
Cisapride , a cytochrome P450 3A4 ( CYP3A4 ) substrate , is widely prescribed for the treatment of gastrointestinal motility disorders .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prolongation of QT interval , torsades de pointes , and sudden cardiac death have been reported after concomitant administration with erythromycin or azole antifungal agents , but not with other
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
CYP3A4 inhibitors .
O O O
A possible drug interaction occurred in a 45 - year - old woman who was taking cisapride for gastroesophageal reflux disorder and diltiazem , an agent that has inhibitory effect
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O
on CYP3A4 , for hypertension .
O O O O O O
The patient was in near syncope and had QT - interval prolongation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After discontinuing cisapride , the QT interval returned to normal and symptoms did not recur .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We suggest that caution be taken when cisapride is prescribed with any potent inhibitor of CYP3A4 , including diltiazem .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
Paclitaxel combined with carboplatin in the first - line treatment of advanced ovarian cancer .
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In a phase I study to determine the maximum tolerated dose of paclitaxel ( Taxol ; Bristol - Myers Squibb Company , Princeton , NJ ) given as a 3
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- hour infusion in combination with carboplatin administered every 21 days to women with advanced ovarian cancer , paclitaxel doses were escalated as follows :
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
level 1 , 135 mg / m2 ; level 2 , 160 mg / m2 ; level 3 , 185 mg / m2 ; and level 4 , 210 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
/ m2 .
O O O
The fixed dose of carboplatin at levels 1 through 4 was given to achieve an area under the concentration - time curve ( AUC ) of 5 using the Calvert
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
formula .
O O
In levels 5 and 6 the carboplatin dose was targeted at AUCs of 6 and 7 . 5 , respectively , combined with a fixed paclitaxel dose of 185 mg
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
/ m2 .
O O O
To date , 30 previously untreated patients , all with a good performance status ( Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group 0 to 2 ) have been entered into this ongoing study
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The dose - limiting toxicity of the combination was myelosuppression ( leukopenia , granulocytopenia , and thrombocytopenia ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neurotoxicity was largely moderate .
O O O O O
So far , 14 patients are evaluable for response ; of these , eight ( 57 % ) showed objective ( complete or partial ) response and disease stabilized in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
six patients .
O O O
No patient had disease progression .
O O O O O O
We conclude that the combination of paclitaxel 185 mg / m2 administered as a 3 - hour infusion followed immediately by a 1 - hour infusion of carboplatin at an
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
AUC of 6 can be administered safely in a 21 - day schedule in the outpatient setting .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The recommended dose for phase III studies is paclitaxel 185 mg / m2 and carboplatin AUC 6 .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O
Treatment of tacrolimus - related adverse effects by conversion to cyclosporine in liver transplant recipients .
O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O
When tacrolimus side effects persist despite dose reduction , conversion to cyclosporine - based immunosuppression ( CyA ) is necessary .
O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
We characterized tacrolimus side effects that warranted discontinuation of the drug , and outcomes after conversion .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of 388 liver recipients who received tacrolimus as primary immunosuppression , 70 required conversion to CyA .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
We recorded indication for conversion , whether conversion was early or late after transplantation , tacrolimus dose and trough blood level at conversion , and incidence of rejection after conversion
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Conversion was early in 29 patients ( 41 . 4 % ) and late in 41 ( 58 . 6 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Indications for early conversion were neurotoxicity ( 20 ) , ( insulin - dependent ) diabetes mellitus ( IDDM ) ( 5 ) , nephrotoxicity ( 3 ) , gastrointestinal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( GI ) toxicity ( 6 ) , and cardiomyopathy ( 1 ) , and for late conversion were neurotoxicity ( 15 ) , IDDM ( 12 ) , nephrotoxicity
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 3 ) , GI toxicity ( 5 ) , hepatotoxicity ( 6 ) , post - transplant lmphoproliferate disease ( PTLD ) ( 2 ) , cardiomyopathy ( 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) , hemolytic anemia ( 1 ) , and pruritus ( 1 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All early - conversion patients showed improvement / resolution of symptoms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Among late - conversion patients , 37 ( 90 . 2 % ) had improvement / resolution ; in 4 ( 9 . 8 % ) , adverse effects persisted
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The overall rejection rate was 30 % .
O O O O O O O O
Sixty - two patients ( 88 . 6 % ) are alive with functioning grafts 686 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
362 days ( range , 154 - 1433 days ) after conversion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When tacrolimus side effects are unresponsive to dose reduction , conversion to CyA can be accomplished safely , with no increased risk of rejection and excellent long - term outcome
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Relative efficacy and toxicity of netilmicin and tobramycin in oncology patients .
O O O O O B O B O O O O
We prospectively compared the efficacy and safety of netilmicin sulfate or tobramycin sulfate in conjunction with piperacillin sodium in 118 immunocompromised patients with presumed severe infections .
O O O O O O O O B I O B I O O O B I O O O O O O O O O
The two treatment regimens were equally efficacious .
O O O O O O O O
Nephrotoxicity occurred in a similar proportion in patients treated with netilmicin and tobramycin ( 17 % vs 11 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
Ototoxicity occurred in four ( 9 . 5 % ) of 42 netilmicin and piperacillin and in 12 ( 22 % ) of 54 tobramycin and piperacillin - treated patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
.
O
Of those evaluated with posttherapy audiograms , three of four netilmicin and piperacillin - treated patients had auditory thresholds return to baseline compared with one of nine tobramycin and
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
piperacillin - treated patients .
B O O O O
The number of greater than or equal to 15 - dB increases in auditory threshold as a proportion of total greater than or equal to 15 - dB changes (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
increases and decreases ) was significantly lower in netilmicin and piperacillin - vs tobramycin and piperacillin - treated patients ( 18 of 78 vs 67 of 115 ) .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We conclude that aminoglycoside - associated ototoxicity was less severe and more often reversible with netilmicin than with tobramycin .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O
Effect of prostaglandin synthetase inhibitors on experimentally induced convulsions in rats .
O O B O O O O O O O O O
To investigate the relationship of prostaglandins ( PGs ) to seizure induction , the effects of six PG synthetase inhibitors on convulsions induced by flurothyl , picrotoxin , pentetrazol (
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O
PTZ ) , electroshock or bicuculline were evaluated .
B O O O O B O O O
Ibuprofen , sulindac , mefenamic acid , and low dose meclofenamic acid increased the latency - to - onset in the flurothyl and / or PTZ models ; the electroshock
B O B O B I O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O
, picrotoxin and bicuculline models were not significantly affected by any of the pretreatment agents .
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that PGs are involved in the mechanism ( s ) underlying fluorthyl - and PTZ - induced convulsions , but not picrotoxin - , electroshock - ,
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O
or bicuculline - induced convulsions .
O B O O O O
Angiotensin - converting enzyme ( ACE ) inhibitor - associated angioedema of the stomach and small intestine : a case report .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This is a case report on a 45 - year old African - American female with newly diagnosed hypertension , who was started on a combination pill of amlodipine /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
benazapril 10 / 5 mg .
B O O O O O
The very next day , she presented at the emergency room ( ER ) with abdominal pain , nausea and vomiting .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Physical exam , complete metabolic panel , and hemogram were in the normal range .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
She was discharged from the ER after a few hours of treatment with fluid and analgesics .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , she returned to the ER the next day with the same complaints .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This time the physical exam was significant for a distended abdomen with dullness to percussion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CT scan of the abdomen revealed markedly thickened antrum of the stomach , duodenum and jejunum , along with fluid in the abdominal and pelvic cavity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitor ( ACEI ) - induced angioedema was suspected , and anti - hypertensive medications were discontinued .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Her symptoms improved within the next 24 hours , and repeat CT after 72 hours revealed marked improvement in stomach and small bowel thickening and resolution of ascites .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The recognition of angiotensin - converting enzyme ( ACE ) and angiotensin receptor blocker ( ARB ) intestinal angioedema constitutes a challenge to primary care physicians , internists , emergency
O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
room personal and surgeons .
O O O O O
Valproic acid
B I
I : time course of lipid peroxidation biomarkers , liver toxicity , and valproic acid metabolite levels in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
A single dose of valproic acid ( VPA ) , which is a widely used antiepileptic drug , is associated with oxidative stress in rats , as recently demonstrated by
O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
elevated levels of 15 - F ( 2t ) - isoprostane ( 15 - F ( 2t ) - IsoP ) .
O O O B I I I I I I I O B I I I I I I I O O
To determine whether there was a temporal relationship between VPA - associated oxidative stress and hepatotoxicity , adult male Sprague - Dawley rats were treated ip with VPA ( 500
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
mg / kg ) or 0 . 9 % saline ( vehicle ) once daily for 2 , 4 , 7 , 10 , or 14 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Oxidative stress was assessed by determining plasma and liver levels of 15 - F ( 2t ) - IsoP , lipid hydroperoxides ( LPO ) , and
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I I O B I O B O O O
thiobarbituric acid reactive substances ( TBARs ) .
B I I I O B O O
Plasma and liver 15 - F ( 2t ) - IsoP were elevated and reached a plateau after day 2 of VPA treatment compared to control .
O O O B I I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Liver LPO levels were not elevated until day 7 of treatment ( 1 . 8 - fold versus control , p < 0 . 05 ) .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Liver and plasma TBARs were not increased until 14 days ( 2 - fold vs . control , p < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Liver toxicity was evaluated based on serum levels of alpha - glutathione S - transferase ( alpha - GST ) and by histology .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Serum alpha - GST levels were significantly elevated by day 4 , which corresponded to hepatotoxicity as shown by the increasing incidence of inflammation of the liver capsule , necrosis
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and steatosis throughout the study .
O O O O O O O
The liver levels of beta - oxidation metabolites of VPA were decreased by day 14 , while the levels of 4 - ene - VPA and ( E ) -
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O O O O O
2 , 4 - diene - VPA were not elevated throughout the study .
B I I I I I I O O O O O O O
Overall , these findings indicate that VPA treatment results in oxidative stress , as measured by levels of 15 - F ( 2t ) - IsoP , which precedes the
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I I O O O O
onset of necrosis , steatosis , and elevated levels of serum alpha - GST .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pheochromocytoma unmasked by amisulpride and tiapride .
O O O B O B O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To describe the unmasking of pheochromocytoma in a patient treated with amisulpride and tiapride .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
CASE SUMMARY :
O O O
A 42 - year - old white man developed acute hypertension with severe headache and vomiting 2 hours after the first doses of amisulpride 100 mg and tiapride 100 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O
.
O
Both drugs were immediately discontinued , and the patient recovered after subsequent nicardipine and verapamil treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
Abdominal ultrasound showed an adrenal mass , and postoperative histologic examination confirmed the diagnosis of pheochromocytoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
Drug - induced symptoms of pheochromocytoma are often associated with the use of substituted benzamide drugs , but the underlying mechanism is unknown .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
In our case , use of the Naranjo probability scale indicated a possible relationship between the hypertensive crisis and amisulpride and tiapride therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
As of March 24 , 2005 , this is the first reported case of amisulpride - and tiapride - induced hypertensive crisis in a patient with pheochromocytoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Physicians and other healthcare professionals should be aware of this potential adverse effect of tiapride and amisulpride .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Quantitative drug levels in stimulant psychosis : relationship to symptom severity , catecholamines and hyperkinesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
To examine the relationship between quantitative stimulant drug levels , catecholamines , and psychotic symptoms , nineteen patients in a psychiatric emergency service with a diagnosis of amphetamine - or
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
cocaine - induced psychosis were interviewed , and plasma and urine were collected for quantitative assays of stimulant drug and catecholamine metabolite levels .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Methamphetamine or amphetamine levels were related to several psychopathology scores and the global hyperkinesia rating .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
HVA levels were related to global hyperkinesia but not to psychopathology ratings .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although many other factors such as sensitization may play a role , intensity of stimulant - induced psychotic symptoms and stereotypies appears to be at least in part dose -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
related .
O O
Delayed asystolic cardiac arrest after diltiazem overdose ; resuscitation with high dose intravenous calcium .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O
A 51 year old man took a mixed overdose including 1 . 8 - 3 . 6 g of diltiazem , paracetamol , aspirin , isosorbide nitrate , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O B B O O
alcohol .
B O
He initially presented to hospital after six hours with mild hypotension and was treated with activated charcoal and intravenous fluids .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Eighteen hours after the overdose he had two generalised tonic - clonic seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient remained unresponsive with junctional bradycardia , unrecordable blood pressure , and then became asystolic .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He was resuscitated with high dose ( 13 . 5 g ) intravenous calcium and adrenaline ( epinephrine ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O
He required inotropic support and temporary pacing over the next 48 hours .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This case suggests there is a role for aggressive high dose intravenous calcium therapy in severe diltiazem overdose , particularly with the onset of asystole .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O
It should be considered early in cases of cardiac arrest after diltiazem overdose .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The case also highlights the problems with delayed toxicity when whole bowel irrigation is not administered .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal papillary necrosis due to naproxen .
O O O O O B O
A 31 - year - old man with rheumatoid arthritis , who had previously been treated with sulindac , fenoprofen calcium , high dose salicylates and gold salts , developed
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I O O O B O B O O O
renal papillary necrosis ( RPN ) 4 months after institution of naproxen therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
No other factor predisposing to RPN could be discovered .
O O O O O O O O O O
Sulindac was substituted for naproxen and no further adverse renal effects occurred over the next 12 months .
B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We review previous reports linking RPN to antiinflammatory drug use and discuss possible advantages of sulindac in patients who have experienced renal toxicity from other antiinflammatory agents .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adverse interaction between beta - adrenergic blocking drugs and verapamil - - report of three cases .
O O O B I I I I O B O O O O O O O
Three patients with ischaemic heart disease developed profound cardiac failure , hypotension and bradycardia during combined therapy with verapamil and beta - adrenergic blocking drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I I I O
This clinical picture resolved completely with cessation of the combined therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Baseline left ventricular function , assessed by cardiac catheterisation or nuclear angiography , was normal in two patients and only mildly reduced in the other .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Simultaneously administration of beta - adrenergic blocking drugs and verapamil may result in profound adverse interactions and should only be administered with great caution .
O O O B I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adverse reactions to bendrofluazide and propranolol for the treatment of mild hypertension .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O
Report of Medical Research Council Working Party on Mild to Moderate Hypertension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Participants in the Medical Research Council treatment trial for mild hypertension are randomly allocated to one of four treatment groups : bendrofluazide , propranolol , or a placebo for either
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
of these drugs .
O O O O
The trial is single - blind .
O O O O O O O
23 582 patient - years of observation have been completed so far , 10 684 on active drugs and 12 898 on placebos .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results show an association between bendrofluazide treatment and impotence , and impotence also occurred more frequently in patients taking propranolol than in those taking placebos .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Other adverse reactions significantly linked with active drugs include impaired glucose tolerance in men and women and gout in men , associated with bendrofluazide treatment , and Raynaud 's phenomenon
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
and dyspnoea in men and women taking propranolol .
O O O O O O O B O
No corneal disease is known to have occurred in the propranolol group .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Mean serum potassium level fell , and urea and uric acid levels rose , in men and women taking bendrofluazide .
O O B O O O O B O B I O O O O O O O O B O
In the propranolol group , serum potassium and uric acid levels rose in both sexes , but the urea level rose significantly in women only .
O O B O O O B O B I O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Dexmedetomidine and cardiac protection for non - cardiac surgery : a meta - analysis of randomised controlled trials .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We conducted a systematic review of the effects of dexmedetomidine on cardiac outcomes following non - cardiac surgery .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
We included prospective , randomised peri - operative studies of dexmedetomidine that reported mortality , cardiac morbidity or adverse drug events .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
A PubMed Central and EMBASE search was conducted up to July 2007 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The reference lists of identified papers were examined for further trials .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of 425 studies identified , 20 were included in the meta - analysis ( 840 patients ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dexmedetomidine was associated with a trend towards improved cardiac outcomes ; all - cause mortality ( OR 0 . 27 , 95 % CI 0 . 01 - 7 .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
13 , p = 0 . 44 ) , non - fatal myocardial infarction ( OR 0 . 26 , 95 % CI 0 . 04 - 1 . 60
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, p = 0 . 14 ) , and myocardial ischaemia ( OR 0 . 65 , 95 % CI 0 . 26 - 1 . 63 , p =
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 36 ) .
O O O O O
Peri - operative hypotension ( 26 % , OR 3 . 80 , 95 % CI 1 . 91 - 7 . 54 , p = 0 . 0001 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and bradycardia ( 17 % , OR 5 . 45 , 95 % CI 2 . 98 - 9 . 95 , p < 0 . 00001 ) were significantly
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
increased .
O O
An anticholinergic did not reduce the incidence of bradycardia ( p = 0 . 43 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A randomised placebo - controlled trial of dexmedetomidine is warranted .
O O O O O O O B O O O
Differential diagnosis of high serum creatine kinase levels in systemic lupus erythematosus .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
We report the clinical and bioptic findings for a 57 - year - old woman with severe chloroquine - induced myopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Since 1989 , she had been suffering from systemic lupus erythematosus ( SLE ) with renal involvement and undergone periods of treatment with azathioprine and cyclophosphamide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Additional therapy with chloroquine ( CQ ) was started because of arthralgia .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O
At the same time , slightly increased creatine kinase ( CK ) levels were noted .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Myositis was suspected , and the patient was treated with steroids .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
The CK increase persisted , however , and she developed progressive muscular weakness and muscular atrophy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Routine controls revealed markedly elevated CK levels of 1 , 700 U / l .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The neurological and electrophysiological findings were not typical of myositis .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Thus , muscle biopsy of the deltoid muscle was performed in order to exclude polymyositis or toxic myopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As it revealed chloroquine - induced myopathy , medication was stopped .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
Discriminating between primary SLE - induced affection of the musculoskeletal system and drug - induced side effects is important for appropriate treatment of SLE patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intravenous ribavirin treatment for severe adenovirus disease in immunocompromised children .
O B O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : Adenovirus is an important cause of morbidity and mortality in the immunocompromised host .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of severe adenovirus disease in pediatrics is increasing in association with growing numbers of immunocompromised children , where case fatality rates as high as 50 % to 80
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% have been reported .
O O O O O
There are no approved antiviral agents with proven efficacy for the treatment of severe adenovirus disease , nor are there any prospective randomized , controlled trials of potentially useful anti
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- adenovirus therapies .
O O O O
Apparent clinical success in the treatment of severe adenovirus disease is limited to a few case reports and small series .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Experience is greatest with intravenous ribavirin and cidofovir .
O O O O O B O B O
Ribavirin , a guanosine analogue , has broad antiviral activity against both RNA and DNA viruses , including documented activity against adenovirus in vitro .
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ribavirin is licensed in aerosol form for the treatment of respiratory syncytial virus infection , and orally in combination with interferon to treat hepatitis C . Intravenous ribavirin is the
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
treatment of choice for infection with hemorrhagic fever viruses .
O O O O O O O O O O
The most common adverse effect of intravenous ribavirin is reversible mild anemia .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
The use of cidofovir in severe adenovirus infection has been limited by adverse effects , the most significant of which is nephrotoxicity .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
We report our experience with intravenous ribavirin therapy for severe adenovirus disease in a series of immunocompromised children and review the literature .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DESIGN / METHODS :
O O O O
We retrospectively reviewed the medical records of 5 children treated with intravenous ribavirin for documented severe adenovirus disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Two patients developed adenovirus hemorrhagic cystitis after cardiac and bone marrow transplants , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The bone marrow transplant patient also received intravenous cidofovir for progressive disseminated disease .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
An additional 3 children developed adenovirus pneumonia ; 2 were neonates , 1 of whom had partial DiGeorge syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The remaining infant had recently undergone a cardiac transplant .
O O O O O O O O O O
Intravenous ribavirin was administered on a compassionate - use protocol .
O B O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Complete clinical recovery followed later by viral clearance was observed in 2 children : the cardiac transplant recipient with adenovirus hemorrhagic cystitis and the immunocompetent neonate with adenovirus pneumonia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The remaining 3 children died of adenovirus disease .
O O O O O O O O O
Intravenous ribavirin therapy was well tolerated .
O B O O O O O
Use of cidofovir in 1 child was associated with progressive renal failure and neutropenia .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
Our series of patients is representative of the spectrum of immunocompromised children at greatest risk for severe adenovirus disease , namely solid - organ and bone marrow transplant recipients ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
neonates , and children with immunodeficiency .
O O O O O O O
Although intravenous ribavirin was not effective for all children with severe adenovirus disease in this series or in the literature , therapy is unlikely to be of benefit if begun
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
late in the course of the infection .
O O O O O O O O
Early identification , eg by polymerase chain reaction of those patients at risk of disseminated adenovirus disease may permit earlier antiviral treatment and better evaluation of therapeutic response .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Two of 5 children with severe adenovirus disease treated with intravenous ribavirin recovered .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The availability of newer rapid diagnostic techniques , such as polymerase chain reaction , may make earlier , more effective treatment of adenovirus infection possible .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Given the seriousness and increasing prevalence of adenovirus disease in certain hosts , especially children , a large , multicenter clinical trial of potentially useful anti - adenoviral therapies ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
such as intravenous ribavirin , is clearly required to demonstrate the most effective and least toxic therapy .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hepatotoxicity of amiodarone .
O O B O
Amiodarone has proved very effective in the treatment of otherwise resistant cardiac tachyarrhythmias .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The use of amiodarone has , however , been limited due to its serious side - effects .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A patient with cholestatic hepatitis due to amiodarone treatment is presented below and a review of the hepatotoxicity of amiodarone is given .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
It is concluded that solid evidence exists of hepatic injury due to amiodarone treatment , including steatosis , alterations resembling alcoholic hepatitis , cholestatic hepatitis and micronodular cirrhosis of the
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
liver .
O O
Patients receiving amiodarone should be regularly screened with respect to hepatic enzyme levels .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Therapy should be discontinued on the suspicion of cholestatic injury or hepatomegaly .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Catalepsy induced by combinations of ketamine and morphine : potentiation , antagonism , tolerance and cross - tolerance in the rat .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Previous studies demonstrated that both ketamine and morphine induced analgesia and catalepsy in the rat . Pre - treatment with ketamine produced cross - tolerance to morphine , whereas pretreatment
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O
with morphine did not induce cross - tolerance to ketamine but rather augmented the cataleptic response ; this augmentation was attributed to residual morphine in the brain .
O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The present studies explored the duration of the loss of righting reflex induced by sub - effective doses of ketamine and morphine , administered simultaneously .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
There was mutual potentiation between sub - effective doses of ketamine and morphine , but sub - effective doses of ketamine partly antagonized fully - effective doses of morphine .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O
Latency to the loss of righting reflex , rigidity and behavior on recovery , reflected the relative predominance of ketamine or morphine in each combination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
Naloxone inhibited the induced cataleptic effects .
B O O O O O O
The degree and time course of development of tolerance to daily administration of sub - effective dose combinations of ketamine and morphine were similar .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
Rats , tolerant to ketamine - dominant combinations , were cross - tolerant to both drugs , while those tolerant to morphine - dominant combinations were cross - tolerant to
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
morphine but showed either no cross - tolerance or an augmented response to ketamine .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
While the mutual potentiation , antagonism and tolerance suggest common mechanisms for the induced catalepsy , differences in latency , rigidity and behavior , asymmetry of cross - tolerance and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a widely - different ID50 for naloxone would argue against an action at a single opioid site .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute renal failure in patients with AIDS on tenofovir while receiving prolonged vancomycin course for osteomyelitis .
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O
Renal failure developed after a prolonged course of vancomycin therapy in 2 patients who were receiving tenofovir disoproxil fumarate as part of an antiretroviral regimen .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O
Tenofovir has been implicated in the development of Fanconi syndrome and renal insufficiency because of its effects on the proximal renal tubule .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Vancomycin nephrotoxicity is infrequent but may result from coadministration with a nephrotoxic agent .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinicians should be aware that tenofovir may raise the risk of renal failure during prolonged administration of vancomycin .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Delayed leukoencephalopathy with stroke - like presentation in chemotherapy recipients .
O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
A transient leukoencephalopathy mimicking cerebrovascular accident has been described as a complication of chemotherapy , most commonly in recipients of intrathecal methotrexate for childhood leukaemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Recently published neuroimaging data suggest a common pathophysiology associated with a variety of chemotherapy agents and modes of administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We reviewed the medical literature for single reports and case series of patients presenting with stroke - like episodes while receiving systemic or intrathecal chemotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We only included studies providing detailed neuroimaging data .
O O O O O O O O O
Patients with cerebrovascular accidents were excluded .
O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
We identified 27 reports of toxic leukoencephalopathy in patients treated with methotrexate ( intrathecal , systemic ) , 5 - fluorouracil and its derivative carmofur , and capecitabine .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B I I O O O B O O B O
Diffusion weighted imaging ( DWI ) of all patients revealed well demarcated hyperintense lesions within the subcortical white matter of the cerebral hemispheres and the corpus callosum , corresponding to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
areas of decreased proton diffusion on apparent diffusion coefficient ( ADC ) maps ( available in 21 / 27 patients ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lesions exceeded the confines of adjacent vascular territories .
O O O O O O O O O
Complete resolution of symptoms within 1 - 4 days was accompanied by normalisation of ADC abnormalities .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , fluid attenuated inversion recovery ( FLAIR ) sequences frequently revealed persistent white matter abnormalities .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Several pathophysiological models of delayed leukoencephalopathy after exposure to intrathecal or systemic chemotherapy have been proposed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DWI findings in this cohort are indicative of cytotoxic oedema within cerebral white matter and lend support to an at least partially reversible metabolic derangement as the basis for this
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
syndrome .
O O
Down - regulation of norepinephrine transporter function induced by chronic administration of desipramine linking to the alteration of sensitivity of local - anesthetics - induced convulsions and the counteraction by
O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
co - administration with local anesthetics .
O O O O O O O
Alterations of norepinephrine transporter ( NET ) function by chronic inhibition of NET in relation to sensitization to seizures induce by cocaine and local anesthetics were studied in mice .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Daily administration of desipramine , an inhibitor of the NET , for 5 days decreased [ ( 3 ) H ] norepinephrine uptake in the P2 fractions of hippocampus but
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
not cortex , striatum or amygdalae .
O O O O O O O
Co -
O O
administration of lidocaine , bupivacaine or tricaine with desipramine reversed this effect .
O O B O B O B O B O O O O
Daily treatment of cocaine increased [ ( 3 ) H ] norepinephrine uptake into the hippocampus .
O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Daily administration of desipramine increased the incidence of appearance of lidocaine - induced convulsions and decreased that of cocaine - induced convulsions .
O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O
Co -
O O
administration of lidocaine with desipramine reversed the changes of convulsive activity of lidocaine and cocaine induced by repeated administration of desipramine .
O O B O B O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O B O
These results suggest that down - regulation of hippocampal NET induced by chronic administration of desipramine may be relevant to desipramine - induced sensitization of lidocaine convulsions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O B O O
Inhibition of Na ( + ) channels by local anesthetics may regulate desipramine - induced down - regulation of NET function .
O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Repeated administration of cocaine induces up - regulation of hippocampal NET function .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Desipramine - induced sensitization of lidocaine seizures may have a mechanism distinct from kindling resulting from repeated administration of cocaine .
B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Definition and management of anemia in patients infected with hepatitis C virus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Chronic infection with hepatitis C virus ( HCV ) can progress to cirrhosis , hepatocellular carcinoma , and end - stage liver disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The current best treatment for HCV infection is combination therapy with pegylated interferon and ribavirin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Although this regimen produces sustained virologic responses ( SVRs ) in approximately 50 % of patients , it can be associated with a potentially dose - limiting hemolytic anemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hemoglobin concentrations decrease mainly as a result of ribavirin - induced hemolysis , and this anemia can be problematic in patients with HCV infection , especially those who have comorbid
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
renal or cardiovascular disorders .
O O O O O
In general , anemia can increase the risk of morbidity and mortality , and may have negative effects on cerebral function and quality of life .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although ribavirin - associated anemia can be reversed by dose reduction or discontinuation , this approach compromises outcomes by significantly decreasing SVR rates .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recombinant human erythropoietin has been used to manage ribavirin - associated anemia but has other potential disadvantages .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Viramidine , a liver - targeting prodrug of ribavirin , has the potential to maintain the virologic efficacy of ribavirin while decreasing the risk of hemolytic anemia in patients with
B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
chronic hepatitis C .
O O O O
Calcium carbonate toxicity : the updated milk - alkali syndrome ; report of 3 cases and review of the literature .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To describe 3 patients with calcium carbonate - induced hypercalcemia and gain insights into the cause and management of the milk - alkali syndrome .
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We report the clinical and laboratory data in 3 patients who presented with severe hypercalcemia ( corrected serum calcium > or = 14 mg / dL ) and review the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
pertinent literature on milk - alkali syndrome .
O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The 3 patients had acute renal insufficiency , relative metabolic alkalosis , and low parathyroid hormone ( PTH ) , PTH - related peptide , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 , 25 - dihydroxyvitamin D concentrations .
B I I I I I O O
No malignant lesion was found .
O O O O O O
Treatment included aggressive hydration and varied amounts of furosemide .
O O O O O O O O B O
The 2 patients with the higher serum calcium concentrations received pamidronate intravenously ( 60 and 30 mg , respectively ) , which caused severe hypocalcemia .
O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of the 3 patients , 2 were ingesting acceptable doses of elemental calcium ( 1 g and 2 g daily , respectively ) in the form of calcium carbonate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
In addition to our highlighted cases , we review the history , classification , pathophysiologic features , and treatment of milk - alkali syndrome and summarize the cases reported from
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
early 1995 to November 2003 .
O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Milk - alkali syndrome may be a common cause of unexplained hypercalcemia and can be precipitated by small amounts of orally ingested calcium carbonate in susceptible persons .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
Treatment with hydration , furosemide , and discontinuation of the calcium and vitamin D source is adequate .
O O O O B O O O O O B O B I O O O O
Pamidronate treatment is associated with considerable risk for hypocalcemia , even in cases of initially severe hypercalcemia .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Management strategies for ribavirin - induced hemolytic anemia in the treatment of hepatitis C : clinical and economic implications .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
Recently published studies have demonstrated increased efficacy and cost - effectiveness of combination therapy with interferon and alpha - 2b / ribavirin compared with interferon - alpha monotherapy in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B I I O O O
treatment of chronic hepatitis C ( CHC ) .
O O O O O O O O O
Combination therapy is associated with a clinically important adverse effect : ribavirin - induced hemolytic anemia ( RIHA ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The objective of this study was to evaluate the direct health - care costs and management of RIHA during treatment of CHC in a clinical trial setting .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
A systematic literature review was conducted to synthesize information on the incidence and management of RIHA .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Decision - analytic techniques were used to estimate the cost of treating RIHA .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Uncertainty was evaluated using sensitivity analyses .
O O O O O O O
RESULTS : RIHA , defined as a reduction in hemoglobin to less than 100 g / L , occurs in approximately 7 % to 9 % of patients treated with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
combination therapy .
O O O
The standard of care for management of RIHA is reduction or discontinuation of the ribavirin dosage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
We estimated the direct cost of treating clinically significant RIHA to be 170 per patient receiving combination therapy per 48 - week treatment course ( range
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
68 - 692 ) .
O O O O O
The results of the one - way sensitivity analyses ranged from 57 to 317 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In comparison , the cost of 48 weeks of combination therapy is 16 , 459 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The direct cost of treating clinically significant RIHA is 1 % ( 170 / 16 , 459 ) of drug treatment costs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Questions remain about the optimal dose of ribavirin and the incidence of RIHA in a real - world population .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Despite these uncertainties , this initial evaluation of the direct cost of treating RIHA provides an estimate of the cost and management implications of this clinically important adverse effect .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effects of amine pretreatment on ketamine catatonia in pinealectomized or hypophysectomized animals .
O O B O O B O O O O O O O
The present studies were designed to clarify the role of catecholamines and pineal idolamines on ketamine - induced catatonia in the intact , pinealectomized or hypophysectomized chick and rat .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the pinealectomized chick , pretreatment with dopamine increased the duration of catatonia ( DOC ) after ketamine , but pretreatment with norepinephrine did not .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O
The pineal indolamines exhibited mixed actions .
O O O O O O O
Serotonin and N - acetyl serotonin which augmented ketamine DOC , did not do so in the absence of the pineal gland , whereas melatonin potentiated the ketamine DOC in
B O B I I I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O
both the intact and pinealectomized chick .
O O O O O O O
Ketamine was more potent in the hypophysectomized chick and the circadian rhythm noted in the intact chick was absent ; furthermore , melatonin did not augment the ketamine DOC whereas
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O
dopamine continued to do so .
B O O O O O
This study did not demonstrate a species difference regarding the role of the amines on the pineal in spite of the immature blood - brain barrier in the young chick
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and the intact barrier in the rat .
O O O O O O O O
In addition , these data indicate a direct role of the pituitary in the augmentation of ketamine DOC induced by melatonin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O
Furthermore , dopamine appeared to act on systems more closely involved with the induction of ketamine catatonia rather than directly on the pituitary .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Multicenter , double - blind , multiple - dose , parallel - groups efficacy and safety trial of azelastine , chlorpheniramine , and placebo in the treatment of spring allergic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
rhinitis .
O O
Azelastine , a novel antiallergic medication , was compared with chlorpheniramine maleate and placebo for efficacy and safety in the treatment of spring allergic rhinitis in a multicenter , double
B O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- blind , multiple - dose , parallel - groups study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
One hundred fifty - five subjects participated .
O O O O O O O O
Subjects ranged in age from 18 to 60 years of age and had at least a 2 - year history of spring allergic rhinitis , confirmed by positive skin test
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to spring aeroallergens .
O O O O
Medications were given four times daily ; the azelastine groups received 0 . 5 , 1 . 0 , or 2 . 0 mg in the morning and evening with
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
placebo in the early and late afternoon ; the chlorpheniramine group received 4 . 0 mg four times daily .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Daily subject symptom cards were completed during a screening period to assess pretreatment symptoms and during a 4 - week treatment period while subjects received study medications .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Individual symptoms , total symptoms , and major symptoms were compared to determine efficacy of medication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Elicited , volunteered , and observed adverse experiences were recorded for each subject and compared among groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Vital signs , body weights , serum chemistry values , complete blood cell counts , urine studies , and electrocardiograms were obtained for each subject and compared among groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Symptoms relief in the group receiving the highest concentration of azelastine ( 2 . 0 mg twice daily ) was statistically greater than in the placebo group during all weeks
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of the study .
O O O O
Lower doses of azelastine were statistically more effective than placebo only during portions of the first 3 weeks of the study .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , although the chlorpheniramine group did have fewer symptoms than the placebo group during the study , the difference never reached statistical significance during any week of the
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
study .
O O
There were no serious side effects in any of the treatment groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Drowsiness and altered taste perception were increased significantly over placebo only in the high - dose azelastine group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Azelastine appears to be a safe , efficacious medication for seasonal allergic rhinitis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Obsolete but dangerous antacid preparations .
O O O O O O
One case of acute hypercalcaemia and two of recurrent nephrolithiasis are reported in patients who had regularly consumed large amounts of calcium carbon - ate - sodium bicarbonate powders for
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O B I O O
more than 20 years .
O O O O O
The powders had been obtained from pharmacists unknown to the patients ' medical practitioners .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is suggested that these preparations were responsible for the patient 's problems , and that such powders should no longer be freely obtainable .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prolonged paralysis due to nondepolarizing neuromuscular blocking agents and corticosteroids .
O O O O B I I I O B O
The long - term use of nondepolarizing neuromuscular blocking agents ( ND - NMBA ) has recently been implicated as a cause of prolonged muscle weakness , although the site
O O O O O O B I I I O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of the lesion and the predisposing factors have been unclear .
O O O O O O O O O O O
We report 3 patients ( age 37 - 52 years ) with acute respiratory insufficiency who developed prolonged weakness following the discontinuation of ND - NMBAs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O
Two patients also received intravenous corticosteroids .
O O O O O B O
Renal function was normal but hepatic function was impaired in all patients , and all had acidosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Electrophysiologic studies revealed low amplitude compound motor action potentials , normal sensory studies , and fibrillations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Repetitive stimulation at 2 Hz showed a decremental response in 2 patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The serum vecuronium level measured in 1 patient 14 days after the drug had been discontinued was 172 ng / mL . A muscle biopsy in this patient showed loss
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of thick , myosin filaments .
O O O O O O
The weakness in these patients is due to pathology at both the neuromuscular junction ( most likely due to ND - NMBA ) and muscle ( most likely due to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O
corticosteroids ) .
B O O
Hepatic dysfunction and acidosis are contributing risk factors .
O O O O O O O O O
Prostaglandin E2 - induced bladder hyperactivity in normal , conscious rats : involvement of tachykinins ?
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
In normal conscious rats investigated by continuous cystometry , intravesically instilled prostaglandin ( PG ) E2 facilitated micturition and increased basal intravesical pressure .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O
The effect was attenuated by both the NK1 receptor selective antagonist RP 67 , 580 and the NK2 receptor selective antagonist SR 48 , 968 , given intra - arterially
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O
, suggesting that it was mediated by stimulation of both NK1 and NK2 receptors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intra - arterially given PGE2 produced a distinct increase in bladder pressure before initiating a micturition reflex , indicating that the PG had a direct contractant effect on the detrusor
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
smooth muscle .
O O O
The effect of intra - arterial PGE2 could not be blocked by intra - arterial RP 67 , 580 or SR 48 , 968 , which opens the possibility that
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B I I I O B I I I O O O O O O
the micturition reflex elicited by intra - arterial PGE2 was mediated by pathways other than the reflex initiated when the PG was given intravesically .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The present results thus suggest that intra - arterial PGE2 , given near the bladder , may initiate micturition in the normal rat chiefly by directly contracting the smooth muscle
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of the detrusor .
O O O O
However , when given intravesically , PGE2 may stimulate micturition by releasing tachykinins from nerves in and / or immediately below the urothelium .
O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
These tachykinins , in turn , initiate a micturition reflex by stimulating NK1 and NK2 receptors .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prostanoids may , via release of tachykinins , contribute to both urge and bladder hyperactivity seen in inflammatory conditions of the lower urinary tract .
B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thiazide diuretics , hypokalemia and cardiac arrhythmias .
B O O O O O O O
Thiazide diuretics are widely accepted as the cornerstone of antihypertensive treatment programs .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hypokalemia is a commonly encountered metabolic consequence of chronic thiazide therapy .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
We treated 38 patients ( 22 low renin , 16 normal renin ) with moderate diastolic hypertension with hydrochlorothiazide ( HCTC ) administered on a twice daily schedule .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
Initial dose was 50 mg and the dose was increased at monthly intervals to 100 mg , 150 mg and 200 mg daily until blood pressure normalized .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The serum K during the control period was 4 . 5 + / -

O O O O O
In 13 patients we observed the effects of HCTZ therapy ( 100 mg daily ) on the occurrence of PVC 's during rest as well as during static and dynamic

O O O O O O O O O O O O
