B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion we found that thiazide diuretics cause hypokalemia and depletion of body potassium .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O
The more profound hypokalemia , the greater the propensity for the occurrence of PVC 's .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diuretics , potassium and arrhythmias in hypertensive coronary disease .
O O B O O O O O O O
It has been proposed that modest changes in plasma potassium can alter the tendency towards cardiac arrhythmias .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
If this were so , patients with coronary artery disease might be especially susceptible .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thus , myocardial electrical excitability was measured in patients with mild essential hypertension and known coronary artery disease after 8 weeks of treatment with a potassium - conserving diuretic (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
amiloride ) and a similar period on a potassium - losing diuretic ( chlorthalidone ) in a randomised study .
B O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O
Plasma potassium concentrations were on average 1 mmol / L lower during the chlorthalidone phase compared to amiloride therapy .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O
Blood pressure and volume states as assessed by bodyweight , plasma renin and noradrenaline ( norepinephrine ) concentrations were similar on the 2 regimens .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
Compared to amiloride treatment , the chlorthalidone phase was associated with an increased frequency of ventricular ectopic beats ( 24 - hour Holter monitoring ) and a higher Lown grading
O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, increased upslope and duration of the monophasic action potential , prolonged ventricular effective refractory period , and increased electrical instability during programmed ventricular stimulation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The above results indicate that because potassium - losing diuretic therapy can increase myocardial electrical excitability in patients with ischaemic heart disease , even minor falls in plasma potassium concentrations
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
are probably best avoided in such patients .
O O O O O O O O
GABA involvement in naloxone induced reversal of respiratory paralysis produced by thiopental .
B O O B O O O O O O O B O
No agent is yet available to reverse respiratory paralysis produced by CNS depressants , such as general anesthetics .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this study naloxone reversed respiratory paralysis induced by thiopental in rats .
O O O B O O O O O B O O O
25 mg / kg , i . v .
O O O O O O O O O
thiopental produced anesthesia without altering respiratory rate , increased GABA , decreased glutamate , and had no effect on aspartate or glycine levels compared to controls in rat cortex and
B O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
brain stem .
O O O
Pretreatment of rats with thiosemicarbazide for 30 minutes abolished the anesthetic action as well as the respiratory depressant action of thiopental .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
50 mg / kg , i . v .
O O O O O O O O O
thiopental produced respiratory arrest with further increase in GABA and decrease in glutamate again in cortex and brain stem without affecting any of the amino acids studied in four regions
B O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
of rat brain .
O O O O
Naloxone ( 2 . 5 mg / kg , i . v . ) reversed respiratory paralysis , glutamate and GABA levels to control values in brain stem and cortex
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
with no changes in caudate or cerebellum .
O O O O O O O O
These data suggest naloxone reverses respiratory paralysis produced by thiopental and involves GABA in its action .
O O O B O O O O O B O O B O O O O
National project on the prevention of mother - to - infant infection by hepatitis B virus in Japan .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In Japan , a nationwide prevention program against mother - to - infant infection by hepatitis B virus ( HBV ) started in 1985 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This program consists of double screenings of pregnant women and prophylactic treatment to the infants born to both hepatitis B surface antigen ( HBsAg ) and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O B O O
hepatitis B e antigen ( HBeAg ) positive mothers .
B I I I O B O O O O
These infants are treated with two injections of hepatitis B immune globulin ( HBIG ) and at least three injections of plasma derived hepatitis B vaccine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O
We sent questionnaires about the numbers of each procedure or examination during nine months of investigation period to each local government in 1986 and 1987 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
93 . 4 % pregnant women had the chance to be examined for HBsAg , and the positive rate was 1 . 4 to 1 . 5 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The HBeAg positive rate in HBsAg positive was 23 to 26 % .
O B O O O B O O O O O O O
The HBsAg positive rate in neonates and in infants before two months were 3 % and 2 % respectively .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Some problems may arise , because 27 to 30 % of infants need the fourth vaccination in some restricted areas .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nociceptive effects induced by intrathecal administration of prostaglandin D2 , E2 , or F2 alpha to conscious mice .
O O O O O O O B I I I I I I I O O O O
The effects of intrathecal administration of prostaglandins on pain responses in conscious mice were evaluated by using hot plate and acetic acid writhing tests .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O
Prostaglandin D2 ( 0 . 5 - 3 ng / mouse ) had a hyperalgesic action on the response to a hot plate during a 3 - 60 min period
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
after injection .
O O O
Prostaglandin E2 showed a hyperalgesic effect at doses of 1 pg to 10 ng / mouse , but the effect lasted shorter ( 3 - 30 min ) than that
B I O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of prostaglandin D2 .
O B I O
Similar results were obtained by acetic acid writhing tests .
O O O O O B I O O O
The hyperalgesic effect of prostaglandin D2 was blocked by simultaneous injection of a substance P antagonist ( greater than or equal to 100 ng ) but not by AH6809 ,
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
a prostanoid EP1 - receptor antagonist .
O O O O O O O
Conversely , prostaglandin E2 - induced hyperalgesia was blocked by AH6809 ( greater than or equal to 500 ng ) but not by the substance P antagonist .
O O B I O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prostaglandin F2 alpha had little effect on pain responses .
B I I O O O O O O O
These results demonstrate that both prostaglandin D2 and prostaglandin E2 exert hyperalgesia in the spinal cord , but in different ways .
O O O O O B I O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
Swallowing - induced atrial tachyarrhythmia triggered by salbutamol : case report and review of the literature .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
CASE :
O O
A 49 - year - old patient experienced chest discomfort while swallowing .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On electrocardiogram , episodes of atrial tachyarrhythmia were recorded immediately after swallowing ; 24 - hour Holter monitoring recorded several events .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The arrhythmia resolved after therapy with atenolol , but recurred a year later .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The patient noticed that before these episodes he had been using an inhalator of salbutamol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
After stopping the beta - agonist , and after a week with the atenolol , the arrhythmia disappeared .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
Swallowing - induced atrial tachyarrhythmia ( SIAT ) is a rare phenomenon .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fewer than 50 cases of SIAT have been described in the literature .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This article summarizes all the cases published , creating a comprehensive review of the current knowledge and approach to SIAT .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It discusses demographics , clinical characteristics and types of arrhythmia , postulated mechanisms of SIAT , and different treatment possibilities such as medications , surgery , and radiofrequency catheter ablation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( RFCA ) .
O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Salbutamol is presented here as a possible trigger for SIAT .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Although it is difficult to define causality in a case report , it is logical to think that a beta - agonist like salbutamol ( known to induce tachycardia )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
may be the trigger of adrenergic reflexes originating in the esophagus while swallowing and that a beta - blocker such as atenolol ( that blocks the adrenergic activity ) may
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
relieve it .
O O O
Coenzyme Q10 treatment ameliorates acute cisplatin nephrotoxicity in mice .
B I O O O B O O O O
The nephroprotective effect of coenzyme Q10 was investigated in mice with acute renal injury induced by a single i . p .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
injection of cisplatin ( 5 mg / kg ) .
O O B O O O O O O O
Coenzyme Q10 treatment ( 10 mg / kg / day , i . p . ) was applied for 6 consecutive days , starting 1 day before cisplatin administration .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Coenzyme Q10 significantly reduced blood urea nitrogen and serum creatinine levels which were increased by cisplatin .
B I O O B I I O O B O O O O O B O
Coenzyme Q10 significantly compensated deficits in the antioxidant defense mechanisms ( reduced glutathione level and superoxide dismutase activity ) , suppressed lipid peroxidation , decreased the elevations of tumor necrosis
B I O O O O O O O O O B I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
factor - alpha , nitric oxide and platinum ion concentration , and attenuated the reductions of selenium and zinc ions in renal tissue resulted from cisplatin administration .
O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O B O O
Also , histopathological renal tissue damage mediated by cisplatin was ameliorated by coenzyme Q10 treatment .
O O O O O O O O B O O O B I O O
Immunohistochemical analysis revealed that coenzyme Q10 significantly decreased the cisplatin - induced overexpression of inducible nitric oxide synthase , nuclear factor - kappaB , caspase - 3 and p53 in
O O O O B I O O O B O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
renal tissue .
O O O
It was concluded that coenzyme Q10 represents a potential therapeutic option to protect against acute cisplatin nephrotoxicity commonly encountered in clinical practice .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Metformin prevents experimental gentamicin - induced nephropathy by a mitochondria - dependent pathway .
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The antidiabetic drug metformin can diminish apoptosis induced by oxidative stress in endothelial cells and prevent vascular dysfunction even in nondiabetic patients .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Here we tested whether it has a beneficial effect in a rat model of gentamicin toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Mitochondrial analysis , respiration intensity , levels of reactive oxygen species , permeability transition , and cytochrome c release were assessed 3 and 6 days after gentamicin administration .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Metformin treatment fully blocked gentamicin - mediated acute renal failure .
B O O O B O O O O O O
This was accompanied by a lower activity of N - acetyl - beta - D - glucosaminidase , together with a decrease of lipid peroxidation and increase of antioxidant systems
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Metformin also protected the kidney from histological damage 6 days after gentamicin administration .
B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
These in vivo markers of kidney dysfunction and their correction by metformin were complemented by in vitro studies of mitochondrial function .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
We found that gentamicin treatment depleted respiratory components ( cytochrome c , NADH ) , probably due to the opening of mitochondrial transition pores .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These injuries , partly mediated by a rise in reactive oxygen species from the electron transfer chain , were significantly decreased by metformin .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Thus , our study suggests that pleiotropic effects of metformin can lessen gentamicin nephrotoxicity and improve mitochondrial homeostasis .
O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O
Sedation depth during spinal anesthesia and the development of postoperative delirium in elderly patients undergoing hip fracture repair .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To determine whether limiting intraoperative sedation depth during spinal anesthesia for hip fracture repair in elderly patients can decrease the prevalence of postoperative delirium .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS AND METHODS :
O O O O
We performed a double - blind , randomized controlled trial at an academic medical center of elderly patients ( > or = 65 years ) without preoperative delirium or severe
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dementia who underwent hip fracture repair under spinal anesthesia with propofol sedation .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Sedation depth was titrated using processed electroencephalography with the bispectral index ( BIS ) , and patients were randomized to receive either deep ( BIS , approximately 50 ) or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
light ( BIS , > or = 80 ) sedation .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Postoperative delirium was assessed as defined by Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders ( Third Edition Revised ) criteria using the Confusion Assessment Method beginning at any time from
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the second day after surgery .
O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
From April 2 , 2005 , through October 30 , 2008 , a total of 114 patients were randomized .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The prevalence of postoperative delirium was significantly lower in the light sedation group ( 11 / 57 [ 19 % ] vs 23 / 57 [ 40 % ] in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the deep sedation group ; P = . 02 ) , indicating that 1 incident of delirium will be prevented for every 4 . 7 patients treated with light sedation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The mean + / -
O O O O O
SD number of days of delirium during hospitalization was lower in the light sedation group than in the deep sedation group ( 0 . 5 + / - 1 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 days vs 1 . 4 + / - 4 . 0 days ; P = . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
The use of light propofol sedation decreased the prevalence of postoperative delirium by 50 % compared with deep sedation .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Limiting depth of sedation during spinal anesthesia is a simple , safe , and cost - effective intervention for preventing postoperative delirium in elderly patients that could be widely and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
readily adopted .
O O O
Sorafenib - induced acute myocardial infarction due to coronary artery spasm .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
A 65 - year - old man with advanced renal cell carcinoma was admitted due to continuing chest pain at rest .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two weeks before his admission , sorafenib had been started .
O O O O O O B O O O O
He was diagnosed with non - ST - elevation myocardial infarction by laboratory data and electrocardiogram .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Enhanced heart magnetic resonance imaging also showed subendocardial infarction .
O O O O O O O O O O
However , there was no stenosis in coronary arteries on angiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Coronary artery spasm was induced by a provocative test .
O O O O O O O O O O
Cessation of sorafenib and administration of Ca - channel blocker and nitrates ameliorated his symptoms , but relapse occurred after resumption of sorafenib .
O O B O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
Addition of oral nicorandil reduced his symptoms and maintained stable angina status .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
We report the first case of sorafenib - induced coronary artery spasm .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Sorafenib is a multikinase inhibitor that targets signaling pathways necessary for cellular proliferation and survival .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On the other hand , the Rho / ROCK pathway has an important role in the pathogenesis of coronary artery spasm .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our report may show an adverse effect on the Rho / ROCK pathway by sorafenib use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Anxiogenic potential of ciprofloxacin and norfloxacin in rats .
O O O B O B O O O
INTRODUCTION :
O O
The possible anxiogenic effects of fluoroquinolones , namely ciprofloxacin and norfloxacin , were investigated in adult Charles Foster albino rats of either sex , weighing 150 - 200 g .
O O O O O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
The drugs were given orally , in doses of 50 mg / kg for five consecutive days and the experiments were performed on the fifth day .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The tests included open - field exploratory behaviour , elevated plus maze and elevated zero maze , social interaction and novelty - suppressed feeding latency behaviour .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The results indicate that ciprofloxacin - and norfloxacin - treated rats showed anxious behaviour in comparison to control rats in all the parameters studied .
O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , ciprofloxacin - and norfloxacin - treated rats did not differ significantly from each other in various behavioural parameters .
O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
The present experimental findings substantiate the clinically observed anxiogenic potential of ciprofloxacin and norfloxacin .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Myocardial Fas ligand expression increases susceptibility to AZT - induced cardiomyopathy .
O O O O O O O B O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Dilated cardiomyopathy ( DCM ) and myocarditis occur in many HIV - infected individuals , resulting in symptomatic heart failure in up to 5 % of patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Highly active antiretroviral therapy ( HAART ) has significantly reduced morbidity and mortality of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome ( AIDS ) , but has resulted in an increase in cardiac and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
skeletal myopathies .
O O O
METHODS AND RESULTS :
O O O O
In order to investigate whether the HAART component zidovudine ( 3' - azido - 2' , 3' - deoxythymidine ; AZT ) triggers the Fas - dependent cell - death
O O O O O O O O B O B I I I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O
pathway and cause cytoskeletal disruption in a murine model of DCM , 8 - week - old transgenic ( expressing Fas ligand in the myocardium : FasL Tg ) and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
non - transgenic ( NTg ) mice received water ad libitum containing different concentrations of AZT ( 0 , 0 . 07 , 0 . 2 , and 0 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
7 mg / ml ) .
O O O O O O
After 6 weeks , cardiac function was assessed by echocardiography and morphology was assessed by histopathologic and immunohistochemical methods .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NTg and untreated FasL
O O O O
Tg mice showed little or no change in cardiac structure or function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , AZT - treated FasL Tg mice developed cardiac dilation and depressed cardiac function in a dose - dependent manner , with concomitant inflammatory infiltration of both ventricles
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
These changes were associated with an increased sarcolemmal expression of Fas and FasL , as well as increased activation of caspase 3 , translocation of calpain 1 to the sarcolemma
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and sarcomere , and increased numbers of cells undergoing apoptosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O
These were associated with changes in dystrophin and cardiac troponin I localization , as well as loss of sarcolemmal integrity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The expression of Fas ligand in the myocardium , as identified in HIV - positive patients , might increase the susceptibility to HAART - induced cardiomyopathy due to activation of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
apoptotic pathways , resulting in cardiac dilation and dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O
Valproate - induced chorea and encephalopathy in atypical nonketotic hyperglycinemia .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Nonketotic hyperglycinemia is a disorder of amino acid metabolism in which a defect in the glycine cleavage system leads to an accumulation of glycine in the brain and other body
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
compartments .
O O
In the classical form it presents as neonatal apnea , intractable seizures , and hypotonia , followed by significant psychomotor retardation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An important subset of children with nonketotic hyperglycinemia are atypical variants who present in a heterogeneous manner .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This report describes a patient with mild language delay and mental retardation , who was found to have nonketotic hyperglycinemia following her presentation with acute encephalopathy and chorea shortly after
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
initiation of valproate therapy .
O O B O O
Microinjection of ritanserin into the CA1 region of hippocampus improves scopolamine - induced amnesia in adult male rats .
O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The effect of ritanserin ( 5 - HT2 antagonist ) on scopolamine ( muscarinic cholinergic antagonist ) - induced amnesia in Morris water maze ( MWM ) was investigated .
O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Rats were divided into eight groups and bilaterally cannulated into CA1 region of the hippocampus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One week later , they received repeatedly vehicles ( saline , DMSO , saline + DMSO ) , scopolamine ( 2 microg / 0 . 5 microl saline / side
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
; 30 min before training ) , ritanserin ( 2 , 4 and 8 microg / 0 . 5 microl DMSO / side ; 20 min before training ) and
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
scopolamine ( 2 microg / 0 . 5 microl ; 30 min before ritanserin injection ) + ritanserin ( 4 microg / 0 . 5 microl DMSO ) through cannulae
B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O
each day .
O O O
Animals were tested for four consecutive days ( 4 trial / day ) in MWM during which the position of hidden platform was unchanged .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the fifth day , the platform was elevated above the water surface in another position to evaluate the function of motor , motivational and visual systems .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results showed a significant increase in escape latencies and traveled distances to find platform in scopolamine - treated group as compared to saline group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Ritanserin - treated rats ( 4 microg / 0 . 5 microl / side ) showed a significant decrease in the mentioned parameters as compared to DMSO - treated group
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
.
O
However , scopolamine and ritanserin co - administration resulted in a significant decrease in escape latencies and traveled distances as compared to the scopolamine - treated rats .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Our findings show that microinjection of ritanserin into the CA1 region of the hippocampus improves the scopolamine - induced amnesia .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Hypoxia in renal disease with proteinuria and / or glomerular hypertension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Despite the increasing need to identify and quantify tissue oxygenation at the cellular level , relatively few methods have been available .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this study , we developed a new hypoxia - responsive reporter vector using a hypoxia - responsive element of the 5 ' vascular endothelial growth factor untranslated region and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
generated a novel hypoxia - sensing transgenic rat .
O O O O O O O O O
We then applied this animal model to the detection of tubulointerstitial hypoxia in the diseased kidney .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
With this model , we were able to identify diffuse cortical hypoxia in the puromycin aminonucleoside - induced nephrotic syndrome and focal and segmental hypoxia in the remnant kidney model
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Expression of the hypoxia - responsive transgene increased throughout the observation period , reaching 2 . 2 - fold at 2 weeks in the puromycin aminonucleoside model and 2 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
6 - fold at 4 weeks in the remnant kidney model , whereas that of vascular endothelial growth factor showed a mild decrease , reflecting distinct behaviors of the two
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
genes .
O O
The degree of hypoxia showed a positive correlation with microscopic tubulointerstitial injury in both models .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Finally , we identified the localization of proliferating cell nuclear antigen - positive , ED - 1 - positive , and terminal dUTP nick - end labeled - positive cells
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in the hypoxic cortical area in the remnant kidney model .
O O O O O O O O O O O
We propose here a possible pathological tie between chronic tubulointerstitial hypoxia and progressive glomerular diseases .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Consensus statement concerning cardiotoxicity occurring during haematopoietic stem cell transplantation in the treatment of autoimmune diseases , with special reference to systemic sclerosis and multiple sclerosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Autologous haematopoietic stem cell transplantation is now a feasible and effective treatment for selected patients with severe autoimmune diseases .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Worldwide , over 650 patients have been transplanted in the context of phase I and II clinical trials .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results are encouraging enough to begin randomised phase III trials .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , as predicted , significant transplant - related morbidity and mortality have been observed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This is primarily due to complications related to either the stage of the disease at transplant or due to infections .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The number of deaths related to cardiac toxicity is low .
O O O O O O O O O O O
However , caution is required when cyclophosphamide or anthracyclines such as mitoxantrone are used in patients with a possible underlying heart damage , for example , systemic sclerosis patients .
O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In November 2002 , a meeting was held in Florence , bringing together a number of experts in various fields , including rheumatology , cardiology , neurology , pharmacology and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
transplantation medicine .
O O O
The object of the meeting was to analyse existing data , both published or available , in the European Group for Blood and Marrow Transplantation autoimmune disease database , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to propose a safe approach to such patients .
O O O O O O O O O
A full cardiological assessment before and during the transplant emerged as the major recommendation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Immunohistochemical study on inducible type of nitric oxide ( iNOS ) , basic fibroblast growth factor ( bFGF ) and tumor growth factor - beta1 ( TGF - beta1 )
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in arteritis induced in rats by fenoldopam and theophylline , vasodilators .
O O O O O O B O B O O O
Arteritis induced in rats by vasodilators , fenoldopam and theophylline , was examined immunohistochemically for expressions of inducible type of nitric oxide synthase ( iNOS ) , basic fibroblast growth
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
factor ( bFGF ) and tumor growth factor - beta1 ( TGF - beta1 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Rats were administered fenoldopam for 24 hours by intravenous infusion with or without following repeated daily oral administrations of theophylline .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Irrespective of theophylline administration , iNOS antigens were remarkably abundant in ED - 1 - positive cells on day 5 and 8 post - fenoldopam - infusion ( DPI )
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
; bFGF antigens were remarkably abundant in ED - 1 - positive cells on 1 and 3 DPI ; TGF - beta1 antigens were observed in ED - 1 -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
positive cells on and after 5 DPI .
O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that the peak expression of iNOS antigen was followed by that of bFGF antigen , and bFGF may have a suppressive effect on iNOS expression in these
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rat arteritis models .
O O O O
On the other hand , TGF - beta1 was not considered to have a suppressive effect on iNOS expression in these models .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Low - molecular - weight heparin for the treatment of patients with mechanical heart valves .
B I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
The interruption of oral anticoagulant ( OAC ) administration is sometimes indicated in patients with mechanical heart valves , mainly before noncardiac surgery , non - surgical interventions , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pregnancy .
O O
Unfractionated heparin ( UH ) is currently the substitute for selected patients .
B I O B O O O O O O O O O
Low - molecular - weight heparin ( LMWH ) offers theoretical advantages over UH , but is not currently considered in clinical guidelines as an alternative to UH in patients
B I I I I I O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
with prosthetic valves .
O O O O
HYPOTHESIS :
O O
The aim of the present study was to review the data accumulated so far on the use of LMWH in this patient population and to discuss its applicability in common
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
practice .
O O
METHODS :
O O
For this paper , the current medical literature on LMWH in patients with mechanical heart valves was extensively reviewed .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
There were eight series and six case reports .
O O O O O O O O O
None of the studies was randomized , and only one was prospective .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Data to establish the thromboembolic risk were incomplete .
O O O O O O O O O
After excluding case reports , the following groups were constructed : ( a ) short - term administration , after valve insertion ( n = 212 ) ; ( b
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) short - term , perioperative ( noncardiac ) / periprocedural ( n = 114 ) ; ( c ) long - term , due to intolerance to OAC (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
n = 16 ) ; ( d ) long - term , in pregnancy ( n = 10 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence rate of thromboembolism was 0 . 9 % for all the studies and 0 . 5 , 0 , 20 , and 0 % in groups a ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
b , c , and d , respectively ; for hemorrhage , the overall rate was 3 . 4 % ( 3 . 8 , 2 . 6 , 10
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and 0 % for the respective groups ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
In patients with mechanical heart valves , short - term LMWH therapy compares favorably with UH .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
Data on mid - and long - term LMWH administration in these patients are sparse .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Further randomized studies are needed to confirm the safety and precise indications for the use of LMWH in patients with mechanical heart valves .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Topiramate - induced nephrolithiasis .
B O O O O
Topiramate is a recently developed antiepileptic medication that is becoming more widely prescribed because of its efficacy in treating refractory seizures .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urologists should be aware that this medication can cause metabolic acidosis in patients secondary to inhibition of carbonic anhydrase .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , a distal tubular acidification defect may result , thus impairing the normal compensatory drop in urine pH . These factors can lead to the development of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
calcium phosphate nephrolithiasis .
B I O O
We report the first two cases of topiramate - induced nephrolithiasis in the urologic literature .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Spironolactone : is it a novel drug for the prevention of amphotericin B - related hypokalemia in cancer patients ?
B O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : Nephrotoxicity is the major adverse effect of amphotericin B ( AmB ) , often limiting administration of full dosage .
O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O
Selective distal tubular epithelial toxicity seems to be responsible for the profound potassium wasting that is a major clinical side effect of treatment with AmB . Potassium depletion also potentiates
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
the tubular toxicity of AmB .
O O O O B O
This study was designed to assess the ability of spironolactone to reduce potassium requirements and to prevent hypokalemia in neutropenic patients on AmB treatment .
O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O
METHODS :
O O
In this study 26 patients with various hematological disorders were randomized to receive either intravenous AmB alone or AmB and oral spironolactone 100 mg twice daily when developing a proven
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O B O O O O O O O O
or suspected fungal infection .
O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Patients receiving concomitant AmB and spironolactone had significantly higher plasma potassium levels than those receiving AmB alone ( P = 0 . 0027 ) .
O O O B O B O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Those patients receiving AmB and spironolactone required significantly less potassium supplementation to maintain their plasma potassium within the normal range ( P = 0 . 022 ) .
O O O B O B O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Moreover , urinary potassium losses were significantly less in patients receiving AmB and spironolactone than those receiving AmB alone ( P = 0 . 040 ) .
O O O B O O O O O O O B O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
This study showed that spironolactone can reduce potassium requirements and prevent hypokalemia by reducing urinary potassium loss in neutropenic patients on AmB treatment .
O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O
Dopamine D2 receptor signaling controls neuronal cell death induced by muscarinic and glutamatergic drugs .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dopamine ( DA ) , through D1 / D2 receptor - mediated signaling , plays a major role in the control of epileptic seizures arising in the limbic system .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Excitotoxicity leading to neuronal cell death in the affected areas is a major consequence of seizures at the cellular level .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this respect , little is known about the role of DA receptors in the occurrence of epilepsy - induced neuronal cell death .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Here we analyze the occurrence of seizures and neurotoxicity in D2R - / - mice treated with the cholinergic agonist pilocarpine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
We compared these results with those previously obtained with kainic acid ( KA ) , a potent glutamate agonist .
O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O B O O
Importantly , D2R - / - mice develop seizures at doses of both drugs that are not epileptogenic for WT littermates and show greater neurotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , pilocarpine - induced seizures result in a more widespread neuronal death in both WT and D2R - / - brains in comparison to KA .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Thus , the absence of D2R lowers the threshold for seizures induced by both glutamate and acetylcholine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Moreover , the dopaminergic control of epilepsy - induced neurodegeneration seems to be mediated by distinct interactions of D2R signaling with these two neurotransmitters .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment of risperidone - induced hyperprolactinemia with a dopamine agonist in children .
O O B O O O O O B O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Risperidone , a potent antagonist of both serotonergic ( 5HT2A ) and dopaminergic D2 receptors is associated with hyperprolactinemia in adults and children .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Chronically elevated prolactin levels in children with prolactinomas may be associated with arrested growth and development resulting in either delayed puberty or short stature .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These possibilities stress the importance of developing a safe and effective approach to drug - induced hyperprolactinemia in youth .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report the successful treatment of risperidone - induced hyperprolactinemia with cabergoline in youth .
O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O
METHODS :
O O
We undertook a retrospective case review of four children with risperidone - induced hyperprolactinemia treated with cabergoline .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O
RESULTS :
O O
Four males ( age 6 - 11 years ) with Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders ( fourth edition ) bipolar disorder or psychoses , with risperidone - induced
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
elevations in serum prolactin levels ( 57 . 5 - 129 ng / mL , normal 5 - 15 ng / mL ) , were treated with cabergoline ( mean
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
dose 2 . 13 + / -
O O O O O O O
0 . 09 mg / week ) .
O O O O O O O O
When serum prolactin levels normalized in all four subjects ( mean 11 . 2 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
10 . 9 ng / mL ) , the cabergoline dose was reduced to 1 mg / week in three of four subjects .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean duration of therapy with cabergoline was 523 . 5 + / -
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
129 . 7 days , and the mean duration of therapy with risperidone was 788 . 5 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
162 . 5 days .
O O O O O
Cabergoline was well tolerated without adverse effects .
B O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Cabergoline may be useful for the treatment of risperidone - induced hyperprolactinemia in youth ; however , further research is needed .
B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cholestatic jaundice associated with the use of metformin .
O O O O O O O B O
We report a patient who developed cholestatic jaundice shortly after initiation of treatment with metformin hydrochloride .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Ultrasound of the liver and abdominal CT were normal .
O O O O O O O O O O
An ERCP showed normal biliary anatomy .
O O O O O O O
A percutaneous liver biopsy was obtained showing marked cholestasis , with portal edema , ductular proliferation , and acute inflammation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Metformin hydrochloride was discontinued , and the patient 's jaundice resolved slowly over a period of several months .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Given the onset of his jaundice 2 wk after the initiation of metformin , we believe that this case represents an example of metformin - associated hepatotoxicity , the first
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
such case reported .
O O O O
Electro - oculography , electroretinography , visual evoked potentials , and multifocal electroretinography in patients with vigabatrin - attributed visual field constriction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
Symptomatic visual field constriction thought to be associated with vigabatrin has been reported .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The current study investigated the visual fields and visual electrophysiology of eight patients with known vigabatrin - attributed visual field loss , three of whom were reported previously .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Six of the patients were no longer receiving vigabatrin .
O O O O O O O O B O
METHODS :
O O
The central and peripheral fields were examined with the Humphrey Visual Field Analyzer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Full visual electrophysiology , including flash electroretinography ( ERG ) , pattern electroretinography , multifocal ERG using the VERIS system , electro - oculography , and flash and pattern visual
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
evoked potentials , was undertaken .
O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Seven patients showed marked visual field constriction with some sparing of the temporal visual field .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The eighth exhibited concentric constriction .
O O O O O O
Most electrophysiological responses were usually just within normal limits ; two patients had subnormal Arden electro - oculography indices ; and one patient showed an abnormally delayed photopic b wave
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
However , five patients showed delayed 30 - Hz flicker b waves , and seven patients showed delayed oscillatory potentials .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Multifocal ERG showed abnormalities that sometimes correlated with the visual field appearance and confirmed that the deficit occurs at the retinal level .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Marked visual field constriction appears to be associated with vigabatrin therapy .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
The field defects and some electrophysiological abnormalities persist when vigabatrin therapy is withdrawn .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Conversion to rapamycin immunosuppression in renal transplant recipients : report of an initial experience .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
The aim of this study is to evaluate the effects of RAPA conversion in patients undergoing cyclosporine ( CsA ) or tacrolimus ( Tac ) toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O B O O B O B O O O
METHODS :
O O
Twenty renal transplant recipients were switched to fixed dose rapamycin ( RAPA ) ( 5 mg / day ) 0 to 204 months posttransplant .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Drug monitoring was not initially used to adjust doses .
O O O O O O O O O O
The indications for switch were chronic CsA or Tac nephrotoxicity ( 12 ) , acute CsA or Tac toxicity ( 3 ) , severe facial dysmorphism ( 2 ) ,
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
posttransplant lymphoproliferative disorder ( PTLD ) in remission ( 2 ) , and hepatotoxicity in 1 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Follow - up is 7 to 24 months .
O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
In the 12 patients switched because of chronic nephrotoxicity there was a significant decrease in serum creatinine
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B
[ 233 + / - 34 to 210 + / - 56 micromol / liter ( P < 0 . 05 ) at 6 months ] .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Facial dysmorphism improved in two patients .
O O O O O O O
No relapse of PTLD was observed .
O O O O O O O
Five patients developed pneumonia ( two Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia , one infectious mononucleosis with polyclonal PTLD lung infiltrate ) and two had bronchiolitis obliterans .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There were no deaths .
O O O O O
RAPA was discontinued in four patients , because of pneumonia in two , PTLD in one , and oral aphtous ulcers in one .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RAPA levels were high ( > 15 ng / ml ) in 7 of 13 ( 54 % ) patients .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
RAPA conversion provides adequate immunosuppression to enable CsA withdrawal .
B O O O O O O B O O
However , when converting patients to RAPA drug levels should be monitored to avoid over - immunosuppression and adequate antiviral and Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia prophylaxis should be given .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Worsening of levodopa - induced dyskinesias by motor and mental tasks .
O O B O O O O O O O O O
Ten patients who had Parkinson 's disease with disabling dyskinesia were included in this study to evaluate the role of mental ( mental calculation ) and motor ( flexion /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
extension of right fingers , flexion / extension of left fingers , flexion / extension of the neck , speaking aloud ) tasks on the worsening of peak - dose
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dyskinesia following administration of an effective single dose of apomorphine .
O O O O O O O O O B O
Compared with the score at rest ( 1 . 3 + / - 0 . 3 ) , a significant aggravation of the dyskinesia score was observed during speaking aloud
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 5 . 2 + / - 1 . 1 , p < 0 . 05 ) , movements of right ( 4 . 5 + / - 1 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 , p < 0 . 05 ) and left ( 3 . 7 + / - 0 . 8 , p < 0 . 05 ) fingers , movements
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of the neck ( 5 . 1 + / - 1 . 0 , p < 0 . 05 ) , and mental calculation ( 3 . 1 + /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- 1 . 0 , p < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that activation tasks such as """" speaking aloud """" could be used for objective assessment of dyskinesia severity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Structural and functional impairment of mitochondria in adriamycin - induced cardiomyopathy in mice : suppression of cytochrome c oxidase II gene expression .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The use of adriamycin ( ADR ) in cancer chemotherapy has been limited due to its cumulative cardiovascular toxicity .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Earlier observations that ADR interacts with mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase ( COX ) and suppresses its enzyme activity led us to investigate ADR 's action on the cardiovascular functions and
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
heart mitochondrial morphology in Balb - c mice i . p .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
treated with ADR for several weeks .
O O B O O O O
At various times during treatment , the animals were assessed for cardiovascular functions by electrocardiography and for heart tissue damage by electron microscopy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In parallel , total RNA was extracted from samples of dissected heart and analyzed by Northern blot hybridization to determine the steady - state level of three RNA transcripts encoded
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
by the COXII , COXIII , and COXIV genes .
O O O O O O O O O O
Similarly , samples obtained from the liver of the same animals were analyzed for comparative studies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our results indicated that 1 ) treatment of mice with ADR caused cardiovascular arrhythmias characterized by bradycardia , extension of ventricular depolarization time ( tQRS ) , and failure of
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
QRS at high concentrations ( 10 - 14 mg / kg body weight cumulative dose ) ; 2 ) the heart mitochondria underwent swelling , fusion , dissolution , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
/ or disruption of mitochondrial cristae after several weeks of treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Such abnormalities were not observed in the mitochondria of liver tissue ; and 3 ) among the three genes of COX enzyme examined , only COXII gene expression was suppressed
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
by ADR treatment , mainly after 8 weeks in both heart and liver .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Knowing that heart mitochondria represent almost 40 % of heart muscle by weight , we conclude that the deteriorating effects of ADR on cardiovascular function involve mitochondrial structural and functional
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
impairment .
O O
Enhanced bradycardia induced by beta - adrenoceptor antagonists in rats pretreated with isoniazid .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
High doses of isoniazid increase hypotension induced by vasodilators and change the accompanying reflex tachycardia to bradycardia , an interaction attributed to decreased synthesis of brain
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
gamma - aminobutyric acid ( GABA ) .
B I I I O B O O
In the present study , the possible enhancement by isoniazid of bradycardia induced by beta - adrenoceptor antagonists was determined in rats anaesthetised with chloralose - urethane .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Isoniazid significantly increased bradycardia after propranolol , pindolol , labetalol and atenolol , as well as after clonidine , but not after hexamethonium or carbachol .
B O O O O B O B O B O B O O O O O B O O O O B O B O
Enhancement was not observed in rats pretreated with methylatropine or previously vagotomised .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
These results are compatible with interference by isoniazid with GABAergic inhibition of cardiac parasympathetic tone .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Such interference could be exerted centrally , possibly at the nucleus ambiguus , or peripherally at the sinus node .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Epileptogenic activity of folic acid after drug induces SLE ( folic acid and epilepsy ) OBJECTIVE :
O O O B I O O O O O B I O O O O O
To study the effect of folic acid - containing multivitamin supplementation in epileptic women before and during pregnancy in order to determine the rate of structural birth defects and epilepsy
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- related side effects .
O O O O O
STUDY DESIGN :
O O O
First a randomised trial , later periconception care including in total 12225 females .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Of 60 epileptic women with periconceptional folic acid ( 0 . 8 mg ) - containing multivitamin supplementation , no one developed epilepsy - related side effects during the periconception
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
period .
O O
One epileptic woman delivered a newborn with cleft lip and palate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Another patient exhibited with a cluster of seizures after the periconception period using another multivitamin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This 22 - year - old epileptic woman was treated continuously by carbamazepine and a folic acid ( 1 mg ) - containing multivitamin from the 20th week of gestation
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
She developed status epilepticus and later symptoms of systemic lupus erythematodes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Her pregnancy ended with stillbirth .
O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The epileptic pregnant patient 's autoimmune disease ( probably drug - induced lupus ) could damage the blood - brain barrier , therefore the therapeutic dose ( > or =
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 mg ) of folic acid triggered a cluster of seizures .
O O O O B I O O O O O O
Physiological dose ( < 1 mg ) of folic acid both in healthy and 60 epileptic women , all without any autoimmune disease , did not increase the risk for
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
epileptic seizures .
O O O
Effects of cisapride on symptoms and postcibal small - bowel motor function in patients with irritable bowel syndrome .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O

O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our aim was to assess the effects of long - term treatment with a prokinetic agent , cisapride , on postprandial jejunal motility and symptoms in the irritable bowel syndrome
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O

O O O O

O O

O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
before and after 12 week 's treatment
O O O O O O O

O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
