CONCLUSION :
O O
Cisapride affects jejunal contraction characteristics and some symptoms in IBS .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Clarithromycin - induced ventricular tachycardia .
B O O O O O
Clarithromycin is a relatively new macrolide antibiotic that offers twice - daily dosing .
B O O O O B O O O O O O O O
It differs from erythromycin only in the methylation of the hydroxyl group at position 6 .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although the side - effect profile of erythromycin is established , including gastroenteritis and interactions with other drugs subject to hepatic mixed - function oxidase metabolism , experience with the
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
newer macrolides is still being recorded .
O B O O O O O
Cardiotoxicity has been demonstrated after both intravenous and oral administration of erythromycin but has never been reported with the newer macrolides .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O
We report a case of ventricular dysrhythmias that occurred after six therapeutic doses of clarithromycin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The dysrhythmias resolved after discontinuation of the drug .
O O O O O O O O O
Persistent nephrogenic diabetes insipidus following lithium therapy .
O O O O O B O O
We report the case of a patient who developed severe hypernatraemic dehydration following a head injury .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ten years previously he had been diagnosed to have lithium - induced nephrogenic diabetes insipidus , and lithium therapy had been discontinued .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O
He remained thirsty and polyuric despite cessation of lithium and investigations on admission showed him to have normal osmoregulated thirst and vasopressin secretion , with clear evidence of nephrogenic diabetes
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
insipidus .
O O
Lithium induced nephrogenic diabetes insipidus is considered to be reversible on cessation of therapy but polyuria persisted in this patient for ten years after lithium was stopped .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
We discuss the possible renal mechanisms and the implications for management of patients with lithium - induced nephrogenic diabetes insipidus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Late cardiotoxicity after treatment for a malignant bone tumor .
O O O O O O O O O O
Cardiac function was assessed in long - term survivors of malignant bone tumors who were treated according to Rosen 's T5 or T10 protocol , both including doxorubicin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I O O O B O
Thirty - one patients , age 10 - 45 years ( median age 17 . 8 years ) were evaluated 2 . 3 - 14 . 1 years ( median
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
8 . 9 years ) following completion of treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O
Cumulative doses of doxorubicin were 225 - 550 mg / m2 ( median dose 360 ) .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The evaluation consisted of a history , physical examination , electrocardiogram ( ECG ) , signal averaged ECG , 24 - hour ambulatory ECG , echocardiography and radionuclide angiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Eighteen of 31 ( 58 % ) patients showed cardiac toxicity , defined as having one or more of the following abnormalities : late potentials , complex ventricular arrhythmias ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
left ventricular dilation , decreased shortening fraction , or decreased ejection fraction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of cardiac abnormalities increased with length of follow - up ( P < or = . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No correlation could be demonstrated between cumulative dose of doxorubicin and cardiac status , except for heart rate variability .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
When adjusted to body surface area , the left ventricular posterior wall thickness ( LVPW index ) was decreased in all patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of doxorubicin - induced cardiotoxicity is high and increases with follow - up , irrespective of cumulative dose .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Life - long cardiac follow - up in these patients is warranted .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results of our study suggest that heart rate variability and LVPW index could be sensitive indicators for cardiotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Venous complications of midazolam versus diazepam .
O O O B O B O
Although some studies have suggested fewer venous complications are associated with midazolam than with diazepam for endoscopic procedures , this variable has not been well documented .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
We prospectively evaluated the incidence of venous complications after intravenous injection of diazepam or midazolam in 122 consecutive patients undergoing colonoscopy and esophagogastroduodenoscopy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
Overall , venous complications were more frequent with diazepam ( 22 of 62 patients ) than with midazolam ( 4 of 60 patients ) ( p < 0 . 001
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
A palpable venous cord was present in 23 % ( 14 of 62 ) of patients in the diazepam group , compared with 2 % ( 1 of 60 patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
) in the midazolam group ( p < 0 . 002 ) .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Pain at the injection site occurred in 35 % ( 22 of 62 ) of patients in the diazepam group compared with 7 % ( 4 of 60 patients )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
in the midazolam group ( p < 0 . 001 ) .
O O B O O O O O O O O O
Swelling and warmth at the injection site were not significantly different between the two groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Smoking , nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drug use , intravenous catheter site , dwell time of the needle , alcohol use , and pain during the injection had no effect
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
on the incidence of venous complications .
O O O O O O O
Tetany and rhabdomyolysis due to surreptitious furosemide - - importance of magnesium supplementation .
O O O O O O B O O O O B O O
Diuretics may induce hypokalemia , hypocalcemia and hypomagnesemia .
O O O O O O O O O
While severe hypokalemia may cause muscle weakness , severe hypomagnesemia is associated with muscle spasms and tetany which can not be corrected by potassium and calcium supplementation alone ( 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
, 2 ) .
O O O O
Surreptitious diuretic ingestion has been described , mainly in women who are concerned that they are obese or edematous .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Symptomatic hypokalemia has been reported in such patients ( 3 - 7 ) and in one case hypocalcemia was observed ( 8 ) , but the effects of magnesium depletion
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
were not noted in these patients .
O O O O O O O
Loss of glutamate decarboxylase mRNA - containing neurons in the rat dentate gyrus following pilocarpine - induced seizures .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
In situ hybridization methods were used to determine if glutamic acid decarboxylase ( GAD ) mRNA - containing neurons within the hilus of the dentate gyrus are vulnerable to seizure
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- induced damage in a model of chronic seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O
Sprague - Dawley rats were injected intraperitoneally with pilocarpine , and the hippocampal formation was studied histologically at 1 , 2 , 4 , and 8 week intervals after
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pilocarpine - induced seizures .
B O O O O
In situ hybridization histochemistry , using a digoxigenin - labeled GAD cRNA probe , demonstrated a substantial decrease in the number of GAD mRNA - containing neurons in the hilus
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of the dentate gyrus in the pilocarpine - treated rats as compared to controls at all time intervals .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Additional neuronanatomical studies , including cresyl violet staining , neuronal degeneration methods , and histochemical localization of glial fibrillary acidic protein , suggested that the decrease in the number of
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
GAD mRNA - containing neurons was related to neuronal loss rather than to a decrease in GAD mRNA levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The loss of GAD mRNA - containing neurons in the hilus contrasted with the relative preservation of labeled putative basket cells along the inner margin of the granule cell layer
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Quantitative analyses of labeled neurons in three regions of the dentate gyrus in the 1 and 2 week groups showed statistically significant decreases in the mean number of GAD mRNA
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- containing neurons in the hilus of both groups of experimental animals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No significant differences were found in the molecular layer or the granule cell layer , which included labeled neurons along the lower margin of the granule cell layer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results indicate that , in this model , a subpopulation of GAD mRNA - containing neurons within the dentate gyrus is selectively vulnerable to seizure - induced damage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Such differential vulnerability appears to be another indication of the heterogeneity of GABA neurons .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Protective effect of misoprostol on indomethacin induced renal dysfunction in elderly patients .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To evaluate the possible protective effects of misoprostol on renal function in hospitalized elderly patients treated with indomethacin .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O
METHODS :
O O
Forty - five hospitalized elderly patients ( > 65 years old ) who required therapy with nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drugs ( NSAID ) were randomly assigned to receive either indomethacin ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
150 mg / day ( Group A ) , or indomethacin 150 mg / day plus misoprostol at 0 . 6 mg / day ( Group B ) .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Laboratory variables of renal function [ serum creatinine , blood urea nitrogen ( BUN ) and electrolytes ] were evaluated before initiation of therapy and every 2 days , until
O O O O O O O B O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
termination of the study ( a period of at least 6 days ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Response to treatment was estimated by the visual analog scale for severity of pain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Forty - two patients completed the study , 22 in Group A and 20 in Group B . BUN and creatinine increased by > 50 % of baseline levels in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
54 and 45 % of Group A patients , respectively , compared to only 20 and 10 % of Group B patients ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Potassium ( K ) increment of 0 . 6 mEq /
B O B O O O O O O O O
l or more was observed in 50 % of Group A , but in only 15 % of Group B patients ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean increments in BUN , creatinine , and K were reduced by 63 , 80 , and 42 % , respectively , in Group B patients compared to Group
O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A . Response to treatment did not differ significantly between the 2 groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Hospitalized elderly patients are at risk for developing indomethacin related renal dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Addition of misoprostol can minimize this renal impairment without affecting pain control .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Nephrotoxic effects of aminoglycoside treatment on renal protein reabsorption and accumulation .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
To quantify the effects of gentamicin , kanamycin and netilmicin on renal protein reabsorption and accumulation , these drugs were administered to rats intraperitoneally ( 30 mg / kg /
O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
day ) for 7 , 14 or 21 days .
O O O O O O O O O O
Scanning electron microscopy of the glomerular endothelia , urinary measurements of sodium , potassium , endogenous lysozyme , N - acetyl - beta - D - glucosaminidase ( NAG )
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
as well as clearance and accumulation experiments after i . v .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
administration of egg - white lysozyme and measurements of inulin clearance ( GFR ) were done in each treatment group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Gentamicin administration decreased diameter , density and shape of endothelial fenestrae .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Kanamycin and netilmicin appeared to have no effect at the dose used .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O
All three aminoglycosides decreased GFR and increased urinary excretion of sodium and potassium .
O O B O O O O O O O B O B O
While gentamicin and kanamycin decreased the percentage reabsorption and accumulation of lysozyme after i . v .
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
administration of egg - white lysozyme netilmicin had no effect .
O O O O O O B O O O O
Daily excretion of total protein , endogenous lysozyme and NAG increased only after treatment with kanamycin and gentamicin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Thus , aminoglycosides may act as nephrotoxicants at glomerular and / or tubular level inducing impairment of renal reabsorption and accumulation of proteins .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pharmacology of GYKI - 41 099 ( chlorpropanol , Tobanum ) a new potent beta - adrenergic antagonist .
O O B I I I O B O B O O O O O O O O O
The compound GYKI - 41 099 , as a beta - adrenergic antagonist , is 3 - 8 times more potent than propranolol in vitro and in vivo .
O O B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Its antiarrhythmic effectiveness surpasses that of propranolol and pindolol inhibiting the ouabain arrhythmia in dogs and cats .
O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O
GYKI - 41 900 has a negligible cardiodepressant activity ; it is not cardioselective .
B I I I O O O O O O O O O O O
The compound shows a rapid and long lasting effect .
O O O O O O O O O O
There was a prolonged elimination of the radioactivity after the injection of 14C - 41 099 to rats and dogs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O
The half life of the unlabeled substance in humans was more than 10 hours .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Chorea associated with oral contraception .
O O O B I O
Three patients developed chorea while receiving oral contraceptives .
O O O O O O B I O
Two were young patients whose chorea developed long after treatment had been started and disappeared soon after it had been discontinued .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The third patient had acute amphetamine - induced chorea after prolonged oral contraception .
O O O O O B O O O O O B I O
Prolonged administration of female sex hormones is a possible cause of chorea in women who have not previously had chorea or rheumatic fever .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reversal of ammonia coma in rats by L - dopa : a peripheral effect .
O O B O O O O B I I O O O O O
Ammonia coma was produced in rats within 10 to 15 minutes of an intraperitonealinjection of 1 . 7 mmol NH4CL .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
This coma was prevented with 1 . 68 mmol L - dopa given by gastric intubation 15 minutes before the ammonium salt injection .
O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O B I O O
The effect of L - dopa was correlated with a decrease in blood and brain ammonia , an increase in brain dopamine , and an increase in renal excretion of
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
ammonia and urea .
B O B O
Intraventricular infusion of dopamine sufficient to raise the brain dopamine to the same extent did not prevent the ammonia coma nor affect the blood and brain ammonia concentrations .
O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O
Bilateral nephrectomy eliminated the beneficial effect of L - dopa on blood and brain ammonia and the ammonia coma was not prevented .
O O O O O O O B I I O O O O B O O B O O O O O
Thus , the reduction in blood and brain ammonia and the prevention of ammonia coma after L - dopa , can be accounted for by the peripheral effect of
O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
dopamine on renal function rather than its central action .
B O O O O O O O O O
These results provide a reasonable explanation for the beneficial effects observed in some encephalopathic patients receiving L - dopa .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O
Heparin - induced thrombocytopenia after liver transplantation .
B O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Unfractionated heparin sodium ( UFH ) or low - molecular weight heparin ( LMWH ) is used in anticoagulant protocols at several institutions to prevent thrombosis after liver transplantation .
B I I O B O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Heparin - induced thrombocytopenia ( HIT ) is an adverse immune - mediated reaction to heparin , resulting in platelet count decreases of more than 50 % .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
The frequencies of HIT after liver transplantation and platelet factor 4 / heparin - reactive antibody ( HIT antibody ) positivity in liver transplantation patients , however , are unknown
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
PATIENTS AND METHODS :
O O O O
The 32 men and 20 women underwent living donor liver transplantation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
We started LMWH ( 25 IU / kg / h ) on postoperative day ( POD ) 1 , switching to UFH ( 5000 U / d ) on POD
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
2 or 3 .
O O O O
The dose of UFH was changed according to the activated clotting time level .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
HIT antibody levels were measured the day before surgery and on POD 7 and 14 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Platelet count was measured daily for 3 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The average platelet counts preoperatively , and on POD 7 , 14 , and 21 were 65 , 88 , 149 , and 169 x 10 ( 9 ) /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
L , respectively .
O O O O
Two patients developed hepatic artery thrombosis on POD 11 and 19 , respectively , although they were HIT antibody - negative and their platelet counts were stable .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 2 other patients , the platelet count decreased suddenly from 107 x 10 ( 9 ) / L on POD 4 to 65 x 10 ( 9 ) /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
L on POD 6 and from 76 x 10 ( 9 ) / L on POD 7 to 33 x 10 ( 9 ) / L on POD 9 ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
respectively .
O O
The heparin - induced platelet aggregation test was negative in these patients .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The percentage of HIT antibody - positive patients was 0 . 5 % preoperatively , 5 . 6 % on POD 7 , and 5 . 6 % on POD
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
14 .
O O
None of the subjects / patients developed UFH - related HIT .
O O O O O O O B O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
In our series , the occurrence of HIT after liver transplantation was uncommon .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PTU - associated vasculitis in a girl with Turner Syndrome and Graves ' disease .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Palpable purpura is a concerning clinical finding in pediatric patients and can have many causes , including infectious and autoimmune processes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A rare cause , drug - induced vasculitis , may result from the production of antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies ( ANCAs ) in response to a medication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report a girl with Turner syndrome and Graves ' disease who presented with palpable purpuric lesions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The diagnosis of propylthiouracil ( PTU ) - associated vasculitis was made by observation of consistent clinical features , the detection of elevated ANA and ANCA in the blood ,
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and the observed clinical resolution of symptoms following withdrawal of PTU .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
Subsequent treatment of persistent hyperthyroidism with radioablation did not result in an exacerbation of the vasculitis , a complication described in prior case reports .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Succinylcholine - induced masseter muscle rigidity during bronchoscopic removal of a tracheal foreign body .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Masseter muscle rigidity during general anesthesia is considered an early warning sign of a possible episode of malignant hyperthermia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The decision whether to continue or discontinue the procedure depends on the urgency of the surgery and severity of masseter muscle rigidity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Here , we describe a case of severe masseter muscle rigidity ( jaw of steel ) after succinylcholine ( Sch ) administration during general anesthetic management for rigid bronchoscopic removal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
of a tracheal foreign body .
O O O O O O
Anesthesia was continued uneventfully with propofol infusion while all facilities were available to detect and treat malignant hyperthermia .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Minor neurological dysfunction , cognitive development , and somatic development at the age of 3 to 7 years after dexamethasone treatment in very - low birth - weight infants .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The objective of this study was to assess minor neurological dysfunction , cognitive development , and somatic development after dexamethasone therapy in very - low - birthweight infants .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Thirty - three children after dexamethasone treatment were matched to 33 children without dexamethasone treatment .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O
Data were assessed at the age of 3 - 7 years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dexamethasone was started between the 7th and the 28th day of life over 7 days with a total dose of 2 . 35 mg / kg / day .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Exclusion criteria were asphyxia , malformations , major surgical interventions , small for gestational age , intraventricular haemorrhage grades III and IV , periventricular leukomalacia , and severe psychomotor retardation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Each child was examined by a neuropediatrician for minor neurological dysfunctions and tested by a psychologist for cognitive development with a Kaufman Assessment Battery for Children and a Draw -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a - Man Test .
O O O O O
There were no differences in demographic data , growth , and socio - economic status between the two groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fine motor skills and gross motor function were significantly better in the control group ( p < 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the Draw - a - Man Test , the control group showed better results ( p < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There were no differences in development of speech , social development , and the Kaufman Assessment Battery for Children .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After dexamethasone treatment , children showed a higher rate of minor neurological dysfunctions .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neurological development was affected even without neurological diagnosis .
O O O O O O O O O
Further long - term follow - up studies will be necessary to fully evaluate the impact of dexamethasone on neurological and cognitive development .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Force overflow and levodopa - induced dyskinesias in Parkinson 's disease .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
We assessed force coordination of the hand in Parkinson 's disease and its relationship to motor complications of levodopa therapy , particularly to levodopa - induced dyskinesias ( LID )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O
.
O
We studied two groups of Parkinson 's disease patients with ( Parkinson 's disease + LID , n = 23 ) and without levodopa - induced dyskinesias ( Parkinson 's
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
disease - LID , n = 10 ) , and age - matched healthy controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The motor score of the Unified Parkinson 's Disease Rating Scale , a dyskinesia score and force in a grip - lift paradigm were assessed ON and OFF levodopa .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
A pathological increase of forces was seen in ON - state in Parkinson 's disease + LID only .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In Parkinson 's disease + LID , the force involved in pressing down the object before lifting was significantly increased by levodopa ( by 61 % , P < 0
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
. 05 ) .
O O O O
An overshooting of peak grip force by 51 % ( P < 0 . 05 ) and of static grip force by 45 % ( P < 0 . 01
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) was observed in the ON - compared with the OFF - drug condition .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , no excessive force was found in Parkinson 's disease - LID .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Peak grip force in ON - state was 140 % ( P < 0 . 05 ) higher in Parkinson 's disease + LID than in Parkinson 's disease -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
LID , while static grip force was increased by 138 % ( P < 0 . 01 ) between groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Severity of peak - dose dyskinesias was strongly correlated with grip force in ON - state ( r = 0 . 79 with peak force , P < 0 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
01 ) .
O O O
No correlation was observed between forces and the motor score as well as with the daily dose of dopaminergic medication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Force excess was only observed in patients with LID and motor fluctuations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A close relationship was seen between the overshooting of forces and dyskinesias in the ON - drug condition .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We postulate that both LID and grip force excess share common pathophysiological mechanisms related to motor fluctuations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Postinfarction ventricular septal defect associated with long - term steroid therapy .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
Two cases of postinfarction ventricular septal rupture in patients on long - term steroid therapy are presented and the favourable outcome in both cases described .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
A possible association between steroid therapy and subsequent postinfarction septal rupture is discussed .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Angioedema associated with droperidol administration .
O O O B O O
Angioedema , also known as angioneurotic edema or Quincke 's disease , is a well - demarcated , localized edema involving the subcutaneous tissues that may cause upper - airway
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
obstruction .
O O
We report the case of a previously healthy 19 - year - old man with no known drug allergies in whom angioedema with significant tongue swelling and protrusion developed within
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
10 minutes of the administration of a single IV dose of droperidol .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Clarithromycin - associated visual hallucinations in a patient with chronic renal failure on continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Visual hallucinations are a rare event in chronic renal failure and not related to uremia per se .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Unreported in the literature is visual hallucinations occurring in association with the new macrolide antibiotic , clarithromycin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O
We describe such a case in a patient with end - stage renal disease ( ESRD ) maintained on continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis ( CAPD ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The combination of a relatively high dose of clarithromycin in face of chronic renal failure in a functionally anephric patient , with underlying aluminum intoxication , may have facilitated the
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
appearance of this neurotoxic side effect .
O O O O O O O
It is important to understand the pharmacokinetics of medications in face of chronic renal failure , the possibility of drug interactions , and how these factors should help guide medication
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
therapy in the ESRD patient .
O O O O O O
Acute renal toxicity of doxorubicin ( adriamycin ) - loaded cyanoacrylate nanoparticles .
O O O O B O B O O O B O O
Acute doxorubicin - loaded nanoparticle ( DXNP ) renal toxicity was explored in both normal rats and rats with experimental glomerulonephritis .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In normal rats , 2 / 6 rats given free doxorubicin ( DX ) ( 5 mg / kg ) died within one week , whereas all control animals and
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
all rats having received free NP or DXNP survived .
O O O O O O O O O O
A 3 times higher proteinuria appeared in animals treated with DXNP than in those treated with DX .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Free NP did not provoke any proteinuria .
O O O O O O O O
Two hr post - injection , DXNP was 2 . 7 times more concentrated in kidneys than free DX ( p < 0 . 025 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
In rats with immune experimental glomerulonephritis , 5 / 6 rats given DX died within 7 days , in contrast to animals treated by DXNP , NP , or untreated
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, which all survived .
O O O O O
Proteinuria appeared in all series , but was 2 - 5 times more intense ( p > 0 . 001 ) and prolonged after doxorubicin treatment ( 400 - 700
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
mg / day ) , without significant difference between DXNP and DX .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Rats treated by unloaded NP behaved as controls .
O O O O O O O O O
These results demonstrate that , in these experimental conditions , DXNP killed less animals than free DX , despite of an enhanced renal toxicity of the former .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Both effects ( better survival and nephrosis ) are most probably related to an enhanced capture of DXNP by cells of the mononuclear phagocyte system , including mesangial cells .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Etoposide - related myocardial infarction .
B O O O O O
The occurrence of a myocardial infarction is reported after chemotherapy containing etoposide , in a man with no risk factors for coronary heart disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Possible causal mechanisms are discussed .
O O O O O O
Subjective assessment of sexual dysfunction of patients on long - term administration of digoxin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Various data suggest that male patients who have received digoxin on a longterm basis have increased levels of serum estrogen and decreased levels of plasma testosterone and luteinizing hormone (
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O
LH ) .
O O O
This study was undertaken to investigate the links between the long - term administration of digoxin therapy and sexual behavior , and the effect of digoxin on plasma levels of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
estradiol , testosterone , and LH .
B O B O O O O
The patients of the study and control group ( without digoxin ) were of similar cardiac functional capacity and age ( 25 - 40 years ) and were randomly selected
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
from the rheumatic heart disease patients .
O O O O O O O
A subjective assessment of sexual behavior in the study and control groups was carried out , using parameters such as sexual desire , sexual excitement , and frequency of sexual
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
relations .
O O
Personal interviews and a questionnaire were also used for the evaluation of sexual behavior .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The findings support the reports concerning digoxin effect on plasma estradiol , testosterone , and LH .
O O O O O O B O O O B O B O O O O
The differences in the means were significant .
O O O O O O O O
Tests used to evaluate the changes in sexual behavior showed a significant decrease in sexual desire , sexual excitement phase ( erection ) , and frequency of sexual relations in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the study group .
O O O O
Fatal aplastic anemia due to indomethacin - - lymphocyte transformation tests in vitro .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Although indomethacin has been implicated as a possible cause of aplastic anemia on the basis of a few clinical observations , its role has not been definitely established .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A case of fatal aplastic anemia is described in which no drugs other than allopurinol and indomethacin were given .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
Indomethacin was first given four weeks prior to the onset of symptoms .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
A positive lymphocyte transformation test with indomethacin in vitro further substantiates the potential role of this drug in causing aplastic anemia in a susceptible patient .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fortunately , this seems to be a very rare complication .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Plasma and urinary lipids and lipoproteins during the development of nephrotic syndrome induced in the rat by puromycin aminonucleoside .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
This study was undertaken to ascertain whether the alterations of plasma lipoproteins found in nephrotic syndrome induced by puromycin aminonucleoside were due to nephrotic syndrome per se , or ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
at least in part , to the aminonucleoside .
O O O O O O O B O
The purpose of the present study was to investigate the changes in plasma and urinary lipoproteins during the administration of puromycin aminonucleoside ( 20 mg / kg for 7 days
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
) and the subsequent development of nephrotic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O
Since massive albuminuria occurred after 6 days of treatment , the time - course study was divided into two stages : pre - nephrotic stage
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( day 1 - 5 ) and nephrotic stage ( day 6 - 11 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In pre - nephrotic stage the plasma level of fatty acids , triacylglycerol and VLDL decreased while that of phospholipid , cholesteryl esters and HDL remained constant .
O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
Plasma apolipoprotein A
O O O
- I tended to increase ( 40 % increase at day 5 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At the beginning of nephrotic stage ( day 6 ) the concentration of plasma albumin dropped to a very low level , while that of apolipoprotein A - I increased
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
abruptly ( 4 - fold increase ) and continued to rise , although less steeply , in the following days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The plasma concentration of HDL followed the same pattern .
O O O O O O O O O O
Plasma VLDL and LDL increased at a later stage ( day 9 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Plasma apolipoprotein A - I was found not only in HDL ( 1 . 063 - 1 . 210 g / ml ) but also in the LDL density class
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 1 . 025 - 1 . 050 g / ml ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the pre - nephrotic stage lipoproteinuria was negligible , while in the early nephrotic stage the urinary loss of plasma lipoproteins consisted mainly of HDL .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These observations indicate that puromycin aminonucleoside alters plasma lipoproteins by lowering VLDL and increasing HDL .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
It is likely that the early and striking increase of plasma HDL found in nephrotic rats is related to a direct effect of the drug on HDL metabolism .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Circulating lysosomal enzymes and acute hepatic necrosis .
O O O O O O O O
The activities of the lysosomal enzymes acid and neutral protease , N - acetylglucosaminidase , and acid phosphatase were measured in the serum of patients with fulminant hepatic failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acid protease ( cathepsin D ) activity was increased about tenfold in patients who died and nearly fourfold in those who survived fulminant hepatic failure after paracetamol overdose , whereas
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
activities were increased equally in patients with fulminant hepatic failure due to viral hepatitis whether or not they survived .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A correlation was found between serum acid protease activity and prothrombin time , and the increase in cathepsin D activity was sustained over several days compared with aspartate aminotransferase ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
which showed a sharp early peak and then a fall .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Circulating lysosomal proteases can damage other organs , and measurement of their activity may therefore be of added value in assessing prognosis in this condition .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Transketolase abnormality in tolazamide - induced Wernicke 's encephalopathy .
O O O B O O O O O O
We studied a thiamine - dependent enzyme , transketolase , from fibroblasts of a diabetic patient who developed Wernicke 's encephalopathy when treated with tolazamide , in order to delineate
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
if this patient also had transketolase abnormality [ high Km for thiamine pyrophosphate ( TPP ) ] , as previously reported in postalcoholic Wernicke - Korsakoff syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition to this patient , we also studied this enzyme from three diabetic kindreds without any history of Wernicke 's encephalopathy and from four normal controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We found that the above - mentioned patient and one of the diabetic kindreds with no history of Wernicke 's encephalopathy had abnormal transketolase as determined by its Km for
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
TPP .
B O
These data suggest a similarity between postalcoholic Wernicke - Korsakoff syndrome and the patient with tolazamide - induced Wernicke 's encephalopathy from the standpoint of transketolase abnormality .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mechanisms of myocardial ischemia induced by epinephrine : comparison with exercise - induced ischemia .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The role of epinephrine in eliciting myocardial ischemia was examined in patients with coronary artery disease .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Objective signs of ischemia and factors increasing myocardial oxygen consumption were compared during epinephrine infusion and supine bicycle exercise .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O
Both epinephrine and exercise produced myocardial ischemia as evidenced by ST segment depression and angina .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , the mechanisms of myocardial ischemia induced by epinephrine were significantly different from those of exercise .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Exercise - induced myocardial ischemia was marked predominantly by increased heart rate and rate - pressure product with a minor contribution of end - diastolic volume , while epinephrine -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
induced ischemia was characterized by a marked increase in contractility and a less pronounced increase in heart rate and rate - pressure product .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings indicate that ischemia produced by epinephrine , as may occur during states of emotional distress , has a mechanism distinct from that due to physical exertion .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Transient contralateral rotation following unilateral substantia nigra lesion reflects susceptibility of the nigrostriatal system to exhaustion by amphetamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Following unilateral 6 - OHDA induced SN lesion , a transient period of contralateral rotation has been reported to precede the predominant ipsilateral circling .
O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In order to clarify the nature of this initial contralateral rotation we examined the effect of the duration of recovery period after the lesion , on amphetamine - induced rotational
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
behavior .
O O
Three days post lesion , most rats circled predominantly contralaterally to the lesion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Such contralateral rotation may result from either degeneration - induced breakdown of the DA pool , or lesion - induced increase of DA turnover in the spared neurons .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A substantial degree of contralateral preference was still evident when amphetamine was administered for the first time 24 days after lesioning , indicating involvement of spared cells in the contralateral
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rotation .
O O
However , regardless of the duration of recovery ( and irrespective of either lesion volume , amphetamine dose , or post - lesion motor exercise ) , amphetamine - induced
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
rotation tended to become gradually more ipsilateral as the observation session progressed , and all rats circled ipsilaterally to the lesion in response to further amphetamine injections .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
These findings suggest that amphetamine has an irreversible effect on the post - lesion DA pool contributing to contralateral rotation .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thyroid function and urine - concentrating ability during lithium treatment .
O O O O O O O O B O O
It has been suggested that adenylate cyclase inhibition may be important in the development of both nephrogenic diabetes insipidus and hypothyroidism during lithium treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
We measured serum thyroxine and urine - concentrating ability ( Umax ) in response to desmopressin ( DDAVP ) in 85 patients receiving lithium .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Hypothyroidism developed in eight patients while they were taking lithium .
O O O O O O O O O B O
Impaired Umax was found in both euthyroid and hypothyroid patients while some hypothyroid patients concentrated their urine well .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is concluded that the dominant mechanisms by which lithium exerts these two effects are different .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Sensitivity of erythroid progenitor colonies to erythropoietin in azidothymidine treated immunodeficient mice .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The anaemia induced by 3' - azido - 3'dideoxythymidine ( AZT ) is poorly understood .
O O O O B I I I I O B O O O O O
We have used a murine model of AIDS , infection of female C57BL / 6 mice with LP - BM5 murine leukaemia ( MuLV ) virus , to determine if
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
AZT - induced anaemia is due , in part , to decreased responsiveness of erythropoietic precursors ( BFU - e ) to erythropoietin ( EPO ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mice in the early stage of LP - BM5 MuLV disease were given AZT in their drinking water at 1 . 0 and 2 . 5 mg / ml .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
AZT produced anaemia in both groups , in a dose - dependent fashion .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Despite the anaemia , the number of splenic and bone marrow BFU - e in AZT treated mice increased up to five - fold over levels observed in infected untreated
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
animals after 15 d of treatment .
O O O O O O O
Colony formation by splenic and bone marrow BFUe was stimulated at lower concentrations of EPO in mice receiving AZT for 15 d than for infected , untreated mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
By day 30 , sensitivity of both splenic and bone marrow BFU - e of treated animals returned to that observed from cells of infected untreated animals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean plasma levels of EPO observed in AZT treated mice were appropriate for the degree of anaemia observed when compared with phenylhydrazine ( PHZ ) treated mice .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
The numbers of BFU - e and the percentage of bone marrow erythroblasts observed were comparable in AZT and PHZ treated mice with similar degrees of anaemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
However , reticulocytosis was inappropriate for the degree of anaemia observed in AZT treated infected mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
AZT - induced peripheral anaemia in the face of increased numbers of BFU - e and increased levels of plasma EPO suggest a lesion in terminal differentiation .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Detection of abnormal cardiac adrenergic neuron activity in adriamycin - induced cardiomyopathy with iodine - 125 - metaiodobenzylguanidine .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O B I I I I O
Radiolabeled metaiodobenzylguanidine ( MIBG ) , an analog of norepinephrine ( NE ) , serves as an index of adrenergic neuron integrity and function .
B I O B O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Using a rat model of adriamycin - induced cardiomyopathy , we tested the hypothesis that abnormal cardiac adrenergic neuron activity may appear and be exacerbated dose - dependently in
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
adriamycin cardiomyopathy .
B O O
The degree of vacuolar degeneration of myocardial cells was analyzed in relation to the duration of adriamycin treatment ( 2 mg / kg , once a week ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
There were no abnormalities or only isolated degeneration in the 1 - or 2 - wk treatment groups , isolated or scattered degeneration in half of the 3 - wk
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
group , frequent scattered degeneration in the 4 - wk group , scattered or focal degeneration in the 5 - wk group , and extensive degeneration in the 8 -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
wk group .
O O O
Myocardial accumulation of [ 125I ] MIBG 4 hr after intravenous injection did not differ between the controls and the groups treated 3 wk or less .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , the 4 - wk group had a slightly lower accumulation in the right ventricular wall ( 82 % of the control ) and significantly lower accumulation in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
left ventricular wall ( about 66 % of the control : p less than 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the 5 - wk group , MIBG accumulation in the right and left ventricular wall was 35 % and 27 % of that in controls , respectively ( p
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
less than 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O
In the 8 - wk group , MIBG accumulation in the right and left ventricular wall was 18 % and 14 % of that in controls , respectively ( p
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
less than 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O
Thus , MIBG accumulation in the myocardium decreased in an adriamycin dose - dependent manner .
O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O
The appearance of impaired cardiac adrenergic neuron activity in the presence of slight myocardial impairment ( scattered or focal vacuolar degeneration ) indicates that MIBG scintigraphy may be a useful
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
method for detection of adriamycin - induced cardiomyopathy .
O O O O B O O O O
Amnestic syndrome associated with propranolol toxicity : a case report .
O O O O B O O O O O O
An elderly woman developed an Alzheimer - like subacute dementia as a result of propranolol toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Analysis of the manifestations showed that severe impairment of memory accounted for virtually all of the abnormalities .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There is evidence that cerebral reactions to drug toxicity can exhibit patterns that suggest highly selective involvement of functional subdivisions of the brain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Biphasic response of the SA node of the dog heart in vivo to selective administration of ketamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Effect of ketamine on the SA node of the dog heart was studied in vivo using a selective perfusion technique of the SA node artery .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Injections of ketamine in doses from 100 microgram to 3 mg into the artery produced a depression of the SA nodal activity by a direct action .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This depression was followed by the sudden appearance of a stimulatory phase .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bilateral vagotomy and sympathectomy or prior administration of a ganglion blocker failed to inhibit the occurrence of the ketamine - induced tachycardia , while it was completely abolished in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
reserpinized dogs or by a prior injection of a beta - blocking agent into the SA node artery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This may indicate that an activation of the peripheral adrenergic mechanism plays an important role in the induction of the excitatory effect of ketamine injected in the SA node artery
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
.
O
The use of serum cholinesterase in succinylcholine apnoea .
O O O O O O B O O
Fifteen patients demonstrating unexpected prolonged apnoea lasting several hours after succinylcholine have been treated by a new preparation of human serum cholinesterase .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adequate spontaneous respiration was re - established in an average period of ten minutes after the injection .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 12 patients biochemical genetic examinations confirmed the presence of an atypical serum cholinesterase .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In three patients none of the usual variants were found .
O O O O O O O O O O O
It is therefore supposed that other unknown variants of serum cholinesterase exist which can not hydrolyze succinylcholine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The use of serum cholinesterase in succinylcholine apnoea provided considerable relief to both patient and anaesthetist .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Orthostatic hypotension occurs following alpha 2 - adrenoceptor blockade in chronic prazosin - pretreated conscious spontaneously hypertensive rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
1 .
O O
Studies were performed to evaluate whether chronic prazosin treatment alters the alpha 2 - adrenoceptor function for orthostatic control of arterial blood pressure in conscious spontaneously hypertensive rats ( SHR

O O

O O

O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
mg kg - 1 i . p . ) or rauwolscine ( 3 mg kg - 1 i . v . ) .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O

i . p .
O O O O
for chronic alpha 1 - adrenoceptor blockade .
O O O O O O O O

1 i . p . ) .
O O O O O O O
