Coexistence of cerebral venous sinus and internal carotid artery thrombosis associated with exogenous sex hormones .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A case report .
O O O O
A forty - six year - old premenopausal woman developed headache , nausea and vomiting , left hemiparesis and seizure two days after parenteral use of progesterone and estradiol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Diabetes mellitus ( DM ) was found during admission .
O O O O O O O O O O
Computed tomography showed a hemorrhagic infarct in the right frontal lobe and increased density in the superior sagittal sinus ( SSS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Left carotid angiography found occlusion of the left internal carotid artery ( ICA ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Right carotid angiograms failed to show the SSS and inferior sagittal sinus , suggestive of venous sinus thrombosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Coexistence of the cerebral artery and the venous sinus occlusion has been described infrequently .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this case , the authors postulate that the use of estradiol and progesterone and the underlying DM increased vascular thrombogenicity , which provided a common denominator for thrombosis of
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
both the ICA and the venous sinus .
O O O O O O O O
Chloroquine related complete heart block with blindness : case report .
B O O O O O O O O O O
A 27 - year old African woman with history of regular chloroquine ingestion presented with progressive deterioration of vision , easy fatiguability , dyspnoea , dizziness progressing to syncopal attacks
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Ophthalmological assessment revealed features of chloroquine retinopathy , cardiac assessment revealed features of heart failure and a complete heart block with right bundle branch block pattern .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The heart block was treated by pacemaker insertion and the heart failure resolved spontaneously following chloroquine discontinuation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
She however remains blind .
O O O O O
Systemic toxicity and resuscitation in bupivacaine - , levobupivacaine - , or ropivacaine - infused rats .
O O O O O B O O B O O O B O O O O
We compared the systemic toxicity of bupivacaine , levobupivacaine , and ropivacaine in anesthetized rats .
O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O
We also compared the ability to resuscitate rats after lethal doses of these local anesthetics .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bupivacaine , levobupivacaine , or ropivacaine was infused at a rate of 2 mg .
B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O
kg ( - 1 ) .
O O O O O O
min ( - 1 ) while electrocardiogram , electroencephalogram , and arterial pressure were continuously monitored .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When asystole was recorded , drug infusion was stopped and a resuscitation sequence was begun .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Epinephrine 0 . 01
B O O O
mg / kg was administered at 1 - min intervals while external cardiac compressions were applied .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Resuscitation was considered successful when a systolic arterial pressure > or = 100 mm Hg was achieved within 5 min .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The cumulative doses of levobupivacaine and ropivacaine that produced seizures were similar and were larger than those of bupivacaine .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The cumulative doses of levobupivacaine that produced dysrhythmias and asystole were smaller than the corresponding doses of ropivacaine , but they were larger than those of bupivacaine .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O
The number of successful resuscitations did not differ among groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O
However , a smaller dose of epinephrine was required in the Ropivacaine group than in the other groups .
O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O
We conclude that the systemic toxicity of levobupivacaine is intermediate between that of ropivacaine and bupivacaine when administered at the same rate and that ropivacaine - induced cardiac arrest appears
O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
to be more susceptible to treatment than that induced by bupivacaine or levobupivacaine .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
22 - oxacalcitriol suppresses secondary hyperparathyroidism without inducing low bone turnover in dogs with renal failure .
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Calcitriol therapy suppresses serum levels of parathyroid hormone ( PTH ) in patients with renal failure but has several drawbacks , including hypercalcemia and / or marked suppression of bone
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
turnover , which may lead to adynamic bone disease .
O O O O O O O O O O
A new vitamin D analogue , 22 - oxacalcitriol ( OCT ) , has been shown to have promising characteristics .
O O B I O O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O
This study was undertaken to determine the effects of OCT on serum PTH levels and bone turnover in states of normal or impaired renal function .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Sixty dogs were either nephrectomized ( Nx , N = 38 ) or sham - operated ( Sham , N = 22 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The animals received supplemental phosphate to enhance PTH secretion .
O O O O B O O O O O
Fourteen weeks after the start of phosphate supplementation , half of the Nx and Sham dogs received doses of OCT ( three times per week ) ; the other half
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
were given vehicle for 60 weeks .
O O O O O O O
Thereafter , the treatment modalities for a subset of animals were crossed over for an additional eight months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Biochemical and hormonal indices of calcium and bone metabolism were measured throughout the study , and bone biopsies were done at baseline , 60 weeks after OCT or vehicle treatment
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
, and at the end of the crossover period .
O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
In Nx dogs , OCT significantly decreased serum PTH levels soon after the induction of renal insufficiency .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In long - standing secondary hyperparathyroidism , OCT ( 0 . 03 microg / kg ) stabilized serum PTH levels during the first months .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Serum PTH levels rose thereafter , but the rise was less pronounced compared with baseline than the rise seen in Nx control .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These effects were accompanied by episodes of hypercalcemia and hyperphosphatemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O
In animals with normal renal function , OCT induced a transient decrease in serum PTH levels at a dose of 0 . 1 microg / kg , which was not
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
sustained with lowering of the doses .
O O O O O O O
In Nx dogs , OCT reversed abnormal bone formation , such as woven osteoid and fibrosis , but did not significantly alter the level of bone turnover .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , OCT improved mineralization lag time , ( that is , the rate at which osteoid mineralizes ) in both Nx and Sham dogs .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
These results indicate that even though OCT does not completely prevent the occurrence of hypercalcemia in experimental dogs with renal insufficiency , it may be of use in the management
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of secondary hyperparathyroidism because it does not induce low bone turnover and , therefore , does not increase the risk of adynamic bone disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Chemotherapy of advanced inoperable non - small cell lung cancer with paclitaxel : a phase II trial .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Paclitaxel
B
( Taxol ; Bristol - Myers Squibb Company , Princeton , NJ ) has demonstrated significant antineoplastic activity against different tumor types , notably ovarian and breast carcinoma .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two phase II trials of 24 - hour paclitaxel infusions in chemotherapy - naive patients with stage IIIB or IV non - small cell lung cancer ( NSCLC ) reported
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
response rates of 21 % and 24 % .
O O O O O O O O O
Leukopenia was dose limiting : as many as 62 . 5 % of patients experienced grade 4 leukopenia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We investigated the efficacy and toxicity of a 3 - hour paclitaxel infusion in a phase II trial in patients with inoperable stage IIIB or IV NSCLC .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The 58 patients treated ( 41 men and 17 women ) had a median age of 59 years ( age range , 25 to 75 ) and a performance status
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of 0 through 2 .
O O O O O
Most patients ( 72 . 4 % ) had stage IV NSCLC .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Paclitaxel 225 mg / m2 was infused over 3 hours every 3 weeks with standard prophylactic premedication .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of 50 patients evaluable for response , 12 ( 24 % ) had partial remission , 26 ( 52 % ) had no change , and 12 had disease progression
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( 24 % ) .
O O O O O
Hematologic toxicities were mild : only one patient ( 2 % ) developed grade 3 or 4 neutropenia , while 29 % had grade 1 or 2 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Grade 1 or 2 polyneuropathy affected 56 % of patients while only one ( 2 % ) experienced severe polyneuropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Similarly , grade 1 or 2 myalgia / arthralgia was observed in 63 . 2 % of patients , but only 14 . 3 % experienced grade 3 or 4
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Nausea and vomiting were infrequent , with 14 % of patients experiencing grade 1 or 2 and only 2 % experiencing grade 3 or 4 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Paclitaxel is thus an active single agent in this patient population , with a 3 - hour infusion proving comparably effective to a 24 - hour infusion and superior in
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
terms of the incidence of hematologic and nonhematologic toxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O
Further phase II studies with paclitaxel combined with other drugs active against NSCLC are indicated , and phase III studies comparing paclitaxel with standard chemotherapy remain to be completed .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Cerebral hemorrhage associated with phenylpropanolamine in combination with caffeine .
O O O O B O O O B O
Phenylpropanolamine ( PPA ) is a drug that has been associated with serious side effects including stroke .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is often combined with caffeine in diet preparations and """" look - alike """" pills .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In order to determine if PPA / caffeine can lead to stroke in normotensive and / or hypertensive rats , we administered the combination in six times the allowed human
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dose calculated on a per weight basis for the rats two times per day for five days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Subarachnoid and cerebral hemorrhage was noted in 18 % of the hypertensive rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A single PPA / caffeine administration ( same dose ) lead to acute hypertension in both the normotensive and hypertensive animals .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that PPA / caffeine can lead to cerebral hemorrhage in previously hypertensive animals when administered in greater than the allowed dosage .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An acute elevation in blood pressure may be a contributing factor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Long - term efficacy and toxicity of high - dose amiodarone therapy for ventricular tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Amiodarone was administered to 154 patients who had sustained , symptomatic ventricular tachycardia ( VT ) ( n = 118 ) or a cardiac arrest ( n = 36 )
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and who were refractory to conventional antiarrhythmic drugs .
O O O O O O O O O
The loading dose was 800 mg / day for 6 weeks and the maintenance dose was 600 mg / day .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sixty - nine percent of patients continued treatment with amiodarone and had no recurrence of symptomatic VT or ventricular fibrillation ( VF ) over a follow - up of 6
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to 52 months ( mean + / -
O O O O O O O O
standard deviation 14 . 2 + / -
O O O O O O O O
8 . 2 ) .
O O O O O
Six percent of the patients had a nonfatal recurrence of VT and were successfully managed by continuing amiodarone at a higher dose or by the addition of a conventional antiarrhythmic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
drug .
O O
One or more adverse drug reactions occurred in 51 % of patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Adverse effects forced a reduction in the dose of amiodarone in 41 % and discontinuation of amiodarone in 10 % of patients .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The most common symptomatic adverse reactions were tremor or ataxia ( 35 % ) , nausea and anorexia ( 8 % ) , visual halos or blurring ( 6 %
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) , thyroid function abnormalities ( 6 % ) and pulmonary interstitial infiltrates ( 5 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although large - dose amiodarone is highly effective in the long - term treatment of VT or VF refractory to conventional antiarrhythmic drugs , it causes significant toxicity in approximately
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
50 % of patients .
O O O O O
However , when the dose is adjusted based on clinical response or the development of adverse effects , 75 % of patients with VT or VF can be successfully managed
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with amiodarone .
O B O
Effect of calcium chloride and 4 - aminopyridine therapy on desipramine toxicity in rats .
O O B I O B I I O O B O O O O
BACKGROUND : Hypotension is a major contributor to mortality in tricyclic antidepressant overdose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recent data suggest that tricyclic antidepressants inhibit calcium influx in some tissues .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
This study addressed the potential role of calcium channel blockade in tricyclic antidepressant - induced hypotension .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Two interventions were studied that have been shown previously to improve blood pressure with calcium channel blocker overdose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
CaCl2 and 4 - aminopyridine .
B O B I I O
Anesthetized rats received the tricyclic antidepressant desipramine IP to produce hypotension , QRS prolongation , and bradycardia .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Fifteen min later , animals received CaCl2 , NaHCO3 , or saline .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O
In a second experiment , rats received tricyclic antidepressant desipramine IP followed in 15 min by 4 - aminopyridine or saline .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B I I O O O
RESULTS :
O O
NaHCO3 briefly ( 5 min ) reversed hypotension and QRS prolongation .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
CaCl2 and 4 - aminopyridine failed to improve blood pressure .
B O B I I O O O O O O
The incidence of ventricular arrhythmias ( p = 0 . 004 ) and seizures ( p = 0 . 03 ) in the CaCl2 group was higher than the other
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
groups .
O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
The administration of CaCl2 or 4 - aminopyridine did not reverse tricyclic antidepressant - induced hypotension in rats .
O O O B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O
CaCl2 therapy may possibly worsen both cardiovascular and central nervous system toxicity .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings do not support a role for calcium channel inhibition in the pathogenesis of tricyclic antidepressant - induced hypotension .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Phase I trial of 13 - cis - retinoic acid in children with neuroblastoma following bone marrow transplantation .
O O O O B I I I I I O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
Treatment of neuroblastoma cell lines with 13 - cis - retinoic acid ( cis - RA ) can cause sustained inhibition of proliferation .
O O O O O O B I I I I I O B I I O O O O O O O O
Since cis - RA has demonstrated clinical responses in neuroblastoma patients , it may be effective in preventing relapse after cytotoxic therapy .
O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This phase I trial was designed to determine the maximal - tolerated dosage ( MTD ) , toxicities , and pharmacokinetics of cis - RA administered on an intermittent schedule
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O
in children with neuroblastoma following bone marrow transplantation ( BMT ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS AND METHODS :
O O O O
Fifty - one assessable patients , 2 to 12 years of age , were treated with oral cis - RA administered in two equally divided doses daily for 2 weeks
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
, followed by a 2 - week rest period , for up to 12 courses .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The dose was escalated from 100 to 200 mg / m2 / d until dose - limiting toxicity ( DLT ) was observed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A single intrapatient dose escalation was permitted .
O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The MTD of cis - RA was 160 mg / m2 / d .
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O
Dose - limiting toxicities in six of nine patients at 200 mg / m2 / d included hypercalcemia ( n = 3 ) , rash ( n = 2 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and anemia / thrombocytopenia / emesis / rash ( n = 1 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All toxicities resolved after cis - RA was discontinued .
O O O O B I I O O O
Three complete responses were observed in marrow metastases .
O O O O O O O O O
Serum levels of 7 . 4 + / -
O O O O O O O O O
3 . 0 mumol / L ( peak ) and 4 . 0 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 8 mumol / L ( trough ) at the MTD were maintained during 14 days of therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The DLT correlated with serum levels > or = 10 mumol / L . CONCLUSION :
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The MTD of cis - RA given on this intermittent schedule was 160 mg / m2 / d .
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Serum levels known to be effective against neuroblastoma in vitro were achieved at this dose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The DLT included hypercalcemia , and may be predicted by serum cis - RA levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O
Monitoring of serum calcium and cis - RA levels is indicated in future trials .
O O O B O B I I O O O O O O O
Effect of calcium chloride on gross behavioural changes produced by carbachol and eserine in cats .
O O B I O O O O O O B O B O O O
The effect of calcium chloride injected into the cerebral ventricles of group - housed unanaesthetized cats upon vocalization ( rage , hissing and snarling ) , fighting ( attack with
O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
paws and claws , defense with paws and claws and biting ) , mydriasis , tremor and clonic - tonic convulsions produced by carbachol and eserine injected similarly was investigated
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
.
O
Calcium chloride depressed or almost completely abolished the vocalization and fighting due to carbachol and eserine .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
On the other hand , mydriasis , tremor and clonic - tonic convulsions evoked by carbachol and eserine were not significantly changed by calcium chloride .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O B I O
It is apparent that calcium chloride can """" dissociate """" vocalization and fighting from autonomic and motor phenomena such as mydriasis , tremor and clonic - tonic convulsions caused by
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
carbachol and eserine .
B O B O
Calcium chloride inhibited the vocalization and fighting produced by carbachol and eserine most probably by a nonspecific stabilizing action on central muscarinic cholinoceptive sites .
B I O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results further support the view that calcium ions in excess have an atropine - like action also in the central nervous system .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Multiple side effects of penicillamine therapy in one patient with rheumatoid arthritis .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Skin rashes , proteinuria , systemic lupus erythematosus , polymyositis and myasthenia gravis have all been recorded as complications of penicillamine therapy in patients with rheumatoid arthritis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
A patient who had developed all 5 is now described .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The skin lesion resembled elastosis perforans serpiginosa , which has been reported as a rare side effect in patients with Wilson 's disease but not in patients with rheumatoid arthritis
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
treated with penicillamine .
O O B O
Electrocardiographic changes and cardiac arrhythmias in patients receiving psychotropic drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Eight patients had cardiac manifestations that were life - threatening in five while taking psychotropic drugs , either phenothiazines or tricyclic antidepressants .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Although most patients were receiving several drugs , Mellaril ( thioridazine ) appeared to be responsible for five cases of ventricular tachycardia , one of which was fatal in a
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
35 year old woman .
O O O O O
Supraventricular tachycardia developed in one patient receiving Thorazine ( chlorpromazine ) .
O O O O O O O B O B O O
Aventyl ( nortriptyline ) and Elavil ( amitriptyline ) each produced left bundle branch block in a 73 year old woman .
B O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Electrocardiographic T and U wave abnormalities were present in most patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The ventricular arrhythmias responded to intravenous administration of lidocaine and to direct current electric shock ; ventricular pacing was required in some instances and intravenous administration of propranolol combined with
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
ventricular pacing in one .
O O O O O
The tachyarrhythmias generally subsided within 48 hours after administration of the drugs was stopped .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Five of the eight patients were 50 years of age or younger ; only one clearly had antecedent heart disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Major cardiac arrhythmias are a potential hazard in patients without heart disease who are receiving customary therapeutic doses of psychotropic drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A prospective clinical trial is suggested to quantify the risk of cardiac complications to patients receiving phenothiazines or tricyclic antidepressant drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Serotonergic drugs , benzodiazepines and baclofen block muscimol - induced myoclonic jerks in a strain of mice .
O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
In male Swiss mice , muscimol produced myoclonic jerks .
O O O O O B O O O O
A 3 mg / kg ( i . p . )
O O O O O O O O O O O
dose induced this response in all of the mice tested and the peak response of 73 jerks per min was observed between 27 and 45 min .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Increasing the brain serotonin levels by the administration of 5 - hydroxytryptophan ( 80 - 160 mg / kg ) in combination with a peripheral decarboxylase inhibitor resulted in an
O O O B O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
inhibition of the muscimol effect .
O O O B O O
However , in a similar experiment l - dopa ( 80 - 160 mg / kg ) was without effect .
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O
In doses of 3 - 10 mg / kg , the serotonin receptor agonist MK - 212 caused a dose - dependent blockade of the response of muscimol .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O B O
Of the benzodiazepines , clonazepam ( 0 . 1 - 0 . 3 mg / kg ) was found to be several fold more potent than diazepam ( 0 .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
3 - 3 mg / kg ) in blocking the myoclonic jerks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
While ( - ) - baclofen ( 1 - 3 mg / kg ) proved to be an effective antagonist of muscimol , its ( + ) - isomer (
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
5 - 20 mg / kg ) lacked this property .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Considering the fact that 5 - HTP and the benzodiazepines have been found to be beneficial in the management of clinical myoclonus , the muscimol - induced myoclonus seems to
O O O O B I I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
be a satisfactory animal model that may prove useful for the development of new drug treatments for this condition .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our present study indicated the possible value of MK - 212 and ( - ) - baclofen in the management of clinical myoclonus .
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Hyperglycemic acidotic coma and death in Kearns - Sayre syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O
This paper presents the clinical and metabolic findings in two young boys with long - standing Kearns - Sayre syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Following short exposure to oral prednisone , both boys developed lethargy , increasing somnolence , polydipsia , polyphagia , and polyuria .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both presented in the emergency room with profound coma , hypotension , severe hyperglycemia , and acidosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nonketotic lactic acidosis was present in one and ketosis without a known serum lactate level was present in the other .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Respiratory failure rapidly ensued and both patients expired in spite of efforts at resuscitation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We believe these two cases represent a newly described and catastrophic metabolic - endocrine failure in the Kearns - Sayre syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effects of active constituents of Crocus sativus L . , crocin on streptozocin - induced model of sporadic Alzheimer 's disease in male rats .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
The involvement of water - soluble carotenoids , crocins , as the main and active components of Crocus sativus L . extract in learning and memory processes has been proposed
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
In the present study , the effect of crocins on sporadic Alzheimer 's disease induced by intracerebroventricular ( icv ) streptozocin ( STZ ) in male rats was investigated .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Male adult Wistar rats ( n = 90 and 260 - 290 g ) were divided into 1 , control ; 2 and 3 , crocins ( 15 and 30
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
mg / kg ) ; 4 , STZ ; 5 and 6 , STZ + crocins ( 15 and 30 mg / kg ) groups .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
In Alzheimer 's disease groups , rats were injected with STZ - icv bilaterally ( 3 mg / kg ) in first day and 3 days later , a similar
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
STZ - icv application was repeated .
B O O O O O O
In STZ + crocin animal groups , crocin was applied in doses of 15 and 30 mg / kg , i . p .
O B O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, one day pre - surgery and continued for three weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prescription of crocin in each dose was repeated once for two days .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O
However , the learning and memory performance was assessed using passive avoidance paradigm , and for spatial cognition evaluation , Y - maze task was used .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
It was found out that crocin ( 30 mg / kg ) - treated STZ - injected rats show higher correct choices and lower errors in Y - maze than
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
vehicle - treated STZ - injected rats .
O O O B O O O O
In addition , crocin in the mentioned dose could significantly attenuated learning and memory impairment in treated STZ - injected group in passive avoidance test .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Therefore , these results demonstrate the effectiveness of crocin ( 30 mg / kg ) in antagonizing the cognitive deficits caused by STZ - icv in rats and its potential
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
in the treatment of neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer 's disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Rosaceiform dermatitis associated with topical tacrolimus treatment .
O O O O O B O O
We describe herein 3 patients who developed rosacea - like dermatitis eruptions while using 0 . 03 % or 0 . 1 % tacrolimus ointment for facial dermatitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Skin biopsy specimens showed telangiectasia and noncaseating epithelioid granulomatous tissue formation in the papillary to mid dermis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Continuous topical use of immunomodulators such as tacrolimus or pimecrolimus should be regarded as a potential cause of rosaceiform dermatitis , although many cases have not been reported .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A novel animal model to evaluate the ability of a drug delivery system to promote the passage through the BBB .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of this investigation was to explore the potentiality of a novel animal model to be used for the in vivo evaluation of the ability of a drug delivery
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
system to promote the passage through the blood - brain barrier ( BBB ) and / or to improve the brain localization of a bioactive compound .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A
O
Tween 80 - coated poly - L - lactid acid nanoparticles was used as a model of colloidal drug delivery system , able to trespass the BBB .
O O O O B I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tacrine , administered in LiCl pre - treated rats , induces electrocorticographic seizures and delayed hippocampal damage .
B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The toxic effects of tacrine - loaded poly - L - lactid acid nanoparticles ( 5mg / kg ) , a saline solution of tacrine ( 5mg / kg )
O O O O B O O B I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
and an empty colloidal nanoparticle suspension were compared following i . p .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
administration in LiCl - pre - treated Wistar rats .
O O B O O O O O O O
All the animals treated with tacrine - loaded nanoparticles showed an earlier outcome of CNS adverse symptoms , i . e . epileptic onset , with respect to those animals
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
treated with the free compound ( 10 min vs . 22 min respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , tacrine - loaded nanoparticles administration induced damage of neuronal cells in CA1 field of the hippocampus in all treated animals , while the saline solution of
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
tacrine only in 60 % of animals .
B O O O O O O O
Empty nanoparticles provided similar results to control ( saline - treated ) group of animals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In conclusion , the evaluation of time - to - onset of symptoms and the severity of neurodegenerative processes induced by the tacrine - lithium model of epilepsy in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
rat , could be used to evaluate preliminarily the capability of a drug delivery system to trespass ( or not ) the BBB in vivo .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The antiarrhythmic effect and possible ionic mechanisms of pilocarpine on animal models .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
This study was designed to evaluate the effects of pilocarpine and explore the underlying ionic mechanism , using both aconitine - induced rat and ouabain - induced guinea pig arrhythmia
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O
models .
O O
Confocal microscopy was used to measure intracellular free - calcium concentrations ( [ Ca ( 2 + ) ] ( i ) ) in isolated myocytes .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The current data showed that pilocarpine significantly delayed onset of arrhythmias , decreased the time course of ventricular tachycardia and fibrillation , reduced arrhythmia score , and increased the survival
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
time of arrhythmic rats and guinea pigs .
O O O O O O O O
[ Ca ( 2 + ) ] ( i ) overload induced by aconitine or ouabain was reduced in isolated myocytes pretreated with pilocarpine .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O B O
Moreover , M ( 3 ) - muscarinic acetylcholine receptor ( mAChR ) antagonist 4 - DAMP ( 4 - diphenylacetoxy - N - methylpiperidine - methiodide ) partially abolished
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B I I O B I I I I I I I I O O O
the beneficial effects of pilocarpine .
O O O O B O
These data suggest that pilocarpine produced antiarrhythmic actions on arrhythmic rat and guinea pig models induced by aconitine or ouabain via stimulating the cardiac M ( 3 ) - mAChR
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
. The mechanism may be related to the improvement of Ca ( 2 + ) handling .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Disulfiram - induced transient optic and peripheral neuropathy : a case report .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
AIM :
O O
To report a case of optic and peripheral neuropathy after chronic use of disulfiram for alcohol dependence management .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
MATERIALS AND METHODS :
O O O O
A case report .
O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
A 57 - year - old male presented with gradual loss of vision in both eyes with intermittent headaches for 2 months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He also complained of paraesthesia with numbness in both feet .
O O O O O O O O O O O
His vision was 6 / 15 and 2 / 60 in the right and left eyes , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fundoscopy revealed bilaterally swollen optic nerve heads .
O O O O O O O O
Visual field testing confirmed bilateral central - caecal scotomata .
O O O O O O O O O O
He had been taking disulfiram for alcohol dependence for the preceding 3 years .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Disulfiram discontinuation lead to an immediate symptomatic improvement .
B O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Physicians initiating long - term disulfiram therapy should be aware of these adverse effects .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
They should recommend annual ophthalmic reviews with visual field testing .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients should be reassured with respect to the reversibility of these adverse effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sustained clinical improvement of a patient with decompensated hepatitis B virus - related cirrhosis after treatment with lamivudine monotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Hepatitis B virus ( HBV ) infection , which causes liver cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma , remains a major health problem in Asian countries .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recent development of vaccine for prevention is reported to be successful in reducing the size of chronically infected carriers , although the standard medical therapies have not been established up
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to now .
O O O
In this report , we encountered a patient with decompensated HBV - related cirrhosis who exhibited the dramatic improvements after antiviral therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient was a 50 - year - old woman .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Previous conventional medical treatments were not effective for this patient , thus this patient had been referred to our hospital .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , the administration of lamivudine , a reverse transcriptase inhibitor , for 23 months dramatically improved her liver severity .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
During this period , no drug resistant mutant HBV emerged , and the serum HBV - DNA level was continuously suppressed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These virological responses were also maintained even after the antiviral therapy was discontinued .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Moreover , both hepatitis B surface antigen and e antigen were observed to have disappeared in this patient .
O O O B I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O
The administration of lamivudine to patients with HBV - related cirrhosis , like our present case , should be considered as an initial medical therapeutic option , especially in countries
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
where liver transplantation is not reliably available .
O O O O O O O O
Dual effects of melatonin on barbiturate - induced narcosis in rats .
O O O B O B O O O O O O
Melatonin affects the circadian sleep / wake cycle , but it is not clear whether it may influence drug - induced narcosis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sodium thiopenthal was administered intraperitoneally into male rats pre - treated with melatonin ( 0 . 05 , 0 . 5 , 5 and 50 mg / kg ) .
B I O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Melatonin pre - treatment affected in a dual manner barbiturate narcosis , however , no dose - effect correlation was found .
B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
In particular , low doses reduced the latency to and prolonged the duration of barbiturate narcosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
In contrast , the highest dose of melatonin ( 50 mg / kg ) caused a paradoxical increase in the latency and produced a sustained reduction of the duration of
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
narcosis , and a reduction in mortality rate .
O O O O O O O O O
Melatonin 0 . 5 and 5 mg / kg influenced the duration but not the latency of ketamine - or diazepam - induced narcosis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O
Thus , the dual action of melatonin on pharmacological narcosis seems to be specific for the barbiturate mechanism of action .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Effects of NIK - 247 on cholinesterase and scopolamine - induced amnesia .
O O B I I O O O B O O O O
The effects of NIK - 247 on cholinesterase , scopolamine - induced amnesia and spontaneous movement were examined and compared with those of the well - known cholinesterase inhibitors
O O O B I I O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
tacrine and E - 2020 .
B O B I I O
NIK - 247 , tacrine and E - 2020 all strongly inhibited acetylcholinesterase ( AChE ) in human red blood cells ( IC50s = 1 . 0 x 10 (
B I I O B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- 6 ) , 2 . 9 x 10 ( - 7 ) and 3 . 7 x 10 ( - 8 ) M , respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , NIK - 247 and tacrine , but not E - 2020 , strongly inhibited butyrylcholinestrase ( BuChE ) in human serum .
O O O B I I O B O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O
All three drugs produced mixed inhibition of AChE activity .
O O O O O O O O O O
Moreover , the inhibitory effect of NIK - 247 on AChE was reversible .
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O
All compounds at 0 . 1 - 1 mg / kg p . o .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
significantly improved the amnesia induced by scopolamine ( 0 . 5 mg / kg s . c . )
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
in rats performing a passive avoidance task .
O O O O O O O O
The three compounds at 1 and 3 mg / kg p . o .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
did not significantly decrease spontaneous movement by rats .
O O O O O O O O O
These findings suggest that NIK - 247 at a low dose ( 0 . 1 - 1 mg / kg p . o . ) improves scopolamine - induced amnesia
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
but does not affect spontaneous movement .
O O O O O O O
The findings suggest that NIK - 247 may be a useful drug for the treatment of Alzheimer 's disease .
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nightmares and hallucinations after long - term intake of tramadol combined with antidepressants .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Tramadol is a weak opioid with effects on adrenergic and serotonergic neurotransmission that is used to treat cancer pain and chronic non malignant pain .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This drug was initiated in association with paroxetine and dosulepine hydrochloride in a tetraparetic patient with chronic pain .
O O O O O O O B O B I O O O O O O O O
Fifty - six days after initiation of the treatment the patient presented hallucinations that only stopped after the withdrawal of psycho - active drugs and tramadol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The case report questions the long term use of pain killers combined with psycho - active drugs in chronic non malignant pain , especially if pain is under control .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Apparent cure of rheumatoid arthritis by bone marrow transplantation .
O O O O O O O O O O
We describe the induction of sustained remissions and possible cure of severe erosive rheumatoid arthritis ( RA ) by bone marrow transplantation ( BMT ) in 2 patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BMT was used to treat severe aplastic anemia which was caused by gold in one case and D - penicillamine in the other .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B I I O O O O
In the 8 and 6 years since the transplants ( representing 8 and 4 years since cessation of all immunosuppressive therapy , respectively ) , the RA in each case
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
has been completely quiescent .
O O O O O
Although short term remission of severe RA following BMT has been reported , these are the first cases for which prolonged followup has been available .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This experience raises the question of the role of BMT itself as a therapeutic option for patients with uncontrolled destructive synovitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urinary enzymes and protein patterns as indicators of injury to different regions of the kidney .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute experimental models of renal damage to the proximal tubular , glomerular , and papillary regions of the rat were produced by administration of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
hexachloro - 1 : 3 - butadiene ( HCBD ) , puromycin aminonucleoside ( PAN ) , and 2 - bromoethylamine ( BEA ) , respectively .
B I I I I I I O B O O B I O B O O O B I I O B O O O O
Several routine indicators of nephrotoxicity , the enzymes alkaline phosphatase and N - acetyl - beta - glucosaminidase , and the molecular weight of protein excretion were determined on urine
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
samples .
O O
Tubular damage produced by HCBD or BEA was discriminated both quantitatively and qualitatively from glomerular damage produced by PAN .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The latter was characterized by a pronounced increase in protein excretion , especially proteins with molecular weight greater than 40 , 000 Da .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , protein excretion in tubular damage was raised only slightly and characterized by excretion of proteins of a wide range of molecular weights .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Proximal tubular damage caused by HCBD and papillary damage caused by BEA were distinguished both by conventional urinalysis ( volume and specific gravity ) and by measurement of the two
O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
urinary enzymes .
O O O
Alkaline phosphatase and glucose were markedly and transiently elevated in proximal tubular damage and N - acetyl - beta - glucosaminidase showed a sustained elevation in papillary damage .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is concluded that both selective urinary enzymes and the molecular weight pattern of urinary proteins can be used to provide diagnostic information about the possible site of renal damage
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Neuromuscular blockade with magnesium sulfate and nifedipine .
O O O B I O B O
A patient who received tocolysis with nifedipine developed neuromuscular blockade after 500 mg of magnesium sulfate was administered .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B I O O O
This reaction demonstrates that nifedipine can seriously potentiate the toxicity of magnesium .
O O O O B O O O O O O B O
Caution should be exercised when these two tocolytics are combined .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Ifosfamide continuous infusion without mesna .
B O O O B O
A phase I trial of a 14 - day cycle .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Twenty patients received 27 courses of ifosfamide administered as a 24 - hour continuous infusion for 14 days without Mesna .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The goal of the study was to deliver a dose rate and total cumulative dose of ifosfamide that would be comparable to standard bolus or short - term infusions administered
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with Mesna .
O B O
Dose escalations proceeded from 200 to 300 , 400 , 450 , 500 , and 550 mg / m2 / d .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Four patients developed transient microscopic hematuria at 400 , 450 , and 500 mg / m2 / d .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There were no instances of macroscopic hematuria .
O O O O O O O O
At 550 mg / m2 / d , three patients experienced nonurologic toxicity ; confusion ( 1 ) , nausea ( 1 ) , and Grade 2 leukopenia ( 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
The recommended dose of 500 mg / m2 / d delivers a total dose of 7 g / m2 per cycle , which is comparable to that delivered in clinical
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
practice for bolus or short - term infusion .
O O O O O O O O O
Because few patients received multiple courses over time , the cumulative effects are indeterminate in the present trial .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The frequency and predictability of hematuria are not precise , and at least daily monitoring by urine Hematest is essential , adding Mesna to the infusate in patients with persistent
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
hematuria .
O O
The protracted infusion schedule for ifosfamide permits convenient outpatient administration without Mesna and reduces the drug cost of clinical usage of this agent by up to 890 per cycle .
O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical activity was demonstrated in a single patient , but a comparative trial of standard bolus schedules with the protracted infusion schedule will be necessary to determine if the clinical
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
effectiveness of the drug is maintained .
O O O O O O O
Myocardial infarction in pregnancy associated with clomiphene citrate for ovulation induction : a case report .
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Clomiphene citrate ( CC ) is commonly prescribed for ovulation induction .
B I O B O O O O O O O O
It is considered safe , with minimal side effects .
O O O O O O O O O O
Thromboembolism is a rare but life - threatening complication that has been reported after ovulation induction with CC .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Spontaneous coronary thrombosis or thromboembolism with subsequent clot lysis has been suggested as one of the most common causes of myocardial infarction ( MI ) during pregnancy , with a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
subsequently normal coronary angiogram .
O O O O O
CASE :
O O
A 33 - year - old woman with a 5 - week gestation had recently received CC for ovulation induction and presented with chest pain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
An electrocardiogram showed a lateral and anterior wall myocardial infarction .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Cardiac enzymes showed a peak rise in troponin I to 9 . 10 ng / mL .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An initial exercise stress test was normal .
O O O O O O O O
At the time of admission , the patient was at high risk of radiation injury to the fetus , so a coronary angiogram was postponed until the second trimester .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It showed normal coronary vessels .
O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
This appears to be the first reported case documenting a possible association between CC and myocardial infarction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Thrombosis might be a rare but hazardous complication of CC .
O O O O O O O O O B O
Given this life - threatening complication , appropriate prophylactic measures should be used in high - risk woman undergoing ovarian stimulation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hepatonecrosis and cholangitis related to long - term phenobarbital therapy : an autopsy report of two patients .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Phenobarbital ( PB ) has a reputation for safety , and it is commonly believed that PB - related increases in serum aminotransferase levels do not indicate or predict the
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
development of significant chronic liver disease .
O O O O O O O
Here we report of two adult patients with a long history of epilepsy treated with PB who died suddenly : one as consequence of cardiac arrest , the other of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
acute bronchopneumonia .
O O O
At autopsy , analysis of liver parenchyma revealed rich portal inflammatory infiltrate , which consisted of mixed eosinophil and monocyte cells , associated with several foci of necrosis surrounded by
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a hard ring of non - specific granulomatous tissue .
O O O O O O O O O O
Inflammatory reactions of internal and external hepatic biliary ducts were also seen .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our findings illustrate that PB may be associated with chronic liver damage , which may lead to more serious and deleterious consequences .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
For this reason , each clinician should recognize this entity in the differential diagnosis of PB - related asymptomatic chronic hepatic enzyme dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Ethambutol - associated optic neuropathy .
B O O O O O
INTRODUCTION :
O O
Ethambutol is used in the treatment of tuberculosis , which is still prevalent in Southeast Asia , and can be associated with permanent visual loss .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report 3 cases which presented with bitemporal hemianopia .
O O O O O O O O O O
CLINICAL PICTURE :
O O O
Three patients with ethambutol - associated toxic optic neuropathy are described .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
All 3 patients had loss of central visual acuity , colour vision ( Ishihara ) and visual field .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The visual field loss had a bitemporal flavour , suggesting involvement of the optic chiasm .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
TREATMENT :
O O
Despite stopping ethambutol on diagnosis , visual function continued to deteriorate for a few months .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Subsequent improvement was mild in 2 cases .
O O O O O O O O
In the third case , visual acuity and colour vision normalised but the optic discs were pale .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OUTCOME :
O O
All 3 patients had some permanent loss of visual function .
O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Ethambutol usage is associated with permanent visual loss and should be avoided if possible or used with caution and proper ophthalmological follow - up .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The author postulates that in cases of ethambutol associated chiasmopathy , ethambutol may initially affect the optic nerves and subsequently progress to involve the optic chiasm .
O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tolerability of nimesulide and paracetamol in patients with NSAID - induced urticaria / angioedema .
O O B O B O O O B O O O O O O
Previous studies evaluated the tolerance of nimesulide and paracetamol in subjects with cutaneous , respiratory and anaphylactoid reactions induced by nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O B O O
In this study we investigated tolerability and reliability of nimesulide and paracetamol in a very large number of patients with an exclusive well - documented history of NSAID - induced
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
urticaria / angioedema .
O O O O
Furthermore , we evaluated whether some factors have the potential to increase the risk of reaction to paracetamol and nimesulide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
A single - placebo - controlled oral challenge procedure with nimesulide or paracetamol was applied to 829 patients with a history of NSAID - induced urticaria / angioedema .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
A total of 75 / 829 ( 9 . 4 % ) patients experienced reactions to nimesulide or paracetamol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Of the 715 patients tested with nimesulide 62 ( 8 . 6 % ) showed a positive test , while of 114 subjects submitted to the challenge with paracetamol ,
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
13 ( 9 . 6 % ) did not tolerate this drug .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , 18 . 28 % of patients with a history of chronic urticaria and 11 . 8 % of subjects with an history of NSAID - induced urticaria /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
angioedema or angioedema alone ( with or without chronic urticaria ) resulted to be intolerant to alternative drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Taken together , our results confirm the good tolerability of nimesulide and paracetamol in patients who experienced urticaria / angioedema caused by NSAIDs .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O B O
However , the risk of reaction to these alternative study drugs is statistically increased by a history of chronic urticaria and , above all , by a history of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NSAID - induced angioedema .
B O O O O
Effects of verapamil on atrial fibrillation and its electrophysiological determinants in dogs .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Atrial tachycardia - induced remodeling promotes the occurrence and maintenance of atrial fibrillation ( AF ) and decreases L - type Ca ( 2 + ) current .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
There is also a clinical suggestion that acute L - type Ca ( 2 ) channel blockade can promote AF , consistent with an AF promoting effect of Ca (
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
2 + ) channel inhibition .
O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
To evaluate the potential mechanisms of AF promotion by Ca ( 2 + ) channel blockers , we administered verapamil to morphine - chloralose anesthetized dogs .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O
Diltiazem was used as a comparison drug and autonomic blockade with atropine and nadolol was applied in some experiments .
B O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
Epicardial mapping with 240 epicardial electrodes was used to evaluate activation during AF .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Verapamil caused AF promotion in six dogs , increasing mean duration of AF induced by burst pacing , from 8 + / - 4 s ( mean + / -
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
S . E . ) to 95 + / - 39 s ( P < 0 . 01 vs . control ) at a loading dose of 0 . 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mg / kg and 228 + / - 101 s ( P < 0 . 0005 vs . control ) at a dose of 0 . 2 mg / kg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Underlying electrophysiological mechanisms were studied in detail in five additional dogs under control conditions and in the presence of the higher dose of verapamil .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
In these experiments , verapamil shortened mean effective refractory period ( ERP ) from 122 + / - 5 to 114 + / - 4 ms ( P < 0
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 02 ) at a cycle length of 300 ms , decreased ERP heterogeneity ( from 15 + / - 1 to 10 + / - 1 % , P
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
< 0 . 05 ) , heterogeneously accelerated atrial conduction and decreased the cycle length of AF ( 94 + / - 4 to 84 + / - 3 ms
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, P < 0 . 005 ) .
O O O O O O O O
Diltiazem did not affect ERP , AF cycle length or AF duration , but produced conduction acceleration similar to that caused by verapamil ( n = 5 ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
In the presence of autonomic blockade , verapamil failed to promote AF and increased , rather than decreasing , refractoriness .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neither verapamil nor diltiazem affected atrial conduction in the presence of autonomic blockade .
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
Epicardial mapping suggested that verapamil promoted AF by increasing the number of simultaneous wavefronts reflected by separate zones of reactivation in each cycle .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Verapamil promotes AF in normal dogs by promoting multiple circuit reentry , an effect dependent on intact autonomic tone and not shared by diltiazem .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Hypotension , bradycardia , and asystole after high - dose intravenous methylprednisolone in a monitored patient .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
We report a case of hypotension , bradycardia , and asystole after intravenous administration of high - dose methylprednisolone in a 73 - year - old patient who underwent electrocardiographic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
( ECG ) monitoring throughout the episode .
O O O O O O O O
There was a history of ischemic cardiac disease 9 years earlier .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient was admitted with a pulmonary - renal syndrome with hemoptysis , rapidly progressive renal failure , and hypoxemia that required mechanical ventilation in the intensive care unit .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After receiving advanced cardiopulmonary resuscitation , the patient recovered cardiac rhythm .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The ECG showed a junctional rhythm without ventricular arrhythmia .
O O O O O O O O O O
This study reviews the current proposed mechanisms of sudden death after a high dose of intravenous methylprednisolone ( IVMP ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
These mechanisms are not well understood because , in most cases , the patients were not monitored at the moment of the event .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Rapid infusion and underlying cardiac disease were important risk factors in the case reported here , and the authors discount ventricular arrhythmia as the main mechanism .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lifetime treatment of mice with azidothymidine ( AZT ) produces myelodysplasia .
O O O O O B O B O O O O
AZT has induced a macrocytic anemia in AIDS patients on long term AZT therapy .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
It is generally assumed that DNA elongation is stopped by the insertion of AZT into the chain in place of thymidine thus preventing the phosphate hydroxyl linkages and therefore suppresses
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O
hemopoietic progenitor cell proliferation in an early stage of differentiation .
O O O O O O O O O O O
CBA / Ca male mice started on AZT 0 . 75 mg / ml H2O at 84 days of age and kept on it for 687 days when dosage reduced
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to 0 . 5 mg / ml H2O for a group , another group removed from AZT to see recovery , and third group remained on 0 . 75 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
At 687 days mice that had been on 0 . 75 mg had average platelet counts of 2 . 5 x 10 ( 6 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Histological examination on 9 of 10 mice with such thrombocytopenia showed changes compatible with myelodysplastic syndrome ( MDS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A variety of histological patterns was observed .
O O O O O O O O
There were two cases of hypocellular myelodysplasia , two cases of hypersegmented myelodysplastic granulocytosis , two cases of hypercellular marrow with abnormal megakaryocytes with bizarre nuclei , one case of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
megakaryocytic myelosis associated with a hyperplastic marrow , dysmyelopoiesis and a hypocellular marrow and two cases of myelodysplasia with dyserythropoiesis , hemosiderosis and a hypocellular marrow .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Above mentioned AZT incorporation may have induced an ineffective hemopoiesis in the primitive hemopoietic progenitor cells , which is known to be seen commonly in the myelodysplastic syndrome .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Influence of diet free of NAD - precursors on acetaminophen hepatotoxicity in mice .
O O O O O B O O O B O O O O
Recently , we demonstrated the hepatoprotective effects of nicotinic acid amide , a selective inhibitor of poly ( ADP - ribose ) polymerase ( PARP ; EC 2 . 4
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O B I I I I I O O O O O O O O
. 2 . 30 ) on mice suffering from acetaminophen ( AAP ) - hepatitis , suggesting that the AAP - induced liver injury involves a step which depends on
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
adenoribosylation .
O O
The present study investigates the effects of a diet free of precursors of NAD , the substrate on which PARP acts , in female NMRI mice with AAP hepatitis and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
evaluates the influence of simultaneous ethanol consumption in these animals .
O O O O O B O O O O O
Liver injuries were quantified as serum activities of glutamate - oxaloacetate transaminase ( GOT ) and glutamate - pyruvate transaminase ( GPT ) .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O B O B O O O O O
While AAP caused a 117 - fold elevation of serum transaminase activities in mice kept on a standard laboratory diet , which was significantly exacerbated by ethanol and inhibited by
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
nicotinic acid amide ( NAA ) , adverse effects were noted in animals fed a diet free of precursors of NAD .
B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
In these animals , only minor increases of serum transaminase activities were measured in the presence of AAP , and unlike the exacerbation caused by ethanol in mice on a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O
standard diet , the liver damage was inhibited by 50 % by ethanol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
A further 64 % reduction of hepatitis was observed , when NAA was given to ethanol / AAP - mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O B O O O
Our results provide evidence that the AAP - induced hepatitis and its exacerbation by ethanol can either be reduced by end - product inhibition of PARP by NAA or by
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
dietary depletion of the enzyme 's substrate NAD .
O O O O O O O B O
We see the main application of NAA as for the combinational use in pharmaceutical preparations of acetaminophen in order to avoid hepatic damage in patients treated with this widely used
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
analgesic .
O O
Antiarrhythmic plasma concentrations of cibenzoline on canine ventricular arrhythmias .
O O O O B O O O O O
Using two - stage coronary ligation - , digitalis - , and adrenaline - induced canine ventricular arrhythmias , antiarrhythmic effects of cibenzoline were examined and the minimum effective plasma
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
concentration for each arrhythmia model was determined .
O O O O O O O O
Cibenzoline suppressed all the arrhythmias , and the minimum effective plasma concentrations for arrhythmias induced by 24 - h coronary ligation , 48 - h coronary ligation , digitalis ,

and adrenaline were 1 . 9 + / -

O O O O O O O O O O
SDM , n = 6 - 7 ) .
O O O O O O O O O
The concentration for adrenaline - induced arrhythmia was significantly higher than those for the other types of arrhythmias .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This pharmacological profile is similar to those of mexiletine and tocainide , and all three drugs have central nervous system ( CNS ) stimulant action .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because cibenzoline had only weak hypotensive and sinus node depressive effects and was found to be orally active when given to coronary ligation arrhythmia dogs , its clinical usefulness is
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
expected .
O O
Immunopathology of penicillamine - induced glomerular disease .
O O B O O O O O
Four patients with rheumatoid arthritis developed heavy proteinuria after five to 12 months of treatment with D - penicillamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O
Light microscopy of renal biopsy samples showed minimal glomerular capillary wall thickening and mesangial matrix increase , or no departure from normal .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Electron microscopy , however , revealed subepithelial electron - dense deposits , fusion of epithelial cell foot processes , and evidence of mesangial cell hyperactivity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Immunofluorescence microscopy demonstrated granular capillary wall deposits of IgG and C3 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The findings were similar to those in early membranous glomerulonephritis , differences being observed however in the results of staining for the early - acting complement components C1q and C4
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
It is tentatively concluded that complement was activated by the classical pathway .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ventricular fibrillation from diatrizoate with and without chelating agents .
O O O B O O O O O O
The toxicity of Renografin 76 % was compared with that of Hypaque 76 % by selective injection of each into the right coronary artery of dogs .
O O O B I I O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renografin contains the chelating agents sodium citrate and disodium edetate , while Hypaque contains calcium disodium edetate and no sodium citrate .
B O O O O B I O B I O O B O B I I O O B I O
Ventricular fibrillation occurred significantly more often with Renografin , suggesting that chelating agents contribute to toxicity in coronary angiography .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Rapid reversal of anticoagulation reduces hemorrhage volume in a mouse model of warfarin - associated intracerebral hemorrhage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Warfarin - associated intracerebral hemorrhage ( W - ICH ) is a severe type of stroke .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There is no consensus on the optimal treatment for W - ICH .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Using a mouse model , we tested whether the rapid reversal of anticoagulation using human prothrombin complex concentrate ( PCC ) can reduce hemorrhagic blood volume .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O
Male CD - 1 mice were treated with warfarin ( 2 mg / kg over 24 h ) , resulting in a mean ( + / - s . d
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. )
O O
International Normalized Ratio of 3 . 5 + / - 0 . 9 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
First , we showed that an intravenous administration of human PCC rapidly reversed anticoagulation in mice .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Second , a stereotactic injection of collagenase was administered to induce hemorrhage in the right striatum .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Forty - five minutes later , the animals were randomly treated with PCC ( 100 U / kg ) or saline i . v .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
( n = 12 per group ) .
O O O O O O O O
Twenty - four hours after hemorrhage induction , hemorrhagic blood volume was quantified using a photometric hemoglobin assay .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mean hemorrhagic blood volume was reduced in PCC - treated animals ( 6 . 5 + / - 3 . 1 microL ) compared with saline controls ( 15
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 3 + / - 11 . 2 microL , P = 0 . 015 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the saline group , 45 % of the mice developed large hematomas ( i . e . , > 15 microL ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , such extensive lesions were never found in the PCC group .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
We provide experimental data suggesting PCC to be an effective acute treatment for W - ICH in terms of reducing hemorrhagic blood volume .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Future studies are needed to assess the therapeutic potential emerging from our finding for human W - ICH .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Impact of alcohol exposure after pregnancy recognition on ultrasonographic fetal growth measures .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : More than 3 decades after Jones and Smith ( 1973 ) reported on the devastation caused by alcohol exposure on fetal development , the rates of heavy drinking
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
during pregnancy remain relatively unchanged .
O O O O O O
Early identification of fetal alcohol exposure and maternal abstinence led to better infant outcomes .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
This study examined the utility of biometry for detecting alcohol - related fetal growth impairment .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We obtained fetal ultrasound measures from routine ultrasound examinations for 167 pregnant hazardous drinkers who were enrolled in a brief alcohol intervention study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
The fetal measures for women who quit after learning of their pregnancies were compared with measures for women who continued some drinking throughout the course of their pregnancies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because intensity of alcohol consumption is associated with poorer fetal outcomes , separate analyses were conducted for the heavy ( average of > or = 5 drinks per drinking day
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) alcohol consumers .
O B O O
Fetal measures from the heavy - exposed fetuses were also compared with measures from a nondrinking group that was representative of normal , uncomplicated pregnancies from our clinics .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Analyses of covariance were used to determine whether there were differences between groups after controlling for influences of gestational age and drug abuse .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Nearly half of the pregnant drinkers abstained after learning of their pregnancies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When women reportedly quit drinking early in their pregnancies , fetal growth measures were not significantly different from a non - alcohol - exposed group , regardless of prior drinking
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
patterns .
O O
Any alcohol consumption postpregnancy recognition among the heavy drinkers resulted in reduced cerebellar growth as well as decreased cranial to body growth in comparison with women who either quit drinking
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
or who were nondrinkers .
O O O O O
Amphetamine abuse was predictive of larger cranial to body growth ratios .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Alterations in fetal biometric measurements were observed among the heavy drinkers only when they continued drinking after becoming aware of their pregnancies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although the reliance on self - reported drinking is a limitation in this study , these findings support the benefits of early abstinence and the potential for ultrasound examinations in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the detection of fetal alcohol effects .
O O O O B O O
Urinary symptoms and quality of life changes in Thai women with overactive bladder after tolterodine treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
To study the urinary symptoms and quality of life changes in Thai women with overactive bladder ( OAB ) after tolterodine treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
MATERIAL AND METHOD :
O O O O
Thirty women ( aged 30 - 77 years ) diagnosed as having OAB at the Gynecology Clinic , King Chulalongkorn Memorial Hospital from January to April 2004 were included in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the present study .
O O O O
Tolterodine 2 mg , twice daily was given .
B O O O O O O O O
After 8 weeks treatment , changes in micturition diary variables and tolerability were determined .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Short form 36 ( SF36 ) questionaires ( Thai version ) were given before and after 8 weeks of treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
At 8 weeks , all micturition per day decreased from 16 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
7 + / - 5 .
O O O O O O
3 to 6 . 7 + / -
O O O O O O O O
2 . 4 times per day .
O O O O O O O
The number of nocturia episodes decreased from 5 . 4 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 . 2 to 1 . 1 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O
1 . 0 times per night .
O O O O O O O
The most common side effect was dry month in 5 cases ( 16 . 7 % ) with 2 cases reporting a moderate degree and 1 case with severe degree
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Only one case ( 3 . 3 % ) withdrew from the present study due to a severe dry mouth .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The SF - 36 scores changed significantly in the domains of physical functioning , role function emotional , social function and mental heath .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Tolterodine was well tolerated and its effects improved the quality of life in Thai women with OAB .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Absence of acute cerebral vasoconstriction after cocaine - associated subarachnoid hemorrhage .
O O O O O O B O O O O O
INTRODUCTION :
O O
Cocaine use has been associated with neurovascular complications , including arterial vasoconstriction and vasculitis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , there are few studies of angiographic effects of cocaine on human cerebral arteries .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Information on these effects could be obtained from angiograms of patients with cocaine - associated subarachnoid hemorrhage ( SAH ) who underwent angiography shortly after cocaine use .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
METHODS :
O O
We screened patients with SAH retrospectively and identified those with positive urine toxicology for cocaine or its metabolites .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Quantitative arterial diameter measurements from angiograms of these patients were compared to measurements from control patients with SAH who were matched for factors known to influence arterial diameter .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Qualitative comparisons of small artery changes also were made .
O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Thirteen patients with positive cocaine toxicology were compared to 26 controls .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
There were no significant differences between groups in the mean diameters of the intradural internal carotid , sphenoidal segment of the middle cerebral , precommunicating segment of the anterior cerebral
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, or basilar arteries ( p greater than 0 . 05 for all comparisons , unpaired t - tests ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There also were no significant differences between groups when expressing diameters as the sum of the precommunicating segment of the anterior cerebral + sphenoidal segment of the middle cerebral +
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
supraclinoid internal carotid artery + basilar artery divided by the diameter of the petrous internal carotid artery ( p greater than 0 . 05 , unpaired t - tests )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Qualitative assessments showed two arterial irregularities in the distal vasculature in each group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
No quantitative evidence for narrowing of large cerebral arteries or qualitative angiographic evidence for distal narrowing or vasculitis could be found in patients who underwent angiography after aneurysmal SAH associated
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with cocaine use .
O B O O
Atrial fibrillation following chemotherapy for stage IIIE diffuse large B - cell gastric lymphoma in a patient with myotonic dystrophy ( Steinert 's disease ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The authors describe the unusual association between diffuse B - cell gastric lymphoma and myotonic dystrophy , the most common form of adult muscular dystrophy , and sudden atrial fibrillation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
following one cycle of doxorubicin - based chemotherapy in the same patient .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Atrial fibrillation or other cardiac arrhythmias are unusual complications in patients treated with chemotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The cardiac toxicity intrinsically associated with the aggressive chemotherapy employed could function as a triggering factor for the arrhythmia in the predisposed myocardium of this patient .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A phase II study of thalidomide in advanced metastatic renal cell carcinoma .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
To evaluate the toxicity and activity of thalidomide in patients with advanced metastatic renal cell cancer and to measure changes of one angiogenic factor , vascular endothelial growth factor (
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
VEGF ) 165 , with therapy .
O O O O O O O
PATIENTS AND METHODS :
O O O O
29 patients were enrolled on a study of thalidomide using an intra - patient dose escalation schedule .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
