Patients began thalidomide at 400 mg / d and escalated as tolerated to 1200 mg / d by day 54 .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fifty - nine per cent of patients had had previous therapy with IL - 2 and 52 % were performance status 2 or 3 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Systemic plasma VEGF165 levels were measured by dual monoclonal ELISA in 8 patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
24 patients were evaluable for response with one partial response of 11 months duration of a patient with hepatic and pulmonary metastases ( 4 % ) , one minor response
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, and 2 patients stable for over 6 months .
O O O O O O O O O O
Somnolence and constipation were prominent toxicities and most patients could not tolerate the 1200 mg / day dose level .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Systemic plasma VEGF165 levels did not change with therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
These results are consistent with a low level of activity of thalidomide in renal cell carcinoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Administration of doses over 800 mg / day was difficult to achieve in this patient population , however lower doses were practical .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The dose - response relationship , if any , of thalidomide for renal cell carcinoma is unclear .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The striatum as a target for anti - rigor effects of an antagonist of mGluR1 , but not an agonist of group II metabotropic glutamate receptors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The aim of the present study was to find out whether the metabotropic receptor 1 ( mGluR1 ) and group II mGluRs , localized in the striatum , are involved
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in antiparkinsonian - like effects in rats .
O O O O O O O O
Haloperidol ( 1 mg / kg ip ) induced parkinsonian - like muscle rigidity , measured as an increased resistance of a rat 's hind foot to passive flexion and
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
extension at the ankle joint .
O O O O O O
( RS ) - 1 - aminoindan - 1 , 5 - dicarboxylic acid ( AIDA ; 0 . 5 - 15 microg / 0 . 5 microl ) ,
B I I I I I I I I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a potent and selective mGluR1 antagonist , or ( 2R , 4R ) - 4 - aminopyrrolidine - 2 , 4 - dicarboxylate ( 2R , 4R - APDC ;
O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O B I I I I O
7 . 5 - 15 microg / 0 . 5 microl ) , a selective group II agonist , was injected bilaterally into the striatum of haloperidol - treated animals
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
.
O
AIDA in doses of 7 . 5 - 15 microg / 0 . 5 microl diminished the haloperidol - induced muscle rigidity .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
In contrast , 2R , 4R - APDC injections were ineffective .
O O O B I I I I O O O O
The present results may suggest that the blockade of striatal mGluR1 , but not the stimulation of group II mGluRs , may ameliorate parkinsonian muscle rigidity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute cholestatic hepatitis after exposure to isoflurane .
O O O O O O B O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To report a case of acute cholestatic hepatitis following exposure to the inhalational anesthetic isoflurane .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
CASE SUMMARY :
O O O
A 70 - year - old healthy woman from Iraq developed acute cholestatic hepatitis 3 weeks following repair of the right rotator cuff under general anesthesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was no evidence for viral , autoimmune , or metabolic causes of hepatitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No other medications were involved except for dipyrone for analgesia .
O O O O O O O B O O O
The alanine aminotransferase was elevated to a peak concentration of 1533 U / L and the serum bilirubin reached a peak of 17 . 0 mg / dL . There
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
was slow improvement over 4 months .
O O O O O O O
Accidental reexposure by the patient to dipyrone was uneventful .
O O O O O O B O O O
DISCUSSION :
O O
The clinical and histologic picture of this case resembles halothane hepatitis , which has a significant mortality rate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Isoflurane , a common anesthetic agent , can cause severe cholestatic hepatitis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Calcitonin gene - related peptide levels during nitric oxide - induced headache in patients with chronic tension - type headache .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
It has been proposed that nitric oxide ( NO ) induced headache in primary headaches may be associated with release of calcitonin gene - related peptide ( CGRP ) .
O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the present study we aimed to investigate plasma levels of CGRP during headache induced by the NO donor glyceryl trinitrate ( GTN ) in 16 patients with chronic tension
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I O B O O O O O O O
- type headache and 16 healthy controls .
O O O O O O O O
The subjects were randomly allocated to receive 0 . 5 microg / kg / min GTN or placebo over 20 min on two headache - free days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Blood samples were collected at baseline , 10 , 20 and 60 min after start of infusion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both patients and controls developed significantly stronger immediate headache on the GTN day than on the placebo day and the headache was significantly more pronounced in patients than in controls
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
There was no difference between the area under the CGRP curve ( AUCCGRP ) on GTN vs . placebo day in either patients ( P = 0 . 65 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
or controls ( P = 0 . 48 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
The AUCCGRP recorded on the GTN day did not differ between patients and controls ( P = 0 . 36 ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Both in patients and controls , CGRP levels changed significantly over time , on both the GTN and placebo days ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The present study indicates that NO - induced immediate headache is not associated with release of CGRP .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Myocardial ischemia due to coronary artery spasm during dobutamine stress echocardiography .
O O O O O O O O B O O O
Dobutamine stress echocardiography ( DSE ) is a useful and safe provocation test for myocardial ischemia .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Until now , the test has been focused only on the organic lesion in the coronary artery , and positive DSE has indicated the presence of significant fixed coronary artery
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
stenosis .
O O
The aim of the present study is to examine whether myocardial ischemia due to coronary spasm is induced by dobutamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
We performed DSE on 51 patients with coronary spastic angina but without significant fixed coronary artery stenosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All patients had anginal attacks at rest with ST elevation on the electrocardiogram ( variant angina ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Coronary spasm was induced by intracoronary injection of acetylcholine , and no fixed coronary artery stenosis was documented on angiograms in all patients .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DSE was performed with intravenous dobutamine infusion with an incremental doses of 5 , 10 , 20 , 30 , and 40 microg / kg / min every 5 minutes
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Of the 51 patients , 7 patients showed asynergy with ST elevation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All 7 patients ( 13 . 7 % ) had chest pain during asynergy , and both chest pain and electrocardiographic changes were preceded by asynergy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings indicate that dobutamine can provoke coronary spasm in some patients with coronary spastic angina .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
When DSE is performed to evaluate coronary artery disease , not only fixed coronary stenosis , but also coronary spasm should be considered as a genesis of asynergy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nitric oxide synthase expression in the course of lead - induced hypertension .
B I O O O O O O B O O O O
We recently showed elevated reactive oxygen species ( ROS ) , reduced urinary excretion of NO metabolites ( NOx ) , and increased NO sequestration as nitrotyrosine in various tissues
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O B O O O
in rats with lead - induced hypertension .
O O O B O O O O
This study was designed to discern whether the reduction in urinary NOx in lead - induced hypertension is , in part , due to depressed NO synthase ( NOS )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
expression .
O O
Male Sprague - Dawley rats were randomly assigned to a lead - treated group ( given lead acetate , 100 ppm , in drinking water and regular rat chow )
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
, a group given lead and vitamin E - fortified chow , or a normal control group given either regular food and water or vitamin E - fortified food for
O O O O B O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
12 weeks .
O O O
Tail blood pressure , urinary NOx excretion , plasma malondialdehyde ( MDA ) , and endothelial and inducible NOS ( eNOS and iNOS ) isotypes in the aorta and kidney
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
were measured .
O O O
The lead - treated group exhibited a rise in blood pressure and plasma MDA concentration , a fall in urinary NOx excretion , and a paradoxical rise in vascular and
O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
renal tissue eNOS and iNOS expression .
O O O O O O O
Vitamin E supplementation ameliorated hypertension , lowered plasma MDA concentration , and raised urinary NOx excretion while significantly lowering vascular , but not renal , tissue eNOS and iNOS expression
B I O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Vitamin E supplementation had no effect on either blood pressure , plasma MDA , or NOS expression in the control group .
B I O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The study also revealed significant inhibition of NOS enzymatic activity by lead in cell - free preparations .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
In conclusion , lead - induced hypertension in this model was associated with a compensatory upregulation of renal and vascular eNOS and iNOS expression .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This is , in part , due to ROS - mediated NO inactivation , lead - associated inhibition of NOS activity , and perhaps stimulatory actions of increased shear stress
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
associated with hypertension .
O O O O
Risk for valvular heart disease among users of fenfluramine and dexfenfluramine who underwent echocardiography before use of medication .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Because uncontrolled echocardiographic surveys suggested that up to 30 % to 38 % of users of fenfluramine and dexfenfluramine had valvular disease , these drugs were withdrawn from the market
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To determine the risk for new or worsening valvular abnormalities among users of fenfluramine or dexfenfluramine who underwent echocardiography before they began to take these medications .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
DESIGN :
O O
Cohort study .
O O O
SETTING :
O O
Academic primary care practices .
O O O O O
PATIENTS : 46 patients who used fenfluramine or dexfenfluramine for 14 days or more and had echocardiograms obtained before therapy .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
MEASUREMENTS : Follow - up echocardiography .
O O O O O O O
The primary outcome was new or worsening valvulopathy , defined as progression of either aortic or mitral regurgitation by at least one degree of severity and disease that met U
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. S . Food and Drug Administration criteria ( at least mild aortic regurgitation or moderate mitral regurgitation ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Two patients ( 4 . 3 % [ 95 % CI , 0 . 6 % to 14 . 8 % ] ) receiving fenfluramine - phentermine developed valvular heart
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
disease .
O O
One had baseline bicuspid aortic valve and mild aortic regurgitation that progressed to moderate regurgitation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The second patient developed new moderate aortic insufficiency .
O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Users of diet medications are at risk for valvular heart disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , the incidence may be lower than that reported previously .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Carboplatin toxic effects on the peripheral nervous system of the rat .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
The most striking of carboplatin 's advantages ( CBDCA ) over cisplatin ( CDDP ) is its markedly reduced rate of neurotoxic effects .
O O O O B O O O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
However , the use of CBDCA higher - intensity schedules and the association with other neurotoxic drugs in polychemotherapy may cause some concern about its safety with respect to peripheral
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
nervous system damage .
O O O O
MATERIALS AND METHODS :
O O O O
Two different schedules of CBDCA administration ( 10 mg / kg and 15 mg / kg i . p .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
twice a week for nine times ) were evaluated in Wistar rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neurotoxicity was assessed for behavioral ( tail - flick test ) , neurophysiological ( nerve conduction velocity in the tail nerve ) , morphological , morphometrical and analytical effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
CBDCA administration induced dose - dependent peripheral neurotoxicity .
B O O O O O O O O
Pain perception and nerve conduction velocity in the tail were significantly impaired , particularly after the high - dose treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The dorsal root ganglia sensory neurons and , to a lesser extent , satellite cells showed the same changes as those induced by CDDP , mainly affecting the nucleus and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
nucleolus of ganglionic sensory neurons .
O O O O O O
Moreover , significant amounts of platinum were detected in the dorsal root ganglia and kidney after CBDCA treatment .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
CBDCA is neurotoxic in our model , and the type of pathological changes it induces are so closely similar to those caused by CDDP that it is probable that neurotoxicity
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
is induced in the two drugs by the same mechanism .
O O O O O O O O O O O
This model can be used alone or in combination with other drugs to explore the effect of CBDCA on the peripheral nervous system .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Iatrogenic risks of endometrial carcinoma after treatment for breast cancer in a large French case - control study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
F d ration Nationale des Centres de Lutte Contre le Cancer ( FNCLCC ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Since tamoxifen is widely used in breast cancer treatment and has been proposed for the prevention of breast cancer , its endometrial iatrogenic effects must be carefully examined .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We have investigated the association between endometrial cancer and tamoxifen use or other treatments in women treated for breast cancer in a case - control study .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cases of endometrial cancer diagnosed after breast cancer ( n = 135 ) and 467 controls matched for age , year of diagnosis of breast cancer and hospital and survival
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
time with an intact uterus were included .
O O O O O O O O
Women who had received tamoxifen were significantly more likely to have endometrial cancer diagnosed than those who had not ( crude relative risk = 4 . 9 , p =
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 0001 ) .
O O O O O
Univariate and adjusted analyses showed that the risk increased with the length of treatment ( p = 0 . 0001 ) or the cumulative dose of tamoxifen received ( p
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
= 0 . 0001 ) , irrespective of the daily dose .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Women who had undergone pelvic radiotherapy also had a higher risk ( crude relative risk = 7 . 8 , p = 0 . 0001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After adjusting for confounding factors , the risk was higher for tamoxifen users ( p = 0 . 0012 ) , treatment for more than 3 years ( all p
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
< 0 . 03 ) and pelvic radiotherapy ( p = 0 . 012 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Women who had endometrial cancer and had received tamoxifen had more advanced disease and poorer prognosis than those with endometrial cancer who had not received this treatment .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our results suggest a causal role of tamoxifen in endometrial cancer , particularly when used as currently proposed for breast cancer prevention .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pelvic radiotherapy may be an additional iatrogenic factor for women with breast cancer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Endometrial cancers diagnosed in women treated with tamoxifen have poorer prognosis .
O O O O O O O B O O O O
Women who receive tamoxifen for breast cancer should be offered gynaecological surveillance during and after treatment .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A long - term evaluation of the risk - benefit ratio of tamoxifen as a preventive treatment for breast cancer is clearly warranted .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Granulosa cell tumor of the ovary associated with antecedent tamoxifen use .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
BACKGROUND : Increased attention has been focused recently on the estrogenic effects of tamoxifen .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Review of the literature reveals an association between tamoxifen use and gynecologic tumors .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
CASE :
O O
A 52 - year - old postmenopausal woman was treated with tamoxifen for stage II estrogen receptor - positive breast carcinoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O
Her aspartate transaminase and alanine transaminase levels increase markedly after 6 months of tamoxifen use .
O B O O B O O O O O O O O B O O
After an additional 17 months of elevated serum transaminases , the patient was found to have a stage Ic granulosa cell tumor of the ovary .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Patients with tamoxifen - induced liver dysfunction may be at increased risk for granulosa cell tumors because of alterations in tamoxifen metabolism .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
A murine model of adenomyosis : the effects of hyperprolactinemia induced by fluoxetine hydrochloride , a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor , on adenomyosis induction in Wistar albino rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : The aim of this study was to investigate whether fluoxetine given to castrated and noncastrated rats caused hyperprolactinemia and its effects with respect to adenomyosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DESIGN :
O O
Fluoxetine , a serotonin reuptake inhibitor , was given to Wistar Albino rats for 98 days to produce hyperprolactinemia .
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The drug was given to two groups consisting of castrated and noncastrated rats and compared to two groups of castrated and noncastrated controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prolactin levels were measured and the uteri of the rats were removed for histopathological analysis at the end of 98 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
SETTING :
O O
Marmara University School of Medicine , Department of Histology and Embryology , Zeynep Kamil Women and Children 's Hospital .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES :
O O O O
Serum prolactin levels , uterine histopathology .
O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The prolactin levels of castrated and noncastrated groups treated with fluoxetine were statistically significantly higher when compared to their respective control groups .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Histological studies revealed 11 cases of adenomyosis , all within the noncastrated group receiving fluoxetine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
CONCLUSION :
O O
It was suggested that high serum prolactin levels cause degeneration of myometrial cells in the presence of ovarian steroids that results in a myometrial invasion by endometrial stroma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
This invasion eventually progresses to adenomyosis .
O O O O O O O
Effects of deliberate hypotension induced by labetalol with isoflurane on neuropsychological function .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O
The effect of deliberate hypotension on brain function measured by neuropsychological tests was studied in 41 adult patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Twenty - four patients were anaesthetized for middle - ear surgery with deliberate hypotension induced by labetalol with isoflurane ( hypotensive group ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
Seventeen patients without hypotension served as a control group .
O O O O O O O O O O
The mean arterial pressure was 77 + / -
O O O O O O O O O
2 mmHg ( 10 . 3 + / -
O O O O O O O O O
0 . 3 kPa ) before hypotension and 50
O O O O O O O O O
+ / - 0
O O O O
mmHg ( 6 . 7 + / - 0 . 0 kPa ) during hypotension in the hypotensive group , and 86 + / - 2 mmHg ( 11 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 + / - 0 . 3 kPa ) during anaesthesia in the control group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The following psychological tests were performed : four subtests of the Wechsler Adult Intelligence Scale ( similarities , digit span , vocabulary and digit symbol ) , Trail - Making
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
tests A and B , Zung tests ( self - rating anxiety scale and self - rating depression scale ) and two - part memory test battery with immediate and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
delayed recall .
O O O
The tests were performed preoperatively and 2 days postoperatively .
O O O O O O O O O O
There were no statistically significant differences between the groups in any of the tests in the changes from preoperative value to postoperative value .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results indicate that hypotension induced by labetalol with isoflurane has no significant harmful effects on mental functions compared to normotensive anaesthesia .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Auditory disturbance associated with interscalene brachial plexus block .
O O O O O O O O O
We performed an audiometric study in 20 patients who underwent surgery of the shoulder region under an interscalene brachial plexus block ( IBPB ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bupivacaine 0 . 75 % with adrenaline was given followed by a 24 - hr continuous infusion of 0 . 25 % bupivacaine .
B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Three audiometric threshold measurements ( 0 . 25 - 18 kHz ) were made : the first before IBPB , the second 2 - 6 h after surgery and the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
third on the first day after operation .
O O O O O O O O
In four patients hearing impairment on the side of the block was demonstrated after operation , in three measurements on the day of surgery and in one on the following
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
day .
O O
The frequencies at which the impairment occurred varied between patients ; in one only low frequencies ( 0 . 25 - 0 . 5 kHz ) were involved .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The maximum change in threshold was 35 dB at 6 kHz measured at the end of the continuous infusion of bupivacaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
This patient had hearing threshold changes ( 15 - 20 dB ) at 6 - 10 kHz on the opposite side also .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
IBPB may cause transient auditory dysfunction in the ipsilateral ear , possibly via an effect on sympathetic innervation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Midazolam compared with thiopentone as an induction agent .
B O O B O O O O O
In patients premedicated with scopolamine + morphine ( + 5 mg nitrazepam the evening before surgery ) , the sleep - inducing effect of midazolam 0 . 15 mg /
O O O O B O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
kg i . v .
O O O O O
was clearly slower in onset than that of thiopentone 4 . 67 mg / kg i . v .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Somewhat fewer cardiovascular and local sequelae were found in the midazolam group , but , although apnoea occurred less often in the midazolam group it lasted longer .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
On the whole , the differences between midazolam and thiopentone had no apparent clinical consequences .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
Midazolam is a new alternative agent for induction in combination anaesthesia .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Cardiotoxic and possible leukemogenic effects of adriamycin in nonhuman primates .
O O O O O O B O O O O
10 monkeys ( macaques ) received adriamycin by monthly intravenous injections at 12 mg / m2 ( 1 mg / kg ) .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
8 of the 10 monkeys developed congestive heart failure at an average cumulative adriamycin dose ( 310 mg / m2 ) well below that considered the safe upper limit (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
550 mg / m2 ) in man .
O O O O O O O O
Histologically , the myocardial lesions resembled those found in human anthracycline - induced cardiomyopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
1 of the 10 monkeys developed acute myeloblastic leukemia after receiving 324 mg / m2 of adriamycin ; the 10th monkey is alive and well 26 months after the last
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dose of drug .
O O O O
Our results suggest that adriamycin is a more potent cardiotoxin in monkeys than in man , and that leukemia may be a consequence of prolonged treatment with this drug .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Doxorubicin cardiomyopathy in children with left - sided Wilms tumor .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Two children with Wilms tumor of the left kidney experienced severe anthracycline cardiomyopathy after irradiation to the tumor bed and conventional dosage of doxorubicin .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The cardiomyopathy is attributed 1 ) to the fact that radiation fields for left Wilms tumor include the lower portion of the heart and 2 ) to the interaction of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
doxorubicin and irradiation on cardiac muscle .
B O O O O O O
It is recommended that doxorubicin dosage be sharply restricted in children with Wilms tumor of the left kidney who receive postoperative irradiation .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Promotional effects of testosterone and dietary fat on prostate carcinogenesis in genetically susceptible rats .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Germfree ( GF )
O O O O
Lobund strain Wistar ( LW ) rats , fed vegetable diet L - 485 , have developed prostate adenocarcinomas spontaneously ( 10 % incidence ) at average age 34 months
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Conventional LW rats , implanted with testosterone at age 4 months , developed a higher incidence of prostate cancer after an average interval of 14 months : 24 % had
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
developed gross tumors , and 40 % when it included microscopic tumors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Preliminary results indicate that testosterone - treated LW rats that were fed the same diet , which was supplemented with corn oil up to 20 % fat , developed prostate
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cancer after intervals of 6 - 12 months .
O O O O O O O O O
Aged GF Sprague - Dawley ( SD ) rats have not developed prostate cancer spontaneously .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Conventional SD rats fed diet L - 485 and treated with testosterone developed only prostatitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Experimental designs should consider genetic susceptibility as a basic prerequisite for studies on experimental prostate cancer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mitomycin C associated hemolytic uremic syndrome .
B I O O O O O
Mitomycin C associated Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome ( HUS ) is a potentially fatal but uncommon condition that is not yet widely recognised .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It consists of microangiopathic hemolytic anemia , thrombocytopenia and progressive renal failure associated with mitomycin C treatment and affects about 10 % of patients treated with this agent .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The renal failure usually develops about 8 - 10 mth after start of mitomycin C treatment and the mortality is approximately 60 % from renal failure or pulmonary edema .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal lesions are similar to those seen in idiopathic HUS and include arteriolar fibrin thrombi , expanded subendothelial zones in glomerular capillary walls , ischemic wrinkling of glomerular basement membranes
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and mesangiolysis .
O O O
The mechanism of action is postulated as mitomycin C - induced endothelial cell damage .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O
We describe the clinical course and pathological findings in a 65 yr - old man with gastric adenocarcinoma who developed renal failure and thrombocytopenia while on treatment with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mitomycin C and died in pulmonary edema .
B I O O O O O O
Continuous ambulatory ECG monitoring during fluorouracil therapy : a prospective study .
O O O O O B O O O O O O
Although there have been anecdotal reports of cardiac toxicity associated with fluorouracil ( 5 - FU ) therapy , this phenomenon has not been studied in a systematic fashion .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We prospectively performed continuous ambulatory ECG monitoring on 25 patients undergoing 5 - FU infusion for treatment of solid tumors in order to assess the incidence of ischemic ST changes
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Patients were monitored for 23 + / -
O O O O O O O O
4 hours before 5 - FU infusion , and 98 + / -
O O O B I I O O O O O O O
9 hours during 5 - FU infusion .
O O O B I I O O
Anginal episodes were rare : only one patient had angina ( during 5 - FU infusion ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O
However , asymptomatic ST changes ( greater than or equal to 1 mm ST deviation ) were common : six of 25 patients ( 24 % ) had ST changes
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
before 5 - FU infusion v 17 ( 68 % ) during 5 - FU infusion ( P less than . 002 ) .
O B I I O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of ischemic episodes per patient per hour was 0 . 05 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 02
O O O
prior to 5 - FU infusion v 0 . 13 + / - 0 . 03 during 5 - FU infusion ( P less than . 001 ) ; the
O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
duration of ECG changes was 0 . 6 + / - 0 . 3 minutes per patient per hour before 5 - FU v 1 . 9 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O
0 . 5 minutes per patient per hour during 5 - FU ( P less than . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O
ECG changes were more common among patients with known coronary artery disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There were two cases of sudden death , both of which occurred at the end of the chemotherapy course .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We conclude that 5 - FU infusion is associated with a significant increase in silent ST segment deviation suggestive of ischemia , particularly among patients with coronary artery disease .
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mechanism and clinical significance of these ECG changes remain to be determined .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lethal anuria complicating high dose ifosfamide chemotherapy in a breast cancer patient with an impaired renal function .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
A sixty - year - old woman with advanced breast cancer , previously treated with cisplatin , developed an irreversible lethal renal failure with anuria , the day after 5
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
g / m2 bolus ifosfamide .
O O O O B O
Postrenal failure was excluded by echography .
O O O O O O O
A prerenal component could have contributed to renal failure because of a transient hypotension , due to an increasing ascitis , occurring just before anuria .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , correction of the hemodynamic parameters did not improve renal function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ifosfamide is a known nephrotoxic drug with demonstrated tubulopathies .
B O O O O O O O O O
We strongly suspect that this lethal anuria was mainly due to ifosfamide , occurring in a patient having received previous cisplatin chemotherapy and with poor kidney perfusion due to transient
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
hypotension .
O O
We recommend careful use of ifosfamide in patients pretreated with nephrotoxic chemotherapy and inadequate renal perfusion .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Central vein thrombosis and topical dipivalyl epinephrine .
O O O O O B I O
A report is given on an 83 - year - old female who acquired central vein thrombosis in her seeing eye one day after having started topical medication with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dipivalyl epinephrine for advanced glaucoma discovered in the other eye .
B I O O O O O O O O O
From present knowledge about the effects of adrenergic eye drops on ocular blood circulation , it is difficult to suggest an association between the two events , which may be
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
coincidental only .
O O O
Amelioration of bendrofluazide - induced hypokalemia by timolol .
O O B O O O O B O
The beta adrenergic blocking drug , timolol , tended to correct the hypokalemia of short - term bendrofluazide treatment in 6 healthy male subjects and although the effect was small
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
it was significant .
O O O O
Timolol also reduced the rise in plasma aldosterone and urine potassium excretion following bendrofluazide and increased the urine sodium / potassium ratio .
B O O O O O O B O O B O O B O O O O B O B O O
There was no evidence of a shift of potassium from the intracellular to the extracellular space .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
A cross - sectional evaluation of the effect of risperidone and selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors on bone mineral density in boys .
O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : The aim of the present study was to investigate the effect of risperidone - induced hyperprolactinemia on trabecular bone mineral density ( BMD ) in children and adolescents
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
METHOD :
O O
Medically healthy 7 - to 17 - year - old males chronically treated , in a naturalistic setting , with risperidone were recruited for this cross - sectional study through
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
child psychiatry outpatient clinics between November 2005 and June 2007 .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Anthropometric measurements and laboratory testing were conducted .
O O O O O O O O
The clinical diagnoses were based on chart review , and developmental and treatment history was obtained from the medical record .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Volumetric BMD of the ultradistal radius was measured using peripheral quantitative computed tomography , and areal BMD of the lumbar spine was estimated using dual - energy x - ray
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
absorptiometry .
O O
RESULTS :
O O
Hyperprolactinemia was present in 49 % of 83 boys ( n = 41 ) treated with risperidone for a mean of 2 . 9 years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Serum testosterone concentration increased with pubertal status but was not affected by hyperprolactinemia .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
As expected , bone mineral content and BMD increased with sexual maturity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After adjusting for the stage of sexual development and height and BMI z scores , serum prolactin was negatively associated with trabecular volumetric BMD at the ultradistal radius ( P
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
< . 03 ) .
O O O O O
Controlling for relevant covariates , we also found treatment with selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors ( SSRIs ) to be associated with lower trabecular BMD at the radius ( P =
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 03 ) and BMD z score at the lumbar spine ( P < . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings became more marked when the analysis was restricted to non - Hispanic white patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of 13 documented fractures , 3 occurred after risperidone and SSRIs were started , and none occurred in patients with hyperprolactinemia .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
This is the first study to link risperidone - induced hyperprolactinemia and SSRI treatment to lower BMD in children and adolescents .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Future research should evaluate the longitudinal course of this adverse event to determine its temporal stability and whether a higher fracture rate ensues .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Seizures associated with levofloxacin : case presentation and literature review .
O O O B O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
We present a case of a patient who developed seizures shortly after initiating treatment with levofloxacin and to discuss the potential drug - drug interactions related to the inhibition of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cytochrome P450 ( CYP )
O O O O O
1A2 in this case , as well as in other cases , of levofloxacin - induced seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Several biomedical databases were searched including MEDLINE , Cochrane and Ovid .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The main search terms utilized were case report and levofloxacin .
O O O O O O O O O B O
The search was limited to studies published in English .
O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Six cases of levofloxacin - induced seizures have been reported in the literature .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Drug - drug interactions related to the inhibition of CYP1A2 by levofloxacin are likely involved in the clinical outcome of these cases .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Clinicians are exhorted to pay close attention when initiating levofloxacin therapy in patients taking medications with epileptogenic properties that are CYP1A2 substrates .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mice lacking mPGES - 1 are resistant to lithium - induced polyuria .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Cyclooxygenase - 2 activity is required for the development of lithium - induced polyuria .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
However , the involvement of a specific , terminal prostaglandin ( PG ) isomerase has not been evaluated .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
The present study was undertaken to assess lithium - induced polyuria in mice deficient in microsomal prostaglandin E synthase - 1 ( mPGES - 1 ) .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O
A 2 - wk administration of LiCl ( 4 mmol . kg ( - 1 ) . day ( - 1 ) ip ) in mPGES - 1 + /
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
+ mice led to a marked polyuria with hyposmotic urine .
O O O O O O O O O O O
This was associated with elevated renal mPGES - 1 protein expression and increased urine PGE ( 2 ) excretion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O
In contrast , mPGES - 1 - / - mice were largely resistant to lithium - induced polyuria and a urine concentrating defect , accompanied by nearly complete blockade of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
high urine PGE ( 2 ) and cAMP output .
O O B I I I O O O O
Immunoblotting , immunohistochemistry , and quantitative ( q ) RT - PCR consistently detected a significant decrease in aquaporin - 2 ( AQP2 ) protein expression in both the renal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cortex and medulla of lithium - treated + / + mice .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
This decrease was significantly attenuated in the - / - mice . qRT - PCR detected similar patterns of changes in AQP2 mRNA in the medulla but not in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cortex .
O O
Similarly , the total protein abundance of the Na - K - 2Cl cotransporter ( NKCC2 ) in the medulla but not in the cortex of the + / +
O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mice was significantly reduced by lithium treatment .
O O O O O B O O
In contrast , the dowregulation of renal medullary NKCC2 expression was significantly attenuated in the - / - mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We conclude that mPGES - 1 - derived PGE ( 2 ) mediates lithium - induced polyuria likely via inhibition of AQP2 and NKCC2 expression .
O O O O O O O O B I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Identification of a simple and sensitive microplate method for the detection of oversulfated chondroitin sulfate in heparin products .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O
Heparin is a commonly implemented anticoagulant used to treat critically ill patients .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Recently , a number of commercial lots of heparin products were found to be contaminated with an oversulfated chondroitin sulfate ( OSCS ) derivative that could elicit a hypotensive response
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
in pigs following a single high - dose infusion .
O O O O O O O O O O
Using both contaminated heparin products and the synthetically produced derivative , we showed that the OSCS produces dose - dependent hypotension in pigs .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The no observed effect level ( NOEL ) for this contaminant appears to be approximately 1mg / kg , corresponding to a contamination level of approximately 3 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We also demonstrated that OSCS can be identified in heparin products using a simple , inexpensive , commercially available heparin enzyme immunoassay ( EIA ) kit that has a limit
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
of detection of approximately 0 . 1 % , well below the NOEL .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This kit may provide a useful method to test heparin products for contamination with oversulfated GAG derivatives .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Doxorubicin cardiomyopathy - induced inflammation and apoptosis are attenuated by gene deletion of the kinin B1 receptor .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical use of the anthracycline doxorubicin ( DOX ) is limited by its cardiotoxic effects , which are attributed to the induction of apoptosis .
O O O O B B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To elucidate the possible role of the kinin B1 receptor ( B1R ) during the development of DOX cardiomyopathy , we studied B1R knockout mice ( B1R ( - /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
- ) ) by investigating cardiac inflammation and apoptosis after induction of DOX - induced cardiomyopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
DOX control mice showed cardiac dysfunction measured by pressure - volume loops in vivo .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This was associated with a reduced activation state of AKT , as well as an increased bax / bcl2 ratio in Western blots , indicating cardiac apoptosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , mRNA levels of the proinflammatory cytokine interleukin 6 were increased in the cardiac tissue .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In DOX B1R ( - / - ) mice , cardiac dysfunction was improved compared to DOX control mice , which was associated with normalization of the bax / bcl
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- 2 ratio and interleukin 6 , as well as AKT activation state .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings suggest that B1R is detrimental in DOX cardiomyopathy in that it mediates the inflammatory response and apoptosis .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
These insights might have useful implications for future studies utilizing B1R antagonists for treatment of human DOX cardiomyopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Hepatotoxicity associated with sulfasalazine in inflammatory arthritis :
O O O B O O O O
A case series from a local surveillance of serious adverse events .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Spontaneous reporting systems for adverse drug reactions ( ADRs ) are handicapped by under - reporting and limited detail on individual cases .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report an investigation from a local surveillance for serious adverse drug reactions associated with disease modifying anti - rheumatic drugs that was triggered by the occurrence of liver failure
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in two of our patients .
O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Serious ADR reports have been solicited from local clinicians by regular postcards over the past seven years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients ' , who had hepatotoxicity on sulfasalazine and met a definition of a serious ADR , were identified .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two clinicians reviewed structured case reports and assessed causality by consensus and by using a causality assessment instrument .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The likely frequency of hepatotoxicity with sulfasalazine was estimated by making a series of conservative assumptions .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Ten cases were identified : eight occurred during surveillance .
O O O O O O O O O O
Eight patients were hospitalised , two in hepatic failure - one died after a liver transplant .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All but one event occurred within 6 weeks of treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Seven patients had a skin rash , three eosinophilia and one interstitial nephritis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Five patients were of Black British of African or Caribbean descent .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Liver enzymes showed a hepatocellular pattern in four cases and a mixed pattern in six .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Drug - related hepatotoxicity was judged probable or highly probable in 8 patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The likely frequency of serious hepatotoxicity with sulfasalazine was estimated at 0 . 4 % of treated patients .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Serious hepatotoxicity associated with sulfasalazine appears to be under - appreciated and intensive monitoring and vigilance in the first 6 weeks of treatment is especially important .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An evaluation of amikacin nephrotoxicity in the hematology / oncology population .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
Amikacin is an aminoglycoside commonly used to provide empirical double gram - negative treatment for febrile neutropenia and other suspected infections .
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Strategies of extended - interval and conventional dosing have been utilized extensively in the general medical population ; however , data are lacking to support a dosing strategy in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
hematology / oncology population .
O O O O O
To evaluate amikacin - associated nephrotoxicity in an adult hematology / oncology population , a prospective , randomized , open - label trial was conducted at a university - affiliated
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
medical center .
O O O
Forty patients with a diagnosis consistent with a hematologic / oncologic disorder that required treatment with an aminoglycoside were randomized to either conventional or extended - interval amikacin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O
The occurrence of nephrotoxicity by means of an increase in serum creatinine and evaluation of efficacy via amikacin serum concentrations with respective pathogens were assessed .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The occurrence of nephrotoxicity was similar between the conventional and extended - interval groups , at 10 % and 5 % , respectively ( P = 1 . 00 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Six patients in the conventional group had a positive culture , compared with none in the extended - interval group ( P = 0 . 002 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The occurrence of nephrotoxicity was similar between the two dosing regimens , but the distribution of risk factors was variable between the two groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Efficacy could not be assessed .
O O O O O O
Memory function and serotonin transporter promoter gene polymorphism in ecstasy ( MDMA ) users .
O O O B O O O O O B O B O O O
Although 3 , 4 - methylenedioxymethamphetamine ( MDMA or ecstasy ) has been shown to damage brain serotonin ( 5 - HT ) neurons in animals and possibly humans ,
O B I I I I O B O B O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O O O O O O
little is known about the long - term consequences of MDMA - induced 5 - HT neurotoxic lesions on functions in which 5 - HT is involved , such as
O O O O O O O O O O B O O B I I O O O O O O B I I O O O O O
cognitive function .
O O O
Because 5 - HT transporters play a key element in the regulation of synaptic 5 - HT transmission it may be important to control for the potential covariance effect of
O B I I O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a polymorphism in the 5 - HT transporter promoter gene region ( 5 - HTTLPR ) when studying the effects of MDMA as well as cognitive functioning .
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The aim of the study was to investigate the effects of moderate and heavy MDMA use on cognitive function , as well as the effects of long - term abstention
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
from MDMA , in subjects genotyped for 5 - HTTLPR .
O B O O O O O O O O O
A second aim of the study was to determine whether these effects differ for females and males .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fifteen moderate MDMA users ( < 55 lifetime tablets ) , 22 heavy MDMA + users ( > 55 lifetime tablets ) , 16 ex - MDMA + users (
O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
last tablet > 1 year ago ) and 13 controls were compared on a battery of neuropsychological tests .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DNA from peripheral nuclear blood cells was genotyped for 5 - HTTLPR using standard polymerase chain reaction methods .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A significant group effect was observed only on memory function tasks ( p = 0 . 04 ) but not on reaction times ( p = 0 . 61 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
or attention / executive functioning ( p = 0 . 59 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Heavy and ex - MDMA + users performed significantly poorer on memory tasks than controls .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , no evidence of memory impairment was observed in moderate MDMA users .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
No significant effect of 5 - HTTLPR or gender was observed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
While the use of MDMA in quantities that may be considered """" moderate """" is not associated with impaired memory functioning , heavy use of MDMA use may lead to
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
long lasting memory impairments .
O O O O O
No effect of 5 - HTTLPR or gender on memory function or MDMA use was observed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Aging process of epithelial cells of the rat prostate lateral lobe in experimental hyperprolactinemia induced by haloperidol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The aim of the study was to examine the influence of hyperprolactinemia , induced by haloperidol ( HAL ) on age related morphology and function changes of epithelial cells in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
rat prostate lateral lobe .
O O O O O
The study was performed on sexually mature male rats .
O O O O O O O O O O
Serum concentrations of prolactin ( PRL ) and testosterone ( T ) were measured .
O O O O O B O O B O B O O O O
Tissue sections were evaluated with light and electron microscopy .
O O O O O O O O O O
Immunohistochemical reactions for Anti - Proliferating Cell Nuclear Antigen ( PCNA ) were performed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In rats of the experimental group , the mean concentration of : PRL was more than twice higher , whereas T concentration was almost twice lower than that in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
control group .
O O O
Light microscopy visualized the following : hypertrophy and epithelium hyperplasia of the glandular ducts , associated with increased PCNA expression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Electron microscopy revealed changes in columnar epithelial cells , concerning organelles , engaged in protein synthesis and secretion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Does supplemental vitamin C increase cardiovascular disease risk in women with diabetes ?
O O B I O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Vitamin C acts as a potent antioxidant ; however , it can also be a prooxidant and glycate protein under certain circumstances in vitro .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These observations led us to hypothesize that a high intake of vitamin C in diabetic persons might promote atherosclerosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : The objective was to examine the relation between vitamin C intake and mortality from cardiovascular disease .
O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
DESIGN :
O O
We studied the relation between vitamin C intake and mortality from total cardiovascular disease ( n = 281 ) , coronary artery disease ( n = 175 ) , and
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
stroke ( n = 57 ) in 1923 postmenopausal women who reported being diabetic at baseline .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diet was assessed with a food - frequency questionnaire at baseline , and subjects initially free of coronary artery disease were prospectively followed for 15 y . RESULTS :
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After adjustment for cardiovascular disease risk factors , type of diabetes medication used , duration of diabetes , and intakes of folate , vitamin E , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B I O O
beta - carotene , the adjusted relative risks of total cardiovascular disease mortality were 1 . 0 , 0 . 97 , 1 . 11 , 1 . 47 ,
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and 1 . 84
O O O O
( P for trend < 0 . 01 ) across quintiles of total vitamin C intake from food and supplements .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O
Adjusted relative risks of coronary artery disease were 1 . 0 , 0 . 81 , 0 . 99 , 1 . 26 , and 1 . 91 ( P
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
for trend = 0 . 01 ) and of stroke were 1 . 0 , 0 . 52 , 1 . 23 , 2 . 22 , and 2 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
57 ( P for trend < 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
When dietary and supplemental vitamin C were analyzed separately , only supplemental vitamin C showed a positive association with mortality endpoints .
O O O O B I O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
Vitamin C intake was unrelated to mortality from cardiovascular disease in the nondiabetic subjects at baseline .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
A high vitamin C intake from supplements is associated with an increased risk of cardiovascular disease mortality in postmenopausal women with diabetes .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Absolute and attributable risk of venous thromboembolism in women on combined cyproterone acetate and ethinylestradiol .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To achieve absolute risk estimates of venous thromboembolism ( VTE ) among women on cyproterone acetate plus ethinylestradiol ( CPA / EE ) , and among women on
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O B O B O O O O O O
combined oral contraceptives ( COCs ) .
B I I O B O O
METHODS :
O O
From the Danish National Register of Patients ( NRP ) , 1996 to 1998 , the records of 1 . 1 million Danish women , ages 15 to 44 years
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, were searched for evidence of VTE .
O O O O O O O O
COC use was ascertained through mailed questionnaires .
B O O O O O O O
Sales statistics of COCs and CPA / EE were provided through Danish Drug Statistics .
O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
During the time frame of the study , 330 women were found to have had VTE while on COCs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Of these women , 67 were on levonorgestrel - containing COCs .
O O O O O O O B O O B O
Eleven were on CPA / EE .
O O O B O B O
The corresponding absolute risk of VTE was 3 . 4 ( range , 3 . 1 - 3 . 8 ) per 10 000 women years among the women on
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
COCs , 4 . 2 ( range , 3 . 2 - 5 . 2 ) per 10 000 women years among women on levonorgestrel - containing COCs , and
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O
3 . 1 ( range , 1 . 3 - 4 . 9 ) per 10 000 women years among the women on CPA / EE .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Our results suggest the absolute risk of VTE among Danish women on COCs is similar to that among women taking CPA / EE .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O B O
Effect of lindane on hepatic and brain cytochrome P450s and influence of P450 modulation in lindane induced neurotoxicity .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Oral administration of lindane ( 2 . 5 , 5 , 10 and 15 mg / kg , body weight ) for 5 days was found to produce a dose
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- dependent increase in the activity of P450 dependent 7 - ethoxyresorufin - O - deethylase ( EROD ) , 7 - pentoxyresorufin - O - dealkylase ( PROD )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and N - nitrosodimethylamine demethylase ( NDMA - d ) in rat brain and liver .
O B I I O O B O O O O O O O O O
A significant increase in the hepatic and brain P450 monooxygenases was also observed when the duration of exposure of low dose ( 2 . 5 mg / kg ) of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
lindane was increased from 5 days to 15 or 21 days .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
As observed with different doses , the magnitude of induction in the activity of P450 monooxygenases was several fold higher in liver microsomes when compared with the brain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Western blotting studies have indicated that the increase in the P450 enzymes could be due to the increase in the expression of P450 1A1 / 1A2 , 2B1 / 2B2
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and 2E1 isoenzymes .
O O O O
In vitro studies using organic inhibitors specific for individual P450 isoenzymes and antibody inhibition experiments have further demonstrated that the increase in the activity of PROD , EROD and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NDMA - d are due to the increase in the levels of P450 2B1 / 2B2 , 1A1 / 1A2 and 2E1 isoenzymes , respectively .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Induction studies have further shown that while pretreatment of 3 - methylcholanthrene ( MC ) , an inducer of P4501A1 / 1A2 , did not produce any significant effect in
O O O O O O O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the incidence of lindane induced convulsions , pretreatment with phenobarbital ( PB ) , an inducer of P450 2B1 / 2B2 or ethanol , an inducer of P450 2E1 catalysed
O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
reactions , significantly increased the incidence of lindane induced convulsions .
O O O O O O O B O O O
Similarly , when the P450 - mediated metabolism of lindane was blocked by cobalt chloride incidence of convulsions was increased in animals treated with lindane indicating that lindane per se
O O O O O O O O O B O O O B I O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O
or its metabolites formed by PB or ethanol inducible P450 isoenzymes are involved in its neurobehavioral toxicity .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Seizure associated with sleep deprivation and sustained - release bupropion .
O O O O O O O O O B O
This case report describes a generalized seizure associated with sustained - release bupropion use and sleep deprivation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
The subject , a 31 - year - old female smoker , was participating in a clinical trial evaluating an investigational medication for smoking cessation that used sustained - release
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
bupropion as an active control .
B O O O O O
After 5 weeks of bupropion use , the subject experienced a generalized tonic clonic seizure after staying up nearly all night packing and moving to a new residence .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient had no other risk factors for seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O
We suggest that sleep deprivation may add to the risk of bupropion - associated seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Nephrotoxic effects in high - risk patients undergoing angiography .
O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
The use of iodinated contrast medium can result in nephropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Whether iso - osmolar contrast medium is less nephrotoxic than low - osmolar contrast medium in high - risk patients is uncertain .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
We conducted a randomized , double - blind , prospective , multicenter study comparing the nephrotoxic effects of an iso - osmolar , dimeric , nonionic contrast medium ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
iodixanol , with those of a low - osmolar , nonionic , monomeric contrast medium , iohexol .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The study involved 129 patients with diabetes with serum creatinine concentrations of 1 . 5 to 3 . 5 mg per deciliter who underwent coronary or aortofemoral angiography .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The primary end point was the peak increase from base line in the creatinine concentration during the three days after angiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Other end points were an increase in the creatinine concentration of 0 . 5 mg per deciliter or more , an increase of 1 . 0 mg per deciliter or
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
more , and a change in the creatinine concentration from day 0 to day 7 .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The creatinine concentration increased significantly less in patients who received iodixanol .
O B O O O O O O O O B O
From day 0 to day 3 , the mean peak increase in creatinine was 0 . 13 mg per deciliter in the iodixanol group and 0 . 55 mg per
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
deciliter in the iohexol group ( P = 0 . 001 ; the increase with iodixanol minus the increase with iohexol , - 0 . 42 mg per deciliter [
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
95 percent confidence interval , - 0 . 73 to - 0 . 22 ] ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two of the 64 patients in the iodixanol group ( 3 percent ) had an increase in the creatinine concentration of 0 . 5 mg per deciliter or more ,
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
as compared with 17 of the 65 patients in the iohexol group ( 26 percent ) ( P = 0 . 002 ; odds ratio for such an increase in
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the iodixanol group , 0 . 09
O B O O O O O
[ 95 percent confidence interval , 0 . 02 to 0 . 41 ] ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No patient receiving iodixanol had an increase of 1 . 0 mg per deciliter or more , but 10 patients in the iohexol group ( 15 percent ) did .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The mean change in the creatinine concentration from day 0 to day 7 was 0 . 07 mg per deciliter in the iodixanol group and 0 . 24 mg per
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
deciliter in the iohexol group ( P = 0 . 003 ; value in the iodixanol group minus the value in the iohexol group , - 0 . 17 mg
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
per deciliter [ 95 percent confidence interval , - 0 . 34 to - 0 . 07 ] ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Nephropathy induced by contrast medium may be less likely to develop in high - risk patients when iodixanol is used rather than a low - osmolar , nonionic contrast medium
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Experimental cranial pain elicited by capsaicin : a PET study .
O O O O O B O O O O O
Using a positron emission tomography ( PET ) study it was shown recently that in migraine without aura certain areas in the brain stem were activated during the headache state
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, but not in the headache free interval .
O O O O O O O O O
It was suggested that this brain stem activation is inherent to the migraine attack itself and represents the so called ' migraine generator ' .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To test this hypothesis we performed an experimental pain study in seven healthy volunteers , using the same positioning in the PET scanner as in the migraine patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A small amount of capsaicin was administered subcutaneously in the right forehead to evoke a burning painful sensation in the first division of the trigeminal nerve .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Increases of regional cerebral blood flow ( rCBF ) were found bilaterally in the insula , in the anterior cingulate cortex , the cavernous sinus and the cerebellum .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Using the same stereotactic space limits as in the above mentioned migraine study no brain stem activation was found in the acute pain state compared to the pain free state
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
The increase of activation in the region of the cavernous sinus however , suggests that this structure is more likely to be involved in trigeminal transmitted pain as such ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rather than in a specific type of headache as was suggested for cluster headache .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neuroleptic malignant syndrome with risperidone .
O O O O B O
Neuroleptic malignant syndrome is thought to be a result of dopamine D2 receptor blockade in the striatum of the basal ganglia .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Risperidone , a benzisoxazole derivative antipsychotic , has high serotonin 5 - HT2 receptor blockade and dose - related D2 receptor blockade .
B O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The high ratio is believed to impart the low frequency of extrapyramidal symptoms with risperidone at low dosages .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
With this low frequency of extrapyramidal symptoms , it was thought the frequency of neuroleptic malignant syndrome might also be lowered .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A 73 - year - old woman developed neuroleptic malignant syndrome after monotherapy with risperidone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The syndrome reversed after discontinuing risperidone and starting treatment with dantrolene and bromocriptine .
O O O O O B O O O O B O B O
It appears that the protection from extrapyramidal side effects observed with risperidone does not ensure protection from neuroleptic malignant syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Hepatic and extrahepatic angiotensinogen gene expression in rats with acute nephrotic syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Plasma concentration and urine excretion of the renin - angiotensin system proteins are altered in rats with nephrotic syndrome ( NS ) .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this work the messenger ribonucleic acid ( mRNA ) levels of angiotensinogen ( Ao ) were analyzed with the slot - blot hybridization technique in liver and other extrahepatic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
tissues : kidney , heart , brain , and adrenal gland from control , nephrotic , and pair - fed ( PF ) rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NS was induced by a single injection of puromycin amino - nucleoside ( PAN ) .
O O O O O O O O B I I I O B O O
Although a great urinary excretion and half - normal plasma levels of Ao were observed on day 6 after PAN injection , when NS was clearly established , hepatic Ao
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
mRNA levels did not change .
O O O O O O
Furthermore , the Ao mRNA levels did not change in any of the extrahepatic tissues studied on day 6 , nor did its hepatic levels at days 1 , 3
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, 5 , or 7 after PAN injection .
O O O O O O B O O
These data suggest that the hepatic and extrahepatic Ao mRNA levels are unaltered during the development of the acute NS induced by PAN .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Cyclophosphamide associated bladder cancer - - a highly aggressive disease : analysis of 12 cases .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
We gained knowledge of the etiology , treatment and prevention of cyclophosphamide associated urothelial cancer .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
MATERIALS AND METHODS :
O O O O
The medical records of 6 men and 6 women ( mean age 55 years ) with cyclophosphamide associated bladder cancer were reviewed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
All tumors were grade 3 or 4 transitional cell carcinoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Of the 5 patients initially treated with endoscopic resection alone only 1 is alive without disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of the 6 patients who underwent early cystectomy 4 were alive at 24 to 111 months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The remaining patient with extensive cancer underwent partial cystectomy for palliation and died 3 months later .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Cyclophosphamide associated bladder tumor is an aggressive disease .
B O O O O O O O O
However , long - term survival is possible when radical cystectomy is performed for bladder tumors with any sign of invasion and for recurrent high grade disease , even when
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
noninvasive .
O O
Leg and back pain after spinal anaesthesia involving hyperbaric 5 % lignocaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Fifty - four patients , aged 27 - 90 years , who were given lignocaine 5 % in 6 . 8 % glucose solution for spinal anaesthesia were studied .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Thirteen of these patients experienced pain in the legs and / or back after recovery from anaesthesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patients affected were younger ( p < 0 . 05 ) and the site of the dural puncture was higher ( p < 0 . 01 ) than those
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
individuals without pain .
O O O O
Five of the 13 patients ( 38 % ) with pain and seven of the 41 patients ( 17 % ) without pain admitted to a high alcohol intake ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
which might be a contributing factor .
O O O O O O O
Leg and / or back pain is associated with the intrathecal use of hyperbaric 5 % lignocaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Acute blood pressure elevations with caffeine in men with borderline systemic hypertension .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Whether the vasoconstrictive actions of caffeine are enhanced in hypertensive persons has not been demonstrated .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Thus , caffeine ( 3 . 3 mg / kg ) versus placebo was tested in 48 healthy men ( aged 20 to 35 years ) selected after screening on
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 separate occasions .
O O O O
Borderline hypertensive men ( n = 24 ) were selected with screening systolic blood pressure ( BP ) of 140 to 160 mm Hg and / or diastolic BP 90
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to 99 mm Hg .
O O O O O
Low - risk controls ( n = 24 ) reported no parental history of hypertension and had screening BP < 130 / 85 mm Hg .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Participants were then tested on 2 occasions after 12 - hour abstinence from caffeine in each of 2 protocols ; this required a total of 4 laboratory visits .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Caffeine - induced changes in diastolic BP were 2 to 3 times larger in borderline subjects than in controls ( + 8 . 4 vs + 3 . 8 mm
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hg , p < 0 . 0001 ) , and were attributable to larger changes in impedance - derived measures of systemic vascular resistance ( + 135 vs + 45
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dynes . s . cm - 5 , p < 0 . 004 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings were consistent and reached significance in both protocols .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The percentage of borderline subjects in whom diastolic BP changes exceeded the median control response was 96 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Consequently , whereas all participants exhibited normotensive levels during the resting predrug baseline , 33 % of borderline subjects achieved hypertensive BP levels after caffeine ingestion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Thus , in borderline hypertensive men , exaggerated responses to caffeine were : selective for diastolic BP , consistent with greater vasoconstriction , replicated in 2 protocols , and representative
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of nearly all borderline hypertensives .
O O O O O O
We suspect that the potential for caffeine to stabilize high resistance states in susceptible persons suggests that its use may facilitate their disease progression , as well as hinder accurate
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
diagnosis and treatment .
O O O O
Hallucinations and ifosfamide - induced neurotoxicity .
O O B O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Hallucinations as a symptom of central neurotoxicity are a known but poorly described side effect of ifosfamide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Most cases of ifosfamide - induced hallucinations have been reported with other mental status changes .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
The authors interviewed six persons with ifosfamide - induced hallucinations in the presence of a clear sensorium .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
All patients were receiving high - dose ifosfamide as part of their bone marrow transplant procedure .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Hallucinations occurred only when the patient 's eyes were closed and , in all but one case , were reported as disturbing or frightening .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Underreporting of these hallucinations by patients is likely .
O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Hallucinations may be the sole or first manifestation of neurotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence may be dose and infusion - time related .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The clinician should be alerted for possible ifosfamide - induced hallucinations , which may occur without other signs of neurotoxicity .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
"""" Eyes - closed """" hallucinatory experiences appear to be an unusual feature of this presentation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients anxious about this experience respond well to support and education about this occurrence .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Optimal pharmacologic management of disturbed patients is unclear .
O O O O O O O O O
If agitation becomes marked , high - potency neuroleptics ( i . e . , haloperidol ) may be effective .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Chlorpropamide - induced optic neuropathy .
B O O O O O
A 65 - year - old woman with adult - onset diabetes treated with chlorpropamide ( Diabenese ) had a toxic optic neuropathy that resolved with discontinuation of chlorpropamide therapy
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
.
O
Visual loss occurs in diabetics for a variety of reasons , and accurate diagnosis is necessary to institute appropriate therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The possibility of a drug - induced optic neuropathy should be considered in the differential diagnosis of visual loss in diabetics .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Levodopa - induced dyskinesia and thalamotomy .
B O O O O O O
Levodopa - induced dyskinesia of the limbs in thirteen cases of Parkinsonism , which was choreic , ballistic or dystonic in type , was alleviated almost completely by stereotaxic surgery
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
using a microelectrode technique for the ventralis oralis anterior and posterior nuclei of the thalamus , but much less by the ventralis intermedius nucleus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Control of levodopa - induced dyskinesias by thalamic lesions in the course of routine treatment of Parkinsonism is discussed .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Factors associated with nephrotoxicity and clinical outcome in patients receiving amikacin .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
Data from 60 patients treated with amikacin were analyzed for factors associated with nephrotoxicity .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
In 42 of these patients , data were examined for factors associated with clinical outcome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
