Variables evaluated included patient weight , age , sex , serum creatinine level , creatinine clearance , duration of therapy , total dose , mean daily dose , organism minimum
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
inhibitory concentration ( MIC ) , mean peak levels , mean trough levels , mean
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
area under the serum concentration - time curve ( AUC ) , total AUC , mean AUC greater than MIC , total AUC greater than MIC , mean Schumacher 's
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
intensity factor ( IF ) , total IF , In ( mean maximum concentration [ Cmax ] / MIC ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Model - dependent pharmacokinetic parameters were calculated by computer based on a one - compartment model .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When the parameters were examined individually , duration of therapy and total AUC correlated significantly ( P less than . 05 ) with nephrotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , a stepwise discriminant function analysis identified only duration of therapy ( P less than . 001 ) as an important factor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Based on this model and on Bayes ' theorem , the predictive accuracy of identifying """" nephrotoxic """" patients increased from 0 . 17 to 0 . 39 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When examined individually , mean IF , MIC , total dose , mean daily dose , and ln ( mean Cmax / MIC ) correlated significantly ( P less than
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 05 ) with cure .
O O O O O O
In contrast , a simultaneous multivariable analysis identified IF , MIC , and total dose according to one model and ln ( mean Cmax / MIC ) according to a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
second statistical model of parameters selected to have the greatest prospective value .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Based on Bayes ' theorem and the first model , the predictive accuracy of identifying patients not cured increased from 0 . 19 to 0 . 83 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
For the second model , the predictive accuracy increased from 0 . 19 to 0 . 50 . ( ABSTRACT
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS )
O O O O O
Cardiac transplantation : improved quality of survival with a modified immunosuppressive protocol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effects on renal function on two different immunosuppressive protocols were evaluated retrospectively in two subsequent groups of heart transplant recipients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In group I , cyclosporine was given before the procedure at a loading dose of 17 . 5 mg / kg and then continued after the procedure to keep a
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
whole blood level about 1000 ng / ml .
O O O O O O O O O
In group II , cyclosporine was started only after the procedure at a lower dosage and was complemented by azathioprine , which was used for the first postoperative week .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Group II showed a better perioperative renal function as determined by serum blood urea nitrogen and serum creatinine levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O B O O
Group II also showed a significant decrease of chronic nephrotoxicity secondary to long - term therapy with cyclosporine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Despite this improvement in late renal function , group II still shows a slow rise in serum creatinine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
We think that even these lower dosages of cyclosporine can cause chronic nephrotoxicity and that further modification of the immunosuppressive regimen is required to completely abolish this toxic side effect
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Reversible cholestasis with bile duct injury following azathioprine therapy .
O O O O O O O B O O
A case report .
O O O O
A 67 - year - old patient , with primary polymyositis and without previous evidence of liver disease , developed clinical and biochemical features of severe cholestasis 3 months after
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
initiation of azathioprine therapy .
O O B O O
Liver biopsy showed cholestasis with both cytological and architectural alterations of interlobular bile ducts .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Azathioprine withdrawal resulted after 7 weeks in the resolution of clinical and biochemical abnormalities .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is believed that this is the first reported case of reversible azathioprine - induced cholestasis associated with histological evidence of bile duct injury .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal function and hemodynamics during prolonged isoflurane - induced hypotension in humans .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The effect of isoflurane - induced hypotension on glomerular function and renal blood flow was investigated in 20 human subjects .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Glomerular filtration rate ( GFR ) and effective renal plasma flow ( ERPF ) were measured by inulin and para - aminohippurate ( PAH ) clearance , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O B O O O O O
Anesthesia was maintained with fentanyl , nitrous oxide , oxygen , and isoflurane .
O O O O B O B I O B O O B O
Hypotension was induced for 236 . 9 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O
15 . 1 min by increasing the isoflurane inspired concentration to maintain a mean arterial pressure of 59 . 8 + / -
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 4 mmHg .
O O O O O
GFR and ERPF decreased with the induction of anesthesia but not significantly more during hypotension .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Postoperatively , ERPF returned to preoperative values , whereas GFR was higher than preoperative values .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal vascular resistance increased during anesthesia but decreased when hypotension was induced , allowing the maintenance of renal blood flow .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We conclude that renal compensatory mechanisms are preserved during isoflurane - induced hypotension and that renal function and hemodynamics quickly return to normal when normotension is resumed .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Debrisoquine phenotype and the pharmacokinetics and beta - 2 receptor pharmacodynamics of metoprolol and its enantiomers .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The metabolism of the cardioselective beta - blocker metoprolol is under genetic control of the debrisoquine / sparteine type .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O
The two metabolic phenotypes , extensive ( EM ) and poor metabolizers ( PM ) , show different stereoselective metabolism , resulting in apparently higher beta - 1 adrenoceptor antagonistic
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
potency of racemic metoprolol in EMs .
O O O B O O O
We investigated if the latter also applies to the beta - 2 adrenoceptor antagonism by metoprolol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The drug effect studied was the antagonism by metoprolol of terbutaline - induced hypokalemia .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
By using pharmacokinetic pharmacodynamic modeling the pharmacodynamics of racemic metoprolol and the active S - isomer , were quantitated in EMs and PMs in terms of IC50 values , representing
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
metoprolol plasma concentrations resulting in half - maximum receptor occupancy .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Six EMs received 0 . 5 mg of terbutaline s . c .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
on two different occasions : 1 ) 1 hr after administration of a placebo and 2 ) 1 hr after 150 mg of metoprolol p . o .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Five PMs were studied according to the same protocol , except for a higher terbutaline dose ( 0 . 75 mg ) on day 2 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Blood samples for the analysis of plasma potassium , terbutaline , metoprolol ( racemic , R - and S - isomer ) , and alpha - hydroxymetoprolol concentrations were taken
O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O
at regular time intervals , during 8 hr after metoprolol .
O O O O O O O O O B O
In PMs , metoprolol increased the terbutaline area under the plasma concentration vs . time curve ( + 67 % ) .
O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Higher metoprolol / alpha - hydroxymetoprolol ratios in PMs were predictive for higher R - / S - isomer ratios of unchanged drug .
O B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was a difference in metoprolol potency with higher racemic metoprolol IC50 values in PMs ( 72 + / -
O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
7 ng . ml - 1 ) than EMs ( 42 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
8 ng . ml - 1 , P less than . 001 ) . ( ABSTRACT

Cefotetan - induced immune hemolytic anemia .
B O O O O O O
Immune hemolytic anemia due to a drug - adsorption mechanism has been described primarily in patients receiving penicillins and first - generation cephalosporins .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
We describe a patient who developed anemia while receiving intravenous cefotetan .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
Cefotetan - dependent antibodies were detected in the patient 's serum and in an eluate prepared from his red blood cells .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The eluate also reacted weakly with red blood cells in the absence of cefotetan , suggesting the concomitant formation of warm - reactive autoantibodies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
These observations , in conjunction with clinical and laboratory evidence of extravascular hemolysis , are consistent with drug - induced hemolytic anemia , possibly involving both drug - adsorption and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
autoantibody formation mechanisms .
O O O O
This case emphasizes the need for increased awareness of hemolytic reactions to all cephalosporins .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Acute renal failure subsequent to the administration of rifampicin .
O O O O O O O O B O
A follow - up study of cases reported earlier .
O O O O O O O O O O
A clinical presentation is made of a 2 - 3 year follow - up of six cases of acute renal failure that have been reported earlier .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patients had developed transient renal failure after the intermittent administration of rifampicin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The stage of olig - anuria lasted for 1 - 3 weeks , and five of the patients were treated by hemodialysis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two of the patients died due to unrelated causes during the follow - up period .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The four patients re - examined were clinically cured .
O O O O O O O O O O
Pathologic findings by light microscopy and immunofluorescence at biopsy were scarce .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nothing abnormal was seen by electron microscopy in two of the cases studied .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal function was normal .
O O O O O
In three cases the excretion at 131I - hippuran renography was slightly slowed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although in the acute stage the renal lesions histologically appeared toxic , evidence suggestive of an immunological mechanism can not be excluded .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Type B hepatitis after needle - stick exposure : prevention with hepatitis B immune globulin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Final report of the Veterans Administration Cooperative Study .
O O O O O O O O O
Hepatitis B immune globulin ( HBIG ) and immune serum globulin ( ISG ) were examined in a randomized , double - blind trial to assess their relative efficacies in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
preventing type B hepatitis after needle - stick exposure to hepatitis B surface antigen ( HBsAG ) - positive donors .
O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O B O O O O O
Clinical hepatitis developed in 1 . 4 % of HBIG and in 5 . 9 % of ISG recipients ( P = 0 . 016 ) , and seroconversion (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
anti - HBs ) occurred in 5 . 6 % and 20 . 7 % of them respectively ( P less than 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mild and transient side - effects were noted in 3 . 0 % of ISG and in 3 . 2 % of HBIG recipients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Available donor sera were examined for DNA polymerase ( DNAP ) and e antigen and antibody ( HBeAg ; anti - HBE ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Both DNAP and HBeAg showed a highly statistically significant correlation with the infectivity of HBsAg - positive donors .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Hepatitis B immune globulin remained significantly superior to ISG in preventing type B hepatitis even when the analysis was confined to these two high - risk subgroups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The efficacy of ISG in preventing type B hepatitis can not be ascertained because a true placebo group was not included .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Serotonin syndrome from venlafaxine - tranylcypromine interaction .
O O O B O B O O
Excessive stimulation of serotonin 5HT1A receptors causes a syndrome of serotonin excess that consists of shivering , muscle rigidity , salivation , confusion , agitation and hyperthermia .
O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The most common cause of this syndrome is an interaction between a monoamine oxidase inhibitor ( MAOI ) and a specific serotonin reuptake inhibitor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Venlafaxine is a new antidepressant agent that inhibits the reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine .
B O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
We report a venlafaxine - MAOI interaction that resulted in the serotonin syndrome in a 23 - y - old male who was taking tranylcypromine for depression .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
He had been well until the morning of presentation when he took 1 / 2 tab of venlafaxine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Within 2 h he became confused with jerking movements of his extremities , tremors and rigidity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He was brought directly to a hospital where he was found to be agitated and confused with shivering , myoclonic jerks , rigidity , salivation and diaphoresis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
His pupils were 7 mm and sluggishly reactive to light .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Vital signs were : blood pressure 120 / 67 mm Hg , heart rate 127 / min , respiratory rate 28 / min , and temperature 97 F .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After 180 mg of diazepam i . v .
O O O O B O O O O
he remained tremulous with muscle rigidity and clenched jaws .
O O O O O O O O O O
He was intubated for airway protection and because of hypoventilation , and was paralyzed to control muscle rigidity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
His subsequent course was remarkable for non - immune thrombocytopenia which resolved .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient 's maximal temperature was 101 . 2 F and his CPK remained < 500 units / L with no other evidence of rhabdomyolysis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
His mental status normalized and he was transferred to a psychiatry ward .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This patient survived without sequelae due to the aggressive sedation and neuromuscular paralysis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of nondopaminergic drugs on L - dopa - induced dyskinesias in MPTP - treated monkeys .
O O O O O B I I O O O O B O O O O
A group of four monkeys was rendered parkinsonian with the toxin MPTP .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
They were then treated chronically with L - DOPA / benserazide 50 / 12 . 5 mg / kg given orally daily for 2 months .
O O O O O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This dose produced a striking antiparkinsonian effect , but all animals manifested dyskinesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A series of agents acting primarily on neurotransmitters other than dopamine were then tested in combination with L - DOPA to see if the dyskinetic movements would be modified .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
Several drugs , including clonidine , physostigmine , methysergide , 5 - MDOT , propranolol , and MK - 801 , markedly reduced the dyskinetic movements but at the cost
O O O O B O B O B O B I I O B O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
of a return of parkinsonian symptomatology .
O O O O O O O
However , yohimbine and meperidine reduced predominantly the dyskinetic movements .
O O B O B O O O O O O
Baclofen was also useful in one monkey against a more dystonic form of dyskinesia .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Atropine converted the dystonic movements into chorea .
B O O O O O O O
CCNU ( lomustine ) toxicity in dogs : a retrospective study ( 2002 - 07 ) .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To describe the incidence of haematological , renal , hepatic and gastrointestinal toxicities in tumour - bearing dogs receiving
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 - ( 2 - chloroethyl ) - 3 - cyclohexyl - 1 - nitrosourea ( CCNU ) .
B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O B O O
DESIGN :
O O
The medical records of 206 dogs that were treated with CCNU at the Melbourne Veterinary Specialist Centre between February 2002 and December 2007 were retrospectively evaluated .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Of the 206 dogs treated with CCNU , 185 met the inclusion criteria for at least one class of toxicity .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CCNU was used most commonly in the treatment of lymphoma , mast cell tumour , brain tumour , histiocytic tumours and epitheliotropic lymphoma .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Throughout treatment , 56 . 9 % of dogs experienced neutropenia , 34 . 2 % experienced anaemia and 14 . 2 % experienced thrombocytopenia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Gastrointestinal toxicosis was detected in 37 . 8 % of dogs , the most common sign of which was vomiting ( 24 . 3 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Potential renal toxicity and elevated alanine transaminase ( ALT ) concentration were reported in 12 . 2 % and 48 . 8 % of dogs , respectively .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of hepatic failure was 1 . 2 % .
O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
CCNU - associated toxicity in dogs is common , but is usually not life threatening .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neuroactive steroids protect against pilocarpine - and kainic acid - induced limbic seizures and status epilepticus in mice .
O B O O B O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
Several structurally related metabolites of progesterone ( 3 alpha - hydroxy pregnane - 20 - ones ) and deoxycorticosterone (
O O O O O B O B I I I I I I I I O O B O
3 alpha - hydroxy pregnane - 21 - diol - 20 - ones ) and their 3 beta - epimers were evaluated for protective activity against pilocarpine - ,
B I I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
kainic acid - and N - methyl - D - aspartate ( NMDA ) - induced seizures in mice .
B I O O B I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O
Steroids with the 3 - hydroxy group in the alpha - position and 5 - H in the alpha - or beta - configurations were highly effective in protecting against
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pilocarpine ( 416 mg / kg , s . c . ) - induced limbic motor seizures and status epilepticus ( ED50 values , 7 . 0 - 18 .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
7 mg / kg , i . p . ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The corresponding epimers with the 3 - hydroxy group in the beta - position were also effective but less potent ( ED50 values , 33 . 8 - 63 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 , i . p . ) .
O O O O O O O O
Although the neuroactive steroids were considerably less potent than the benzodiazepine clonazepam in protecting against pilocarpine seizures , steroids with the 5 alpha , 3 alpha - configuration had comparable
O O O B O O O O O O B B O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
or higher protective index values ( TD50 for motor impairment divided by ED50 for seizure protection ) than clonazepam , indicating that some neuroactive steroids may have lower relative toxicity
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O
.
O
Steroids with the 5 alpha , 3 alpha - or 5 beta , 3 alpha - configurations also produced a dose - dependent delay in the onset of limbic seizures
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
induced by kainic acid ( 32 mg / kg , s . c . ) , but did not completely protect against the seizures .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , when a second dose of the steroid was administered 1 hr after the first dose , complete protection from the kainic acid - induced limbic seizures and status
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O
epilepticus was obtained .
O O O O
The steroids also caused a dose - dependent delay in NMDA ( 257 mg / kg , s . c . ) - induced lethality , but did not completely
O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
protect against NMDA seizures or lethality .
O O B O O O O
We conclude that neuroactive steroids are highly effective in protecting against pilocarpine - and kainic acid - induced seizures and status epilepticus in mice , and may be of utility
O O O O B O O O O O O B O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in the treatment of some forms of status epilepticus in humans .
O O O O O O O O O O O O

O O O O

O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I O
SC - 48334 ) ( an alpha - glucosidase I inhibitor ) and zidovudine versus zidovudine alone .
B I I O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O

O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O

O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
respectively ( p > 0 . 36 ) .
O O O O O O O O O

O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
cells / mm3 at week 8 and 6 . 8 cells / mm3 and - 45 . 1 cells / mm3 at week 16 , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The number of patients with suppression of HIV p24 antigenemia in the combination and zidovudine groups was six ( 40 % ) and two ( 11 % ) at week
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 ( p = 0 . 10 ) and five ( 45 % ) and two ( 14 % ) at week 24 ( p = 0 . 08 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, respectively .
O O O
Diarrhea , flatulence , abdominal pain , and weight loss were common for combination recipients . ( ABSTRACT

O O O O O
Recent preclinical and clinical studies with the thymidylate synthase inhibitor N10 - propargyl - 5 , 8 - dideazafolic acid ( CB 3717 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I I I I O B I O O
CB 3717 , N10 - propargyl - 5 , 8 - dideazafolic acid , is a tight - binding inhibitor of thymidylate synthase ( TS ) whose cytotoxicity is mediated
B I O B I I I I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
solely through the inhibition of this enzyme .
O O O O O O O O
Recent preclinical studies have focused on the intracellular formation of CB 3717 polyglutamates .
O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
Following a 12 - hour exposure of L1210 cells to 50 microM [ 3H ] CB 3717 , 30 % of the extractable radioactivity could be accounted for as
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
CB 3717 tetra - and pentaglutamate , as determined by high - pressure liquid chromatography ( HPLC ) analyses .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As inhibitors of isolated L1210 TS , CB 3717 di - , tri - , tetra - and pentaglutamate are 26 - , 87 - , 119 - and 114
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- fold more potent than CB 3717 , respectively , and their formation may , therefore , be an important determinant of CB 3717 cytotoxicity .
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
In early clinical studies with CB 3717 , activity has been seen in breast cancer , ovarian cancer , hepatoma , and mesothelioma .
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Toxicities included hepatotoxicity , malaise , and dose - limiting nephrotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
This latter effect is thought to be due to drug precipitation within the renal tubule as a result of the poor solubility of CB 3717 under acidic conditions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
In an attempt to overcome this problem , a clinical trial of CB 3717 administered with alkaline diuresis is under way .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
Preliminary results at 400 and 500 mg / m2 suggest that a reduction in nephrotoxicity may have been achieved with only 1 instance of renal toxicity in 10 patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hepatotoxicity and malaise are again the most frequent side effects .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Evidence of antitumor activity has been seen in 3 patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Pharmacokinetic investigations have shown that alkaline diuresis does not alter CB 3717 plasma levels or urinary excretion and that satisfactory urinary alkalinization can be readily achieved .
O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ethopropazine and benztropine in neuroleptic - induced parkinsonism .
B O B O O O O O O
In a 12 - week controlled study ethopropazine was compared to benztropine in the treatment of parkinsonism induced by fluphenazine enanthate in 60 schizophrenic outpatients .
O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
Ethopropazine and benztropine were found to be equally effective in controlling parkinsonian symptoms and were as efficacious as procyclidine , their previous antiparkinsonian drug .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
However , benztropine treated patients had a significant increase in tardive dyskinesia compared to their condition during procyclindine treatment , and significantly more anxiety and depression than ethopropazine treated patients
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O
.
O
This suggests that benztropine is not the anticholinergic drug of choice in the treatment of neuroleptic - induced parkinsonian symptoms , because of its more toxic central and peripheral atropinic
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
effect .
O O
Effect of alpha - tocopherol and deferoxamine on methamphetamine - induced neurotoxicity .
O O B I I O B O B O O O O
Methamphetamine ( MA ) - induced dopaminergic neurotoxicity is believed to be associated with the increased formation of free radicals .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This study examined the effect of alpha - tocopherol ( alpha - TC ) , a scavenger of reactive oxygen species , and deferoxamine ( DFO ) , an
O O O O O O B I I O B I I O O O O O O B O O O B O B O O O
iron chelator , on the MA - induced neurotoxicity .
B O O O O B O O O O
Male rats were treated with MA ( 10 mg / kg , every 2 h for four injections ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The rat received either alpha - TC ( 20 mg / kg ) intraperitoneally for 3 days and 30 min prior to MA administration or DFO ( 50 mg /
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O
kg ) subcutaneously 30 min before MA administration .
O O O O O O B O O
The concentrations of dopamine ( DA ) , serotonin and their metabolites decreased significantly after MA administration , which was inhibited by the alpha - TC and DFO pretreatment .
O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B I I O B O O
alpha - TC and DFO attenuated the MA - induced hyperthermia as well as the alterations in the locomotor activity .
B I I O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The level of lipid peroxidation was higher and the reduced glutathione concentration was lower in the MA - treated rats .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O
These changes were significantly attenuated by alpha - TC and DFO .
O O O O O O B I I O B O
This suggests that alpha - TC and DFO ameliorate the MA - induced neuronal damage by decreasing the level of oxidative stress .
O O O B I I O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Use of dexamethasone with mesna for the prevention of ifosfamide - induced hemorrhagic cystitis .
O O B O B O O O O B O O O O O
AIM : Hemorrhagic cystitis ( HC ) is a limiting side - effect of chemotherapy with ifosfamide ( IFS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
In the study presented here , we investigated the use of dexamethasone in combination with mesna for the prevention of IFS - induced HC .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O B O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Male Wistar rats ( 150 - 200 g ; 6 rats per group ) were treated with saline or mesna 5 min ( i . p . )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
before and 2 and 6 h after ( v . o . ) administration of IFS .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
One , two or three doses of mesna were replaced with dexamethasone alone or with dexamethasone plus mesna .
O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O B O B O
Cystitis was evaluated 24 h after its induction by the changes in bladder wet weight and by macroscopic and microscopic analysis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The replacement of the last dose or the last two doses of mesna with dexamethasone reduced the increase in bladder wet weight induced by IFS by 84 . 79 %
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
and 89 . 13 % , respectively .
O O O O O O O O
In addition , it almost abolished the macroscopic and microscopic alterations induced by IFS .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Moreover , the addition of dexamethasone to the last two doses of mesna was more efficient than three doses of mesna alone when evaluated microscopically .
O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Dexamethasone in combination with mesna was efficient in blocking IFS - induced HC .
B O O O B O O O O B O O O O
However , the replacement of last two doses of mesna with saline or all of the mesna doses with dexamethasone did not prevent HC .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O
Behavioral effects of MK - 801 on reserpine - treated mice .
O O O B I I O B O O O O
The effects of dizocilpine ( MK - 801 ) , a noncompetitive N - methyl - D - aspartate ( NMDA ) receptor antagonist , were studied on dopamine -
O O O B O B I I O O O O B I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O B O
related behaviors induced by reserpine treatments .
O O O O B O O
This study focuses on behavioral syndromes that may used as models for Parkinson 's disease , or tardive dyskinesia , and its response after glutamatergic blockage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reserpine ( 1 mg / kg ) , administered once every other day for 4 days , produced increases in orofacial dyskinesia , tongue protrusion and vacuous chewing in mice
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, which are signs indicative of tardive dyskinesia .
O O O O O O O O O
Reserpine also produced tremor and catalepsy , which are signs suggestive of Parkinson 's disease . MK - 801
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I
( 0 . 1 mg / kg ) , administered 30 min before the observation test , prevented the vacuous chewing movements , tongue protrusions and catalepsy induced by
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
reserpine .
B O
However , MK - 801 injection produced a significant increase of tremor in reserpine - treated mice .
O O B I I O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Reserpine ( 1 mg / kg ) , administered 90 min before the test and followed by apomophine injection ( 0 . 1 mg / kg ) 5 min before
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
the test , did not produce oral dyskinesia in mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O
On the other hand , reserpine induced increases in tremor and catalepsy compared to control mice . MK - 801
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B I I
( 0 . 1 mg / kg ) administration attenuated the catalepsy and tremor induced by reserpine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Pretreatment with reserpine ( 1 mg / kg ) 24 h before the observation test produced increases in vacuous chewing movements and tongue protrusion , as well as increases in
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
tremor and catalepsy , whereas MK - 801 ( 0 . 1 mg / kg ) injection 90 min before the test reversed the effects of reserpine .
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
These results show that reserpine produces different and abnormal movements , which are related to dose and schedule employed and can be considered as parkinsonian - like and tardive dsykinesia
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
signs .
O O
The glutamatergic blockage produced by NMDA can restore these signs , such as vacuous chewing movements , tongue protrusions , catalepsy and tremor according to the employed model .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effect of glyceryl trinitrate on the sphincter of Oddi spasm evoked by prostigmine - morphine administration .
O O B I O O O O O O O O B O B O O
OBJECTIVE : In this study the effect of glyceryl trinitrate on the prostigmine - morphine - induced sphincter of Oddi spasm was evaluated in nine female patients with sphincter of
O O O O O O O O B I O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Oddi dyskinesia .
O O O
METHOD :
O O
Sphincter of Oddi spasm was induced by prostigmine - morphine administration ( 0 . 5 mg prostigmine intramuscularly and 10 mg morphine subcutaneously ) and visualized by quantitative hepatobiliary scintigraphy
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O
.
O

O O O O O O B I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O

O O

O O O O O O O O O O O
3 . 26 ) and the common bile duct
O O O O O O O O O
( CBD : 60 . 44 + / -
O O O O O O O O O
5 . 99 vs . 40 . 0 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 88 ) and in the half - time of excretion ( T1 / 2 ) over the liver parenchyma ( LP : 120 . 04 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
16 . 01 vs . 27 . 37 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O
2 . 19 ) , HH ( 117 . 61 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
14 . 71 vs . 31 . 85 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O
3 . 99 ) and CBD ( 158 . 11 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
9 . 18 vs . 40 . 1 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O
6 . 24 ) , indicating a complete spasm at the level of the sphincter of Oddi .

O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
CONCLUSION :
O O
These results provide the first evidence of the effectiveness of glyceryl trinitrate on the morphine - induced sphincter of Oddi spasm in humans .
O O O O O O O O O O B I O O B O O O O O O O O O
Since glyceryl trinitrate is able to overcome even the drastic effect of morphine , it might be of relevance in the treatment of sphincter of Oddi dyskinesia .
O B I O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effects of acute steroid administration on ventilatory and peripheral muscles in rats .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Occasional case reports have shown that acute myopathy may occur in patients treated with massive doses of corticosteroids .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The mechanism of this myopathy is poorly understood .
O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , 60 male rats were randomly assigned to receive daily injection of saline ( C ) , methylprednisolone ( M ) , or triamcinolone ( T ) 80 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O B O B O O O
/ kg / d for 5 d . Nutritional intake , measured daily in 15 animals , showed a significant reduction of food intake in the steroid - treated groups
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
( - 50 and - 79 % in M and T , respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
This was associated with a similar loss in body weight .
O O O O O O O O O O O
In the 45 remaining animals , diaphragm contractility and histopathologic features of several muscles were studied .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Weights of respiratory and peripheral muscles were similarly decreased after steroid treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Maximal twitches of the diaphragm were lower in the C group ( 653 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
174 g / cm ( 2 ) ) than in the M group ( 837 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
171 g / cm ( 2 ) ; p < 0 . 05 ) and the T group ( 765 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
145 g / cm ( 2 ) , NS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Half - relaxation time was prolonged in both steroid groups , and time to peak tension was longer with M , whereas tetanic tensions were similar .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Steroid treatment also induced a leftward shift of the force - frequency curve at 25 and 50 Hz when compared with saline treatment ( p < 0 . 05 )
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
ATPase staining of the diaphragm , scalenus medius , and gastrocnemius showed type IIb fiber atrophy in the steroid groups and also diaphragmatic type IIa
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
atrophy with T , whereas histologic examinations revealed a normal muscular pattern with absence of necrosis .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Finally , a pair - fed ( PF ) study , performed in 18 rats ( C , T , and PF ) , showed that muscle atrophy was considerably
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
less pronounced in PF animals than in T - treated animals .
O O O O O O O B O O O O
We conclude that ( 1 ) short - term treatment with massive doses of steroids induced severe respiratory and limb muscle wasting ; ( 2 ) both types of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
steroids induced predominantly type IIb atrophy , resulting in the expected alterations in diaphragm contractile properties ; ( 3 ) neither steroid caused muscle necrosis ; ( 4 ) type
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
IIb atrophy was not caused by acute nutritional deprivation alone .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Refractory cardiogenic shock and complete heart block after verapamil SR and metoprolol treatment .
O O O O O O O O B O O B O O
A case report .
O O O O
A seventy - eight - year - old woman presented with complete heart block and refractory hypotension two days after a therapeutic dose of sustained - release verapamil with concomitant
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
use of metoprolol .
O O B O
The patient continued to remain hypotensive with complete heart block , even with multiple uses of intravenous atropine as well as high doses of pressor agents such as dopamine and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
dobutamine .
B O
However , shortly after the use of intravenous calcium chloride , the refractory hypotension and complete heart block resolved .
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
A phase I clinical study of the antipurine antifolate lometrexol ( DDATHF ) given with oral folic acid .
O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O B I O
Lometrexol is an antifolate which inhibits glycinamide ribonucleotide formyltransferase ( GARFT ) , an enzyme essential for de novo purine synthesis .
B O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Extensive experimental and limited clinical data have shown that lometrexol has activity against tumours which are refractory to other drugs , notably methotrexate .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
However , the initial clinical development of lometrexol was curtailed because of severe and cumulative antiproliferative toxicities .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Preclinical murine studies demonstrated that the toxicity of lometrexol can be prevented by low dose folic acid administration , i . e . for 7 days prior to and 7
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
days following a single bolus dose .
O O O O O O O
This observation prompted a Phase I clinical study of lometrexol given with folic acid supplementation which has confirmed that the toxicity of lometrexol can be markedly reduced by
O O O O O O O O O B O O B I O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
folic acid supplementation .
B I O O
Thrombocytopenia and mucositis were the major toxicities .
O O O O O O O O
There was no clear relationship between clinical toxicity and the extent of plasma folate elevation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Associated studies demonstrated that lometrexol plasma pharmacokinetics were not altered by folic acid administration indicating that supplementation is unlikely to reduce toxicity by enhancing lometrexol plasma clearance .
O O O O B O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
The work described in this report has identified for the first time a clinically acceptable schedule for the administration of a GARFT inhibitor .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This information will facilitate the future evaluation of this class of compounds in cancer therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Involvement of the mu - opiate receptor in peripheral analgesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The intradermal injection of mu ( morphine , Tyr - D - Ala - Gly - NMe - Phe - Gly - ol and morphiceptin ) , kappa (
O O O O O O B O B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O B O O O O
trans - 3 , 4 - dichloro - N - methyl - N [ 2 - ( 1 - pyrrolidinyl ) cyclohexyl ] benzeneactemide ) and delta (
B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O
[ D - Pen2 . 5 ] - enkephalin and [ D - Ser2 ] - [ Leu ] enkephalin - Thr ) selective opioid - agonists , by themselves
B I I I I I I I I O B I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O O O O O
, did not significantly affect the mechanical nociceptive threshold in the hindpaw of the rat .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intradermal injection of mu , but not delta or kappa opioid - agonists , however , produced dose - dependent inhibition of prostaglandin E2 - induced hyperalgesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
The analgesic effect of the mu - agonist morphine was dose - dependently antagonized by naloxone and prevented by co - injection of pertussis toxin .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Morphine did not , however , alter the hyperalgesia induced by 8 - bromo cyclic adenosine monophosphate .
B O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I O
We conclude that the analgesic action of opioids on the peripheral terminals of primary afferents is via a binding site with characteristics of the mu - opioid receptor and that
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
this action is mediated by inhibition of the cyclic adenosine monophosphate second messenger system .
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O
Adequate timing of ribavirin reduction in patients with hemolysis during combination therapy of interferon and ribavirin for chronic hepatitis C . BACKGROUND : Hemolytic anemia is one of the major
O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
adverse events of the combination therapy of interferon and ribavirin .
O O O O O O O B O B O
Because of ribavirin - related hemolytic anemia , dose reduction is a common event in this therapy .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this clinical retrospective cohort study we have examined the suitable timing of ribavirin reduction in patients with hemolysis during combination therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Thirty - seven of 160 patients who had HCV - genotype 1b , had high virus load , and received 24 - week combination therapy developed anemia with hemoglobin level
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
< 10 g / dl or anemia - related signs during therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After that , these 37 patients were reduced one tablet of ribavirin ( 200 mg ) per day .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
After reduction of ribavirin , 27 of 37 patients could continue combination therapy for a total of 24 weeks ( group A ) .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , 10 of 37 patients with reduction of ribavirin could not continue combination therapy because their < 8 . 5 g / dl hemoglobin values decreased to or anemia
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- related severe side effects occurred ( group B ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
We assessed the final efficacy and safety after reduction of ribavirin in groups A and B . RESULTS :
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
A sustained virological response ( SVR ) was 29 . 6 % ( 8 / 27 ) in group A and 10 % ( 1 / 10 ) in group
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
B , respectively .
O O O O
A 34 . 4 % ( 12 / 27 ) of SVR + biological response in group A was higher than 10 % ( 1 / 10 ) in group
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
B ( P = 0 . 051 ) , with slight significance .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
With respect to hemoglobin level at the time of ribavirin reduction , a rate of continuation of therapy in patients with > or = 10 g / dl hemoglobin was
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
higher than that in patients with < 10 g / dl ( P = 0 . 036 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS : Reduction of ribavirin at hemoglobin level > or = 10 g / dl
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
is suitable in terms of efficacy and side effects .
O O O O O O O O O O
Increased expression and apical targeting of renal ENaC subunits in puromycin aminonucleoside - induced nephrotic syndrome in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
Nephrotic syndrome is often accompanied by sodium retention and generalized edema .
O O O O O O B O O O O O
However , the molecular basis for the decreased renal sodium excretion remains undefined .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
We hypothesized that epithelial Na channel ( ENaC ) subunit dysregulation may be responsible for the increased sodium retention .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
An experimental group of rats was treated with puromycin aminonucleoside ( PAN ; 180 mg / kg iv ) , whereas the control group received only vehicle .
O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After 7 days , PAN treatment induced significant proteinuria , hypoalbuminemia , decreased urinary sodium excretion , and extensive ascites .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The protein abundance of alpha - ENaC and beta - ENaC was increased in the inner stripe of the outer medulla ( ISOM ) and in the inner medulla (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
IM ) but was not altered in the cortex .
O O O O O O O O O O
gamma - ENaC abundance was increased in the cortex , ISOM , and IM .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Immunoperoxidase brightfield - and laser - scanning confocal fluorescence
O O O O O O O O O
microscopy demonstrated increased targeting of alpha - ENaC , beta - ENaC , and gamma - ENaC subunits to the apical plasma membrane in the distal convoluted tubule ( DCT2
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) , connecting tubule , and cortical and medullary collecting duct segments .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Immunoelectron microscopy further revealed an increased labeling of alpha - ENaC in the apical plasma membrane of cortical collecting duct principal cells of PAN - treated rats , indicating enhanced
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
apical targeting of alpha - ENaC subunits .
O O O O O O O O
In contrast , the protein abundances of Na ( + ) / H ( + ) exchanger type 3 ( NHE3 ) , Na ( + ) - K (
O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O
+ ) - 2Cl ( - ) cotransporter ( BSC - 1 ) , and thiazide - sensitive Na ( + ) - Cl ( - ) cotransporter ( TSC
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O B O O O O O O
) were decreased .
O O O O
Moreover , the abundance of the alpha ( 1 ) - subunit of the Na - K - ATPase was decreased in the cortex and ISOM , but it remained
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
unchanged in the IM .
O O O O O
In conclusion , the increased or sustained expression of ENaC subunits combined with increased apical targeting in the DCT2 , connecting tubule , and collecting duct are likely to play
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a role in the sodium retention associated with PAN - induced nephrotic syndrome .
O O O O B O O O B O O O O O
The decreased abundance of NHE3 , BSC - 1 , TSC , and Na - K - ATPase may play a compensatory role to promote sodium excretion .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O B O O
Does hormone therapy for the treatment of breast cancer have a detrimental effect on memory and cognition ?
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A pilot study .
O O O O
This pilot study examines whether hormone therapy for breast cancer affects cognition .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients participating in a randomised trial of anastrozole , tamoxifen alone or combined ( ATAC ) ( n = 94 ) and a group of women without breast cancer (
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
n = 35 ) completed a battery of neuropsychological measures .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Compared with the control group , the patients were impaired on a processing speed task ( p = 0 . 032 ) and on a measure of immediate verbal memory
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( p = 0 . 026 ) after controlling for the use of hormone replacement therapy in both groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Patient group performance was not significantly related to length of treatment or measures of psychological morbidity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results showed specific impairments in processing speed and verbal memory in women receiving hormonal therapy for the treatment of breast cancer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Verbal memory may be especially sensitive to changes in oestrogen levels , a finding commonly reported in studies of hormone replacement therapy in healthy women .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In view of the increased use of hormone therapies in an adjuvant and preventative setting their impact on cognitive functioning should be investigated more thoroughly .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Association of nitric oxide production and apoptosis in a model of experimental nephropathy .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : In recent studies increased amounts of nitric oxide ( NO ) and apoptosis have been implicated in various pathological conditions in the kidney .
O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We have studied the role of NO and its association with apoptosis in an experimental model of nephrotic syndrome induced by a single injection of adriamycin ( ADR ) .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
METHODS :
O O
The alteration in the NO pathway was assessed by measuring nitrite levels in serum / urine and by evaluating the changes in vascular reactivity of the isolated perfused rat kidney
O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( IPRK ) system .
O O O O O
Rats were stratified into control groups and ADR - induced nephropathy groups .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
These two groups were then divided into : group 1 , animals receiving saline ; and group 2 , animals receiving aminoguanidine ( AG ) which is a specific inhibitor
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
of inducible - NO synthase .
O O O B O O
On day 21 , rats were sacrificed after obtaining material for biochemical analysis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Histopathological examination of the kidneys of rats treated with ADR revealed focal areas of mesangial proliferation and mild tubulointerstitial inflammation .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
They also had significantly higher levels of proteinuria compared with control and treatment groups ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urine nitrite levels were significantly increased in the ADR - nephropathy group ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In the IPRK phenylephrine and acetylcholine related responses were significantly impaired in the ADR - nephropathy group .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O B O O O O
Apoptosis was not detected in controls .
O O O O O O O
However , in the ADR - nephropathy group , numerous apoptotic cells were identified in the tubulointerstitial areas .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Double staining revealed numerous interstitial apoptotic cells to stain for ED1 , a marker for monocytes / macrophages .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Treatment with AG prevented the impairment of renal vascular bed responses and reduced both urine nitrite levels and apoptosis to control levels .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
We suggest that interactions between NO and apoptosis are important in the pathogenesis of the ADR - induced nephrosis .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The attenuating effect of carteolol hydrochloride , a beta - adrenoceptor antagonist , on neuroleptic - induced catalepsy in rats .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is known that beta - adrenoceptor antagonists are effective in the treatment of akathisia , one of the extrapyramidal side effects that occur during neuroleptic treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neuroleptic - induced catalepsy , a model of neuroleptic - induced extrapyramidal side effects , was considered suitable as a model for predicting neuroleptic - induced akathisia in humans ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
although neuroleptic - induced catalepsy was not considered a specific test for neuroleptic - induced akathisia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therefore , the effects of carteolol , a beta - adrenoceptor antagonist , on haloperidol - induced catalepsy in rats were behaviorally studied and compared with those of propranolol and
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
biperiden , a muscarinic receptor antagonist .
B O O O O O O
Carteolol , as well as propranolol and biperiden , inhibited the haloperidol - induced catalepsy .
B O O O O B O B O O O B O O O O
The inhibitory effect of carteolol was almost comparable to that of propranolol , but was weaker than that of biperiden .
O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O
Carteolol did not evoke postsynaptic dopamine receptor - stimulating behavioral signs such as stereotypy and hyperlocomotion in rats .
B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Carteolol did not antagonize the inhibitory effects of haloperidol on apomorphine - induced stereotypy and locomotor activity in rats .
B O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
In addition , carteolol did not evoke 5 - HT1A receptor - stimulating behavioral signs such as flat body posture and forepaw treading and did not inhibit
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 - hydroxytryptophan - induced head twitch in rats .
B I I O O O O O O O
Finally , carteolol did not inhibit physostigmine - induced lethality in rats .
O O B O O O B O O O O O O
These results strongly suggest that carteolol improves haloperidol - induced catalepsy via its beta - adrenoceptor antagonistic activity and is expected to be effective in the treatment of akathisia without
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
attenuating neuroleptic - induced antipsychotic effects due to its postsynaptic dopamine receptor antagonistic activity .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Penicillamine - induced rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis in a patient with rheumatoid arthritis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
A 67 - year - old woman with rheumatoid arthritis presented rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis ( RPGN ) after 5 months of D - penicillamine ( 250 mg / day )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O
treatment .
O O
Light microscopy study showed severe glomerulonephritis with crescent formation in 60 % of the glomeruli and infiltration of inflammatory cells in the wall of an arteriole .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Immunofluorescence revealed scanty granular IgG , IgA and C3 deposits along the capillary walls and mesangium .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient was treated with steroid pulse , plasmapheresis , cyclophosphamide and antiplatelet agents .
O O O O O B O O O O B O B I O
A complete recovery of renal function was achieved in a few weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This new case of RPGN in the course of D - penicillamine treatment emphasizes the need for frequent monitoring of renal function and evaluation of urinary sediment and proteinuria in
O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
these patients .
O O O
The prompt discontinuation of D - penicillamine and vigorous treatment measures could allow for a good prognosis as in this case .
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nature , time course and dose dependence of zidovudine - related side effects : results from the Multicenter Canadian Azidothymidine Trial .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
To characterize the nature , time course and dose dependency of zidovudine - related side effects , we undertook a multicenter , prospective , dose - range finding study .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our study group consisted of 74 HIV - positive homosexual men belonging to groups II B , III and IV C2 from the Centers for Disease Control ( CDC )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
classification of HIV disease .
O O O O O
Following a 3 - week observation period , volunteers were treated with zidovudine 600 mg / day for 18 weeks , 900 mg / day for 9 weeks and 1200
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mg / day for 9 weeks , followed by a washout period of 6 weeks after which they were re - started on 1200 mg / day or the highest
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
tolerated dose at 8 - hourly intervals .
O O O O O O O O
Subjects were randomly assigned to 4 - hourly or 8 - hourly regimens within CDC groups while taking 600 and 1200 mg / day .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinical and laboratory evaluations were performed at 3 - week intervals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Symptomatic adverse effects were present in 96 % of subjects , most commonly nausea ( 64 % ) , fatigue ( 55 % ) and headache ( 49 % )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
These were generally self - limited , reappearing briefly at each dose increment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A decrease in hemoglobin occurred shortly after initiation of therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O
This was not dose dependent and reversed rapidly upon discontinuation of treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A red blood cell count decrease , a mean cell volume increase and a granulocyte count decrease developed early in a dose - independent fashion , reverting at least partially
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
during the washout phase .
O O O O O
The decrease in reticulocyte count was dose related between 600 and 900 mg / day with no further change when the dose was escalated to 1200 mg / day .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bone marrow changes occurred rapidly as demonstrated by megaloblastosis in 95 % of 65 specimens at week 18 . ( ABSTRACT

TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS )

Bilateral optic neuropathy due to combined ethambutol and isoniazid treatment .
O O O O O O B O B O O
The case of a 40 - year - old patient who underwent an unsuccessful cadaver kidney transplantation and was treated with ethambutol and isoniazid is reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
A bilateral retrobulbar neuropathy with an unusual central bitemporal hemianopic scotoma was found .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ethambutol was stopped and only small improvement of the visual acuity followed .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Isoniazid was discontinued later , followed by a dramatic improvement in the visual acuity .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The hazards of optic nerve toxicity due to ethambutol are known .
O O O O O O O O B O O O
We emphasize the potential danger in the use of ethambutol and isoniazid .
