Progestational agents and blood coagulation .
O O O O O O
VII .
O O
Thromboembolic and other complications of oral contraceptive therapy in relationship to pretreatment levels of blood coagulation factors : summary report of a ten - year study .
O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
During a ten - year period , 348 women were studied for a total of 5 , 877 patient months in four separate studies relating oral contraceptives to changes in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O
hematologic parameters .
O O O
Significant increases in certain factors of the blood coagulation and fibrinolysin systems ( factors I , II , VII , VIII , IX , and X and plasminogen ) were
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
observed in the treated groups .
O O O O O O
Severe complications developed in four patients .
O O O O O O O
All four had an abnormal blood coagulation profile , suggesting """" hypercoagulability """" before initiation of therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Some of these findings represented the most extreme abnormalities seen in the entire group of patients ; some increased further during therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One of these patients developed a myocardial infarction before receiving any medication , shortly after the base - line values were obtained .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One patient developed retinopathy 19 months after she began therapy , and another developed thrombophlebitis after 27 months of therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The fourth patient developed thrombophlebitis 14 days after initiation of contraceptive therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All four patients were of the A or AB blood group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Previous studies suggested the possiblility of increased propensity for thromboembolic episodes in patients possessing the A antigen .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It appears from these data that hematologic work - ups may be useful in women who are about to start long - term oral contraceptive therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O
Cardiac arrest in a child with cerebral palsy undergoing sevoflurane induction of anesthesia after preoperative clonidine .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O
Clonidine is a frequently administered alpha2 - adrenergic agonist which can decrease heart rate and blood pressure .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We present a case of a 5 - year - old child with cerebral palsy and seizure disorder , receiving clonidine for restlessness , who presented for placement of a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
baclofen pump .
B O O
Without the knowledge of the medical personnel , the patient 's mother administered three doses of clonidine during the evening before and morning of surgery to reduce anxiety .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
During induction of anesthesia , the patient developed bradycardia and hypotension requiring cardiac resuscitation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There are no previous reports of clonidine - associated cardiac arrest in a child undergoing induction of anesthesia .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effects of UMB24 and ( + / - ) - SM 21 , putative sigma2 - preferring antagonists , on behavioral toxic and stimulant effects of cocaine in mice .
O O B O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Earlier studies have demonstrated that antagonism of sigma1 receptors attenuates the convulsive , lethal , locomotor stimulatory and rewarding actions of cocaine in mice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
In contrast , the contribution of sigma2 receptors is unclear because experimental tools to selectively target this subtype are unavailable .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To begin addressing this need , we characterized UMB24 ( 1 - ( 2 - phenethyl ) - 4 - ( 2 - pyridyl ) - piperazine ) and (
O O O O O O O O B O B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O O O
+ / - ) - SM 21 ( 3alpha - tropanyl - 2 - ( 4 - chorophenoxy ) butyrate ) in receptor binding and behavioral studies .
O O O O O B I O B I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O O O O O
Receptor binding studies confirmed that UMB24 and ( + / - ) - SM 21 display preferential affinity for sigma2 over sigma1 receptors .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O
In behavioral studies , pretreatment of Swiss Webster mice with UMB24 or ( + / - ) - SM 21 significantly attenuated cocaine - induced convulsions and locomotor activity ,
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B I O O B O O O O O O O
but not lethality .
O O O O
When administered alone , ( + / - ) - SM 21 produced no significant effects compared to control injections of saline , but UMB24 had locomotor depressant actions .
O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Together , the data suggest that sigma2 receptor antagonists have the potential to attenuate some of the behavioral effects of cocaine , and further development of more selective , high
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
affinity ligands are warranted .
O O O O O
Methimazole - induced cholestatic jaundice .
B O O O O O
Methimazole is a widely used and generally well - tolerated antithyroid agent .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
A 43 - year - old woman had severe jaundice and itching 1 month after receiving methimazole ( 10 mg tid ) and propranolol ( 20 mg tid ) for
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O
treatment of hyperthyroidism .
O O O O
The patient continued treatment for another 4 days after the appearance of jaundice until she finished both medications .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When seen at the emergency department 2 weeks later , she still had severe icterus , pruritus , and hyperbilirubinemia , formed mainly of the conjugated fraction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Methimazole - induced cholestasis was diagnosed , and propranolol therapy was resumed .
B O O O O O O O B O O O O
Over the following 9 days , the symptoms improved and plasma bilirubin levels were normal after 12 weeks without methimazole .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O
In rare cases within the first few weeks of therapy , this drug can cause severe and reversible cholestatic jaundice .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Physicians and patients should be aware of this adverse effect so that , upon occurrence , they can discontinue methimazole therapy and avoid unnecessary invasive procedures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Ciprofloxacin - induced acute interstitial nephritis and autoimmune hemolytic anemia .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Ciprofloxacin has been associated with several side effects including interstitial nephritis and hemolytic anemia .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The combination of both side effects is extremely rare .
O O O O O O O O O O
In this report , we describe a case of ciprofloxacin - induced interstitial nephritis and autoimmune hemolytic anemia .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Hemolytic anemia improved after stopping the drug and initiation of steroid therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Unfortunately , acute interstitial nephritis was irreversible and the patient developed end - stage renal disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Contribution of sodium valproate to the syndrome of inappropriate secretion of antidiuretic hormone .
O O B I O O O O O O O O O O
We report the case of a 62 - year - old man who was administered sodium valproate ( VPA ) and who subsequently developed the syndrome of inappropriate secretion of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O
antidiuretic hormone ( SIADH ) .
O O O O O O
He had been taking VPA for treatment of idiopathic generalized tonic - clonic convulsions since he was 56 years old .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After substituting VPA with zonisamide , the serum sodium level returned to normal .
O O B O B O O O B O O O O O
We consider this episode of SIADH to be the result of a combination of factors including a weakness of the central nervous system and the long - term administration of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
VPA .
B O
Vasopressin in the treatment of milrinone - induced hypotension in severe heart failure .
B O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The use of phosphodiesterase inhibitors such as milrinone in the treatment of severe heart failure is frequently restricted because they cause vasodilation and hypotension .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In patients with decompensated heart failure with hypotension after treatment with milrinone , low doses of vasopressin restored blood pressure without inhibiting the inotropic effect of milrinone .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O
Halogenated anesthetics form liver adducts and antigens that cross - react with halothane - induced antibodies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Two halogenated anesthetics , enflurane and isoflurane , have been associated with an allergic - type hepatic injury both alone and following previous exposure to halothane .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Halothane hepatitis appears to involve an aberrant immune response .
B O O O O O O O O O
An antibody response to a protein - bound biotransformation product ( trifluoroacetyl adduct ) has been detected on halothane hepatitis patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O
This study was performed to determine cross - reactivity between enflurane and isoflurane with the hypersensitivity induced by halothane .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O B O
The subcellular and lobular production of hepatic neoantigens recognized by halothane - induced antibodies following enflurane and isoflurane , and the biochemical nature of these neoantigens was investigated in two
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
animal models .
O O O
Enflurane administration resulted in neoantigens detected in both the microsomal and cytosolic fraction of liver homogenates and in the centrilobular region of the liver .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the same liver , biochemical analysis detected fluorinated liver adducts that were up to 20 - fold greater in guinea pigs than in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This supports and extends previous evidence for a mechanism by which enflurane and / or isoflurane could produce a hypersensitivity condition similar to that of halothane hepatitis either alone or
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
subsequent to halothane administration .
O O B O O
The guinea pig would appear to be a useful model for further investigations of the immunological response to these antigens .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Induction by paracetamol of bladder and liver tumours in the rat .
O O B O O O O O O O O O
Effects on hepatocyte fine structure .
O O O O O O
Groups of male and female inbred Leeds strain rats were fed diets containing either 0 . 5 % or 1 . 0 % paracetamol by weight for up to 18
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
months .
O O
At the 1 . 0 % dosage level , 20 % of rats of both sexes developed neoplastic nodules of the liver , a statistically significant incidence .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These rats also showed gross enlargement of their livers and an increase in foci of cellular alteration , the latter also being observed in the low dosage male rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Papillomas of the transitional epithelium of the bladder developed in all paracetamol - treated groups , and three rats bore bladder carcinomas .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
However , significant yields of bladder tumours were only obtained from low dosage females and high dosage males .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Additionally , 20 to 25 % of paracetamol - treated rats developed hyperplasia of the bladder epithelium , which was not coincident with the presence of bladder calculi .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A low yield of tumours at various other sites also arose following paracetamol feeding .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
An electron microscope study of the livers of paracetamol - treated rats revealed ultrastructural changes in the hepatocytes that resemble those that result from exposure to a variety of known
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
hepatocarcinogens .
O O
Rat extraocular muscle regeneration .
O O O O O
Repair of local anesthetic - induced damage .
O O O O O O O O
Local anesthetics that are commonly used in ophthalmic surgery ( 0 . 75 % bupivacaine hydrochloride , 2 . 0 % mepivacaine hydrochloride , and 2 . 0 %
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O B I O O O O O O
lidocaine hydrochloride plus 1 : 100 , 000 epinephrine ) were injected into the retrobulbar area of rat eyes .
B I O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Controls were injected with physiological saline .
O O O O O O O
All three anesthetics produced massive degeneration of the extraocular muscles .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Muscle degeneration is followed by regeneration of the damaged muscle fibers .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition to muscle damage , severe damage was also seen in harderian glands , especially after exposure to mepivacaine and lidocaine plus epinephrine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O
With these findings in rats , it is hypothesized that the temporary diplopia sometimes seen in patients after ophthalmic surgery might be due to anesthetic - induced damage to the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
extraocular muscles .
O O O
Reversal of neuroleptic - induced catalepsy by novel aryl - piperazine anxiolytic drugs .
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O
The novel anxiolytic drug , buspirone , reverses catalepsy induced by haloperidol .
O O O O O B O O O O O B O
A series of aryl - piperazine analogues of buspirone and other 5 - hydroxytryptaminergic agonists were tested for their ability to reverse haloperidol induced catalepsy .
O O O B I I O O B O O B I I I O O O O O O O B O O O
Those drugs with strong affinity for 5 - hydroxytryptamine1a receptors were able to reverse catalepsy .
O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
Drugs with affinity for other 5 - HT receptors or weak affinity were ineffective .
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O
However , inhibition of postsynaptic 5 - HT receptors neither inhibited nor potentiated reversal of catalepsy and leaves open the question as to the site or mechanism for this effect
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Diazepam facilitates reflex bradycardia in conscious rats .
B O O O O O O O
The effects of diazepam on cardiovascular function were assessed in conscious rats .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Intravenous administration of diazepam ( 1 - 30 mg kg - 1 ) produced a dose - dependent decrease in both the mean arterial pressure and the heart rate .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Also , reflex bradycardia was produced in rats by intravenous infusion of adrenaline ( 1 . 25 - 2 . 5 micrograms kg - 1 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intravenous pretreatment of the rats with diazepam , although causing no change in the adrenaline - induced pressor effect , did enhance the adrenaline - induced reflex bradycardia .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
However , the diazepam enhancement of adrenaline - induced reflex bradycardia was antagonized by pretreatment of rats with an intravenous dose of picrotoxin ( an agent blocks chloride channels by
O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O
binding to sites associated with the benzodiazepine - GABA - chloride channel macromolecular complex ) .
O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O
The data indicate that diazepam acts through the benzodiazepine - GABA - chloride channel macromolecular complex within the central nervous system to facilitate reflex bradycardia mediated through baroreceptor reflexes in
O O O O B O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
response to an acute increase in arterial pressure .
O O O O O O O O O
Chronic carbamazepine inhibits the development of local anesthetic seizures kindled by cocaine and lidocaine .
O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O
The effects of carbamazepine ( CBZ ) treatment on local anesthetic - kindled seizures and lethality were evaluated in different stages of the kindling process and under different methods of
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CBZ administration .
B O O
Chronic oral CBZ inhibited the development of both lidocaine - and cocaine - induced seizures , but had little effect on the fully developed local anesthetic seizures .
O O B O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Chronic CBZ also decreased the incidence of seizure - related mortality in the cocaine - injected rats .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Acute CBZ over a range of doses ( 15 - 50 mg / kg ) had no effect on completed lidocaine - kindled or acute cocaine - induced seizures .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O
Repeated i . p .
O O O O O
injection of CBZ ( 15 mg / kg ) also was without effect on the development of lidocaine - or cocaine - kindled seizures .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O
The differential effects of CBZ depending upon stage of seizure development suggest that distinct mechanisms underlie the development versus maintenance of local anesthetic - kindled seizures .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effectiveness of chronic but not repeated , intermittent injections of CBZ suggests that different biochemical consequences result from the different treatment regimens .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
The possible utility of chronic CBZ in preventing the development of toxic side effects in human cocaine users is suggested by these data , but remains to be directly evaluated
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
D - penicillamine in the treatment of localized scleroderma .
B I I O O O O O O O
Localized scleroderma has no recognized internal organ involvement but may be disfiguring and disabling when the cutaneous lesions are extensive or affect children .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There is no accepted or proven treatment for localized scleroderma .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Case reports of 11 patients with severe , extensive localized scleroderma who were treated with D - penicillamine are summarized in this article .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O
This drug was judged to have a favorable effect on the disease course in 7 ( 64 % ) of 11 patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Improvement began within 3 to 6 months and consisted of cessation of active cutaneous lesions in all 7 patients , skin softening in 5 , and more normal growth of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the affected limb in 2 of 3 children .
O O O O O O O O O
Joint stiffness and contractures also improved .
O O O O O O O
The dose of D - penicillamine associated with a favorable response was as low as 2 to 5 mg / kg per day given over a period ranging from 15
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to 53 months .
O O O O
D - Penicillamine caused nephrotic syndrome in 1 patient and milder reversible proteinuria in 3 other patients ; none developed renal insufficiency .
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These data suggest that D - penicillamine may be effective in severe cases of localized scleroderma .
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
Preservation of renal blood flow during hypotension induced with fenoldopam in dogs .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O
The introduction of drugs that could induce hypotension with different pharmacological actions would be advantageous because side effects unique to a specific drug could be minimized by selecting appropriate therapy
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Specific dopamine - 1 , ( DA1 ) and dopamine - 2 ( DA2 ) receptor agonists are now under clinical investigation .
O B O O O O B O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Fenoldopam mesylate is a specific DA1 receptor agonist that lowers blood pressure by vasodilatation .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The hypothesis that fenoldopam could be used to induce hypotension and preserve blood flow to the kidney was tested .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Systemic aortic blood pressure and renal blood flow were measured continuously with a carotid arterial catheter and an electromagnetic flow probe respectively , in order to compare the cardiovascular and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
renal vascular effects of fenoldopam and sodium nitroprusside in ten dogs under halothane general anaesthesia .
O O O O B O B B O O O O B O O O
Mean arterial pressure was decreased 30 + / -
O O O O O O O O O
8 per cent from control with infusion of fenoldopam ( 3 . 4 + / - 2 . 0 micrograms . kg - 1 . min - 1 ) and
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
34 + / - 4 per cent with infusion of sodium nitroprusside ( 5 . 9 micrograms . kg - 1 . min - 1 ) ( NS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O B B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Renal blood flow ( RBF ) increased during fenoldopam - induced hypotension 11 + / -
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
7 per cent and decreased 21 + / -
O O O O O O O O O
8 per cent during sodium nitroprusside - induced hypotension ( P less than 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O B B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sodium nitroprusside is a non - selective arteriolar and venous vasodilator that can produce redistribution of blood flow away from the kidney during induced hypotension .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fenoldopam is a selective dopamine - 1 ( DA1 ) receptor agonist that causes vasodilatation to the kidney and other organs with DA1 receptors and preserves blood flow to the
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
kidney during induced hypotension .
O O O O O
Antiarrhythmic effects of optical isomers of cibenzoline on canine ventricular arrhythmias .
O O O O O O B O O O O O
Antiarrhythmic effects of ( + ) - cibenzoline
O O O O O O O B
and ( - ) - cibenzoline were examined using two canine ventricular arrhythmia models .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Digitalis arrhythmia , which is suppressed by Na channel blockers , was induced by intermittent intravenous ( i . v . )
B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
injection of ouabain in pentobarbital - anesthetized dogs .
O O B O B O O O O
Adrenaline arrhythmia , which is suppressed by Ca channel blockers , was induced by adrenaline infusion in halothane - anesthetized dogs .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O B O O O O
Ten and 5 mg / kg i . v .
O O O O O O O O O O
( + ) - cibenzoline suppressed digitalis - and adrenaline - induced arrhythmias , respectively .
O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O
The minimum effective plasma concentrations of ( + ) - cibenzoline for digitalis - and adrenaline - induced arrhythmias were 1 . 4 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 4 and 2 . 0 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 6 micrograms / ml , respectively ( mean + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
SD , n = 6 ) .
O O O O O O O
A lower dose of 1 mg / kg i . v .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
of ( - ) - cibenzoline suppressed the digitalis - induced arrhythmia , whereas 5 mg / kg i . v . was needed to suppress adrenaline - induced arrhythmias
O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
.
O
The minimum effective plasma concentrations of ( - ) - cibenzoline for digitalis - and adrenaline - induced arrhythmia were 0 . 06 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 04 and 0 . 7 + / - 0 . 1 micrograms / ml , respectively ( mean + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
SD , n = 6 ) .
O O O O O O O
The stronger antiarrhythmic effect of ( - ) - cibenzoline indicates that ( - ) - isomer may have an effect nearly 5 - 20 times stronger in suppressing
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Na channels , but effects of both drugs on Ca channels may be almost equipotent .
B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Effect of Hibiscus rosa sinensis on reserpine - induced neurobehavioral and biochemical alterations in rats .
O O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O
Effect of methanolic extract of Hibiscus rosa sinensis ( 100 - 300 mg / kg ) was studied on reserpine - induced orofacial dyskinesia and neurochemical alterations .
O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The rats were treated with intraperitoneal reserpine ( 1 mg / kg , ip ) for 3 days every other day .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On day 5 , vacuous chewing movements and tongue protrusions were counted for 5 min .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reserpine treated rats significantly developed vacuous chewing movements and tongue protrusions however , coadministration of Hibiscus rosa sinensis roots extract ( 100 , 200 and 300 mg / kg ,
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O
per orally ) attenuated the effects .
O O O O O O O
Biochemical analysis of brain revealed that the reserpine treatment significantly increased lipid peroxidation and decreased levels of superoxide dismutase ( SOD ) , catalase ( CAT ) and glutathione reductase
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
( GSH ) , an index of oxidative stress process .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Coadministration of extract significantly reduced the lipid peroxidation and reversed the decrease in brain SOD , CAT and GSH levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results of the present study suggested that Hibiscus rosa sinensis had a protective role against reserpine - induced orofacial dyskinesia and oxidative stress .
O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Comparison of aqueous and gellan ophthalmic timolol with placebo on the 24 - hour heart rate response in patients on treatment for glaucoma .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
Topical beta - blocker treatment is routine therapy in the management of patients with glaucoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Therapy results in systemic absorption , however , the degree of reduction of resting and peak heart rate has not been quantified .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DESIGN :
O O
This trial evaluated the effect of placebo , 0 . 5 % aqueous timolol ( timolol solution ) and a 0 . 5 % timolol suspension that forms a gel
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
on application to the conjunctiva ( timolol gellan ) on the 24 - hour heart rate in patients currently being treated for glaucoma to quantify the reduction in mean heart
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rate .
O O
METHODS :
O O
Forty - three Caucasian patients with primary open - angle glaucoma or ocular hypertension with a mean ( + / - SD ) age of 63 ( + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
8 ) years were randomized and crossed over in a double - masked manner to 14 days of treatment with placebo ( morning and evening in both eyes ) ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
timolol solution ( morning and evening in both eyes ) , or timolol gellan ( morning in both eyes with placebo in the evening ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On the 13th day of each period , heart rate was recorded continuously during a typical , ambulant 24 - hour period .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Both timolol solution and timolol gellan reduced the mean 24 - hour heart rate compared with placebo ( P < or = . 001 ) , and this reduction was
O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
most pronounced during the daytime ( - 7 . 5 % change in mean heart rate , - 5 . 7 beats / min ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Timolol gellan showed a numerically but not significantly smaller reduction in 24 - hour heart rate , compared with timolol solution .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
During the night , the mean 12 - hour heart rate on placebo and timolol gellan were both significantly less than on timolol solution ; the difference between solution and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
gellan treatments was statistically significant ( P = . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Both timolol solution and timolol gellan decrease the mean 24 - hour heart rate compared with placebo .
O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This response was most pronounced during the active daytime period .
O O O O O O O O O O O
These data quantify the modest bradycardia associated with ophthalmic beta - blocker therapy in a typical patient population on therapy for glaucoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although exercise performance was not assessed in this trial , reductions of this magnitude should not have substantial clinical consequences .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 flourouracil - induced apical ballooning syndrome : a case report .
B I O O O O O O O O O O
The apical ballooning syndrome ( ABS ) is a recently described stress - mediated acute cardiac syndrome characterized by transient wall - motion abnormalities involving the apex and midventricle with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
hyperkinesis of the basal left ventricular ( LV ) segments without obstructive epicardial coronary disease .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cardiotoxicity is not an uncommon adverse effect of chemotherapeutic agents .
O O O O O O O O O O O
However , there are no reports of ABS secondary to chemotherapeutic agents .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We describe the case of a woman who developed the syndrome after chemotherapy for metastatic cancer .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A 79 - year - old woman presented with typical ischemic chest pain , elevated cardiac enzymes with significant ST - segment abnormalities on her electrocardiogram .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
She underwent recent chemotherapy with fluorouracil for metastatic colorectal cancer .
O O O O O B O O O O O
Echocardiography revealed a wall - motion abnormality involving the apical and periapical segments which appeared akinetic .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Coronary angiography revealed no obstructive coronary lesions .
O O O O O O O O
The patient was stabilized with medical therapy .
O O O O O O O O
Four weeks later she remained completely asymptomatic .
O O O O O O O O
Echocardiogram revealed a normal ejection fraction and a resolution of the apical akinesis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pathogenetic mechanisms of cardiac complications in cancer patients undergoing chemotherapy include coronary vasospasm , endothelial damage and consequent thrombus formation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In our patient , both supraphysiologic levels of plasma catecholamines and stress related neuropeptides caused by cancer diagnosis as well as chemotherapy may have contributed the development of ABS .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reduction of pain during induction with target - controlled propofol and remifentanil .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Pain on injection of propofol is unpleasant .
O O O O B O O O
We hypothesized that propofol infusion pain might be prevented by infusing remifentanil before starting the propofol infusion in a clinical setting where target - controlled infusions ( TCI ) of
O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
both drugs were used .
O O O O O
A prospective , randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled trial was performed to determine the effect - site concentration ( Ce ) of remifentanil to prevent the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
pain without producing complications .
O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
A total of 128 patients undergoing general surgery were randomly allocated to receive normal saline ( control ) or remifentanil to a target
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Ce of 2 ng ml ( - 1 ) ( R2 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O
, 4 ng ml ( - 1 )
O O O O O O O O
( R4 ) , or 6 ng ml ( - 1 ) ( R6 ) administered via TCI .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After the target Ce was achieved , the infusion of propofol was started .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Remifentanil - related complications were assessed during the remifentanil infusion , and pain caused by propofol was evaluated using a four - point scale during the propofol infusion .
B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
RESULTS :
O O
The incidence of pain was significantly lower in Groups R4 and R6 than in the control and R2 groups ( 12 / 32 and 6 / 31 vs 26 /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
31 and 25 / 32 , respectively , P < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pain was less severe in Groups R4 and R6 than in the control and R2 groups ( P < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , both incidence and severity of pain were not different between Groups R4 and R6 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No significant complications were observed during the study .
O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
During induction of anaesthesia with TCI of propofol and remifentanil , a significant reduction in propofol infusion pain was achieved without significant complications by prior administration of remifentanil at a
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
target
O
Ce of 4 ng ml ( - 1 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
Prenatal exposure to fluoxetine induces fetal pulmonary hypertension in the rat .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
RATIONALE : Fluoxetine is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor antidepressant widely used by pregnant women .
O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Epidemiological data suggest that fluoxetine exposure prenatally increases the prevalence of persistent pulmonary hypertension syndrome of the newborn .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mechanism responsible for this effect is unclear and paradoxical , considering the current evidence of a pulmonary hypertension protective fluoxetine effect in adult rodents .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
To evaluate the fluoxetine effect on fetal rat pulmonary vascular smooth muscle mechanical properties and cell proliferation rate .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Pregnant rats were treated with fluoxetine ( 10 mg / kg ) from Day 11 through Day 21 of gestation .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MEASUREMENTS AND MAIN RESULTS :
O O O O O
Fetuses were delivered by cesarean section .
O O O O O O O
As compared with controls , fluoxetine exposure resulted in fetal pulmonary hypertension as evidenced by an increase in the weight ratio of the right ventricle to the left ventricle plus
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
septum ( P = 0 . 02 ) and by an increase in pulmonary arterial medial thickness ( P < 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Postnatal mortality was increased among experimental animals , and arterial oxygen saturation was 96 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
1 % in 1 - day - old control animals and significantly lower ( P < 0 . 01 ) in fluoxetine - exposed pups ( 79 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
2 % ) .
O O O O
In vitro , fluoxetine induced pulmonary arterial muscle contraction in fetal , but not adult , animals ( P < 0 . 01 ) and reduced serotonin - induced contraction
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
at both ages ( P < 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
After in utero exposure to a low fluoxetine concentration the pulmonary arterial smooth muscle cell proliferation rate was significantly increased in fetal , but not adult , cells ( P
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
< 0 . 01 ) .
O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
In contrast to the adult , fluoxetine exposure in utero induces pulmonary hypertension in the fetal rat as a result of a developmentally regulated increase in pulmonary vascular smooth muscle
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
proliferation .
O O
Syncope and QT prolongation among patients treated with methadone for heroin dependence in the city of Copenhagen .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Methadone is prescribed to heroin addicts to decrease illicit opioid use .
B O O O B O O O O O O O
Prolongation of the QT interval in the ECG of patients with torsade de pointes ( TdP ) has been reported in methadone users .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
As heroin addicts sometimes faint while using illicit drugs , doctors might attribute too many episodes of syncope to illicit drug use and thereby underestimate the incidence of TdP in
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
this special population , and the high mortality in this population may , in part , be caused by the proarrhythmic effect of methadone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
METHODS :
O O
In this cross - sectional study interview , ECGs and blood samples were collected in a population of adult heroin addicts treated with methadone or buprenorphine on a daily basis
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O B O O O O
.
O
Of the patients at the Drug Addiction Service in the municipal of Copenhagen , 450 ( approximately 52 % ) were included .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The QT interval was estimated from 12 lead ECGs .
O O O O O O O O O O
All participants were interviewed about any experience of syncope .
O O O O O O O O O O
The association between opioid dose and QT , and methadone dose and reporting of syncope was assessed using multivariate linear regression and logistic regression , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Methadone dose was associated with longer QT interval of 0 . 140 ms / mg ( p = 0 . 002 ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No association between buprenorphine and QTc was found .
O O O B O O O O O
Among the subjects treated with methadone , 28 % men and 32 % women had prolonged QTc interval .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
None of the subjects treated with buprenorphine had QTc interval > 0 . 440 s ( ( 1 / 2 ) ) .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A 50 mg higher methadone dose was associated with a 1 . 2 ( 95 % CI 1 . 1 to 1 . 4 ) times higher odds for syncope
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Methadone is associated with QT prolongation and higher reporting of syncope in a population of heroin addicts .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Peripheral neuropathy caused by high - dose cytosine arabinoside treatment in a patient with acute myeloid leukemia .
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O
The central nervous system toxicity of high - dose cytosine arabinoside is well recognized , but the toxicity of cytosine arabinoside in the peripheral nervous system has been infrequently reported
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O
.
O
A 49 - year - old Japanese man was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukemia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After he achieved complete remission , he received high - dose cytosine arabinoside treatment ( 2 g
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
/ m2 twice a day for 5 days
O O O O O O O O
; total , 20 g / m2 ) as consolidation therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The first course of high - dose cytosine arabinoside resulted in no unusual symptoms , but on day 21 of the second course of treatment , the patient complained of
O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
numbness in his right foot .
O O O O O O
Electromyogram and nerve - conduction studies showed peripheral neuropathy in both peroneal nerves .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This neuropathy was gradually resolving ; however , after the patient received allogeneic bone marrow transplantation , the symptoms worsened , with the development of graft - versus - host
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
disease , and the symptoms subsequently responded to methylprednisolone .
O O O O O O O O B O
Although the mechanisms of peripheral neuropathy are still unclear , high - dose cytosine arabinoside is a therapy that is potentially toxic to the peripheral nervous system , and auto
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
/ alloimmunity may play an important role in these mechanisms .
O O O O O O O O O O O

mg / kg / day or tap water for 15 days .

B O O O O O O O O
Thus , atorvastatin prevented and reversed dexamethasone - induced hypertension in the rat .
O O B O O O B O O O O O O O
Two prodrugs of potent and selective GluR5 kainate receptor antagonists actives in three animal models of pain .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Amino acids 5 and 7 , two potent and selective competitive GluR5 KA receptor antagonists , exhibited high GluR5 receptor affinity over other glutamate receptors .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Their ester prodrugs 6 and 8 were orally active in three models of pain : reversal of formalin - induced paw licking , carrageenan - induced thermal hyperalgesia , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O
capsaicin - induced mechanical hyperalgesia .
B O O O O O
Sirolimus and mycophenolate mofetil for calcineurin - free immunosuppression in renal transplant recipients .
B O B I O O O O O O O O O O
Calcineurin inhibitors , such as cyclosporine and tacrolimus , have been available for almost 20 years .
O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
Although these drugs are highly effective and represent the mainstay of transplant immunosuppression , they are associated with acute and chronic nephrotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute nephrotoxicity , which occurs in the early period after transplantation , leads to a higher rate of dialysis , and chronic nephrotoxicity may eventually result in graft loss .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute and chronic nephrotoxicity is becoming more common as the use of marginal kidneys for transplantation increases .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two recently available immunosuppressive agents , mycophenolate mofetil and sirolimus ( rapamycin ) , have no nephrotoxicity .
O O O O O O B I O B O B O O O O O O
The use of these drugs in combination with other agents has led to the development of new paradigms of immunosuppressive therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This paper reviews the results of clinical trials that have investigated these new approaches to immunosuppression in renal transplant recipients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Erythropoietin restores the anemia - induced reduction in cyclophosphamide cytotoxicity in rat tumors .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
The aim of this study was to examine the impact of anemia prevention by recombinant human erythropoietin ( rHuEPO ) treatment on the cytotoxicity of cyclophosphamide in solid experimental tumors
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
.
O
Anemia was induced using a single dose of carboplatin ( 50 mg / kg i . v . ) resulting in a long - lasting reduction ( 30 % )
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of the hemoglobin concentration .
O O O O O
In a second group , the development of anemia was prevented by rHuEPO ( 1000 IU / kg ) administered s . c .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
three times / week starting 7 days before carboplatin application .
O O O O O O O O B O O
Four days after carboplatin treatment , tumors ( DS - sarcoma of the rat ) were implanted s . c .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
onto the hind food dorsum .
O O O O O O
Neither carboplatin nor rHuEPO treatment influenced tumor growth rate per se .
O B O O O O O O O O O O
When tumors were treated with a single dose of cyclophosphamide ( 60 mg / kg
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
i . p . )
O O O O O
5 days after implantation , a growth delay with a subsequent regrowth of the tumors was observed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the anemia group , the growth delay was significantly shorter compared with nonanemic controls ( 13 . 3 days versus 8 . 6 days ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the group where anemia was prevented by rHuEPO treatment , growth delay was comparable with that of nonanemic controls ( 13 . 3 days ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results suggest that chemotherapy - induced anemia reduces cytotoxicity of cyclophosphamide in tumors , whereas correction of anemia by rHuEPO treatment ( epoetin alpha ) increases the sensitivity ,
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
probably as a result of an improved oxygen supply to tumor tissue .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
The role of nitrergic system in lidocaine - induced convulsion in the mouse .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The effects of N - nitro - L - arginine - methyl ester ( L - NAME ) a nitric oxide ( NO ) synthase inhibitor and
O O O B I I I I I I I I I O B I I O O B I O B O O O O
L - arginine , a NO precursor , were investigated on lidocaine - induced convulsions .
B I I O O B O O O O O B O O O O
In the first experiment , four groups of mice received physiological saline ( 0 . 9 % ) , L - arginine ( 300 mg / kg , i .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O
p . ) , L - NAME ( 100 mg / kg , i . p . ) and diazepam ( 2 mg / kg ) , respectively .
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Thirty minutes after these injections , all mice received lidocaine ( 50 mg / kg , i . p . ) .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the second experiment , four groups of mice received similar treatment in the first experiment , and 30 min after these injections , all mice received a higher dose
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of lidocaine ( 80 mg / kg ) .
O B O O O O O O O
L - NAME ( 100 mg / kg , i . p . ) and diazepam ( 2 mg / kg ) significantly decreased the incidence of lidocaine ( 50
B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
mg / kg ) - induced convulsions .
O O O O O O O O
In contrast , the L - arginine treatment increased the incidence of lidocaine ( 80 mg / kg , i . p . ) - induced convulsions significantly .
O O O O B I I O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results may suggest that NO is a proconvulsant mediator in lidocaine - induced convulsions .
O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O
Effect of intravenous metoprolol or intravenous metoprolol plus glucagon on dobutamine - induced myocardial ischemia .
O O O B O O B O O O B O O O O O
STUDY OBJECTIVE :
O O O
To determine the effect of metoprolol on dobutamine stress testing with technetium - 99 m sestamibi single - photon emission computed tomography imaging and ST - segment monitoring , and
O O O O O B O B O O O B I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to assess the impact of intravenous glucagon on metoprolol 's effects .
O O O O O O O O B O O O
DESIGN :
O O
Randomized , double - blind , placebo - controlled trial .
O O O O O O O O O O O
SETTING :
O O
Community hospital .
O O O
PATIENTS :
O O
Twenty - two patients with known reversible perfusion defects .
O O O O O O O O O O
INTERVENTION :
O O
Patients underwent dobutamine stress tests per standard protocol .
O O B O O O O O O
Before dobutamine was begun , no therapy was given during the first visit , and patients were randomized on subsequent visits to receive metoprolol or metoprolol plus glucagon 1 mg
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
.
O
Metoprolol was dosed to achieve a resting predobutamine heart rate below 65 beats / minute or a total intravenous dose of 20 mg .
B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MEASUREMENTS AND MAIN RESULTS :
O O O O O
Metoprolol reduced maximum heart rate 31 % , summed stress scores 29 % , and summed difference scores 43 % versus control .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Metoprolol plus glucagon also reduced the maximum heart rate 29 % versus control .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Summed stress and summed difference scores were not significantly reduced , although they were 18 % and 30 % lower , respectively , than control .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No significant differences were found in any parameter between metoprolol and metoprolol - glucagon .
O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
During dobutamine stress testing , metoprolol attenuates or eliminates evidence of myocardial ischemia .
O B O O O B O O O O O O O O
Glucagon 1 mg , although somewhat effective , does not correct this effect to the extent that it can be administered clinically .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Prednisolone - induced muscle dysfunction is caused more by atrophy than by altered acetylcholine receptor expression .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Large doses of glucocorticoids can alter muscle physiology and susceptibility to neuromuscular blocking drugs by mechanisms not clearly understood .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We investigated the effects of moderate and large doses of prednisolone on muscle function and pharmacology , and their relationship to changes in muscle size and acetylcholine receptor ( AChR
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
) expression .
O O O
With institutional approval , 35 Sprague - Dawley rats were randomly allocated to receive daily subcutaneous doses of 10 mg / kg prednisolone ( P10 group ) , 100 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
/ kg prednisolone ( P100 group ) , or an equal volume of saline ( S group ) for 7 days .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A fourth group of rats was pair fed ( food restricted ) with the P100 rats for 7 days ( FR group ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On Day 8 , the nerve - evoked peak twitch tensions , tetanic tensions , and fatigability , and the dose - response curves of d - tubocurarine in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O
tibialis cranialis muscle were measured in vivo and related to muscle mass or expression of AChRs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Rate of body weight gain was depressed in the P100 , FR , and P10 groups compared with the S group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tibialis muscle mass was smaller in the P100 group than in the P10 or S groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The evoked peak twitch and tetanic tensions were less in the P100 group than in the P10 or S groups , however , tension per milligram of muscle mass was
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
greater in the P100 group than in the S group .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The 50 % effective dose of d - tubocurarine ( microg / kg ) in the tibialis muscle was smaller in the P10 ( 33 . 6 + / -
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 . 4 ) than in the S ( 61 . 9 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 . 0 ) or the P100 ( 71 . 3 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
9 . 6 ) groups .
O O O O O O
AChR expression was less in the P10 group than in the S group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The evoked tensions correlated with muscle mass ( r ( 2 ) = 0 . 32 , P < 0 . 001 ) , however , not with expression of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
AChR .
O O
The 50 % effective dose of d - tubocurarine did not correlate with muscle mass or AChR expression .
O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
Our results suggest that the neuromuscular dysfunction after prednisolone is dose - dependent , and derives primarily from muscle atrophy and derives less so from changes in AChR expression .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
IMPLICATIONS :
O O
The mechanisms by which chronic glucocorticoid therapy alters neuromuscular physiology and pharmacology are unclear .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We suggest that the observed effects are dose - dependent and derive primarily from muscle atrophy and derive less from changes in acetylcholine receptor expression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Rapid reversal of life - threatening diltiazem - induced tetany with calcium chloride .
O O O O O O B O O O O B I O
We describe a patient who developed tetany with sudden respiratory arrest after the infusion of intravenous diltiazem .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The administration of calcium chloride rapidly resolved the patient 's tetany with prompt recovery of respiratory function , averting the need for more aggressive airway management and ventilatory support .
O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The emergency physician should be aware that life - threatening tetany may accompany the administration of intravenous diltiazem and that calcium chloride may be a rapid and effective remedy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B I O O O O O O O O
Effects of nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drugs on hemostasis in patients with aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Platelet function is impaired by nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) with prominent anti - inflammatory properties .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Their safety in patients undergoing intracranial surgery is under debate .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Patients with aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage ( SAH ) were randomized to receive either ketoprofen , 100 mg , three times a day ( ketoprofen group , n = 9 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
or a weak NSAID , acetaminophen , 1 g , three times a day ( acetaminophen group , n = 9 ) starting immediately after the diagnosis of aneurysmal SAH
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Treatment was continued for 3 days postoperatively .
O O O O O O O O
Test blood samples were taken before treatment and surgery as well as on the first , third , and fifth postoperative mornings .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Maximal platelet aggregation induced by 6 microM of adenosine diphosphate decreased after administration of ketoprofen .
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O B O
Aggregation was lower ( P < . 05 ) in the ketoprofen group than in the acetaminophen group just before surgery and on the third postoperative day .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , maximal platelet aggregation increased in the acetaminophen group on the third postoperative day as compared with the pretreatment platelet aggregation results ( P < . 05 )
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
One patient in the ketoprofen group developed a postoperative intracranial hematoma .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
Coagulation ( prothrombin time [ PT ] , activated partial thromboplastin time [ APPT ] , fibrinogen concentration , and antithrombin III
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
[ AT III ] ) was comparable between the two groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ketoprofen but not acetaminophen impaired platelet function in patients with SAH .
B O O B O O O O O O O O
If ketoprofen is used before surgery on cerebral artery aneurysms , it may pose an additional risk factor for hemorrhage .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Value of methylprednisolone in prevention of the arthralgia - myalgia syndrome associated with the total dose infusion of iron dextran : a double blind randomized trial .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O
The safety and efficacy of total dose infusion ( TDI ) of iron dextran has been well documented .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O
In 40 % of treated patients , an arthralgia - myalgia syndrome develops .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of this randomized , double - blind , prospective study was to investigate whether intravenous ( i . v . ) administration of methylprednisolone ( MP ) prevents
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
this complication .
O O O
Sixty - five patients , 34 women and 31 men , ages 36 to 80 years , received either normal saline before and after TDI ( group 1 ) ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
125 mg i . v .
O O O O O O
MP before and saline after TDI ( group 2 ) , or 125 mg i . v .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MP before and after TDI ( group 3 ) .
B O O O O O O O O O
Patients were observed for 72 hours and reactions were recorded and graded according to severity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fifty - eight percent of group 1 patients , 33 % of group 2 , and 26 % of group 3 had reactions to TDI .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The severity of reactions ( minimal , mild , and moderate , respectively ) was as follows : group 1 - - 6 , 6 , and 2 ; group
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 - - 1 , 5 , and 0 ; group 3 - - 5 , 1 , and 0 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Data were analyzed by the two - sided Fisher 's exact test using 95 % confidence intervals with the approximation of Woolf .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These data demonstrate that administration of MP before and after TDI reduces the frequency and severity of the arthralgia - myalgia syndrome .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We conclude that 125 mg i . v .
O O O O O O O O O
MP should be given routinely before and after TDI of iron dextran .
B O O O O O O O O O B I O
Long - term effects of vincristine on the peripheral nervous system .
O O O O O B O O O O O O
Forty patients with Non - Hodgkin 's Lymphoma treated with vincristine between 1984 and 1990 ( cumulative dose 12 mg in 18 - 24 weeks ) were investigated in order
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to evaluate the long term effects of vincristine on the peripheral nervous system .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The patients were interviewed with emphasis on neuropathic symptoms .
O O O O O O O O O O
Physical and quantitative sensory examination with determination of vibratory perception and thermal discrimination thresholds were performed , four to 77 months ( median 34 months ) after vincristine treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Twenty - seven patients reported neuropathic symptoms .
O O O O O O O O
In 13 of these 27 patients symptoms were still present at the time of examination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In these patients sensory signs and symptoms predominated .
O O O O O O O O O
In the other 14 patients symptoms had been present in the past .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Symptoms persisted maximally 40 months since cessation of therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O
There was no age difference between patients with and without complaints at the time of examination .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Normal reflexes were found in two third of patients .
O O O O O O O O O O
Neuropathic complaints were not very troublesome on the long term .
O O O O O O O O O O O
It is concluded that with the above mentioned vincristine dose schedule signs and symptoms of vincristine neuropathy are reversible for a great deal and prognosis is fairly good .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A case of polymyositis in a patient with primary biliary cirrhosis treated with D - penicillamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O
Although D - penicillamine has been used for many rheumatologic diseases , toxicity limits its usefulness in many patients .
O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Polymyositis / dermatomyositis can develop as one of the autoimmune complications of D - penicillamine treatment , but its exact pathogenesis remains unclear .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O
We report a patient with primary biliary cirrhosis , who developed polymyositis while receiving D - penicillamine therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O
We described the special clinical course of the patient .
O O O O O O O O O O
Patients receiving D - penicillamine therapy should be followed carefully for the development of autoimmune complications like polymyositis / dermatomyositis .
O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Photodistributed nifedipine - induced facial telangiectasia .
O B O O O O O
Five months after starting nifedipine ( Adalat ) , two patients developed photodistributed facial telangiectasia , which became more noticeable with time .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neither patient complained of photosensitivity or flushing .
O O O O O O O O
Both patients reported a significant cosmetic improvement after discontinuing the drug .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
One commenced the closely related drug amlodipine 3 years later , with recurrence of telangiectasia .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The photodistribution of the telangiectasia suggests a significant drug / light interaction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nephrotoxicity of cyclosporin A and FK506 : inhibition of calcineurin phosphatase .
O O B I O B O O O O O O
Cyclosporin A ( CsA ; 50 mg / kg ) and Fujimycine ( FK506 ; 5 mg / kg ) , but not the related macrolide immunosuppressant rapamycin ( 5
B I O B O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
mg / kg ) , caused a reduction of glomerular filtration rate , degenerative changes of proximal tubular epithelium , and hypertrophy of the juxtaglomerular apparatus in male Wistar rats
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
when given for 10 days .
O O O O O O
The molecular mechanisms of CsA and FK506 toxicity were investigated .
O O O O B O B O O O O
Cyclophilin A and FK506 - binding protein , the main intracytoplasmic receptors for CsA and FK506 , respectively , were each detected in renal tissue extract .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In the kidney , high levels of immunoreactive and enzymatically active calcineurin were found which were inhibited by the immunosuppressants CsA and FK506 , but not by rapamycin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O B O
Finally , specific immunophilin - drug - calcineurin complexes formed only in the presence of CsA and FK506 , but not rapamycin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O B O
These results suggest that the nephrotoxic effects of CsA and FK506 is likely mediated through binding to renal immunophilin and inhibiting calcineurin phosphatase .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Massive cerebral edema associated with fulminant hepatic failure in acetaminophen overdose : possible role of cranial decompression .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Cerebral edema may complicate the course of fulminant hepatic failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Response to conventional therapy has been disappointing .
O O O O O O O O
We present a patient with fatal acetaminophen - induced fulminant hepatic failure , with signs and symptoms of cerebral edema , unresponsive to conventional medical therapy .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cranial decompression was carried out .
O O O O O O
A justification of the need for further evaluation of cranial decompression in such patients is presented .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Gentamicin nephropathy in a neonate .
B O O O O O
The clinical and autopsy findings in a premature baby who died of acute renal failure after therapy with gentamicin ( 5 mg / kg / day ) and penicillin are
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O
presented .
O O
The serum gentamicin concentration had reached toxic levels when anuria developed .
O O B O O O O O O O O O
Numerous periodic acid Schiff ( PAS ) positive , diastase resistant cytoplasmic inclusion bodies which appeared as myelin figures in cytosegresomes under the electron microscope were identified in the proximal
O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
convoluted tubules .
O O O
The pathological changes induced by gentamicin in the human neonatal kidneys have not been previously reported .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Anti - carcinogenic action of phenobarbital given simultaneously with diethylnitrosamine in the rat .
O O O O O B O O O B O O O O
The present work has been planned in order to elucidate the effect of phenobarbital ( PB : 15 mg per rat of ingested dose ) on carcinogenesis when it is
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
administered simultaneously with diethylnitrosamine ( DEN : 10 mg / kg / day ) .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
Wistar rats ( 180 g ) were treated by DEN alone or by DEN + PB during 2 , 4 and 6 weeks according to our schedule for hepatocarcinogenesis .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After the end of the treatment , the number and the size of induced PAS positive preneoplastic foci was significantly reduced when PB was given simultaneously with DEN for 4
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O
and 6 weeks .
O O O O
The mitotic inhibition and the production of micronuclei normally observed after partial hepatectomy in DEN treated rats were also significantly decreased in DEN + PB treated rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O B O O O
When the treatment last only 2 weeks , the presence of PB did not change significantly the last parameters .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
In DEN + PB treated rats , the survival was prolonged and the tumor incidence decreased as compared with the results obtained by DEN alone .
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
It is concluded that PB , which promotes carcinogenesis when administered after the DEN treatment , reduces the carcinogen effect when given simultaneously with DEN .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
This ' anti - carcinogen ' effect acts on the initiation as well as on the promotion of the precancerous lesions .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Biochemical investigations are in progress to obtain more information about this ' paradoxical ' PB effect .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Post - operative rigidity after fentanyl administration .
O O O O O B O O
A case of thoraco - abdominal rigidity leading to respiratory failure is described in the post - operative period in an elderly patient who received a moderate dose of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
fentanyl .
B O
This was successfully reversed by naloxone .
O O O O O B O
The mechanisms possibly implicated in this accident are discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O
Postpartum psychosis induced by bromocriptine .
O O O O B O
Two multigravida patients with no prior psychiatric history were seen with postpartum psychosis , having received bromocriptine for inhibition of lactation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Bromocriptine given in high doses has been associated with psychosis in patients receiving the drug for Parkinson 's disease .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These cases demonstrate that bromocriptine may cause psychosis even when given in low doses .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
A prospective study on the dose dependency of cardiotoxicity induced by mitomycin C .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Since 1975 mitomycin C ( MMC ) has been suggested to be cardiotoxic , especially when combined with or given following doxorubicin .
O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Data on dose dependency or incidence concerning this side effect were not known .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We have initiated a prospective study to obtain some more data on these subjects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Forty - four MMC - treated patients were studied , 37 of them could be evaluated .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All patients were studied by repeated physical examinations , chest X - rays , electro - and echocardiography and radionuclide left ventricular ejection fraction ( EF ) determinations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results were evaluated per cumulative dose level .
O O O O O O O O O
One of the patients developed cardiac failure after 30 mg m - 2 MMC and only 150 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
m - 2 doxorubicin .
O O O B O
The cardiac failure was predicted by a drop in EF determined during a cold pressor test .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
None of the other patients developed clinical cardiotoxicity , nor did the studied parameters change .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The literature on this subject was also reviewed .
O O O O O O O O O
Based on the combined data from the present study and the literature , we suggest that MMC - related cardiotoxicity is dose dependent , occurring at cumulative dose levels of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
30 mg m - 2 or more , mainly in patients also ( previously or simultaneously ) treated with doxorubicin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The incidence is likely to be less than 10 % even for this risk group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Phlorizin - induced glycosuria does not prevent gentamicin nephrotoxicity in rats .
B O O O O O O B O O O O
Because rats with streptozotocin - induced diabetes mellitus ( DM ) have a high solute diuresis ( glycosuria of 10 to 12 g / day ) , we have suggested
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
that this may in part be responsible for their resistance to gentamicin - induced acute renal failure ( ARF ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The protection from gentamicin nephrotoxicity was studied in non - diabetic rats with chronic solute diuresis induced by blockage of tubular glucose reabsorption with phlorizin ( P ) .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O B O O
DM rats with mild glycosuria ( similar in degree to that of the P treated animals ) were also studied .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Unanesthetized adult female , Sprague - Dawley rats were divided in four groups and studied for 15 days .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Group 1 ( P alone ) received P , 360 mg / day , for 15 days ; Group II ( P + gentamicin ) ; Group III (
O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
gentamicin alone ) and Group IV ( mild DM + gentamicin ) .
B O O O O O O O O O B O O
Nephrotoxic doses ( 40 mg / kg body wt / day ) of gentamicin were injected during the last nine days of study to the animals of groups II to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
IV .
O O
In Group I , P induced a moderate and stable glycosuria ( 3 . 9 + / -
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 1 g / day , SE ) , and no functional or morphologic evidence of renal dysfunction ( baseline CCr 2 . 1 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 1 ml / min , undetectable lysozymuria ) or damage ( tubular necrosis score [ maximum 4 ] , zero ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In Group II , P did not prevent gentamicin - ARF ( maximal decrease in CCr at day 9 . 89 % , P less than 0 . 001 ;
O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
peak lysozymuria , 1863 + / -
O O O O O O O
321 micrograms / day ; and tubular necrosis score , 3 . 9 + / - 0 . 1 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These values were not different from those of Group III : maximal decrease in CCr 73 % ( P less than 0 . 001 ) ; lysozymuria , 2147 +
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
/ -

701 micrograms / day ; tubular necrosis score , 3 . 8 + / -

0 . 1 . ( ABSTRACT

O O O O O
Tiapride in levodopa - induced involuntary movements .
B O B O O O O O
Tiapride , a substituted benzamide derivative closely related to metoclopramide , reduced levodopa - induced peak dose involuntary movements in 16 patients with idiopathic Parkinson 's disease .
B O O O B O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , an unacceptable increase in disability from Parkinsonism with aggravation of end - of - dose akinesia led to its cessation in 14 patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tiapride had no effect on levodopa - induced early morning of """" off - period """" segmental dystonia .
B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results fail to support the notion that levodopa - induced dyskinesias are caused by overstimulation of a separate group of dopamine receptors .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Effects of the hippocampal deep brain stimulation on cortical epileptic discharges in penicillin - induced epilepsy model in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
AIM :
O O
Experimental and clinical studies have revealed that hippocampal DBS can control epileptic activity , but the mechanism of action is obscure and optimal stimulation parameters are not clearly defined .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aim was to evaluate the effects of high frequency hippocampal stimulation on cortical epileptic activity in penicillin - induced epilepsy model .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
MATERIAL AND METHODS :
O O O O
Twenty - five Sprague - Dawley rats were implanted DBS electrodes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
In group - 1 ( n = 10 ) hippocampal DBS was off and in the group - 2 ( n = 10 ) hippocampal DBS was on ( 185
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hz , 0 . 5V , 1V , 2V , and 5V for 60 sec ) following penicillin G injection intracortically .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O
In the control group hippocampal DBS was on following 8 l saline injection intracortically .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
EEG recordings were obtained before and 15 minutes following penicillin - G injection , and at 10th minutes following each stimulus for analysis in terms of frequency , amplitude ,
O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and power spectrum .
O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
High frequency hippocampal DBS suppressed the acute penicillin - induced cortical epileptic activity independent from stimulus intensity .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
In the control group , hippocampal stimulation alone lead only to diffuse slowing of cerebral bioelectrical activity at 5V stimulation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Our results revealed that continuous high frequency stimulation of the hippocampus suppressed acute cortical epileptic activity effectively without causing secondary epileptic discharges .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results are important in terms of defining the optimal parameters of hippocampal DBS in patients with epilepsy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Neural correlates of S - ketamine induced psychosis during overt continuous verbal fluency .
O O O B I I O O O O O O O O
The glutamatergic N - methyl - D - aspartate ( NMDA ) receptor has been implicated in the pathophysiology of schizophrenia .
O O B I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Administered to healthy volunteers , a subanesthetic dose of the non - competitive NMDA receptor antagonist ketamine leads to psychopathological symptoms similar to those observed in schizophrenia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
In patients with schizophrenia , ketamine exacerbates the core symptoms of illness , supporting the hypothesis of a glutamatergic dysfunction .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In a counterbalanced , placebo - controlled , double - blind study design , healthy subjects were administered a continuous subanesthetic S - ketamine infusion while differences in BOLD responses
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O
measured with fMRI were detected .
O O O O O O
During the scanning period , subjects performed continuous overt verbal fluency tasks ( phonological , lexical and semantic ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ketamine - induced psychopathological symptoms were assessed with the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale ( PANSS ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ketamine elicited psychosis like psychopathology .
B O O O O O
Post - hoc t - tests revealed significant differences between placebo and ketamine for the amounts of words generated during lexical and semantic verbal fluency , while the phonological domain
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
remained unaffected .
O O O
Ketamine led to enhanced cortical activations in supramarginal and frontal brain regions for phonological and lexical verbal fluency , but not for semantic verbal fluency .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ketamine induces activation changes in healthy subjects similar to those observed in patients with schizophrenia , particularly in frontal and temporal brain regions .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our results provide further support for the hypothesis of an NMDA receptor dysfunction in the pathophysiology of schizophrenia .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Dopamine is not essential for the development of methamphetamine - induced neurotoxicity .
B O O O O O O O B O O O O
It is widely believed that dopamine ( DA ) mediates methamphetamine ( METH ) - induced toxicity to brain dopaminergic neurons , because drugs that interfere with DA neurotransmission decrease
O O O O O B O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
toxicity , whereas drugs that increase DA neurotransmission enhance toxicity .
O O O O O O B O O O O
However , temperature effects of drugs that have been used to manipulate brain DA neurotransmission confound interpretation of the data .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Here we show that the recently reported ability of L - dihydroxyphenylalanine to reverse the protective effect of alpha - methyl - para - tyrosine on METH - induced
O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O B I I I I I I O B O O
DA neurotoxicity is also confounded by drug effects on body temperature .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Further , we show that mice genetically engineered to be deficient in brain DA develop METH neurotoxicity , as long as the thermic effects of METH are preserved .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O
In addition , we demonstrate that mice genetically engineered to have unilateral brain DA deficits develop METH - induced dopaminergic deficits that are of comparable magnitude on both sides of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the brain .
O O O
Taken together , these findings demonstrate that DA is not essential for the development of METH - induced dopaminergic neurotoxicity and suggest that mechanisms independent of DA warrant more intense
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
investigation .
O O
Brainstem dysgenesis in an infant prenatally exposed to cocaine .
O O O O O O O O B O
Many authors described the effects on the fetus of maternal cocaine abuse during pregnancy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Vasoconstriction appears to be the common mechanism of action leading to a wide range of fetal anomalies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report on an infant with multiple cranial - nerve involvement attributable to brainstem dysgenesis , born to a cocaine - addicted mother .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The protective role of Nrf2 in streptozotocin - induced diabetic nephropathy .
O O O O O O B O O O O O
