OBJECTIVE : Diabetic nephropathy is one of the major causes of renal failure , which is accompanied by the production of reactive oxygen species ( ROS ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Nrf2 is the primary transcription factor that controls the antioxidant response essential for maintaining cellular redox homeostasis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Here , we report our findings demonstrating a protective role of Nrf2 against diabetic nephropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESEARCH DESIGN AND METHODS :
O O O O O
We explore the protective role of Nrf2 against diabetic nephropathy using human kidney biopsy tissues from diabetic nephropathy patients , a streptozotocin - induced diabetic nephropathy model in Nrf2 (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
- / - ) mice , and cultured human mesangial cells .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The glomeruli of human diabetic nephropathy patients were under oxidative stress and had elevated Nrf2 levels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the animal study , Nrf2 was demonstrated to be crucial in ameliorating streptozotocin - induced renal damage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
This is evident by Nrf2 ( - / - ) mice having higher ROS production and suffering from greater oxidative DNA damage and renal injury compared with Nrf2 ( +
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
/ + ) mice .
O O O O O
Mechanistic studies in both in vivo and in vitro systems showed that the Nrf2 - mediated protection against diabetic nephropathy is , at least , partially through inhibition of transforming
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
growth factor - beta1 ( TGF - beta1 ) and reduction of extracellular matrix production .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In human renal mesangial cells , high glucose induced ROS production and activated expression of Nrf2 and its downstream genes .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , activation or overexpression of Nrf2 inhibited the promoter activity of TGF - beta1 in a dose - dependent manner , whereas knockdown of Nrf2 by siRNA enhanced TGF
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- beta1 transcription and fibronectin production .
O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
This work clearly indicates a protective role of Nrf2 in diabetic nephropathy , suggesting that dietary or therapeutic activation of Nrf2 could be used as a strategy to prevent or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
slow down the progression of diabetic nephropathy .
O O O O O O O O
High - dose tranexamic Acid is associated with nonischemic clinical seizures in cardiac surgical patients .
O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
In 2 separate centers , we observed a notable increase in the incidence of postoperative convulsive seizures from 1 . 3 % to 3 . 8 % in patients having
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
undergone major cardiac surgical procedures .
O O O O O O
These events were temporally coincident with the initial use of high - dose tranexamic acid ( TXA ) therapy after withdrawal of aprotinin from general clinical usage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of this review was to perform a retrospective analysis to examine whether there was a relation between TXA usage and seizures after cardiac surgery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
An in - depth chart review was undertaken in all 24 patients who developed perioperative seizures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Electroencephalographic activity was recorded in 11 of these patients , and all patients had a formal neurological evaluation and brain imaging studies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Twenty - one of the 24 patients did not have evidence of new cerebral ischemic injury , but seizures were likely due to ischemic brain injury in 3 patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All patients with seizures did not have permanent neurological abnormalities .
O O O O O O O O O O O
All 24 patients with seizures received high doses of TXA intraoperatively ranging from 61 to 259 mg / kg , had a mean age of 69 . 9 years ,
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and 21 of 24 had undergone open chamber rather than coronary bypass procedures .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All but one patient were managed using cardiopulmonary bypass .
O O O O O O O O O O
No evidence of brain ischemic , metabolic , or hyperthermia - induced causes for their seizures was apparent .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Our results suggest that use of high - dose TXA in older patients in conjunction with cardiopulmonary bypass and open - chamber cardiac surgery is associated with clinical seizures in
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
susceptible patients .
O O O
Recurrent dysosmia induced by pyrazinamide .
O O O O B O
Pyrazinamide can have adverse effects such as hepatic toxicity , hyperuricemia or digestive disorders .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In rare cases , alterations in taste and smell function have been reported for pyrazinamide when combined with other drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
We report a case of reversible olfactory disorder related to pyrazinamide in a woman , with a positive rechallenge .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The patient presented every day a sensation of smelling something burning 15 min after drug intake .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dysosmia disappeared completely after pyrazinamide withdrawal and recurred after its rechallenge .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
The case was reported to the Tunisian Centre of Pharmacovigilance .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Longitudinal assessment of air conduction audiograms in a phase III clinical trial of difluoromethylornithine and sulindac for prevention of sporadic colorectal adenomas .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
A phase III clinical trial assessed the recurrence of adenomatous polyps after treatment for 36 months with difluoromethylornithine ( DFMO ) plus sulindac or matched placebos .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O
Temporary hearing loss is a known toxicity of treatment with DFMO , thus a comprehensive approach was developed to analyze serial air conduction audiograms .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The generalized estimating equation method estimated the mean difference between treatment arms with regard to change in air conduction pure tone thresholds while accounting for within - subject correlation due
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
to repeated measurements at frequencies .
O O O O O O
Based on 290 subjects , there was an average difference of 0 . 50 dB between subjects treated with DFMO plus sulindac compared with those treated with placebo ( 95
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
% confidence interval , - 0 . 64 to 1 . 63 dB ; P = 0 . 39 ) , adjusted for baseline values , age , and frequencies
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
In the normal speech range of 500 to 3 , 000 Hz , an estimated difference of 0 . 99 dB ( - 0 . 17 to 2 . 14
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dB ; P = 0 . 09 ) was detected .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Dose intensity did not add information to models .
O O O O O O O O O
There were 14 of 151 ( 9 . 3 % ) in the DFMO plus sulindac group and 4 of 139 ( 2 . 9 % ) in the placebo
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
group who experienced at least 15 dB hearing reduction from baseline in 2 or more consecutive frequencies across the entire range tested ( P = 0 . 02 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Follow - up air conduction done at least 6 months after end of treatment showed an adjusted mean difference in hearing thresholds of 1 . 08 dB ( - 0
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 81 to 2 . 96 dB ; P = 0 . 26 ) between treatment arms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was no significant difference in the proportion of subjects in the DFMO plus sulindac group who experienced clinically significant hearing loss compared with the placebo group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The estimated attributable risk of ototoxicity from exposure to the drug is 8 . 4 % ( 95 % confidence interval , - 2 . 0 % to 18 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
8 % ; P = 0 . 12 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
There is a < 2 dB difference in mean threshold for patients treated with DFMO plus sulindac compared with those treated with placebo .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O
Increased mental slowing associated with the APOE epsilon4 allele after trihexyphenidyl oral anticholinergic challenge in healthy elderly .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
The objectives of this study were to examine the relationship between APOE epsilon4 and subjective effects of trihexyphenidyl on measures reflecting sedation and confusion and to investigate the relationship between
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
trihexyphenidyl - induced subjective effects and objective memory performance .
B O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
This study comprised 24 cognitively intact , health elderly adults ( 12 APOE epsilon4 carriers ) at an outpatient geriatric psychiatry research clinic .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This was a randomized , double blind , placebo - controlled , three - way , crossover experimental design .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All participants received 1 . 0 mg or 2 . 0 mg trihexyphenidyl or placebo administered in counterbalanced sequences over a period of three consecutive weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bond and Lader 's visual analog scales and alternate versions of the Buschke Selective Reminding Test were administered in a repeated measures design at baseline , 1 , 2 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 , and 5 hours postdrug administration .
O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
A 2 . 0 - mg oral dose of trihexyphenidyl resulted in increased subjective ratings of mental slowness in carriers of the APOE epsilon4 allele only .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Drug effects as determined by difference scores between 2 . 0 mg trihexyphenidyl and placebo on ratings of mental slowness significantly correlated with total and delayed recall on the Buschke
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Selective Reminding Test in carriers of the APOE epsilon4 allele only .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , no significant effects were found with other visual analog scales reflecting subjective sedation and clear - headedness .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
The epsilon4 allele in healthy elderly was associated with increased subjective mental slowing after trihexyphenidyl anticholinergic challenge .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Behavioral effects of pubertal anabolic androgenic steroid exposure in male rats with low serotonin .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O
The goal of this study was to assess the interactive effects of chronic anabolic androgenic steroid ( AAS ) exposure and brain serotonin ( 5 - hydroxytryptamine ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O B I I O
5 - HT ) depletion on behavior of pubertal male rats .
B I I O O O O O O O O O
Serotonin was depleted beginning on postnatal day 26 with parachlorophenylalanine ( PCPA 100 mg / kg , every other day ) ; controls received saline .
B O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At puberty ( P40 ) , half the PCPA - treated rats and half the saline - treated rats began treatment with testosterone ( T , 5 mg / kg
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
, 5 days / week ) .
O O O O O O O
Behavioral measures included locomotion , irritability , copulation , partner preference , and aggression .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Animals were tested for aggression in their home cage , both with and without physical provocation ( mild tail pinch ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Brain levels of 5 - HT and its metabolite , 5 - hydroxyindoleacetic acid ( 5 - HIAA ) , were determined using HPLC .
O O O B I I O O O O B I I I O B I I O O O O O O O
PCPA significantly and substantially depleted 5 - HT and 5 - HIAA in all brain regions examined .
B O O O O B I I O B I I O O O O O O
Chronic T treatment significantly decreased 5 - HT and 5 - HIAA in certain brain areas , but to a much lesser extent than PCPA .
O B O O O B I I O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Chronic exposure to PCPA alone significantly decreased locomotor activity and increased irritability but had no effect on sexual behavior , partner preference , or aggression .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
T alone had no effect on locomotion , irritability , or sexual behavior but increased partner preference and aggression .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The most striking effect of combining T + PCPA was a significant increase in attack frequency as well as a significant decrease in the latency to attack , particularly following
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
physical provocation .
O O O
Based on these data , it can be speculated that pubertal AAS users with low central 5 - HT may be especially prone to exhibit aggressive behavior .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O
Intracavitary chemotherapy ( paclitaxel / carboplatin liquid crystalline cubic phases ) for recurrent glioblastoma - - clinical observations .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Human malignant brain tumors have a poor prognosis in spite of surgery and radiation therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cubic phases consist of curved biocontinuous lipid bilayers , separating two congruent networks of water channels .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Used as a host for cytotoxic drugs , the gel - like matrix can easily be applied to the walls of a surgical resection cavity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
For human glioblastoma recurrences , the feasibility , safety , and short - term effects of a surgical intracavitary application of paclitaxel and carboplatin encapsulated by liquid crystalline cubic phases
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
are examined in a pilot study .
O O O O O O O
A total of 12 patients with a recurrence of a glioblastoma multiforme underwent re - resection and received an intracavitary application of paclitaxel and carboplatin cubic phases in different dosages
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
.
O
Six of the patients received more than 15 mg paclitaxel and suffered from moderate to severe brain edema , while the remaining patients received only a total of 15 mg
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
paclitaxel .
B O
In the latter group , brain edema was markedly reduced and dealt medically .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intracavitary chemotherapy in recurrent glioblastoma using cubic phases is feasible and safe , yet the clinical benefit remains to be examined in a clinical phase II study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Methylphenidate - induced obsessive - compulsive symptoms in an elderly man .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
An 82 - year - old man with treatment - resistant depression and early Alzheimer 's disease was started on methylphenidate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Significant obsessive - compulsive behavior ensued but diminished over several weeks when methylphenidate was replaced by fluvoxamine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O
The patient had no prior psychiatric history , but he had a sister with obsessive - compulsive disorder .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It appears that methylphenidate precipitated the patient 's pathological behavior .
O O O B O O O O O O O
Cardiac arrest after intravenous metoclopramide - a case of five repeated injections of metoclopramide causing five episodes of cardiac arrest .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
We describe a patient where intravenous injection of metoclopramide was immediately followed by asystole repeatedly .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
The patient received metoclopramide 10 mg i . v .
O O O B O O O O O O
five times during 48 h .
O O O O O O
After interviewing the attending nurses and reviewing the written documentation , it is clear that every administration of metoclopramide was immediately ( within s ) followed by asystole .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The asystole lasted 15 - 30 s on four occasions , on one occasion it lasted 2 min .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient received atropine 0 . 5 - 1 mg and chest compressions , before sinus rhythm again took over .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We interpret this as episodes of cardiac arrest caused by metoclopramide .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
The rapid injection via the central venous route and the concomitant tapering of dopamine infusion might have contributed in precipitating the adverse drug reaction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Severe immune hemolytic anemia associated with prophylactic use of cefotetan in obstetric and gynecologic procedures .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Second - and third - generation cephalosporins , especially cefotetan , are increasingly associated with severe , sometimes fatal immune hemolytic anemia .
O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We noticed that 10 of our 35 cases of cefotetan - induced hemolytic anemias were in patients who had received cefotetan prophylactically for obstetric and gynecologic procedures .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Eight of these cases of severe immune hemolytic anemia are described .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cauda equina syndrome after spinal anaesthesia with hyperbaric 5 % lignocaine : a review of six cases of cauda equina syndrome reported to the Swedish Pharmaceutical Insurance 1993 - 1997
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Six cases of cauda equina syndrome with varying severity were reported to the Swedish Pharmaceutical Insurance during the period 1993 - 1997 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All were associated with spinal anaesthesia using hyperbaric 5 % lignocaine .
O O O O O O O O O O B O
Five cases had single - shot spinal anaesthesia and one had a repeat spinal anaesthetic due to inadequate block .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The dose of hyperbaric 5 % lignocaine administered ranged from 60 to 120 mg .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Three of the cases were most likely caused by direct neurotoxicity of hyperbaric 5 % lignocaine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
In the other 3 cases , direct neurotoxicity was also probable , but unfortunately radiological investigations were not done to definitely exclude a compressive aetiology .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All cases sustained permanent neurological deficits .
O O O O O O O
We recommend that hyperbaric lignocaine should be administered in concentrations not greater than 2 % and at a total dose preferably not exceeding 60 mg .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cortical motor overactivation in parkinsonian patients with L - dopa - induced peak - dose dyskinesia .
O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O
We have studied the regional cerebral blood flow ( rCBF ) changes induced by the execution of a finger - to - thumb opposition motor task in the supplementary and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
primary motor cortex of two groups of parkinsonian patients on L - dopa medication , the first one without L - dopa induced dyskinesia ( n = 23 ) and
O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O
the other with moderate peak - dose dyskinesia ( n = 15 ) , and of a group of 14 normal subjects .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Single photon emission tomography with i . v .
O O O O O O O O O
133Xe was used to measure the rCBF changes .
O O O O O O O O O
The dyskinetic parkinsonian patients exhibited a pattern of response which was markedly different from those of the normal subjects and non - dyskinetic parkinsonian patients , with a significant overactivation
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in the supplementary motor area and the ipsi - and contralateral primary motor areas .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results are compatible with the hypothesis that an hyperkinetic abnormal involuntary movement , like L - dopa - induced peak dose dyskinesia , is due to a disinhibition of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O
the primary and associated motor cortex secondary to an excessive outflow of the pallidothalamocortical motor loop .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dexamethasone - induced ocular hypertension in perfusion - cultured human eyes .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
Glucocorticoid administration can lead to the development of ocular hypertension and corticosteroid glaucoma in a subset of the population through a decrease in the aqueous humor outflow facility .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of this study was to determine whether glucocorticoid treatment can directly affect the outflow facility of isolated , perfusion - cultured human eyes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
The anterior segments of human donor eyes from regional eye banks were placed in a constant flow , variable pressure perfusion culture system .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Paired eyes were perfused in serum - free media with or without 10 ( - 7 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
M dexamethasone for 12 days .
O B O O O O
Intraocular pressure was monitored daily .
O O O O O O
After incubation , the eyes were morphologically characterized by light microscopy , transmission and scanning electron microscopy , and scanning laser confocal microscopy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
A significant increase in intraocular pressure developed in 13 of the 44 pairs of eyes perfused with dexamethasone with an average pressure rise of 17 . 5 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
3 . 8 mm Hg after 12 days of dexamethasone exposure .
O O O O O O O O O B O O
The contralateral control eyes , which did not receive dexamethasone , maintained a stable intraocular pressure during the same period .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The outflow pathway of the untreated eyes appeared morphologically normal .
O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , the dexamethasone - treated hypertensive eyes had thickened trabecular beams , decreased intertrabecular spaces , thickened juxtacanalicular tissue , activated trabecular meshwork cells , and increased amounts
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of amorphogranular extracellular material , especially in the juxtacanalicular tissue and beneath the endothelial lining of the canal of Schlemm .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The dexamethasone - treated nonresponder eyes appeared to be morphologically similar to the untreated eyes , although several subtle dexamethasone - induced morphologic changes were evident .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Dexamethasone treatment of isolated , perfusion - cultured human eyes led to the generation of ocular hypertension in approximately 30 % of the dexamethasone - treated eyes .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Steroid treatment resulted in morphologic changes in the trabecular meshwork similar to those reported for corticosteroid glaucoma and open angle glaucoma .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This system may provide an acute model in which to study the pathogenic mechanisms involved in steroid glaucoma and primary open angle glaucoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cognitive deterioration from long - term abuse of dextromethorphan : a case report .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Dextromethorphan ( DM ) , the dextrorotatory isomer of 3 - hydroxy - N - methylmorphinan , is the main ingredient in a number of widely available , over -
B O B O O O O O O B I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the - counter antitussives .
O O O O O
Initial studies ( Bornstein 1968 ) showed that it possessed no respiratory suppressant effects and no addiction liability .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Subsequently , however , several articles reporting abuse of this drug have appeared in the literature .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The drug is known to cause a variety of acute toxic effects , ranging from nausea , restlessness , insomnia , ataxia , slurred speech and nystagmus to mood changes
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, perceptual alterations , inattention , disorientation and aggressive behavior ( Rammer et al 1988 ;
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Katona and Watson 1986 ; Isbell and Fraser 1953 ; Devlin et al 1985 ; McCarthy 1971 ; Dodds and Revai 1967 ; Degkwitz 1964 ; Hildebrand et al 1989
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
There have also been two reported fatalities from DM overdoses ( Fleming 1986 ) .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
However , there are no reports describing the effects of chronic abuse .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This report describes a case of cognitive deterioration resulting from prolonged use of DM .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Long - term lithium treatment and the kidney .
O O O B O O O O O
Interim report on fifty patients .
O O O O O O
This is a report on the first part of our study of the effects of long - term lithium treatment on the kidney .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Creatinine clearance , maximum urinary osmolality and 24 hour urine volume have been tested in 50 affectively ill patients who have been on long - term lithium for more than
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
one year .
O O O
These findings have been compared with norms and with values of the same tests from screening prior to lithium , available for most of our patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
No evidence was found for any reduction of glomerular filtration during lithium treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Low clearance values found in several patients could be accounted for by their age and their pre - lithium values .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Urinary concentration defect appeared frequent but the extent of the impairment is difficult to assess because of the uncertainty about the norms applicable to this group of patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The concentration defect appeared reversible , at least in part .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Polyuria above 3 litres / 24 hours was found in 10 % of patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An attempt is made to draw practical conclusions from the preliminary findings .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Complete heart block following a single dose of trazodone .
O O O O O O O O B O
Forty minutes after receiving a single starting dose of trazodone , a patient developed complete heart block .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The case illustrates that , despite the results of earlier studies , trazodone 's effect on cardiac conduction may be severe in individuals at risk for conduction delay .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Quinidine phenylethylbarbiturate - induced fulminant hepatitis in a pregnant woman .
B I O O O O O O O O O
A case report .
O O O O
We report the case of a 19 - year - old Laotian patient affected by fulminant hepatitis during the third trimester of her pregnancy after a 1 - month administration
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of quinidine phenylethylbarbiturate .
O B I O
After delivery , the patient underwent orthotopic liver transplantation .
O O O O O O O O O O
The patient was in good condition 16 months after liver transplantation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Quinidine itself or phenylethylbarbiturate may be responsible for fulminant hepatitis in this patient .
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The epidemiology of the acute flank pain syndrome from suprofen .
O O O O O O O O O B O
Suprofen , a new nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drug , was marketed in early 1986 as an analgesic agent .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Until physicians began reporting an unusual acute flank pain syndrome to the spontaneous reporting system , 700 , 000 persons used the drug in the United States .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Through August 1986 , a total of 163 cases of this syndrome were reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To elucidate the epidemiology of the syndrome , a case - control study was performed , comparing 62 of the case patients who had been reported to the spontaneous reporting
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
system to 185 suprofen - exposed control subjects who did not have the syndrome .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Case patients were more likely to be men ( odds ratio , 3 . 8 ; 95 % confidence interval , 1 . 2 - 12 . 1 ) ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
suffer from hay fever and asthma ( odds ratio , 3 . 4 ; 95 % confidence interval , 1 . 0 - 11 . 9 ) ; to participate
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in regular exercise ( odds ratio , 5 . 9 ; 95 % confidence interval , 1 . 1 - 30 . 7 ) , especially in the use of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nautilus equipment ( p = 0 . 02 ) ; and to use alcohol ( odds ratio , 4 . 4 ; 95 % confidence interval , 1 . 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- 17 . 5 ) .
O O O O O O
Possible risk factors included young age , concurrent use of other analgesic agents ( especially ibuprofen ) , preexisting renal disease , a history of kidney stones , a history
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of gout , a recent increase in activity , a recent increase in sun exposure , and residence in the Sunbelt .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These were findings that were suggestive but did not reach conventional statistical significance .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These findings are consistent with the postulated mechanism for this unusual syndrome : acute diffuse crystallization of uric acid in renal tubules .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O
Hemolytic - uremic syndrome associated with ingestion of quinine .
O O O O O O O O B O
Hemolytic - uremic syndrome following quinine ingestion is a newly described phenomenon , with just two previous descriptions of 4 cases in the literature .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We describe a 5th case .
O O O O O O
The reaction may be mediated by the presence of antibodies reactive against platelets in the presence of quinine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Treatment has included use of plasma exchange , prednisone , aspirin , and dipyridamole .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O
The patients have all regained some degree of renal function .
O O O O O O O O O O O
However , it is unclear whether pharmacological treatment or spontaneous resolution is responsible for the improvement .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Quinine - associated hemolytic - uremic syndrome probably occurs more often than is recognized .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is important to recognize this reaction when it occurs and to avoid further quinine exposure , since the reaction seems to be recurrent .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Pyeloureteral filling defects associated with systemic anticoagulation : a case report .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The etiology of pyeloureteritis cystica has long been attributed to chronic infection and inflammation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A case is presented that is unique in that the acute onset and the rapid resolution of pyeloureteral filling defects in this patient were documented by radiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There is no evidence of antecedent or concurrent infection in this patient .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The disease occurred subsequent to the initiation of heparin therapy for suspected pelvic thrombophlebitis and cleared rapidly subsequent to its discontinuation .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The rate of resolution of the radiographic findings may be helpful in distinguishing between true pyeloureteritis cystica and submucosal hemorrhage .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Changes in peroxisomes in preneoplastic liver and hepatoma of mice induced by alpha - benzene hexachloride .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O
Peroxisomes in hepatomas and hyperplastic preneoplastic liver lesions induced in mice by 500 ppm alpha - benzene hexachloride were examined histochemically and electron microscopically .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O
Although most of the hepatomas were well - differentiated tumors and contained a considerable number of peroxisomes , the tumor cells did not respond to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ethyl - alpha - p - chlorophenoxyisobutyrate with proliferation of peroxisomes .
B I I I I I I O O O O O
At the 16th week of carcinogen feeding , hyperplastic nodules appeared and advanced to further stages .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A majority of the nodules showed a considerable number of peroxisomes and the inductive proliferation of peroxisomes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Within the nodules , foci of proliferation of the cells that showed no inducibility of proliferation of peroxisomes appeared .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These cells proliferated further , replacing the most part of the nodules , and with this process hepatomas appeared to have been formed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No abnormal matrical inclusions of peroxisomes were formed in the cells of hyperplastic nodules by ethyl - alpha - p - chlorophenoxyisobutyrate unlike in the case of rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I O O O O O O O
Quinidine hepatitis .
B O O
Long - term administration of quinidine was associated with persistent elevation of serum concentrations of SGOT , lactic acid dehydrogenase , and alkaline phosphatase .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O
Liver biopsy showed active hepatitis .
O O O O O O
Discontinuance of quinidine therapy led to normalization of liver function tests .
O O B O O O O O O O O O
A challenge dose of quinidine caused clinical symptoms and abrupt elevation of SGOT , alkaline phosphatase , and lactic acid dehydrogenase values .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O
We concluded that this patient had quinidine hepatotoxicity and believe that this is the first case reported with liver biopsy documentation .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This report also suggests that , even after long - term administration , the hepatic toxicity is reversible .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cholesteryl hemisuccinate treatment protects rodents from the toxic effects of acetaminophen , adriamycin , carbon tetrachloride , chloroform and galactosamine .
B I O O O O O O O O B O B O B I O B O B O
In addition to its use as a stabilizer / rigidifier of membranes , cholesteryl hemisuccinate , tris salt ( CS ) administration has also been shown to protect rats from
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O
the hepatotoxic effects of carbon tetrachloride ( CCl4 ) .
O O O O B I O B O O
To further our understanding of the mechanism of CS cytoprotection , we examined in rats and mice the protective abilities of CS and the non - hydrolyzable ether form of
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
CS , gamma - cholesteryloxybutyric acid , tris salt ( CSE ) against acetaminophen - , adriamycin - , carbon tetrachloride - , chloroform - and galactosamine - induced toxicity
B O B I I I O B I O B O O B O O B O O B I O O B O O B O O O
.
O
The results of these studies demonstrated that CS - mediated protection is not selective for a particular species , organ system or toxic chemical .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A 24 - h pretreatment of both rats and mice with a single dose of CS ( 100mg / kg , i . p . )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
, resulted in significant protection against the hepatotoxic effects of CCl4 , CHCl3 , acetaminophen and galactosamine and against the lethal ( and presumably cardiotoxic ) effect of adriamycin administration
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O
.
O
Maximal CS - mediated protection was observed in experimental animals pretreated 24 h prior to the toxic insult .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These data suggest that CS intervenes in a critical cellular event that is an important common pathway to toxic cell death .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mechanism of CS protection does not appear to be dependent on the inhibition of chemical bioactivation to a toxic reactive intermediate ( in light of the protection observed against
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
galactosamine hepatotoxicity ) .
B O O O
However , based on the data presented , we can not exclude the possibility that CS administration inhibits chemical bioactivation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Our findings do suggest that CS - mediated protection is dependent on the action of the intact anionic CS molecule ( non - hydrolyzable CSE was as protective as
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O
CS ) , whose mechanism has yet to be defined .
B O O O O O O O O O O
DSMM XI study : dose definition for intravenous cyclophosphamide in combination with bortezomib / dexamethasone for remission induction in patients with newly diagnosed myeloma .
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
A clinical trial was initiated to evaluate the recommended dose of cyclophosphamide in combination with bortezomib and dexamethasone as induction treatment before stem cell transplantation for younger patients with newly
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
diagnosed multiple myeloma ( MM ) .
O O O O O O O
Thirty patients were treated with three 21 - day cycles of bortezomib 1 . 3 mg / m ( 2 ) on days 1 , 4 , 8 , and
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
11 plus dexamethasone 40 mg on the day of bortezomib injection and the day after plus cyclophosphamide at 900 , 1 , 200 , or 1 , 500 mg /
O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
m ( 2 ) on day 1 .
O O O O O O O O
The maximum tolerated dose of cyclophosphamide was defined as 900 mg / m ( 2 ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
At this dose level , 92 % of patients achieved at least a partial response .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The overall response rate [ complete response ( CR ) plus partial response ( PR ) ]
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
across all dose levels was 77 % , with a 10 % CR rate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No patient experienced progressive disease .
O O O O O O
The most frequent adverse events were hematological and gastrointestinal toxicities as well as neuropathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results suggest that bortezomib in combination with cyclophosphamide at 900 mg / m ( 2 ) and dexamethasone is an effective induction treatment for patients with newly diagnosed MM
O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
that warrants further investigation .
O O O O O
Results of a comparative , phase III , 12 - week , multicenter , prospective , randomized , double - blind assessment of the efficacy and tolerability of a fixed
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- dose combination of telmisartan and amlodipine versus amlodipine monotherapy in Indian adults with stage II hypertension .
O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : The aim of this study was to evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of a new fixed - dose combination ( FDC ) of telmisartan 40 mg +
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
amlodipine 5 mg ( T + A ) compared with amlodipine 5 - mg monotherapy ( A ) in adult Indian patients with stage II hypertension .
B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
This comparative , Phase III
O O O O O
, 12 - week , multicenter , prospective , randomized , double - blind study was conducted in Indian patients aged 18 to 65 years with established stage II hypertension
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Patients were treated with oral FDC of T + A or A QD before breakfast for 12 weeks ; blood pressure ( BP ) and heart rate were measured in
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the sitting position .
O O O O
Primary efficacy end points were reduction in clinical systolic BP ( SBP ) / diastolic BP ( DBP ) from baseline to study end and number of responders ( ie
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, patients who achieved target SBP / DBP < 130 / < 80 mm Hg ) at end of study .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tolerability was assessed by treatment - emergent adverse events , identified using physical examination , laboratory analysis , and electrocardiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
A total of 210 patients were enrolled in the study ; 203 patients ( 143 men , 60 women ) completed the study while 7 were lost to follow -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
up ( 4 patients in the T + A group and 3 in the A group ) and considered with - drawn .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At study end , statistically significant percentage reductions from baseline within groups and between groups were observed in SBP ( T + A [ - 27 . 4 % ]
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
; A [ - 16 . 6 % ] ) and DBP
O O O O O O O O O O O O
( T + A [ - 20 . 1 % ] ; A [ - 13 . 3 % ] ) ( all , P < 0 . 05 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Response rates were 87 . 3 % ( 89 / 102 ) in the T + A group and 69 . 3 % ( 70 / 101 ) in the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A group ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
The prevalences of adverse events were not significantly different between the 2 treatment groups ( T + A , 16 . 0 % [ 17 / 106 ] ; A
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, 15 . 4 % [ 16 / 104 ] ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Peripheral edema was reported in 8 . 5 % patients ( 9 / 106 ) in the T + A group compared with 13 . 5 % ( 14 /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
104 ) in the A group , and cough was reported in 3 . 8 % patients ( 4 / 106 ) in the T + A group and 1
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 0 % ( 1 / 104 ) patients in the A group ; these differences did not reach statistical significance .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidences of headache , dizziness , and diarrhea were similar between the 2 groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Among these Indian patients with stage II hypertension , the FDC of T + A was found to be significantly more effective , with regard to BP reductions , than
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A , and both treatments were well tolerated .
O O O O O O O O O
Cutaneous leucocytoclastic vasculitis associated with oxacillin .
O O O O O B O
A 67 - year - old man who was treated with oxacillin for one week because of Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia , developed renal failure and diffuse , symmetric , palpable
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
purpuric lesions on his feet .
O O O O O O
Necrotic blisters were noted on his fingers .
O O O O O O O O
Skin biopsies showed findings diagnostic of leucocytoclastic vasculitis .
O O O O O O O O O
Oxacillin was discontinued and patient was treated with corticosteroids .
B O O O O O O O B O
The rash disappeared after three weeks and renal function returned to normal .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Leucocytoclastic vasculitis presents as palpable purpura of the lower extremities often accompanied by abdominal pain , arthralgia , and renal involvement .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Etiologic factors or associated disorders include infections , medications , collagen vascular disease and neoplasia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , in half of the cases no etiologic factor is identified .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Usually it is a self - limited disorder , but corticosteroid therapy may be needed in life - threatening cases since early treatment with corticosteroids in severe cases can prevent
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
complications .
O O
Oxacillin should be included among the drugs that can cause leucocytoclastic vasculitis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Naloxazone pretreatment modifies cardiorespiratory , temperature , and behavioral effects of morphine .
B O O O O O O O O O O B O
Behavioral and cardiorespiratory responses to a lethal dose of morphine were evaluated in rats pretreated with saline or naloxazone , an antagonist of high - affinity mu 1 opioid receptors
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Pretreatment with naloxazone significantly blocked morphine analgesia , catalepsy and hypothermia at a dose which completely eliminated high - affinity binding in brain membranes .
O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Moreover , naloxazone significantly attenuated the morphine - induced hypotension and respiratory depression , whereas morphine - induced bradycardia was less affected .
O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Results indicate that subpopulations of mu receptors may mediate selective behavioral and cardiorespiratory responses to morphine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Dexrazoxane protects against myelosuppression from the DNA cleavage - enhancing drugs etoposide and daunorubicin but not doxorubicin .
B O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O
PURPOSE :
O O
The anthracyclines daunorubicin and doxorubicin and the epipodophyllotoxin etoposide are potent DNA cleavage - enhancing drugs that are widely used in clinical oncology ; however , myelosuppression and cardiac toxicity
O B B O B O O B B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
limit their use .
O O O O
Dexrazoxane ( ICRF - 187 ) is recommended for protection against anthracycline - induced cardiotoxicity .
B O B I I O O O O O O B O O O O
EXPERIMENTAL DESIGN :
O O O
Because of their widespread use , the hematologic toxicity following coadministration of dexrazoxane and these three structurally different DNA cleavage enhancers was investigated : Sensitivity of human and murine blood
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
progenitor cells to etoposide , daunorubicin , and doxorubicin + / -
O O O B O B O O B O O O
dexrazoxane was determined in granulocyte - macrophage colony forming assays .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Likewise , in vivo , B6D2F1 mice were treated with etoposide , daunorubicin , and doxorubicin , with or without dexrazoxane over a wide range of doses : posttreatment ,
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
a full hematologic evaluation was done .
O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Nontoxic doses of dexrazoxane reduced myelosuppression and weight loss from daunorubicin and etoposide in mice and antagonized their antiproliferative effects in the colony assay ; however , dexrazoxane neither reduced
O O O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
myelosuppression , weight loss , nor the in vitro cytotoxicity from doxorubicin .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Although our findings support the observation that dexrazoxane reduces neither hematologic activity nor antitumor activity from doxorubicin clinically , the potent antagonism of daunorubicin activity raises concern ; a possible
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O
interference with anticancer efficacy certainly would call for renewed attention .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Our data also suggest that significant etoposide dose escalation is perhaps possible by the use of dexrazoxane .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O
Clinical trials in patients with brain metastases combining dexrazoxane and high doses of etoposide is ongoing with the aim of improving efficacy without aggravating hematologic toxicity .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
If successful , this represents an exciting mechanism for pharmacologic regulation of side effects from cytotoxic chemotherapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Effects of the novel compound aniracetam ( Ro 13 - 5057 ) upon impaired learning and memory in rodents .
O O O O O B O B I I I O O O O O O O O O
The effect of aniracetam ( Ro 13 - 5057 , 1 - anisoyl - 2 - pyrrolidinone ) was studied on various forms of experimentally impaired cognitive functions ( learning
O O O B O B I I I O B I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and memory ) in rodents and produced the following effects : ( 1 ) almost complete prevention of the incapacity to learn a discrete escape response in rats exposed to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
sublethal hypercapnia immediately before the acquisition session ; ( 2 ) partial ( rats ) or complete ( mice ) prevention of the scopolamine - induced short - term amnesia
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
for a passive avoidance task ; ( 3 ) complete protection against amnesia for a passive avoidance task in rats submitted to electroconvulsive shock immediately after avoidance acquisition ; (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
4 ) prevention of the long - term retention - or retrieval - deficit for a passive avoidance task induced in rats and mice by chloramphenicol or cycloheximide administered immediately
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O
after acquisition ; ( 5 ) reversal , when administered as late as 1 h before the retention test , of the deficit in retention or retrieval of a passive
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
avoidance task induced by cycloheximide injected 2 days previously ; ( 6 ) prevention of the deficit in the retrieval of an active avoidance task induced in mice by subconvulsant
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
electroshock or hypercapnia applied immediately before retrieval testing ( 24 h after acquisition ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These improvements or normalizations of impaired cognitive functions were seen at oral aniracetam doses of 10 - 100 mg / kg .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Generally , the dose - response curves were bell - shaped .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The mechanisms underlying the activity of aniracetam and its ' therapeutic window ' are unknown .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Piracetam , another pyrrolidinone derivative was used for comparison .
B O O B O O O O O O
It was active only in six of nine tests and had about one - tenth the potency of aniracetam .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The results indicate that aniracetam improves cognitive functions which are impaired by different procedure and in different phases of the learning and memory process .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Nicotine potentiation of morphine - induced catalepsy in mice .
B O O B O O O O O O
In the present study , effects of nicotine on catalepsy induced by morphine in mice have been investigated .
O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O
Morphine but not nicotine induced a dose - dependent catalepsy .
B O O B O O O O O O O
The response of morphine was potentiated by nicotine .
O O O B O O O B O
Intraperitoneal administration of atropine , naloxone , mecamylamine , and hexamethonium to mice reduced catalepsy induced by a combination of morphine with nicotine .
O O O B O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O
Intracerebroventricular injection of atropine , hexamethonium , and naloxone also decreased catalepsy induced by morphine plus nicotine .
O O O B O B O O B O O O O O B O B O
Intraperitoneal administration of atropine , but not intraperitoneal or intracerebroventricular injection of hexamethonium , decreased the effect of a single dose of morphine .
O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O
It was concluded that morphine catalepsy can be elicited by opioid and cholinergic receptors , and the potentiation of morphine induced by nicotine may also be mediated through cholinergic receptor
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O
mechanisms .
O O
Reduced cardiotoxicity and preserved antitumor efficacy of liposome - encapsulated doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide compared with conventional doxorubicin and cyclophosphamide in a randomized , multicenter trial of metastatic breast cancer .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
To determine whether Myocet ( liposome - encapsulated doxorubicin ; The Liposome Company , Elan Corporation , Princeton , NJ ) in combination with cyclophosphamide significantly reduces doxorubicin cardiotoxicity while
O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O
providing comparable antitumor efficacy in first - line treatment of metastatic breast cancer ( MBC ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS AND METHODS :
O O O O
Two hundred ninety - seven patients with MBC and no prior chemotherapy for metastatic disease were randomized to receive either 60 mg / m ( 2 ) of Myocet (
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
M ) or conventional doxorubicin ( A ) , in combination with 600 mg / m ( 2 ) of cyclophosphamide ( C ) , every 3 weeks until disease
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
progression or unacceptable toxicity .
O O O O O
Cardiotoxicity was defined by reductions in left - ventricular ejection fraction , assessed by serial multigated radionuclide angiography scans , or congestive heart failure ( CHF ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Antitumor efficacy was assessed by objective tumor response rates ( World Health Organization criteria ) , time to progression , and survival .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Six percent of MC patients versus 21 % ( including five cases of CHF ) of AC patients developed cardiotoxicity ( P = . 0002 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Median cumulative doxorubicin dose at onset was more than 2 , 220 mg / m ( 2 ) for MC versus 480 mg / m ( 2 ) for AC
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
( P = . 0001
O O O O O
, hazard ratio , 5 . 04 ) .
O O O O O O O O O
MC patients also experienced less grade 4 neutropenia .
O O O O O O O O O
Antitumor efficacy of MC versus AC was comparable : objective response rates , 43 % versus 43 % ; median time to progression , 5 . 1 % versus 5
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 5 months ; median time to treatment failure , 4 . 6 versus 4 . 4 months ; and median survival , 19 versus 16 months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Myocet improves the therapeutic index of doxorubicin by significantly reducing cardiotoxicity and grade 4 neutropenia and provides comparable antitumor efficacy , when used in combination with cyclophosphamide as first -
B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
line therapy for MBC .
O O O O O
Protective effect of a specific platelet - activating factor antagonist , BN 52021 , on bupivacaine - induced cardiovascular impairments in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O B O O O O O O O
Administration of the local anaesthetic bupivacaine ( 1 . 5 or 2 mg / kg , i . v . ) to rats elicited a marked decrease of mean arterial
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
blood pressure ( MBP ) and heart rate ( HR ) leading to death ( in 67 % or 90 % of animals respectively ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intravenous injection of the specific platelet - activating factor ( PAF ) antagonist BN 52021 ( 10 mg / kg ) , 30 min before bupivacaine administration ( 2 mg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
/ kg i . v . ) suppressed both the decrease of MBP and HR .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , doses of 1 mg / kg BN 52021 given 30 min before or 10 mg / kg administered 5 min before i . v .
O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
injection of bupivacaine were ineffective .
O O B O O O
When BN 52021 ( 20 mg / kg i . v . ) was injected immediately after bupivacaine ( 2 mg / kg ) , a partial reversion of the
O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
decrease of MBP and HR was observed , whereas the dose of 10 mg / kg was ineffective .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A partial recovery of bupivacaine - induced ECG alterations was observed after pretreatment of the rats with BN 52021 .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
Since the administration of BN 52021 , at all doses studied , did not alter MBP and HR at the doses used , the bulk of these results clearly demonstrate
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
a protective action of BN 52021 , a specific antagonist of PAF , against bupivacaine - induced cardiovascular toxicity .
O O O O B I O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Thus , consistent with its direct effect on heart , PAF appears to be implicated in bupivacaine - induced cardiovascular alterations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Benzylacyclouridine reverses azidothymidine - induced marrow suppression without impairment of anti - human immunodeficiency virus activity .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Increased extracellular concentrations of uridine
O O O O B
( Urd ) have been reported to reduce , in vitro , azidothymidine ( AZT ) - induced inhibition of human granulocyte - macrophage progenitor cells without impairment of its
O B O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
antihuman immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) activity .
O O O O O O O O
Because of the clinical toxicities associated with chronic Urd administration , the ability of benzylacyclouridine ( BAU ) to effect , in vivo , AZT - induced anemia and leukopenia
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O
was assessed .
O O O
This agent inhibits Urd catabolism and , in vivo , increases the plasma concentration of Urd in a dose - dependent manner , without Urd - related toxicity .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O
In mice rendered anemic and leukopenic by the administration of AZT for 28 days in drinking water ( 1 . 5 mg / mL ) , the continued administration of
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
AZT plus daily BAU ( 300 mg / kg , orally ) partially reversed AZT - induced anemia and leukopenia ( P less than . 05 ) , increased peripheral
B O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
reticulocytes ( to 4 . 9 % , P less than . 01 ) , increased cellularity in the marrow , and improved megaloblastosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When coadministered with AZT from the onset of drug administration , BAU reduced AZT - induced marrow toxicity .
O O O B O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
In vitro , at a concentration of 100 mumol / L , BAU possesses minimal anti - HIV activity and has no effect on the ability of AZT to reverse
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
the HIV - induced cytopathic effect in MT4 cells .
O O O O O O O O O O
The clinical and biochemical implications of these findings are discussed .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Cyclophosphamide - induced cystitis in freely - moving conscious rats : behavioral approach to a new model of visceral pain .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
To develop a model of visceral pain in rats using a behavioral approach .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cyclophosphamide ( CP ) , an antitumoral agent known to produce toxic effects on the bladder wall through its main toxic metabolite acrolein , was used to induce cystitis .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
MATERIALS AND METHODS :
O O O O
CP was administered at doses of 50 , 100 and 200 mg . / kg .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
i . p .
O O O O
to male rats , and their behavior observed and scored .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The effects of morphine ( 0 . 5 to 4 mg . / kg . i . v . ) on CP - induced behavioral modifications were tested administered alone
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
and after naloxone ( 1 mg . / kg . s . c . ) .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , 90 minutes after CP injection , that is , at the time of administration of morphine , the bladder was removed in some rats for histological examination
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Finally , to show that the bladder is essential for the CP - induced behavioral modifications , female rats also received CP at doses of 200 mg . / kg
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
.
O
i . p .
O O O O
and of 20 mg .
O O O O O
by the intravesical route , and acrolein at doses of 0 . 5 mg .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
by the intravesical route and of 5 mg . / kg . i . v .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
CP dose - relatedly induced marked behavioral modifications in male rats : breathing rate decrease , closing of the eyes and occurrence of specific postures .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Morphine dose - dependently reversed these behavioral disorders .
B O O O O O O O O
A dose of 0 . 5 mg . / kg . produced a reduction of almost 50 % of the behavioral score induced by CP 200 mg . / kg
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
.
O
This effect was completely prevented by pretreatment with naloxone .
O O O O O O O O B O
At the time of administration of morphine , histological modifications of the bladder wall , such as chorionic and muscle layer edema , were observed .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In female rats , CP 200 mg . / kg .
O O O O B O O O O O O
i . p .
O O O O
produced the same marked behavioral modifications as those observed in male rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Administered at the dose of 20 mg .
O O O O O O O O
intravesically , CP did not produce any behavioral effects , whereas acrolein at 0 . 5 mg .
O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
intravesically induced behavioral modifications identical to those under CP 200 mg . / kg .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
i . p .
O O O O
, with the same maximal levels .
O O O O O O O
Conversely , acrolein 5 mg . / kg . i . v . did not produce any behavioral effects at all .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Overall , these results indicate that this experimental model of CP - induced cystitis may be an interesting new behavioral model of inflammatory visceral pain , allowing a better understanding
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of these painful syndromes and thus a better therapeutic approach to them .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hyperalgesia and myoclonus in terminal cancer patients treated with continuous intravenous morphine .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Eight cancer patients in the terminal stages of the disease treated with high doses of intravenous morphine developed hyperalgesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
All cases were retrospectively sampled from three different hospitals in Copenhagen .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Five patients developed universal hyperalgesia and hyperesthesia which in 2 cases were accompanied by myoclonus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 3 patients a pre - existing neuralgia increased to excruciating intensity and in 2 of these cases myoclonus occurred simultaneously .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although only few clinical descriptions of the relationship between hyperalgesia / myoclonus and high doses of morphine are available , experimental support from animal studies indicates that morphine , or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
its metabolites , plays a causative role for the observed behavioural syndrome .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The possible mechanisms are discussed and treatment proposals given suggesting the use of more efficacious opioids with less excitatory potency in these situations .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A prospective study of adverse reactions associated with vancomycin therapy .
O O O O O O O O B O O
A prospective evaluation of the efficacy and safety of vancomycin was conducted in 54 consecutive patients over a 16 - month period .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Vancomycin was curative in 95 % of 43 patients with proven infection .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Drugs were ceased in six patients because of adverse reactions ; in three of these vancomycin was considered the likely cause .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Reactions included thrombophlebitis ( 20 of 54 patients ) , rash ( 4 of 54 ) , nephrotoxicity ( 4 of 50 ) , proteinuria ( 1 of 50 )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and ototoxicity ( 1 of 11 patients tested by audiometry ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thrombophlebitis occurred only with infusion through peripheral cannulae ; nephrotoxicity and ototoxicity were confined to patients receiving an aminoglycoside plus vancomycin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
We conclude that vancomycin , administered appropriately , constitutes safe , effective therapy for infections caused by susceptible bacteria .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Blockade of both D - 1 and D - 2 dopamine receptors may induce catalepsy in mice .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
1 .
O O
The catalepsy induced by dopamine antagonists has been tested and the possible dopamine subtypes involved in catalepsy was determined .
O O O O B O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
2 .
O O
Dopamine antagonist fluphenazine , D - 1 antagonist SCH 23390 or D - 2 antagonist sulpiride induced catalepsy .
B O B O O O O O B I O O O O O B O O O
The effect of fluphenazine and sulpiride was dose - dependent .
O O O B O B O O O O O
Combination of SCH 23390 with sulpiride did not induce catalepsy potentiation .
O O B I O B O O O O O O
3 . D - 1
O O O O O
agonist SKF 38393 or D - 2 agonist quinpirole decreased the catalepsy induced by fluphenazine , SCH 23390 or sulpiride .
O B I O O O O O B O O O O O B O B I O B O
4 .
O O
Combination of SKF 38393 with quinpirole did not cause potentiated inhibitory effect on catalepsy induced by dopamine antagonists .
O O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O
5 .
O O
The data may indicate that although D - 2 receptor blockade is involved in catalepsy , the D - 1 receptor may plan a role .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dextran - etodolac conjugates : synthesis , in vitro and in vivo evaluation .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Etodolac ( E ) , is a non - narcotic analgesic and antiinflammatory drug .
B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
A biodegradable polymer dextran has been utilized as a carrier for synthesis of etodolac - dextran conjugates ( ED ) to improve its aqueous solubility and reduce gastrointestinal side effects
O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
An activated moiety , i . e . N - acylimidazole derivative of etodolac ( EAI ) , was condensed with the polysaccharide polymer dextran of different molecular weights (
O O O O O O O O B I I O O B O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
40000 , 60000 , 110000 and 200000 ) .
O O O O O O O O O
IR spectral data confirmed formation of ester bonding in the conjugates .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
Etodolac contents were evaluated by UV - spectrophotometric analysis .
B O O O O O O O O O
The molecular weights were determined by measuring viscosity using the Mark - Howink - Sakurada equation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In vitro hydrolysis of ED was done in aqueous buffers ( pH 1 . 2 , 7 . 4 , 9 ) and in 80 % ( v / v
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) human plasma ( pH 7 . 4 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
At pH 9 , a higher rate of etodolac release from ED was observed as compared to aqueous buffer of pH 7 . 4 and 80 % human plasma (
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pH 7 . 4 ) , following first - order kinetics .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
In vivo investigations were performed in animals .
O O O O O O O O
Acute analgesic and antiinflammatory activities were ascertained using acetic acid induced writhing model ( mice ) and carrageenan - induced rat paw edema model , respectively .
O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
In comparison to control , E and ED1 - ED4 showed highly significant analgesic and antiinflammatory activities ( p < 0 . 001 ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Biological evaluation suggested that conjugates ( ED1 - ED4 ) retained comparable analgesic and antiinflammatory activities with remarkably reduced ulcerogenicity as compared to their parent drug - - etodolac .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Hypersensitivity myocarditis complicating hypertrophic cardiomyopathy heart .
O O O O O O O
The present report describes a case of eosinophilic myocarditis complicating hypertrophic cardiomyopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The 47 - year - old female patient , known to have hypertrophic cardiomyopathy , was admitted with biventricular failure and managed aggressively with dobutamine infusion and other drugs while
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
being assessed for heart transplantation .
O O O O O O
On transthoracic echocardiogram , she had moderate left ventricular dysfunction with regional variability and moderate mitral regurgitation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The recipient 's heart showed the features of apical hypertrophic cardiomyopathy and myocarditis with abundant eosinophils .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Myocarditis is rare and eosinophilic myocarditis is rarer .
O O O O O O O O O
It is likely that the hypersensitivity ( eosinophilic ) myocarditis was related to dobutamine infusion therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Eosinophilic myocarditis has been reported with an incidence of 2 . 4 % to 7 . 2 % in explanted hearts and may be related to multidrug therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All - trans - retinoic acid - induced erythema nodosum in patients with acute promyelocytic leukemia .
B I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O
Erythema nodosum associated with all - trans - retinoic acid ( ATRA ) for acute promyelocytic leukemia ( APL ) is very rare .
O O O O B I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
We describe four patients with classic APL who developed erythema nodosum during ATRA therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Fever and subsequent multiple painful erythematous nodules over extremities developed on D11 , D16 , D17 , and D19 , respectively , after ATRA therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The skin biopsy taken from each patient was consistent with erythema nodosum .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All patients received short course of steroids .
O O O O O O B O
Fever subsided rapidly and the skin lesions regressed completely .
O O O O O O O O O O
All patients achieved complete remission without withdrawal of ATRA .
O O O O O O O O B O
ATRA seemed to be the most possible etiology of erythema nodosum in our patients .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Short - term use of steroid is very effective in ATRA - induced erythema nodosum .
O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O
Delayed - onset heparin - induced thrombocytopenia .
O O O B O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Heparin - induced thrombocytopenia presents 5 to 12 days after heparin exposure , with or without arterial or venous thromboemboli .
B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Delayed recognition and treatment of heparin - induced thrombocytopenia contribute to poor patient outcomes .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To describe and increase awareness of a clinical scenario in which the onset or manifestations of heparin - induced thrombocytopenia are delayed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
DESIGN :
O O
Retrospective case series .
O O O O
SETTING :
O O
Three large urban hospitals ( with active cardiovascular surgery programs ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS :
O O
14 patients seen over a 3 - year period in whom heparin - induced thrombocytopenia became apparent on delayed presentation with thromboembolic complications .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
MEASUREMENTS :
O O
Platelet counts , onset of objectively determined thromboembolism , results of heparin - induced platelet factor 4 antibody tests , and outcomes .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Patients went home after hospitalizations that had included heparin exposure - - in most cases , with no thrombocytopenia recognized - - only to return to the hospital ( median
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, day 14 ) with thromboembolic complications .
O O O O O O O O
Thromboemboli were venous ( 12 patients , 7 with pulmonary emboli ) or arterial ( 4 patients ) or both .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Platelet counts were mildly decreased in all but 2 patients on second presentation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On readmission , 11 patients received therapeutic heparin , which worsened the patients ' clinical condition and , in all 11 cases , decreased the platelet count ( mean at
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
readmission , 143 x 10 ( 9 ) cells / L ; mean nadir after heparin re - exposure , 39 x 10 ( 9 ) cells / L )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Results of serologic tests for heparin - induced antibodies were positive in all patients .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Subsequent treatments included alternative anticoagulants ( 11 patients ) , thrombolytic drugs ( 3 patients ) , inferior vena cava filters ( 3 patients ) and , eventually ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
warfarin ( 11 patients ) .
B O O O O O
Three patients died .
O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Delayed - onset heparin - induced thrombocytopenia is increasingly being recognized .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
To avoid disastrous outcomes , physicians must consider heparin - induced thrombocytopenia whenever a recently hospitalized patient returns with thromboembolism ; therapy with alternative anticoagulants , not heparin , should
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
be initiated .
O O O
Valsartan , a new angiotensin II antagonist for the treatment of essential hypertension : a comparative study of the efficacy and safety against amlodipine .
B O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To compare the antihypertensive efficacy of a new angiotensin II antagonist , valsartan , with a reference therapy , amlodipine .
O O O O O O O O B I O O B O O O O O O B O
METHODS :
O O
One hundred sixty - eight adult outpatients with mild to moderate hypertension were randomly allocated in double - blind fashion and equal number to receive 80 mg valsartan or 5
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
mg amlodipine for 12 weeks .
O B O O O O
After 8 weeks of therapy , in patients whose blood pressure remained uncontrolled , 5 mg amlodipine was added to the initial therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Patients were assessed at 4 , 8 , and 12 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The primary efficacy variable was change from baseline in mean sitting diastolic blood pressure at 8 weeks .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Secondary variables included change in sitting systolic blood pressure and responder rates .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Both valsartan and amlodipine were effective at lowering blood pressure at 4 , 8 , and 12 weeks .
O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Similar decreases were observed in both groups , with no statistically significant differences between the groups for any variable analyzed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
For the primary variable the difference was 0 . 5 mm Hg in favor of valsartan ( p = 0 . 68 ; 95 % confidence interval , - 2
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 7 to 1 . 7 ) .
O O O O O O O O
Responder rates at 8 weeks were 66 . 7 % for valsartan and 60 . 2 % for amlodipine ( p = 0 . 39 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Both treatments were well tolerated .
O O O O O O
The incidence of drug - related dependent edema was somewhat higher in the amlodipine group , particularly at a dose of 10 mg per day ( 2 . 4 %
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
for 80 mg valsartan ; 3 . 6 % for 5 mg amlodipine ; 0 % for valsartan plus 5 mg amlodipine ; 14 . 3 % for 10 mg
O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O
amlodipine ) .
B O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
The data show that valsartan is at least as effective as amlodipine in the treatment of mild to moderate hypertension .
O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The results also show valsartan to be well tolerated and suggest that it is not associated with side effects characteristic of this comparator class , dihydropyridine calcium antagonists .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B B O O
KF17837 : a novel selective adenosine A2A receptor antagonist with anticataleptic activity .
B O O O O B O O O O O O O
KF17837 is a novel selective adenosine A2A receptor antagonist .
B O O O O B O O O O
Oral administration of KF17837 ( 2 . 5 , 10 . 0 and 30 . 0 mg / kg ) significantly ameliorated the cataleptic responses induced by intracerebroventricular administration of
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
an adenosine A2A receptor agonist , CGS 21680 ( 10 micrograms ) , in a dose - dependent manner .
O B O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
KF17837 also reduced the catalepsy induced by haloperidol ( 1 mg / kg i . p . ) and by reserpine ( 5 mg / kg i . p .
B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
) .
O O
These anticataleptic effects were exhibited dose dependently at doses from 0 . 625 and 2 . 5 mg / kg p . o . , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Moreover , KF17837 ( 0 . 625 mg / kg p . o . )
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
potentiated the anticataleptic effects of a subthreshold dose of L - 3 , 4 - dihydroxyphenylalanine ( L - DOPA ; 25 mg / kg i . p . )
O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I O B I I O O O O O O O O O O
plus benserazide ( 6 . 25 mg / kg i . p . ) .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results suggested that KF17837 is a centrally active adenosine A2A receptor antagonist and that the dopaminergic function of the nigrostriatal pathway is potentiated by adenosine A2A receptor antagonists .
