O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Furthermore , KF17837 may be a useful drug in the treatment of parkinsonism .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Some central effects of repeated treatment with fluvoxamine .
O O O O O O O B O
We investigated the effect of repeated treatment with fluvoxamine , a selective serotonin uptake inhibitor , on behavioral effects of dopaminomimetics and methoxamine and on the animal behavior in the
O O O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
"""" behavioral despair """" test .
O O O O O O
A repeated treatment with fluvoxamine ( twice daily for 14 days ) potentiated in mice and in rats ( weaker ) the amphetamine - induced hyperactivity .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The hyperactivity induced by nomifensine in mice remained unaffected by fluvoxamine .
O O O O B O O O O O B O
The stimulation of locomotor activity by intracerebroventricularly administered methoxamine was not affected by repeated treatment with fluvoxamine .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O B O
Given three times fluvoxamine had no effect on the immobilization time in the """" behavioral despair """" test in rats .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The results indicate that fluvoxamine given repeatedly acts differently than citalopram , another selective serotonin uptake inhibitor , and differs also from other antidepressant drugs .
O O O O B O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Severe congestive heart failure patient on amiodarone presenting with myxedemic coma : a case report .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
This is a case report of myxedema coma secondary to amiodarone - induced hypothyroidism in a patient with severe congestive heart failure ( CHF ) .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To our knowledge and after reviewing the literature there is one case report of myxedema coma during long term amiodarone therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Myxedema coma is a life threatening condition that carries a mortality reaching as high as 20 % with treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The condition is treated with intravenous thyroxine ( T4 ) or intravenous tri - iodo - thyronine ( T3 ) .
O O O O O O B O B O O O B I I I I O B O O
Patients with CHF on amiodarone may suffer serious morbidity and mortality from hypothyroidism , and thus may deserve closer follow up for thyroid stimulating hormone ( TSH ) levels .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This case report carries an important clinical application given the frequent usage of amiodarone among CHF patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The myriad clinical presentation of myxedema coma and its serious morbidity and mortality stresses the need to suspect this clinical syndrome among CHF patients presenting with hypotension , weakness or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
other unexplained symptoms .
O O O O
Fear - potentiated startle , but not light - enhanced startle , is enhanced by anxiogenic drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RATIONALE AND OBJECTIVES : The light - enhanced startle paradigm ( LES ) is suggested to model anxiety , because of the non - specific cue and the long -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
term effect .
O O O
In contrast , the fear - potentiated startle ( FPS ) is suggested to model conditioned fear .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , the pharmacological profiles of these two paradigms are very similar .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The present study investigated the effects of putative anxiogenic drugs on LES and FPS and aimed at determining the sensitivity of LES for anxiogenic drugs and to potentially showing a
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pharmacological differentiation between these two paradigms .
O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
Male Wistar rats received each dose of the alpha ( 2 ) - adrenoceptor antagonist yohimbine ( 0 . 25 - 1 . 0mg / kg ) , the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 - HT ( 2C ) receptor agonist m - chlorophenylpiperazine ( mCPP , 0 . 5 - 2 . 0mg / kg ) or the GABA ( A )
B I I O O O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
inverse receptor agonist pentylenetetrazole ( PTZ , 3 - 30mg / kg ) and were subsequently tested in either LES or FPS .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
None of the drugs enhanced LES , whereas mCPP increased percentage FPS and yohimbine increased absolute FPS values .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O
Furthermore , yohimbine increased baseline startle amplitude in the LES , while mCPP suppressed baseline startle in both the LES and FPS and PTZ suppressed baseline startle in the FPS
O O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
.
O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
In contrast to findings in the FPS paradigm , none of the drugs were able to exacerbate the LES response .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thus , a clear pharmacological differentiation was found between LES and FPS .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Proteinase 3 - antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody - ( PR3 - ANCA ) positive necrotizing glomerulonephritis after restarting sulphasalazine treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
A 59 - year - old woman with ulcerative colitis developed red eyes , pleural effusion , eosinophilia and urinary abnormalities after restarting of sulphasalazine treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Light microscopy of a kidney biopsy revealed segmental necrotizing glomerulonephritis without deposition of immunoglobulin or complement .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Proteinase 3 - antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody ( PR3 - ANCA ) titer was elevated at 183 ELISA units ( EU ) in sera ( normal range less than 10 EU
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) , myeloperoxidase - ANCA was negative .
O O O O O O O O
PR3 - ANCA titer was 250 and 1 , 070 EU in pleural effusions on right and left side , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although cessation of sulphasalazine treatment resulted in improvements in fever , red eyes , chest pain , titer of C - reactive protein and volume of the pleural effusions ,
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
we initiated steroid therapy , because PR3 - ANCA titer rose to 320 EU , eosinophil count increased to 1 , 100 cells / microl , and the pleural effusion
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
remained .
O O
One month after steroid therapy , the pleural effusion disappeared , and PR3 - ANCA titer normalized 3 months later .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This case suggests that sulphasalazine can induce PR3 - ANCA - positive necrotizing glomerulonephritis .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Is phenytoin administration safe in a hypothermic child ?
O B O O O O O O O
A male neonate with a Chiari malformation and a leaking myelomeningocoele underwent ventriculoperitoneal shunt insertion followed by repair of myelomeningocoele .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
During anaesthesia and surgery , he inadvertently became moderately hypothermic .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Intravenous phenytoin was administered during the later part of the surgery for seizure prophylaxis .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Following phenytoin administration , the patient developed acute severe bradycardia , refractory to atropine and adrenaline .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
The cardiac depressant actions of phenytoin and hypothermia can be additive .
O O O O O B O O O O O O
Administration of phenytoin in the presence of hypothermia may lead to an adverse cardiac event in children .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As phenytoin is a commonly used drug , clinicians need to be aware of this interaction .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Amisulpride related tic - like symptoms in an adolescent schizophrenic .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Tic disorders can be effectively treated by atypical antipsychotics such as risperidone , olanzapine and ziprasidone .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O B O
However , there are two case reports that show tic - like symptoms , including motor and phonic variants , occurring during treatment with quetiapine or clozapine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O
We present a 15 - year - old girl schizophrenic who developed frequent involuntary eye - blinking movements after 5 months of amisulpride treatment ( 1000 mg per day )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
.
O
The tic - like symptoms resolved completely after we reduced the dose of amisulpride down to 800 mg per day .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
However , her psychosis recurred after the dose reduction .
O O O O O O O O O O
We then placed her on an additional 100 mg per day of quetiapine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
She has been in complete remission under the combined medications for more than one year and maintains a fair role function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
No more tic - like symptoms or other side effects have been reported .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Together with previously reported cases , our patient suggests that tic - like symptoms might occur in certain vulnerable individuals during treatment with atypical antipsychotics such as quetiapine ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
clozapine , or amisulpride .
B O O B O
Comparison of developmental toxicology of aspirin ( acetylsalicylic acid ) in rats using selected dosing paradigms .
O O O O O B O B I O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Analysis of the literature for nonsteroidal anti - inflammatory drugs ( NSAIDs ) suggests that a low incidence of developmental anomalies occurs in rats given NSAIDs on specific days during
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
organogenesis .
O O
Aspirin ( acetylsalicylic acid [ ASA ] ) , an irreversible cyclooxygenase 1 and 2 inhibitor , induces developmental anomalies when administered to Wistar rats on gestational day ( GD
B O B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) 9 , 10 , or 11 ( Kimmel CA , Wilson JG , Schumacher HJ .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Teratology 4 : 15 - 24 , 1971 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O
There are no published ASA studies using the multiple dosing paradigm of GDs 6 to 17 .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Objectives of the current study were to compare results between Sprague - Dawley ( SD ) and Wistar strains when ASA is administered on GD 9 , 10 , or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
11 ; to compare the malformation patterns following single and multiple dosings during organogenesis in SD rats ; and to test the hypothesis that maternal gastrointestinal toxicity confounds the detection
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of low incidence malformations with ASA when a multiple dosing paradigm is used .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
METHODS :
O O
ASA was administered as a single dose on GD 9 ( 0 , 250 , 500 , or 625 mg / kg ) , 10 ( 0 , 500 ,
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
625 , or 750 mg / kg ) , or 11 ( 0 , 500 , 750 , or 1000 mg / kg ) and from GD 6 to GD
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
17 ( 0 , 50 , 125 , or 250 mg / kg a day ) in the multiple dose study to SD rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Animals were killed on GD 21 , and fetuses were examined viscerally .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
The literature evaluation suggested that NSAIDs induce ventricular septal defects ( VSDs ) and midline defects ( MDs ) in rats and diaphragmatic hernia ( DH ) , MDs ,
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and VSDs in rabbits ( Cook JC et al . , 2003 ) ; hence , the present study focused on these malformations , even though ASA induces several other
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
low - incidence malformations .
O O O O O
In single dose studies , DH , MD , and VSD were induced on GDs 9 and 10 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
VSD also was noted following treatment on GD 11 .
O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , DH and MD were noted in the multiple dose study design only in the high - dose group , and VSD was noted across all dose groups
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
High concordance in major developmental anomalies between Wistar and SD rats were noted with the exception of VSD in the SD rats and hydrocephalus in the Wistar rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Variations and malformations were similar when ASA was administered as a single dose or during the period of organogenesis ( GDs 6 to 17 ) .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It was also evident that , by titrating the dose to achieve a maximum tolerated dose , malformations that normally occur at low incidence , as reported from previous single
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
dose studies , could also be induced with ASA given at multiple doses .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Torsade de pointes induced by metoclopramide in an elderly woman with preexisting complete left bundle branch block .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
There is a growing list of drugs implicated in acquired long QT syndrome and torsade de pointes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , the torsadogenic potential of metoclopramide , a commonly used antiemetic and prokinetic drug , has not been reported in the literature , despite its chemical similarity to
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
procainamide .
B O
We report on a 92 - year - old woman with preexisting complete left bundle branch block who developed torsade de pointes after intravenous and oral administration of metoclopramide .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
This patient also developed torsade de pointes when cisapride and erythromycin were given simultaneously .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O
These two episodes were suppressed successfully after discontinuing the offending drugs and administering class IB drugs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This is the first documentation that metoclopramide provokes torsade de pointes clinically .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Metoclopramide should be used cautiously in patients with a risk of torsade de pointes .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Apomorphine : an underutilized therapy for Parkinson 's disease .
B O O O O O O O O O
Apomorphine was the first dopaminergic drug ever used to treat symptoms of Parkinson 's disease .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
While powerful antiparkinsonian effects had been observed as early as 1951 , the potential of treating fluctuating Parkinson 's disease by subcutaneous administration of apomorphine has only recently become the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
subject of systematic study .
O O O O O
A number of small scale clinical trials have unequivocally shown that intermittent subcutaneous apomorphine injections produce antiparkinsonian benefit close if not identical to that seen with levodopa and that
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
apomorphine rescue injections can reliably revert off - periods even in patients with complex on - off motor swings .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Continuous subcutaneous apomorphine infusions can reduce daily off - time by more than 50 % in this group of patients , which appears to be a stronger effect than that
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
generally seen with add - on therapy with oral dopamine agonists or COMT inhibitors .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Extended follow - up studies of up to 8 years have demonstrated long - term persistence of apomorphine efficacy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
In addition , there is convincing clinical evidence that monotherapy with continuous subcutaneous apomorphine infusions is associated with marked reductions of preexisting levodopa - induced dyskinesias .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The main side effects of subcutaneous apomorphine treatment are related to cutaneous tolerability problems , whereas sedation and psychiatric complications play a lesser role .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Given the marked degree of efficacy of subcutaneous apomorphine treatment in fluctuating Parkinson 's disease , this approach seems to deserve more widespread clinical use .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fatal excited delirium following cocaine use :
O O O O B O O
epidemiologic findings provide new evidence for mechanisms of cocaine toxicity .
O O O O O O O O B O O
We describe an outbreak of deaths from cocaine - induced excited delirium ( EDDs ) in Dade County , Florida between 1979 and 1990 .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
From a registry of all cocaine - related deaths in Dade County , Florida , from 1969 - 1990 , 58 EDDs were compared with 125 victims of accidental
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cocaine overdose without excited delirium .
B O O O O O
Compared with controls , EDDs were more frequently black , male , and younger .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
They were less likely to have a low body mass index , and more likely to have died in police custody , to have received medical treatment immediately before death
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, to have survived for a longer period , to have developed hyperthermia , and to have died in summer months .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
EDDs had concentrations of cocaine and benzoylecgonine in autopsy blood that were similar to those for controls .
O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The epidemiologic findings are most consistent with the hypothesis that chronic cocaine use disrupts dopaminergic function and , when coupled with recent cocaine use , may precipitate agitation , delirium
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
, aberrant thermoregulation , rhabdomyolysis , and sudden death .
O O O O O O O O O O
Heparin - induced thrombocytopenia , thrombosis , and hemorrhage .
B O O O O O O O O O
Sixty - two patients with a heparin - induced thrombocytopenia are reported .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Clinical manifestations of this disorder include hemorrhage or , more frequently , thromboembolic events in patients receiving heparin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Laboratory testing has revealed a falling platelet count , increased resistance to heparin , and aggregation of platelets by the patient 's plasma when heparin is added .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Immunologic testing has demonstrated the presence of a heparin - dependent platelet membrane antibody .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The 20 deaths , 52 hemorrhagic and thromboembolic complications , and 21 surgical procedures to manage the complications confirm the seriousness of the disorder .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Specific risk factors have not been identified ; therefore , all patients receiving heparin should be monitored .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
If the platelet count falls to less than 100 , 000 / mm3 , while the patient is receiving heparin , platelet aggregation testing , using the patient 's plasma
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
, is indicated .
O O O O
Management consists of cessation of heparin , platelet anti - aggregating agents , and alternate forms of anticoagulation when indicated .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cardiac toxicity of 5 - fluorouracil .
O O O B I I O
Report of a case of spontaneous angina .
O O O O O O O O
We report a case of a patient with colon carcinoma and liver metastasis who presented chest pain after 5 - fluorouracil ( 5 - FU ) administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O B I I O O O
Clinical electrocardiographic evolution was similar to that observed in Prinzmetal 's angina , and chest pain promptly resolved with nifedipine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
These data suggest that coronary spasm may be the cause of cardiotoxicity due to 5 - FU , and that calcium antagonists may probably be used in the prevention or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O B O O O O O O O O O
treatment of 5 - FU cardiotoxicity .
O O B I I O O
Toxicity due to remission inducing drugs in rheumatoid arthritis .
O O O O O O O O O O
Association with HLA - B35 and Cw4 antigens .
O O O O O O O O O
Twenty - five patients with rheumatoid arthritis ( RA ) who developed toxicity while taking remission inducing drugs and 30 without toxicity were studied for possible associations with class I
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
and II HLA antigens .
O O O O O
A strong association has been found between nephritis and dermatitis due to Tiopronin ( a D - Penicillamine like compound ) and class I antigens B35 - Cw4 , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O
between dermatitis due to gold thiosulphate and B35 .
O O O O B B O O O
Compared to healthy controls a lower DR5 frequency was observed in patients with RA except for the Tiopronin related nephritis group .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Transient hemiparesis : a rare manifestation of diphenylhydantoin toxicity .
O O O O O O O B O O
Report of two cases .
O O O O O
Among the common side effects of diphenylhydantoin ( DPH ) overdose , the most frequently encountered neurological signs are those of cerebellar dysfunction .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Very rarely , the toxic neurological manifestations of this drug are of cerebral origin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two patients are presented who suffered progressive hemiparesis due to DPH overdose .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Both had brain surgery before DPH treatment .
O O O O O B O O
It is assumed that patients with some cerebral damage are liable to manifest DPH toxicity as focal neurological signs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Nerve growth factor and prostaglandins in the urine of female patients with overactive bladder .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
PURPOSE :
O O
NGF and PGs in the bladder can be affected by pathological changes in the bladder and these changes can be detected in urine .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We investigated changes in urinary NGF and PGs in women with OAB .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O
MATERIALS AND METHODS :
O O O O
The study groups included 65 women with OAB and 20 without bladder symptoms who served as controls .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Evaluation included patient history , urinalysis , a voiding diary and urodynamic studies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urine samples were collected .
O O O O O
NGF , PGE2 , PGF2alpha
O O B O B
and PGI2 were measured using enzyme - linked immunosorbent assay and compared between the groups .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , correlations between urinary NGF and PG , and urodynamic parameters in patients with OAB were examined .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Urinary NGF , PGE2 and PGF2alpha were significantly increased in patients with OAB compared with controls ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , urinary PGI2 was not different between controls and patients with OAB .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
In patients with OAB urinary PGE2 positively correlated with volume at first desire to void and maximum cystometric capacity ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urinary NGF ,
O O O
PGF2alpha
B
and PGI2 did not correlate with urodynamic parameters in patients with OAB .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
NGF and PGs have important roles in the development of OAB symptoms in female patients .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Urinary levels of these factors may be used as markers to evaluate OAB symptoms .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute low back pain during intravenous administration of amiodarone : a report of two cases .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Amiodarone represents an effective antiarrhythmic drug for cardioversion of recent - onset atrial fibrillation ( AF ) and maintenance of sinus rhythm .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We briefly describe two patients suffering from recent - onset atrial fibrillation , who experienced an acute devastating low back pain a few minutes after initiation of intravenous amiodarone loading
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
.
O
Notably , this side effect has not been ever reported in the medical literature .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Clinicians should be aware of this reaction since prompt termination of parenteral administration leads to complete resolution .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Postoperative myalgia after succinylcholine : no evidence for an inflammatory origin .
O O O B O O O O O O O O
A common side effect associated with succinylcholine is postoperative myalgia .
O O O O O O B O O O O
The pathogenesis of this myalgia is still unclear ; inflammation has been suggested but without convincing evidence .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We designed the present study to investigate whether an inflammatory reaction contributes to this myalgia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence and severity of succinylcholine - associated myalgia was determined in 64 patients pretreated with saline or dexamethasone before succinylcholine ( n = 32 for each ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
Incidence and severity of myalgia did not differ significantly between the two groups : 15 patients in the dexamethasone group complained of myalgia compared with 18 patients in the saline
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
group , and severe myalgia was reported by five patients and three patients , respectively ( not significant ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At 48 h after surgery , 12 patients in both groups still suffered from myalgia ( not significant ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , interleukin - 6 ( IL - 6 ) as an early marker of inflammation was assessed in a subgroup of 10 patients pretreated with saline .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We found an increase of IL - 6 for only three patients , but only one patient reported myalgia ; no relationship between myalgia and the increase of IL -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
6 was found .
O O O O
In conclusion , there is no evidence for an inflammatory origin of succinylcholine - associated myalgia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
IMPLICATIONS :
O O
Administration of dexamethasone before succinylcholine was not effective in decreasing the incidence or the severity of succinylcholine - induced postoperative myalgia .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Furthermore , there was no significant relationship between postoperative myalgia and time course of interleukin - 6 concentrations , a marker of inflammation .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pretreatment with dexamethasone is not justified to prevent postoperative myalgia after succinylcholine .
O O B O O O O O O O O B O
Levodopa - induced oromandibular dystonia in progressive supranuclear palsy .
B O O O O O O O O O
Levodopa - induced dyskinesias have been reported in Parkinson 's disease and multiple system atrophy .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cranial dystonias are rare in patients with progressive supranuclear palsy ( PSP ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this report we describe an unusual case of reversible levodopa - induced Oromandibular dystonia ( OMD ) in a PSP patient to highlight the importance of recognizing this drug
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
related complication in the management of PSP , and discuss the possible underlying pathophysiology .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Protective effect of edaravone against streptomycin - induced vestibulotoxicity in the guinea pig .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
This study investigated alleviation of streptomycin - induced vestibulotoxicity by edaravone in guinea pigs .
O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O
Edaravone , a free radical scavenger , has potent free radical quenching action and is used in clinical practice to treat cerebral infarction .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Streptomycin was administered to the inner ear by osmotic pump for 24 h , and edaravone ( n = 8 ) or saline ( n = 6 ) was intraperitoneally
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
injected once a day for 7 days .
O O O O O O O O
We observed horizontal vestibulo - ocular reflex as a marker of postoperative vestibular function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Animals injected with saline showed statistically smaller gains than those injected with edaravone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
These results suggest that edaravone suppresses streptomycin - induced vestibulotoxicity .
O O O O B O B O O O O
Ketamine in war / tropical surgery ( a final tribute to the racemic mixture ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A technique of continuous intravenous anaesthesia with ketamine was used successfully during the Somalia civil war in 1994 and in north Uganda in 1999 for 64 operations in 62 patients
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, aged from 6 weeks to 70 years , undergoing limb and abdominal surgery including caesarian sections and interventions in neonates .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Operations lasting up to 2h could be performed in the absence of sophisticated equipment such as pulse oximeters or ventilators in patients on spontaneous ventilation breathing air / oxygen only
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
.
O
After premedication with diazepam , glycopyrrolate and local anaesthesia , and induction with standard doses of ketamine , a maintenance dose of 10 - 20 microg / kg / min
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of ketamine proved safe and effective .
O B O O O O O
Emphasis was placed on bedside clinical monitoring , relying heavily on the heart rate .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diazepam , unless contraindicated or risky , remains the only necessary complementary drug to ketamine as it buffers its cardiovascular response and decreases the duration and intensity of operative and
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
postoperative hallucinations .
O O O
Local anaesthetic blocks were useful in decreasing the requirement for postoperative analgesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An antisialogue was usually unnecessary in operations lasting up to 2 h , glycopyrrolate being the best choice for its lowest psychotropic and chronotropic effects , especially in a hot
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
climate .
O O
Experience in war / tropical settings suggests this technique could be useful in civilian contexts such as outdoor life - saving emergency surgery or in mass casualties where , e
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. g . amputation and rapid extrication were required .
O O O O O O O O O O
Steroid structure and pharmacological properties determine the anti - amnesic effects of pregnenolone sulphate in the passive avoidance task in rats .
B O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O
Pregnenolone sulphate ( PREGS ) has generated interest as one of the most potent memory - enhancing neurosteroids to be examined in rodent learning studies , with particular importance in
B I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the ageing process .
O O O O
The mechanism by which this endogenous steroid enhances memory formation is hypothesized to involve actions on glutamatergic and GABAergic systems .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This hypothesis stems from findings that PREGS is a potent positive modulator of N - methyl - d - aspartate receptors ( NMDARs ) and a negative modulator of
O O O O O O B O O O O O O B I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O
gamma - aminobutyric acid ( A ) receptors ( GABA ( A ) Rs ) .
B I I I O O O O O B O O O O O O
Moreover , PREGS is able to reverse the amnesic - like effects of NMDAR and GABA ( A ) R ligands .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
To investigate this hypothesis , the present study in rats examined the memory - altering abilities of structural analogs of PREGS , which differ in their modulation of NMDAR and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
/ or GABA ( A ) R function .
O O B O O O O O O
The analogs tested were : 11 - ketopregnenolone sulphate ( an agent that is inactive at GABA ( A ) Rs and NMDARs ) ,
O O O O O B I I I O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
epipregnanolone ( [ 3beta - hydroxy - 5beta - pregnan - 20 - one ] sulphate , an inhibitor of both GABA ( A ) Rs and NMDARs ) ,
B I I I I I I I I I I I I I I I O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
and a newly synthesized ( - ) PREGS enantiomer ( which is identical to PREGS in effects on GABA ( A ) Rs and NMDARs ) .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O B O O O O O O O O
The memory - enhancing effects of PREGS and its analogs were tested in the passive avoidance task using the model of scopolamine - induced amnesia .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Both PREGS and its ( - ) enantiomer blocked the effects of scopolamine .
O B O O O O O O O O O O B O
The results show that , unlike PREGS , 11 - ketopregnenolone sulphate and epipregnanolone sulphate failed to block the effect of scopolamine , suggesting that altering the modulation of
O O O O O O B O B I I I O B I O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
NMDA receptors diminishes the memory - enhancing effects of PREGS .
B O O O O O O O O B O
Moreover , enantioselectivity was demonstrated by the ability of natural PREGS to be an order of magnitude more effective than its synthetic enantiomer in reversing scopolamine - induced amnesia .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
These results identify a novel neuropharmacological site for the modulation of memory processes by neuroactive steroids .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Preliminary efficacy assessment of intrathecal injection of an American formulation of adenosine in humans .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
BACKGROUND :
O O
Preclinical studies of intrathecal adenosine suggest it may be effective in the treatment of acute and chronic pain in humans , and preliminary studies in volunteers and patients with a
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Swedish formulation of adenosine suggests it may be effective in hypersensitivity states but not with acute noxious stimulation .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The purpose of this study was to screen for efficacy of a different formulation of adenosine marketed in the US , using both acute noxious stimulation and capsaicin - evoked
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
mechanical hypersensitivity .
O O O
METHODS :
O O
Following Food and Drug Administration and institutional review board approval and written informed consent , 65 volunteers were studied in two trials : an open - label , dose -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
escalating trial with intrathecal adenosine doses of 0 . 25 - 2 . 0 mg and a double - blind , placebo - controlled trial of adenosine , 2 mg
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
.
O
Cerebrospinal fluid was obtained for pharmacokinetic analysis , and pain ratings in response to acute heat stimuli and areas of mechanical hyperalgesia and allodynia after intradermal capsaicin injection were determined
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
.
O
RESULTS :
O O
Adenosine produced no effect on pain report to acute noxious thermal or chemical stimulation but reduced mechanical hyperalgesia and allodynia from intradermal capsaicin injection for at least 24 h .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
In contrast , residence time of adenosine in cerebrospinal fluid was short ( < 4 h ) .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
These results show selective inhibition by intrathecal adenosine of hypersensitivity , presumed to reflect central sensitization in humans after peripheral capsaicin injection .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
The long - lasting effect is consistent with that observed in preliminary reports of patients with chronic neuropathic pain and is not due to prolonged residence of adenosine in cerebrospinal
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
fluid .
O O
Effect of lithium maintenance therapy on thyroid and parathyroid function .
O O B O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVES :
O O
To assess changes induced by lithium maintenance therapy on the incidence of thyroid , parathyroid and ion alterations .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These were evaluated with respect to the duration of lithium therapy , age , sex , and family history ( whether or not the patient had a first - degree
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
relative with thyroid disease ) .
O O O O O O
DESIGN :
O O
Prospective study .
O O O
SETTING :
O O
Affective Disorders Clinic at St . Mary 's Hospital , Montreal .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS :
O O
One hundred and one patients ( 28 men and 73 women ) with bipolar disorder receiving lithium maintenance therapy ranging from 1 year 's to 32 years ' duration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The control group consisted of 82 patients with no psychiatric or endocrinological diagnoses from the hospital 's out - patient clinics .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OUTCOME MEASURES :
O O O
Laboratory analyses of calcium , magnesium and thyroid - stimulating hormone levels performed before beginning lithium therapy and at biannual follow - up .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Hypothyroidism developed in 40 patients , excluding 8 patients who were hypothyroid at baseline .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All patients having first - degree relatives affected by thyroid illness had accelerated onset of hypothyroidism ( 3 . 7 years after onset of lithium therapy ) compared with patients
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
without a family history ( 8 . 6 years after onset of lithium therapy ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Women over 60 years of age were more often affected by hypothyroidism than women under 60 years of age ( 34 . 6 % versus 31 . 9 % )
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Magnesium levels in patients on lithium treatment were unchanged from baseline levels .
B O O O O B O O O O O O O
After lithium treatment , calcium levels were higher than either baseline levels or control levels .
O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Thus , lithium treatment counteracted the decrease in plasma calcium levels associated with aging .
O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Familial thyroid illness is a risk factor for hypothyroidism and hypercalcemia during lithium therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Systemic toxicity following administration of sirolimus ( formerly rapamycin ) for psoriasis : association of capillary leak syndrome with apoptosis of lesional lymphocytes .
O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BACKGROUND : Sirolimus ( formerly rapamycin ) is an immunosuppressive agent that interferes with T - cell activation .
O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After 2 individuals with psoriasis developed a capillary leak syndrome following treatment with oral sirolimus lesional skin cells and activated peripheral blood cells were analyzed for induction of apoptosis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
OBSERVATIONS :
O O
A keratome skin specimen from 1 patient with sirolimus - induced capillary leak syndrome had a 2 . 3 - fold increase in percentage of apoptotic cells ( to 48
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
% ) compared with an unaffected sirolimus - treated patient with psoriasis ( 21 % ) .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Activated peripheral blood T cells from patients with psoriasis tended to exhibit greater spontaneous or dexamethasone - induced apoptosis than did normal T cells , particularly in the presence of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
sirolimus .
B O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Severe adverse effects of sirolimus include fever , anemia , and capillary leak syndrome .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
These symptoms may be the result of drug - induced apoptosis of lesional leukocytes , especially activated T lymphocytes , and possibly release of inflammatory mediators .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Because patients with severe psoriasis may develop capillary leak from various systemic therapies , clinical monitoring is advisable for patients with inflammatory diseases who are treated with immune modulators .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Contribution of the glycine site of NMDA receptors in rostral and intermediate - caudal parts of the striatum to the regulation of muscle tone in rats .
O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aim of the present study was to assess the contribution of the glycine site of NMDA receptors in the striatum to the regulation of muscle tone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Muscle tone was examined using a combined mechanoand electromyographic method , which measured simultaneously the muscle resistance ( MMG ) of the rat 's hind foot to passive extension and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
flexion in the ankle joint and the electromyographic activity ( EMG ) of the antagonistic muscles of that joint : gastrocnemius and tibialis anterior .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Muscle rigidity was induced by haloperidol ( 2 . 5 mg / kg i . p . ) .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 , 7 - dichlorokynurenic acid ( 5 , 7 - DCKA ) , a selective glycine site antagonist , injected in doses of 2 . 5 and 4 .
B I I I I I O B I I I I O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
5 microg / 0 . 5 microl bilaterally , into the rostral region of the striatum , decreased both the haloperidol - induced muscle rigidity ( MMG ) and the
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
enhanced electromyographic activity ( EMG ) .
O O O O O O O
5 , 7 - DCKA injected bilaterally in a dose of 4 . 5 microg / 0 . 5 microl into the intermediate - caudal region of the striatum of
B I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
rats not pretreated with haloperidol had no effect on the muscle tone .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O
The present results suggest that blockade of the glycine site of NMDA receptors in the rostral part of the striatum may be mainly responsible for the antiparkinsonian action of this
O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
drug .
O O
Efficacy and tolerability of lovastatin in 3390 women with moderate hypercholesterolemia .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To evaluate the efficacy and safety of lovastatin in women with moderate hypercholesterolemia .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
DESIGN :
O O
The Expanded Clinical Evaluation of Lovastatin ( EXCEL ) Study , a multicenter , double - blind , diet - and placebo - controlled trial , in which participants were
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
randomly assigned to receive placebo or lovastatin at doses of 20 or 40 mg once daily , or 20 or 40 mg twice daily for 48 weeks .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
SETTING :
O O
Ambulatory patients recruited by 362 participating centers throughout the United States .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
PATIENTS : Women ( n = 3390 ) from the total cohort of 8245 volunteers .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
MEASUREMENTS :
O O
Plasma total , low - density lipoprotein ( LDL ) , and high - density lipoprotein ( HDL ) cholesterol , and triglycerides ; and laboratory and clinical evidence of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O
adverse events monitored periodically throughout the study .
O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Among women , lovastatin ( 20 to 80 mg / d ) produced sustained ( 12 - to 48 - week ) , dose - related changes ( P <
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 001 ) : decreases in LDL cholesterol ( 24 % to 40 % ) and triglycerides ( 9 % to 18 % ) , and increases in HDL
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
cholesterol ( 6 . 7 % to 8 . 6 % ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Depending on the dose , from 82 % to 95 % of lovastatin - treated women achieved the National Cholesterol Education Program goal of LDL cholesterol levels less than 4
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O
. 14 mmol / L ( 160 mg / dL ) , and 40 % to 87 % achieved the goal of 3 . 36 mmol / L ( 130
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
mg / dL ) .
O O O O O
Successive transaminase elevations greater than three times the upper limit of normal occurred in 0 . 1 % of women and were dose dependent above the 20 - mg dose
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Myopathy , defined as muscle symptoms with creatine kinase elevations greater than 10 times the upper limit of normal , was rare and associated with the highest recommended daily dose
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of lovastatin ( 80 mg ) .
O B O O O O O
Estrogen - replacement therapy appeared to have no effect on either the efficacy or safety profile of lovastatin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Lovastatin is highly effective and generally well tolerated as therapy for primary hypercholesterolemia in women .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
REM sleep deprivation changes behavioral response to catecholaminergic and serotonergic receptor activation in rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effects of REM sleep deprivation ( REMD ) on apomorphine - induced aggressiveness and quipazine - induced head twitches in rats were determined .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Forty - eight hr of REMD increased apomorphine - induced aggressiveness , and reduced ( immediately after completing of REMD ) or increased ( 96 hr after completing of REMD
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) quipazine - induced head twitches .
O B O O O O O
Results are discussed in terms of similarity to pharmacological effects of other antidepressive treatments .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Extrapyramidal side effects and oral haloperidol : an analysis of explanatory patient and treatment characteristics .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
The incidence of extrapyramidal side effects ( EPS ) was evaluated in 98 patients treated with haloperidol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
The incidence of parkinsonism was higher at higher doses of haloperidol and in younger patients .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Prophylactic antiparkinsonian medication was effective in younger but not in older patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , these medications were more effective in both young and old patients when given after parkinsonism developed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Akathisia was controlled by the benzodiazepine lorazepam in 14 out of 16 patients , while prophylactic antiparkinsonians were ineffective .
O O O O O B B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The present study points to patient characteristics that may be of significance in the development of EPS due to haloperidol .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Hepatic veno - occlusive disease caused by 6 - thioguanine .
O O O O O O O B I I O
Clinically reversible veno - occlusive disease of the liver developed in a 23 - year - old man with acute lymphocytic leukemia after 10 months of maintenance therapy with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
6 - thioguanine .
B I I O
Serial liver biopsies showed the development and resolution of intense sinusoidal engorgement .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although this disease was clinically reversible , some subintimal fibrosis about the terminal hepatic veins persisted .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This case presented a unique opportunity to observe the histologic features of clinically reversible hepatic veno - occlusive disease over time , and may be the first case of veno
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- occlusive related solely to 6 - thioguanine .

Treatment of ifosfamide - induced urothelial toxicity by oral administration of sodium 2 - mercaptoethane sulphonate ( MESNA ) to patients with inoperable lung cancer .
O O B O O O O O O O O B I I I I O B O O O O O O O O
The protective effect of oral administration of the thiol compound sodium 2 - mercaptoethane sulphonate ( MESNA ) against urothelial toxicity induced by ifosfamide ( IF ) was tested in
O O O O O O O O B O B I I I I O B O O O O O O B O B O O O O
a group of 45 patients with inoperable lung cancer under treatment with IF ( 2250 mg / m2 on days 2 - 5 ) as part of a polychemotherapy regimen
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
repeated in a 4 - week cycle .
O O O O O O O O
MESNA was given orally on the days of treatment with IF in 3 doses of 840 mg / m2 , each administered at 0
B O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
hr ( = injection of IF ) , 4 hr and 8 hr p . i .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Out of a total of 88 courses of this treatment we observed 10 episodes of asymptomatic microscopic haematuria and no episodes of gross haematuria .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this group of 45 patients under protection with MESNA there were 5 complete remissions and 9 partial remissions ( total 31 % ) .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A further group of 25 patients under polychemotherapy with IF were treated by conventional prophylactic measures ( raised fluid intake and forced diuresis ) .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this group there were 1 complete and 5 partial remissions ( total 24 % ) , but nearly all patients developed either gross haematuria and / or symptoms of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
bladder irritation ( cystitis and pollakisuria ) .
O O O O O O O O
There were no appreciable differences between the MESNA series and the conventional prophylaxis series with respect to either haematological or systemic toxicity of the cytostatic treatment .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our results support the view that MESNA , given orally in conjunction with combined cytostatic regimens which include IF , simplifies the treatment and provides optimum protection for the urinary
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
epithelium .
O O
Protection with oral MESNA is particularly suitable for outpatients .
O O O B O O O O O O
Time course alterations of QTC interval due to hypaque 76 .
O O O O O O O O B I O
Sequential measurement of QT interval during left ventricular angiography was made 30 seconds and one , three , five and ten minutes after injection of hypaque 76 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O
The subjects were ten patients found to have normal left ventricles and coronary arteries .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Significant QTC prolongation occurred in 30 seconds to one minute in association with marked hypotension and elevation of cardiac output .

Production of autochthonous prostate cancer in Lobund - Wistar rats by treatments with N - nitroso - N - methylurea and testosterone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I O B O
More than 50 % of Lobund - Wistar ( L - W ) strain rats developed large , palpable prostate adenocarcinomas ( PAs ) following treatments with
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

B I I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O

B I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The incubation periods averaged 10 . 6 months .
O O O O O O O O O
Within the same timeframe , no L - W rat developed a similar palpable PA when treated only with TP .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
In L - W rats , TP acted as a tumor enhancement agent , with primary emphasis on the development of prostate cancer .

A dystonia - like syndrome after neuropeptide ( MSH / ACTH ) stimulation of the rat locus ceruleus .
O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
The movement disorder investigated in these studies has some features in common with human idiopathic dystonia , and information obtained in these studies may be of potential clinical benefit .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The present experimental results indicated that peptidergic stimulation of the LC resulted in a NE - mediated inhibition of cerebellar Purkinje cells located at terminals of the ceruleo - cerebellar
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
pathway .
O O
However , it is not certain as to the following : ( a ) what receptors were stimulated by the ACTH N - terminal fragments at the LC that resulted
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
in this disorder ; ( b ) whether NE , released onto Purkinje cell synapses located at terminals of the ceruleo - cerebellar pathway , did indeed cause the long
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- term depression at Purkinje cell synapses ( previously described by others ) that resulted in the long duration of the movement disorder ; ( c ) whether the inhibition
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of inhibitory Purkinje cells resulted in disinhibition or increased excitability of the unilateral cerebellar fastigial or interpositus nuclei , the output targets of the Purkinje cell axons , that may
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
have been an important contributing factor to this disorder .
O O O O O O O O O O
These questions are currently being investigated .
O O O O O O O
Dexmedetomidine , acting through central alpha - 2 adrenoceptors , prevents opiate - induced muscle rigidity in the rat .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The highly - selective alpha - 2 adrenergic agonist dexmedetomidine ( D - MED ) is capable of inducing muscle flaccidity and anesthesia in rats and dogs .
O O O O O O O O O B O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intense generalized muscle rigidity is an undesirable side effect of potent opiate agonists .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although the neurochemistry of opiate - induced rigidity has yet to be fully elucidated , recent work suggests a role for a central adrenergic mechanism .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the present study , the authors determined if treatment with D - MED prevents the muscle rigidity caused by high - dose alfentanil anesthesia in the rat .
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Animals ( n = 42 ) were treated intraperitoneally with one of the following six regimens : 1 ) L - MED ( the inactive L - isomer of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
medetomidine ) , 30 micrograms / kg ; 2 ) D - MED , 10 micrograms / kg ; 3 ) D - MED , 30 micrograms / kg ;
B O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O
4 ) D - MED [ 30 micrograms / kg ] and the central - acting alpha - 2 antagonist , idazoxan [ 10 mg / kg ] ; 5
O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
) D - MED [ 30 micrograms / kg ] and the peripheral - acting alpha - 2 antagonist DG - 5128 [ 10 mg / kg ] , or
O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O
; 6 ) saline .
O O O O O
Baseline electromyographic activity was recorded from the gastrocnemius muscle before and after drug treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Each rat was then injected with alfentanil ( ALF , 0 . 5 mg / kg sc ) .
O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O
ALF injection resulted in a marked increase in hindlimb EMG activity in the L - MED treatment group which was indistinguishable from that seen in animals treated with saline .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In contrast , D - MED prevented alfentanil - induced muscle rigidity in a dose - dependent fashion .
O O O B I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O
The small EMG values obtained in the high - dose D - MED group were comparable with those recorded in earlier studies from control animals not given any opiate .
O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The high - dose D - MED animals were flaccid , akinetic , and lacked a startle response during the entire experimental period . ( ABSTRACT TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS
O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
)
O
Seizure activity with imipenem therapy : incidence and risk factors .
O O O B O O O O O O O
Two elderly patients with a history of either cerebral vascular accident ( CVA ) or head trauma and no evidence of renal disease developed seizures while receiving maximum doses of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

B I I O

O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

O O O O O O O O B O
Both patients had received maximum doses of other beta - lactam antibiotics without evidence of seizure activity .

The ability of insulin treatment to reverse or prevent the changes in urinary bladder function caused by streptozotocin - induced diabetes mellitus .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
1 .
O O
The effects of insulin treatment on in vivo and in vitro urinary bladder function in streptozotocin - diabetic rats were investigated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
2 .
O O
Diabetes of 2 months duration resulted in decreases in body weight and increases in fluid consumption , urine volume , frequency of micturition , and average volume per micturition ;
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
effects which were prevented by insulin treatment .
O O O O O O O O
3 .
O O

O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O

O O

5 .
O O

6 .
O O
The data indicate that the effects of streptozotocin - induced diabetes on urinary bladder function are both prevented and reversed by insulin treatment .
