Delayed institution of hypertension during focal cerebral ischemia : effect on brain edema .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The effect of induced hypertension instituted after a 2 - h delay following middle cerebral artery occlusion ( MCAO ) on brain edema formation and histochemical injury was studied .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Under isoflurane anesthesia , the MCA of 14 spontaneously hypertensive rats was occluded .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the control group ( n = 7 ) , the mean arterial pressure ( MAP ) was not manipulated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the hypertensive group ( n = 7 ) , the MAP was elevated by 25 - 30 mm Hg beginning 2 h after MCAO .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Four hours after MCAO , the rats were killed and the brains harvested .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The brains were sectioned along coronal planes spanning the distribution of ischemia produced by MCAO .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Specific gravity ( SG ) was determined in the subcortex and in two sites in the cortex ( core and periphery of the ischemic territory ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The extent of neuronal injury was determined by 2 , 3 , 5 - triphenyltetrazolium staining .
O O O O O O O O B I I I I I I O O
In the ischemic core , there was no difference in SG in the subcortex and cortex in the two groups .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the periphery of the ischemic territory , SG in the cortex was greater ( less edema accumulation ) in the hypertensive group ( 1 . 041 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 001 vs 1 . 039 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 001 , P less than 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The area of histochemical injury ( as a percent of the cross - sectional area of the hemisphere ) was less in the hypertensive group ( 33 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
3 % vs 21 + / -
O O O O O O O
2 % , P less than 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O
The data indicate that phenylephrine - induced hypertension instituted 2 h after MCAO does not aggravate edema in the ischemic core , that it improves edema in the periphery of
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the ischemic territory , and that it reduces the area of histochemical neuronal dysfunction .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Amiodarone pulmonary toxicity .
B O O O
Amiodarone is an effective antiarrhythmic agent whose utility is limited by many side - effects , the most problematic being pneumonitis .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The pulmonary toxicity of amiodarone is thought to result from direct injury related to the intracellular accumulation of phospholipid and T cell - mediated hypersensitivity pneumonitis .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The clinical and radiographic features of amiodarone - induced pulmonary toxicity are characteristic but nonspecific .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The diagnosis depends on exclusion of other entities , such as heart failure , infection , and malignancy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
While withdrawal of amiodarone leads to clinical improvement in majority of cases , this is not always possible or advisable .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dose reduction or concomitant steroid therapy may have a role in selected patients .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Light chain proteinuria and cellular mediated immunity in rifampin treated patients with tuberculosis .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Light chain proteinuria was found in 9 of 17 tuberculosis patients treated with rifampin .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
Concomitant assay of cellular mediated immunity in these patients using skin test antigen and a lymphokine in vitro test provided results that were different .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Response to Varidase skin test antigen was negative for all eight tuberculosis patients tested , but there occurred a hyper - responsiveness of the lymphocytes of these eight patients to
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
phytomitogen ( PHA - P ) .
O O O O O O O
as well as of those of seven other tuberculous patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O
This last finding may be related to time of testing and / or endogenous serum binding of rifampin which could have inhibited mitogen activity for the lymphocyte .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Initial potassium loss and hypokalaemia during chlorthalidone administration in patients with essential hypertension : the influence of dietary sodium restriction .
O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
To investigate the initial potassium loss and development of hypokalaemia during the administration of an oral diuretic , metabolic balance studies were performed in ten patients with essential hypertension who
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
had shown hypokalaemia under prior oral diuretic treatment .
O O O O O O O O O
Chlorthalidone ( 50 mg daily ) was given for 14 days .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
Six patients received a normal - sodium diet and four a low - sodium ( 17 mmol / day ) diet .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
All patients had a normal initial total body potassium ( 40 K ) .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
The electrolyte balances , weight , bromide space , plasma renin activity , and aldosterone secretion rate were measured .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
In both groups a potassium deficit developed , with proportionally larger losses from the extracellular than from the intracellular compartment .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the normal - sodium group the highest mean potassium deficit was 176 mmol on day 9 , after which some potassium was regained ; in the low -
O O O O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
sodium group the highest deficit was 276 mmol on day 13 .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
The normal - sodium group showed an immediate but temporary rise of the renin and aldosterone levels ; in the low - sodium group renin and aldosterone increased more slowly
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O B O O O
but remained elevated .
O O O O
It is concluded that dietary sodium restriction increases diuretic - induced potassium loss , presumably by an increased activity of the renin - angiotensin - aldosterone system , while
O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
sodium delivery to the distal renal tubules remains sufficiently high to allow increased potassium secretion .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Dynamic response of blood vessel in acute renal failure .
O O O O O O O O O O
In this study we postulated that during acute renal failure induced by gentamicin the transient or dynamic response of blood vessels could be affected , and that antioxidants can prevent
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the changes in dynamic responses of blood vessels .
O O O O O O O O O
The new approach to ex vivo blood vessel experiments in which not only the end points of vessels response within the time interval is considered , but also dynamics of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
this response , was used in this paper .
O O O O O O O O O
Our results confirm the alteration in dynamic response of blood vessels during the change of pressure in gentamicin - treated animals .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
The beneficial effects of vitamin C administration to gentamicin - treated animals are also confirmed through : lower level of blood urea and creatinine and higher level of potassium .
O O O O B I O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O B O
The pressure dynamic responses of isolated blood vessels show a faster pressure change in gentamicin - treated animals ( 8 . 07 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
1 . 7 s vs . 5 . 64 + / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O
0 . 18 s ) .
O O O O O O
Vitamin C administration induced slowdown of pressure change back to the control values .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
The pressure dynamic properties , quantitatively defined by comparative pressure dynamic and total pressure dynamic , confirm the alteration in dynamic response of blood vessels during the change of pressure
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
in gentamicin - treated animals and beneficial effects of vitamin C administration .
O B O O O O O O O B I O O
The hemodynamics of oxytocin and other vasoactive agents during neuraxial anesthesia for cesarean delivery : findings in six cases .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Oxytocin is a commonly used uterotonic that can cause significant and even fatal hypotension , particularly when given as a bolus .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The resulting hypotension can be produced by a decrease in systemic vascular resistance or cardiac output through a decrease in venous return .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Parturients with normal volume status , heart valves and pulmonary vasculature most often respond to this hypotension with a compensatory increase in heart rate and stroke volume .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Oxytocin - induced hypotension at cesarean delivery may be incorrectly attributed to blood loss .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pulse power analysis ( also called """" pulse contour analysis """" ) of an arterial pressure wave form allows continuous evaluation of systemic vascular resistance and cardiac output in real
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
time , thereby elucidating the causative factors behind changes in blood pressure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pulse power analysis was conducted in six cases of cesarean delivery performed under neuraxial anesthesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hypotension in response to oxytocin was associated with a decrease in systemic vascular resistance and a compensatory increase in stroke volume , heart rate and cardiac output .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pulse power analysis may be helpful in determining the etiology of and treating hypotension during cesarean delivery under neuraxial anesthesia .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Exaggerated expression of inflammatory mediators in vasoactive intestinal polypeptide knockout ( VIP - / - ) mice with cyclophosphamide ( CYP ) - induced cystitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
Vasoactive intestinal polypeptide ( VIP ) is an immunomodulatory neuropeptide distributed in micturition pathways .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
VIP ( - / - ) mice exhibit altered bladder function and neurochemical properties in micturition pathways after cyclophosphamide ( CYP ) - induced cystitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O
Given VIP 's role as an anti - inflammatory mediator , we hypothesized that VIP ( - / - ) mice would exhibit enhanced inflammatory mediator expression after cystitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A mouse inflammatory cytokine and receptor RT2 profiler array was used to determine regulated transcripts in the urinary bladder of wild type ( WT ) and VIP ( - /
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- ) mice with or without CYP - induced cystitis ( 150 mg / kg ; i . p .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
; 48 h ) .
O O O O O
Four binary comparisons were made :
O O O O O O
WT control versus CYP treatment ( 48 h ) , VIP ( - / - ) control versus CYP treatment ( 48 h ) , WT control versus VIP (
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
- / - ) control , and WT with CYP treatment ( 48 h ) versus VIP ( - / - ) with CYP treatment ( 48 h ) .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The genes presented represent ( 1 ) greater than 1 . 5 - fold change in either direction and ( 2 ) the p value is less than 0 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
05 for the comparison being made .
O O O O O O O
Several regulated genes were validated using enzyme - linked immunoassays including IL - 1beta and CXCL1 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CYP treatment significantly ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) increased expression of CXCL1 and IL - 1beta in the urinary bladder of WT and VIP ( -
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
/ - ) mice , but expression in VIP ( - / -
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
) mice with CYP treatment was significantly ( p < or = 0 . 001 ) greater ( 4 . 2 - to 13 - fold increase ) than that
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
observed in WT urinary bladder ( 3 . 6 - to 5 - fold increase ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The data suggest that in VIP ( - / - ) mice with bladder inflammation , inflammatory mediators are increased above that observed in WT with CYP .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
This shift in balance may contribute to increased bladder dysfunction in VIP ( - / - ) mice with bladder inflammation and altered neurochemical expression in micturition pathways .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intraocular pressure in patients with uveitis treated with fluocinolone acetonide implants .
O O O O O O O O B I O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To report the incidence and management of elevated intraocular pressure ( IOP ) in patients with uveitis treated with the fluocinolone acetonide ( FA ) intravitreal implant .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O B O O O O
DESIGN :
O O
Pooled data from 3 multicenter , double - masked , randomized , controlled , phase 2b / 3 clinical trials evaluating the safety and efficacy of the 0 . 59
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- mg or 2 . 1 - mg FA intravitreal implant or standard therapy were analyzed .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
During the 3 - year follow - up , 71 . 0 % of implanted eyes had an IOP increase of 10 mm Hg or more than baseline and 55
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 1 % , 24 . 7 % , and 6 . 2 % of eyes reached an IOP of 30 mm Hg or more , 40 mm Hg or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
more , and 50 mm Hg or more , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Topical IOP - lowering medication was administered in 74 . 8 % of implanted eyes , and IOP - lowering surgeries , most of which were trabeculectomies ( 76 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
2 % ) , were performed on 36 . 6 % of implanted eyes .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Intraocular pressure - lowering surgeries were considered a success ( postoperative IOP of 6 - 21 mm Hg with or without additional IOP - lowering medication ) in 85 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 % of eyes at 1 year .
O O O O O O O O
The rate of hypotony ( IOP < / = 5 mm Hg ) following IOP - lowering surgery ( 42 . 5 % ) was not different from that of
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
implanted eyes not subjected to surgery ( 35 . 4 % ) ( P = . 09 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Elevated IOP is a significant complication with the FA intravitreal implant but may be controlled with medication and surgery .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pallidal stimulation : an alternative to pallidotomy ?
O O O O O O O O
A resurgence of interest in the surgical treatment of Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) came with the rediscovery of posteroventral pallidotomy by Laitinen in 1985 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Laitinen 's procedure improved most symptoms in drug - resistant PD , which engendered wide interest in the neurosurgical community .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Another lesioning procedure , ventrolateral thalamotomy , has become a powerful alternative to stimulate the nucleus ventralis intermedius , producing high long - term success rates and low morbidity rates
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Pallidal stimulation has not met with the same success .
O O O O O O O O O O
According to the literature pallidotomy improves the """" on """" symptoms of PD , such as dyskinesias , as well as the """" off """" symptoms , such as rigidity
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
, bradykinesia , and on - off fluctuations .
O O O O O O O O O
Pallidal stimulation improves bradykinesia and rigidity to a minor extent ; however , its strength seems to be in improving levodopa - induced dyskinesias .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Stimulation often produces an improvement in the hyper - or dyskinetic upper limbs , but increases the """" freezing """" phenomenon in the lower limbs at the same time .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Considering the small increase in the patient 's independence , the high costs of bilateral implants , and the difficulty most patients experience in handling the devices , the question
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
arises as to whether bilateral pallidal stimulation is a real alternative to pallidotomy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Case report : Dexatrim ( Phenylpropanolamine ) as a cause of myocardial infarction .
O O O B O B O O O O O O O O
Phenylpropanolamine ( PPA ) is a sympathetic amine used in over - the - counter cold remedies and weight - control preparations worldwide .
B O B O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Its use has been associated with hypertensive episodes and hemorrhagic strokes in younger women .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Several reports have linked the abuse of PPA with myocardial injury , especially when overdose is involved .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
We report here the first case of Dexatrim ( PPA ) - induced myocardial injury in a young woman who was using it at recommended doses for weight control .
O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition , we review the 7 other cases of PPA related myocardial injury that have been reported so far .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Physicians and patients should be alert to the potential cardiac risk associated with the use of PPA , even at doses generally considered to be safe .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Risperidone - associated , benign transient visual disturbances in schizophrenic patients with a past history of LSD abuse .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Two schizophrenic patients , who had a prior history of LSD abuse and who had previously developed EPS with classic antipsychotics , were successfully treated with risperidone .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
They both reported short episodes of transient visual disturbances , which appeared immediately after starting treatment with risperidone .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
This imagery resembled visual disturbances previously experienced as """" flashbacks """" related to prior LSD consumption .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Risperidone administration was continued and the visual disturbances gradually wore off .
B O O O O O O O O O O O
During a six - month follow - up period , there was no recurrence of visual disturbances .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This phenomenon may be interpreted as a benign , short - term and self - limiting side effect which does not contraindicate the use of risperidone or interfere with treatment
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
.
O
Conclusions based on two case reports should be taken with appropriate caution .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Activation of poly ( ADP - ribose ) polymerase contributes to development of doxorubicin - induced heart failure .
O O B I I I I I O O O O O B O O O O O
Activation of the nuclear enzyme poly ( ADP - ribose ) polymerase ( PARP ) by oxidant - mediated DNA damage is an important pathway of cell dysfunction and tissue
O O O O O B I I I I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
injury in conditions associated with oxidative stress .
O O O O O O O O
Increased oxidative stress is a major factor implicated in the cardiotoxicity of doxorubicin ( DOX ) , a widely used antitumor anthracycline antibiotic .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O B O O
Thus , we hypothesized that the activation of PARP may contribute to the DOX - induced cardiotoxicity .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Using a dual approach of PARP - 1 suppression , by genetic deletion or pharmacological inhibition with the phenanthridinone PARP inhibitor PJ34 , we now demonstrate the role of PARP
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
in the development of cardiac dysfunction induced by DOX . PARP - 1 + / + and PARP - 1 - / - mice received a single injection of
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DOX ( 25 mg / kg i . p ) .
B O O O O O O O O O O
Five days after DOX administration , left ventricular performance was significantly depressed in PARP - 1 + / + mice , but only to a smaller extent in PARP -
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 - / - ones .
O O O O O O
Similar experiments were conducted in BALB / c mice treated with PJ34 or vehicle .
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Treatment with a PJ34 significantly improved cardiac dysfunction and increased the survival of the animals .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition PJ34 significantly reduced the DOX - induced increase in the serum lactate dehydrogenase and creatine kinase activities but not metalloproteinase activation in the heart .
O O B O O O B O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O
Thus , PARP activation contributes to the cardiotoxicity of DOX .
O O O O O O O O O B O
PARP inhibitors may exert protective effects against the development of severe cardiac complications associated with the DOX treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Fluconazole - induced torsade de pointes .
B O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE :
O O
To present a case of fluconazole - associated torsade de pointes ( TDP ) and discuss fluconazole 's role in causing TDP .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
CASE SUMMARY :
O O O
A 68 - year - old white woman with Candida glabrata isolated from a presacral abscess developed TDP eight days after commencing oral fluconazole
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B
The patient had no other risk factors for TDP , including coronary artery disease , cardiomyopathy , congestive heart failure , and electrolyte abnormalities There was a temporal association between
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
the initiation of fluconazole and TDP .
O O O B O O O
The TDP resolved when fluconazole was discontinued ; however , the patient continued to have premature ventricular contractions and nonsustained ventricular tachycardia ( NSVT ) until six days after drug
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
cessation DISCUSSION
O O
: Use of the Naranjo probability scale indicates a probable relationship between the use of fluconazole and the development of TDP .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
The possible mechanism is depression of rapidly activating delayed rectifier potassium currents .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O
In our patient , there was no other etiology identified that could explain QT prolongation or TDP
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The complete disappearance of NSVT and premature ventricular contractions followed by normalization of QT interval after the drug was stopped strongly suggests fluconazole as the etiology .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
CONCLUSIONS :
O O
Clinicians should be aware that fluconazole , even at low doses , may cause prolongation of the QT interval , leading to TDP .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Serial electrocardiographic monitoring may be considered when fluconazole is administered in patients who are at risk for ventricular arrhythmias .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
High - dose methylprednisolone may do more harm for spinal cord injury .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Because of the National Acute Spinal Cord Injury Studies ( NASCIS ) , high - dose methylprednisolone became the standard of care for the acute spinal cord injury .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the NASCIS , there was no mention regarding the possibility of acute corticosteroid myopathy that high - dose methylprednisolone may cause .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O
The dosage of methylprednisolone recommended by the NASCIS 3 is the highest dose of steroids ever being used during a 2 - day period for any clinical condition .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We hypothesize that it may cause some damage to the muscle of spinal cord injury patients .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Further , steroid myopathy recovers naturally and the neurological improvement shown in the NASCIS may be just a recording of this natural motor recovery from the steroid myopathy , instead
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
of any protection that methylprednisolone offers to the spinal cord injury .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
To our knowledge , this is the first discussion considering the possibility that the methylprednisolone recommended by NASCIS may cause acute corticosteroid myopathy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O
Probing peripheral and central cholinergic system responses .
O O O O O O O O
OBJECTIVE : The pharmacological response to drugs that act on the cholinergic system of the iris has been used to predict deficits in central cholinergic functioning due to diseases such
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
as Alzheimer 's disease , yet correlations between central and peripheral responses have not been properly studied .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This study assessed the effect of normal aging on ( 1 ) the tropicamide - induced increase in pupil diameter , and ( 2 ) the reversal of this effect
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with pilocarpine .
O B O
Scopolamine was used as a positive control to detect age - dependent changes in central cholinergic functioning in the elderly .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
DESIGN :
O O
Randomized double - blind controlled trial .
O O O O O O O
PARTICIPANTS :
O O
Ten healthy elderly ( mean age 70 ) and 9 young ( mean age 33 ) volunteers .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
INTERVENTIONS :
O O
Pupil diameter was monitored using a computerized infrared pupillometer over 4 hours .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The study involved 4 sessions .
O O O O O O
In 1 session , tropicamide ( 20 microL , 0 . 01 % ) was administered to one eye and placebo to the other .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In another session , tropicamide ( 20 microL , 0 . 01 % ) was administered to both eyes , followed 23 minutes later by the application of pilocarpine (
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
20 microL , 0 . 1 % ) to one eye and placebo to the other .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
All eye drops were given in a randomized order .
O O O O O O O O O O
In 2 separate sessions , a single dose of scopolamine ( 0 . 5 mg , intravenously ) or placebo was administered , and the effects on word recall were
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
measured using the Buschke Selective Reminding Test over 2 hours .
O O O O O O O O O O O
OUTCOME MEASURES :
O O O
Pupil size at time points after administration of tropicamide and pilocarpine ; scopolamine - induced impairment in word recall .
O O O O O O O O B O B O B O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
There was no significant difference between elderly and young volunteers in pupillary response to tropicamide at any time point ( p > 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
The elderly group had a significantly greater pilocarpine - induced net decrease in pupil size 85 , 125 , 165 and 215 minutes after administration , compared with the young
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
group ( p < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O
Compared with the young group , the elderly group had greater scopolamine - induced impairment in word recall 60 , 90 and 120 minutes after administration ( p < 0
O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. 05 ) .
O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
There is an age - related pupillary response to pilocarpine that is not found with tropicamide .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O B O
Thus , pilocarpine may be useful to assess variations in central cholinergic function in elderly patients .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acetazolamide - induced Gerstmann syndrome .
B O O O O O
Acute confusion induced by acetazolamide is a well known adverse drug reaction in patients with renal impairment .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report a case of acetazolamide - induced Gerstmann syndrome in a patient with normal renal function , to highlight predisposing factors that are frequently overlooked .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hypomania - like syndrome induced by olanzapine .
O O O O O O B O
We report a female patient with a diagnosis of a not otherwise specified psychotic disorder ( DSM - IV ) who developed hypomania shortly after the introduction of olanzapine treatment
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
.
O
Neutrophil superoxide and hydrogen peroxide production in patients with acute liver failure .
O B O B I O O O O O O O O
Defects in superoxide and hydrogen peroxide production may be implicated in the high incidence of bacterial infections in patients with acute liver failure ( ALF ) .
O O B O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the present study , oxygen radical production in patients with ALF due to paracetamol overdose was compared with that of healthy volunteers .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
Neutrophils from 14 ALF patients were stimulated via the complement receptors using zymosan opsonized with ALF or control serum .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Superoxide and hydrogen peroxide production by ALF neutrophils stimulated with zymosan opsonized with ALF serum was significantly reduced compared with the control subjects ( P < 0 . 01 )
B O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
This defect persisted when zymosan opsonized by control serum was used ( P < 0 . 05 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Superoxide and hydrogen peroxide production in neutrophils stimulated with formyl - methionyl - leucyl - phenylalanine ( fMLP ) from a further 18 ALF patients was unaffected compared with control
B O B I O O O O O B I I I I I I O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
neutrophils .
O O
Serum C3 complement levels were significantly reduced in ALF patients compared with control subjects ( P < 0 . 0005 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
These results demonstrate a neutrophil defect in ALF due to paracetamol overdose , that is complement dependent but independent of serum complement , possibly connected to the complement receptor .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Absence of effect of sertraline on time - based sensitization of cognitive impairment with haloperidol .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O B O
This double - blind , randomized , placebo - controlled study evaluated the effects of haloperidol alone and haloperidol plus sertraline on cognitive and psychomotor function in 24 healthy male
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O B O B O O O O O O O O O
subjects .
O O
METHOD :
O O
All subjects received placebo on Day 1 and haloperidol 2 mg on Days 2 and 25 .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
From Days 9 to 25 , subjects were randomly assigned to either sertraline ( 12 subjects ) or placebo ( 12 subjects ) ; the sertraline dose was titrated from
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
50 to 200 mg / day from Days 9 to 16 , and remained at 200 mg / day for the final 10 days of the drug administration period .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cognitive function testing was performed before dosing and over a 24 - hour period after dosing on Days 1 , 2 , and 25 .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
RESULTS :
O O
Impairment of cognitive function was observed 6 to 8 hours after administration of haloperidol on Day 2 but was not evident 23 hours after dosing .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
When single - dose haloperidol was given again 25 days later , greater impairment with earlier onset was noted in several tests in both treatment groups , suggesting enhancement of
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
this effect .
O O O
There was no indication that sertraline exacerbated the impairment produced by haloperidol since an equivalent effect also occurred in the placebo group .
O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Three subjects ( 2 on sertraline and 1 on placebo ) withdrew from the study because of side effects .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ten subjects in each group reported side effects related to treatment .
O O O O O O O O O O O O
The side effect profiles of sertraline and of placebo were similar .
O O O O O B O O O O O O
CONCLUSION :
O O
Haloperidol produced a clear profile of cognitive impairment that was not worsened by concomitant sertraline administration .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Ciprofloxacin - induced nephrotoxicity in patients with cancer .
B O O O O O O O O
Nephrotoxicity associated with ciprofloxacin is uncommon .
O O O B O O O
Five patients with cancer who developed acute renal failure that followed treatment with ciprofloxacin are described and an additional 15 cases reported in the literature are reviewed .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Other than elevation of serum creatinine levels , characteristic clinical manifestations and abnormal laboratory findings are not frequently present .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Allergic interstitial nephritis is believed to be the underlying pathological - process .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Definitive diagnosis requires performance of renal biopsy , although this is not always feasible .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An improvement in renal function that followed the discontinuation of the offending antibiotic supports the presumptive diagnosis of ciprofloxacin - induced acute renal failure .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Case report : pentamidine and polymorphic ventricular tachycardia revisited .
O O O B O O O O O O
Pentamidine isethionate has been associated with ventricular tachyarrhythmias , including torsade de pointes .
B I O O O O O O O O O O O O
This article reports two cases of this complication and reviews all reported cases to date .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Pentamidine - induced torsade de pointes may be related to serum magnesium levels and hypomagnesemia may synergistically induce torsade .
B O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Torsade de pointes occurred after an average of 10 days of treatment with pentamidine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
In these patients , no other acute side effects of pentamidine were observed .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Torsade de pointes can be treated when recognized early , possibly without discontinuation of pentamidine .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O
When QTc interval prolongation is observed , early magnesium supplementation is advocated .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Time dependence of plasma malondialdehyde , oxypurines , and nucleosides during incomplete cerebral ischemia in the rat .
O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O
Incomplete cerebral ischemia ( 30 min ) was induced in the rat by bilaterally clamping the common carotid arteries .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Peripheral venous blood samples were withdrawn from the femoral vein four times ( once every 5 min ) before ischemia ( 0 time ) and 5 , 15 , and
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
30 min after ischemia .
O O O O O
Plasma extracts were analyzed by a highly sensitive high - performance liquid chromatographic method for the direct determination of malondialdehyde , oxypurines , and nucleosides .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O
During ischemia , a time - dependent increase of plasma oxypurines and nucleosides was observed .
O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O
Plasma malondialdehyde , which was present in minimal amount at zero time ( 0 . 058 mumol / liter plasma ; SD 0 . 015 ) , increased after 5
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
min of ischemia , resulting in a fivefold increase after 30 min of carotid occlusion ( 0 . 298 mumol / liter plasma ; SD 0 . 078 ) .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Increased plasma malondialdehyde was also recorded in two other groups of animals subjected to the same experimental model , one receiving 20 mg / kg b . w .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of the cyclooxygenase inhibitor acetylsalicylate intravenously immediately before ischemia , the other receiving 650 micrograms / kg b . w .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of the hypotensive drug nitroprusside at a flow rate of 103 microliters / min intravenously during ischemia ,
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
although in this latter group malondialdehyde was significantly higher .
O O O O O B O O O O
The present data indicate that the determination of malondialdehyde , oxypurines , and nucleosides in peripheral blood , may be used to monitor the metabolic alterations of tissues occurring during
O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
ischemic phenomena . ( ABSTRACT TRUNCATED AT 250 WORDS )
O O O O O O O O O O
Cholinergic toxicity resulting from ocular instillation of echothiophate iodide eye drops .
O O O O O O O B I O O O
A patient developed a severe cholinergic syndrome from the use of echothiophate iodide ophthalmic drops , presented with profound muscle weakness and was initially given the diagnosis of myasthenia gravis
O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Red blood cell and serum cholinesterase levels were severely depressed and symptoms resolved spontaneously following discontinuation of the eye drops .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Acute renal failure in high dose carboplatin chemotherapy .
O O O O O O B O O
Carboplatin has been reported to cause acute renal failure when administered in high doses to adult patients .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We report a 4 1 / 2 - year - old girl who was treated with high - dose carboplatin for metastatic parameningeal embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Acute renal failure developed followed by a slow partial recovery of renal function .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Possible contributing factors are discussed .
O O O O O O
Endometrial carcinoma after Hodgkin disease in childhood .
O O O O O O O O
A 34 - year - old patient developed metastic endometrial carcinoma after Hodgkin disease in childhood .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
She had ovarian failure after abdominal irradiation and chemotherapy for Hodgkin disease , and received exogenous estrogens , a treatment implicated in the development of endometrial cancer in menopausal women
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
.
O
Young women on replacement estrogens for ovarian failure after cancer therapy may also have increased risk of endometrial carcinoma and should be examined periodically .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Induction of the obstructive sleep apnea syndrome in a woman by exogenous androgen administration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
We documented airway occlusion during sleep and an abnormally high supraglottic resistance while awake in a 54 - yr - old woman who had developed physical changes and the syndrome
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
of obstructive sleep apnea while being administered exogenous androgens .
O O O O O O O O B O
When the androgens were withdrawn , the patient 's physical changes , symptoms , sleep study , and supraglottic resistance all returned to normal .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A rechallenge with androgen produced symptoms of obstructive sleep apnea that abated upon withdrawal of the hormone .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Previous reports have favored a role of androgens in the pathogenesis of sleep apnea .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O
Our report provides direct evidence for this role .
O O O O O O O O O
Structural and functional measurements indicate that androgens exert a permissive or necessary action on the structural configuration of the oropharynx that predisposes to obstruction during sleep .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Development of the obstructive sleep apnea syndrome must be considered a possible side effect of androgen therapy .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Effect of captopril on pre - existing and aminonucleoside - induced proteinuria in spontaneously hypertensive rats .
O O B O O O O O B O O O O O O O O
Proteinuria is a side effect of captopril treatment in hypertensive patients .
O O O O O O B O O O O O
The possibility of reproducing the same renal abnormality with captopril was examined in SHR .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O
Oral administration of captopril at 100 mg / kg for 14 days failed to aggravate proteinuria pre - existing in SHR .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Also , captopril treatment failed to potentiate or facilitate development of massive proteinuria invoked by puromycin aminonucleoside in SHR .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O B I O O O
Captopril had little or no demonstrable effects on serum electrolyte concentrations , excretion of urine , sodium and potassium , endogenous creatinine clearance , body weight , and food and
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O B O O O O O O O O
water consumption .
O O O
However , ketone bodies were consistently present in urine and several lethalities occurred during multiple dosing of captopril in SHR .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O
Epileptogenic properties of enflurane and their clinical interpretation .
O O O B O O O O O
Three cases of EEG changes induced by single exposure to enflurane anesthesia are reported .
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
In one patient , enflurane administered during a donor nephrectomy resulted in unexpected partial motor seizures .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Until the cause of the seizures was correctly identified , the patient was inappropriately treated with anticonvulsants .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Two other patients suffered from partial , complex and generalized seizures uncontrolled by medication .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Epileptic foci delineated and activated by enflurane were surgically ablated and the patients are now seizure - free .
O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Previous exposures to enflurane have to be disclosed to avoid mistakes in clinical interpretation of the EEG .
O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On the other hand , enflurane may prove to be a safe fast acting activator of epileptic foci during corticography or depth electrode intraoperative recordings .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reversible cerebral lesions associated with tiazofurin usage : MR demonstration .
O O O O O B O O O O O
Tiazofurin is an experimental chemotherapeutic agent currently undergoing clinical evaluation .
B O O O O O O O O O O
We report our results with magnetic resonance ( MR ) in demonstrating reversible cerebral abnormalities concurrent with the use of this drug .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The abnormalities on MR were correlated with findings on CT as well as with cerebral angiography .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The utility of MR in the evaluation of patients receiving this new agent is illustrated .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Antagonism of diazepam - induced sedative effects by Ro15 - 1788 in patients after surgery under lumbar epidural block .
O O B O O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O
A double - blind placebo - controlled investigation of efficacy and safety .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The aim of this study was to assess the efficacy of Ro15 - 1788 and a placebo in reversing diazepam - induced effects after surgery under epidural block , and
O O O O O O O O O O O B I I O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O
to evaluate the local tolerance and general safety of Ro15 - 1788 .
O O O O O O O O O B I I O
Fifty - seven patients were sedated with diazepam for surgery under epidural anaesthesia .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O
Antagonism of diazepam - induced effects by Ro15 - 1788 was investigated postoperatively in a double - blind placebo - controlled trial .
O O B O O O O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The patient 's subjective assessment of mood rating , an objective test of performance , a test for amnesia , and vital signs were recorded for up to 300 min
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
after administration of the trial drug .
O O O O O O O
No significant differences between the two groups were observed for mood rating , amnesia , or vital signs .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Ro15 - 1788 group showed a significant improvement in the performance test up to 120 min after administration of the drug .
O B I I O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was no evidence of reaction at the injection site .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Enhanced stimulus - induced neurotransmitter overflow in epinephrine - induced hypertensive rats is not mediated by prejunctional beta - adrenoceptor activation .
O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The present study examines the effect of 6 - day epinephrine treatment ( 100 micrograms / kg per h , s . c . ) on stimulus - induced (
O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
1 Hz ) endogenous neurotransmitter overflow from the isolated perfused kidney of vehicle - and epinephrine - treated rats .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
Renal catecholamine stores and stimulus - induced overflow in the vehicle - treated group consisted of norepinephrine only .
O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
However , epinephrine treatment resulted in the incorporation of epinephrine into renal catecholamine stores such that approximately 40 % of the catecholamine present was epinephrine while the norepinephrine content was
O O B O O O O O O B O O B O O O O O O O O B O O B O O B O O
reduced by a similar degree .
O O O O O O
Total tissue catecholamine content of the kidney on a molar basis was unchanged .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O
Stimulus - induced fractional overflow of neurotransmitter from the epinephrine - treated kidneys was approximately twice normal and consisted of both norepinephrine and epinephrine in proportions similar to those found
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O B O B O O O O O O
in the kidney .
O O O O
This difference in fractional overflow between groups was not affected by neuronal and extraneuronal uptake blockade .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Propranolol had no effect on stimulus - induced overflow in either group .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O
Phentolamine increased stimulus - induced overflow in both groups although the increment in overflow was greater in the epinephrine - treated group .
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O O O
In conclusion , chronic epinephrine treatment results in enhanced fractional neurotransmitter overflow .
O O O O B O O O O O O O O
However , neither alterations in prejunctional beta - adrenoceptor influences nor alterations in neuronal and extraneuronal uptake mechanisms appear to be responsible for this alteration .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Furthermore , data obtained with phentolamine alone do not suggest alpha - adrenoceptor desensitization as the cause of the enhanced neurotransmitter overflow after epinephrine treatment .
O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
Ocular manifestations of juvenile rheumatoid arthritis .
O O O O O O O
We followed 210 cases of juvenile rheumatoid arthritis closely for eleven years .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Thirty - six of the 210 patients ( 17 . 2 % ) developed iridocyclitis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Iridocyclitis was seen most frequently in young female patients ( 0 to 4 years ) with the monoarticular or pauciatricular form of the arthritis .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , 30 % of the patients developed uveitis after 16 years of age .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Although 61 % of patients had a noncontributory ocular history on entry , 42 % had active uveitis on entry .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our approach was effective in detecting uveitis in new cases and exacerbations of uveitis in established cases .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Forty - four percent of patients with uveitis had one or more identifiable signs or symptoms , such as red eye , ocular pain , decreased visual acuity , or
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
photophobia , in order of decreasing frequency .
O O O O O O O O
Even after early detection and prompt treatment , 41 % of cases of uveitis did not respond to more than six months of intensive topical treatment with corticosteroids and mydriatics
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B O O
.
O
Despite this , there was a dramatic decrease in the 50 % incidence of blinding complications of uveitis cited in earlier studies .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Cataract and band keratopathy occurred in only 22 and 13 % of our group , respectively .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We used chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine in 173 of 210 cases and found only one case of chorioretinopathy attributable to these drugs .
O O B O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Systemically administered corticosteroids were used in 75 of 210 cases ; a significant number of posterior subcapsular cataracts was found .
O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Typical keratoconjunctivitis sicca developed in three of the uveitis cases .
O O O O O O O O O O O
This association with uveitis and JRA was not noted previously .
O O O O O O O O O O O
Surgical treatment of cataracts , band keratopathy , and glaucoma achieved uniformly discouraging results .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Water intoxication associated with oxytocin administration during saline - induced abortion .
O O O O B O O O O O O O
Four cases of water intoxication in connection with oxytocin administration during saline - induced abortions are described .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O
The mechanism of water intoxication is discussed in regard to these cases .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Oxytocin administration during midtrimester - induced abortions is advocated only if it can be carried out under careful observations of an alert nursing staff , aware of the symptoms of
B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
water intoxication and instructed to watch the diuresis and report such early signs of the syndrome as asthenia , muscular irritability , or headaches .
O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The oxytocin should be given only in Ringers lactate or , alternately , in Ringers lactate and a 5 per cent dextrose and water solutions .
O B O O O O O O B O O O O O O B O O O O O B O O O O
The urinary output should be monitored and the oxytocin administration discontinued and the serum electrolytes checked if the urinary output decreases .
O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The oxytocin should not be administered in excess of 36 hours .
O B O O O O O O O O O O
If the patient has not aborted by then the oxytocin should be discontinued for 10 to 12 hours in order to perform electrolyte determinations and correct any electrolyte imbalance .
O O O O O O O O O B O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
